title: b'I hated the ending'
body: b"Marvelous book. I hated the ending, but that's just because it made me sad. The writing was spectacular."

author: b'Doctor G.'
title: b"This one was not for me. I have loved everything else she's written (with exception to the little after the fact Harry guides."
body: b"I didn't read it when it first came out, even after I knew who wrote it. I'm a huge Harry Potter fan and wasn't ready for her foray into the adult world. Not that Harry didn't evolve into the adult world. I read her first Cormoran Strike book and loved it. I have read the whole series and am hoping for another. I decided that, maybe it was time to give this a chance."

author: b'KJ'
title: b'Not your typical JK Rowling but one can assume that ...'
body: b'Not your typical JK Rowling but one can assume that was her intent.  I will try a sample before purchase on her next new venture.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Outstanding'
body: b"I never knew a book could make me feel so much emotion. As a guy who grew up with Harry Potter this book totally blew my mind. I loved every page, JK Rowling is a master of story telling and language. I laughed hysterically at times and wept like a baby at times. Read it over two months ago and I still think about it. I'm trying to get people I know to read it simply because I want someone to talk to."

author: b'David Charlebois'
title: b'None better than her'
body: b"J.K. Rowling is a master of words and imagination.  None better than her.  I'm thoroughly enjoying her Cormeran Strike who-done-it series!"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'It is a book that is not for the light-hearted ...'
body: b'It is a book that is not for the light-hearted. It is deep and emotional. I was quite surprised that J.K. Rowling wrote this book; however, I also understand it from her background.'

author: b'Diana B.'
title: b'Its not a feel good book, a fictional story about small town life ...'
body: b'Lots of characters difficult to keep track of.  Its not a feel good book, a fictional story about small town life in England and various family problems that get shook up by postings on the town website after a vacancy on the town board.  Disappointing.'

author: b'Enobie Wun'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Story turned me off and went nowhere. A real let down after Harry Potter.'

author: b'Kyla from CA'
title: b'No one is black or white.'
body: b'Rowling again removes all doubt that she is a talented and sophisticated writer; moreover, she is also an insightful and empathic person. Without having read any revews, I found this book surprisingly gripping, often amusing and wholly human.'

author: b'Debby Dallmann'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Disappointing and drawn out.'

author: b'MTStew'
title: b'I hated this book.  But it was amazing.  But seriously...WARNING...terrible language and sexually explicit...'
body: b"This book was amazing.  And horrible.  The way that JK Rowling connects everything and everyone and wraps it all into one amazing the story...the way that you really truly feel that you KNOW every character deeply, even though there are so many of them...how I couldn't put the book down even though I hated it...JK Rowling is brilliant."

author: b'Gary E. Eckert'
title: b'Not worth reading.'
body: b"Sorry J.K.  Potter is a masterpiece, the likes of which I dont think humanity will ever see again.  I think someone else wrote this one for you..:(  I didn't even care to finish it."

author: b'Z. Evans'
title: b'Tough to read, but well worth it.'
body: b"The casual vacancy is a great book, but its a really rough read. Rough because it deals with some topics that are hard to deal with. Drug addiction and it's effects on a family, depression, self mutilation (cutting), and other really difficult topics. It basically tries to show the underbelly of society that we try to ignore."

author: b'Nita Harper'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'A bit too cussy for me but a great story.  I love her stuff'

author: b'J. G. Wilson'
title: b'I was hoping for a Murder Mystery'
body: b'I made a point of reading this book without checking any reviews first. I wanted to make sure I did not read any spoilers. For some reason, I assumed the story was a murder mystery when I first started reading it. There was the death of a character, and the introduction of several very unpleasant people who would be likely suspects. It was a surprise to me when no unlikely detective with a personality quirk showed up on the scene. In fact, there was no character in the beginning of the book that I could feel any attachment to. It was a tough read at first because there were no characters I was concerned about. I began to feel some sympathy for the horrible teenagers in the story when I realized that their parents were much worse. The exception is one teen who seems to be a real psychopath or sociopath. Even at the end, I was not sure whether he was actually showing remorse, or if he was only showing fear.'

author: b'Mrs Prairie Bear'
title: b'Awful'
body: b"The untimely death of a councilman lays bare the rotting reality of an entire town's worth of Dursley-esque families with dysfunctions running the gamut from drug addiction to child neglect, trafficking in stolen goods to self-mutilation. Rowling's formidable powers of observation are wasted on the lurid and depressing subject matter and a decent plot is all but buried under too much descriptive detail. There is not one appealing character in the entire book and when the denouement is revealed, we couldn't care less. Skip it."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"I have never read any of the Harry Potter books but of course I've heard they are fantastic. I read A LOT"
body: b"I bought this book because it was chosen for a book club. I have never read any of the Harry Potter books but of course I've heard they are fantastic. I read A LOT. If I don't get into a book in the first few chapters I stop reading it. I can not get into this book but have to read it for the book club. There are so many characters and story lines that it's almost impossible to keep up with it all. The writing style, however, is very good. J.K. Rowling is very talented in her word choices. With that being said, I would no recommend this book."

author: b'Julia'
title: b'An Enjoyable British Satire!'
body: b"Only purchased this volume as I thought that it was just going to be 'interesting' as my daughter had gone 'on and on ' about Harry Potter.  But I was really surprised.  Being English myself I felt myself drifting back to my own little town when I read about the fictional town of Pagford.  I could see the cobbled street and the old Abbey.  When JKR was writing about the internal politics of local county council I was a child again.  It was truly a real treat."

author: b'mpbear'
title: b'Not my kind of story.'
body: b'This story is very well written, engaging, thought provoking, and is certainly a social commentary, but I personally did not like it.  I like feel-good, fun, reading.  This is not.'

author: b'Kindra Strickland'
title: b'I enjoyed every minute of it'
body: b"I have no complaints with this novel. I enjoyed every minute of it. JKR is an amazing writer. I became completely invested in the characters and couldn't wait to find out what would happen next."

author: b'iwiszonori'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'amazing book.'

author: b'Maureen B'
title: b"Didn't capture me"
body: b"Couldn't relate to most of the characters. Story seemed to take a long time to set up. I did however, find the ending to be satisfying."

author: b'Julie'
title: b'Surprise'
body: b'This book was a little boring at first and confusing as it jumps from one family to another but as I got into the book it was very entertaining with a surprising ending.'

author: b'pam b'
title: b'Then picks up towards the end as all the best stories come together'
body: b'Starts slow. Then picks up towards the end as all the best stories come together. Reminded me of Ruth Rendall.'

author: b'MariaGrace'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Not as good as I was hoping'

author: b'Conna Rickard'
title: b'Not so good'
body: b"Rowling, is totally out of her element.  The plot was slow, the language was filthy and there wasn't any reason other than showing the difference of class distinction. At least her detective books have an ending!"

author: b'Marte Cliff'
title: b"If you're looking for a story about something - skip this one."
body: b"I don't like to give up on a book, but I nearly did with this one - several times. It seemed to slog. Aside from that, it was depressing - all about people who primarily hate each other, but put on false fronts."

author: b'Tamara'
title: b'It took awhile to get into the book and remember ...'
body: b'It took awhile to get into the book and remember who all the characters were, but by the end it was rivetting'

author: b'gracie'
title: b'I really enjoyed this book.  Great characters.'
body: b"I thought this was a great book.  I liked the small town with quirky characters & the way the plot all twists together at the end.  It reminded me a lot of Jon Hassler's books."

author: b'Regan Mitchell'
title: b'I love the Harry Potter series ane I figured I love ...'
body: b"I picked this book up at my schools bookstore because its J.K. Rowling. I love the Harry Potter series ane I figured I love this too, I wasn't wrong. The style is different from Harry Potter so if youre expecting the same thing you'll be disappointed."

author: b'Retired Geek'
title: b'Riveting'
body: b"I couldn't put this book down and read it in one session. As usual Rowling's characters are well developed and complex. They all have positive and negative aspects and often behave unpredictably. I recommend it highly."

author: b'Aviva Sofer'
title: b'Good story for the right person.'
body: b"Don't just read it because you loved Harry Potter for its fun adventurousness. But if you are an adult, who can take very dark things, and loved the Harry Potter books for the incredibly developed charachters and throught out plot lines, this is a great read. This book should come with trigger warnings, though. There are many things that are hard to face and for anyone who was a victim, know yourself and decide if you want to read this book."

author: b'Mark R. Jones'
title: b'Peyton Place filtered through Graham Green with a little bit of P.G. Wodehouse thrown in'
body: b'Peyton Place filtered through Graham Green with a little bit of P.G. Wodehouse thrown in.'

author: b'NLT'
title: b'I loved the Harry Potter series and knew this one was ...'
body: b"I loved the Harry Potter series and knew this one was quite different, but honestly I just couldn't get through it. I wanted to like it, but it became one of those books I never finished."

author: b'Paola'
title: b'Good story'
body: b'My first book by J.K. Rowling! I look forward to reading others!'

author: b'psems'
title: b'No Magic Here'
body: b'Lots of characters to keep track of.  All were disfunctional and unhappy.  Might have been better if some characters were left out and the book were shorter.'

author: b'dittany'
title: b'Great book!'
body: b'I thought this was really thought provoking and lovely.  Well done!'

author: b'Del Purcell'
title: b'A Decent Effort'
body: b'I like the fact that J.K. Rowling has released something other than Harry Potter books. I never read the Harry Potter series but I have watched all the movies and I love the stories; however, I longed for a change from the fantasy/wizard book and I am she brought this one to the public.'

author: b'nana2'
title: b'The book was great and enjoyed reading it'
body: b'The book was great and enjoyed reading it.  The sexual content was part of the story and not thrown in for effect.  It was well done.  My only complaint is that the ending is not very satisfying...I wanted more.  Did the author do that on purpose so that she could write a sequal???'

author: b'digi'
title: b'Excellent Novel'
body: b"I got this book because I very much enjoyed the Harry Potter series, and wanted to read more by its author.  I didn't know what to expect, other than it wouldn't be anything to do with HP.  I didn't get hooked right off.  This is a novel with many layers.  There is some depth to this story that I think many missed, or gave up before realizing.  It reminds me of a modern day Charles Dickens novel, in that it explores many characters by inviting us along to observe the happenings in a small English town.  No particular character is given a starring role, and none of them are there to win your heart.  They come across as very real and human.  But unlike Dickens, she clearly isn't being paid by the word, so no wordy descriptions of scenery and the like."

author: b'rebecca dekalb'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'not thrilled. she should stick to harry potter.'

author: b'Richard Todd'
title: b'Not the best'
body: b'I got this for a gift for my mom, she said it was all right not the standard book for J.k'

author: b'Michael D Hawkins'
title: b"I'm amazed there are so many 5 star reviews and can ..."
body: b"My wife quit reading way before I did, and I wish I had listened to her. It's not that the characters are dreary, or that I couldn't care about any of them. Her use of analogies was what finally caused me to quit. I'm amazed there are so many 5 star reviews and can only assume that either I'm wrong or they are, and I know it's not me... I wanted to enjoy it but there was nothing to latch on to. I've certainly read worse books, and finished them, but I just had to give up about half way on this one. I realized it was a little like reading an EastEnders script and my wife also commented on how she thought it read like a screenplay. There were so many characters that it took a couple of seconds of reading to remember who was who. Sorry, a miss in my ever to be humble opinion."

author: b'L. G. Ruch'
title: b'a different sort of story from her but well worth getting to know'
body: b"thoroughly enjoyed this. The setting was real, the characters and events were convincing. A brave effort, following the stunning success she's had with Harry Potter. Although a different sort of story, she again demonstrates her understanding of communities in England and how people are apt to behave in that context."

author: b'Karen A. Perry'
title: b'Slow start but it gathers steam'
body: b'I think I was way past the middle of the book before I got hooked... but I did. A few surprises and satisfying close.'

author: b'sassy girly books'
title: b'Great novel'
body: b'I have put off reading this novel for a couple of years. Finally picked up this novel. Wow, was so blown away by her very acute observations and portrayals of human social behavior.  She is such a stunning talent.  Was never bored and am still dreading the end of this very great novel.'

author: b'DerbyCityObserver'
title: b"I didn't enjoy this book"
body: b"I didn't enjoy this book.  It was slow and bored me. I never finished it. Ended up giving it to someone at work who didn't like it either."

author: b'SR'
title: b'Love it'
body: b'I thought this was absolutely fantastic. One of the only books that has had me weeping by the end. Suburb.'

author: b'Amy'
title: b'love it'
body: b'I want to dive into the book and stroll around the town'

author: b'Patricia N. Klingenberg'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'So impressive and original. This book has stayed with me.'

author: b'RhodeIsland 1969'
title: b'Much Better Than I Expected'
body: b'By the time I got to around page 100, I backtracked and wrote out a list, on the inside cover, of all of the main characters (I had purchased a used copy from amazon).  Once that was done, it was considerably easier to keep the characters straight, and by the time I was half way through I was pretty certain of who was who.  While this is a story filled with small-town grotesques, and many reviewers have found it "depressing," I would categorize it as black humor.  Yes, there is a certain grimness to some of the events, but the skewering of small-town politics and social conventions is skillfully handled.'

author: b'Sarah'
title: b'She was better with Harry Potter, but maybe we are expecting too much ;-/'
body: b'Not her best.'

author: b'Michele Perry'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Love JKR, but this book was a miss to me!'

author: b'Eyeman'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Rowlings outdoes even herself! Thoughtful and involving.'

author: b'Anna E.'
title: b'This is my favorite book in a very long while'
body: b"This is my favorite book in a very long while.  I also listened to the cd's and loved it even more.  I watched the HBO/BBC adaptation of it and though there were a few changes, it was excellent as well.  This was my first JK Rowling book ever and now I know why she is so beloved and popular.  Her characters were so real.  I will always love this book."

author: b'John Martin'
title: b'Disappointing and boring work from the author of the Harry Potter books.'
body: b'J.K. Rowling is, of course, the author of the highly popular and imaginative Harry Potter books. Thus in deciding to read her first book for adults, The Casual Vacancy, I was looking forward to a grand adventure. However I found the early part of the novel to be tedious and boring, centering on the foibles of a small English town and events the follow the death of one of its more prominent citizens. The pettiness and self-serving behavior of people, both in the community and even within families is evident from the start. I rarely fail to finish reading a book once I have started it, but I found the first section to be such a disappointment that I decided not to finish reading what is a rather long novel. British citizens may find the story relevant and interesting, but I think few Americans will agree.'

author: b'Sarah'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'An interesting read'

author: b'Cory'
title: b'Meh'
body: b"I couldn't help but feeling like JK was just trying too hard to prove herself with this book. It felt clunky too me. Would not recommend."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"The main character who isn't there"
body: b"Superb. A multitude of voices and views captures complex politics and society in a small English town. The most difficult task--creating the personality of a character who's died by using the people around him and their opinions. I learned so much about writing from this book."

author: b'Nanohiker'
title: b'Disturbing, dark portrayal of dysfunctional families in small-town England'
body: b'This novel was not what I expected from the author of the Harry Potter series.  Set in a picturesque English town, with a council deeply divided over whether to cut funding for the methadone clinic that serves addicts who live in the nearby rundown public housing, the teenagers who drive the narrative forward are an unappealing lot.  Their parents are even worse, with few exceptions.  The writing is surprisingly weak.  One of the teenage characters does experience a sort of epiphany, and is reconciled with her parents, but the rest remain unappealing.  A disappointing read.'

author: b'William P.'
title: b'It felt like J. K'
body: b'It felt like J.K. Rowling was trying too hard to write for adults but still included a lot content involving teens but not in a good way.  Every familiy in the book was dysfuntional and there were no "happy" families.  Several characters had few redeeming qualities so it was hard to relate to them, while others were trapped in their lives by circumstances beyond their control.  It was an interesting study of life in a very small town.'

author: b'Spargle'
title: b'Morose with a Cause'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy depressed me in a similar way as Flannery O'Connor depresses me.  I think that it was beautifully written."

author: b'john g. biddlecome'
title: b'Book 15'
body: b'Great book'

author: b'Lisa Patrice Dale'
title: b'bored the hell out of me and I am hard ...'
body: b'bored the hell out of me and I am hard to bore. . . I love Prourtte and Agatha Christy'

author: b'Kerrylynn1953'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'Certainly not Harry Potter...'

author: b'Riviliana'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I went at this book with enthusiasm I trusted the author and I was disappointed. This is a horrible book. There is little to no character growth, there are no good characters really and the plot was dull as tombs.  A really disappointing offering from such a talented author. I read the entire book thinking there may be a great ending to somehow redeem it but no the end was as bad as the rest.'

author: b'Jeff Pitts'
title: b'Do not buy or read this book'
body: b"Just horrible. Waste of my reading time. Can't even finish it but it's worse reading it than wasting my money and moving on. Loved the HPotter series. This is just pitiful."

author: b'KM'
title: b'A beautiful book about the ugliness of people.'
body: b"Rowling seems to have mastered the creation of complex, and, I thought, touchingly realistic characters. As in any case of familiarity breeding contempt, the small town in this book is perfect on the surface, with a roiling sea of negativity, cruelty, and sadness underneath. As many small towns are. I didn't really enjoy the book, per se, but I did enjoy the artistry with which it was written."

author: b'David Haines'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Well written and interesting. A map and a cast of characters would have been very helpful.'

author: b'S&E'
title: b'Good read.'
body: b'An interesting read. No main character exactly. Lots of stories in one that relate to each other. About many people that are in the same community and from different life circumstances. A compare and contrast of those life styles. Upper Middle class vs. Middle class vs. Disparity, how they see each other without knowing each others story/history. A book with an underlying message. Good read.'

author: b'sally'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Slow and dismal'

author: b'Molly'
title: b'A terrific read.'
body: b"I loved this book. It's one of the best I've read this year--a fascinating, believable story, beautifully plotted and written."

author: b'mcr'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'I loved it'

author: b'Cindy'
title: b'Loved the characters, but the story dragged on.'
body: b"I love the author's writing style and enjoyed all of the various characters in this book.  However, the story dragged on and on, and the ending was abrupt.  Not her best work."

author: b'Body-n-Soul'
title: b"Gretchen Rubin said it best, 'life is too short to read a book ..."
body: b"Gretchen Rubin said it best, 'life is too short to read a book that doesn't do it for you' or something to that effect."

author: b'Heather M. Head'
title: b'I really wanted to love this book'
body: b'I really wanted to love this book, or at least to like it. I suspected strongly that the general disregard for it was simply because it is a different sort of book from Harry Potter. I came to it fresh, with no expectations other than the thought that it was almost certainly better than the critics have made it out to be.'

author: b'Michael Victor Hoff'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'author must follow up. keep the action in London, include Paris maybe'

author: b'Ashley Stahl'
title: b'NOT a Potter spin-off!'
body: b"I love when children's book authors write for adults (Roald Dahl is another great example) because they really get to spread their wings."

author: b'Paul Kelly'
title: b'One Star'
body: b"Didn't think it was up to JK standards"

author: b'Cody'
title: b'Great Read'
body: b'Stunningly picturesque, beautifly sad, tragically realistc. Jk Rowling weaves a gripping narrative set in a (not so) perfect english small town. Funny, depressing, and most imporatantly provocative.'

author: b'mshuff'
title: b'Compelling story'
body: b"This book is very different from the author's normal style of writing.  I enjoyed this book tremendously and highly recommend this books to others."

author: b'Jaime'
title: b'I recommend her "Robert Galbraith" series instead!'
body: b'Too many Voldemorts, not enough Harry Potters. What a downer. The further I got into the book, the more disturbing it was. Apparently, J.K. Rowling wanted to go as much to the opposite of her Harry Potter universe as she possibly could. If this book had been written by another author I was less familiar with, I think I would be even harsher in my review, and I may not have even finished this book. However, I respect her and her writing too much to give this one star. She tried something different. That\'s alright. She\'s allowed. Judging by the other similar reviews to mine, it didn\'t work out too well for her. I would recommend her "Robert Galbraith" series (she writes under that pseudonym.) That series is a much more interesting read, with likeable characters.'

author: b'Gboro'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Major disappointment from my favorie author!'

author: b'White Oak'
title: b"Rubbish. Boring.  Don't Bother to Read."
body: b'Rubbish.  I don\'t know what is wrong with the people who call this book a "page turner" "genuinely moving" "joy to read" etc.  I am 175 pages into this book and I haven\'t found any redeeming qualities.  It is slow.  There is virtually no plot.  The characters aren\'t the least bit engaging.  I think those reviewers were just unwilling to say anything bad about Rowling because of her reputation with Harry Potter.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy by JK Rowling will surprise even the most ardent reader!'
body: b"JK Rowling sure surprised me with an adult book! Had an unusual ending.I didn't see it coming."

author: b'Yasmin Abadian'
title: b"I didn't enjoy the book"
body: b"I didn't enjoy the book ... I found it rather depressing felt it was too negative and focused too much on peoples' flaws without showing much of their goodness and kindness.  More bad than good.  Characters were incredibly one dimensional."

author: b'Suzanne A. Richards'
title: b'Slow'
body: b'This book took me a long time to read--there were a lot of characters and sometimes hard to follow.  I thought the ending was a disappointment, moving away from the original theme of the book about the casual vacancy and onto darker, sadder characters.'

author: b'Bobby Desmond'
title: b"Pretty good story that'll keep you interested until the end"
body: b"Pretty good story that'll keep you interested until the end. Plus it was turned into a television miniseries so you can watch that after you finish the book."

author: b'Doru'
title: b"Beautifully written, one of the best books I've read"
body: b"Beautifully written, one of the best books I've read. In my opinion, J.K. Rowling is one of the greatest storytellers of our time."

author: b'Sandra Montana'
title: b'Right on class war in a village'
body: b'The novel surprises with its grit and insight. The village is deftly drawn, at the same time that it could be any closed, divided society. Like high school.  Or camp or jobs.  The thing is, what gets got is funny-awful and right on earned. This is one smart lady who knows the way of the world'

author: b'Kurisitaru'
title: b'This is NOT Harry Potter, it is something new and it is AMAZING'
body: b'I honestly loved this book. It made me think, made me care about characters and what happened to them and that says something!'

author: b'writeon'
title: b'Portrait of a small town explores social issues'
body: b'This engrossing story tells about the ways petty prejudices can have disastrous consequences for a community with multiple intersections.'

author: b'S. B. Lacroix'
title: b'If you like your tales dark, and complex, and morbidly fascinating...'
body: b'This book had such mixed reviews that I wondered if I, like others, might not enjoy it. While I adored the Harry Potter series of books, I didnt expect this book to be like those, but the 1 and 2 star reviews went on about how awful it was, how depressing, how tedious, and how it just "wasnt like Harry Potter. Putting too much stock into those 1 and 2 star reviews, I waited to purchase the book until I was able to find a previously read hardcover copy at a low price.'

author: b'Sponge Cake'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b"I always enjoy Rowling's writing."

author: b'H. Natola'
title: b'Interesting read from JK Rowling'
body: b'Not as good as Harry Potter but I enjoyed reading this.'

author: b'chuck'
title: b'Good read'
body: b'She did a really good job with character development and binging everything together at the end. Well done. Nothing like the hp books.'

author: b'annemarie bohn'
title: b'Takes a long time to grab you'
body: b"The meaning of the story is good, it's just that it takes 350-400 pages for it to pick up"

author: b'Karen Rehne'
title: b'I found it well written and a sad commentary on present day life'
body: b'This was my 1st experience reading a J.K. Rowling novel.  I found it well written and a sad commentary on present day life, especially generational poverty, the haves and the have nots and the difficulty in breaking out of these "stations"  in life.'

author: b'Observation'
title: b'Completely pointless'
body: b'The only reason I finished it is that I promised a friend I would read it. I see no reason why this book was ever written. What a complete waste of my time. See the other one-star reviews for more details.'

author: b'Sugar Bear'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'on time, as descibed'

author: b'Dianne Toaspern'
title: b'Too many other GOOD books out thereNot worth your time!'
body: b'Too many other GOOD books out there'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Really good read.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'great'
body: b'fast delivery'

author: b'Patricia H. Gelini'
title: b'J. K. Rowling is a very skilled writer ...'
body: b'J.K. Rowling is a very skilled writer.'

author: b'stretch'
title: b'Feels like living there'
body: b'A fascinating glimpse behind the doors of the private lives and public faces in a stereotypical English village. Very well crafted, and even for me, easy to follow. Deserves another visit'

author: b'Ranting Mommy'
title: b'Entertaining and Sensitive'
body: b"It's not often that a book grips me from the beginning, stays interesting throughout and then finishes strong.  The characters are real and you can feel what's going on inside them without the overall story being depressing. Highly recommended!!"

author: b'Jim'
title: b'Troubles among the town'
body: b'This was a long mini-series type book. The main conflict is about the political position to fill and the people who want it. There are no heroes in this story. The teens are mischievous and some are downright nasty. The married couples are bored with their marriages.'

author: b'Jackie Baker'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b"Not her best by a long shot.  Although I'm well over the age her Harry Potter books were written for I found them to be fun and hard to put down.  I'm having a hard time finishing this one."

author: b'Verdi Joe'
title: b'So far so good!'
body: b"Very enjoyable read. Clever writing and well drawn characters.  I'm seriously invested in the plot and have a sense of foreboding that I can't shake.  I guess I'll soon see how things turn out!  Can't wait.  Very glad I purchased this although it's a far cry from the genre from which I was first introduced to Ms. Rawling. She is a talented writer for sure!"

author: b'Dianacpw'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Terrible story'

author: b'ReeceDarlene1'
title: b'Embark on this novel at your own risk.'
body: b'This is definitely a "love it" or "hate it" book, there is no in between.  I am not an avid J.K. Rawling fan so I went into this with little to no expectations.  I found the overall story very boring.  Near the end it got better, but it almost wasn\'t worth finishing.  Reading this book was like running a marathon; you start out feeling really good about it, then you get so out of breath and nauseous you want to stop, but you\'re so close to the end, you just force yourself to finish, and then you question if it was really worth it.  I would mostly recommend this book to people who care about politics (which I do not, at all - especially English politics).  If you don\'t care or understand politics you\'re going to be lost for most of this book (like I was).  It\'s also worth mentioning that there were explicit scenes about self mutilation that some sensitive people in my life couldn\'t handle and were very upset by.'

author: b'Helen Hazelton'
title: b'I wish I would have liked it'
body: b'I tried to read this book and could not get in to it so I bought the audio version and finished it by listening to it. I wish I would have saved my money. The characters were unlikeable and the story was hard to follow at times because it jumped from one group of people to another, none had any redeemable qualities. This is not a book that I would recommend, and I wanted to like it.'

author: b'Dale'
title: b'Great writer'
body: b'Engaging and beautifully written.'

author: b'Kelsey Waddle'
title: b'Loved it!!'
body: b'Surprising, emotional, and overall amazing. The writing is easy to read but not childish. I loved this book. There are so many elements and J.K. Might be the only person that can write this way without getting readers confused.'

author: b'JP'
title: b'I did not appreciate some of the foul language used'
body: b"The language that she used in this book was really not expected. I did not appreciate some of the foul  language used.  As far as the book goes, I could not make heads or tails of what the story was about. I didn't finish the book."

author: b'Priscila Martins'
title: b'A book with potential... Can Ms. Rowling rewrite it?'
body: b"I am not quite sure how to rate it, to be honest. A 3.5 stars would be fair. First thing first, if you didn't know it was JK Rowling, you could never say it was her writing. Which means a lot of people, just like me, or maybe just like you reading my review, just got interested in this book because it was hers. The book is good, but I wish there was more of a point, it feels like a book with potential. Could have been more, could have done more. I liked the fact that I really couldn't see where the story was going, which kept me interested. But by the end of it, it felt like there something was missing... I was waiting for a climax, which never really happens. There are a lot of characters and Ms. Rowling does a good job on developing them, but maybe there was too many people, and the story got lost. She could develop more on them and their personal stories... Ms. Rowling, can you rewrite this story again? Make some adjustments? I know you can do better with this material!"

author: b'Daniel E. Penz'
title: b'As much as I have enjoyed the authors other works'
body: b'As much as I have enjoyed the authors other works, I finally put this one down, not even half way through.'

author: b'Martha Grace Reese'
title: b'Amazing Roeling characters'
body: b"Yes, it's not as funny as Harry Potter, but beautiful characterizations.  I was ensorcelled."

author: b'Carole Decker'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'As a big fan of the Harry Potter series I was pleasantly surprised by this book.'

author: b'JJ'
title: b'Great Read'
body: b"A great story for those that really like to get into his real lives of the characters and understand that life isn't always pretty. HBO has aired a 3 part mini series based on the book which is really great and helps piece together all the characters  in a clear manner and enda the book so well."

author: b'Rina_Stuff!'
title: b"it's a great story. The characters are complex and interesting"
body: b"Of course I picked this up hoping to relive the magic of Harry Potter, and of course it's totally different.  That said, it's a great story.  The characters are complex and interesting, and in my case, I was not a fan of most of them in the beginning, but almost all of them grew on me towards the end until I felt very emotionally tied to all of them, which I enjoyed. The story is steeped in reality, and covers issues I think a lot of people may struggle with, and once you get into it, connecting with the story was easy, and I was sad when it was over.  I've read it a while ago, so it's time for a re-read soon, since this one is a keeper for my re read list."

author: b'Irene Stevens'
title: b'The book arrived in good time and was in excellent condition'
body: b"The book arrived in good time and was in excellent condition, however, I didn't finish the book. I was very disappointed in the foul language in the book, especially from normal people. I can accept some foul language from criminals, if I'm reading a mystery, but this was too much. I stopped after about 2 chapters and threw the book away."

author: b'Collin'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'I loved the book.'

author: b'Merideth Kilbourne-Mathias'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'I love jk rowling!'

author: b'magen'
title: b'Give this book a chance'
body: b"I really wanted to give this book five starts but I'm just not sure. I did absolutely love it tho. A lot of people are complaining about how this book is dark or crude and it is but it is not distasteful. This is not Harry Potter so don't expect Harry Potter themes or story lines. The beginning is very slow and it seems like there is no light at the end of this tunnel. However, when I finished I realized I had actually grown strong feelings toward every character and was actually very sad when it had ended. I bought the book used and it came in perfectly. Give this book a chance and don't go in being biased."

author: b'Lynn A.'
title: b'Loved the book, hated the ending'
body: b"It takes a while to start up, but after the first 100 pages, I couldn't put it down. The characters were all sympathetic yet horrible in their own way, and it's so interesting to see how they're all oddly tied together. Rowling's social commentary is sharp and even painful at times."

author: b'Julia L. Scott'
title: b'Depressing'
body: b"Very well written novel with so much truth that it left me depressed & discouraged.  I don't like not recommending the book it may be I'm more sensitive to the situations described so well in the book."

author: b'yvonne stewart'
title: b'I really enjoyed this book'
body: b'I really enjoyed this book. Taking you into the lives of neighbours and how things are so different behind closed doors. Certainly one to read.'

author: b'Kevin McGill'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'I had read good reviews of this book, but it disappointed me.'

author: b'Retired English Teacher'
title: b'A Must Read for Parents'
body: b"This book started slowly, then the pace picked up and I was able to distinguish different characters.  I found it interesting with a very definite message about parents, their relationships with their kids, how they can mess with kids' minds, and how kids can get even if there is some kind of neglect or abuse going on.  I understand that is one of Rowling's missions in life.  I wish all parents were required to read this.  Very good commentary on how easy it is to negatively impact a child's life."

author: b'MISTER SJEM'
title: b'OVERALL GRADE: C plus to B minus. (audio version)'
body: b'First off, this is almost nothing like Harry Potter.'

author: b'fisherguy446'
title: b'That being said though it did have a surprisingly beautiful ending that I cannot say to much about as ...'
body: b'A book that can at times be overly long and confusing due to the multitude of characters. That being said though it did have a surprisingly beautiful ending that I cannot say to much about as it would ruin the book for those interested in reading it.'

author: b'Morgan Bost'
title: b'Excellent!'
body: b"Wow wow wow. Good ole JK. First- this is not Harry Potter, let's just make that clear. This book is very mature so be prepared. This is also a book that needs (in my opinion) to be read in large chunks- there are a lot of characters to keep track of so it's helpful to just sit down with it and read. It took me a bit to get in to, but then it was all of the sudden I found that I couldn't put it down. The story builds in a seemingly very casual way- she doesn't rush you through to the end but you can feel the tension building. Wonderful story, wonderfully written."

author: b'MostlySunny'
title: b'Unlikable characters, difficult subject matter'
body: b"J.K. Rowling has a beautiful way with words.  The book is well-written.  That said, almost every character in the book is entirely unlikable.  If you're familiar with the Harry Potter series, Pagford is very much like Little Whinging, and it's full of Dursley-like characters.  However, instead of  the deep-set fear and anger towards the magical world that the Dursleys possess, many of the Pagford residents cast their disdain upon the people of the fields, a poor, crime-ridden area at the edge of the parish.  The parish council is divided; some members want to continue to support The Fields and others want to pass them off to neighboring Yarvil Parish.  When a seat on the Council opens up, both sides scramble to fill the seat, and much ugliness is exposed, both in The Fields and in Pagford."

author: b'FictionForesight'
title: b'...Because You Cant Write Holden Caulfield Starring as Harry Potter.'
body: b'Review Originally Posted At: www.FictionForesight.com'

author: b'Becky'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'Not really a page turner...'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"Don't read!!!"
body: b'Terrible read. Why did she even bother writing this book!!!'

author: b'Mara Beck'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Very disappointed with this book.  Not a worthwhile read.'

author: b'C. Sue Phelps'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Never finished it!'

author: b'Rachel A Woods'
title: b'Not a bad novel but not something that kept me involved or ...'
body: b"When you're used to Rowlings imaginative personality in the Harry Potter series this is quite the let down. Not a bad novel but not something that kept me involved or interested either"

author: b'Lis220'
title: b'it just left you feeling sad and depressed'
body: b'It was hard to put down, but there was no redemption for the characters. So, while a gripping story, it just left you feeling sad and depressed, and with no sense that Rowling actually likes any of her characters (or people, generally).'

author: b'Tonya Gamble'
title: b'Good Read'
body: b'Lots of different plot lines going on,all plausibly connected in the end.'

author: b'Art Sherm'
title: b'Read her often'
body: b'Another good book by JK'

author: b'Addison Beck'
title: b'It may seem like a slow start'
body: b'It may seem like a slow start, but you eventually get so invested in the characters that you forgot about it. Everything comes together in a beautiful ending that you will probably never forget.'

author: b'Gayle W. Ekins'
title: b'but a good read nonetheless'
body: b'Not what a reader expects from Rowling (or Galbraith), but a good read nonetheless. Intricate plot, vivid characters, but a much slower, more deliberate development of both. Drop your JK expectations, and come to this one as a serious exploration of a complex community with all the problems and intricacies that entails. This one is a thinker!'

author: b'Stefani'
title: b'Meh'
body: b'Dont go into this book expecting another Harry Potter. Read the synopsis, will you?'

author: b'Mary Teague'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'I was very pleased with this product'

author: b'martine d lowe'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'Good story quite comical in places as well as sad'

author: b'Futer'
title: b'A page turner'
body: b"Rowling draws you into the characters of this small town and you can't put it down. Her character development is superior! A surprising, excellent read."

author: b'Jane Amico'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'loved it!'

author: b'zzen'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Interesting reading about the small town.'

author: b'Dana Mentink'
title: b'Brilliant characterization, keen insights'
body: b'Brilliant characterization, keen insights, blistering social commentary. It was a book so real that it stayed with me for a long time. My trouble with it was the sheer hopelessness of the story. The book is steeped in despair right up to the finish. I read fiction to be left with some thread, some small flicker of hope. I could not find that glimmer in this novel.'

author: b'Paula Vince'
title: b'Not the same magic as Harry Potter'
body: b'Middle-aged Barry Fairbrother, school teacher, town councillor and pillar of his small community, dies suddenly from a burst aneurysm. Everyone presents a sorrowful face, although secret, heartfelt reactions range from devastation to relief and pleasure. He has left a gaping hole in council to fill (the casual vacancy) and some townsfolk are anxious to put their own names forward. The story is all about the chain of events which is set off when they do.'

author: b'Jennifer'
title: b'Depressing Soap Opera'
body: b"JK Rowling can write. There's no doubt about that. She has a way with words, and her characters are real and distinct."

author: b'Ilya Shindyalov'
title: b'What a prose, what a delightful language, and a plenty of healthy (aka, British dark and not that dark) humor.'
body: b"I am only 10% through the Kindle edition of The Casual Vacancy, but cannot stop laughing. What a prose, what a delightful language, and a plenty of healthy (aka, British dark and not that dark) humor. It has fully grabbed me, and I am looking forward spending a while in Pagford and savouring Rowling's writing."

author: b'Preston Washburn'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Another brain child of J.K. Rowling, but more adult/non-fantastical.'

author: b'Knit_tink89'
title: b'Very good read. Nice mature book by Rowling'
body: b'Was a lovely story. I really enjoyed this different side of JK Rowling.'

author: b'fuhping chen'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'I like the book.'

author: b'Charlene P.'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Good story, interesting characters.'

author: b'prudy'
title: b'I was disappointed in this book'
body: b"I was disappointed in this book.  Having read all of her Harry Potter's books I thought she would do as well with an adult book.  Not to be."

author: b'Jane Prendergast'
title: b'Surprise from JK Rowling'
body: b"I bought this book at an airport mostly because it had the most pages per Euro of all those on the table.  I'd tried to read the Harry Potter books but found the prose turgid, the subject material uninteresting, and always gave up after a few pages."

author: b'bluheron'
title: b'A thoroughly unlikable collection of characters - and yet the ...'
body: b'A thoroughly unlikable collection of characters - and yet the writing was so realistic, and the politics and pettiness of small town life (be it British or American) rang so true that I could hardly put it down. Hardly what I expected from the creator of Harry Potter, but - guilty pleasure - I preferred it.'

author: b'Amber S.'
title: b"One of the best books I've read in this lifetime"
body: b"One of the best books I've read in this lifetime. Great variety of character viewpoints and interweaving of plot lines. A poignant story for any generation, but especially moving in light of the current events and political climate of my country."

author: b'Indigo'
title: b'Brilliance carries over to this genre!'
body: b'I just finished this today and am compelled to weigh in, like others, to maybe offset unfair ratings from folks that only read a small part of the book or none at all.  Not that J.K. Rowling has anything to worry about reputation-wise, but amazon ratings and reviews can be a powerful influence on consumers and should be responsibly entered.'

author: b'EastIcon'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Arrived in very good condition within the allotted time frame. Thanks!!'

author: b'HSR'
title: b'This was a beautiful and raw read'
body: b"This was a beautiful and raw read. Like many others have pointed out, the story has a dark element to it, but it's real and full of depth. Fascinating to the very end, Rowling did not disappoint."

author: b'Marilyn Renaudin'
title: b'Fair read'
body: b'Had too many characters.  Took half the book to really become interesting. Second half was not half bad.'

author: b'Carol Brown'
title: b'Admire Authors Talent!'
body: b"Great book, but keep in mind that this is not a Harry Potter book. Admire Rowling's ability to write a story using MANY characters and weave an intricate web of how each person's life intertwines with the others and how one small incident can create a domino effect on a whole community. Very well written, and I would love a sequel."

author: b'Rebecca L. Fisk'
title: b'Food for Thought'
body: b'A fascinating study of the complexities of human nature. This book would not likely appeal to people who wants a lot to "happen" in a story, instead it\'s about looking beneath the surface of a quiet town and its residents and the dark secrets and nuances that make us tick. I loved it.'

author: b'James Agee'
title: b'Not A Good Read'
body: b"I couldn't even finish this book. I got over half way through it, forcing myself to get that far, and it got so boring that I couldn't continue. Liberal use of foul language throughout also made it a tough read as there was so much profanity that it distracted from the story."

author: b'Libby'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Everybody has a secret- or two.  The book is dark in a light hearted way.'

author: b'Daniel Sheiner'
title: b"It's gritty and raw and better. If you enjoy sympathizing with characters you want ..."
body: b"Don't expect Harry Potter.  Don't expect a slightly more grown-up version of the same narrative style.  It's gritty and raw and better.  If you enjoy sympathizing with characters you want to hate and raging at those you want to love unconditionally, put this at the top of your list."

author: b'Ava M Harston'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'It was slow until about page 200 then it became a real page turner.'

author: b'BS'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Pleasant read...'

author: b'Terri'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Boring boring boring'

author: b'Janet M. Bank'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'Unexpected.'

author: b'Meg'
title: b'Brilliant story telling'
body: b"It's easy to be sucked into Rowling's story telling. The lives of people in a small town are entwined especially after the death of a prominent citizen. Rowling exposes secrets and baser desires all while illustrating the need for compassion in our society. And, once again, impeccably captures the lives of teens."

author: b'Julie W. Snyder'
title: b'The "other"side of Rowling.- not an uplifting book.'
body: b"Interesting premise for a novel about a small town that isn't what it appears to be on the surface.  I came away from the book with the feeling that Rowling does better with knowing the younger set than the adults.  Probably why her Potter novels are such a hit."

author: b'Luis Roberto E. Rondez'
title: b'Nothing like Harry Potter, but pretty good nonetheless.'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy is J.K. Rowlings first novel for adults, following the conclusion of her well-loved Harry Potter series in 2007. The book revolves around the citizens of Pagford, a quaint town in the English countryside whose seemingly idyllic existence is disrupted by the sudden death of one of its most beloved council members, Barry Fairbrother, causing a frenzied election to ensue.'

author: b'Cheryl'
title: b'Very clever!'
body: b'As usual JK takes on societal disparities. This book was very well done.'

author: b'Michele Moore'
title: b"This book was so boring I couldn't even make it to 10% read on ..."
body: b"This book was so boring I couldn't even make it to 10% read on the kindle. I rarely stop reading a book but this was so awful and boring I couldn't waste any more time on it. I wish I had paid more attention to the negative reviews because for the life of me I can't see how anyone could enjoy this book."

author: b'Gloria/Francis Vanderwall'
title: b'Dark, adult, and tragic'
body: b'A very different JK Rowling from Harry Potter.  Yet, like the last Harry Potter books, dark and ultimately tragic.'

author: b'Annie'
title: b'I am SO glad I read this book.....'
body: b'I finished this book two days ago and cannot stop thinking about it.  Although the book is just over 500 pages I zipped through it in less time than it normally takes me to read a book of 300 pages.  The characters really draw you in, and are very complex...they aren\'t either "good" or "bad" people.  They aren\'t black and white, or even gray.  They are multi-hued and very believable.  I would caution that the language is very rough, but not unrealistically so.  I truly believe that everyone could benefit from reading this - It\'s causing me to re-examine my attitudes toward people.  J. K. Rowling obviously has tremendous insight into human nature'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'OUTSTANDING'
body: b"Couldn't wait to get back to the story each day."

author: b'Zarah'
title: b'Nope'
body: b"I flipping hated this book. Writing was fine, bla, bla, bla, but I hated every single page of it. I can't even be bothered really reviewing it."

author: b'A reader from Washington State'
title: b'Excellent Book but not Harry Potter'
body: b'I found "The Casual Vacancy" to be a very well written and thought provoking book.  It is not Harry Potter (which I loved) and in general is not going to appeal to the Harry Potter audience, which I believes explains its poor reviews.'

author: b'Jenni L'
title: b'I really enjoyed this novel'
body: b'I really enjoyed this novel. Weeks after reading it I still thought of the characters and setting. Rowling tackles important social issues here. Our book club really enjoyed discussing those issues and related themes.'

author: b'D-dre'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy by J. K. Rowling'
body: b'FTC Disclosure : I received a free copy of this book for the purpose of an honest review.'

author: b'Linda'
title: b"This is the best book I've read in the past few years"
body: b'This is the best book I\'ve read in the past few years. The writing is brilliant. The characters and their individual voices are so well-formed and rich. I honestly could not put it down. I often read books and think, "People don\'t really say that or act like that." Not so with this book. I felt the characters were spot on, and I could hear their individual voices. The story would seem to be incredibly dull by it\'s description, but it is captivating in it\'s web of characters and the masterful use of the English language. I dislike light weight stories and characters, and this book is anything but that. I recommend it to everyone, and will read it again myself.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"it's a great soap opera"
body: b"Hard to get into initially due to British slang and accent but once your into it, it's a great soap opera.  Very well written.  Caution, this is no Harry Potter."

author: b'Ane Hvass'
title: b'Need more excitement.'
body: b'I had higher hopes for this first adult book. But it becomes better as the pages turns.'

author: b'Kip Zegers'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'weak and overwritten'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Fabulous!'

author: b'Auggie Cook'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Great characters but some unfinished plots.'

author: b'ZacksDad'
title: b'Garbage!'
body: b'Terrible piece of garbage'

author: b'Mary C. Fitzpatrick'
title: b'The language is foul. I was very disappointed in Rowling since the ...'
body: b"I didn't get one quarter into the book before I deleted it. The language is foul. I was very disappointed in Rowling since the Harry Potter series was so well written."

author: b'Mark'
title: b'Okay, but hard to care about the story.'
body: b'Pretty surprising, coming from the author who wrote Harry Potter. Somebody with so much imagination wrote something completely devoid of it.'

author: b'John Dunn'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Clever considered human and believable'

author: b'noodlesmoody'
title: b'This novel is excellent. Highly engaging'
body: b"This novel is excellent. Highly engaging, with a complex web of plot lines and relationships. Very satisfying. I don't think that it's lacking purpose, as one reviewer said. It's rife with highly relevant social commentary for our times, and insights into morality for all times."

author: b'Mike Brighton'
title: b'Not her best.'
body: b'This book reminds me of an apprentice piece of carpentry or metalwork. Perfectly crafted but lacking in usefulness or substance.'

author: b'L A MacDonald'
title: b'Rather enjoyed this book'
body: b'Rather enjoyed this book.  Gave an interesting perspective on small town life in the UK with both sides of the tracks.  Very well written.'

author: b'Vanessa'
title: b'Just so so.'
body: b'Characters were just a little too much....too much bully, too much victim, too mentally ill, too all-round good guy, etc.'

author: b'Bridget M. Panzer'
title: b"Don't waste your money"
body: b'You can get the book used at Goodwill or a yard sale for 25 cents. Disgusting, no plot, very disappointed.'

author: b'Hartman'
title: b'Not the grown up version of Harry Potter - absolutely not suitable for children'
body: b"Let me start off by mentioning that I have two college degrees - one in English Literature. I have read Harry Potter several times. From glancing at the reviews, it seems people were expecting Harry Potter 2.0 from this exquisite novel, and were dismayed with the results of their curiosity. This is considered an adult novel. It isn't a magical fairytale; I would venture to say it could be considered the exact opposite of HP."

author: b'Pallavi Kidambi'
title: b'A powerful story, believable characters.'
body: b"I thought this book was really boring when I first started it but I came back to it awhile later and couldn't put it down. J.k. Rowling creates real characters here with such control that you believe she has lived the life of each one. I feel like I learned something about the nature of human beings after reading this book. I can't wait to pick up her other adult novels under her pseudonym."

author: b'N'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Another side of English life. Honest and true.'

author: b'Ink and Page'
title: b'Secrets, Lies and No Escape'
body: b"Just like all of the Harry Potter novels, I purchased this book to be delivered on publishing day. Unlike Harry Potter, I have only just read it. I highly suspect that its average rating can partially be blamed on the fact that it isn't the world-beloved boy wizard, saving the his friends between its pages; also it is adult fiction, and a fiction that is unpleasant in just about every way. I daresay that Ms. Rowling might have done herself and the book a favor had she written her first book after graduating from Hogwarts under a pseudonym; I wonder if the reviewers consciously or unconsciously were a little extra hard on the author because they thought writing for children to be much easier than writing for adults. Many adults who have read and love the Potter series will laugh at them for even thinking that (this reader included)."

author: b'Catwhisperer'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'A wonderful story of middle class mediocrity and how we all somehow fit into that picture. A great read...'

author: b'CalifPetite'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Great story!'

author: b'Emerald Jean'
title: b'Excellent choice for my grandsons'
body: b'Excellent choice for my grandsons.  We watched  one each day and ate popcorn on the floor.  It was great fun.'

author: b'Anonymous'
title: b'A very compelling novel!'
body: b'Stuck in an airport and needing something to read, I picked up this book because it was written by JKR.  I was not disappointed in the least!  While I agree with others comments that there are a lot of characters to keep up with in the beginning, in the end it was worth the trouble to do so.  I should add that while I do love the Harry Potter series, I have not read most of those books - the movies were already coming out before my kids were old enough to read.  Perhaps that is why, in part, I do not have a strong rebellion to this content as some of the Harry fans seem to be struggling against; but then again, I can recognize the difference between teen fantasy novels and present day novels for adults. Something the 1-star folks probably need to do too.  All in all probably more of a 4 or 4-1/2star than a 5 for me, but like others I feel the ratings need to be counter-balanced.'

author: b'GatorCTS'
title: b'Pretty decent'
body: b'Slow start but ending was very interesting. Pretty decent read'

author: b'Jacqueline Yeich'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Did not care for the book. Thought it was tedious to read.'

author: b'?'
title: b'A vouyeristic journey into the darkest thoughts of a death aftertold'
body: b'I love reading. Understand that this review might be slightly biased because of it.'

author: b'Anita Kovacevic'
title: b'LIFE, FOR BETTER OR WORSE'
body: b'It took me a while to get into the story, I give you that. Not because I expected it to be like H. Potter at all. I never did. I did expect the level of writing to be on that level, which is what I got, because an author either has a unique style or perishes, and J.K. Rowling definitely has a unique style, and I love it (even when Robert Galbraith takes over). There are lines in her books that stay with us forever.'

author: b'J. Sparks'
title: b'The Antithesis of Harry Potter.'
body: b'This well written book tells of the pain and confusion of every conceivable human frailty:  drugs, prostitution,, bullying, parental abuse, jealousy,'

author: b'UF'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Great book'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Author should stick with fantasy'
body: b"There were too many characters to keep track of and I didn't like (or believe) any of them.  There wasn't one decent, functional character.  The book was way too long."

author: b'Jude'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b"this is a book that I just couldn't put down.  she knows her characters."

author: b'peter matallana'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'JK Rowling and a delightful read.'

author: b'Teckla Stonecipher'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Long & slow read.  Not her Harry Potter style at all!'

author: b'Michelle Woodward'
title: b'... to actually get into reading it but it was amazing and so moving'
body: b'It took a little bit of time to actually get into reading it but it was amazing and so moving!!! This is the kind of book that makes you really think about your life and the lives of others.'

author: b'Frankie L. Winchester'
title: b'A Great Read'
body: b'This was a great book with unusual characters whose ages ranged from teens to 70s. It was a different kind of mystery that held my attention throughout.'

author: b'Alfonso V. Pena'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'I had to quit reading it because I could not find a thread of a plot.'

author: b'Amy Tyler'
title: b'Engaging, but so different from what I expected. ...'
body: b"Engaging, but so different from what I expected....which can only mean one thing: JK Rowling may be known for Harry Potter, but doesn't define her talent by genre alone."

author: b'Martha S. Hollifield'
title: b'This book went in a very different direction than I ...'
body: b'This book went in a very different direction than I had expected. The characters were interesting and well rounded.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Bravo'
body: b"J.K. Rowling did a wonderful job writing this book, even though I disliked almost every character.  This story was told in such a fashion that you got to know each of the many characters inside and out. J.K. also paints a good picture of how the towns are laid out with her description of the scenery.  I particularly liked the way she wrote the character Cubby. I didn't like him as a person at all.  But J.K. wrote his mental illness in such a believable way that I now am more sympathetic to those individuals.  This story was tragic and disturbing at times, but J.K. treated each story line with respect by giving us the details and background we need to understand the characters. Bravo"

author: b'A. S. Dowling'
title: b'Not quite Harry Potter for adults..'
body: b"A disappointment. I'm not a Harry Potter fan, which puts me in a tiny minority, but I thought I might enjoy her writing for adults. The problem is that the characters just don't come alive and they move in a largely predictable and formulaic manner.  The central idea (when someone dies, the fabric of life changes as those left behind are reshuffled).  Ambitions spring forth, evil rushes in where it can, love blooms and so on.  The book ends with two more deaths which will, in turn, deeply affect the lives of those who remain."

author: b'Tybee'
title: b'I was somewhat disappointed. Very hard to follow the characters'
body: b'I was somewhat disappointed. Very hard to follow the characters. Continuing backing up in book to remember who was who.'

author: b'Carl E Finfrock'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Did not find this book interesting at all & gave up early.'

author: b'1776freak'
title: b"It's OK."
body: b'This book was OK but those who want to read another J.K. Rowling book that is not Potter might try " The Cuckoo\'s Calling" I loved it.'

author: b'Teame gebru'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Hard book to read transitioning from Young Adult to Adult'

author: b'Alison'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'Slow to build, but well-written'

author: b'Renee A. Parker'
title: b'Avid reader'
body: b"The writing was well done, however the story line and the characters were just too dark for me to enjoy.  I would not care to have any of the characters in my life.  This is not a good example, in my opinion, of Rowling's work."

author: b'Alison H'
title: b'A powerful surprise'
body: b"Compelling, moving, tragic and funny, Rowling's the casual vacancy is an unexpectedly powerful book. Her insight into the life of a small English town, from joys to toxic jealousies, is keen."

author: b'Anita C. Gross'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'No redeemable characters -- sorry that I took the time to finish it.'

author: b'mappt'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'The characters were very good but it was kind of a dark depressing book.'

author: b'mishon'
title: b'I enjoyed this book'
body: b'I enjoyed this book.  JK Rowling has a way of fleshing out her characters in a way that you feel you know and understand them.  I find the interplay between her characters compelling, and I find her a writer that I enjoy.'

author: b'elizabeth zelinger'
title: b'A serious story'
body: b'Interesting story with many characters. Due to the authors terrific writing skills, I became attached to a couple of the characters in the book.  The ending was not at all what I expected and it has haunted me since I finished the book.  This would be an incredible book club selection because there is a lot to discuss.  Endless possibilities.  Readers will either love this book or hate it but they will not be able to decide until the end.  Well crafted, eye opening and thought provoking.'

author: b'Peter Roberts'
title: b'JK keeps Rowling out the goodies!'
body: b'I saw the mini series on BBC before I read the book. I thought the mini series was excellent and the book is just as good.'

author: b'Nancy Naigle fun interesting author'
title: b"It was so bad I didn't finish it"
body: b"It was so bad I didn't finish it.  Not worth your time and I cannot believe it was written by J K Rowling!"

author: b'rawlings191946'
title: b'Not what I anticipated.'
body: b"Didn't enjoy this at all."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Very disappointing'

author: b'C. J. Petty'
title: b'Rowling is a fantastic writer and this book is no exception'
body: b'Do NOT dismiss the note, "If you\'re expecting Harry Potter, this ISN\'T it."  J.K. Rowling is a fantastic writer and this book is no exception.  The characters are developed and the story line is real.  Too real.  J.K. gets you invested in the characters.  And you feel for them.  And the story isn\'t full of happy endings and magic and joy.  The writing is talented, the story is heartbreaking.'

author: b'West3'
title: b'Fantastic look at social issues in the UK'
body: b"I wasn't sure what to expect of J.K. Rowling after Harry Potter, but this book left me in no doubt of her ability to open up new worlds to readers.  It shouldn't have surprised me that she was able to translate so easily into another world outside of Hogwarts.  This book really does prove her talent even more.  That's not necessary, but it does."

author: b'James Glawson'
title: b'Totally did not like this. I feel she went to the extreme ...'
body: b"Totally did not like this.  I feel she went to the extreme from her Harry Potter books.  Just so crude, we never finished it.  I was surprised at her writing.  It took forever to get any where and like I said it was so awful just couldn't get to the point of the book."

author: b'Devin F.'
title: b"I love JKR's Harry Potter series so thought I would give ..."
body: b"I love JKR's Harry Potter series so thought I would give this a try.  It was slow and hard to get through. Disappointed."

author: b'KKJ'
title: b'Terrific read!'
body: b"Terrific book! Didn't want it to end. Complex characters and situations. If you are o.k. with challenging social issues, it's a great book. I never read the Harry Potter books, but these characters are deftly drawn and the teenagers are especially realistic."

author: b'Tom'
title: b'Trying to keep the people straight while they wallow through social and economic class struggles and/or warfare does not make a'
body: b"I read for entertainment and this ain't it!  If it had started off with a flyleaf listing the large cast of characters, their individual roles and their interrelationships it might make it  a little more interesting.  Trying to keep the people straight while they wallow through social and economic class struggles and/or warfare  does not make a good read.  That this came from the same fertile imagination that gave us Harry Potter makes this doubly disappointing! The second star is because of the author's  previous work."

author: b'Brandie'
title: b'but the writing of it was wonderful.'
body: b'The story itself was not my cup of tea, but the writing of it was wonderful.'

author: b'Ashley N. Killen'
title: b'Loved it!'
body: b'I really loved this book when I read it (I gave it to a friend and never got it back, though!) and I think that JK Rowling\'s writing style carried over very well into more "grown-up" material. Awesome characterization, really fun to read, and a neat allegory for society to take note of.'

author: b'Alsson'
title: b'Boring.'
body: b'Boring. Boring. Boring.'

author: b'Mike Robbins'
title: b'A good book. Maybe not a nice one'
body: b'J. K. Rowlings first adult book certainly generated some interest. In its first week, it sold 124,000 copies in the UK and three times that in the USA. It also got a good kicking from some of the critics, and readers  after all, Rowling is quite a target. She is rich (worth about 620m, according to Sky News, though one wonders how they can know). She is massively successful as a writer and generates plenty of jealousy (another writer once accused her of sucking the air out of the market, apparently). She is politically on the left despite a massive fortune. Many critics, I am sure, would have liked this book to be rubbish; they could then wag their fingers and say, well, shes a one-trick pony, isnt she? All she can do is wizards really.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Appalling'
body: b"JK Rowling shows herself as mean-spirited patronizing and totally lacking in empathy towards everyday people with every(day) issues. It's as if she had a checklist for all the social issues of the world; drugs, alcohol,teenage pregnancy, (etc - you name it; it's included), and wanted a compendium in one book. The multitude of characters are one-dimensional, poorly developed and at the beginning some of them indistinguishable. Maybe it would have been better if she had written it under her nom de plume. Then I wouldn't have had any expectations. What a disappointment. It left me feeling very sad for the community and mad at JK Rowling. Bummer"

author: b'Noel'
title: b'A great story with a riveting plot and characters that engage with readers.'
body: b'This book developed into a suspenseful narrative that I really enjoyed reading. It started out a little slow for my taste, but within a few chapters I found myself becoming so attached to characters that found parts of my feelings in each of theirs. I even attracted a few glances in the library. ;) Well done as usual, J. K. Rowling!'

author: b'booknosh'
title: b'Yes, she can write adult fiction...'
body: b'Cut to the Chase:'

author: b'KMP'
title: b'Very Good Book'
body: b"I am not a Harry Potter fan. I discovered JK Rowling in her new incarnation as a writer and I am not disappointed. Casual Vacancy is a really compelling story. It is not a happy story but it is well written and presents characters that are well drawn. They are easy to see and easy to relate to, especially the young characters. Many of the characters are young but it is not a children's story. The characters and situations are all very grown up, in some instances sadly so. It may or may not be the most original story but it is told by an author who simply loves to tell stories and she tells stories really well. I was surprised by the ending. I really did not see it coming. Good book. Read it."

author: b's.mathews'
title: b'Dont bother'
body: b"Worse book I've ever read. Read half and decided that I would never get this time back."

author: b'JMB'
title: b'What Lies in the Hearts of Men (and Women)'
body: b'J K Rowling is a master at creating worlds on the page that are so solid, compelling and truthful that the reader is fully transported to and immersed in them.  With The Casual Vacancy, she has, once again, proved that very few authors can touch her astounding ability at doing just that.  Brutal in its realistic depiction of a small town and those who inhabit it, Rowling draws such fine, full, searing portraits of her characters.  Though at first, those portraits seem cold and harsh, Rowling infuses her characters with deeply touching (if also infuriating and disturbing) humanness.  One gets the sense that she knows these people intimately, and loves them despite their appalling failings and cowardice.  As a reader, I was shocked and disgusted by behavior that I hope I would myself never engage in, by thoughts I hope I myself would never entertain.  By sketching these people and their failings so fully and honestly, though, Rowling forces us, though we might pass judgement on the inhabitants of Pagford and Yarvil, to confront the bits of ourselves that are familiar in these people.'

author: b'Shannon Vincelette'
title: b'Hard to read. The highlight of the book was ...'
body: b'Hard to read.  The highlight of the book was on chapter one, and went downhill from there.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Much Better Than the Movie'
body: b'It was so much better than the movie, which really could not develop all the subtleties of character that the book does.'

author: b'msq'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'what a surprise and a real pleasure!'

author: b'Sergey Lobov'
title: b'Smart reading'
body: b'That`s very interesting book about life in modern England.'

author: b'Alex'
title: b'There is nothing happy, no rose-tinted-spectacles, and no happy ending'
body: b'There is nothing happy, no rose-tinted-spectacles, and no happy ending.  But that not what is wrong with the book.  I was not expecting the sex, rape, bullying, self harm and drug scenes, not the explicit descriptions of child abuse.'

author: b'Hillary'
title: b'I read this because I thought "I liked her writing in the Harry Potter series'
body: b'I read this because I thought "I liked her writing in the Harry Potter series, so I will probably like her novel for adults." I was wrong. Stepping away from my Harry Potter expectations, I didn\'t like it if any author had written it. It was disturbing, somewhat boring, and when I pushed through to the end thinking that it has to get better and have some kind of conclusion, I was wrong again. I would not recommend this book to anyone.'

author: b'Rita Mountain'
title: b"Couldn't put it down. The characters and the story ..."
body: b"Couldn't put it down. The characters and the story line grabbed me at the beginning and wouldn't let go."

author: b'solmaz'
title: b"... this as a gift for a friend and they loved it. I heard it's different from the HP ..."
body: b"Got this as a gift for a friend and they loved it. I heard it's different from the HP series though. Take that into account before buying."

author: b'Michael J. Plant'
title: b'Poor J.K. Rowling'
body: b'I could not decide if this was satire or farce or simply a scathing critique of the character of the British citizenry. Poor J.K. Rowling, if her portrayals of parenthood in England is anywhere close to biographical. This is a hopelessly depressing, frustrating, unevenly written novel. I forged through it, hoping for some kind of resolution that never came.  The author is trying way too hard.'

author: b'astudent'
title: b"I don't think it was that bad of a read"
body: b"I don't think it was that bad of a read.Sure a huge jump from Harry Potter but the story was immersive and intriguing. Really got me thinking about life issues. I love how gutsy JKR is with her story endings."

author: b'J'
title: b"Don't expect Harry Potter.  There's no magic here."
body: b"Don't expect Harry Potter.  There's no magic in The Casual Vacancy.  JK Rowling isn't a one-trick pony.  If you like stories that cycle through different people, then this is a great novel."

author: b'Grandma Ruth'
title: b'Very foul language. Not up to JK Rowling standard of ...'
body: b'Very foul language.  Not up to JK Rowling standard of excellence.'

author: b'Atara Bieler'
title: b'Brilliantly woven story of immense intrigue in the smallest town ...'
body: b'Brilliantly woven story of immense intrigue in the smallest town ever. Original genre of a supposedly obvious plot. Extremely surprising and compelling.'

author: b'siggy'
title: b'I just wanted to keep reading.....'
body: b'I loved the book, well developed characters. Yes, there are many of them but what a wonderful walk through the life of a small community. We all know - or are? - people like that. It made me question how I judge people and sanitize my world. Perhaps for those who bagged the book too much of it was too close to the bone.'

author: b'Melanie'
title: b'Really good book. But you have to be English to ...'
body: b'Really good book.  But you have to be English to appreciate it.'

author: b'Michael Pendergraft'
title: b'Good read'
body: b'Plenty of plot twists and turns.  Surprising end.'

author: b'Eric'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'A Luke warm story about unappetizing characters.'

author: b'V. Rodz'
title: b'I felt I knew many people like them. The ordinariness of their circumstances makes their ...'
body: b'It is hard to describe all the emotions that arose while I was reading this novel.  I am a Harry Potter fan and I went into it knowing that this was not about the wizarding world.  Although I intuited it from reading her prose in my teens, I can now say that Rowling is a master story teller, she can develop multiple tones and shades in her words, and it is just a pleasure to read the sentences she has crafted.'

author: b'Grammy'
title: b'Would not recommend...'
body: b'I did not enjoy this book as I had hoped to. Ms Rowling should stick to novels for the younger reader.
