The foul language in this book, which is necessary to depict her characters, I suppose, is offensive and prolific. Pretty graphic sex scenes...Hard to get the idea of the Harry Potter series out of mind when reading this very crude sample of her adult writing. It drags on and on...certainly not a page turner. I was able to fall asleep while reading it.'

author: b"Girl's Gotta Read"
title: b"Don't Punish This for Not Being a Harry Potter Book"
body: b'I loved this book, so imagine my surprise that it only has an average of three stars on Amazon. My theory is that readers wanted this to be a Harry Potter book (or Harry Potter-esque), so this dark tale is a disappointment to them. The writing is superb, and the story of the dark underbelly of a small English town is detailed and engrossing.'

author: b'Anne and Jerry'
title: b"but I didn't like any of them"
body: b"Characters were well developed, but I didn't like any of them."

author: b'Sharon Cuthbert'
title: b'Rowling is such a good writer and I enjoy her detective stories written under ...'
body: b"This is THE SADDEST book I have ever read!!!!!  A friend agreed.  Rowling is such a good writer and I enjoy her detective stories written under another name.  I pray she never again goes to such a sad place as this.  The saddest part of my opinion is this could be, and I'm afraid, is true.  Some of us have been required to live with people like those portrayed.  Fortunately, I lived through it and was able to get away."

author: b'Nguyen'
title: b'A great first adult novel! I loved it!'
body: b"This book was brilliant. I have no idea why people didn't like it. I grew to love (and hate) all the characters. It was a wonderfully written first adult novel for J. K. Rowling. She can do no wrong in my eyes."

author: b'Lawrence P. Geraghty'
title: b'who operate as a separate subculture create all elements for a terrific book.'
body: b'J. k. Rowling is a genius at creating a world of interesting and dysfunctional characters. She succeeds at creating no fewer than twenty well developed characters all linked together by the death of a major character in the first ten pages. The competing political interests of the town and their disconnect from their children, who operate as a separate subculture create all elements for a terrific book. . . And then she inexplicably has almost all the main characters act in such heidious ways, that at the end, you are left with two major characters who have some redeeming value- oddly disappointing!'

author: b'IchliebeGott'
title: b"This isn't a great book for a Dyslexic or ADHD individual to pick ..."
body: b"This isn't a great book for a Dyslexic or ADHD individual to pick up if you want to do some light pleasure reading. It's complicated and requires keeping several different story lines straight. It's well written, though. It's J.K. Rowling, so that's just kind of a given."

author: b'gerry'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'Hard to follow all the characters. Not very exciting.'

author: b'Michael C. Dubin'
title: b'In contrast to the brilliantly realized world she created in the Harry Potter books'
body: b"I kept waiting for something to happen. I kept waiting to be drawn in, I kept waiting to care about these people. The writing itself is  well-done but it just doesn't really seem to go anywhere, In contrast to the brilliantly realized world she created in the Harry Potter books, the wolrd one encounters here is rather flat and dull and not terribly interesting. I was hoping to really like this book. I am sorry that I can't say that I did."

author: b'Dan S.'
title: b'Good book'
body: b'Not Harry Potter'

author: b'K. Smith'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'So maudlin...'

author: b'William H. Cleveland'
title: b'Very character-driven, and the characters are unlikable'
body: b"This was interesting, but tiring to read because there's really only one of the adult characters who's a generally good person.  The teenagers are harder to judge, but probably a bit better.  The characters do individually seem very real, but collectively, it doesn't really seem plausible that one town would be full of so many terrible people."

author: b'Morning brew'
title: b'Boring, filthy minded characters and a ridiculous battle of ...'
body: b'Boring, filthy minded characters and a ridiculous battle of the council members of a small town.  I wish I could get my money back for this worthless purchase.'

author: b'Wendy Coakley-Thompson'
title: b'Brilliantly executed story from an author without equal'
body: b'Telling you more would be gilding the lily. Just read the book and have the experience for yourself. That is all.'

author: b'Renovationman26'
title: b'Naw - this was over-hyped and in fairness to J ...'
body: b'Naw - this was over-hyped and in fairness to J.K. we all expected too much. Clumsy, contrived, cartoon characters. But for the name, I would have abandoned this mess after Chapter 1.'

author: b'systerwynd'
title: b"Don't go by the HBO show"
body: b"Don't go by the HBO show! This book is well worth reading. I love a great character study and this book ranks pretty high, the twists and turns of the love and hate within this town kept me wanting to know what was going to happen next."

author: b'Juan Fajardo'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Did not lived for the hipe.'

author: b'Teebyrd'
title: b'A great read!'
body: b'I thought this book was terific!  I loved the interaction of the characters and their gossipy nature.  I had read other reviews saying there were too many characters to keep up with but I disagree as they all play a role in the story.  This was excellent !'

author: b'B. Nicolai'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'I loved her "Harry Potter"books but this was depressing with very little light at the end of the tunnel.'

author: b'Jacquie'
title: b'GOOD READ. NOT HP.'
body: b'My second reading as I was following the series on tv. the author really knows her folks and the dynamics of the "small town". I definitely found myself liking and disliking various characters in the story. it is not possible to be remote from the drama or the people. j k rowling is a fine writer.'

author: b'MamaDurk'
title: b"I just couldn't."
body: b"I've tried for the past year to finish this book. I'm about a third of the way through, and just couldn't pick out a plot. Recently, my husband saw that hbo had it as a 3 episode mini series. We watched it, hoping it would get my interest up enough to get back into the book. After watching all three episodes, my husband suggested I just pitch the book. I have no plans to finish the book."

author: b'JC Shaw'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Loved it.'

author: b'Staci'
title: b"She's a great writer, especially when she has likable characters"
body: b"She's a great writer, especially when she has likable characters. The problem with this book is that you don't really like any of the characters."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Potterville grows up'
body: b"Jk writes and you need to read it, that's all I have to say!"

author: b'shirley debalsi'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Thank you'

author: b'Regina Hamilton'
title: b'Soul crushing'
body: b"There has been a lot of bad reviews on this book. So many, that I was hesitant to read it. I am so glad I finally did. Rowling's unequaled skill in building an immersive world full of detailed characters that she displayed in the Harry Potter series definitely comes through in this book. It is not, however, a feel good story. There is no clear cut good and evil. This book left me in tatters emotionally. It is a rare author that can elicit such strong emotion from their readers. I loved this book."

author: b'Pauline Hogan'
title: b'quick read'
body: b'It was an ok book .  Quick read.  Good summer read.  Drags in some parts.  Interesting characters with interesing personalities'

author: b'Debs'
title: b'Forget the fact that she wrote Harry Potter - this is well written but not fun'
body: b"I purposely waited a while to review this book to allow my initial disappointment with it to subside and then read it again. I fully admit that I read The Casual Vacancy because I am a massive Harry Potter fan and was keen to get my hands on Rowling's next work. If you are like me in that regard and thinking of reading The Casual Vacancy, I strongly urge you to do your best to forget that this is the same author who created Harry Potter. Rowling's debut novel for an adult audience is tragically devoid of any of the wonder I experienced reading her HP series. Although I was not expecting The Casual Vacancy to be similar by any means, I was hoping to be dazzled by it as I was by her previous novels and their characters. I wasn't. And that was surely her point."

author: b'jan'
title: b'Relentless Suspense'
body: b'Just loved it.  Slowly, and carefully the reader got to know the characters.  Seemed like very true human emotions brought out.  The good and the bad.  When the closing part of the book began, it was very fast and covered every and all questions about characters.  Very good, and sorry to have it end.'

author: b'Arbor Dell'
title: b'An engrossing surprise'
body: b'Clockwork Orange meets Lord of the Flies. Not what you would expect from this author, and not an easy book to get into. Uncomfortable and edgy, but worth the effort.'

author: b'Chanel torres'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b"I love this book I didn't really like the movie"

author: b'Pitt Fan'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'good story.'

author: b'Alan Z'
title: b"I was hoping it would be a good read. It's not."
body: b'This review is from my wife:'

author: b'Alan Z'
title: b"I was hoping it would be a good read. It's not."
body: b'This review is from my wife:'

author: b'Kathleen R. Coates'
title: b'Worth the wait'
body: b'Although I enjoyed this book, the pace was rather slow.  I enjoyed the character development.  The last few chapters were worth the wait.  I an looking forward to the upcoming series.'

author: b'Patricia Payne'
title: b"I didn't like any of the characters and considered putting the book ..."
body: b"The writing is the ONLY thing that kept me reading...I didn't like any of the characters and considered putting the book down several times, but due to the genius of J.K....I just kept reading..."

author: b'NoOneYouKnow'
title: b'Author Catharsis'
body: b'Most of the one star reviews are from HP fans who were hoping for Harry Potter Goes to College or something like that.  This is the exact opposite.  Filled with poverty, abuse, sex and drugs and everything else only for mature audiences.  Very raw.  I understand Rowling needed to tell this story as an act of catharsis.  I think the subject may have been too close to home. Rowling is a good writer but  the narrative is jumbled and there are too many minor characters to keep track of.  A good, quick read.'

author: b'Fiona Jeanne Purcell'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'fantastic book'

author: b'Jean Stradling'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'love the fast service and the product was perfect'

author: b'Greg S. Churilov'
title: b'Excellent writing style'
body: b'Excellent writing style, utterly depressing book. The story describes a sh*tty little town full of small-minded, petty people who live in quiet desperation. At the start of the book, something awful happens. A few hundred pages later, something awful happens.'

author: b'jtingermany'
title: b'the plot moves along nicely and though i disliked most of the narrators'
body: b"Having seen the mixed reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect, though it's immediately clear that Rowling has an entirely different voice from her Harry Potter novels (which I enjoyed). However, her characters just aren't very likeable, which a few exceptions. The small town of Pagford is filled with bitter, little people who mostly try to use Fairbrother's death for their own gains. Having said that, the plot moves along nicely and though i disliked most of the narrators, I was driven to finish it."

author: b'Heather Guran'
title: b'Slow moving but enjoyable'
body: b"Enjoyed the story but it was a bit more slow moving of a narrative than what I wished it to have been. It wasn't until the last half that I really was able to feel akin to characters."

author: b'Carolyn Lopez'
title: b'Brilliant!'
body: b"Don't give up on this book as you try to untangle the characters. I'm sure all of us are in there somewhere. Hmmm. Why do I feel guilty?"

author: b'Kerry J. Chinnick'
title: b"... and it didn't fulfil my basic requirement for a good read. It must make me want to turn ..."
body: b"I only read half the book (no haven't read Harry Potter) and it didn't fulfil my basic requirement for a good read.  It must make me want to turn the page to find out what is next and this one doesn't do it for me.  I couldn't follow the number of characters, lost track of who was who.  And as another comment compared it to say 1984, well I read that and I was hooked on finding out how it turned out.  There is no hook in this one, it plods along from one unlikeable character to another."

author: b'Charles Guerriero'
title: b'Not her best effort'
body: b"Somewhat convoluted and too many characters that don't pay an integral role in the main plot... Bring back Cormoran Strike"

author: b'Mirza Borogovac'
title: b'To enjoy Casual Vacancy you need to lobotomize part of your brain where your memories of Harry Potter are stored'
body: b"A lot of people gave this book bad review because they were expecting Harry Potter. This book is nothing like Harry Potter. It's not just that the story is different, but the style, the way it's narrated, characters,  are all radically different. Two books are so different that it is hard to believe that Casual Vacancy and Harry Potter are product of the same mind. If harry potter is kind of similar to Narnia, than Casual vacancy is kind of similar to movie Requiem for a Dream."

author: b'joyce l. cundy'
title: b'with great insight into the psyche of the characters'
body: b'Extremely well written, with great insight into the psyche of the characters, but also a little too realistic and sad in its outcome.'

author: b'Sandy Hines'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'Somewhat disappointed in this.'

author: b'Franklin the Mouse'
title: b'Lives Of Quiet And Not So Quiet Desperation'
body: b"Many initial reviews I read about Ms. Rowling's first work outside of the Harry Potter world were tepid at best. It's what caused me to shy away from reading 'The Casual Vacancy.' Fortunately, curiosity got the better of me and I finally read the darned thing. It's hard for me to believe many of the negative reviews she's received are not due to readers having difficulty separating Ms. Rowling from her juggernaut Harry Potter series. It is weird. If her name wasn't on the book, the number of readers would've been less, but my guess, the percentage of those readers giving it a positive response would have been much bigger."

author: b'Blake'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'yup'

author: b'Carolynn L. Parker'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'This was a cross between a whodunit and a soap opera.  I really felt for the characters.'

author: b'Breanna'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Good read'

author: b'Janet L. Shepler'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'ok'

author: b'seattlemarinerfan'
title: b'Good, Not Great'
body: b'Entertaining.'

author: b'shmuel'
title: b'One Star'
body: b"this book should be rated xxx. jk rowling should never have written it. It's a disgrace to literature"

author: b'wendy hampton'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b"The story was a bit slow starting but got better. Unfortunately it wasn't as gripping or as hard to put down as her other books. But then we have been spoilt by how very very good her other books are."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'good plot, well'
body: b'What you would expect from J.K. Rowling - detailed character development, good plot, well done'

author: b'Book Bug'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b"Bought because it was Rowling's FIRST non-HP Book!!"

author: b'Jan'
title: b"I just couldn't find anything to like. The characters were despicable"
body: b"I didn't care for this book. I don't fault the author's writing style, nor the violence,sexual content and language. I just couldn't find anything to like. The characters were despicable, self-centered and tragic. I wasn't looking for Harry Potter when I started this book but I wasn't looking for depression either."

author: b'Ms V Griffith'
title: b'Great read!'
body: b'Once one gets to grips with the host of charecters initially....its a page-turner. Most enjoyable.'

author: b'Cincinnati, Ohio'
title: b"Borrow from the library, don't spend $$"
body: b'Soooo disappointed. After the Brilliant writing and character development of the Harry Potter series, I was anxious to read J. K. Rowlings next offering. This book was so bad that it was difficult to finish it, though I did because I kept thinking it had to get better. Hoping this is a one-off for her.'

author: b'Sally Domingues'
title: b'Worth reading, interesting story'
body: b"I'll admit it took slogging through at first, because there are so many characters and I got confused. However, it was an interesting look at modern English village life and a fresh story, so that made it worth it to me. And I was glad I stuck with it, because it became very interesting. I hope JK will continue to produce -- I will certainly look for more!"

author: b'Brenda S Retterer'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Very good'

author: b'Brenda'
title: b'not worth my time'
body: b"I couldn't finish this book. I expected better from J.K. Rowling.  Just because you add sex and cursing doesn't mean that you have an adult book."

author: b'Aarennaar Krishnan'
title: b'As dour as any epic from yore, without the payoff'
body: b"Try as you may, it's well nigh impossible to approach a book from a famous author without thinking of her earlier books. Good or bad, JK Rowling manages to make you forget about Harry Potter very quickly while reading this book. So much so, that very soon you are left yearning to get something from the world of wizardry to save this book of misery."

author: b'TrpDip7'
title: b'AN EXCELLENT COMBINATION'
body: b'THIS WELL WRITTEN NOVEL ABOUT A SMALL BRITISH VILLAGE WAS INTRIGUING, SAD AND FUNNY. IN A VERY REALISTIC WAY.  WELL DONE!'

author: b'Jane'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Great read, had me hooked from the start'

author: b'technoguy'
title: b'Risen like a Phoenix from the ashes of Harry Potter'
body: b"Casual Vacancy, JK Rowling's 1st post Harry Potter novel is an epiphenomenon of the Harry Potter phenomenon. The two kinds of fiction, one realistic state-of -the -nation novel,the other children's fantasy of the boy wizard Harry Potter,together with other wizards,witches and spells,which went on to sell 450 million world-wide and spawn 8 Hollywood movies. However, she's kicked all that away,to explore the world of the 'muggles' .I'm sure,secretly, in the back of her mind was a desire to play by the laws of ordinary reality, and see if she could write a book,free of tricks, to write a good book,that stood alone, without any dependence of the success of Harry Potter. Could she even write well without all the gobbledegook,a strong and fearless novel?"

author: b'Betsy Sanders'
title: b'One Star'
body: b"Just couldn't get into the book.  Not very interestind"

author: b'SpunStories B.'
title: b'Stick with this story for a rewarding, thought-provoking read'
body: b'THE CASUAL VACANCY by J. K. Rowling is the story of a bitter class struggle between the smug, wealthy inhabitants of Pagford, and their much poor neighbors who inhabit the council flats called The Fields.'

author: b'Arcade Bear'
title: b'not even a good book.'
body: b"not really into it... not even a good book... compare this to HP and you'll be dissapointed."

author: b'Posie'
title: b'Very disapppointing.'
body: b'Too many strange characters, too many social problems in all just too much.  I read the book after watching the tv adaptation to see how they had changed the ending and was disappointed with both.  J.K. Rowling has made her fortune with Harry Potter and should leave it at that if this is an example of her adult work.'

author: b'Ricky Taillefer'
title: b'Use two books as spacers to raise your monitor because its always better to view at eye leveled to the center of ...'

author: b'John E. Skelsey'
title: b'a very different novel'
body: b'lots of twists and turns; sad ending'

author: b'j9er81'
title: b'Boring!'
body: b"Horribly boring - don't waste your time or money on this."

author: b'Eberhali'
title: b'Ok'
body: b"I wanted to like this book more than I did.  She's such a great writer, but this book didn't grab me like her others have."

author: b'JamieLynn'
title: b'Very dark'
body: b'I loved the Harry Potter books and so figured this one would also be a new favorite.  While I realize this was written for adults, it was much too dark for me.  Lots of F*** bombs, abuse, drugs, and general unhappiness.  It was well-written with an interesting storyline and well-developed characters, but just not what I enjoy reading.'

author: b'Eric'
title: b'JK Rowling shows that she is an excellent, mature writer'
body: b"JK Rowling shows that she is an excellent, mature writer.  She has created characters with such detail that you believe you are reading a work of non-fiction.  I quickly became wrapped up in the story and lost all track of time.  It was a pleasure to read a book that was crafted so well (after dragging myself through so many second rate stories).  I don't know much about small English town life, but now feel like an expert."

author: b'Siofra'
title: b'Good Read'
body: b'Classic Rowling with vivid character description. A sometimes hilarious take on small-town politics. A good read albeit dark and sad in place. Would recommend it.'

author: b'catherine street'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'A amusing take on the complications of rural living'

author: b'Rachael D.'
title: b'... reading this book WITHOUT expecting it to be anything like the Harry Potter series'
body: b"I started reading this book WITHOUT expecting it to be anything like the Harry Potter series. I wasn't disappointed. In THAT aspect. I was, however, disappointed in every other aspect. It was a stew of horrible people doing horrible things. I get it that she wanted to do something new and edgier than what she was known for. It turns out there is a thin line between edgy and awful and offensive, and she hurdled over that line and left it in the dust."

author: b'CBo'
title: b'The Social Politics of a Small Town'
body: b"Great book written in the usual clarity that you would expect from JK Rowling.  Although the storyline stems from the sudden death of a Parish Councillor, it is more about the gritty social politics that exists between the small-minded inhabitants of Pagford, than the political policies of it's council.  Rowling has a way of defining the exact thoughts that go on in the many characters heads that really hits home, exposing them for their insular attitudes and behaviours, in particular, the blood-thirsty need for gossip from some of the middle aged, middle class wormen that feature in the story.  The only disappointment for me was that the x-ray function of my Kindle was not available for this book and given the multitude of characters this would have been very helpful."

author: b'Maura Dolan'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Great book, which touches on gender, generation and social class themes.'

author: b'Elaine M.'
title: b"The intricacy of the characters and the plot are amazing. Highly recommend it but don't expect Harry Potter"
body: b"Incredibly well written. The intricacy of the characters and the plot are amazing. Highly recommend it but don't expect Harry Potter!"

author: b'foxylady'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Not as well written as Harry Potter'

author: b'R. C. Chopyak'
title: b'Good Read'
body: b'Well detailed and the characters were presented sequentially with complete information.  The chapters were of a length allowing the reader pause and reflection.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Excellent read from J K Rowling'
body: b"Absolutely fantastic book. Didn't want to finish it. Very well witten. Certainly made me think."

author: b'Copie'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Great reading if you like jk Rowling.'

author: b'Sarah McCarthy'
title: b'Not a boring council story!'
body: b"I can't believe I waited so long to read this book. JK is a master storyteller and this tale of small town pettiness and suburban secrets is compelling, funny and inevitably heartbreaking."

author: b'SamsonCarlMiller'
title: b'3 Reasons to buy this book by Rowling'
body: b"When this book was published, it wasn't published with the famous Harry Potter real name on it, and still it received decent reviews about a thrilling, though somewhat disturbing plot. I would say that it is a book that isn't for everyone though some of the characters can be easily related to."

author: b'Susan T.'
title: b'Love J. K'
body: b"Love J.K. Rowling's adult books.  She draws you in to the inner workings of the tale and then keeps you on the edge of your seat while telling a very complicated tale.  Look forward to more books by her!"

author: b'richard fuller'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'great'

author: b'Sihaya'
title: b'not fun or funny'
body: b'Well written, but very depressing, not fun or funny...just an all around downer.'

author: b'Alexis DeSousa'
title: b'Ehhhhhhhhh'
body: b'n The Casual Vacancy, a local councilman in a small town dies, which leads to the whole town going downhill when his council seat comes up for re-election.'

author: b'DEBRA D. JEAKINS'
title: b'Not expecting to find Harry P and his friends in this book I really did enjoy reading about all the dirty little secrets that ca'
body: b"As a huge Harry Potter fan I went into this book knowing its NOT about Harry Potter! There, that's done!  Casual Vacancy is about death,sex,life, sex, life and the living in a small town.  As I live in an American village of about 2500 I can definitely say I know the life in the book.  Everyone spends all their time either knowing of trying to find out everyone elses business."

author: b'Sandy'
title: b'Riveting'
body: b"Wow, I am shocked that this book has received such mixed reviews! I could not put this book down. I found the characters and plot fascinating, and I especially enjoyed the multiple points of view. This is a book I'll remember."

author: b'R. Schadt'
title: b'enjoyed it, for a fully fictional account'
body: b'The community of Pagford is filled with dysfunctional people.  It was a fairly quick read, enjoyed it, for a fully fictional account.'

author: b'Veronica Wilkens'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'one of the most boring books i have ever read.'

author: b'Isabella'
title: b"It's obvious that Rowling wants to create somewhat of a ..."
body: b"It's obvious that Rowling wants to create somewhat of a crass contrast to HP but her superb way of writing and the way she engages us with the characters is evident. Her focus lies on the children's stories in this book too so in a way familiar. It is a tragic but interesting book about social class, adolescence and politics in a picturesque British village where nothing is as it seems."

author: b'Sheila Karlson'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'I was disappointed.'

author: b'Daryl'
title: b'J. K. Rowling has created a dark, ...'
body: b'J.K. Rowling has created a dark, creepy society full of vulgar people with no redeeming value. Why would anyone care? Yuck.'

author: b'Marie Doud'
title: b"I don't like to read books with so much profanity"
body: b'I don\'t like to read books with so much profanity.  It isn\'t even realistic that every character in the story (professional adults as well as teenagers) used "gutter" language constantly.'

There were too many characters to try to keep straight and the story line was rather boring,it just didn't go anywhere..  I read the whole book, but truly did not enjoy it.  Sorry, I really wanted to like it."

author: b'Andreatf'
title: b'A Very Different Story'
body: b'I am amazed at how involved I became with these characters. It was difficult putting the book down and the story will stay with me for a long time to come.'

author: b'Adventures with Brianne'
title: b'you probably will not enjoy this book'
body: b"If you've read a Harry Potter book, you probably will not enjoy this book. I was not a huge fan. It took me so long to get through this book, that I had trouble even finishing the story. It was not as crazy exciting as the Potter series, and I was expecting so much more from this book. Sadly, I was disappointed and unimpressed by the topics she went over."

body: b"The book was somewhat boring. I just couldn't bring myself to like any of the characters.  Everything from their back stories to what happens to them next was uninteresting."

title: b'I enjoyed her other books much more than this one'
body: b'I enjoyed her other books much more than this one.  This book had a disjointed feel to it and was hard to get into.'

author: b'Nana S'
title: b'interesting read'
body: b'It took a while for me to get into the story but at some point I was hooked and wanted to see what happened to the characters in the book. The story was raw and the characters were not particularly likable but all so human. Though their personalities seemed exaggerated, I could see many real human frailties and characteristics in each. The contrasts the author drew between the haves and have-nots rang true. I would recommend this book.'

title: b'Charles Maurice'
body: b'Being a huge Harry Potter fan, I knew that this was something different.'

author: b'James Vigil'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Very boring! Took forever to get into it, Lost interest fast.'

author: b'S. Pawson'
title: b'very good'
body: b'easy to read, fun, good old fashioned detective story. really enjoyed it, quick read. was left wanting a detective Strike sequel.'

author: b'Michele Feltman Strider'
title: b'This book is a blessing.'
body: b"The author's love and compassion for her characters shines though this sad tale like sunshine. It was the little touches that killed me, like when we learn that Krystal had never had a banana before. Did I cry? You bet your banana I did."

author: b'Connie P. Utt'
title: b'Not an interesting book'
body: b'Not my favorite book by any means.  A struggle to finish it but afterward when I thought about it, I could see what whe wass trying to say.'

author: b'LYNN G KRUEGER'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'OK'

author: b'Chazaam'
title: b'Much Better Than Some Would Have You Believe'
body: b"You'd be hard pressed to find such a modern study of human character, sometimes in its basest forms, that is both entertaining and thought-provoking.  Many will never enjoy the brilliance of this novel because they are put off by the rather slow start. I had even avoided it for years, but after reading and thoroughly enjoying the two Cormoran Strike installments, I couldn't put it off any longer.  Believe me when I say that your patience will be justly rewarded.  While reading, I was struck by how mean and narcissistic the characters were, and my ability to identify with them. It made me think of The Last Psychologist's proclamation that we are all just a bunch of narcissists . I know that I'm misquoting him, so just go and check out his posts for yourselves.  http://thelastpsychiatrist.com/narcissism/"

author: b'lonegunwoman'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy by J K Rowling...................'
body: b'For me this was an enjoyable engaging read, with a story line  that features strong characters, some are not so nice that makes the pages turn faster!  With prose that flows smoothly  I found it difficult to put down  for any length of time.  Having read this novel some time ago I wanted to add my voice to all the reviews out there,  as always it is a personal choice when reading a novel, I found this a very entertaining read for a good few hours one that remains with you long after finishing the novel.'

author: b'Loves To Read'
title: b"There's a bit of a barrier to entry, but it's brilliantly written"
body: b"This is a book that you have to commit to reading in its entirety.  The beginning is a bit overwhelming and I can completely understand why so many readers gave up on it in the first few chapters.  There are so many characters to try to learn and keep track of that it seems like an impossible mess.  However Rowling does just enough to make each character memorably unique that as long as you're paying attention, you'll be able to sort out who's who."

author: b'Glynnis Jones'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'The casual vacancy was poignant and powerful. I was truly moved.'

author: b'C. Bronte'
title: b'An engrossing enjoyable read'
body: b"I admit I procrastinated in reading this book after hearing some negative reports about the crude language, the unpleasant characters, and the all around disappointment of many with this beloved author.  I should have known better.  J K Rowling just can't write a bad book.  This one is as carefully crafted as her magnificent Harry Potters, everything falls in place.  The language that some readers deplore fit the characters exactly.  I found the insight into human nature to be as finely accurate as that in the HP books, but the struggle between good and evil now takes place within the psyches of her people.  As others have stated, this book isn't for everyone.  But if you have lived in a small town like this one, it rings as clear and true as a bell.  The striving for position, for holding onto small amounts of power, the desperation of the big fish in a small pond mentality, is dead on.  J K Rowling is expert at dissecting the layers that hold such societies together, showing how fragile they are.  This is a book I am glad to have read."

author: b'Loren Krumwiede'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Very dull'

author: b'GAPLI'
title: b'Made patrons of our library happy!'
body: b'We have a strong J.K. Rowling following and they were thrilled to see a new book by her!'

body: b'The only reason I have this book 4 stars is that I found it difficult keeping the characters straight in my mind.  There are so many characters and sometimes their first name is used and sometimes their surnames.'

author: b'Nancy from GA'
