body: b'Moves too slowly'

author: b'Katie Strganac'
title: b'Vulgar!!'
body: b"This book was extremely vulgar. I didn't even get halfway through the book. It was awful!"

author: b'A&P'
title: b'This is like the dark side of Little Whinging'
body: b'Since I haven\'t read anything by Rowling other than the Harry Potter series,  I didn\'t know what to expect.  The novel is pretty slow going and she lulls you into thinking, "Ok, this is English life in a small town written like a soap opera" but as you keep reading, you can sense that something is happening but you\'re not quite sure what it is. She builds the characters gradually, giving you time to become engrossed and care (or not care) about them. The momentum builds and then comes the avalanche at the end. This book is an adult book and reveals Rowling\'s diverse writing skills. 01-23-15'

author: b"Erin O'Riordan"
title: b'Kudos, Ms. Rowling'
body: b'I recently finished The Casual Vacancy, the first novel J.K. Rowling wrote specifically for adults and her first post-Harry Potter release. If you have not read it, please look away now, as this post is not spoiler-free.'

author: b'Italian Dreamer'
title: b"Not sure I will really enjoy it. I've started reading it several times but ..."
body: b"I've put this novel aside for later.  Not sure I will really enjoy it.  I've started reading it several times but never actually finished it."

author: b'Yolonda Smith'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Very disappointed in the book very long and not good.'

author: b'andreasarasota'
title: b'somewhat Interesting.......very sad'
body: b'It was interesting to view life in a small town in Europe. It is probably much akin to small-town USA. It was terribly sad to see in nearly every family such unhappiness and so much sadness. I chose to read this because I liked all of the Harry Potter books so much. What a let-down !'

author: b'sksd49'
title: b"Unequivocally not a children's book"
body: b"The first 300 pages of this book seem to be a laundry list of everything that couldn't be put into a children's book. If I wasn't reading this for my book club, I would have given up after the first section. There were also far too many characters to keep track of; I saw a character map and there are around 35 characters...much too many."

author: b'Bill Grennan'
title: b'best writer of our age'
body: b'Rowling is without a doubt the best writer of our age!  Loved the book and all of her books, no matter under which name she writes'

author: b'Danbob'
title: b'Bought as a present.'
body: b'Bought as a present.  My wife did enjoy reading it.'

author: b'Debbie Dammeir'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'no Harry Potter.'

author: b'Susan M. Peyton'
title: b'Almost TOO Real but I Still Recommend It'
body: b"It was a much quicker read for me than any of her Harry Potter books, but I can't say it was an enjoyable read because--unlike her fantasy novels--everything is almost too real to be enjoyed, and yet, that was probably her point. The characters' lives kept the pages turning even though their conflicts were mostly petty and often downright stupid, but it's those kinds of people who believe their issues supercede everyone else's. The lives of the downtrodden don't matter even though those people to whom the small-town and small-minded people turn up their noses have the most real problems. Like reality, their outcomes don't fare well at all. Also like reality, the harsh underbelly of racism and classism remain virtually unchanged and almost unnoticeable if it weren't for Rowling's omniscient glimpse into the ugliest minds of the most seemingly banal of characters."

author: b'Ask Peg'
title: b"Hadn't yet hit her stride as an adult novelist with ..."
body: b'Hadn\'t yet hit her stride as an adult novelist with "The Casual Vacancy".  By the time she wrote "The Silkworm", she\'d perfected yet another genre.'

author: b'KatieM'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b"Excellent book! It's identifiable as JK Rowling's style"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A Challenge to Read But an Opportunity to Broaden Perceptions'
body: b"I picked this book up in a library to read during cruise down time. I selected the book because of the author, decided to read it because of the cover jacket description and continued reading to the end because I wanted to see how it ended and I wanted to get a picture of British village life. I was not making Harry Potter comparisons at any time. I am able to compartmentalize my expectations and took this book on its own merit. That being said, it was difficult for me to make it through the book. The numerous characters were hard to keep straight until almost half way through. Once I thought I had them sorted, the story became easier to follow and I did develop feelings, good and bad, for some of the characters. I would not recommend this book except as a look into the way villagers live from day to day as they struggle to find their place in the scheme of their world. I saw another review that mentioned Peyton Place and that was my first thought on completing the book as I reviewed my reaction. That characters have few redeeming qualities and the ones they do exhibit do not seem strong enough to be a permanent part of their substance. They have moments of ethical or moral behavior but can't seem to maintain it and fall back into old habits. Almost as if the reason they behave ethically is not because it is the right thing to do but because they have considered how others will perceive their action. Perhaps that is not far from the mark."

author: b'David B'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'I liked it'

author: b'Zootie'
title: b"Couldn't get into it"
body: b"The characters in this novel were like characters in Tolstoy, in the sense that I needed a chart to keep track of them.  I tried and tried to like this book but I just could not get into it.  I couldn't get into Harry Potter, either.  I thought maybe a book for adults would suit me better.  It didn't."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'All over the place'
body: b"I found this book very confusing at first due to the large amount of characters introduced within a very short time period.  I also found that the vast majority of the characters were not redeemable.  The ending was so abrupt I had to check my Kindle a couple times to make sure I wasn't missing something.  Truly not the book I was expecting."

author: b'Patricia Myers'
title: b'Liked it!'
body: b"It was an interesting story of how one man effected so many lives. Barry's death effected teenagers and adults alike. He effected them directly and indirectly. It certainly made me think about the people in my life. My only complaint about the book was a lot of characters were thrown at you at once. It was hard to keep everyone straight."

author: b'Ed  Creede'
title: b'One Star'
body: b"Couldn't finish it. Thought it was trash."

author: b'Noemi'
title: b'Great Book'
body: b"This book was sad, funny and interesting to read.  I've had sleepless nights and mornings and found myself reading this book I fell asleep. It was sometimes sad, funny and interesting to put down at times and that's why I rated this book 5 stars. I would recommend this book not only to teenagers but to adults as well."

author: b'Kamila Stofirova'
title: b'Distrubing topics, lovely prose'
body: b"If you like easy reading with a highly moral character to identify with, don't even think about picking up this book. You'd be risking becoming one of those dissatisfied reviewers. But if you can appreciate expert writing even though it paints a rather disturbing picture, you're gonna love this book. It explores many present-day issues, such as physical abuse, substance abuse, bullying, child neglect, self-mutilation, domestic violence, adolescent revolt, or neurological disorders. Characters are motivated by anger, jealousy, selfishness, fear, provincial narrow-mindedness, and other negative sides of human nature. Ms. Rowling has woven an intricate web of characters and relationships, all tainted by some sort of frustration. Thanks to the third person omniscient point of view, all pieces of the mosaic fall nicely in place and psychological motivation of individual characters is revealed."

author: b'AllieMac'
title: b'Too many characters, hard to keep my interest.'
body: b"Too many characters, hard to keep my interest. Couldn't get into it and never finished the book after getting halfway through"

author: b'M. Schlachter'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Boring'

author: b'Charlie'
title: b'an adult reading'
body: b'A very intense story about the classes in England.  This could apply to many towns in America.  Rowling shows a side of life that is very real and very sad.  The personalities of the characters are heart wrenching.'

author: b'Catherine A. Latora'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b"Couldn't get through the first couple of chapters."

author: b'Malcolm Ellis'
title: b'disappointing'
body: b'A disappointing read that seemed to go nowhere & left a number of issues up in the air & unfinished'

author: b'G. Punto'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'An OK book, but was not as excited abut the book as anticipated.'

author: b'michael chiedi'
title: b'Great book'
body: b'JK has done it again. loved every second. the story had me in a range of emotions from start to finish.'

author: b'owlet'
title: b"I was disappointed in Rowling's first sortie away from the fantasy world ..."
body: b'I was disappointed in Rowling\'s first sortie away from the fantasy world of Harry Potter which I adored. Casual Vacancy is carefully void of any magic, even the "ordinary" human magic of compassion. The only character who seems to have decency and lovingkindness dies on page one. Everyone else seems greedy or venal or terribly limited. But I\'m glad that Ms. Rowling is still writing because I know she has a remarkable gift and she will find her way to produce more excellent works.'

author: b'Alissa'
title: b"Don't Waste Your Time"
body: b"My book club and I all hated this more than any other book we have read in the past 3 years. I had never read the Harry Potter series so I went in with an open mind but it was a waste of time. It was depressing without any resolution. The characters did not grow despite all of the devastating occurrences in their lives. It almost seems like Rowling just wanted to write a sob story and then gave up halfway through. I've read that it was a socialist manifesto in disguise but I wouldn't give it that much credit."

author: b'Frances Ballard'
title: b"Couldn't finish"
body: b"One of the few books I couldn't bring myself to finish reading.  I loved the Harry Potter series, so I was very disappointed with this one."

author: b'Joyce Strohman'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'This was quite different than the Harry Potter series. I had trouble following it and did not finish the book'

author: b'Ardy Woolley'
title: b'It did get a little better at the end in a morbid way'
body: b'Kind of disturbing.  It did get a little better at the end in a morbid way.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Worth dragging through it at the end, but my goodness it was dark!'

author: b'Jeffrey A. Simons'
title: b'Not Harry Potter and that is a good thing'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy is a complete departure from J.K. Rowling's previous books but is equally captivating and compelling."

author: b'A. Cohn'
title: b'Huge disappointment for this Rowling fan'
body: b"While I loved the Harry Potter series, and thought the Cuckoo's Calling was a brilliant start to a great series, I can't believe how much I disliked The Casual Vacancy. I read it through to the end, almost against my will - like looking at something gross despite the revulsion. Rowling may have been making a social statement - or something - but it was lost amidst the despair, unlikable characters, heavy-handed plotting, etc. Even her usual, impeccably precise writing couldn't rise above the mess and the complete lack of subtlety. Really disappointing and a complete waste of time. (I'm giving it two stars and not one, because I reserve one-star ratings for books I can't finish. This one, unfortunately, I did.)"

author: b'anonymous'
title: b'slow start, but interesting.'
body: b'Interesting characters, but sometimes hard to keep all of them apart.  Had a hard time getting through it at first, but the plot picked up 1/2 way through.'

author: b'Robyn Vrana'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'So well-written.'

author: b'Paul Mallon'
title: b'Gave as gift. Well protected in shipment.'
body: b'Gave as gift.'

author: b'Katie Williams'
title: b'Slow start but draws you in.'
body: b"It took me a while to get into this book but I am pleased that I persevered with it. The characters are very real - some I loved while some were cruel. I was heartbroken at times and certainly didn't pick the ending. Couldn't put it down towards the end."

author: b'alan stops'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'I found it  captivating.'

author: b'IRV FRANKEL'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'She writes well.'

author: b'Celia Stone'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'The first few chapters I read were trash.I did not read the rest.'

author: b'Sue'
title: b'She loved it. It came speedily'
body: b'I bought this as a gift. She loved it. It came speedily. Thanks so much.'

author: b'Julia Carroll, Ph.D.'
title: b'BORING'
body: b'BORING'

author: b'JJD'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Not up to her normal quality. Strange ending.'

author: b'Kdelight'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Just a depressing book.'

author: b'Stan Snapp'
title: b'Not a Harry Potter Story'
body: b"Loved this book and I'm not a Harry Potter person but his is well written and a real page turner."

author: b'Patricia Rosario'
title: b'Another side of JK...'
body: b'Well written, but of course, a much different style than the HP books.  This book paints British small town life as the dreariest, fakest, most unhhapy thing on Earth. Not a single good thing happens throughout the book!  Interesting read, but boy, it brings you down...'

author: b'Looking for a Fun Read'
title: b'Unpleasant book with somewhat redeeming ending'
body: b'I hated this book until the final section, and then I thought it redeemed itself enough to give it a marginally favorable review.  Rowling did a masterful job for the first nine-tenths of this book in creating a small community filled with loathsome people with few favorable characteristics.  Unfortunately, the reading experience was so miserable that I think I have actually been irritable with my family while I have been reading the book.'

author: b'Ruth Marks'
title: b'I hope this is the first of many books for adults by JK Rowling.'
body: b'The character development in this book made it so fun to read. I keep thinking about the characters and I am glad I read it.'

author: b'Cecilia'
title: b'it was okay'
body: b'Meh. It wasn\'t horrible. But it wasn\'t good. And the repeated reference to "under my umbrella" was extremely annoying. Why she chose to repeatedly use that song is beyond me. However, there is grit and realism, which I can appreciate. Some may say she should have stuck to HP. What those people don\'t realize is this shows her development and talent as a writer to go from children\'s fantasy to a novel of this sort. Well done Ms. Rowling'

author: b'Peg'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Great book'

author: b'Sherry Shike'
title: b'Brilliant story of teenage angst and often the hypocrisy in all of us, underneath the layers'
body: b"It's rare to find a book that wakes you up so deeply while having you laughing and crying, in equal measure."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'I would not recommend this to my worst enemy'
body: b'Never in my life have I not completed a book. I read several different books whilst reading this one just to try and break up the complete and utter hideousness of a shockingly dreadful read. Alas, it was not so. I gave up. Sadly, I would not recommend this to my worst enemy. A total contrast in writing style to the HP novels we all know and adore.'

author: b'Freezy'
title: b'So good.'
body: b'Loved this book. You feel like you know these people and this town long after finishing the book. J K Rowling is an amazing writer.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Not a page turner'
body: b"Really hard to get into. Seems disjointed with so many different story lines. I haven't finished it yet as it's not fully captured me and I purchased it several months ago."

author: b'Pat Barry'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'good story line'

author: b'Faye Stephens'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'I did not complete.  Not my kind of reading'

author: b'Kathryn M. Maguire'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Difficult to get into expected better'

author: b'Buddy Rogers'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'Having never read this author, but being aware of her great fame, i was disappointed by the lack of cleverness of the plot, and the characters being so trite and unbelievable.  A very long read for such little payoff.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Started out slow, but overall, a good read.'
body: b"The story does start off slow and I had the urge to quit reading it; however, owing to my faith in Jo's writing, I decided to continue on. First of all, reviewers who didn't like this story either did not finish it or were just expecting another extraordinary Harry Potter story to come out. On the contrary, The Casual Vacancy is anything but extraordinary --- the novel focuses on one small little town and on the ordinary lives of its residents. I do admit that the premise of the story would have have grip me to read the book if it weren't written by Jo. It is not a gripping story that would keep you awake at night, wanting to know what's next, wanting to read more. I read this book over the course of six months (I usually read and finish books within a day or two) during my downtime at work, wanting to finish it and knowing what eventually happens. When it all ended, I did feel like I would miss reading about the characters because the characters, especially the teenagers of the story, was the most interesting part of the story."

author: b'Gerald W. Lankford'
title: b'Good Writing a little slow'
body: b'Enjoyed it for the most part but not one of my favorites. Very complex to get into 89 characters .  Drama in a small community in the UK.'

author: b'Buffy Moon'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Story of the intertwined lives in a small town voyueristic look behind the closed doors.  Deep character development.'

author: b'Mara L. Marsh'
title: b'Different feel, but still excellent writing'
body: b"Overall, I liked this book.  I listened to the audio version and have not read the text.  I've read the reviews about too much fluff, but I would disagree.  While the subject matter and tone is drastically different than Harry Potter, I could still see each scene and character as I listened and to me that is the mark of a good writer.  I did not find my mind wandering while I listened.  There are two main reasons I did not give the book 5 stars.  The first is that there were a lot of characters that were introduced quickly.  I did find myself wondering who a character was shortly after the introduction.  This corrected itself as I got further in the book, but in the beginning it was slightly confusing.  The other point was I personally did not care for the ending.  I was waiting for the next chapter and the book was over."

author: b'Ann C Allard'
title: b"I loved this book as well as the other two 'non-Harry ..."
body: b"I loved this book as well as the other two 'non-Harry Potter' books by J. K. Rowling.  I found this one to be very dark and considered putting it down several times.  But the characters grabbed me and I couldn't stop thinking about them.  Had to finish the book to see how each was ultimately developed.  Once completed, it stayed on my mind for a long time.  I think this would be a great 'book club' selection."

author: b'susan hicksj'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Love it.'

author: b'Karen Lea Hansen'
title: b'Riveting. It left me feeling emotionally wrecked.'
body: b"Like most people I know, I jumped on the Harry Potter train. I read the series, saw about half of the movie adaptations and I'm eager to visit Universal Studio's The Wizarding World of Harry Potter. I enjoyed the stories, but I must confess that I didn't really think of J.K. Rowling as a writer beyond the Potter Series."

author: b'Colin MOORCRAFT'
title: b'Marvellous character assassination of virtually everyone in a small town ...'
body: b'Marvellous character assassination of virtually everyone in a small town community and their local politics, whilst involved with impending Parish Council Elections following the sudden death of a Councillor.'

author: b'Eric A. Kugler'
title: b'The Outsiders meets Anna Karenina'
body: b'Pretry good book with a boring and trite ending.'

author: b'Tree'
title: b'Not really her best. Too much fluff about nothing in the book'
body: b'Not really her best.  Too much fluff about nothing in the book.'

author: b'David A. Lamb'
title: b'J. K. Rowling is, undoubtedly a phenomenal ...'
body: b"J.K. Rowling is, undoubtedly a phenomenal writer. This story centers on one small town and the lives it contains. I read all of the Harry Potter books and was struck at Rowling's ability to tailor her writing style to her aging audience. Here, Rowling once again knows her audience...unless somebody is expecting fantasy and magic. If you're looking for fantasy and magic, look elsewhere. This book is a real as you can get."

author: b'LadyHerbie'
title: b"This can't possibly be the same author as HP. ..."
body: b"This can't possibly be the same author as HP.  There is nothing redeeming about any of the characters or the story."

author: b'youstruckgold'
title: b'Life under the stairs.'
body: b"This is NOT Harry Potter! Nor is it the smile-inducing detective romps of her Galbraith musings. The only positive force in this novel, disappears in the first few pages. From there Rowling treats us to a world of petty parochial politics, emotional heart ache, and unhappy endings. Casual vacancy again demonstrates Rowling's fabulous character development and scene setting; while demonstrating the enormous challenges that face those challenged most of all by their circumstances and demographics. A good read  - this is a journey well and truly under the stairs."

author: b'Desert Rat'
title: b"Didn't Even Finish It"
body: b'I checked this book out at my local library and returned it a week later.'

author: b'Gonzo'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Quality book.'

author: b'Russell S. Marshall'
title: b'A Modest Work with Significant Profanity'
body: b'A modest work with significant and gratuitous profanity.  The book contains a pot-load of characters that are never fully developed.  Yet, they act and respond quite surprisingly.  Teachers, teens, and young children use language like they are characters in an HBO prison life or swingers special.  I finished it, but it was not a pleasant or particularly informative piece of writing.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Not quite Harry Potter!!'
body: b'I was a bit disappointed in this book, especially with what I considered a quite unsatisfactory ending. I must admit that it held my attention throughout!'

author: b'Loraine Mc Namee'
title: b'I would not recommend this book to a friend and would be wary ...'
body: b'I read the book completely, and found it to be depressing - I prefer a more uplifting book and something that is a bit lighter.  The story line was dark, and definately an adult book - graphic detailed descriptions in this book of various social situations/scenarios not suitable for children.  Surprised that J. K. Rowling could produce this type of book following her huge international success with the Harry Potter series.  I would not recommend this book to a friend and would be wary of purchasing another book by this author'

author: b'Barbara Henzel'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Hard to find anything to like in any of the characters until the very end.'

author: b'Julian Satran'
title: b'A beautifully written but heartbreaking story'
body: b'A heartbreaking story that will spoil for you forever the picture perfect image of an English village/suburb. It starts with the sudden death of a councilman due to an aneurysm and its main-line is the competition for the seat that involves a school headmaster, a printing shop foreman and a local attorney (who happens to be the son of the head of the local council). The story evolves around the candidates\' families/extended families and it touches the lives of a single-mother who is a drug addict and her two children - a teenage daughter and a three year old boy. The author manages to make you feel like you were living in Pagford (the name of the village) without filling pages of details - with the same "magic" she succeeded making you live with Hary Potter. And breaks your heart with the accidental death of the little boy of the single mother and the suicide of his sister. The language is perfect and concise, the storytelling is beautiful. I thoroughly enjoyed reading the book and you will probably too (but don\'t expect to be very happy after it).'

author: b'Bonnie M Myers'
title: b'It did not move or move me, as a ...'
body: b'It did not move or move me, as a result, it took me much longer to finish this kindle book than others! The resolutions at the end tied up some things, but not all.'

author: b'Lindsay Swanson'
title: b'Dark humor people will love this!'
body: b'Well I may be bias because I love jk Rowling. But this book is amazing. I also have a very dark sense of humor, and was laughing so hard at many points. I love how all the characters are intertwined and the stories with them.'

author: b'D. Postma'
title: b'There is everything to like in this story'
body: b"There is everything to like in this story. Rowling proves she has more depth than children's fantasy. I am well read and if any would be offended I can only say try looking in the mirror a bit more. If you don't like what you see... start with yourself then your circle, then beyond."

author: b'VA Girl'
title: b"I'd recommend it to anyone 13 years and up"
body: b"I don't have the words to express the impact this story could have on readers.  Ms. Rowling is not a one time Harry Potter success!"

author: b'Adrian I.'
title: b'five stars'
body: b'great item & book and in very good condition.'

author: b'PKsweets'
title: b'In need of good editing!'
body: b"Tried to like it.....HAD to stop at chapter 40.....just don't care anymore, my time is more valuable.  Long, overdone, over-narrated and I am over it!"

author: b'Milpitas'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b"Story wasn't as good as I thought"

author: b'Hunters'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b"didn't care for it.  She should stick with Harry Potter"

author: b'PegM'
title: b'A Difficult Read'
body: b'We in the U.S. have noticed a tendency on the part of some those who reside "across the pond" to be cruelly sarcastic without a trace of shame. There is a lot of that sort of spirit in this book and that made it a difficult read for this reader. If you like "gotcha" moments, if revenge is your cup of tea, you should enjoy the bulk of this book, however, you might find the softening of that stance toward the end a bit of a disappointment. If you, on the other hand want to believe in virtue and goodness you might want to know that although truly awful things happen, at the end there seems to be something of a vindication of worthwhile values, if you don\'t particularly mind having been dragged across a minefield of nastiness to get there.'

author: b'Vernon Goodrich'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Big let down from her Harry Potter books.'

author: b'JLS'
title: b'Not for the sensitive'
body: b"I was, at first, overwhelmed by the number of characters introduced in the beginning of this story, however, Ms. Rowling has a talent for giving each character their own voice and qualities. The events that happen throughout the book are mostly connected to each other and equally interesting. You may find yourself sympathizing with one person while despising another and then reversing your feelings all together. In any case, it's a story that makes you open your eyes."

author: b'SJB'
title: b'I expected more.'
body: b"I really hoped for more from JK Rowling.  Harry Potter series was amazingly imaginative and I couldn't put it down.  This book was not her best.  Her new series under her pen name is much better than this book.  Start with the Cormoran Strike books instead.  This was the only book of J.K. Rowling that didn't suck me in"

author: b'Moira Sheridan'
title: b'Loved it.'
body: b'What a surprise........  had read many negative reviews of this book but finally decided to dive in.  Loved it.'

author: b'beatrice j seegers'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'just so so'

author: b'manuela i.b.'
title: b'Pushed aside'
body: b"Hard to get into. I need to make another attempt in the future. I wasn't turned on at all."

author: b'Jimena Nieto'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'I had a great time with this book!'

author: b'Mary D. Grace'
title: b'A little hard to follow at first...'
body: b"This book was a little hard to follow at first. There were numerous, seemingly disconnected characters with their lives and stories moving in different directions. Somewhere past the middle of the book, however, their lives started moving toward each other. And in the end, the loose ends were tied up, although not necessarily in a pretty package. The characters' difficult lives were exposed and sometimes overly heavy. The conclusion of the book, though, made the ride worthwhile. And the inspirational spark to do something to better our communities was an unexpected gift."

author: b'M. Ann'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'The opposite of Harry Potter - no character development, no interesting story line, no value.'

author: b'Donna P. Katsaounis'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Super book.'

author: b'Wood'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Perfect gift.'

author: b'A.M.A.'
title: b'Yesh! Could not get through it.'
body: b'Yesh!  Could not get through it.'

author: b'Lana23'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Enjoy her stories.  So different from her Harry Potter series.  Will read more of this series.'

author: b'AZ Flygirl'
title: b'Gross profanity does not make a story edgy, only shows lack of imagination'
body: b"I was astonished at the profane language in this book and I admit I couldn't get past the 2nd chapter.  I was listening to it and when the character used the most profane word in the middle of Diety's name I took my earbuds out and gave up. I know it is considered sophisticated now to use profanity, but some of us would rather not muddy up the language with words that do not describe, only show the inability to create a story with actual thoughtfulness. I also did not like any of the characters, and it's hard to stay with a story if I don't feel any sympathy or affection for them. After reading the other reviews I'm glad I did not buy this audiobook and can just return it to the library. I wish I had read the reviews before."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'This book is not for the lighthearted.'
body: b'"The Casual Vacancy" touches on a lot of heavy topics and Rowling isn\'t shy about painting a graphic picture for us. I personally loved this book, although I did have to put it down to catch my breath a few times.'

author: b'Cathy Pentecost'
title: b'Not a happy read'
body: b'The characters really evolved well, but pretty sad.'

author: b'Kres'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b"Thank JKR! I'll keep buying all your stories!"

author: b'Eric Conn'
title: b'great storytelling, extremely graphic'
body: b'Rawling tells a great story as always, and character development is second to none. This is hardly Harry Potter, however, as the story is full of incredibly graphic material. Likewise, the story seems to end without much resolution or point. Did Rawling get tired of writing and force an abrupt closing? It sure feels that way. English 101: every good story needs a resolution.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'OK'

author: b'Derrick Lyons'
title: b'Great and intricate plot'
body: b"Great and intricate plot. It sometimes is a bit difficult to keep up with all of the moving pieces in her puzzle but it's really a well written story. And the character development is awesome. You really get a good feel for all of the people."

author: b'RICHARD LA'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Every bit as good as her Harry Potter series.  She is clearly a multifaceted person and writer.'

author: b'alazala'
title: b'proceeding through hate or rebellion and closing whith reconciliation'
body: b'This choral plot is a passionate manifesto in defence of the less blessed and weak members of communities. It aims to show that they are worth of pity and protection as much as the self centered members of upper class, who generally feel as much miserable and unhappy  only due to ambiguous human relations.  The indifference and selfishiness of rich people is made laughable in comparison to disgraces and basic unmet needs of the very unlucky counterpart.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Fantastic characters'
body: b'Such an amazing story full of real and captivating characters. Can the story get a little disturbing? Yes. This book is not for the faint of heart, but if you want a real, well-written look at small-town life - this book is a must-read! Loved it!'

author: b'M. McDonough'
title: b'when does the plot get interesting?'
body: b'After reading twenty percent of this slow-moving tale of a small town, I gave up. Yes, the character development was excellent but no obvious plot.'

author: b'Wendy Hutchinson'
title: b'all hating their lives and going on to screw each other over in pathetic ways. JKR should stick to fantasy'
body: b'Actually, I would give this book zero stars!  It was awful from beginning to end.  A total downer.  Many, many dreary characters, all hating their lives and going on to screw each other over in pathetic ways.  JKR should stick to fantasy.'

author: b'Alin'
title: b"Can think of no reason to recommend this to anyone except someone I don't like."
body: b"I am very appreciative that Rowling and the major media reviewers have cleared up for me the features needed to get a critically aclaimed novel. To wit - a boring story, all characters headed nowhere good, no single likeable character, no identifiable justification for writing the story. The main take-home is a description of the one place and population you absolutely don't want to be around. I refuse to accept that it's worth writing a depressing story just to be depressing - does this mean I'm not 'cultured' or 'intellectual' by reviewers standards?."

author: b'Lucy M.'
title: b'Good book'
body: b"I was surprised to see all the bad reviews at this site and an overall rating of 3 stars for Rowling's book, The Casual Vacancy. Were all these people expecting Harry Potter?  I get the feeling that if she had never written that phenomenal series, people might not be so critical of her stab at an adult novel. Reviewers complained that there were no redeemable characters in the cast and the book was a depressing mess.  Well, I thought it was a very good book, well written and hard to put down. I thought this was a fairly accurate picture of life in modern times. Teens hating their parents....teens being bullied...bored spouses who cheat...rich people turning their heads with no concern for the poor in their midst...innocent children being abused and neglected with tragic results....insincere people gossiping. It all happens in the real world we live in and Rowling just took a slice from that real world and portrayed it well in her novel. Everyone isn't rich, moral or happy. Problems exist."

author: b'Sheila Deeth'
title: b'Thought-provoking and thoroughly authentic'
body: b'If you watched Broadchurch, or the American version, Gracepoint, you probably already know the flavor of J. K. Rowlings The Casual Vacancy. A small English town and its even smaller suburb across the hill form the backcloth to the tale. A wealth of characters, rich and poor, young and old, all hide their sins and secrets, living seemingly normal lives with normal afflictions covering normal needs. But one man has died, leaving a casual vacancy on the council. The councils word just might decide the future of a teenage girl and her run-down neighborhood. But it all depends on who can win the most votes, sway the most opinions, or beat the system most efficiently.'

author: b'Michael Harryman'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'good'

author: b'Hils'
title: b'An interesting read.'
body: b"An interesting read, but rather prescriptive in that she seemed to want to 'tick the boxes' re.social problems. I didn't feel I empathised with many of the characters, except for the young girl, Krystal. There were parts of the book that I enjoyed, others that were heavy going. However, overall I enjoyed her descriptive writing, and felt that her small observations of characters were well done."

author: b'RGC Burns'
title: b'Realistic, well-researched and well-written page-turner'
body: b'I am puzzled by a lot of the negative reader reviews, unless they are from people who were expecting a Harry Potter-type story.  I thought this was an exceptional book, with a wide range of social issues interwoven with very realistic and, I thought, mostly well-drawn characters into a well-written story that kept my interest.  This is a much better book and a much more realistic one than I expected from a writer who has heretofore written fantasy.  It kept me up reading into the early hours several nights running.  One reviewer said the ending was predictable; I disagree completely.  This book is not "about" drug use, child abuse and other horrors of modern life that impact characters in the story; it is about the interconnectedness of lives, the unexpected consequences of actions both planned and spontaneous, the secrets we guard and the lies we tell, sometimes to ourselves, to guard them; and how readily we misjudge others\' motives and characters, being willfulling ignorant of what they have actually experienced.  Images and characters from this book will stay with me for a long time.'

author: b'Linda L.Clark'
title: b'Well developed characters; but not particularly likeable.'
body: b'Well developed characters;but not particularly likeable.'

author: b'SCM'
title: b'Great writing, but not enjoyable to read.'
body: b"I think JK Rowling is a brilliant author.  Probably the best on earth.  However, I did not enjoy this book.  It's excellent writing, but the story, the subject matter, and the general tone of the book were unpleasant and I derived no pleasure from reading this.  Artistically it's perfectly executed, but it was just not enjoyable to read."

author: b'Brian A Stokes'
title: b'Venality in small town England'
body: b"This was listed under mystery, but I wouldn't categorize it as such. The story of life in a small town among a small circle of friends, acquaintances and enemies is well told and pulls you into its orbit. The characters are well drawn."

author: b'Aisling Peyton'
title: b'Wow'
body: b"A really wonderful read, you could never predict where this book would take you. I laughed out loud and I cried. The characters are rich and you'll end up loving the ones you thought you'd hate!"

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Left no impression'

author: b'Horst Eisfelder'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'A very good story. However to fully understand it, I am now reading it again from the very beginning.'

author: b'gammyraye'
title: b'Not bad, but not really great either....'
body: b"If this novel were by an unknown author, I doubt that it would have made much of a splash at all. Since it was written by the author of the Harry Potter series, of course it attracted all kinds of attention and undoubtedly sold very well, despite the fact that it's not earth-shaking, groundbreaking, spirit lifting, thought inspiring, or page-turning. It's not a bad novel by any means, but it's not an especially good one either. It's actually pretty depressing in its picture of the people in a small English village."

author: b'Adam J. Cooper'
title: b'Big Disappointment!'
body: b'Such a disappointment!  So far below the quality of Harry Potter.  The plot was boring and so were the characters.  Very flat and uninteresting.'

author: b'S D McEachron'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Boring money not well spent.  Well written though.'

author: b'Jessica Donohue'
title: b'purposefully so that I (as a huge Harry Potter fan) would not be too disappointed when I read it'
body: b"I waited a long time to read this book, purposefully so that I (as a huge Harry Potter fan) would not be too disappointed when I read it. I had heard lots of bad things and was completely resigned to low expectations. However, it was wonderful. It got off to a little of a rocky start, and the large cast of characters lost me for a little while before I hit my stride. But this is one of the best depictions of human foibles, how we think we are versus how others perceive us, how we all have brutal flaws and soaring high points. The shifting perspectives allows an insight into different points of view, creating multifaceted, interesting characters. I hated and loved all of them. By about halfway through this book I was having trouble putting it down and upon finishing it was left with a powerful ache and a new perspective. This book is probably not for everyone, and I can see how many a HP fan would be disappointed and bewildered. This book is JK doing something very different. It's adult, it's serious, it's complex, and it's very heavy. The book this most reminds me of is The Goldfinch, which I recently finished. If that sort of thing isn't your cup of tea, this probably isn't either."

author: b'jms'
title: b'Eye Opener'
body: b"I wish many conservatives would read this book. It could be an eye opener. Politics, attitudes and the lives affected in a small English community seems to reflect what we see, but can't understand, on a larger scale (USA). I gave it an extra star for impact. Takes a while to get to know the characters, but worth it."

author: b'john martin'
title: b"There's not one character to love in this book"
body: b"There's not one character to love in this book."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Wonderful'
body: b"Great book. well written with real characters and an interesting plot. Don't read if you are expecting another Harry Potter- this is a book for adults so yes it deals with things like death, rape, self mutilation, and abuse and includes some cursing, just like in real life. The beginning was a bit of a slow going since there are so many main characters but once you figure out who everyone is it reads much faster and it's well worth the effort."

author: b'Carol from Ohio'
title: b'Got better towards the end'
body: b'Characters hard to follow. Got better towards the end.'

author: b'LPD'
title: b'This is a work of genius.'
body: b"I absentmindedly picked up this book out of curiosity and absolutely could not put it down. From the start I marveled at Rowling's storytelling and at her perfectly sketched characters; if you like dynamic, vulnerable, flawed characters (read: no perfect heroes or villains) this is the book for you. These initial feelings were only strengthened as the story unfolded and I became even more engulfed in the lives of Pagford's denizens."

author: b'Post It Note'
title: b'well-written'
body: b'I really wanted to love this book. It was exceptionally well-written, though the sheer number of characters was daunting in the first portion. The subject was one that should have been boring but became intriguing. However, few of the characters had any redeeming qualities. The ending was also infuriating. Without giving away too much, I found the emotions that Rowling tried to arouse too complex and the unraveling of events too quick.'

author: b'London Lass'
title: b'Teenagers steal the show'
body: b'The untimely death of a local councillor (from natural causes!) results in ructions as the posher villagers gang up on the crumbling council estate on their doorstep. Although the adult characters are well drawn, it is the teenagers who steal the show. As in Harry Potter, it is absolutely clear who the heroes and villains are. A fun, escapist read.'

author: b'M. Turner'
title: b'The morphing of JK Rowling'
body: b'A simple story but elevated by the beautiful use of language and descriptive phrasing. JKR has morphed magically from the world of Harry Potter into the more mundane arena of small-town politics and its players.'

author: b'C. Taylor'
title: b'Good but very sad'
body: b"Definitely worth reading, but I probably won't be able to bring myself to read it again."

author: b'Derek'
title: b'I am thrilled to see a different story from Ms ...'
body: b'I am thrilled to see a different story from Ms. Rowling, although I am still waiting for a update on Harry.'

author: b'Wombat the Bookworm'
title: b'Strong characters & intense experiences; a meditation on middle age, and an exercise in cruelty; also not very good.'
body: b'When Barry Fairbrother, town counsellor for a tiny English down, dies of an anurysm, the ensuing vicious squabble over the titular opening becomes both intricate, fraught, and nightmarish.  The leading lights of the town and their children are all tightly intertwined, and often at odds with one another.  Its a book of strong characters and intense experiences, a meditation on the malaise of middle age, and an exercise in cruelty.  Its also just not a great book.'

author: b'Cynthia A.'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'I was waiting for something amazing to happen the entire book and it never really did.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'It was ok not great'

author: b'Sam'
title: b'I gave it a shot since I love to read'
body: b'Not impressed.'

author: b'Jacqui Whitney'
title: b'Patience Pays Off Here'
body: b'You have to be patient with this story. It takes time to develop the characters and make the reader care enough about them to read on. Having said that, to me it was worth not giving up as the story headed towards its poignant conclusion.  I shed a tear and thought about it afterwards - to me, that makes it a success.'

author: b'Doris L.'
title: b'YUCK. Did not finish this.'
body: b'YUCK.  Did not finish this.'

author: b'S. Moran'
title: b'liked it but a bit long winded'
body: b'Slow start, liked it but a bit long winded.'

author: b'Sharon J. Larson'
title: b"I was very impressed with Rowling's ability to shift her ..."
body: b"I was very impressed with Rowling's ability to shift her writing to a quite different style. The book's focus was obviously well"

author: b'Donna Elsie Flink Linley'
title: b'Fabulous'
body: b"Thank you for writing this book.  I work with victims of domestic violence and at times those who self medicate because of life history or domestic violence.  I find myself frequently disturbed by socio-economic stereotypes & found the author's rich character development outstanding. I have not read any of the author's other books, but will now.  Again thank you.  This book may just change many people's understanding of the world beyond their comfort zone and convince them to get involved and to not be so very quick to judge and/or dismiss other human beings.  Fabulous, fabulous.  I will read again."

author: b'Rahul Zala'
title: b'One line review:'
body: b'A must read because its Rowling...Other then that, its nothing special --- it all kind of worth it in the end.'

author: b'Christopher Beck'
title: b'sadly an epic fail'
body: b"I give 3 stars for the great plot and because it's J.K. Rowling a.k.a. Harry Potter mommy. The plot, however was not executed very well and was put to a total waste I couldn't bear it, I'm sorry. I really tried to finish the book but I can't even go through it halfway. . . I'm stuck and I don't usually get stuck. I haven't finished it, yes, but I can say there were no development in the characters in the story, speaking for just as much as I have read. Like what others would say, she should have stopped at Harry Potter."

author: b'Shirley A. Lambeth'
title: b'Language'
body: b"I liked the book; however not all the fowl language.  I just don't think anyone needs to talk or write like this."

author: b'Judy'
title: b'I liked it. It starts slowly so you need to ...'
body: b'I liked it.  It starts slowly so you need to hang in there with her.'

author: b'Carol Ann'
title: b'OK if you like soap opera-like stories'
body: b'a lot of commotion about very little.OK if you like soap opera-like stories.'

author: b'Dave'
title: b'With the profanity and the sexual parts it seems the ...'
body: b'With the profanity and the sexual parts it seems the book is trying to hard not to be PG.'

author: b'J. A. Hupperich'
title: b'Rowling book'
body: b"I like J.K. Rowling's books but have not had time to read this one yet.  Too many other books in progress.... I'll get around to it.  Looks interesting."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Extremely disappointing'
body: b'I bought the book because I admire J.K. Rowling\'s writing.  I LOVED the Harry Potter series.  Rowling is exceptional at characterization and at setting, and at plot! However, in "The Casual Vacancy" only the plot keeps it going.  I had to read to the end, but I suffered.  I didn\'t care about any of the characters and I saw no need for the intense swearing.  What a disappointment!'

author: b'Talented TJ'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I gave this as a gift to my mother. She thought it was terrible can't figure out why people like it."

author: b'Susan Keleher'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Loved it!'

author: b'Darith'
title: b'should have stopped at Harry Potter'
body: b'started to read the book and realized I needed the audio. So I am listening to it. There is so much foul language it makes it difficult to enjoy the book. None of the characters  have any redeeming qualities. We have Barry Fairweather die at the start of the book and who will fill his council seat. as the story progresses you have children backstabbing their parents, people being raped families not getting along, child  abuse,  . All the book showed me is how messed up Pagford is and I never would want to live there, J.k should have stop with Harry Potter, It makes me not to read any other of her books'

author: b'Rebeccah Neu'
title: b'She writes so well... hope she continues ...'
body: b'She writes so well...hope she continues to bring adult reading to us.'

author: b'Marvin'
title: b'Solid writing'
body: b'A solid effort at adult fiction from a good author.  The little ones turned me into a Potter fan, and her adult stuff is good too.'

author: b'Earl P. Chantrill'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'Good story telling, terrible language.'

author: b'Rebekah Hope'
title: b'Extremely well written. Brilliant character development.'
body: b"J. K. Rowling's usual style of fantasy is quite brilliant. This novel wasn't well received, and I was curious, being a huge fan of her other books. I find that because this book deals with quite serious issues without the guise of fantasy to make them more palatable, her audience may not have expected such a stark view of a town's underpinnings."

author: b'Skb'
title: b'Too much swearing'
body: b'Has too much swearing for my taste.  J K Rowling is a very good writer, but, this is written with too much "adult" content.  Detracts from the story.  Still haven\'t finished it.  Don\'t know if I will.'

author: b'Tiffany Neman'
title: b'... seem to understand why this book has so many poor reviews. Did people expect Harry Potter reincarnated'
body: b"I can't seem to understand why this book has so many poor reviews. Did people expect Harry Potter reincarnated?"

author: b'Melinda Barret'
title: b'Rowling is a very talented writer and I enjoyed the way she wrote this story'
body: b"J.K. Rowling is a very talented writer and I enjoyed the way she wrote this story. The characters were similarly unlikeable to the Dursley's in the Harry Potter series. I am very sensitive, so the ending of the book upset me greatly and I could barely finish it. It was depressing, the characters were depressing but probably true to life. Just because my personality has a hard time with tragedies doesn't mean she is less of a writer. I kind of wish I hadn't ever read it...good art always evokes strong feelings"

author: b'Marlene Sukiennik'
title: b'Good book'
body: b'A little slow in the beginning with a lot of characters intertwined.  Interesting relationship dynamics.  Quick easy read once you get past the first 50 pages or so.'

author: b'Barb Richie'
title: b'ANOTHER GREAT WORK DESTINED TO BECOME A CLASSIC!'
body: b'The woman who, in my opinion, is a better writer than Shakespeare, has written yet another truly great Mistresswork of fiction.'

author: b'Peter Hatch'
title: b'Not what I expected from a writer who has proved ...'
body: b'Not what I expected from a writer who has proved herself to be adept at writing exciting, mysterious novels. I found the subject of this novel with its small town prejudices and pettiness depressing.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'I loved this book'
body: b'I loved this book. J.K Rowling has a way of getting into the heads of her characters. The book looks at the dynamics of village life, and how the death of one person has an impact on more than the family. The characters are real and although their lives are interwoven they are unaware of the connection with each other that  effects the wider village community. Good read'

author: b'JessicaJaneDRG'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'A very political book.'

author: b'Elham Nourani'
title: b'Great plot, great characters'
body: b'The story is amazingly organized around the many characters that seemed difficult to keep track of at first, but all came to have significant roles. I enjoyed the book and could hardly put it down.'

author: b'Sharon D Gray'
title: b'interesting characters'
body: b'Was a little too sad for me and no happy people at all'

author: b'Karen Sisel'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Unnecessary bawdy language.  Distracts from the story.'

author: b'William Paul Plumlee'
title: b'and it seemed to my senses similar in scene setting to the many Brit Coms I enjoy, but it did not capture my full attention ...'
body: b'Just finished Rowling\'s "Casual Vacancy". An amazingly interesting read. I read a few pages in July when I first downloaded it, and it seemed to my senses similar in scene setting to the many Brit Coms I enjoy, but it did not capture my full attention and I put it aside. Picked it back up yesterday, and realized that like a surgeon J.K. had started at the surface, but once she started pealing back layer after layer the novel took on an amazingly interesting light. I will have to digest it for a while to appreciate the entirety of the message encoded within. Definitely a book that has provoked thought in me. Enjoyable read.'

author: b'Kelly Foxworthy'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b"It's was ok."

author: b'Mafe Salas'
title: b'The level of description that Rowling includes makes you feel like you live in Pagford'
body: b"The beginning of the book is a little slow. There are too many characters and that makes it hard to follow each character's storylines. However, once you figure out who's who, the story becomes interesting and captivating. The level of description that Rowling includes makes you feel like you live in Pagford."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Loved it .'

title: b'meh...'
body: b"The way it's written makes me feel like I'm reading an SK novel. Colorful and odd characters with unique descriptions of them, which I do enjoy but I don't like the story at all. I guess  I'm so used to the fanciful Harry Potter books from her I'm having a hard time wrapping my mind around a book about politics. If it wasn't JK, I would have never read it."

author: b'Rehannon Ryder'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'One of those books where you will miss the characters when the book is over.'

author: b'Cynthia S. VanEtta'
title: b"My daughter loved it, my son couldn't finish it"
body: b"I could not finish it!  The characters and plot confused me!  I am told that if I will hang in there I will be rewarded, but as of now the book is closed.  I gave it four stars because I believe what I have been told.  My daughter loved it, my son couldn't finish it.  I will try again because I have read everything J.K Rowling has written, and I've never been disappointed."

author: b'Amanda Baillie'
title: b'Save your money'
body: b"Dreary and depressing. Disagreeable characters and a very uninspiring plot. Couldn't even finish it. There's a reason this book didn't sell until the real name of the author was revealed."

author: b'R. Newman'
title: b'He sounds like he was a swell guy'
body: b'Uhg! Such a chore to even get through this book. Not a single likable character except for the one who caused the vacancy. He sounds like he was a swell guy.'

title: b'I love J. K'
body: b"Sadly, I had to start skimming. So slow. I love J.K. but couldn't do it."

author: b'MARY ANN SCHELL'
title: b'Talent Personified'
body: b"Just finished reading this book for the second time.  J. K. Rowling is a very talented writer.  This book points out the devastating effects drug addiction has on family members, resulting in complete waste and destruction of lives.  J. K. Rowling is an example how success is possible from sheer devotion and motivation, willpower.  I will read all of J. K. Rowling's works.  Knowledgeable and able to write on many subjects."

author: b'Lynne Kipp'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Enjoyed a different side of JK'

author: b'Jane Crofton'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'It seemed like an adult book written for teens to understand.'

author: b'theprimate@aol.com'
title: b'No game'
body: b"I started reading this with no previous knowledge of the author or work, but as a student of writing. This book was like watching baseball practice, with Derek Jeter: the skill, the power, the accuracy, savvy, balance, all the things that make a great athlete. The writer is also extremely skilled. The main flaw, is there was no game, no drama to hold attention, edge of your seat anticipation. I didn't care about the main issue of the town council, and I have met enough jerks in my life, that I don't care to delve into their details during my spare time. Guys, I don't go to the Stadium to watch practice, but to go through a good nine innings. I am wondering what she could do in the next novel."

author: b'Zebra Four'
title: b'we did not expect "Harry Potter" but found the work dull and uninteresting'
body: b'Really disappointing. No. we did not expect "Harry Potter" but found the work dull and uninteresting. On the other had we do like her Cormoran Strike books'

title: b'But by the end i think i understood the meaning behind the book and am happy i read it'
body: b'Very ambitious, i persevered just to see how long it would take be to catch up. But by the end i think i understood the meaning behind the book and am happy i read it.'

body: b'Miss Rowling really knows how to write about people and their feelings, what drives them.For me she can always use her own name on her books, as I would be the first to buy them. I read it in one weekend.'

title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'depressing and unpleasant read.'

author: b'vlk'
title: b'Maybe unexpected, but definitely not bad'
body: b"Often, the success of a book is based upon the fact how the book meets the readers' expectations."

author: b'JM'
title: b'Really good'
body: b"Yes, if you love HP then this book could be uncomfortable. Kind of like listening to your grandparents swear. But that doesn't make it a bad book."

author: b'Jeremy L. Smith'
title: b'Brilliant, Moving, Humorous Novel; Loved It'
body: b"Knowing the brilliant imagination required to write the Harry Potter series, I knew that Rowling would make a great writer of adult novels, and I was not disappointed-quite the opposite.  This is a brilliant book which illustrates Rowling's true empathy and understanding of human nature; it illustrates without cliche what makes us all different and what makes us all similar.  Some of the rough and disadvantaged characters in the novel are probably as complete polar opposites of Rowling as could be possible in behavior and social status, but she is able to create characters whom you are simultaneously sympathetic with and repelled by.  Rowling understands people, all kinds of them; and she is not a snob...that much is clear from the book.  I could not put this book down and I truly enjoyed getting to know these characters; they are beautifully well-drawn and the book contains a lot of humor in spots which balances out some of the tragic and negative aspects of the story.  Rowling has me now as a devoted fan and I will continue to read her novels...she is now writing a series of mysteries which began with 'The Cuckoo's Calling' and I truly hope she will write more novels akin to 'The Casual Vacancy'."

author: b'Mary Moodie'
title: b'One Star'

title: b'Whimsical & awfull!'

title: b'Casual Vacancy Not Filled'
body: b'Kept waiting for something that never really materialized. Like her earlier, better known work, the focus was on the adolescent set while the adult characters were shallow and seemingly incapable of dealing with their own flaws while oblivious to the flaws and needs of their children. It holds your interest and ultimately takes you nowhere.'

title: b'amazing read, J'

As i child i grew up reading Harry Potter, which i still love, but it is nice that now as an adult i can continue to read more mature books that are still amazing from an author who recaptured my love of reading as a child'

author: b'Joe Da Rold'
title: b'A Rowling Disappointment'
body: b'The heart-attack death of a village councilman opens up a window of opportunity for others.  After 100 pages I could not find any reason to continue.  The characters were flat and there was no plot in sight.  Rowling knows how to tell a story, but she fails to apply it here.  A major disappointment.'

author: b'Judy Galloway'
title: b'I liked the reader- he does a good job w/ the ...'
body: b'I purchased the Kindle version for my iPad but never really got started on it. I ended up listening to the audio book version. I liked the reader- he does a good job w/ the voices and I enjoyed his read.  That said, I was not having the best of weeks and listening to this while driving to and from work didn\'t improve my mood. None of the characters were lovable - it was even hard to "root" for any of them really.  In retrospect, Krystal was the most "authentic" - that is, unlike Fats or Gaia, she "was what she was".  The end seemed to come soon and leave me hanging.  Not sure how I would really feel if this book was written by "Mrs. Smith" - I was interested in it mostly because of the author (as I am sure many other readers were).'

author: b'P. Hayden'
title: b'This is an interesting book. There were major/minor plot ...'
body: b'This is an interesting book. There were major/minor plot twists. All characters remained viable throughout the story. The author is a writer and deserves to be recognized for her craft. This is not Harry Potter nor should it be.'

author: b'The Book Wheel'
title: b"A Victory for 'Vacancy'"
body: b'The Casual Vacancyis a story about theintricacies of small town politics, relationships, and rivalries following the untimely death of parish councilman, Barry Fairbrother. Barrys death is important because, without him, an important decision regarding the poor side of town is suddenly open for debate again, so both sides are trying to fill the spot with one of their own. Everyone, from the deli owner to the social worker to the junkie, is brought into drama.'

author: b'Glenda Lane'
title: b'This book is not easy to get into like the Harry Potter books'
body: b'This book is not easy to get into like the Harry Potter books. I am really disappointed with this book.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'

author: b'judyh'
title: b'FIVE STARS from me :)'
body: b"I felt I really NEEDED to write a review to help redress the mediocre rating this book currently suffers from. I almost missed out on the pleasure of reading this book due to being put off by its 3*** rating . I enjoyed this book more than even The Cormoran Strike books which I also loved. Don't be put off...it's a super read :)"

This book accurately represents the intricacies and tangled web that is woven through the lives of the members of a small town. She does a fantastic job of showing the good and the evil that exist within us all as humans. I highly recommend this read!'

author: b'Susan'
title: b"It's boring. I normally stick it out at this point ..."
body: b"I have a 100 page rule with any book I am reading. If the story doesn't grab me by page 100, I decide if I am putting the book down and moving on or if I am going to finish the book.  At page 100 I decided to finish the book although the story line was slow to develop.  Now I am at page 200, roughly the half way mark, and the story line is still trying to develop.  It's boring.  I normally stick it out at this point but I I am so bored that I'm not sure it's worth it.  Ms Rowling develops characters well and is obviously making an attempt to show she can write to adults much not much is happening in the story."

author: b'Jill in Colorado'
title: b'Well written but too much of a downer'
body: b'First of all, I had no expectations of similarities to the Harry Potter books (which I loved) when I read this.  It was well written with interesting characters, but it was such a downer - all the characters seemed to fall backwards into their flaws rather than overcome any of them; all the situations went badly instead of well, the moral of the story seemed to be people are awful and life sucks.  I am not a Pollyanna - I like some depth and some flaws in my characters and some gray areas.  But this book was just a bit too negative for me.'

author: b'Geraldine N'
title: b'A Disappointment!'
body: b'I was very disappointed in this book.  It does not come up to the same standard as her detective novels written under the name of  R. Galbraith.  The author packs in so many characters, each with a problematic, intense and detailed profile that the main story-line - if there ever was one to begin with - gets completely lost.  The Casual Vacancy is formulaic and evokes the worst episodes of "Eastenders" and "Coronation Street" combined.  Do yourself a favour and give it a miss!'

author: b'Dianne Shuker'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'I really enjoyed it'

author: b'Pat'
title: b"It just never caught me. The characters didn't endear ..."
body: b"It just never caught me.  The characters didn't endear themselves to me and the story tended to chop from here to there.  It did eventually tie the loose ends up but by then I really didn't care much.  I kept hoping for some revelation to grab me but it was just a grim, seedy story with no real redeeming ending."

author: b'Vanna Fuqua'
title: b"She didn't disappoint. She gives the readers an honest look at ..."
body: b"I've read all the Harry Potter books several times over so as an avid fan, I was curious to see how JK Rowling would handle an adult themed book. She didn't disappoint. She gives the readers an honest look at the most private thoughts of her characters. With just a few pages, you get a feel for who they are as people and the face they present to the rest of the world. Some of them I couldn't stand and others I wanted to get to know better."

author: b'Amazon Customer'

title: b'It was boring. There was no point'
body: b'It was boring. There was no point. I love Rowling. but there was no REAL plotline. there was no real action. it was a book that you trudge through hoping something happens, and it never does. there are some mildly interesting happenings, but nothing where you think to yourself "my i cannot go to sleep because this is so good." I did the audiobook, and it took me about half a year to muster the time to listen and finish. it is about a man dying, and people considering taking his place. how i friend\'s/family deal with the death. it is based on a small town, and the plot is pretty small to accomodate.'

title: b'Spent the last chapter crying in public because it was so good'
body: b'Starts out slightly boring, but becomes incredibly engaging. Surprisingly so. Please, please, fight your way through the first 80 pages or so because hoooooly bejesus it is worth it.'

author: b'spellavis'
title: b'I adore JK Rowling and her writing but is one ...'
body: b"I adore JK Rowling and her writing but is one just was not for me. Her 'Cormoran Strike' series is FAR more enjoyable. And of course dear old Harry. Maybe at a later date once I'm finished with my reading lists and all, I'll pick this one up again."

author: b'The Wiz'
title: b'Well woven tale - but takes a bit of time to get into the flow.'
body: b"I found this book very difficult to get in to.  The story set in fictional Pagford, a rural English village, is largely as life, intrigue with some tragic events that really increase the complexity of the novel.  After months of trying, I finally got in the book's rhythm, and actually quite enjoyed the second half of this book about life's twists and turns.  Having spent years of my career in England, I had no trouble with the rural language and the various hierarchy's of the English way of life.  The story is well woven and captivating, once you get in to the flow.  Worth the read."

author: b'Freya Gordon'
title: b'Great Story'
body: b'J K Rowling has proved herself as a skilled, complex author. The Casual Vacancy is worth reading - a real page-turner for adults.'

author: b'Clare Russo'
title: b'I loved this book'
body: b'I loved this book.  Ms. Rowling is a master of character development, and by the end of the book, I felt like I knew each of the them.  My only negative is that I felt the story ended rather abruptly.  I would have liked some kind of an epilogue to bring closure.'

body: b"Took a while to get into but once I made it through a few chapters I couldn't put it down. Loved the characters. Looking forward to her next book."

author: b'Victoria Leigh'
title: b'Best book I ever read'
body: b"I would'nt have believed that a book about a small town replacing a town official could possibly be this interesting, but because JK Rawlings wrote it I decided to give it a try (not like I had read any of the Harry Potter books).  I literally couldn't put it down.  Read it straight through (by and large) in 2 days, most unlike me.  It was the best book I have ever read.  Her characters are still with me, and after 2 weeks and another novel (Donna Tratt's Pulitzer Prizing-winning novel The Goldfinch (not 1/3 as good by the way), I am still wondering how and what those characters are doing.  Absolutely fascinating to read.  What a writer!"

author: b'Puddle'
title: b'Not a casual read'
body: b'This is a hard slog of a read, like reading a TV soap that does not inspire, full of horrible characters with few redeeming features you do not really want to know the minutiae about because you would not want to bother with them in real life. Sorry JK battled to the end but did not enjoy.'

author: b'Jesk'
title: b'Exciting first adult book for Rowling'
body: b"An exciting first step for Rowling into the world of adult literature. She creates a world with characters you can't help but love, hate, pity and root for. The ending is unexpected and challenging. Rowling lives up to her reputation as an enigmatic and engaging storyteller."

author: b'Heidi Schwalbe'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Well written'

author: b'Nikki'
title: b'Suprisingly enjoyable!'
body: b"I actually enjoyed this book a lot more than I thought I would. I hadn't heard that many amazing things about it, and to be honest, the boring-sounding summary and the surprisingly long length made me a bit worried."

author: b'Ka Riley'
title: b'No Casual Writing Here!'
body: b"Causal Vacancy incites all sorts of reactions, and my friends, like the public, are severely divided on the merits of J.K. Rowling's departure from the world of wizarding magic. Unlike the Potter series, Vacancy is written for adults and deals with the kind of political wrangling we so often see in the news. The characters are all flawed, as is humanity. Some are seriously ill, mentally or physically. Some are well off; others are poor, living in deplorable conditions. Rowling's cast is varied and large; it isn't always easy to keep track of them, and most aren't likable enough for readers to form sentimental attachments to them. However, they are all rounded and real. So real, in fact, that it's easy to see them in one's mind's eye, to know they are people who might be on any street in any neighborhood."

author: b'Emily'
title: b'the characters read like real people who have real problems'
body: b"An engrossing but difficult read.  Rowling can be heavy handed at times, but, overall, the characters read like real people who have real problems.  Some hide behind a thin veneer of respectability while others don't have that luxury.  Rowling deftly weaves the threads of all the personal narratives together, using the death of one man as a touchstone; by the end, all the characters collide through a series of heartbreaking events that bring out the best or worst in each.  The book is like life itself, moments of redemption and grace mingled with painful self-realization that can bring you to your knees.  Or worse, a life that is static, intractable to change; that's the real horror."

author: b'MJC'
title: b'An Awful Tale'
body: b'I must agree with others who have given this negative reviews.  There was not one character in this tale that brought any likability.  Every single person was damaged in some way.  Perhaps these characters will be sprinkled within a community...but not every single person is so stricken.  While it was touted to be a tale of the haves and have-nots, usually there are some good people in each.  She developed no one with any quailites of goodness.  Shame on her and to all the reviewers who wrote that this was a good story.  Simply not so!'

author: b'ilze Truter'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Excellent! Keep on writing J.K. Rowling! Loved it.'

author: b'Mels books'
title: b'Two Stars'
body: b'Subject matter was boring and the Characters not very likeable.'

author: b'Dana R. Stone'
title: b"Good book for J K Rowling's next after Harry Potter"
body: b"Good book for J K Rowling's next after Harry Potter.  I read it and enjoyed it and then my sister-in-law also read the book and said she enjoyed it as well."

author: b'Stephen R. Winham'
title: b'Fabulous Departure from the Potter Books'
body: b"I read all the Harry Potter books as they came out and began to tire of them toward the end, no doubt partially because they were written for people a generation or two younger than me.  This adult book, with a totally believable story line, is so different it could have been written by somebody else.  It captures the layers, nuances, complexities and inconsistencies of the human psyche more honestly than any book I've ever read.  It is a great literary work and a true page-turner as well.  I am anxious to move on to her other books to see what further depths Rowling can plumb."

author: b'Loves Cats'
title: b"but I'm glad I did"
body: b"It was hard to stick with this book, but I'm glad I did.  The first 3rd was a jumble of depressed and depressing characters whom I had difficulty keeping straight; and the main character was dead.  That said, once it got into the stories of the young adults, I was hooked.  I found their characters moving, real and poignant.  This book is no comedy.  It is a poignant look into the unpredictable ways we are shaped by our choices, random events and the lives of those around us."

author: b'Real Mom'
title: b'One Star'

The only kind of prediction that could be made was "Where is this going?"  Was going to read her recent book, but this cured me.  There was not a single instance of decency in life.'

Will be buying her next one, too.  Reading the "Cuckoo\'s Calling" now, and that one is also very good.  It\'s a private detective story setting - hard to put down.'

When I found "The Casual Vacancy" in a bookstore remainder bin I picked it up in the hope this would be different, having no allegiance to the last seven books that brought J.K. Rowling fame and fortune.'

author: b'Tyler Francke'
title: b'This book was not for me'
body: b'"The Casual Vacancy" was not for me. I finished it, and gave it three stars, out of respect for J.K. Rowling, an enormously gifted author, who has clearly proven that "Harry Potter" does not contain the sum of her talents. "Vacancy" is an extremely well-crafted book, and contains many beautifully written and even moving passages. Its commentary on society, through the tragic character of Krystal Weedon, is poignant and well-rendered. At the same time, the book ends at its most hopeless point, with several of its characters\' story arcs  not to mention, the central conflict of the entire novel  basically unresolved.'

author: b'Susan Hart'
title: b'took a while to get into...'
body: b"At 72% I finally got my attention into this story. There seemed to be too many characters and too many story lines going that weren't connecting for me. The story in the end finished strong which is why I gave it a 3 tar rating. I'm moving on to reading her next book, hopeful that it will better come together."

author: b'jocelyn'
title: b'Slow. Dark. Good'
body: b"this book is told from several different points of view and is extremely confusing in the beginning. the book didn't get extremely interesting until part 4. everything else felt like a lead up until those things. the ending was very very dark. very real. but very dark."

author: b'Texanwmn'
title: b'Not great'
body: b"I'm not sure what I expected, but this definitely wasn't it. A few parts of the story made me laugh, but some of the names and families were difficult to follow at times. Nicknames, pet names, etc, all used throughout also made it difficult to identify each character."

author: b'Emile'
title: b'Wonderful narrative and cast of characters'
body: b'Wonderful narrative and cast of characters. Yes, there are many different people to follow throughout the story, but so interesting and satisfying.'

author: b'Joe'
title: b'I loved this book'
body: b'I loved this book. I think a lot of the negative reviews come from people that were expecting it to be more like Harry Potter. This is a character driven story and its target audience is adults. It is not fast paced and it is not for everyone. Overall I thought it was very well done. JK does a great job of making her characters interesting and you genuinely care about what will ultimately happen to them.'

author: b'margaret moseley'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b'did not hold my attention for long... did not finish it'

author: b'Whitney B'
title: b'I bought this a long time ago and have yet ...'
body: b"I bought this a long time ago and have yet to finish it. It doesn't quite live up to my expectations after loving the Harry Potter series so much."

author: b'nancy a pendleton'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'very dense but i enjoyed it. so many characters and a look at seamy-side of life'

author: b'alee'
title: b'So disappointed with J.K.'
