body: b"We picked this book for book club and we were all disappointed in J.K. Rowling.  This book is hard to follow, and it just goes on and on....It was also a super depressing storyline, and I think that contributed to my book club not liking the book.  We were all disappointed in J.K. Rowling with this book - we had high hopes for it because she is typically an amazing writer.  Don't bother reading this."

author: b'Hank Rearden'
title: b"This wasn't a horrible book. It wasn't even a bad book"
body: b"You know I just don't understand all of the negative reviews here. This wasn't a horrible book. It wasn't even a bad book. Those hoping that this would be rooted in some fantasy land, instead of a modern countryside setting will be in for a let down. But once you get past the initial shock, you might actually come to like this little tale of social justice, or injustice, and who is it that really gets caught in the middle of power struggles.  Be forewarned, there are casualties.  No happy endings here, just victims."

author: b'Linda McEnaney'
title: b'Great characters. I usually skip pages of a book ...'
body: b'I never read any of the "Harry Potter" books but I can see their appeal if this book is any indication of her style. Great characters. I usually skip pages of a book if parts are boring--no skipped pages here. I can\'t remember the name of that book she wrote under a pseudonym but that was how I discovered her. Also, excellent.'

author: b'QT 3.14'
title: b'A compelling, complex book'
body: b'I generally do not like stories where everything is tied into a neat little bow at the end - all the issues are resolved, the good guys "win" and the bad guys get their due - so this was just the kind of book I liked. The characters were complex - they all had good and bad qualities, even though they were sometimes subtle and the reader has to try and remember that the author is creating a realistic story. I initially found the ending to be jarring, but it was one I kept pondering and after some thought, I did "like" it.'

author: b'Lra'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Great book. Great character development. Very engrossing. Leaves you thinking .'

author: b'Robyn Hotchin'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'Excellent story.'

author: b'Luvs2Read'
title: b'Casual Vacancy, Totally Vacated!'
body: b'Normally I hate to do a review on any book that I didn\'t read a substantial part, at least.  This one, however, totally failed to get me even a third of the way through.  The depression portrayed in this writing, all the four-letter words with no real addition to the storyline, and in general, the lack of storyline that I could see, made it so I just deleted this book.  Anyone who really is interested in this book, please download a "sample" to get your own impressions before laying out good money for a bad book.'

author: b'Grandmadoc'
title: b'what was this'
body: b"This book made no sense to me, ending abruptly. I am sorry I bought it and I probably won't bother to read the next one she wrote. Maybe you need to be British to understand it."

author: b'Clara Beard'
title: b'Good, but not excellent'
body: b'It is an interesting, engrossing read, but suffers, somewhat, from a lack of judicious editing. Rowling can definitely weave a tale.'

author: b'meadhbh cahill'
title: b'Loved this book'
body: b"Loved this book! I don't think of JK as the Harry Potter author anymore, and have just bought the new book in the Striker series so can't wait. JK's capacity for telling an intelligent, well thought out, complex, and complete story is truly fantastic, especially as her writing style makes it seem like the book wrote itself! Not an easy thing to do, she is a gifted writer and long may she keep the stories coming!"

author: b'RK'
title: b'I thought CV was really good but not great'
body: b"I thought CV was really good but not great.  If I had not known it was Rowling I would not have guessed it.  Clearly she can write and this book shows that she has some pretty great range beyond the Potterverse. I liked the butterfly effect concept that runs through it, the notion that one event triggers off a sequence that flows through the rest of the story. I thought the characters were pretty engaging for the most part although I thought a few didn't bring much to the table and some were a little one-dimensional (why did we need Maureen?  she isn't very relevant and only kind of becomes marginally significant at the end).  The whole Gavin character was a little baffling too other than she felt like we needed a character who pretty much always gets things wrong.  The one thing I did not expect from the book was that it, for me, was a gut punch throughout.  Some reviews thought this was black comedy or tragicomedy but I didn't feel like the humorous scenes balanced the drama and tragedy that runs from the first chapter on.  I did like the small town where everyone is out to ruin everyone angle.  That was an intriguing point and how all politics is local.  Some reviewer called this book 500 pages of socialist propaganda.  That just made me giggle.  I think you know what you're going to get with Rowling now that she has enough money to own the planet so didn't really get why they were so upset (assume this was all about the clinic and how the town was trying to turn its back on the Fields)."

author: b'Charlotte B Calacci'
title: b'Three Stars'
body: b"Didn't move along and keep my interest."

author: b'leh'
title: b'I expected so much more'
body: b'Not impressed at all.'

author: b'Kathleen DesHotel'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'JK should have stayed the Harry Potter path.'

author: b'Rose Gjvik'
title: b'Their story is not easily forgotten.'
body: b"Rowling masters the art of making human nature brutally transparent. She turns us upside-down and shakes us until our heart, soul and pockets are empty of hidden truths, shames and weaknesses. The Casual Vacancy doesn't have characters, only flesh and blood people. Krystal, Robbie, Nana Cath, Kevin and Miles all come out of their pages to meet you halfway as if they were living in the backyard of your head. Not to mention what they in unison do to your heart. Their story is not easily forgotten."

author: b'David Allard'
title: b'Dark Read'
body: b'So much different from her other works but this novel still shows that J.K. Rowling has got it. Good plot and interesting characters who are relatable. While I enjoyed it, some may find this novel as a depressing read with an ending that leaves little hope for most characters. Overall, I enjoyed this novel, and I believe that those who can appreciate literature and books with "darker endings" will find reading this worthwhile.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Not that great'
body: b'I thought it quite difficult to follow the story in the beginning and could see the ending coming way before it actually happened.'

author: b'joble'
title: b'disappointing'
body: b'Grammatically a very well written book. The author has managed to convey the sense of a British accent and a vocabulary to suit the locale of her plot.'

author: b'Nancy Whitlock'
title: b'Four Stars'
body: b'Great shape, but I hated the book.'

author: b'Connie Thorpe'
title: b'Different, but the same. I liked it not being in the USA.'
body: b'jK Rowling.'

author: b'Alissa A. Wells'
title: b'Snooze'
body: b"This book is so boring I couldn't finish it. I'm nearly halfway through and I'm not entirely sure what it's about. Politics and education?"

author: b'Virginia Cann'
title: b'One Star'
body: b'Not worthy'

author: b'Katharine (ventureadlaxre)'
title: b'bit hard to read for how real and depressing it is, but fantastic overall'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy by J. K. Rowling is a contemporary piece of literature, seasoned with a dash of  well, people seem to be saying mystery, but I hesitantly dont agree. I simply see it as a harsh view on society that isnt exactly nice to read, but would have to agree that more spotlight probably needs to be shown on such areas. I have the feeling that the style of life shown within this book is more prevalent than many of us would like to think on.'

author: b'connie'
title: b'Real characters for once'
body: b'J.K. Rowling is a genius at character and plot development. No matter what she writes becomes a page turner. And since when did it become necessary to write characters that people can commiserate with completely? Life is filled with such a variety of peoples, personalities and issues that it is refreshing to have it expressed in print.'

author: b'Julie'
title: b'Realistic Fiction'
body: b"This book was okay.  It's a testament to her writing that I kept with it because I detested most of the characters (which I think was what she was going for), and the novel didn't seem like it was really going anywhere.  But I also think that was by design, as it was intended to be a snapshot of a time and of a place.  By that criteria, it's excellent.  The characters were believable, honest, and thoughtfully portrayed - especially the kids.  They behaved exactly as one would expect them to, and as such, the book was appropriately heartbreaking."

author: b'Christopher R. Wilson'
title: b"Powerful tale of fearing what you don't understand"
body: b"This book started slowly, a bit like life in sleepy Pagford. But it steadily gathers steam as the characters start to interact in expected, and unexpected, ways. The end is a blur of resolutions to individual and collective storylines. I can't say if this book reflects life in rural England or not, but it makes a whale of a story!"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'great characters good story line'
body: b'Enjoyed following story but sometimes hard to keep characters straight.  Sympathetic characters for the most part but seems to end a little abruptly.'

author: b'N Don Brown'
title: b'Proof she can be boring'
body: b"The dialect is great IF you want to hear/read lower income British. I am still not sure why she wrote the book. Certainly doesn't need the money. and if she does it for the love of writing she should stop now"

author: b'Ann'
title: b'Second reading was better'
body: b"I started reading the book but would put it aside for a week or more between sessions.  I found it confusing as there were a lot of characters.  I finally left it alone for several months and then read it more or less continuously.  Once I did this it was easier and not at all confusing.  It's worth 4 stars."

author: b'JKG'
title: b'I tried...'
body: b"I read 25% of this.  I just couldn't get into it.  This might be the only book that I have ever read and not finished.  Her next one (the detective one) was a lot better in my opinion."

author: b'Shelly L. Snow'
title: b'Not your casual book!'
body: b"A Casual Vacancy, not your casual book, is a fictional story set in the small English town of Pagford. Like any small town it seems peaceful to the casual onlooker but once an outsider takes up residence they realize things aren't quite what they seem. Its her first book after the highly successful Harry Potter series and in no way should be compared to her earlier works."

author: b'Enrique'
title: b'better than expected'
body: b'really slow start, about 60% starts to get interesting, great ending. great reference to the way kids nowadays use cellphones and text messaging for communications.'

author: b'Michael Gray'
title: b'Bubbles of Isolation in a splintered world'
body: b'In "The Casual Vacancy" J.K. Rowling has brought her unrivalled mastery of the adolescent psyche into the fictional, dysfunctional world of a small English community where individuals and families alike live in bubbles of hostile isolation.  Not only has the magic of Hogwarts gone, but most of that world\'s capacity for empathy and mutual caring.  Rowling uses Third Person Omniscient (the inner thoughts of characters can surface at any moment in any scene) in order to present the dynamic life of a community in which hidden resentments and insincerity abound.  Rowling personally devotes much of her wealth and heart (through her non-profit, "Lumos")to the plight of neglected children, and in "The Casual Vacancy" she combines her narrative talent with a deep concern for children in a heartless and splintered world, especially those who have no voice.  In giving the voiceless voice, she has also written a gripping tale with believable and entertaining characters.'

author: b'Grannybunny'
title: b'Simply Awesome!'
body: b'If anyone was concerned that Rowling would not be able to transition into a successful writing career post Harry Potter, no problem.'

author: b'A. Allen'
title: b"I'm not sure what I can add, but here's my review for this Devastating Masterpiece"
body: b"Ahh, I think I've been avoiding this review."

author: b'EUGENE J MOLINELLI'
title: b'Fascinating look into small town personalities'
body: b'Believable and flawed characters each contribute in a small way to a tragic end. Would have preferred one or two more likable characters in the mix other than the one who created the vacancy..'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Book noir'
body: b'There is no doubt in my mind that Rowling can write. Despite the unrelenting misery of everyone in the novel, I made it to the end.'

author: b'Darragh V. Metzger'
title: b"Don't bother"
body: b"JK Rowling can write, no one doubts that.  But in all these pages, there is not one single character who is not a waste of air and food.  Makes me resent having to spend the time with any of them.  Real life is filled with people like this; they're in the papers every day, on TV, all around.  Sadly.  So why should I read about them?"

author: b'Donna C. Short'
title: b'Good Read'
body: b"I had not read any of J K Rowling's other books but must say that I thoroughly enjoyed"

author: b'Angela Michelle Jay'
title: b'An amazing, true to life tale.'
body: b"This book was as I expected, a masterpiece. Rowling has again proved to be a master of her craft. The story is wound tight from start to finish, woven with believable, (sometimes agitating) wonderful characters in their own right. You don't have  to be a previous reader of Rowling to enjoy this book; however, you might want several pots of tea on hand."

author: b'Brian Nallick'
title: b'A jumbled mess.'
body: b'Like many others Im a huge Potter fan so I was anxious to see how JK would fare with a non Potter book.'

author: b'Burt'
title: b'Worthless'
body: b'Probably the most worthless use of time in my lifetime. Absolutely no redeeming value.  Much better to take a nap.'

author: b'stephen keyte'
title: b"Steve's"
body: b'It takes a long time to get going. But it a very accurate account of lives in some UK housing estates. Very good characters'

author: b'Jen D.'
title: b"I'm so sad"
body: b"I'm so sad about this book.  I tried so hard, but couldn't get past page 30.  It was just so dull and spent so much time introducing characters with very little happening."

author: b'Juli Gasque'
title: b'unexpected disappointment'
body: b'I found this a very difficult read.  Not at all what I expected.  I could find no redeeming characters  and had to make myself finish the book.'

author: b'LeeAnn Bigley'
title: b'The title is right!'
body: b"Casually written by a vacant mind. If I hadn't read the Harry Potter series, there'd be no way I would ever pick up another J.K. Rowling book. Is this really the same author who wrote that series? If I were to picture the author of this book, I'd guess a middle-aged woman in a chronic state of funk, deserted by her husband and children and embittered against the world, living in a small community where she is able to pick up on all the scum floating around in her town. Surviving the book's pages is a superhuman effort only viable to convince one that this author MUST (please God) have a point in here somewhere! But no ... It is as actually as bad as it seems to be, all the way through. This is the type of book rendered offensive by the author's unloading such trash on her unsuspecting public, given that this author has encouraged readers in previous novels. Shame!"

author: b'RenaudME'
title: b'Expect something new'
body: b'I had completely gone into this book first expecting the magic of Harry Potter and also a murder mystery.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A "grim" place'
body: b'I didn\'t expect Hogwarts, but this novel was just too bleak.  Try "The Cukoo\'s Calling".  A good mystery with a sympathetic protagonist.'

author: b'Joan Carlton'
title: b'Cheap Shot'
body: b'It was hard to care about any of the characters.  Their lives were all too fictions to develop any real interest in the overlaping events that were supposed to be connected.  Dissapointing!'

author: b'Vera Regelbrugge'
title: b'Jk Rowling'
body: b'Had it difficult to start reading this but once I was in the story loved the book. Another great work.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Amazing'
body: b"Depressing but utterly thought provoking and touching. Well written, witty and intriguing. The first half is a bit hard to plough through, I'll admit, but well worth it in the end. Well worth the read."

author: b'Gibbs'
title: b"Not a bad experience, worth reading, but I can't say I liked it."
body: b'There is a lot of anger and pain in this book.  The people lead lonely, angry, and often desperate lives.  There is something to be said for the strength that keeps people moving forward, the "extraordinariness" of real kindness, the difficulty in doing good, or understanding one\'s own motives.  There is something about the danger of lives not examined and the illusions and delusions that keep us alive.  There is something about how inter-connected lives are, and how little we can appreciate that or are aware of it.  There is a lot to think about here.  But I did not find any satisfaction in it nor would I suggest it to anyone looking for something to read.'

author: b'Jiri'
title: b'Fascinating story, great language'
body: b'I really enjoyed the book.'

author: b'Kasper W'
title: b'Well written and thrilling plot'
body: b'That Ms Rowling has managed to put the HP universe well away in this book stands to her credit. It is an interesting plot that grows more and more interesting with each page, depicting what goes on behind the drawn curtains and closed doors of small town England. The only let down is the end which is perhaps a little unsurprising. Still it is very well written and a really great read. Well worth buying.'

author: b'ipad reader'
title: b'Nothing like Harry Potter!'
body: b"This book is totally depressing yet I was compelled to finish it anyway. Each character has their own evil selfish thoughts exposed as their lives intermingle in a twisted tale revolving around the death of one man. Graphic descriptions, language and deviant sex descriptions don't usually bother me but there was absolutely NO redeeming goals or happiness to be found in any of the towns peoples' lives. This is the first book I have ever written a review on and I've read a lot over 60 years! I am just amazed at how the same person who wrote the magical Harry Potter books could have also written this. Sure there was some child abuse and evil going on in HP but there was also good triumphing over evil. In The Casual Vacancy, there's just the evil. I will delete this book from my ipad and do NOT recommend reading it."

author: b'Penny'
title: b'Interesting character study'
body: b'I found it fascinating that there were no outwardly focused characters except the dead one. I did enjoy the characters themselves and had full pictures of them in my head as I read the story.'

author: b'Mary Mertz'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b'I found this book hard to read.  I kept getting the characters mixed up and finally made a list to keep track.  Depressing stuff mostly.'

author: b'Mysontherobot'
title: b'Well written, but not very exciting.....'
body: b'This was just not my kind of book.  The book was well written, and you felt as if you really know the characters,  I just prefer mysteries.  It was more a book of day to day activities.'

author: b'Art Flores'
title: b'Not recommended reading - what a drool of a story'
body: b"Is this Rowling's first attempt at writing fiction?  A very sad plot indeed.  There's really not much of a story unless you want to read about people's dull lives. Not developed well including plot, characters and development of story."

author: b'Bruce'
title: b'All Politics is Local'
body: b'J.K. Rowling is the most financially successful writer of this generation, having penned the Harry Potter series which morphed into various forms of lucrative licensed entertainment.  The Casual Vacancy is a stylistic departure for Rowling.'

author: b'n. cunningham'
title: b'Boring'
body: b"It's a very boring book and was not interesting at all. I'm actually really sad I spent money on it."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Well written characters and story'
body: b"If I was to tell you what this book is about your probably think it's boring. But the way the characters are created, I couldn't stop reading. Some if them are not mineable at all, in some of them you can find pieces of yourself. Very well written and thought provoking."

author: b'Corinne Hall'
title: b'True life characters'
body: b'Great human drama, wonderful characters, hard to put down.  Easy for the reader to associate with the characters.  Am hoping Ms. Rowling puts another page-turner out soon!'

author: b'Unknown'
title: b'disappointing'
body: b'I expected something great from this author,though the concept of focusing on one subject was interesting it became tiring. I would have preferred it in a shorter version.'

author: b'VA'
title: b'psychological foray'
body: b'Interesting fictional account into the minds of various community members responding the death of a town member. Perhaps a bit too long'

author: b'Vincent J. Joyce'
title: b'A good start'
body: b'I think JK Rowling is off to a good start as her post Potter career begins to blossom. Look forward to reading her tomes far into the future.'

author: b'Liz McLeod'
title: b'Slow to start'
body: b"J.K. Rowling has given us another group of interesting characters who's lives become intertwined by a lust for power and jealousy. These characters have real human flaws and desires. Much more grown up than Ron and Harry and get up to way more mischief. After a slow start getting to know each character it literally could not put this book down. I look forward to more of her writings."

author: b'Bobbe'
title: b'An adult version of Harry Potter'
body: b'This book was not fast easy reading, but intriguing enough to keep me reading.  It left me wanting to read  more about the lives involved, just as Harry Potter did.'

author: b'SHELLY BURKO'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"This is Rowling's first major foray into adult literature.  I am a grandmother, but I loved the Harry Potter series.  They were well written and contained everything good fiction should have.  I thought this was just okay.  I saw a similar writting style as in the Potter series, but the book was just not as good.  There were too many characters, some with nicknames,which confused things  even more.  I thought she tried to include too manythings in the bookso it was too long as well.  We did have a great discussion at our monthly book club meeting.  We all agreed about the rating of the book, but the discussion was great. It was the best part of the book.  I read a sample of Cuckoo's Calling and really liked it.  Several of the women read it and said it was better than The Casual Vacancy.  ilook forward to reading it."

author: b'D. Benson'
title: b'Not Harry Potter...'
body: b'I had a really hard time engaging with this book initially...actually for about half the book.  After I reached the point where i was engaged, my overall perception changed for the positive.  Not for everyone, but a very well written book, complex with a dark social theme.'

author: b'David D.'
title: b'Definitely NOT Harry Potter!'
body: b"I was prepared for something different, but I was not prepared for the unrelenting darkness and malevolence that permeates Rowling's newest world. Usually one can discern the protagonists and antagonists, but it was really hard to find anyone to cheer for, let alone care about. Even those seemingly worthy of some sort of sympathy are so flawed otherwise that they too dissolve into the waves of selfishness, deceit, paranoia, and pain that flood these pages. Now ... if the reader can handle page after page, chapter after chapter of such despair, rest assured the ride will be a worthy one, as the writing is brilliant and the many intertwined stories so compelling that it is hard to stop turning the pages even when the hint of absolute revulsion lies immediately beyond.This book is disturbing, depressing, vulgar (excessively, I thought, hence a loss of a star), and ultimately offers a less than fulfilling denouement (hence the loss of a second star), but it proves that J.K. Rowling can conjure quite a tale without the aid of witchcraft."

author: b'AMil'
title: b'slow start, a great finish'
body: b"I really wanted to love this book. While there were definitely parts of it that shined, a really tedious set-up and the lack of a central character (or even characters) to root for left it at 3 stars for me. If you can get through the tedious introduction and are good at plowing through that kind of stuff, I'd recommend this book. The writing and character development are excellent, and kind of make up for all the other boring stuff. If you're not good at reading books that don't grab you within the first few chapters, then maybe pass on this one."

author: b'dianora'
title: b'Bah'
body: b"I read only the first few pages. Didn't work its magic on me. I was expecting more from the next J.K. Rowling book."

author: b'carolyn turkington'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I thought this was a great look into small town politics. What seemed like a simple story really turned out to be an indepth look into human kind. It shows how people come to be the way they are as well as showing that there are two sides to every story. Highly recommend it whether you're a Potter fan or not. You might be disappointed if you're expecting a story about the wizarding world but you will be very pleased if you are looking for Rowling's inherently kind and wise voice."

author: b'Shirley Eyden'
title: b'Not anything like the Harry Potter books!'
body: b"I found this book disturbing and didn't fall in love with the characters which I did with the Harry Potter books.  This book was one dysfunctional character after another.  Would not recommend this book at all."

author: b'Lorraine'
title: b'I wanted to love it....but.....'
body: b"Rowling presents us with moments of brilliance, heartbreaking loss, and grime in the disparity-filled lives of the residents of Pagford Parish, however, they are sandwiched in between vast, unrewarding stretches of tedium and mundane character development.  Taken on whole, it's just enough to keep you reading to the end, but not enough to make you really care about any of the characters until the last few dozen pages."

author: b'R. McGee'
title: b'Casual Vacancy begs for a sequel'
body: b"Casual Vacancy reminds me a lot of James Joyce's Dubliners;interconnected allies and enemies,  sometimes within the family and in  the small town in which they languish in.  The most compelling character is Crystal Wheaton, an abused teen teetering on the edge of the civility in Pagford and the doom of drugs and poverty and a hollowed out mum.  The lyrics from Rihanna were a delight and a surprise and the ending begs for a sequel. Overall,  the sum of the parts are greater than the sketchy whole. It was good to find Rawlings in the real, messed up world, a universe away from Harry Potter."

author: b'NTM'
title: b'A well written, deeply moving novel!'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy takes an entertaining approach to a realistic problem. Poverty, drug abuse, and adolescent struggles are all explored through multidimensional characters living in a secretly corrupt British town. The reader is enveloped by a setting vividly described by J.K. Rowling and is taken along for a ride that includes dramatic parish council fights, eye opening exposure to poverty and addiction, and a devistating ending to a tragically comical book.'

author: b'M Domaschenz'
title: b"Well written but 'Oh so depressing'"
body: b"I read this story out of interest as I had read all the HP books as my children grew up.  I wasn't expecting wizards and magic but what I got was a depressing look at British small town life, leaving out all the good bits.  I kept reading hoping that there might be a glimmer of light.  I won't be a 'spoiler' so I'll leave it up to the individual reader to see if they can find one."

author: b'Bill Simpson'
title: b'Piece of Trash!'
body: b'I had looked forward to reading a "non-Harry Potter" book by Ms Rowling because I had enjoyed that series very much, but was almost immediately disappointed in The Casual Vacancy from the first chapter. I was surprised by the vulgarity used and the pitiful cast of characters she\'d created. While I was initially interested in the what was began to unfold in the book, I just could not overcome the foul language contained within the book and so this was one of the very few books I totally stopped reading and have no plans of ever reading it.'

author: b'Stephanie E. Snider'
title: b'like home'
body: b'i love her style of writing! it feels like home. obviously, the subject is a far cry from Harry Potter, but her handling of characters is familiar. there is justice and there is injustice, much like in the Potter series. Rowling has a gift in presenting seemingly unsavory characters in a way that allows you to at least understand why they are the way they are. everyone has a story, and rowling is a master at telling. the actual story was not what was fascinating to me. it was the characters and their interwoven lives. well done!'

author: b'Christine Smith'
title: b'I liked it!'
body: b"As others have said, it rambled around a bit and some of the characters seemed a bit contrived and sometimes vicious, but she is of course a great writer and it was enjoyable.  I stuck with it and was glad I did.  Interestingly, for someone who wrote the definitive young people's book, she gave the children, even the grown-up daughter, the power to affect their parents' lives.  Particularly in this case, when no one else seemed to call parents out on their poor behavior.  I will read her other books."

author: b'Patricia Breitzer'
title: b'quite different from Harry Potter'
body: b'Realistic, well-written, somewhat depressing. It also contains some comedy, mainly in the online postings of several anonymous townspeople, one calling himself "The ghost of Barry Fairbrother." Fairbrother has died at the beginning of the book, leaving a vacancy on the city council.'

author: b'Robin O,'
title: b'a bit difficult to get into but worth it!'
body: b'The characters were well written but with so many of them, you got a bit confused. Otherwise, it was an excellent story with a good message.'

author: b'K. Spangler'
title: b'Bad language.'
body: b'Unfortunately, the book has too many swear words. I\'m just not a fan of reading literature with that many uses of the "f" word.  I\'m aware that the British use this word more than we do, but I don\'t appreciate it.'

author: b'Kenn Day'
title: b'Well written but degrading'
body: b"For Potter fans, imagine an entire novel written about the world of Harry's muggle relations, unrelieved by hogwarts or magic of any kind. This is the world as presented by Rowling in The Casual Vacancy."

author: b'D. Wright'
title: b'Great book!'
body: b"I have been reading books by J.K. Rowling for years now and I cannot get enough of them, I just can't put them down once I start reading them, this one was even harder. Would recommend 100%"

author: b'V.P.Q.'
title: b'Highly recommended'
body: b'A very good read and the storylines wove very well. The characters were very believable and well made. Quite emotional.'

author: b'MHD'
title: b'better than the reviews'
body: b"I read some of the reviews of this book on Amazon and almost didn't buy it.  I'm glad I followed my heart instead.  The book has richly developed characters and a cohesive story line.  I'll think about this book for some time to digest all of what I've read and may go back and read it again.  There are a lot of characters all introduced in a short number of pages, so I think I'll enjoy it more the second time around.  I would recommend the book to anyone who enjoys thinking about what makes people tick."

author: b'Mr Toad'
title: b'I had difficulty staying interested'
body: b"Remarkably tedious. I got to page 100 and there were still no characters I cared about or plot to interest me. I never put books aside and I finally put it aside. I started flipping ahead and it doesn't appear anything ever really happens- there is a large cast of characters and many of them seem kind of similar- had trouble distinguishing one middle age couple from another and what they wanted. There are some nice descriptive bits here and there, and racy bits to show it is for adults but the sexy stuff just feels awkward and self conscious. Mostly tedious. I read a lot of genres- from Jane Austen to Dickens to young adult to sci fi and fantasy to Mary Stewart- but this was just unreadable."

author: b'Alicia D. Finnerty'
title: b'Well done, J.K.'
body: b"Heartbreaking but addictive read. Will stay with me for a long time. Once you begin you won't want to stop reading."

author: b'Jill Clardy'
title: b'Complex Characters in a Village Setting'
body: b'My review is for the Audiobook, skillfully read by Tom Hollander. The audio book runs nearly 18 hours, so it occupied me for several weeks during my daily commute.'

author: b'Catrina Van Horn'
title: b'Horrible'
body: b"I bought this book assuming it was going to be fantastic. Look at the author, It is the same one as the amazing Harry Potter books, but his couldn't hold a candle to those books. Much more of an adult book and it was not well written. Clearly, it just got past because of who the author is. She should stick to kids stories in my opinion."

author: b'NJtwinmom'
title: b'insightful, thought-provoking'
body: b'This is a far cry from Harry Potter, and I was a HUGE HP fan, but it is still very much worth reading. This story examines/illustrates a common, widespread social dilemma from multiple angles/points of view with keen insight. The character descriptions an interpersonal dynamics between characters were so good, so insightful, you wonder how Ms. Rowling does it. She puts herself in the position of the miserable housewife, the rebellious teenage boy, the junky mom, etc. and creates such rich and realistic internal dialogue for each character. She is truly brilliant.'

author: b'David Antunes'
title: b'Simply amazing!'
body: b'Being a Harry Potter fan, when this new JK Rowlinkg book was available for sale I immediately bought it.'

author: b'Gail Harden'
title: b'A farce or not?'
body: b"A bit over the top for me.  Every single character (and there were many, hard to keep up with them) was dysfunctional.  In the end, I figured it was a farce, but I didn't love it."

author: b'Eleonora Domenichini'
title: b'A casual vacancy tantalizing the desire of residents in a British small town.'
body: b'I do not understand the negative reviews of this book. The characters, dialogues, and events are so masterfully intertwined, that it would not room to boredom even if the story was boring. And it is not.'

author: b'D. at LLRC'
title: b'A adult book by J. K. Rowling'
body: b'The book is about the politics of a small town in England.  I never finished the second disk, not because the story wasn\'t that good, because of the language used.  I know that the "F" word may not be as profane a word in England, but to hear it constantly used was something that I felt I did not need to listen to.'

author: b'Diane Tabern'
title: b'Read for book club choice'
body: b'Having read all of Harry Potter books I was curious as to what Casual Vacancy would be like.  The book has some strong characters, most have very few redeeming qualities. The story of semi rural Englands local Parish councillors was full of secrets, lies and indescressions. Without giving away too much, it is unsurprising, given Rowlings previous subject matter, that it is the children who end up causing the whole village to unravel and turn on itself. Overall, an excellent read and recommened not just for HP fans.'

author: b'L. Warren'
title: b'I did not enjoy'
body: b'This very dark story has well developed characters, but maybe too many for a clear focus.  It seems more like an exercise.  Of the 18 or so examined characters.  Only 3 youth and 3 adults seem to have a shred of hope or growth of experience by the end.  I dont need it to be black & white / good & evil, but in an entire village there was only one nice, hopeful, caring person (who often neglected his family for his causes) and he drops dead in the first chapter.  Everyone else is selfish, evil, abused, timid, intimidated, miserable, defeated, arrogant, judgmental, abusive or powerless. Some have described this as more realistic but I felt it to be unbalanced.  Like the negatives have been hand-picked and anything positive lasting for longer than a moment is ignored for the sake of exposing the dark parts.'

author: b'Margaret Barnett'
title: b'I did like it, but only Casually good'
body: b"There were a lot of characters to keep track of and a lot of words that I had to look up.  Some of the English phrases were hard to understand.  Very good story line with lots of twists and turns.  I liked Cuckoo's Calling much better though."

author: b'Kristin  Gronemeyer'
title: b'slow reading'
body: b"I was expecting more, I don't know, action? Or at least a story that moved along a little faster.  Lots of characters to keep track of."

author: b'Steve Riley'
title: b'Great story!'
body: b'I very much enjoyed this book although I started reading it with some trepidation but I was pleasantly surprised.  I enjoyed knowing what each character was thinking as it was written in third-person omniscient point of view. It did take some effort in keeping everything in account but it was worth it.  I was especially impressed with the authors understanding of the issues in teenagers lives.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'I liked it, but not as much as the Harry Potter series'
body: b'It took me awhile to get into this book, I have to admit.  i found that there were so many characters that it was hard for me to remember who was who and also track who was married to who.  But I do have problems remembering names of people I know as well.  I also do not have large chunks of time in my life to read and there are large gaps in the time I spend with a book, so remembering all the characters might be easier if you sat for an hour or so to read instead of 10 minutes here and there.'

author: b'Giles S.'
title: b'the most boring book I have ever read:'
body: b'Was this the book that Janet Rowling wrote under a pseudonym that received great reviews?'

author: b'Carol'
title: b'The Moral Vacancy'
body: b'I may have expected too much from J.K. Rowling.  She has such an awesome imagination.  However, in The Casual Vacancy, she took a small village in England and made everyone in it a pervert of some sort.  Not a good person could be found!  Very disappointing to me.'

author: b'Constance'
title: b'Excellent story of real life not magical life'
body: b'I did not expect to like this story but was drawn into the life and characters of this village.  They were all imperfect and tragic to some extent but the ending illustrated the strength and simplicity of the human spirit.'

author: b'Dramatic Conclusions, Pam Boyd'
title: b'A Book That Meddles'
body: b'After reading this book, I cannot look at any photo of Rowling without seeing a face familiar with all manner of suffering, loneliness, and isolation. Although the casual vacancy is a political descriptor, the term seems to also describe the painful vacancy that exists casually in our relationships.'

author: b'SMBP'
title: b'Disappointing.'
body: b'Of course, following a fabulously successful Potter series is difficult, but this lacks imagination and class. Would have been better to quit while you were ahead.'

author: b'Kits'
title: b'A decent read (plot spoilers in review)'
body: b"I was rather excited to read Casual Vacancy by Rowling. I haven't read Cuckoo's Calling so I thought it would be interesting to see what she came up with after the Harry Potter series. The book didn't overwhelm me neither did it excite me that much. There was too much time spent on details of the characters. Fleshing out characters is one thing but over working them is quite another. I also reckon that the two deaths (plot spoiler) are unnecessary just to create a catalyst of sorts. A one time read only if you are a true Rowling fan."

author: b'Stephen'
title: b"Meet the Dursley's neighbors"
body: b'What I imagined the brown of little whinging could have been like if there was no Hogwarts and we delved deeper into the life of mugggles.'

author: b'CLAIRE H.'
title: b'not very interesting...the casual vacancy'
body: b'I did not like the kindle version of the book...seemed like the subjects kept changing just about every other paragraph..not at all like the harry potter books which I thoroughly enjoyed...it took me a long time before I finished the book...I found it really boring..'

author: b'Phil'
title: b'Underwelmed'
body: b'I got the senario but it was pointless. The only possible reason to write this book was to verify the state of the UK society.'

author: b'Rosie'
title: b'Mr. Perfect has died'
body: b'The story revolves around how all the inhabitants of a Parish are connected to "Mr. Right" and how they are failing to "measure up".  For in this town "it\'s The secrets that will kill you".  While i could anticipate the denouement, it was not as predictable is i thought it would be if people jumped on their white steeds and galloped of into the sunset.'

author: b'debsdeal'
title: b'Different J. K. Rowling'
body: b'Pretty good read for a first time book of a different genre.  I did not, however, like the ending.  I guess I am a sucker for a happy ending.'

author: b'theweed'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"After the Harry Potter series, I looked forward to a good book.  I should have guessed that an author who changes genres often stumbles a bit, failing to meet the quality of the previous book.  Ms. Rowling din't only stumble, she tripped and fell.  During the entire read, I failed to see any plot.  The characters, all unlikeable and rife with myriad problems, underwent little change, either good or bad.  I failed to see the point of the entire story, if that's what you dare call it.  It seemed more like one very long, boring vignette.  I do hope she does better with her next one."

author: b'Francesca'
title: b'Dull Characters'
body: b"I liked the quality of the writing, but the story was rather uninteresting.  Believe it or not her characters were predictable and nearly all living men were caricatures and the woman just slightly more developed.  I didn't really care what happened to most of them.  Nevertheless, the ending wrapped most of the story lines up into a neatly presented package"

author: b'Nancy H Miller'
title: b'Better than expected'
body: b'Fun,crazy and sad all in one. Although I bought it for the author I really enjoyed the style and the story.'

author: b'Angela Chiang'
title: b'Completed the book, was baffled and disappointed'
body: b'I did give the book a chance.  You cannot compare this book with 1984 or other classics as a few other reviewers have done; it is honestly a straightforward observation of several families in town.  It is not a disturbing character study.  I found all of the characters caricatures of extreme personalities or extreme situations, and each of them a different extreme.  Their reactions of things that happen to them are immediate, surface reactions; it does not allow the reader to be sympathetic or to be empathetic to the characters.'

author: b'Angela'
title: b'Loved it'
body: b'I know a lot of people who had a hard time getting into it. There are many characters, so I can see how that can happen, but you start to learn and care about all the characters and understand how they are all connected in a small town, so stick with it!'

author: b'maureen c. ogden'
title: b"On-the-mark commentary of today's world"
body: b'Highlighted the cruelty and pettiness exhibited by so many in the world today.  J.K. Rowling, as in previous books, makes her characters come alive.'

author: b'louise'
title: b'Great  story'
body: b'From the beginning this story was very enthralling.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Very much a downer'
body: b"I am glad to see J.K. Rowling venture into other genres but, while this book may have been well written, it was not my cup of tea. The story started off depressing and never got better. I don't know how it ends because I got too depressed reading it to finish it. I very much enjoyed her mystery story and am looking forward to its sequel but I really didn't care for The Casual Vacancy."

author: b'Joan Plummer'
title: b'Rowling did not achieve her goal.'
body: b"This book is so boring, not up to J.K. Rowling's capabilities.  Small town lives as in any town anywhere.  Nothing exciting or even worth reading."

author: b'Sarah Atkinson'
title: b"Power through the set up stage- it's worth the read."
body: b'What a book.  Of course, I picked it up'

author: b'Robert Benfatto'
title: b"Rowling turns her modern day Pagford into the equivalent of Trollope's Barsetshire and George Eliot's English Midlands."
body: b"A moving novel with multiple living, breathing characters moving seamlessly throughout the intertwined stories depicted in this brilliant work of craftmanship and art. I have never read a Harry Potter book and I gather those works  are the reason behind this allergy some readers have to to everyday language, drug use and human sexuality that are offered as the reason for their bad reviews.This work is not disappointing. It's a triumph. Rowling turns her modern day Pagford into the equivalent of Trollope's Barsetshire and George Eliot's English Midlands.  A very sad book that begins with a death and ends during a funeral, but with a life affirming memory."

author: b'Beckyloutx'
title: b'Weak'
body: b'Loved loved loved Harry potter series and was prepared to love this book too. But the characters seemed one dimensional,plot was thin...never  satisfactory. I just couldn\'t get into it. Also some aspects seemed very shallow...the treatment of characters lacks veracity--I just cannot believe people actually think/behave this way. It\'s funny because in some science fiction and fantasy stories outrageous things happen, but I still "believe" the characters. In this book, I wanted to believe...but I just couldn\'t.'

author: b'L.Rose'
title: b'twists and turns right up until the end'
body: b"twists and turns right up until the end....didn't see the ending coming at all."

author: b'Randy norton'
title: b'J.K. Rowling'
body: b"I am having a difficult time getting interested in this book. I'm a grandmother who loved the Harry Potter series but her attempt at an adult book leaves me uninterested. Hopefully it will improve as I read on."

author: b'Ximena'
title: b"Don't read if you are expecting something similar to Harry Potter"
body: b'Casual Vacancy is a very good book. I enjoyed it because it shows some of the realities of the welfare system in the UK and the views of their different citizens. It also shows how even with this system some people fall through the cracks. If you are expecting something similar to HP do not read it as this is a book for adults. It has some strong language and some very visual stuff but i do believe is a very good book. I actually enjoyed reading some more serious literature from her although I do love the harry potter series.'

author: b'genevany'
title: b'Defining human nature'
body: b'Rowling takes a massive amount of characters and defines each one by picking them apart for flaws. She manages to meld this into a story about life and death and human nature. The seamy undersides of each are exposed and dissected as though the reader were there in the room with each character. The story line is tightly wound around a small town environment where everyone plays at being important. Just like a small planet of ants, they go about their business with an agenda of their own.'

author: b'Edward L. Keating'
title: b'outstanding'
body: b"I truly enjoyed this book.  It was such an amazing set of character studies.  Even when I was not reading, the story stayed in my mind.  I'm likely to start it again."

author: b'Patricia H. Bullock'
title: b"She's here for us."
body: b"I couldn't put the book down; Rowling gets inside the heads of so many bewildered people, of all ages, that the story is automatically exciting and a bit sad from the first page. Anxiously awaiting more."

author: b'D. K. Ennis'
title: b'New Avenue for Readers'
body: b'I started this book and liked it but I prefer her mystical adventures of Harry Potter.  J.K. Rowling is an amazing writer!!!'

author: b'Luke'
title: b'not so casual'
body: b'Her characters come off the page and are extremely believable though very flawed. It is a depressing read, but well written and haunting. If you work with young people, it is a valuable read. So often adults make judgments about kids that make situations worse rather than better.'

author: b'carrie-ann ness'
title: b'Most people in my book club hated the story as well'
body: b"I have never read Harry Potter (yes yes i know) so I didn't come into this book with any particular expectations.  It wasn't an enjoyable storyline....quite brutal in places.  I also didn't find the writing to be anything of consequence.  Most people in my book club hated the story as well...although one woman really enjoyed the writing style."

author: b'penny'
title: b'it takes a village to raise a child'
body: b'Never has this quote been so true. A community can make or break an individual . Unfortunately tis is a breaking rather than making story.'

author: b'Michael Self'
title: b"I'm glad I stuck with it"
body: b"Initially, I wondered if the author was being just a tad too clever. On passing that, I began to relax into the delightful character development that continued for the bulk of the rest of the novel. I'm glad I stuck with it. A satisfying read on multiple levels."

author: b'Ben'
title: b'Well written, insightful peek into the dynamics of a small town'
body: b'Full of well rounded characters, this story will keep you turning the pages while simultaneously feeling both empathy and disgust for each of the many characters. Ultimately, it leaves you walking away thoughtful and curious about where you fit in with the cast and questioning your own motivations for good or bad.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Disappointing!'
body: b"JK, stick to Harry Potter books.  This was one of the most hard to read, depressing (and not just the subject matter), confusing books ever. Every possible scenario was stuffed into this book and. . .nothing!!  It was a huge disappointment from such a successful writer.  My best advice is don't read it!!"

author: b'Barbara Wert'
title: b'Very depressing'
body: b'Skipped thru to the end hoping it would get better. The writer found little positive in the life of her characters.'

author: b'Brian G.'
title: b'I kept hoping for an actual plot...'
body: b'...but it never materialized. I love JK Rowling\'s Harry Potter books, but this one didn\'t do it for me. It reminded me of an episode of Seinfeld where they joked it was a "show about nothing." This is a book about nothing.'

author: b'ozone'
title: b'All gossip, no plot.'
body: b"I listened to this book on CD's I got from the library.  I'd actually give this book 2.5 stars.  The reason I rounded up is because J.K. Rowling is a great writer.  She has a way with words that is to be admired.  So I just couldn't give it two stars.  I didn't dread listening to it or consider stopping, but the story just wasn't very good.  It was very much like a soap opera.  If you are old enough to remember the TV show Dallas, I think it was much like that, except without a plot.  If you like the idea of listening to a bunch of gossip, this book is for you."

author: b'T. Schlosser'
title: b'Wanted to Disagree with the Bad Reviews'
body: b"The negative reviews kept me from buying this book when it first came out.  However, when it showed up on the shelf in the lunchroom I decided to read it and form my own opinion.  Honestly, I can't add much to the other bad reviews except to agree with them. Want to read JK Rowling's work for adults try Cuckoos Calling."

author: b'E.G.'
title: b'Not bad'
body: b'Just a story about a town of people and their lives. After the success of Harry Potter, how do you go main stream? This was a decent story overall. But, not as engaging as the Potter series.'

author: b'Regine Tollefsen'
title: b'heart break'
body: b"Don't read this book with Harry Potter in mind. It is a very real tale of social and psychological pressures in contemporary England. The social worker in me highly recommends it."

author: b'JDT75'
title: b'Having problems sleeping?  Read this!'
body: b"She did such a great job of keeping readers on the edge of their seats when reading Harry Potter.  Not a real fair comparison as this book was geared toward adults but her attempt at this was lacking.  Just couldn't get into it.  Just too slow and boring for me.  Found myself falling asleep while trying to struggle through."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Excellent read, left me thinking'
body: b"Just finished this novel. I had a very difficult time putting it down from the very beginning. Rowling's writing is superb. Each of the characters were so well developed and brilliantly described. They are realistic in the sense that we all know people like these. It's a book that leaves you frustrated with human nature, people's poor choices and selfishness, but encouraged by the way that some people can make a difference with a little bit of effort. I guess it's not a book for everyone, but some of the one star reviews reveal that there are a lot of people out there who don't understand or appreciate the real purpose of great literature : to teach us more about human nature, even if what we learn is the ugly truth."

author: b'Jane Offutt'
title: b"Teens expose parents' bad behavior"
body: b"I found this story interesting because the bad behavior of the teens was sympathetic compared to the bad behavior of their parents.  The story is clever in how J.K. Rowling shows how teens use social media to turn their parents' lives upside down."

author: b'Isabel Luengo'
title: b'Shut down the Fields!'
body: b'The book is fun to read, but it is a little too Peyton Pacish. When I finished the book, I was completely for closing the detox clinic and letting the Fields go. What a story of failure! Rowling would have done better if she had chosen a character from the Fields with some hope of redemption. It was hard to feel much sympathy for any of the characters. What a mess!'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Interesting character development wasted on a story without a purpose.'
body: b"Honestly, I am the kind of person who just has to know how a story plays out, but I cant with this book, and I wont.  I got to page 105 and then read the last five or six pages and I am done, I wont be back to it.  Too many characters, too much description but no plot i could find in those first 105 pages and an ending that I just wasn't prepared to read up to."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A Fascinating Character Study in Abnormal Psychology'
body: b'When Barry Fairbrother drops dead of an aneurism while celebrating his wedding anniversary with his wife at the local golf club in the small town of Pagford, it leaves a casual vacancy on the parish council.  Residents of the town react differently to Fairbrothers death, and the novels main focus is on the interaction of the different personalities, how they are affected by the death, and how they plot and scam to use the death to their advantage.'

author: b'Ellen Peterson'
title: b'Excellent read'
body: b"Sad to see negative reviews of this book, probably because the readers were expecting more Harry Potter.  This book has many characters introduced quickly,  warts & all, but once you get it you are sucked into the unfolding story.  The individual characters (some not very sympathetic) may seem unattached in the beginning, but as you read on it becomes clear that each one's actions impact the final outcome.  Really good book and I hope to see more of these from Ms. Rowling."

author: b'leigh'
title: b'thrilling from the start'
body: b'Although I was expecting a mystery or an adventure like Harry Potter, this did not disappoint. Brilliantly crafted and entertaining, this book is a must read!'

author: b'E. Tait'
title: b'Wonderful read'
body: b'Rowling creates Well developed characters, as well as wonderful descriptions of small town politics in England. A beautiful book. Recommended!'

author: b'LeeAnn'
title: b'Just keep reading...'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy initially caught my attention because of the author.  Had I known what the book was about ahead of time, I may not have purchased or read it.  I am not particularly interested in politics at all and find small-town or local politics to be possibly one of the most boring subjects to discuss.  However, upon completing the book, I am glad that I took the time to read this story.'

author: b'Joan'
title: b'An entertaining read'
body: b"I read somewhere (after I read it) that this is Jilly Cooper coupled with Joanna Trollope.  Couldnt agree more, how many times did I think of Jilly Cooper reading this. I'm not knocking Jilly Cooper, I read her voraciously when I was younger, and have read all the HP books, and I thoroughly enjoyed this book. Its not great literature, but it is an entertaining read"

author: b'M. Hornsby'
title: b"Didn't make it past page 22"
body: b'I was looking forward to reading this book, especially since it takes place in Britain.  I love to read about their villages, towns, cultures etc.  However, I was sorely disappointed when I began running into curse words and adolescent sexual thoughts and actions.  I\'m not a Puritan by any means, but come on now - in the span of 3 pages, the "F" word was used 7 times!  Then when "JFC" was used, that was it for me.  Sorry if I sound picky, but had I known about the language and other factors in this novel I would not have bought it.  Just a heads up for those folks who prefer not to read books with "colorful" language.'

author: b'James Owen'
title: b"It's not all bad"
body: b"I am re-reading it now (my usual habit) so I reserve the right to change my mind, but I was not into the book until 65% (It's on my Kindle.) After that, I began to be involved with Krystal. That's a bit long."

author: b'Stargazer51'
title: b'Boring'
body: b"I was the only one in the household who actually finished this book.  I can't understand how JK Rowling could do such a superb job with the Harry Potter series but bomb on this book."

author: b'Oboe Mom'
title: b'A well-written and unexpected story'
body: b"Couldn't say why I liked this book until I read the other 4-5 star reviews, which excellently explained why I did. I think Rowling wrote an excellent book. I almost didn't read it because of the negative reviews, but I'm really glad I did. It is dark. It is real. I can see my community in Pagford. I'm glad that Rowling wrote a different type of book than her Potter series."

author: b'Lowell N. Schwankl'
title: b"Absorbing cautionary tale.  Couldn't put it down."
body: b'A little like watching a slo-mo train wreck.  Fascinating look into where a free-stuff society can go over a few decades.  Should scare hell out of those Americans who think this kind of entitlement life is a good thing.'

author: b'Flopsysmum'
title: b'Anything but a Casual Vacancy'
body: b"This is not a children's book so be warned people! This adult novel by JK Rowling showcases her fantastic use of language. Her descriptive and rhythmic style grabs the readers imagination from the beginning. For anyone who knows the West Country in England, the novel quickly transports the reader to many small rural town facing change from encroaching urban areas. The character of Howard, could very well be found in many villages: larger than life in size and in personality. I loved Fats and Andrew, typical cocky teenagers, even if their actions were appalling at times. However, these characters were so well developed, they could have walked through my door with own son of a weekend! This is a novel that showcases JK Rowling's sense of humour throughout. I loved this despite it not being a warm and fuzzy story. JK, you rock!"

author: b'Virginia M. van Rookhuyzen'
title: b'Look for the real story ...'
body: b'When read with an understanding of J.K. Rowlings early life experience, with an awareness that she grew up in an environment much like The Fields, it helps one realize her desire to tell this story. The real story, is her desire to make others aware of such a life, for which I thank her.'

author: b'm.hjiujnbvg'
title: b'would love to see it a movie'
body: b"Another great Rowling book.  Again, not anything like the Potter books.  The characters in this books are so wonderfully dysfunctional, politically crooked, drug addicted, hypocritical, self important and oblivious to anyone else's feelings or problems.  Every family in this small town has dark, ugly, and extremely disturbing problems and their children all suffer because of this.  The adults cannot see past their own wants and selfish problems to realize that their children are suffering.  Even after major tragic events, the children were the only ones who felt pain, grief and guilt."

author: b'lisa mccaul'
title: b'Boring'
body: b"i wasn't captured at the begging so kept putting it down and found it hard to get back into as there were to many caricatures. and then just as I was getting into it thinking now the story will start it was the last page. overall S***e."

author: b'Dika R.'
title: b'only soso'
body: b'Not surprisingly, the teen characters are better written than the adults.  The first half of the book is a real slog to get thru before it starts to get better.'

author: b'Monique'
title: b'amazing! compelling.'
body: b'Great! Could not stop reading! Sensitive, beautiful language, loved the sayings in between. Longing to read more of her other books'

author: b'El'
title: b'Nothing Casual about the Craft of this Vacancy'
body: b"You know those headlines you read that make you shake your head, cluck your tongue, and thank heavens it's not you? A heartbreaking story of cruelty against a child, or a rape, or an overdose? Rowling takes one of those heartbreaking headlines and completely and totally humanizes it, giving you the backstory of just how such a sad story came to pass. With her usual brilliance at world building and character development, she takes you deep into an emotional and cerebral battle against futility that took decades to build to its crescendo. But brace yourself; this is no Hogwart's."

author: b'Amanda'
title: b'Amanda'
body: b"It's ok a bit confusing jumping between character all the time and it did take a bit to get into it"

author: b'Florence E. Staege'
title: b'Bad book'
body: b'I did not like this book at all and would not recommend it to anyone.  I only read it to see what her writing was like, because I have heard so much about her, but had never read any of her other books.'

author: b'Marla Bagley'
title: b'Lessons for us all'
body: b'I do not believe that in writing this book J.K. Rowling created it for our enjoyment but rather an introduction to situations that many'

author: b'MBSM'
title: b"Wish I hadn't read it"
body: b"While the book was an okay read;  I really wish I hadn't read it. I felt that the characters were developed properly, but I just didn't really like, the whole story line. I felt it could have been written better and that there was too much information on some characters as compared to others."

author: b'LJB'
title: b'A hard read'
body: b'The plot took forever to get going. The last 25%  finally pulled me in.'

author: b'Siansonea'
title: b'Loved itnever read any of the Harry Potter books'
body: b"Honestly, it took a lot of guts to write a book like this, after pandering to a specific audience for so many years. The masses don't like books like this, because the masses like Heroes and Villains (note the capital H and capital V). Well, none of those here, though it could be argued that Obbo and Fats are villains (small v) and that Krystal Weedon is an antihero of sorts. But none of that clean and artificial character delineation we so often see in books. Some characters are thoroughly detestable (Shirley, I'm lookin' at you), and a lot of characters are deeply flawed (including the aforementioned Krystal), but what makes them interesting is that they ring true. The garden variety Good and Evil characters of other books are relentlessly artificial, and I find it difficult to engage with such characters. J. K. Rowling wasn't afraid to ditch that paradigm, even though she had perhaps been the biggest purveyor of them (thus my lack of interest in Harry Potter), and I applaud her for it. These characters may not be likable, but really, likability is overrated. Or rather, it should be."

author: b'Anon'
title: b'You let me down, J.K. Rowling'
body: b"I bought this book based on Rowling's previous works. Sorry I didn't read the reviews by others first. Dull. I can't even give it away."

author: b'Vicki Bland'
title: b'Too many switches of characters'
body: b'It took too long to get to know the characters and who was connected to who?  Felt very disjointed.  Hard to enjoy.'

author: b'P. DeBarr'
title: b'Terrible!'
body: b'My book club read this book and very few people enjoyed it.  I was very interested in reading a J.K. Rowling book because I never read any of the Harry Potter series due to my dislike of fantasy.  I had high hopes for this book.  I did NOT like any of the adult characters in the book.  I found them confusing and distasteful.  The whole book was dark and depressing.'

author: b'Carol D. Crotts'
title: b'Hard to get into'
body: b'Almost too many characters and a lot of character development. Not enough suspense or intrigue. Will try her other adult novel.'

author: b'Derin Attwood'
title: b'An excellent surprise.'
body: b'I was pleasantly surprised at this book. I had no expectations, and it was different to any of my usual choices. It did take me a while to sort out all of the characters, but once they fell into place and I was able to enjoy the play of people and their situations.'

author: b'Exor Cote'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b'Not Harry Potter, so it is different style and content.  Was a bit difficult to start for me, but a great read from J.K. Rowling.'

author: b'JFox'
title: b'Absolutely brilliant! 10 stars!'
body: b"Brilliant writing, wonderful characters.  Stories that will grip your hearts.  This is NOT for kids or even young adults (12-13 years of age) although it does deal with a lot of teenage problems, big and small. The idea of how each life counts and how one person's (seemingly a not a powerful or significant person) can alter other people's lives forever. Truly brilliant read. IT should be required reading in junior and senior years in high school.  Seriously."

author: b'Doc C'
title: b'Painfully true'
body: b'The subject matter makes it difficult to say I "enjoyed" the book, so giving four stars doesn\'t mean I will read it again.  But I am glad that I\'ve read it once.'

author: b'M. Steelman'
title: b'A British Peyton Place'
body: b"J. K. Rowling's first adult book bears all the hallmarks of her Harry Potter books: interesting characters, tangible setting, building a story the reader wants to know. Her talent in creating a world that is familiar yet foreign shines here. Pagford is full of hidden lives and secret desires and Rowling unveils them while slowly building to the climax. As in life, there are no happy endings, just changes as the world keeps turning in the West Country."

author: b'J. Brown'
title: b'Poor read'
body: b'The storyline moved far too slow. Was bored throughout most of the book. Almost gave up reading to the end but persisted and managed to make it to the end. Would not recommend it to anyone else to read.'

author: b'Ariesme'
title: b'She should be a Agathe Christie.'
body: b'I am currently up to chapter 6. It is slowly unfolding and gets better. The characters are so surprising. I know the ending will be a slam dunk.'

author: b'Hannah Sandoval'
title: b'Amazing'
body: b"I couldn't put it down! The characterization was wonderful. Just as good as harry potter eventhough its an entirely different genre"

author: b'Ralph W. McCann'
title: b'Too Many People that are almost fatally flawed'
body: b'It is hard to believe that no one involved leads an ordinary life and not be involved in the plot'

author: b'Jessica Peveler'
title: b'Definitely NOT Harry Potter'
body: b"I'm amazed at how boldly Rowling shed her Harry Potter series to write this raw story about the dark secrets of a small English town. It's like a modern British Peyton Place. It reminded me a lot of Catcher in the Rye; some of the characters and ideas were so vulgar. And yet, they can seem to be forgiven by the fact that their vulgarity is so harshly truthful."

author: b'Frances'
title: b'a struggle to get through'
body: b'Like the boat race mentioned throughout, the story was a hard pull. A collection of prejudice and snobbery offset by prejudice and slobbery'

author: b'Mahoney'
title: b'Interpersonal relationships, cloaked in small town politics...'
body: b'With compelling and interesting characters (always good character development from Ms. Rowling) this is a quick read. While she does not present new ideas about community and the politics of interpersonal relationships, she does insist that you re-examine your own assumptions.'

author: b'Paula A. McMahon'
title: b'Excellent Book!'
body: b"This book had excellent character development, plot and ending.  I had a difficult time putting it down; one of the best books I've read in a while!"

author: b'Eric Juneau'
title: b'Too Much Setup - Only Appealing to BBC Lovers'
body: b'I\'d heard a lot of things about J.K.\'s post-Potter experiment. Opinions seemed to be split. I heard critics panned it on release day, but at the end of the year, it was hitting a lot of "Best of" lists. I went into it giving a lot of benefit of the doubt. After all, this is an author who has her own theme park.'

author: b'Eugenia C. Leal'
title: b'JK Rowling latest book'
body: b"It is a well written book.The start is good, like it could be a thriller but later it becomes a story about suburbia, a small town in England with all the gossip and speculation. It has a lot of characters but unfortunately, I couldn't identify with any of them. I finish reading it because I always finish what I start but the ending was just as disappointing as the rest of the story."

author: b'Diane C Roebuck'
title: b'Mildly interesting'
body: b'The story was okay, but the book was way too long and slow moving.  I prefer to read books that keep me from wanting to put it down.  This was not one of those.'

author: b'Andrew Zaruski'
title: b'Very engrossing!'
body: b'It is a very dark vision of "human condition" beautifully written and well plotted.'

author: b'happy reader'
title: b'good read'
body: b'Good book about people in a small town and what happens when city counsel type position is vacant. The characters  realistic and interesting.'

author: b'Indigo'
title: b'Great read!'
body: b'This is a book that deals with "heavy" subjects though it is not crass or unnecessarily vulgar. I could not put the book down. I was fascinated by the characters and how their motivation and personalities were slowly revealed. I couldn\'t wait to see what happened next. It\'s definitely not a "happy go lucky" book, but it is fascinating in its brutal honesty and depiction of how everyday decisions can have resounding consequences. Loved it!'

author: b'Kristin87645412543'
title: b'Loved reading this book!'
body: b'Definite departure from HP books, so dont read if thats what you are looking for.  However, same amazing writing that JK Rowling is known for.  At first there were so many characters it was hard for me to keep track of what was going on, but the story was so interesting to me, I found it impossible not become invested in each character.  Even the unlikable ones are brilliant and so...human.  The story is dark, and graphic at times (which wasnt what I expected from her as a huge HP fan) but its so funny and the characters are so realistic.  I just loved this book; I can not wait to read more from JK Rowling as an adult fiction author.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'unexpectedly poignant read'
body: b'Much depth of character'

author: b'David Collins'
title: b'British class culture.'
body: b"Interesting insight into class culture on a small country village. Some things, unemployment, drugs and drinking ring true. Rowling's portrait of middle class Britain a bit scary."

author: b'B. Campbell'
title: b'Dark but compelling'
body: b"I admit that I didn't think JK Rowling was a very good writer when I read the first Harry Potter book - but the books were completely engaging and she did improve immensely with each book. The Casual Vacancy has nothing in common with those books - so don't look for that - but it is a gritty, real story that exposes the worst of people in a small town. I finished the book feeling uneasy - but knowing that I had read something masterful."

author: b'John'
title: b'JK Rowling did herself proud'
body: b'Interesting plot.  The switching back and forth from present to past makes you pay attention to the book at every turn.'

author: b'Barbara Skilbeck'
title: b'Great book well written'
body: b'Kept interest from first to last page.  Well thought out story that was well written.'

author: b'robert h cormier'
title: b'Very different from Harry Potter'
body: b'Very interesting about small town politics and how the lives of people intertwined with one another to create all sorts of problems.'

author: b'Nancy W.'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy not what I expected'
body: b'I did finish the book.'

author: b'J. Baker'
title: b'Loved this book.'
body: b'I cannot wait for her next one.  Hope this will be a series.  Character development was fun to watch. A good read.'

author: b'Brian OConnor'
title: b'dark, thoughtful, well-written, humorous'
body: b'I loved "The Casual Vacancy." The narrative style is third-person but frequently switches perspective between the large cast of characters, and JK Rowling has such an amazing understanding of her characters/way of crafting and portraying her characters, who are each so distinct and realistic, that when she writes from each of their perspectives you really feel like you\'re experiencing the novel through the characters\' experiences. Kind of hard to explain (there\'s probably a literary term for this - I just thought it was done extremely well here).'

author: b'Margaret Taylor'
title: b'A disappointing read'
body: b'I must say that curiosity drove me to read this book. After enjoying the Harry Potter series, I wanted to see how well J.K. Rowling could engage adults in her first novel aimed at adult readership. I was disappointed. I probably would not even have finished it had it not been a book club selection. That being said, the book did realistically portray life on the dark side of both halves of the socio-economic divide. It was not an enjoyable book by any matter of means, but it did spark lively discussion at our book club meeting.'

author: b'miltr'
title: b'What was the point?'
body: b'The novel appears to be about class warfare in a small English town.  She describes a number of people in very uncomplimentary terms.  None have any redeeming features.  It was frustrating for me because I could not tell the point of the story.'

author: b'Jeanne Gehret'
title: b'Not Worth Finishing'
body: b"More than a hundred pages into the book, it doesn't have a single character that I like, and is very slow-moving. Why would I want to fill my head with a bunch of nasty, self-interested, foul-mouthed, violent, deluded people who are not going to do anything particularly interesting?"

author: b'DIANE MINARCIK'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Story and characterizations were excellent, however.  It held my attention until the end, which was not satisfying.  It seemed to end abruptly giving most of the characters closure, but not the story..'

author: b'Sydney1817'
title: b'How to appreciate and actually enjoy The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'First: at the beginning, jot down the character names in one of two columns: those who are pro-Fields and those who are anti-Fields. To get you started, the man who dies at the outset, Barry Fairbrother, is pro-Fields. Note their nicknames and spouses, and the parent/child relationships. There are many significant characters and your notes will help sort out the cast and get you through the first 100 pages.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Book was disappointing'
body: b'After reading her latest book, "The Cuckoo\'s Calling," which was a suspenseful page-turner, I was disappointed with her first effort after the Harry Potter books. It was slow and hard to get into. It didn\'t really get interesting into about halfway through. The subject matter, dialects and setting were very British and had a limited appeal for me. I was tempted to give up part-way through the book but kept going. It did get more interesting as it went on. I would recommend this book to diehard fans of J.K. Rowling.'

author: b'S. G. K.'
title: b'Dressed up soap opera'
body: b'Not much happens for a very long time. But Rowling has an easy style and a great eye for the little things that make us individuals.'

author: b'Shelly King'
title: b'It was OK'
body: b"Not the greatest book I've ever read but still a good read.  We'll written and kept me wanting to read more but I didn't find many admirable qualities in the characters.  Not a happy and uplifting story."

author: b'Rusty'
title: b'Good story.'
body: b'I picked it to see if I would enjoy J.K. Rowling\'s work outside of "Harry Potter" and I did.  Should be a movie.'

author: b'kathy haile'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'In true Rowling form this work is intreguing from start to finish. The characters are well developed and interesting. This is a must read for fans of J. K. Rowling.'

author: b'Rhett Parsons'
title: b'A Very Different J.K.Rowling'
body: b"Rowling's building of character and unashamedly highlighting flaws in nearly everyone draws you in and has you debating with yourself who's the goodie and who's the baddie."

author: b'Michael Kuhn'
title: b'not  at all your Harry Potter'
body: b'Well worth the read.  Very Brittish.  Much human suffering nod turmoil of the soul.  Rivalry, competition, defeat, loss, saving the traditions of the past, paving the way for perceived improvement."  Where is the redemption?  Where is the joy?'
