author: b'Kimberly Williams'
title: b'very disapointing'
body: b"I expected more from a children's author. The profanity and the sexual references are not what I expected.  Great authors can write well without this junk.  A vast majority would prefer clean books."

author: b'Sandy'
title: b'thought it would. better'
body: b'Too much description of characters and too many characters.  The last third of the book was the best. Took me a long time to get into it.'

author: b'L. L. Lloyd'
title: b'Had a hard time with this one'
body: b'I knew this was no Harry Potter, but still had a hard time getting into it. It may be a culture difference. However, I would recommend it as a type of "coming of age" novel. Gritty at times, filled with the drama found in most small towns, "Vacancy" shows how difficult parenthood is whether you are upper middle class or a junky.'

author: b'Julie Elizabeth Powell'
title: b'An excellent read!'
body: b'A very well written somewhat dark read which character lead. Each character has its flaws, weaknesses and dark side yet each also are real in an all too human way.'

author: b'Gloria Matuska'
title: b'A disappointment'
body: b'Got bored with it but was determined to finish it!'

author: b'Keiron Malkin'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy - post Harry Potter'
body: b'After Harry Potter, my expectations were too high, I found this book a little awkward / clumsy but it could just be that JK Rowling has been so adventurous in previous books, and this didn\'t have that "magic".'

author: b'grizzlysmit'
title: b'Great book'
body: b'Loved it J. K. Rowling is a great author this is totally different from the "Harry Potter" series but this is still a  great work'

author: b'G. Hunter'
title: b'Character development?  Resloution?  Plot?  Dark and Depressing.'
body: b'First off, please do not let anyone under the age of 18 read this book.  Of course it is a break from the Harry Potter series.  what a break.  Of course the Potter books were contagious and at times a guilty pleasure. This book had very little of the positives of her earlier work.'

author: b'M. Woo'
title: b'it got better'
body: b'It took me forever to get through this book. I started in October and finally finished it. The book was so slow in the beginning, but it picked up towards the end.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'An excellent read'
body: b'I thought the characters were brilliantly drawn and very true to life, warts and all.'

author: b'Missao13'
title: b'It was great!'
body: b"I expected not to like this book because of what I had been hearing about it but I'm glad that didn't happen."

author: b'BCB'
title: b'Just not what I was looking for'
body: b"I'm probably one of those people who was judging this book on the Harry Potter series, but I just couldn't get into it at all."

author: b'K Thomas'
title: b'Dark and Depressing'
body: b'Although well written, this book will not make you feel happy.  It is a sad, dark tale through and through...'

author: b'mary'
title: b'not what I expected'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy is definitely not in the same vein as Harry Potter.  For the first third of the book, it was hard to follow--jumping from one person to the next and back again.  There is a lot of foul language and actions in the story.  It is depressing at times.  Very dis-functional people/families.  The only sane person seemed to be Barry (and he was dead before the story starts).'

author: b'David Clark'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'Boring, Boring, Boring. I expected so much more from such an accomplished writer.  The views and tips say more words needed, so Boring, Boring, Boring.'

author: b'barbik'
title: b'Peyton Place in England'
body: b'HAHA dating myself ... page Turner lots of twists ....older crowd....you really feel for all the characters. Hope she writes again!'

author: b'Josh'
title: b"Don't bother"
body: b"This book didn't get good until page 400. Too many characters, too much back and forth. Not a fan of this one by Rowling."

author: b'M. Danielson'
title: b'Rowling Made Me Eat Crow'
body: b"As a rather crusty English teacher, I have always taken the liberty of looking down on J.K. Rowling and her little Harry Potter series. I read this book because of a challenge issued by one of my students, and I couldn't put it down. The sheer, genuine awfulness of Rowling's characters is delightful. There is absolutely no one to cheer for, but I found myself hoping for redemption for all. Anyone who has lived in a small community will recognize the ugliness that resides behind closed doors and smiling faces."

author: b'Becky'
title: b'Fantastic'
body: b'Life in a small British town. The author has transformed into adult fiction well. I loved the characters and their very human flaws. A very good read.'

author: b'Cheryl Coneeny'
title: b'To many. Characters'
body: b'felt there were to many people involved in the story. took several chapters to remember who was who and how they intertwined'

author: b'J. L. Harrison'
title: b"Where's Harry?"
body: b"As a lover of the Harry Potter series, I found myself looking for any sign of wizardry in this novel.  We HP fans watched J.K. Rowling develop from a YA author to a fully developed adult fiction writer.  In this book she blooms...leaving all the magical tricks behind; relying solely on her insight, rapier wit and honed writing skills.  A dear friend, who had just unexpectedly lost his wife, recommended the book.  As I read I marveled that he could get through such a dark and complicated tale and that he raved about it.  The ripple  effect of an unexpected death takes the reader into the lives of a disparate and vast cast of characters, many of whom do horrible things to the each other.  I never found Harry, but I certainly saw the colorful and quirky character development I'd grown to love in the HP saga."

author: b'Jillymc'
title: b'Slow start but thought provoking'
body: b'I seemed to get bogged down with the multiple names for every character.  Probably just me, but I had a hard time keeping them straight.  The book seemed to take a long time to develop, however, in the end, there were a number of things to ponder with regard to human nature and I find myself still reflecting on the story even though i finished it a week ago.'

author: b'Ole Asbjrn Riis'
title: b'Beautifully vitriolic commentary'
body: b'J.K. Rowling gives a succinct and very amusing portrait of small town England - deliciously exposing the more ridiculous aspects of local politics, but doing it with love and sympathy. She writes in a flowing, easy to read manner and tells a jolly good story.'

author: b'earth'
title: b'No Harry Potter Here!'
body: b'Starts out sort of slow....Picks up the pace and interest of the reader!  Well written and I did not want the end to come!'

author: b'R. Bolden'
title: b'Great book club selection!'
body: b"Well written story.  The character's come to life.  What goes on behind closed doors, in the comfort of one's own home, in the quiet of one's own thoughts, can be frightening!"

author: b'Molly Donnellan'
title: b'No Harry Potter'
body: b"ok, I didn't expect Harry Potter.  It was supposed to be a departure from that.  It was well written - but I just really disliked most of the characters."

author: b'The Hooker'
title: b'Rubbish'
body: b"this is definitely the worst adult fiction I have read very unbelievable characters and a absolutely stupid storyline Harry potter it isn't"

author: b'Wneki'
title: b'I am disappointed'
body: b'As much as I loved the Harry Potter books I had to force myself to finish this one. Hopeless, depressing, not that well written. I think that J.K. Rowling was brilliant when she wrote Harry Potter but if this book was to shape her career as an author it would have been one of these books one may not even finish reading and forgets and wants to forget as soon as is done reading. It would never be a bestseller.'

author: b'pj'
title: b'Rowling more than disappoints'
body: b'This novel verges on trashy and even though I "get" what her point is, I certainly expected more of J.K. If this is her best attempt at an adult novel she should stick with fantasy.'

author: b'Carl Alves'
title: b'Just awful'
body: b'JK Rowlings displayed such an amazing ability as a storyteller, that it amazes me that she would do such a poor job in her post Harry Potter debut.  My biggest issue with The Casual Vacancy is that there isnt so much as a thin plot, but more like no plot.  The novel starts off with Barry Fairbrother dying in his small town in England, and the rest of the novel is people reacting to it.  It is full of people with petty concerns and unimportant things that they dwell on, but there is no actual story here.  Furthermore, there is not a single likeable character.  I have no idea who is supposed to be the protagonist or antagonist, but I didnt care in the least for any of them.  This novel was so painful to read that I had to stop midway through.  Normally, I stick with a novel to the end even if Im not enjoying it, but this was so dull and uninteresting that the thought of reading another 300 pages worth of it depressed me.  If youre a Harry Potter fan, avoid this one or you will be sorely disappointed.'

author: b'Beth Mulbry'
title: b'Long boring'
body: b'We read this book in my book club.  Half the group did not even finish it.  J.K. Rowlings is great at detail and this book had too much detail on some things, it made the book drag.  Also, if you like happy ends do not read this book.'

author: b'Frank Salucci'
title: b'Hard to believe this was writen by JK Rowlings'
body: b"The whole time I was reading I kept thinking it would get better, it's JK Rowling. I was even more disappointed once I finished. The ending was so unnecessary and only made a bad book more disappointing."

author: b't -wizzle'
title: b'painful to get through'
body: b"I'm a Rowling fan, but I only finished this book because I felt that I owed her for the hours of enjoyment she has given me In her other books.  The tone of this book felt like Rowling was going through a Miley Cyrus-esque distancing of herself from her previous work.  It was unnecessarily crass, the plot had no driving or compelling tension (so the character development just seemed to languish on and on), and the end had no redeeming value.  I'm sure that some will say that she wrote it to build awareness of those less fortunate (the poor, the addicted, the mentally ill or psychologically disturbed) but if that is the case, she failed - because she never created a character that we could care about or identify with.  I read 1-2 books a week and this was easily the worst book I've read in a decade."

author: b'Jane'
title: b'Not my favorite...'
body: b"I had to work at getting through this.  I found the british english a little difficult to understand at times.  The book moved a little slow for me, but 'ok'."

author: b'S. Callaghan'
title: b'One of two books in my life that I seriously considered not finishing.'
body: b"I borrowed this book from the library (thank god I didn't spend money on it!!!) for the same reason thousands of others did.  I loved Harry Potter, and wanted to see what else the author could offer.  That said, I agree with other reviewers who said you can't compare this to Harry Potter because it is a completely different kind of narrative.  However, the real reason I think people compare it to Harry Potter is not to compare the content of this dark, depressing, and disturbing story (which is completely opposite from that series), but more because it is completely missing one of Rowling's greatest attributes as a writer... engaging characters and an interesting plot."

author: b'Jill S.'
title: b'Greatly disappointed with this book.'
body: b'J.K. Rowling keep me entranced from page one with every one of her "Harry Potter" books.  However, after patiently reading this one, hoping it would get better eventually, at 1/3 of the way through I finally gave up and could not finish it.'

author: b'Beverly Beth Urban'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy . . .'
body: b'Harry Potter, this is NOT!!  I have read all the Harry Potter books by J. K. Rowling--and loved them.  However, "The Casual Vacancy" is an entirely different \'breed of cat\'--and if you can get through the life-in-the-raw shock of Part One, you will appreciate what a truly gifted writer this woman is.  J. K. Rowling is truly brilliant and writes straight from the chill in her bones.  Beautiful work here while, at the same time, being sadly authentic.'

author: b'Carol Siegel'
title: b'Yes, This is How It Is for the Poor in a Bourgeois World'
body: b"Everyone who has ever been desperately poor and struggled up to literacy and beyond should read this book.  At first the amount of rage against the middle-class characters shocked me.  I've never seen more cruel character portrayals or more vicious humor than Rowling directs against the Mollisons, for example.  But then I began to recall what it was like to feel as helpless as Krystal Weedon and as terrified of ending up like Terri Weedon, before  I found a teacher who cared enough to help me surmount my dyslexia (thanks, Mr. Miller!) and later professors from the lower classes  who spent the time with me I needed to learn to solve problem with words. Rowling is cruel to the cruel and speaks for those who can't write books.  She deeply explores what the loss of Barry Fairbrother, who thought everyone was at least as valuable as he was, does to a community of smug, selfish, judgmental, over-privileged creeps.  And it's balm for the soul of everyone who has ever had to contend with similar communities.  If you feel sick with anger when you see the top 10% pinching up their faces in distaste as they step over the homeless lying in the street on their way into boutiques and expensive cafes, then you'll enjoy this cathartic novel.  (And bonus points for the depiction of what it's like to live with a guy like Simon Price!)"

author: b'Paul J. Austin'
title: b'Interesting'
body: b'the subject matter was not overly exhilarating. Long story that really was dreary. I was surprised by the outcome, I suppose I thought there would be a more uplifting ending. It just ended!'

author: b'Anna Crowe'
title: b'Strangely Unredeemable'
body: b"I had hoped for Rowling's demanding pace and style that demands the reader to turn another page. I kept turning pages only with the hope that these people (who were terribly difficult to follow) had something -- anything redeemable in them."

author: b'James Beardsley'
title: b'Stick with childrens books.'
body: b"I got the impression that she was trying to write for adults but hadn't made the transition from children books."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'From kids books to adults'
body: b'I loved the characters and I hated some which is still a good thing.  she is very good at making her characters real and getting you to feel for them I was worried to read this because going from very successful kids books into adult fiction had to be hard not many authors could pull off a complete genre switch.  this is certainly not a book for kids.  I was sad to see it end but it came full circle before doing so'

author: b'Ruth Angela'
title: b'Great for a cruise when you have a lot of time'
body: b'The story is convoluted, and well written .. of course... There are some superb descriptions that would equal any famous writer in the world.'

author: b'Beth'
title: b'Interesting...'
body: b"I may be the only adult in the English-speaking world who had never read any of the Harry Potter books, so my expectations of The Casual Vacancy were minimal. It was a tad slow to get going, but I ripped through the last 20% or so very quickly. It did end kind of abruptly, as another poster mentioned. The other problem was that it seemed to have a few too many characters; I kept mixing a few of them up together. In retrospect, that may have been deliberate; the ones that confused me most were Shirley and Maureen, the wife and business partner respectively of Howard, the top guy in Pagford. As it turns out Maureen may have had an affair with Howard (or not, we never really know), it may be that I was meant to mix them up. It's a reasonably good book; I enjoyed it."

author: b'Michelle Boytim'
title: b'A gritty tale of suburban English life'
body: b'(3.5 stars) This a gritty tale of village and suburban life in England. Conflicts that have been simmering under the surface for years come to a head with the unexpected death of a councilman, leading to a "casual vacancy" on the council. The factions on the council are divided over the perceived drain on resources by the subsidized housing community (the Fields) just outside of the town. Whereas Barry, the deceased man, rose from poverty in the Fields to a comfortable middle class experience, others are convinced that is a blight on their community. At the center of the story is Krystal, a kind of anti-heroine, a teenager trying to take care of her toddler brother and her in and out of rehab for heroin mother. She had been taken under Barry\'s wing as a member of the rowing team. While far from an angel, Krystal has a tragic air of trying to do the right thing but failing despite her good intentions. As the politics become nastier, we see how the families are affected and how small things can erupt into terrible consequences. While I agree with some of the other reviewers that the dark and gritty nature of the novel can sometimes be over the top and is certainly a big departure from the Harry Potter series, it is a shot of reality, and you can see Rowling\'s depth of character development and storytelling in spite of the modern and "real" tone. While I didn\'t love the book, certain aspects stuck with me, particularly the characters of Krystal and Sukhvinder who were overlooked for their perceived inadequacies and yet had true hearts hidden beneath their pain.'

author: b'Dragonfly'
title: b'Diappointing'
body: b"I didn't finish this book, it was depressing and unpleasant to read about a group of unhappy quarreling people.  The author must have been out of sorts when she wrote this, it isn't up to any standard expected of J.K. Rowling."

author: b'N. Warren'
title: b'Snooze'
body: b"I couldn't get through this novel. I really tried. I wanted to like it, but I just couldn't. I am such a huge fan of the Harry Potter series, and I really wanted to enjoy her first adult novel."

author: b'Roberta L Chalou'
title: b'Skip this one.'
body: b"Very boring read - Rowling doesn't get to the heart of the story until half way through the book. Too many characters, too many scenarios, and mediocre writing. Rowling should stick to children's books, where her imagination soars."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"It started off really interesting but introduced too many characters and the relationships got confusing.  I'm not giving up on it and will try again."

author: b'Carole L. Martin'
title: b'Oh dear'
body: b'I LOVE JK Rowlings\'s stories. I couldn\'t wait to read this to see how she fared in "adult\' material. Oh. No. The basic story is good, a counselman dies suddenly and leaves a vacancy that several people vie for. But there are so many characters I couldn\'t keep them straight (weird, I didn\'t have any problem with that in Harry Potter) and the characters are all vicious, angry and foul mouthed. The story began to drag and I was actually glad when I finished it, but I did not like the ending. I hear it will be made into a movie. Please don\'t.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Definitely a change from Harry Potter but I liked it'
body: b'An interesting character driven story about a small town full of secrets and intrigue.  As you read the book you learn more and more about the different people in the town.  Overall I thought it was fun to read but wasnt my favorite. I still prefer the Harry Potter series but this is a completely different style.  And for that, I commend the author.'

author: b'Jenny M. Bangerter'
title: b'good book'
body: b"First I have not read Harry Potter, ( yes some of us haven't) the book was recommended by a book club I belong to. Didn't mind it was very sad at last but that is life."

author: b'Mary Emma Middleton'
title: b'Interesting look at  small town politics'
body: b'I actually read all the HP books but that was not why I chose to read Casual Vacancy. Every character was flawed in some way (as are we all) and they wanted to be noticed more than anything. So much misunderstanding between husbands & wives, the teenagers and the other characters. No one confronting the truth except for Krystal and even then, she could not face up to her responsibilities as a sister - perhaps too much had been placed upon her shoulders too soon. We only have to look around us to see that this type of behaviour, the lies, the secrets, the push for power is in our midst. And even when disaster struck, there still was little compassion for the wounded and the hurting. So real; so true.'

author: b'MW'
title: b"What's with all the negativity?"
body: b"No, this is not Harry Potter (which I loved).  This was written for adults and has an entirely different writing style.  Some have said this book is dystopian with evil characters.  SO not true! This is far from dystopian.  Yes, I guess almost all the characters are flawed in some fashion (some by choice and some by circumstance), but aren't we all?"

author: b'Victoria Anderson'
title: b'Gift'
body: b"Not sure about this one.  It was a gift for my niece for Christmas; however, being she loves everything J K Rowling writes, I'm sure she loves it too."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'well written. a slice of real life'
body: b"Rowling wrote a gritty novel. Sad and moving . Insight into drug world. All characters very well developed . Didn't not like them personally but very. Real."

author: b'Jim gahring'
title: b'Just ok'
body: b"I wanted to like this book.  The writing is wonderful and the story is a good one.  My problem was with the characters.  Not one of them is likeable.  I couldn't find something to relate to in any of them.  That was my biggest problem with the book.  By the end I didn't care enough what happened to them."

author: b'Emma Peale'
title: b"If it weren't by Rowling, it wouldn't have been published."
body: b"Admittedly, I haven't finished yet. I'm giving it 100 pages before I abandon it and I'm just a few pages short when Amazon emailed the urge to review. Okay. It's not that it isn't about magic; it's not that it's not Harry Potter; it's that is written as if it is purposely trying to not be lyrical, beautiful, or incisive in its style. I get it that it's a trend these days for authors to write each new book in a different style, but I must ask, Why? This might have made it as a short story. The writing is blocky, trudging, decidedly pedestrian. Every now and then there is a funny moment, a witty observation, an incisive scene, as when the social worker tries to interview the junkie mother with the hungry toddler running around in wet diapers, risking his life as he fights the already entrenched negligence. But there are so many characters, most of whom seem to be short and squat or tall and obese, it is difficult to keep them straight."

author: b'Anne Zirkle'
title: b'Interesting story but lacking'
body: b"As stated by many other reviewers, this is not Harry Potter, nor should it be compared in any way to the author's children's series. That being said, I was not expecting this book to be remotely like Harry Potter, but I still came away feeling disappointed. The story lines in the book were interesting and could have been meaningful, however the author failed to make me care about her characters. By the time I reached the denouement, which the author obviously intended to be very emotional and heart-rending, I was honestly just relieved that the book was over. I've tried to put my finger on what it was that left me feeling so ambivalent about this book and think that perhaps the problem was that there were too many characters that she tried to get us to care about, resulting in my ultimately caring about none of them?"

author: b'Kay D. Kirby'
title: b'Disappointed--Never read Harry Potter books because genre did not appeal--but thought she must be a good author.I was wrong!'
body: b'I read it because someone gave me the book. Could be of interest to someone at a diffeent place in life'

author: b'K. Bandy'
title: b'A ponderous satire with a strong finish'
body: b"I have just finished reading The Casual Vacancy, and was interested in reading some reviews, hoping to find some great interpretations and insight into Rowling's message.  Instead, it seems like everyone either expected Harry Potter or just missed the point."

author: b'SW'
title: b'Surprisingly, this book about a small town was really.much bigger'
body: b'Rowling has an amazing ability to make the people she writes about into.people you know. This could really.be about.my.small.town in.the US. The seemingly slow moving pace of.the beginning magically draws you.in so you will end up reading this all.night to find out what comes next from.the characters who become people you know'

author: b'Calvin'
title: b'Foul language'
body: b'There are so many words in the English dictionary to use without using the"f" word.  I have no recommendation to give for this book!'

author: b'Kortney'
title: b'Too many character switches.'
body: b"I got to about 180 pages and stopped. I figured if I didn't know which character was which by then it wasn't worth continuing. I hated how she switched between so many characters to try to tell a crappy story that was really depressing."

author: b'ThomasR'
title: b'Thought I needed therapy after reading only half of the book'
body: b'Morose; if small English society is this twisted and perverted I am indeed sorry for them.  I saw no socially redeeming quality in the narrative other than to appreciate where I live (and I already do).'

author: b'skeeterbug'
title: b'Certainly NOT Harry Potter'
body: b"I wasn't sure what my expectations were regarding this book when I started reading it.  I was NOT expecting it to be anything like Harry Potter - phenomena of that sort come around once in a lifetime and I was curious to see how JK Rowling would be as a writer when she wasn't writing about HP."

author: b'BookLover'
title: b'Terrible'
body: b"I read a lot of books so I am used to bad language.  But I just couldn't stand all of it in this book.  Not all young people swear like this.  Plus, there weren't any characters that I liked.  Sorry that I wasted my money on it."

author: b'Debbie Stombaugh'
title: b'Lengthy and Sad'
body: b"Very long. The characters were shallow and self involved. I wouldn't recommend it. It was hard to finish.I kept wanting to go on to another book."

author: b'R. Camilleri'
title: b'A divine comedy'
body: b'A perceptive reviewer here noted with puzzlement "that Rowling has described this as a dark comedy."  JKR is of course right that The Casual Vacancy is comedy in the sense that Dante\'s epic was a "divine comedy."'

author: b'R. Camilleri'
title: b'A Comedy of Resurrection'
body: b'A perceptive reviewer here noted with puzzlement "that Rowling has described this as a dark comedy."  JKR is of course right that The Casual Vacancy is comedy in the sense that Dante\'s epic was a "divine comedy."'

author: b'antonio vega.jr'
title: b'great book'
body: b'it took a while to get into the book but once it got it it was a great read - way to change it up'

author: b'Gina Arnone'
title: b'Behind closed doors'
body: b"This was a difficult book to read. If a book ever needed warnings for being a possible trigger this is it. It definitely wasn't a feel good story. That aside, once I got into this book I found it hard to set down. It definitely is a peek behind closed doors, and that can be a scary thing. I did have some problems with aspects of the characters, I am not sure if it was just not liking how things were going or if it was an actual character flaw. The nurse didn't seem to be very useful when it came to caring for injuries, no matter the circumstance that lead to the injuries."

author: b'Road Warrior'
title: b'Well Written - Gritty, sad, true'
body: b"It's not surprising that Harry Potter fans don't like this book. Rowling has used her fame and readers' expectations of escapist literature to lure comfortable people into thinking about uncomfortable things - things that need our concern, repentance, and action. This book is well written, drawing the reader in gently to the dynamics of a small community, eliciting chuckles and finally, tears."

author: b'Willow'
title: b'A Depression Cast of Characters'
body: b"JK Rowling can write.  No doubt about it.  But this was a dismal, dreary group of characters living in a dreary dismal town and there wasn't anything in it that didn't make me feel deflated."

author: b'ZC'
title: b'Spectacular prose in a rambling story'
body: b'Spectacular prose in a rambling story that seems to pleasantly go nowhere for some 400 pages before (spoiler alert) suddenly taking a very dark turn in action in the last 100 pages.'

author: b'Ashleigh Lay'
title: b'Run-of-the-mill omelet'
body: b"This type of shadowy drama isn't really my jam and if Rowling hadn't written it, I doubt I would have even picked it up. In the throes of Potter passion, I was always so impressed with how big her scope can be as a writer, how imaginative. This book is the polar opposite of scope, taking cues from the Jane Austen school of thought that all you need for a good story is a few families in a small town and a spark. Unfortunately, the citizens of Pagford are never as interesting or sympathy-inducing as Austen's characters. Mostly, they are ordinary small town people who peck and gossip, desperately trying to hide their own flaws and secrets while exposing those of their neighbors. Some of them are better eggs than others, but they all make a rather run-of-the-mill omelet in the end."

author: b'Bianca Asher'
title: b'Thumbs and toes up!'
body: b'Being a die hard Harry Potter fan, I was very reluctant to read this more adult based book from J.K. Rowling. However, once it hit my Kindle I was absorbed into the storyline and characters that she so beautifully creates.'

author: b'Jj'
title: b'Fly on wall'
body: b'Loved it. I love that feeling of being a fly on the wall. To see people when there is no audience. Not a light book by any means, but was pleasantly surprised at the characters and how much I enjoyed them all.'

author: b'nikki feldman'
title: b'the book was ok but not great.'
body: b'Good story & suspense.'

author: b'William Whipple III'
title: b'Falling Dominos'
body: b'I bought The Casual Vacancy out of curiosity as to what Ms. Rowling would choose to write about after the spectacularly successful Harry Potter series, and found it a good effort.  The book is a bit hard to follow, however, because of the large number of characters and frequent switches in perspective.'

author: b'Nicole'
title: b'A Realistic Book by a Fantastic Writer'
body: b"Overall, this is a really good novel. It was a little slow going at first because she has to take time to introduce the many different characters, but once it started moving I couldn't put it down. This book is brilliant in it's depiction of human nature, including the ugly side of it. But for Harry Potter fans, I warn you, this is not at all a fantasy and is not the feel good novel that her Harry Potter series often was. Instead this book is a work of literary fiction that exposes the petty behavior and apathy of a small town, full of fairly affluent middle class people, towards a community of impoverished people on their border. Rowling has created a story that most people could see unfolding everyday outside their own doors, if only they would stop and really look. Her characters are totally believable, but not necessarily likable (though there are a few that I liked). These are flawed people, but they have their moments of revelation and introspection that lead a few to rethink their way of living. But at it's core, like Harry Potter, this is a novel about tolerance, understanding, courage, and love. It just isn't shown through rose colored glasses."

author: b'S. Robbins'
title: b'What was the point of this'
body: b"I think J. K. should stick to fantasy.  This was interesting but a real downer and at the end I wasn't sure why I was listening, other than I wanted to know what happened.  Expensive buy, and you probably can live without it."

author: b'Julia D. Kirwan'
title: b'Slog at first but then it gets interesting'
body: b'JK has taken on a new literary challenge with this story of a small town in England and its local politics, the relationships of parents and children, and classism, elitism of some town members contrasted by those in the "Fields".  While the author is developing the characters in the first 100 pages, it is a bit of a slog, but once you get into the story it gets interesting.  The characters (with all of their flaws and inadequacies) are developed and revealed. At the end, you are in consideration of right and wrong, good and evil, and human condition.'

author: b'Kady Turner'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy Review'
body: b'"I dont know who this is for. I dont know who would like it. I feel like J.K Rowling might be beating me over the head with some social message, but I dont get it. Or perhaps J.K. Rowling..."'

author: b'March Hare'
title: b'Too casual by far'
body: b'Not a great novel.  This is a novel in which nothing happens.  Everything is much the same at the end as it is in the beginning.  The people who were in power are still in power (with one very small addition).  The do-gooders are still trying their best to overcome evil.  Nothing gets resolved, there are no learnings for the reader.  The one good thing - JK Rowling really knows how to draw a character.'

author: b'JoyceSi'
title: b'Worst book ever'
body: b'I was so excited to read this book when it came out because I loved the Harry Potter movies but had never read any of JK Rowling\'s books. What a disappointment, There are too many characters to keep track of and not enough plot to hold my interest. I kept waiting for the payoff and found myself getting more and more frustrated by the boring story and pointless trivia that the author chose to focus on. I even skipped over 100 pages in the middle and I doubt it made a difference at all. Skip this book and read "The Cuckoo\'s Calling" instead.'

author: b'Janira Ramos'
title: b'Thumbs up for Jo Rowling'
body: b'I liked how the story kept going back and forth, a bit confusing but I liked it. I was disappointed with the ending but I still enjoyed the quality and content of it.'

author: b'StrangePegs'
title: b'The Protagonist Is DEAD'
body: b'My first impression of the book remains my impression of the book now that I\'ve finished it, that Rowling was trying too hard to be "adult." It\'s like the stereotypical starlet who goes out of her way to do as many nude and/or sex scenes in her movies as soon as she turns 18. Or, you know, like Lindsay Lohan or Britney Spears. Or, prior to them, Drew Barrymore (if any of you remember when she went through that stage and posed in Playboy and all of that). It\'s not that there is sex in the book, it\'s that any time there was anything sexual, she conveyed it in the most crude and vulgar way possible. Like the detailed description of a young girl\'s genital area in a quasi-sexual way. It just seemed to me like a cry of, "Look! I can write adult stuff! I can!"'

author: b'Los Osos Girl'
title: b'A boring town made interesting'
body: b"When this book was assigned by my book club I was not overly excited to read it, however, Rowling's makes the daily pettiness and challenges of this community and its citizen quite memorable.  Like real life, its characters are hardly perfect and there is both melodrama and melancholy.  Who knew the parish council elections could lead to such insight into this community.  Los Osos Girl"

author: b'Marti'
title: b'Wonderful story!'
body: b'When I first began reading this book, knowing nothing of the book,  I imagined it would be something like the HP series. I quickly discovered that I was wrong. This book is nothing at all like HP. This book is about real everyday life and the Pain, Hurt and pettiness of people. It deals with ignorance and foolishness, social stigma and taboo. I cant say I am surprised that I loved this book, J.K Rowling is an amazing author..'

author: b'StrangePegs'
title: b'The Protagonist Is DEAD'
body: b'My first impression of the book remains my impression of the book now that I\'ve finished it, that Rowling was trying too hard to be "adult." It\'s like the stereotypical starlet who goes out of her way to do as many nude and/or sex scenes in her movies as soon as she turns 18. Or, you know, like Lindsay Lohan or Britney Spears. Or, prior to them, Drew Barrymore (if any of you remember when she went through that stage and posed in Playboy and all of that). It\'s not that there is sex in the book, it\'s that any time there was anything sexual, she conveyed it in the most crude and vulgar way possible. Like the detailed description of a young girl\'s genital area in a quasi-sexual way. It just seemed to me like a cry of, "Look! I can write adult stuff! I can!"'

author: b'Sheryl Sorrentino'
title: b'Lively, Moving and Fast-Paced'
body: b'Wow. The Casual Vacancy has got to be one of the best books I have ever read. I am rather pleasantly surprised to feel this way, because I didnt much care for J.K. Rowling when I read her early Harry Potter books to my then school-aged daughter. Id found her writing as dry and unmoving as her stories were imaginative.'

author: b'diri'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b'Awesome story,  characters come to life and leave you thinking about them long after you have turned the last page.  Raw, gritty realism.  Heart wrenching,  kept me immersed from the first page.  This book transports you, with vivid descriptions. I cannot praise this book enough. Thanks J. K. Crawling!'

author: b'deborah kelly'
title: b'depressing book!'
body: b"The book moved way too slowly I did not like any of the characters I didn't care what happened to them,made it 1/2 way through and quit.Every time I read it I came away feeling sad and hopeless muchlike the books characters."

author: b'A. Johnston'
title: b'Insightful and very well written'
body: b"Very engaging book.  Some books have a slow start trying to set the stage for future action but this book grabs you right away. In her description of a characters' thoughts J.K. Rowling shows brilliant insight into their true nature and motivations.  This book describes life in a small town and how people are affected by an unexpected death. She helps us understand what it feels like to be in each character's position and sheds light on how each character came to have their current point of view.  She adeptly describes situations in brief but highly descriptive phrases so I was never inclined to skip ahead. Each part of this book was carefully and succinctly crafted to precisely convey an image to the reader.  There's much more going on here than just the straight story line. Lots to think about but never approaches being preachy."

author: b'Daniel Davidson'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'A novel without a single interesting character or insight. I wonder what percentage of those who started reading it made it to the end'

author: b'J. Rudolph'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This one took some reading over to understand what is going on in some places but it certainly was off the beaten path, but I did enjoy it.'

author: b'Alexander'
title: b"Intelligent read, reminiscent of George Eliot's Middlemarch"
body: b"I loved it, couldn't put it down, and now can't find anything to replace it.  The Casual Vacancy is not at first an easy read, but contains humor amidst the realism.  I especially recommend it to teachers, who deal with real life on a daily basis.  The story itself centers around the death of a teacher in the opening scenes, and the lives of the people he left behind.  This story is about a village and the lives and thoughts of its people, similar to George Eliot's Middlemarch, another very intense look at humanity.  Yes, there are a lot of characters, and yes, there are no completely good people or completely evil people, but those are strengths in a novel."

author: b'Ryan'
title: b'A Surprise'
body: b"I didn't know how I would feel when I heard that J.K. Rowling came out with an adult novel, but of course I was going to read it. This novel was the perfect start for this fantastic author to break away from Harry Potter and start to write adult novels. This epic tale of a corrupt town may be confusing at first, but after a few chapters in the characters begin to all fit together and the story line is incredible. It was a fantastic book that I did a book report on last year and it gave me so much to talk about and think about what is wrong with our corrupt society and the government. I highly recommend everyone to read this novel."

author: b'Gail S.'
title: b"Don't expect Harry!"
body: b'Well written but a little depressing!  It was easy to connect with the characters.  A great insight into small town life and politics.'

author: b'llindalu'
title: b'Different'
body: b"I enjoyed the book once I convinced myself I shouldn't be comparing the Harry Potters I so love.  It is if course an entirely different read.  I look forward to more."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Wow'
body: b'Amazing insight into Brit local politics. Loved the rich characters, could hear their voices in my head for days. What a tale. Read it!'

author: b'jobooks'
title: b'Good read, but...'
body: b'A very readable and well-managed book, that yet never takes off into that higher sphere of insight and understanding which real Literature requires,'

author: b'P. Hjemboe'
title: b"couldn't get into it"
body: b"I had high hopes for this book, but it was seemed so disjointed from the get-go, some many characters intoduced and not really fleshed out enough to make me care about any of them...I just decided there too many other things I I'd rather be reading. I gave up after a couple chapters."

author: b'Alison Pheasant'
title: b'AVERAGE READ'
body: b'Not what I expected after Harry Potter series!  took a long time to get into and the characters were hard to follow.'

author: b'Joy'
title: b'Rowling hits a home run with this one!'
body: b"This was a very interesting and easy book to read.  Characters were clearly defined and the story line kept you involved.  Definitely would recommend any of JK Rowling's books for adults.  Very entertaining and enjoyable."

author: b'Stefan.K'
title: b'Success beyond Potter'
body: b'Well written and simply enough for a very lay audience to grasp in terms of writing style.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Hard To Get Into'
body: b'This book was "hard to get into"....but hang in there..it gets good...worth the wait!!!The plot definitely has some twists and turns.'

author: b'Joanna'
title: b'Extremely interesting!'
body: b'Great study of human character! Highly readable - reads like the best whudunnit, yet highbrow! By highbrow I mean thought provoking, intellectually challenging and sophisticated!'

author: b'Tracey Harty'
title: b'Well-woven Tale'
body: b'This started out slow for me, trying to stay focused on the varied character descriptions. In the end I came to truly enjoy the depth of the characters and how their relationships and situations were inter-related.  Very crafty!  Also enjoyed the glimpse of life in a current-day small town in England.'

author: b'R. WAUGH'
title: b'No Harry Potter Here'
body: b'A very interesting book about British political life.  Great the way the characters are developed and the interplay amongst them.  Takes time to get into the story and to sort out the characters but by the end you want it to keep going.'

author: b'Peg P'
title: b'Read with caution!'
body: b"Do not use this book for bedtime reading if you are looking for something relaxing.  This is a grim novel.  it opens with the sudden death of the one redeeming character.  Rowling's characters are vividly drawn.  Are they believable?  A few, perhaps."

author: b'John M. Vizcarra'
title: b'Pleasantly adult small-town week-in-the-life-of book'
body: b"I must admit, going into this book I didn't quite know what to expect. After enjoying her Young Adult Harry Potter series, I knew this was a more mature book, but really didn't know much about it. The jacket write-up wouldn't normally be enough to rope me in, but the strength of Rowling's other works was."

author: b'April'
title: b'Too much bad language'
body: b"The story might be interesting, if it wasn't so vulgar.  There was a lot of unnecessary swearing and sex.  I know it is a book for adults, but I felt it took away from the plot."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'After the rich imaginative prose in her Harry Potter books I expected something more. i found her style stilted and the storyline unimaginative and dull.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Love Her Writing'
body: b'Not so much this book. Could not get through it. Found the characters unlikeable and did not want to invest my time to see if that changed. I read for entertainment and did not find this book entertaining. J.K. Rowling is a wonderfully talented writer, this book failed to draw me in. That is my experience with the Casual Vacancy,'

author: b'Alma Sessler'
title: b'Uninteresting and dull'
body: b'Dull, poor plot. Not at all up to her Harry Potter series. I would not recommend it to my friends.'

author: b'Heather M'
title: b'Better than the other reviews made it seem.'
body: b'I\'m a fan of the Harry Potter series (having read the entire series) so I thought I\'d give her first shot at a book for adults a try.  While others complained about its gloominess and the lack of magic, fantasy and or how boring it is, I disagree. It isn\'t by any means a "happy" story, but just like in the HP series, I laughed, cried, got angry, and felt a kinship with many of the characters. HP was successful not only for its subject matter but also for the skillfulness in which JK Rowling breathes life into her characters. After reading A Casual Vacancy, I have to say that while the story may not be everyone\'s cup of tea (as another review said, "if you wanted something funny or magical then head to the another genre section")  I have to give JK Rowling some props for her first stab at writing for adults. I look forward to reading whatever she comes up with next!'

author: b'R. Hartley'
title: b"JK Rowlings' Casual Vacancy review"
body: b'As normal, it takes awhile to get into a JK book... keep listening. Are there a lot of characters, yes. Will you get lost; yes. Is the story worth it; YES!'

author: b'Shannon Elf'
title: b'I wish I could give it 6 stars'
body: b"I loved this book. I couldn't put it down and read it cover to cover in about a week. I got so attached to all the characters - they are written so beautifully and with such depth and I miss them now that I've finished the book. That's the best kind of fiction, in my opinion."

author: b'K. B. O.'
title: b'Cant get through it'
body: b"Big harry potter fan. Didn't expect this to be the same but the story has not grabbed me at all. I just don't care."

author: b'vcdeitrick'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b"A grown up book by JKRowling was just as satisfying as the Harry Potter Series. It was a little British, but I can't rate 1/2 a star off, so I'll leave it at 5 stars."

author: b'Judith A. Myers'
title: b'Worth your time!'
body: b'Great read. The characters are very well developed and you become involved in the plot almost immediately. I would buy again.'

author: b'Mnj'
title: b'WOW'
body: b'This book was so unexpected! Rowling writes a compelling story that is realistic and heart breaking. Well done very well done'

author: b'JMR'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Very interesting book. Not exactly what I expected. Think of small town politics and all of the dirt that sometimes comes out when an unexpected event occurs. In this situation it is the death of Barry Fairbrother. The parents, also involved in the small town politics, are so busy scheming that they have neglected one important thing -  their children who each in their own way secretly expose family dirt. This is truly a like it or hate it book but worth the read.'

author: b'Joan Alexander'
title: b'actually, I would give 1/2 a star.  It just was not up to her standards.'
body: b'It was not up to her standards.  It was very hard to read and not a page-turner.  I would not recommend this book.'

author: b'Brian Hetherington'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b"To be honest I wish I hadn't bought this book.. I found it slow and dull..In fact quite disappointing. It seemed to me an"

author: b'Maureen McAfee'
title: b'Perfect'
body: b'I got the book as soon as I expected and the book was undamaged.'

author: b'JYM'
title: b'Read it'
body: b"Stunned. I'm only familiar with the HP books via nephews. I decided to buy one nephew her book for adults, read pages online. Decided to order one for college reader and one for me. Could not put it down. She has 20 or so characters fleshed out, and the interplay is funny, sad, astonishing. Her child characters will astonish you. If you love fiction, read this book."

author: b'Laci Nagy'
title: b'A slow hard slog'
body: b"Few of the characters are likable and until the last few chapters I only kept reading out of loyalty and a sense of having wasted my time if I didn't finish it."

author: b'Susanne Zels'
title: b'A very honest and well written novel'
body: b"I couldn't put the book down and was positively suprised by J.K Rowlings first adult novel. The story touches upon some real social issues in the UK."

author: b'Susan L. L.'
title: b'Casual Vacancy Good read'
body: b'There are so many dysfunctional families in one town.  I had a little trouble in the beginning keeping track of all the family members but once I got to know them I was able to keep track.  It is a very good read and I enjoyed it.  It was a tragic story from the beginning to the end.  Be ready because it will start and end with tragedy. The story and its characters are very dysfunctional.  My kind of book.'

author: b'gaye blomfield'
title: b'Poor read'
body: b"Having read The Cuckoos Calling expectations of this book also being a good read we're high. Was let down and rating reflects my opinion of this read."

author: b'Pat Thomasson'
title: b'Started twice. Glad I finished.'
body: b"I've read all of the Harry Potter books. Ok, that's done."

author: b'July Moore'
title: b'Too difficult to get into.'
body: b"I read about 25 pages, but it didn't catch my interest.  since I have other choices, I can afford to be choosy.  Note, I own a bookstore."

author: b'annlelli'
title: b'Very interesting'
body: b"Could be any town or city...people with problems.  It's our society with the haves and have nots anywhere you go."

author: b'P. M.'
title: b'too dark'
body: b'I finished 2 chapters.  Too dark for me.  I read to relax.  This book is not relaxing.  This is my first book review.  Shows how much I disliked the book.'

author: b'L. W. Schore'
title: b'Lost her luster'
body: b"I was astounded to see the drop in tone, liveliness and vibrancy that was so evident in J.K.'s wonderful Potter books. What's awful here is a desire to be serious and adult, with shocking displays helpings of  foul language. It's a shocking come down. I couldn't believe it's the same author that made a billion on something so good."

author: b'Stephanie'
title: b'Brilliant. I was drawn in from the very first page...'
body: b'I never read Harry  Potter, so I came to the book with no thoughts of comparing her past work. What I loved about Casual Vacancy is how she nailed the small, but very meaningful idiosyncrasies in all of her characters.'

author: b'Sadaf Haroon'
title: b'returned!!'
body: b'what a disappointment after HP series!!!!...'

author: b'Julie G Caldwell'
title: b'Modern issues'
body: b'Surprising different from the Harry Potter books, but covered a variety of issues pertinent to the current day reader.  Very interesting reading.'

author: b'Armin Hanik'
title: b'Tried it valiantly,,, just to give her a fair chance'
body: b'I have to admit I gave up after 10% (kindle) in. What a load of boring cobbled together crappola.'

author: b'Lorraine Cleary'
title: b'Brilliant'
body: b"it's funny, sad, horrific, brutally honest and very clever.  I am going to miss the characters."

author: b'M. Q. Bell'
title: b'A Bunch of Muggles'
body: b'I know it\'s not fair to compare this work to her Harry Potter series, but it\'s a natural thing to do.  Her "magic" isn\'t there in this one, though the 2nd half flew by after a sloggy first half.'

author: b'Susan Ballard'
title: b'No good'
body: b"I read almost this entire book waiting for something to happen. I finally gave up. I'm certain she's just introducing characters for a series, but I found them rather flat, and I couldn't decide who the main character was.  This is an adult book, so language and situations are adult in nature, I knew that going in and was not offended or surprised. It was just incredibly boring.."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Why did I waste the money??'
body: b'Took the extremely talented writers credentials and said to myself, "myself, this should be good."  Fought my way through the first 75 pages and could not go on.  Reputation or not the writer could not hold my interest.  Seemed way to ordinary and mundane with way to many characters you have to try and keep up with.  I like to read for "pleasure" not pain.'

author: b'Kindle Customer GINNY'
title: b'OMG'
body: b'I loved this mystery. I love the style of writing, the language usage, the character developement and the unraveling of clues. It kept me guessing. And it was fun. Not gorey.'

author: b'Janet Franzen'
title: b'What a Storyteller!!!'
body: b"This is such a great read.  Once you get to know the characters you just can't wait to keep going to find out what happens to them.  It was a challenge to keep them straight, but it all worked out.  My book club had a great discussion as we related the events in the story to our society today."

author: b'C. Walton'
title: b'Change of pace'
body: b'I\'m not the kind of person who can divine the allegory behind an author\'s story or printed sentence, but this book seemed to be a look into the lives of a small group of people and their motivations and how the life of one person can affect the lives of many in ways you wouldn\'t expect and regardless of the relationship between the people. Depending on the kind of life you\'ve led and the people you\'ve known, you may or may not find the characters to be "real" in that they seem to have more than their fair share of faults, idiosyncrasies, and secrets, but I found them to be very real on many levels. If you don\'t find them to be real or believable, just remember it\'s a novel, not a psychology text book.'

author: b'Julia Larson'
title: b'Poor ending'
body: b'How to end a story when all is loss..kill them off.  Sad situations make poor reading. I expected more from a talented writer.'

author: b'Cynthia M. Shaler'
title: b'Greatly enjoyed it. Tightly written.'
body: b'This is how one would want Rowling to write a murder mystery: with well-developed characters (sympathetic and otherwise), intense action, and just enough hints to keep you turning the pages and--at the end--wanting the next novel to come out really soon.'

author: b'Patap'
title: b'How one incident affects many'
body: b'I found this book quite interesting in how a death in an English village affected many families.  The story did jump around from family to family a little too fast at first but then I became used to Rowlings type of writing.  She gives many insights to thoughts of her many characters and has some wonderful perceptions of life; i.e. "tiny ghosts of your living children haunted your heart;they could never know, and would hate it if they did, how their growing was a constant bereavement."  Enough said.'

author: b'Mibby'
title: b'Good and Quick Read'
body: b'Not too good at reviewing books.  I bought it for my Kindle..  I enjoyed the book, and it was an easy quick read.'

author: b'Laurie Mack'
title: b"I've read half way through and as hard as I try, I'm not going to be able to finish it."
body: b'I love the way JK Rowling develops her characters, but it is all character development and outside of the beginning, no mystery.'

author: b'Christina Rickman'
title: b'Interesting and well written!'
body: b'JK Rowling is a great author- her style of writing is unique and interesting. This book is all about characterization (as opposed to a particularly action packed plot-line) but JK Rowling keeps you interested and engaged with her witty insights on human nature. You finish feeling very unsettled because the characters and their emotions and intentions feel very real.'

author: b'AnneP'
title: b"Couldn't put it down"
body: b'I know a lot of people have complained that Rowling head hops in this novel, but I really sort of liked it.  Her insights into human behavior and how the interactions and acts of the people around us effect how we behave are amazing and well worth keeping notes for the first three chapters until you know the characters well enough to put it down.  .'

author: b'Z Hayes'
title: b'Has its moments'
body: b'I have to admit that I purchased this book because I am a great fan of the Harry Potter novels by J.K. Rowling. I knew that this was going to be a very different read just from all the synopses and reviews I read but I felt compelled to read it anyway. I wanted to experience for myself how well Ms. Rowling transitions into the mature, grown-up fiction genre after having written so successfully for the Young Adult fantasy market (though the HP novels are ageless in that they appeal to readers of all ages).'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Mixed Feelings'
body: b"In true JK Rowling fashion, the characters were well defined and she revealed the characters in an unvarnished fashion. For me, I like my reading to be more of an escape from life's harsh realities."

author: b'Peggy'
title: b'excellent character development!'
body: b"So well written.  Not being a follower of Harry Potter, wasn't sure about experiencing this departure. So glad I did!"

author: b'Heather E. Poginy'
title: b'Excellent Writing, Not for the Faint of Heart'
body: b'If you are looking for an uplifting read, do not read this.  The Casual Vacancy starts off quite confusing, as there are many characters that you have to sort out before you get to know them.  Each has their own way of contributing to the tragedy of the story.  Yes, you heard it - this story is NOT uplifting.  It will tear you to pieces.  Given the length of the story, it gives you a long time to truly connect with the characters.'

author: b'Peg Abt'
title: b'fabulous read'
body: b'Memorable characters who depict beautifully the different classes and why the Brits make it so hard to be successful without the right pedigree.  But the book also shows our universal desires, strengths , weaknesses, pettiness, compassion & lack of compassion. Amazing detail-- Pagford and the Fields come to life--& an impressive portrait of the fears, insecurities, & difficulties of being a teenager is the modern world & what lies beneath the seemingly idyllic life of a small town.'

author: b'firewithin'
title: b'kimee56@yahoo.com.au'
body: b'Human nature written about in all rawness.  Very clever indeed.  You recognise all the characters.  The story is a brilliant study of people.  Bravo!'

author: b'Lisa L.'
title: b'Not Harry Potter, to be sure, but a strong piece of adult literature'
body: b'Given the length of this book, the plot is minimalist, detailing the quotidian microdrama of a tiny hamlet in England and the adjacent, slightly larger town.  There is no backdrop of historical significance, there is no cataclysm, there are no dragons. I normally have little patience for endless descriptions without a lot of action, but Rowling is something of a wizard in her own right when it comes to the subtle magic of arranging words on a page.'

author: b'Stephen A. Benner'
title: b'A Decent Social Commentary, but Not Such a Good Novel'
body: b"This story shows J.K. Rowling's usual gathering of several threads together in one story, but unlike her other books The Cuckoo's Calling (as Robert Galbraith) and if course the famous Harry Potter series, she doesn't bind all the threads together in a neat conclusion.  They are mostly left dangling at the anticlimactic ending that while it is considered a sad local tragedy is forgotten soon by everyone in the town."

author: b'monita'
title: b'Not casual- Edgy, Thought provoking, Honest'
body: b'I recently picked up  The Casual Vacancy by JK Rowling to read on a flight. I had not read the reviews but I remembered hearing that this was different from the  Magical Potter series.  This is a somber but well-written adult read. I would not recommend it for children because of graphic accounts of self-mutilation, suicide, pedophilia, mental illness and other ugly realities.  JK Rs narration is effortless; dry British humor emerges but is restrained. Rowling boldly strips her characters to their sullied souls and makes the reader acutely aware of her penetrating literary eye. I dont think she wrote this book on her train trips but I sense that this plot was brewing in her mind for sometime perhaps since childhood. She is a wizard at creating adolescent characters. They are painted with so much finesse that you can touch and feel their blemishes, insecurities; false sense of bravado, odd alliances and stark rebellion. There is probably a bully like Fats in any school and a silently suffering victim like Sukhvinder. There is no protagonist but one is left feeling deeply for the rough and tough, Krystal daughter of a drug-addict mother who tries hard to beat dire poverty and the odds stacked up against her but fails miserably. There is no redemption and the ending is bleak but there is a metaphor of hope in the yearning to excel at rowing!'

author: b'Billie Settles'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy - a chequered success.'
body: b'"The Casual Vacancy" was, not surprisingly, beautifully written. J.K. Rowling\'s readers have come to expect this, and we were not disappointed. However, the story was convoluted and dense, reminding me of a Russian novel. The town, itself, finally emerged as the main character, with the many tormented townspeople playing the roles which defined it. If there was a rewrite, I would suggest focusing on one or two of the finely drawn characters with the others as subsidiaries.'

author: b'Margarita'
title: b"Couldn't put it down once I got hooked."
body: b'It took me a couple of chapters to get the characters straight, and then I was hooked. Krystal Weedon is one of those memorable characters who sticks with you for days after finishing the book. Rowling is truly gifted with the ability to create a world that a reader enters and lives in while reading. A dark world, but I was there.'

author: b'G Andrews'
title: b'Intriguing...'
body: b"This was quite different from what I'd expected and it took a while to figure everything out, then it became nearly impossible to put down."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"At first it was difficult to keep everybody straight and to understand this English town.  I liked the consequences of behavior throughout the book.  Sad ending but the only ending.  Very insightful about how people dwell on their own problems and can't see beyond it."

author: b'Wynter Jackson'
title: b'I am a little dissapointed because I ADORE the Harry Potter series'
body: b"I can not actually 100% rate this novel as I really was unable, rather, more uninterested in finishing it. I simply couldn't connect with any of the characters and therefore after numerous attempts at reading it-I sadly shelved it. Perhaps another time?"

author: b'Grandma Bella'
title: b'Novel "Casual Vacancy"'
body: b'The plot was good, but the unnecessary use of so many "4 letter" words seem to be overused and abused.  The characters in this small village were well developed, and could be used in future books.'

author: b'Peter Speers'
title: b'good not great'
body: b'Started very slow almost gave up several times. Characters as well developed, so much so that you know them almost personally by the end.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Intriguing Story'
body: b'I liked the flow of the story and was somewhat surprised by the ending. It seemed somehow cutoff and unfinished.'

author: b'Rebecca Jaxon'
title: b'Brilliant writer - Different'
body: b'I suspect that many people who bought this were expecting another Harry Potter-type book and were disappointed as a result. I loved all the HP books, but I am happy that Rowling is wishing to branch out into other genres and exercise her craft on other topics.'

author: b'ReadsReviewsAlways'
title: b'Lots of characters- confusing yet interesting!'
body: b'Our book club is reading it. It took a long time for me to "get into it." The characters are super flawed, interesting, awful & also just human! Nobody is safe. The ending knocked my socks off & after a week I\'m still angry about it! :) I think that means it was good.'

author: b'Maureen Chernick'
title: b'Casual Vacancy opinion'
body: b'Am in the middle of Casual Vacancy and so far I love it.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'anything by this author is amazing.'
body: b"Anything by this author is amazing, I would recommend it wholeheartedly, she can write, gets you involved into the story line and it's just a great read."

author: b'Kathleen Beetar'
title: b'Excellent Mystery'
body: b"I chose the mystery because of J.K. Rowling's authorship. I have never read her work before, and wanted to try something. But the problems of the detective are quite depressing."

author: b'Anna L. Crepps'
title: b'BOREING!!'
body: b"I found it so exceedingly boreing that I couldn't  even finish reading it.  It was a selection for my book club."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'Honestly I really liked it.  The only complaint I have is she jumps around with so many characters I found it confusing for a good portion of the book.  It is a very sad but thought provoking novel.'

author: b'Escargot'
title: b'Worth reading but'
body: b'Interesting but way too many characters introduced. The story takes a while to start and it is hard to find a character that you can root for as they are all kind of mean or bad. Lots of gossiping too.'

author: b'KATH KEATING'
title: b'Not exciting'
body: b"I found this book to be too slow in the telling. I've no doubt these small towns are well described and at least it is more realistic of every day events and class prejudices."

author: b'A. Jones'
title: b'I wanted to like it'
body: b"It's interesting that the majority of the reviews on this book are either at one end or another."

author: b'Belen'
title: b'awesome book'
body: b'This book is a great, it shows you the views on social issues from so many different characters. Great read.'

author: b'Colette diegel'
title: b'Dreadful book'
body: b'Nothing happened in this novel just people being elected to a local council. Not worth reading I quit half way through'

author: b'kathleen murphy'
title: b'very disappointing'
body: b'so disappointing... where is the story.. where is the plot?.. just a lot of characters that are not very interesting mulling around the "vacancy"... ! Hmmm might as well read a tacky mag.'

author: b'headoverhooves'
title: b'An intimate look at the lives behind the masks we wear'
body: b"I loved this book. Rowling shows herself to have a very good understanding of, and a great ability to communicate the effects of things like poverty, childhood trauma, addiction, and the hidden issues in everyday life. None of the characters in this book are purely good or evil. If you want a book about good guys and bad guys this is not for you. This books takes a deep look into the private lives of many individuals in a community and how they interact. As with real humans, the characters have good and bad sides and they all have reasons for being as they are. I love that this book develops and shares the complicated lives of many characters (similar in my opinion to '100 Years of Solitude' or 'Circus in Winter'). This is not a happy tale, mind you. It examines extremely serious events with brutal honesty. Rowling's writing is superb and fearless. I highly recommend 'The Casual Vacancy'."

author: b'Joyce E. Williams'
title: b'disappointed'
body: b'Loved the Harry Potter series, her new book never engaged me.  It was my book club book and I just could not finish it.'

author: b'Catherine Moore'
title: b'Grown Up book'
body: b'J.K. Rowling\'s writing is just as superb in this book as it was in her Harry Potter series, but this is definitely a "grown up" book.  The characters are real and the stories are real life and a very harsh reality at that. It\'s not a book that will leave you with a warm and fuzzy feeling at the end, but it\'s a good read.'

author: b'klm'
title: b'Not what I expected'
body: b'This is a rather dark book,but with elements of humor and compassion.  It very well written and well worth reading.'

author: b'LaDunn'
title: b'Excellent!'
body: b'I really did not know what to expect when I started this book I was pleasantly surprised. The characters are all interesting and the story kept my attention to the very surprising end.'

author: b'zugzwang18'
title: b'Intriguing read!'
body: b'JK Rowling has captured "It\'s a Wonderful Life," by exploring the lives of people that a single death touches and their selfish conniving attitudes. The transition from teen read to adult literature is refreshing. I recommend this to the eclectic reader.'

author: b'Huskerfan2915'
title: b'Book was terrible!!'
body: b'Book was terrible!!  I should have stopped reading after the first chapter! Not worth your time to read it all the way through.'

author: b'pja08'
title: b'J K Rowling.'
body: b'I was a bit disappointed with the book, but possibly because I was expecting something more like the Harry Potter series.  It is a good read, just not what I was hoping for.'

author: b'Merlin'
title: b'If this were a first novel...'
body: b".. I don't think it would have been published.  I think this author rode her name to a book people would not have purchased otherwise.  I have not read the Harry Potter series, so I had no bias even though I came to the novel with high hopes.  The title refers to a empty council seat after the holder's death, but I think Rowling is simply trying to show how vacant, or vacuous, people and humanity are generally.  Unfortunately, the 'vacancy' here can also refer to the book itself."

author: b'garry walker'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'it very good I would recommend it to anyone to read but then I love JK Rowling have a good time xx'

author: b'captain'
title: b'Rowling always pleases!'
body: b'A bit difficult to follow at first as Rowling switches between characters and settings. Rowling sucks you in immediately with a death and interesting characters to follow along.'

author: b'Phyllis Taylor'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'I chose this book because I really enjoyed her other adult book "The Cuckoos Calling".  In "Casual Vacancy" I found it difficult to connect to any of the characters and took forever to finish as it was so boring for me.  When you can\'t invest in any character it is difficult to get into the storyline.'

author: b'drumnbasskitty'
title: b'tale of many threads woven to draw you in slowly'
body: b"slow starting. takes a little bit to figure out all the parallel lives and how they connect. before you know it, you are drawn in to pagford and the peculiar relationships therein. very raw, real, and refreshing. still, you can hear rowling's authorial voice in the careful descriptions of people, places, feelings, and interactions."

author: b'Happy Padre'
title: b'book is vulgar and innapropriate'
body: b'Bought this book for my wife for Christmas. Very disappointed. Full of vulgar language and sexual themes. It will be tossed unread.'

author: b'Susan Beamon'
title: b'village life'
body: b'I have not read any of the Harry Potter books yet, so I had no preset idea of how the author would or should handle the material. The book is about an English village, on the edge of a growing town, that really wants to stay the small, insular village it has always been, without the troubles and problems of an increasingly varied population. This cannot be, so everybody is unhappy with conditions. One of the governing council of the village dies, setting up covert warfare for the future of the village. The story is bracketed by death, resulting in changes to many lives. I enjoyed this book, even if some of the people in it could, in my opinion, use a swift kick.'

author: b'Barbara L Cavanagh'
title: b'My least favorite book'
body: b"This book did not hold my attention, it was easy to put down and if I didn't pick it for my bookclub I wouldn't have finished it."

author: b'Lorna Harper'
title: b'A Good Story'
body: b'I found this to be a good , well written, interesting and hard to put down.'

author: b'Jennifer Cameron-Smith'
title: b'Serious, awful damage to peoples lives.'
body: b"Barry Fairbrother, Pagford Parish Councillor, is taking his wife Mary out for dinner to celebrate their 19th wedding anniversary when he dies suddenly. Barry's death results in a casual vacancy on the Pagford Parish Council, and a number of people are keen to fill it. There are those who want to carry on Barry's work, and those who want to put a stop to what he was trying to achieve. Like most small towns, Pagford has its politics and its secrets."

author: b'MaryEllen Putnam'
title: b'Excellent reading!'
body: b"What a great story! From the master story teller! I loved it! Let's hope that J.K. writes more books for the adult audience!"

author: b'rensk'
title: b'Was Sorry I Bought This One!'
body: b'I pre-ordered this book when it was offered  because I had read the "Harry Potter" series and expected to enjoy a new genre from this author.  I thought I understood that this is not in the same category as Harry Potter; but to me, it did not even seem that it was the same author.  I really could not get into this book even though I read it to the end (painfully) -- I am not a prude, but the language was quite unexpected!  Sorry, but I will never order another of her books until they have been thoroughly reviewed.'

author: b'margaret barugh'
title: b'Enjoyable'
body: b"I was impressed by Ms Rowling's first adult novel and I look forward to many more.  Definitely a book I passed on to friends."

author: b'Danielle Edwards'
title: b'Brilliant'
body: b"I enjoyed this book as I've enjoyed all of J.K. Rowling's books. This book should not be completed to Harry Potter, it's not written for the same audience! I found the book to be beautiful and disturbing at times! We as humans display some very disgusting, yet amazing behavior in situations! This book displays that perfectly!"

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Muggles can be depressing'
body: b'It was so disappointing to only read the most depressing side of a village people life.  I had to reread HP to get over it.'

author: b'Barry Silverstein'
title: b'A total downer'
body: b'JK, you might want to stick to children\'s literature. There is little here to excite, engage or uplift a reader. There isn\'t a single character who it is easy to like. The adults are petty and spiteful, their children are hateful and hopeless, and the interactions between the two are disheartening. Maybe this is what "reality" is supposed to be like in a small town environment, but it certainly doesn\'t make for good reading. Granted, Rowling is an accomplished writer who spins a good phrase here and there. Still, this is a completely depressing book that will leave you feeling rather slimy. Just goes to show the world\'s most celebrated author is human, too. This is a stinker.'

author: b'Bob the norske'
title: b'Outstanding Creation!'
body: b'My expectations for this book were mixed.  First the mediocre ratings and reviews concerned me a little.  However I had already read Rowling and so was excited to get started on it.'

author: b'susbark'
title: b'Interesting'
body: b'This is a good study of human nature.  Rowling demonstrates great perception and writes well.  However, I found that the book drags.  This is not a book for someone who wants action. Rather it is a thoughtful analysis of how people behave and the consequences of their behavior.  I rate at three stars because I love books that deal with human nature, but this one bordered on boring.'

author: b'Book Addict'
title: b'A grudging 3.5 stars'
body: b"The story stars the death of Barry Fairbrother: father, husband, parish counsellor and general good guy. Barry means different things to different people, but sufficient to say that he leaves a gap in the lives of those who knew him. There's no avoiding the cliche of 'ripples over the surface of a pond' as his friends and acquaintances manoeuvre to fill the void - the most significant of which is his now 'vacant' (the casual vacancy of the title)parish council seat."

author: b'R S'
title: b"It's not Harry Potter, which is a good thing"
body: b"After getting this book as a gift for Christmas 2012 and procrastinating on reading it, I finally finished it last night after slowly reading it during a period of a few months. The immediate revelation is that this book is not Harry Potter 8, it's not fantasy or teen fiction, it's harrowing literary fiction that delves deep into human nature, and through a cast of diverse and intelligently-constructed characters, shows how all of us can be led to resent our fellow humans. The plot is somewhat threadbare, which is fine; it develops in much the same way a season of Mad Men does, with the bulk of the material exploring and developing the characters and showing us the facets of their personalities, before presenting two satisfying climaxes near the end where, finally, the stakes are raised for these characters and we glimpse them in their most vulnerable states. The characters in the book are very strong; Fats, Gaia, Suhkvinder, and Andrew have replaced the main trio from Harry Potter as my favorite Rowling teenage characters. Reading their subplots makes me wish that Harry Potter had had more swearing and sex, because Rowling masterfully portrays these adolescents without resorting to hyperbole or cliche, and it would've been awesome to see a Rated R conversation between Harry and Draco or Ron and Hermione instead of the PG talk of the Harry Potter series. If there's a weak link in the cast, it's the character of the Weedons. I won't spoil their placement in the society of Pagford, but after 400 pages it was slightly tiresome to keep coming back to them in the exact same position that they'd always been in when I was more interested in the development of the rest of the characters. However, the Weedons feature heavily in the finale and this makes up for it somewhat.
