The book is well-written, will make you exercise the dictionary function on your Kindle unless your vocabulary is much stronger than mine, and will alternatively make you bust up laughing with Rowling's dry, dark sense of humor, and cry for the characters, not with artificial tragedy (of which there's a little bit in this book) but because Rowling makes them so achingly human that you can't help sympathize yet be annoyed by them at the same time. I enjoyed the book thoroughly and highly recommend it."

author: b'Valerie'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"I enjoy the story telling of J.K. Rowling and thought this would be a delightful story.  Unfortunately I cannot get past the vulger language, trashy sexual references, and disgusting character descriptions.  The story is interesting enough, but I am distracted with the unintelligent conversation between characters and constant swearing.  I was hoping for something a bit more challenging considering how imaginative and intelligent her former series was.  I guess genius like that cannot be duplicated.  Unfortuante; but I'm sure her name and fame from the HP series will keep the ball rolling on this one.  I hope she makes another attempt at story telling and does a better job of it later on."

author: b'Andrea Ryan'
title: b'Quick and easy read but anticlimactic'
body: b"I found this story interesting and intriguing but was left disappointed. I kept waiting for the story to go somewhere but the climax was extremely underwhelming. I did not dislike the book but I can't recommend it."

author: b'miva'
title: b'Great Book'
body: b'i think J.K. Rowling absolutely nailed it when it comes to small town living and the range of different human experiances and emotions.'

author: b'Peggy Glenn'
title: b'Egads - give me death over this book'
body: b"I don't care how famous you are, or how much you're revered for your Potterisms - this endlessly depressing and often revolting tale was the worst read I've had in eons. Ordinarily, I'd have put this down after struggling through 2 chapters. Not a single sympathetic character - not even until the end. But, I forced myself to try to see what others raved about in this. Never did see it. Now, it's on to the shelves and shelves of books I really do want to read - no hype, just good reading. GAAAAAACK, this was the most unsatisfying book I've EVER read, and I've been reading for nigh on to 65 years."

author: b'julie goss'
title: b'Insights'
body: b'Gives  much to think about & to ask yourself in the mirror every day. Pass/do a kindness everyday. Strong and touching.'

author: b'Hans Mortl'
title: b'Average'
body: b"Having read the outstanding Harry Potter stories by the same author, I've been somewhat disappointed with this book. Most of the persons in this story are not quite believeable, the dialogue quite often extremely crude, yet the plot isn't bad."

author: b'raney'
title: b'Book club enjoyed it !'
body: b"Sorry, just couldn't get into it, but will try again when my mind isn't so cluttered.  My book club really enjoyed the book, so I'm sure that it is a good read."

author: b'yr'
title: b'unexpected'
body: b"I couldn't put it down. Difficult topics dealt with really well. Nobody wins. it is an insight about where we are heading to and if we will continue to be oblivious about our own lives"

author: b'Mike Issaev'
title: b'Deftly written, thematically wobbly'
body: b"I thought book as a whole revealed a conscious effort by Rowling to disassociate her writing from the more or less tame HP series; in that respect, the novel is undoubtedly successful. I can't deny enjoying the wit and style of the narrative and the acute insight into the nuanced social fabric of the town she creates."

author: b'Sujatha'
title: b'A big winding novel about a small town'
body: b'I picked up the novel after following the hype in the media; especially after Ms Rowling owned up to being the author.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Well written, but no happy endings here'
body: b"Casual Vacancy has a lot of characters and it takes a bit to sort everyone out. I was drawn into the book, but it felt like watching a train wreck, I just couldn't look away, and it left me sad and miserable. Technically the book is very well done, but I prefer a story with less reality."

author: b'Rae Bookgirl'
title: b'Just not up to her usual standard'
body: b'Found this one pedestrian to read, a bit of a downer.. Well enough written but just not a story to get your mind into.'

author: b'Maranda Cook'
title: b'bought as a gift'
body: b"I bought this for my brothrr-in-law for Christmas. He was so excited. He's been wanting to read this book. Great purchase :)"

author: b'Jeanie Wilson'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'It not like this subject matter, not my cup of tea.  Awaiting her newest novel and hope it is better'

author: b'EA, South America'
title: b'I had to keep a list of personnae...'
body: b'For the first third of the book, I had to make a written list of all the characters and their relationships.  They are introduced in an active mode - appearing first in one context, briefly, then reappearing later as related to other characters which have been introduced briefly in another context.  Anyway, it was well worth it.  Rowling clearly knows how to write a good book.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Gave up half way through'
body: b'I Kept waiting for this book to take off but it never did so I gave up half way through.'

author: b'Melissa Bowman'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Having read and enjoyed all of the Harry Potter books, I was almost afraid to pick up The Casual Vacancy out of fear of being disappointed.  However, I'm glad I did."

author: b'Cathy Elliott'
title: b'I really hated this book'
body: b'Did J.K. Rowling really write this trash?  What happened to her imagination?  What kind of people does she know that she filled this book with idiots.  I have to say that I only read two chapters and then had to ask myself, "Why am I reading this trash?" and I put it down and got rid of it quickly.  I was so disappointed but it makes me not want to read any other new things she puts out.  Not worth the paper it was printed on.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Almost hating it.'
body: b"I'm falling asleep between paragraphs.  There's not ONE likable character in this book. I don't give a fig about any of them and can't wait for the end of the book so I can find out if they all fall in a hole and disappear in Pagford.  Boooorrrringggg."

author: b'Kathi Kellenberger'
title: b'Interesting IT twist'
body: b'This is a great read, especially after about 50% in. Before that, I really had a difficult time keeping track of all the characters. I was tempted to start over and create a diagram of the characters and how they were linked. The really interesting thing for me was the lesson to be learned from bad website design. That is the driver for many critical events in the story.'

author: b'Linda'
title: b'I disliked everyone, except the dead guy!'
body: b'This book was a challenge to get through. The amount of characters to keep track of was overwhelming. Page after page the reader is introduced to more and more unlikeable, selfish, mean people. At some point, I felt like I would have to meet each and every horrible resident in Pagford. I disliked everyone, except the dead guy!'

author: b'Anne-Marie E. Nakhla'
title: b'Tedious and disappointing.'
body: b"I didn't make it past page 40. For an author who is so capable, this book was a huge disappointment. The characters were terrible, and the plot lacked any moral center."

author: b'Eileen'
title: b'Good Story'
body: b'This book really makes you take a hard look at our society, the good, the bad and the ugly. It is one that will have you pondering about your own role in your personal relationships and community interactions. Great characters, great underlying moral message.'

author: b'Ryan Crete'
title: b'great book'
body: b'JK Rowling was outstanding.  Book took many unexpected twists and kept me reading with out putting the book down.  Awesome ending!'

author: b'Idle Expatter'
title: b'Characters that stick with you; plot forgettable'
body: b'I did not expect to like this, let alone like it a lot. What better praise can one give a novel than "it surprised me"?'

author: b'Esther Stewart'
title: b'Real life story'
body: b"A bit depressing at times, but written very well and it's a real life story. I am looking forward to her next book."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Interesting read'
body: b'I felt that the characters were familiar. These were people I knew with all of their idiosyncrasies and faults. Very human.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A detailed read'
body: b"I'm a huge J.K. Rowling fan. I love how she creates worlds and the way she develops characters. With this book, I was skeptical because I had heard bad things about this book. When I finally got the book, I admit that I was disappointed by how slow and detailed the story was but by the middle of the book I was intrigued and by the end I loved it. The story develops at the pace it does to make sure the reader is ready for the end of the book. I recommend this story to others."

author: b'B. Petree'
title: b'Great characters'
body: b"Once again, Rowling gets lost in some of her characterizations.  This is not a bad thing, but I think with this book, she tried to make everyone so eccentric that the story itself suffered by comparison.  I've had a hell of a time finishing this one..."

author: b'Tracy in NY'
title: b'liked it'
body: b"i was wary after reading reviews, but agree if you keep in mind it's nothing like harry potter, i found it very enjoyable"

author: b'Mary Lou'
title: b'What Happened?'
body: b"Possibly the most depressing, unlikable book I've read in years.  There's not one character here to root for; even pity is hard to come by.  This book is all darkness with no light, no hope.  Why would anyone bother?  And it seems as if Rowling used superfluous vulgarities just to prove that she can.  What a disappointment."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Profound'
body: b"A brilliant book. Rowling's way of creating realistic characters is totally unmatchable. A very smooth read as well. I absolutely loved it."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Great Story!'
body: b"Wasn't certain I would like this especially since Harry Potter was so fabulous.  Great story - kept wanting to read more."

author: b'Happy'
title: b"Brilliant writer; and in case you didn't notice, this is not a sequel to Harry Potter"
body: b"This book is as brilliant as its author, for the same reasons that the HP series is so wonderful. There are many kids' fantasy series that will never outsell the Bible-- it is JK Rowling's genius that set HP apart. Many of the people who wrote bad reviews of this book seem to be mostly disappointed that this book is not another Harry Potter. So please, do not read, or review, this book from the mistaken notion that it should somehow mirror Harry Potter. It is a book for adults, which implies not just chronological age but also an assumption of maturity. Again, because so many people have made this mistake: this book is written by the author of Harry Potter, but it is not Harry Potter, so get over it."

author: b'Peter Jensen'
title: b'Great story, easy reading....'
body: b'Great descriptive novel.  Captures the characters and feeling of an English village/town situation wonderfully well.  Like the Potter stories, the characters are etched into your brain.  Recommended reading.'

author: b'Margo Crosthwaite'
title: b'Interesting Characters'
body: b'This is a very dark book to read,complex and depressed people interacting in a small village where gossip is rampant'

author: b'Deena'
title: b'A bit too complicated'
body: b"Although, the story consist of interesting characters and plots in the beginning it's a bit hard to familiarize oneself with the characters."

author: b'Eden Wales Freedman'
title: b'Dark, difficult, powerful.'
body: b'Rowling addresses dark themes in a realistic, heart-rending way. Those who did not like this book likely expect it to be another Harry Potter. It\'s not, although, like the HP series, *Casual Vacancy* also asks readers to confront evil. The evil that engage in its pages, however, is not "magical" but that which lies in our own communities (and in our own hearts). A difficult read but an important one.'

author: b'T. G. Gutheil'
title: b'Rowling keeps her edge'
body: b'Fabulous analytic narrative of small town British life, relationships and how they go wrong. Excellent writing level is maintained  throughout.'

author: b'TabH'
title: b'Unusual'
body: b"I love the Harry potter series & knew this would be nothing like it but I gave it a read.  Hands down most unusual book I've ever read. Several points when I wanted to give up on the book, but kept going for my love of the author. This was a very slow book & too many characters to keep track of, but after pushing through it became interesting. Worth the read if you are patient & have an open mind."

author: b'Peggy G. Stone'
title: b'Slow read'
body: b'I do not stop reading a book, but this one was not finished. I may pick it up again, may be not.'

author: b'John C. Trentelman'
title: b'Boring Characters'
body: b"Too many dull characters that don't move the story. Too slow a pace in plot.  Not worth keeping it on the Kindle."

author: b'Jasmyne Martinez'
title: b'Well,'
body: b"I still haven't finished this and I've had this book since it came out. It is a lot different from the Harry Potter series as she has said. I'll finish it one day. : )"

author: b'James P. Thompson, Jr.'
title: b'Can of worms!'
body: b'A crude convoluted arduous read .'

author: b'Jean'
title: b'Not her best'
body: b'The premise of the book was good, but it took to long to get to the heart of the story.  The message was pretty good, but it was hard to follow so many characters.'

author: b'K. Parker'
title: b'It should never have gone to print.'
body: b'I bought it because I loved the Harry Potter series. It was not the book I expected. I started to read it and had to put it down. Months later I started to read it again and put it down again. After the third failed attempt, where I forced myself deeper into the book, I put it down for the last time. I went out to read the book reviews and found that I agreed with the negative reviews more than the positive. I threw the book away.'

author: b'Jane B. Austen'
title: b'Forgettable'
body: b"If I finish a book and really like it the story stays with me. I can't even remember this one. I was hoping to love it."

author: b'M. Witteman'
title: b'EXCELLENT'
body: b"Ms Rowling continues her deft hand with writing. I have read both of her novels and enjoy her ability to write characters that are so well embodied that you don't always like them but find them immensely interesting."

author: b'Anissa Annalise'
title: b'Never Read Potter But I Liked This'
body: b'The only other Rowling book I\'ve read is "The Cuckoo\'s Calling" so I went into this one with both no other expectations than she\'d tell me a story with characters that I would find compelling. She absolutely did.'

author: b'Shannon'
title: b'Took awhile but I loved it in the end'
body: b"OK, I read it because it's JK and it took many pages to get into the story and care about the large number of characters. But by the end, JK had weaved her magic again on a story of a seemingly simple town in Britain. She's so great at writing real people, especially people you know. I can't wait to see what else she writes in the upcoming years."

author: b'Amarathine'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling'
body: b"In reading the other reviews, Harry Potter fans did not enjoy The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling.  Sadly to say I wasn't a Harry Potter fan; therefore, with no expectations from Rowling, I enjoyed this book.  The book deals with a reality that we try to facade with the perfect home, fancy clothes and the perception of having it all together in public.  Yet, as this book does, it takes you behind closed doors of many characters to show you the issues of the characters and how those issues flow into the lives of the people  around you whether you choose to interact with them or not.  I enjoyed learning about each of the characters in detail.  It does take a few chapters to keep all the characters straight but  by the end of the book you'll feel like part of each of the characters lives."

author: b'M.G.'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'If you expect this to be harry potter you will be disappointed.  If you read it for itself it is very enjoyable, well written, and interesting.  Kept me turning pages.  I loved the characters!'

author: b'Jonathan Robbins'
title: b'X-Ray of a Small Town'
body: b"It seems that people either really like, or really dislike, this book.  I fall into the positive camp - this was a book I read quickly and enjoyed quite a bit.  It reminded me, in a way, of Richard Russo's books in the way it takes a town and examines it and its inhabitants closely, never really feeling the need to desire to stray from the town's borders.  Everything, and everyone, the book needs is within the town's reach.  The book touches on lots of issues, some pretty and some not - poverty, disease, snobbery, politics, education to name a few.  It also takes a deep dive into a number of the characters' lives and examines the realities of every day life:  a man frozen by his fears, a woman held captive to her bad taste in men and her constant belief that she'll get her fairy-tale ending, an essentially good kid destroyed by the poverty and lack of guidance surrounding her, parents utterly unaware of the life their children lead, petty people effecting small cruelties that their small lives permit them.  It also beautifully illustrates how fundamentally one person can touch so many lives and cause a town to literally unravel when he passes away.  This is the stuff of life, and sometimes it is ugly, and petty - and sometimes beautiful and soaring.  We get to go along for the ride as people get sick and heal, succeed and fail, rise and fall.  By the end of the book, I really cared about some of the characters - and really disliked others for their smallness and cruelty.  But the fact that I cared (good or bad) shows the skill that Rowling brings to this book.  For only a gifted author can leave us caring so much, right?"

author: b'zagain'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"In the Casual Vacancy, Rowling turns her attention away from the wizard world of Harry Potter to the more adult focused small community of Pagford  where everyone knows everyone else.  The community is in the midst of a small civil war among its elected representatives as lines have been drawn between two sides who are debating whether or not the town should rid itself of the responsibility of a local housing project (called The Fields) and a connected drug treatment facility.  Readers of the Potter series will recognize Rowling's writing style in which she does an excellent job of handling multiple characters and weaving together several subplots in to the main direction of the novel.  Interestingly, there are some other parallels to her earlier work.  Like the Potter series which focused on a central dynamic figure, Harry, who the others rallied around, The Casual Vacancy has its own central player in Barry Fairbrother, the primary leader of the pro-Fields movement and an integral player in the lives of all the primary characters.  In an interesting twist, however (which is far from a spoiler), Barry dies suddenly in the first few pages of the novel, leaving the other characters to adapt and struggle with his absence.  While Barry departs the book early, his presence remains felt throughout the plot.  The elements of the book at times seem reminiscent of a soap opera with the various intrigues of the characters, however, it is an engaging story that is helped along by Rowling's solid style.  Overall, a good novel that falls a bit short of her previous (and astoundingly popular) works."

author: b'Cecilia Fernandes'
title: b"Missing Rowling's magic"
body: b"Rowling's Harry Potter books were such a delight to read, not only because of the story but mainly because of her writing style and story pace and richness of characters."

author: b'John R. Charles'
title: b'Gritty'
body: b'I did not read the Harry Potter books so I did not know what to expect when our book club chose this book.  Rowling introduces several characters very quickly and all of them are thoroughly unlikeable -- except for the one that dies as the story begins.  The teenagers hate their parents and the parents hate their children right back.  There are some interesting situations and the dialogue rings true but the only sympathetic characters are two of the teenagers.  A rather dark read.'

author: b'K. Regan'
title: b'Well...'
body: b"I'm a huge Harry Potter fan.  I had high hopes for this book but I only made through a couple of chapters before I lost interest."

author: b'Natalie B.'
title: b'Amazing!!'
body: b'She is one of the most gifted storytellers I have ever read, I recommend this book to anyone and everyone who enjoys reading.'

author: b'Frankie'
title: b'Frankie'
body: b'This is a wonderful book, it will make you think. So many things did not have to happen if only.... I wonder if this world will ever change. The Classes.'

author: b'Cheryl'
title: b'boring'
body: b"Bought this because of the author and I adored the Harry Potter series. I don't generally read fiction and this book disappointed me all around. I tried reading it...about 100 pages and it felt like the longest book ever. Then I gave up and deleted it from my kindle."

author: b'Vicki Bosch'
title: b'Difficult, but worth the effort.'
body: b'I had some problems keeping all the characters straight, but once I got that figured out, the story was fine. It was rather sad but really an interesting testament to strength of character (or lack thereof).'

author: b'N. Thompson'
title: b'Quietly Brilliant, Unflinching...Worth It'
body: b"After reading all the hype and negative reviews, I was reluctant to take a chance on this book. Even after the first 30 pages, I wasn't sure about it."

author: b'Laura'
title: b"I can't get past the name,"
body: b"The book might be very well written, the plot may be great. But to switch from Harry to Barry?! I can't get past it!"

author: b'Anne Keats'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"After so many children's books the author vented her frustration by the use of excessive obscenities and inane nonsense, ghastly"

author: b'Trekkie'
title: b'Had to stop reading'
body: b"This story just isn't interesting at all. I can't remember the last time I stopped reading a book half way through, but I certainly did with this one."

author: b'JHolmes'
title: b'Puerile writing, very slow development'
body: b"One of my friends convinced me to try reading this book. It's short enough I could have knocked it out in a day, but it took me a few weeks of failed starts to finally power my way through it."

author: b'Sas'
title: b'Meh'
body: b'I was NOT looking for the further adventures of Harry, Ron, & Hermione. I was, however, looking for a story that was as well-crafted and interesting.'

author: b'Dana J. Robinson'
title: b'Not her best work.'
body: b"I found this book to be rather boring and the store wasn't all that appealing.  I also listen to the book she wrote under a different name. It was even worse! J.K isn't writing like she did with Harry Potter!"

author: b'anonymous'
title: b'warning: profane language'
body: b'Love JK Rowling, but was appalled at the use of the profane language littered all of over the book.  Too many characters as well.  Could not even finish the book.'

author: b'Sanlock'
title: b'Review'
body: b'Disappointing and most unexpected from this author. Took quite a while to actually get all the characters in my head.'

author: b'Suestelle'
title: b'Spot on'
body: b'Characters were so realistic, I enjoyed each one. Dark and deeper than expected. One of my favorites  of the year.'

author: b'Alison McDonald'
title: b'Casual Vacancy - just too confusing'
body: b"'There is no doubt the author has great demand of the English, but unfortunately I found it very difficult to follow as there were just too many characters'."

author: b'lynnezi2'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This book has a very negative tone.  Heroes are primarily very unsatisfied teenagers with great angst toward live and dead parents.  I did quit the book after reading 1/4 of it and so I could be accused of giving it short shrift. Purchased from Amazon for Kindle and returned without refund.'

author: b'Jan Kellis'
title: b'Big book, small town'
body: b'With a vast cast of characters, The Casual Vacancy plunges the reader into the small town politics of Pagford, its slum area The Fields, and its bigger, brighter neighboring town of Yarvil.  The characters are all well-developed, and even the most vile are, on some level, understandable.  Anyone who lives in a small town will recognize the facade vs. undercurrent of truth.'

author: b'Jane Ryan'
title: b'Very entertaining read.'
body: b"This book provokes laughter and tears,  It is a poignant look at the human foilbles which affect us all.  I would recommend this book to anyone trying to work around the intricacies of local government for the good of the community.  This can be an exhausting and complicated process.  This book allows us to take time out for a humorous, realistic look at ourselves.  Life is complicated, isn't it?"

author: b'Agnes Well'
title: b'Wasted time and money'
body: b'A huge disappointment! Boring plot. Political correctness all over the place. Poorly constructed. Characters have little or no redeeming qualities.'

author: b'Stretch'
title: b'I was tempted to rate it lower. Not sure ...'
body: b'I was tempted to rate it lower. Not sure what I expected from this book, but surely not what I ran across. Truthfully stated, I read part of it, lost interest, and set it aside to read something else. No real suspense, at least not to the part where I set it down.'

author: b'k Brady'
title: b'excellent adult read'
body: b"Read all my daughter's Harry potter books, really enjoyed them. Great to move on to a splendid groin-up adult book."

author: b'Arnold Camus Mas'
title: b'I really loved it.'
body: b'I really love the story. Maybe some people was expecting a Harry Potter-related story. The caracthers are like taken from real life.'

author: b'mike  brien'
title: b'An interesting read from one of the best  authors to date .'
body: b"It,s an interesting story about a made up town, but it,s so typically  British , the characters hold your interest from  the first page.  It would appeal more to the British  market .  [i bought it on Amazons USA ] .  The further you read the more you want to know , what's afoot ."

author: b'Julie Marrs'
title: b"Couldn't get into this one at all."
body: b'A real let-down after her Harry Potter books.  I realize it is a totally different genre, which I was expecting, but I could not get engaged at all with this book.  Very disappointed.'

author: b'Hilary Lorraine'
title: b"Great writing, but I couldn't care about the characters."
body: b"I am sure the story might have gotten my interest if I had pursued it. Rowling is a good writer.  But I just couldn't care about any of the characters. Shallow aimless and pained people no longer interest me. Sorry."

author: b'Gail Fox'
title: b'Book group selection.'
body: b'Poorly written, disgusting and unappealing descriptions with too much information.  Does she hate her characters or just want the reader to hate them?  None of us liked or will recommend the book. ( we are 14 retired readers.)'

author: b'Nefarious Oldman'
title: b'Not for All Harry Potter Fans'
body: b"As a Harry Potter/JK Rowling fan, I will buy anything she writes, but I absolutely couldn't stand this book at all. It was painful to read and I had to stop about 1/4 of the way through it. I'm not saying it is horrible writing. It just didn't appeal to me. I miss Harry Potter."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"So Many People Can Judge, They Can't Produce."
body: b"I didn't read this yet.  It gets five stars, just because, the amount of judgmental folk who have knocked down a brave creative mind, someone who is willing to do something different.  Shame on the negative people - I feel bad for you.  What was the last item of creative art you produced?  Just wondering...."

author: b'Dhuha Tawil'
title: b'J.K. Rowling is a woman who knows how to write.'
body: b'J.K Rowling is an amazing writer. She can capture the essence of a character and make you remember them long after you finished her book. However, I wish she could write about more powerful female characters...broken homes and men who are "the chosen ones" seems to be an ongoing theme.'

author: b'Brian Murray'
title: b'Book review'
body: b'The story was not too bad but the language was atrocious.It is not worth nine more words to be quite honest'

author: b'exercise hopeful'
title: b'fun read'
body: b'clever and intriguing- moved along well- the review requires a certain amount of works to be accepted and I said it all in less.'

author: b'CHarp'
title: b'Too Hard to get into this story.'
body: b'I just could not get into this story.  There were too many characters for me.  I will try another time, maybe but I got bored and put it down.'

author: b'izik'
title: b'Far from previous books'
body: b"Got me hooked by the first chapter, did not enjoy the rest. Really far from harry Potter books, I'm a little disappointed."

author: b'T.M. Patron'
title: b'A different road taken'
body: b'I had heard this was a different road taken by the author. In constructing real life, I found her character construction true to my life experience with the intertwining of emotions, attitudes, self justifications along with small town politics an interesting; albeit emotionally difficult read.  While not a happily ever after ending, it offers hope that individuals can make a difference in small ways.'

author: b'Jo Mardis'
title: b'Well written but not a feel-good book'
body: b'For literary merit, it was top-notch, with especially interesting character development. However, there was a dark, almost cynical approach toward humanity, even the least fortunate.  The book was too raw and edgy, perhaps, for my taste--prefer to view humankind in a kinder, gentler way!'

author: b'Susan'
title: b'Unwanted truths'
body: b'Not what I expected,  but very good writing and a very profond message.  Exposes parts of politics and relationships we try not to see or acknowledge.'

author: b'Doris A. Maley'
title: b'Disappointing book, not worth the time and effort to read'
body: b"I did not care for this book.  I did not finish it as it didn't hold my interest.  Disappointing.  She writes well but this book is difficult to follow.  Others in my book club agreed with me on this book."

author: b'fred zamon'
title: b'A real gem in a new style for Rowling'
body: b'I loved this book- and was sad to see it end- I hope it becomes a series- very different than authors well know works- but very good in a new way.'

author: b'F. Barrett'
title: b'Goings on in the Village'
body: b'Great book, so much going on with so many people in the village. Could not put it down. Recommend it.'

author: b'RAB'
title: b'This Book Is Not  About a Town Election'
body: b"Nobody is safe in comfortable surroundings with Rowling's raw tale of Krystal Weedon, a teenager from the wrong side of town, whose story is told not only in her words and actions, but in those of her friends, enemies,  teachers,  counselors and adult detractors.  Read this book, and you will never look at poverty, addiction, and broken families in the same way."

author: b'KD'
title: b'Love the writer, not so this book.'
body: b"Didn't care for this book and the reason is, I like to read for entertainment as well as education.  There has to be something inspiring with the uninspiring.  Not so with this book.  There were no real likable characters.  Sad because I know JK Rowling is a wonderful writer, but when I am not looking forward to reading, I look for another book."

author: b'loves2read'
title: b'Deep Muggle'
body: b"This is not Harry Potter - in fact I'm not a huge HP fan.  I love this book though. Rowling is fierce, honest, and insightful."

author: b'Clare Heron'
title: b'A fast moving eveyday story - very much in touch with relatity'
body: b'It is a fast moving story that could apply to any community with typical characters that are found everywhere.  I loved that they were so real and not polished perfect.  A really good read'

author: b'Larry Lippow'
title: b'Microcosm of known and unknown interelations of life experiences among friends and/or colleagues'
body: b"It took awhile to understand the relationships among all the characters; however, once you understand the dynamics involved, it is an interesting but sad story.  It is interesting how one man's death impacts so many people in unexpected ways.  It also makes one ponder the many challenges/struggles in people's lives that are not evident from appearance only."

author: b'Diane'
title: b'JK Rowling for Adults.'
body: b'She can really cast her spell and she did it in this book.  I remember thinking it was well worth the read and recommended to others.'

author: b'Julie A. Gelsinger'
title: b'thought-provoking novel'
body: b'A great, serious read. This is not fluff. This is life in all its absurdity, vileness, and hopefulness. Read it.'

author: b"Kerry's"
title: b'unexpected twist gains attention'
body: b'The harsh reality of teenager life in a complex world of selfish adults. The plot uncovers the boredom of life in an English village where there is a reluctance to accept social issues, instead opting for a false set of values that disintegrate when the only real person dies.'

author: b'Robert B. Glickman'
title: b'good read'
body: b'This was a lot better than Cuckoos calling.  It was very interesting and we got to see another side of this great author'

author: b'Pat'
title: b'A Disappointment'
body: b'I read this book because I had enjoyed the Potter series so much. I was very disappointed because of the rough language. I had to stop reading it. I read a John Grisham book and then came back to to finish Casual Vacancy only because I bought it.'

author: b'Nola'
title: b'Fabulous read!'
body: b'I really enjoyed this book.  I love anything set in England and could picture the little town the book was set in. All the families had their twists and turns and real life was exposed as all wanted to fill " the vacancy". Beautifully written as only J K Rowling knows how to!'

author: b'Heidi'
title: b'Not what I was expecting.'
body: b'Boring, boring, boring, boring.... WHAT?!?  This book was depressing and uninteresting, but I forced myself to finish it and then was rather upset that I did.  I realize that this was an attempt to branch out, and I do typically read adult novels.  I just do not recommend this one.'

author: b'Stanley Crowe'
title: b"you'll laugh, you'll cry, you won't put it down . . .BUT . . ."
body: b"Strengths: The multiple plots are very deftly interwoven, and there are elements of suspense in each and elements of suspense throughout that make you want to keep reading. The writing is clear and straightforward, not particularly elegant, but it doesn't get in the way."

author: b'Casey'
title: b"just in case you didn't realize that JKR is actually an amazing writer"
body: b'I very much did not know what to expect going into this book, but I was impressed by just the first few pages. I\'m a huge Harry Potter fan, but it was never the writing itself that enthralled me, but rather the plotting and the characters. Within a few pages of The Casual Vacancy there were several turns of phrases where I sat back and thought, "Wow. Wow, she\'s a really good writer."'

author: b'Justin Winokur'
title: b'Very character driven and not all that amazing'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy follows the lives of a few families in a small England town. When a well-liked local councilman dies, the fight for his seat becomes the primary plot point. At issue is the fate of a not-so-good area of town, The Fields, and whether the local community should cast it off.'

author: b'Suzanne DeGReeff'
title: b'Nothing like the Potter series'
body: b'I enjoyed this book - it was a bit depressing but well written and engaging. Looking forward to more work from J.K. Rowling'

author: b'A. Carter'
title: b'No Fancy Review...just my humble opinion.'
body: b'Ok Folks, from a housewife who just loves to read.....here is MY simple review of The Casual Vacancy.  I really enjoyed it.  I found it very thought provoking and real.  It is a look into the lives of several families who are affected by the death of a prominent counsel member.  J. K. Rowling created well rounded characters and intertwined them beautifully.  Sometimes I thought the book was funny, sometimes it was sad, sometimes confusing, shocking, and while some reviewers felt that the end was predictable, I did not see it coming.  I enjoyed seeing the characters evolve, even though it took them, especially the adults, to the END of the book to make positive changes.  I found the story line very real and dealing with issues that are happening in todays world.  I read that many of the reviewers found it too dark and depressing, and felt that J. K. Rowling was attempting to be edgy by throwing in all of these hot button issues....I disagree with that.  The issues in this book, found in this community, are issues found in most communities whether one cares to believe that or not.'

author: b'Donna Pedersen'
title: b"I can't believe the same person that wrote the amazing HP series wrote this piece of trash."
body: b"If you have to use profanity to make your point, it wasn't a very strong point. Each page makes the point weaker and weaker."

author: b'MaySkies'
title: b'Big Let Down- Very Depressing'
body: b"I knew this book was going to be different then Harry Potter so I dove in with an open mind.....Wow very disappointed. Even if I didn't know the author I would not have enjoyed this book. There were very few likeable characters and I felt depressed reading this book! I read a lot of books, at least one or two a week and am usually very lenient. I did finish the book but did not feel any better by doing so. I do not recommend this book. If you are debating do not waste your money, if you feel you must read go to your library. It was not worth the money I spent."

author: b'Debra Steiger'
title: b'Author could have done better'
body: b"I did not read the HP series, but had high hopes for work by the author.  I found J.K. Rowling's writing to be just on the edge of very good.  But, she is much too good of an author to have to resort to profanity.  The story might have held my interest, but the profanity was mis-placed and unnecessary to the story or the characters.  I didn't finish the book simply because it didn't hold my interest.  I do believe this author can do better, much better."

author: b'Denise Shea'
title: b'not interesting'
body: b'i found the book very boring it did not hold my interest and i found myself skimming much of the time'

author: b'Dennis Brown'
title: b'Not very good'
body: b'This story is very dark. Not as entertaining at all. I finished it in hopes that there would be something to lighten it, but it was a waste of time. J. K. Rowling should go back to stories like Harry Potter.'

author: b'Jennifer Pye Gebbie'
title: b'Sad story'
body: b'Well written but very sad. If you are very happy with your lot in life and need a literary depressant, this book is for you. However, it could work the other way. If you\'re really depressed you could read this book and think, "Well, could be worse  At least I\'m not a meth addict..."'

author: b'Breathe to Read'
title: b'a very real book'
body: b'I love this book. It is gritty and honest and shows a real depth of understanding of the characters and issue of living in a small community. As a high school teacher I can say that Rowling "gets" young people - a rare thing these days as our adolescents are so rapidly changing. She has shown a depth and breadth to her writing that consolidates her position as a genuine and serious author. A great read - extremely well written.'

author: b'Jason LaMoy'
title: b"Stick to what you're good at"
body: b"Stick to what you're good at. This was a waste of my time and yours, there is a reason it is already half off."

author: b'catlvr14'
title: b'not for me'
body: b'I wanted to read this book only because it was written by J.K. Rowling. I love the Harry Potter books and was interested to see her book written for adults.'

author: b'Xinjun Wang'
title: b'Well-crafted, a classic of tomorrow'
body: b'This resonated for long after I finished it. HP is a hard act to follow but The Casual Vacancy worked for me. I loved how nearly every character had flaws and secrets. I loved the authenticity of the voices from every age and class. I hope JKR has some more adult novels in the works.'

author: b'Ms Jean E Martin'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy.'
body: b'I have not quite finished the book at this time. I felt it took a while to get into the story.  But it "grows" on you.'

author: b'Alan McLay'
title: b'A different story to what the author usually writes.'
body: b'An interesting build up to a story. Asked on characters and a limited story line. A good mystery out of the authors usual mould.'

author: b'Weasel'
title: b'loved it'
body: b'All I can add to the posts already up there is that I\'m one of the people who loved this novel. Extremely well developed characters -- I "know" some of them in "real life". The plot is not at all what kept me solidly engrossed -- it was the characters. Couldn\'t put it down.'

author: b'Leslie F'
title: b'Good insights into social structures of England, NOT Harry Potter....'
body: b'So, certainly not written in any similiar style as the Harry Potter series, very complex stories interwoven but at the end of the book, it was almost a "who" cares...I just didn\'t feel a connection with the characters.  It is an interesting read and a view into probably the social issues within England between the have and have nots, that part was very interesting, not so different from the US.  Just didn\'t think the character development was on par with the Harry Potter books where you really felt you got to know and care about them.'

author: b'Andy Moon Wilson'
title: b'Snooze Fest'
body: b'The first 3/4 of the book was laying the groundwork and was tedious to say the lease.  It picked up speed near the end and neatly tied up all the loose ends'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'This is something entirely different!'
body: b"Gritty, real, heartbreaking and completely engaging. This book is so far from the simple entertainment of the Harry Potter books that I wouldn't have believed it was the same author."

author: b'Don Seymour'
title: b'Read it'
body: b'The woman is a genius. Hard to believe, when so many others fail to make it in an new genre, she could do this. A great read that makes the politics of a small village intriguing and interesting.'

author: b'Jane'
title: b'Depressing'
body: b"As a huge Harry Potter fan I was definitely disappointed in this book. It makes for an extremely depressing read. Everything that can go wrong seems to go wrong with the inhabitants of Pagford. It is extremely unrealistic. No one town can have so much bad luck. I think JK Rowling should stick to writing children's books."

author: b'Megan Stewart'
title: b'Great Book in a Different Genre Than Expected'
body: b"About the book - it gets a bit windy in parts of it. Not for her usual children's audience. But if you are an adult, STICK WITH IT and read the whole thing. The way it all ties together in the end is genius, obviously."

author: b'margaret dearing'
title: b"Awful - don't buy it."
body: b"Very hard to get into. I was half-way thru the book, and all the sub-plots were still not making sense. I couldn't even finish this book it was so bad. Her other book, The Cuckoo's Calling, is much better."

author: b'Linda'
title: b'Far from Harry Potter ....'
body: b'Being a HARRY POTTER fanatic (and a grandma of 5) I was very excited at the prospect of reading her first "Adult" novel. But actually, in my opinion, the incredible Harry Potter journey (so intricately and brilliantly woven from Book 1 to Book 7) is definitely not just for children, but most certainly also for any discerning adult. The Casual Vacancy - though well written and quite clever - was not riveting. It was "dark" and not very enjoyable. Such a pity!  I have always been convinced that J.K. Rowlings is a pure genius, and she can deliver far better than this book.'

author: b'Desiree'
title: b'Enjoyable'
body: b'I really enjoyed this book, I have recommended it to friends and family.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Not what I expected'
body: b"This book is very different from Rowling's previous books. I'm a big Potter fan and was excited to read the new book. I was disappointed with the book for the first hundred pages. Won't disclose why so not to spoil it but it was not what I was expecting but Rowling didn't disappoint with the ending. Left me satisfied as I expected she would. Not as good as the Harry Potters but still a decent read."

author: b'Mavourneen Davis'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I thought this book was supposed to be written for adults.  I believe it is more suited to late teen years.'

author: b'Suzanne J Kilcommons'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b'Felt it a little slow to begin compared with the pace at end. Lots of characters to keep track of. But still thoroughly readable.'

author: b'Stephanie'
title: b'Boring with unlikable characters....'
body: b'I never could get into the book. It switches back and forth between so many different characters and nothing really exciting happens. None of the characters were very likable so I had a hard time caring what happened to them. Eventually I gave up finishing the book. I  expected better from J. K. Rowling.'

author: b'WZ Kid'
title: b'Not cut out for adult novels'
body: b"This is definitely the worst book I have read by this author. I bought the book and tried to read it only to get discouraged by falling asleep. I should tell you, I am someone who reads 2 books a month so this is odd for me. I then tried to listen to this book on tape. Awful! The narrator is fine, but dear god the language in this book is ultimately uncalled for. JK has an entire chapter dedicated to a teenage boy thinking about a porn he had watched... and detailed it. I think she was trying to be seductive but this book was a bore with disgusting, overly long, paragraphs of images even adults don't want to read about. I have read every other book she has written and wasn't as offended as this one. Stick to children's books my friend, you are just not cut out for adult novels."

author: b'michael j king'
title: b'dissapointing'
body: b'difficult to follow charactures -- crudity -- boring -- I half paused half way thro it which shows how much it captured my attention'

author: b'Marie'
title: b'Wonderful Book!!'
body: b"There were a lot of people who did not like this book and I can't understand why. It was an amazing story of a whole town and instead of learning about just one person you got to learn about all the different people who made the town and how it came together. Yes it was sad, but it looked at the town in a whole new perspective. In the beginning of the book J.K Rowling introduces a lot of different people, but that isn't any different from Agatha Christie, and Joyce Carol Oates. They both introduce a lot of people in their novels as well, and it does make it hard to get everyone straight at first. I will admit that I was going back and finding the initial introduction to make sure that I had the right person but afterwards I found this book to be wonderful."

author: b'Earthstone'
title: b'disappointed'
body: b'not up to the quality of the Harry Potter books - the story line is totally disappointing.  Her grammar and use of language is great, as usual, but this book is a dud.'

author: b'gram2-2'
title: b'The Casual vacancy'
body: b"This is definitely not a Harry Potter story.This one's for the adults who were waiting so patiently for Rowling' s latest literary masterpiece. It's more like some other authors' work,actually.P.D.James or some other dark noir author. The story line is adult but about teens inter- actions and sad family life.Also about the adults in their small community who are considered hypocrites by the children,and by each other.It's a sad story all the way around with everyone's secrets being spilled by  other people.The culprits turn out to be their own family members.Petty jealousies,mental illness,deep-seated senseless cruelty all take center stage in this novel about the human condition."

author: b'Amanda Jackson'
title: b'Good and bad'
body: b"I was definitely hooked, and I didn't even realize it until I was half way through.  I did like it. A lot. Even though the characters were a bit difficult I was able to keep them organized in my mind after a short while."

author: b'Rosemary Amodeo'
title: b"It's Complicated."
body: b'This book is very long and the prose is somewhat difficult to read in certain parts.  I would not recommend this book to anyone who wants an easy read.'

author: b'Gerry L'
title: b'Not about Harry Potter, but a good read and good description of village life in the U.K.'
body: b'Perfect story - kept me interested until the final pages.  Recommend it for its descriptive passages and good story line'

author: b'Gregory Francis'
title: b'How does the death of one person impact a community?'
body: b'As many others have stated, this is not Harry Potter or the world that he lives in. This is a world much closer to reality and can be very painful to read at times. That said, I really enjoyed it. For me, all of the characters felt real in their own way, although at times they could border on caricature. Each of the characters (and there are many of them) saw the world in a slightly different way and responded to the world in a different way. Some of the characters you learn to despise, others you want to root for, and some you just have to wonder what made them the way they are.'

author: b'Andrew Greensfelder'
title: b'Wonderful journey with magical children and the dark sides of grownups.'
body: b"Plenty of reviews so I'll be brief and cover perhaps some different angles. The heroes of this book are the children. The only praiseworthy adult dies in the first few pages the rest of the story allows us to appreciate him. While the book shows the many adults' dark sides, we suspect (hope) they have some redeeming features. Ms Rowling merely gives us the pleasure of living with their ids, as Freud would call their dark streams of consciousness."

author: b'Maggail'
title: b'Made Me Laugh, Made Me Cry'
body: b'This was a wonderful book! The characters were well rounded and the story complex. The story had been told at a leisurely pace, but the end felt hurried and "there now it\'s done!" attitude.  Everything was tied up, but I was a  little disappointed by it\'s brevity. Will certainly look forward to her next adult book.'

author: b'Beth61'
title: b"Couldn't finish"
body: b"Ugh.  I couldn't even get past the first 80 pages because I was too disinterested.  It was really hard to figure out who the characters were and what their relationship was to each other.  Maybe if I had continued, I would have like it.  Loved the Harry Potter series but just got bored with this one."

author: b'Kenlah0406'
title: b'Masterful writing'
body: b'J.K. Rowling is truly a master of capturing the nature of what it means to be human on the page.  Every nuance of emotion is all there.  Her characters are complex and they came fully to life for me when reading this book.  Yes people, it is no wonder the book is 500 pages!  She weaves this tale deftly, though there is a large cast of characters and not one thread is broken.  She is also a genius when it comes to WHAT to reveal and conceal and WHEN to reveal and conceal.  This truly makes her an expert storyteller.'

author: b'Lloyd Bever'
title: b'Book Revies'
body: b"Not as interesting a book as many of J.K. Rowling's past editions. J. K. Rowling's books such as the Harry Potter series were very creative and enjoyable reading"

author: b'John Carter'
title: b'Sadly terrible'
body: b'Vacant pointless tedious. How could this be? I read every Harry Potter - twice - what happened JK? Her next one is quite a bit better.'

author: b'Donna R. Kleintjes'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"I was really disappointed in this book.  It could have done without the excessive foul language.  I hope Ms. Rowling doesn't continue in this vein."

author: b'Mollie Sue'
title: b'Hard to put down'
body: b"Rowling's character development is superb and the woman does know how to work with words.  It's not the best book I've ever read, but it's a far cry from the worst.  This book is hard to put down because the characters are so despicable and you're anxious to find out what mess they're going to get into next.  I wondered if readers took potshots at the book just because it was Rowling.  ."

author: b'Nancy R. Wilson'
title: b'Good read.'
body: b'This is a very good book.  She has a great depth of understanding of human nature.  Much enjoyed by me and my swimming pool group.'

author: b'Sharon Fries'
title: b'I Miss Harry'
body: b"I was sad that this book was so negative.  Life can't always be an adventure or have a happy ending but this book is just depressing."

author: b'Ana Maria Chai Chong'
title: b'Magnificent!'
body: b'One of the best books I have ever read. If you enjoy British literature this is a must read. In most novels, the hero is all good and the villain is all bad. Rowling exposes the reality that there are devils and angels in all of us and celebrates our humanity in this wonderful novel.'

author: b'kaylee schubenski'
title: b'Loved it!!'
body: b"Rowling, as always, delivers with her beautiful style of writing. This plot wouldn't work at all if it wasn't for the omniscient viewpoint, it makes it much more interesting. I give 5 stars, it had me hooked from the beginning. A juicy plot line with a shocking ending."

author: b'Jo-Ann Harper'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b"What a confusing mess of characters! We read it for our Book Club for November and the general consensus was that it stunk. It was hard to read and keep all the characters straight in your mind since quite a few had nicknames (more than one) and she used them differently in the same paragraph so at times you couldn't figure out about whom she was talking."

author: b'cassy'
title: b'meh..'
body: b'did not enjoy. waited whole book for something to happen. i seem to have missed the point of the story. depressing'

author: b'Lauren'
title: b'Good read!'
body: b"I initially heard very mixed reviews about this book, but being a Harry Potter fan, I had to see what J.K. Rowling's non-Harry work was like. She did not disappoint! Many of the characters are easy to relate to and the story captures the struggles of people of all different ages, which makes the book that much more interesting. I read this book over six months ago and I still find myself wondering what happened to some of the characters."

author: b'Vicki Mattingly'
title: b'Causual Vacancy'
body: b"I did not finish this book -- I was so disappointed --- was expecting more from J K Rowling.  Don't understand what happened with this one."

author: b'xylon2'
title: b"very hard beginning, couldn't put it down by the end"
body: b'I started this book months ago, and had to put it down and read lighter fun books in between, but after the 1/2 way mark of this book, I got really interested. In the end I could not put this book down. It was full of amazing connections that J K Rowling is so good at. It is sad, and I cried but I loved it. It made me think about the town and its characters and their lives. I only regret that I do not know anyone who has read this book and I have no one to talk to about it. I was a total fan of Harry Potter, and I was disappointed that this book was so different, but after putting my time into this book I ended up just glued to the pages. I was tempted to rate this with 5 stars, because I just loved the 2nd 1/2 so much, but the 1st half was so depressing and hard to read, that I could really only give it a 4 star rating. I look forward to more books from J K Rowling. I feel she is so very talented and has many more stories to tell. This book is not for everyone, but if you can make it through the first 1/2, you will not be disappointed by the end.'

author: b'Jim Klepper'
title: b'disappointing'
body: b'I was so disappointed in this book.  I enjoyed all of her harry potter books so much.  Too many characters with too many problems!!  The only good thing about the book was our book club had a good discussion!!!!!  Such unhappy people!'

author: b'Barbara Weissenberger'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'Disappointing novel from this great author. Too many characters not fully developed and none that were engaging enough to sustain my interest in a slow moving plot.'

author: b'delwyn mudgway'
title: b'poor'
body: b"rowling needs to stick to writing for teenagers.  This book is all about teenages angst.  Hasn't decided if she is writing for adults yet or still stuck in the Harry Potter age group.  All in all, quite pathetci"

author: b'Toni van Rijen'
title: b'Refreshing and interesting'
body: b'Her writing was refreshing and interesting and I kind of enjoyed the story even though it felt like I was reading a television series where not a lot was happening but I was slowly being drawn in to the characters lives and personalities. I was kept intrigued and absorbed although I was prepared to dislike this book. However I have to say that I actually enjoyed it. And yes, I would definitely recommend it.'

author: b'Mags'
title: b'A truly great read!'
body: b"Although The Casual Vacancy is a view of life through a jaundiced eye, it's brilliantly written and the characters are sharp and  the story, while confronting, is beautifully unfolded.  I haven't read any of the Harry Potter series and I imagine people who pick up 'The Casual Vacancy' thinking it might belong in the same genre  might be quite shocked as this is adult fiction, raw, gritty and in your face.  Can't wait to read more of her adult fiction."

author: b'Maggie'
title: b'Not for me'
body: b"A big let down after the Harry Potter Series.  It was very difficult to get started and I didn't care for the story line.  What else can I say."

author: b'Colleen J. Nicholson'
title: b'Not Harry Potter!'
body: b'I liked her Harry Potter stories but am very put off on her "adult" stories.  I will find other authors for that.'

author: b'Alexis Clark'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b'I think that the book was kind of confusing. Besides that I think that the book was a really good one. You never knew what was going to happen next. It also had some suspense to it as well.'

author: b'Dolina'
title: b'not worth your time'
body: b'I have read about two thirds of this book, but have decided that life is too short to spend any more time on it.  Rowling is a good writer, but I am tired of the unrelenting depiction of despicable, stupid and degenerate human beings.  The book is not entertaining, nor does it instruct or edify.'

author: b'Carol Sulli'
title: b'A rare disappointment'
body: b'Let me start by saying I have loved every book written by J.K. Rowling until....  This book still has her wonderful way with words, but with so little point in this dirgy drama.  The story was oh so tiresome, populated with every form of loser.  The only character not a complete waste of plasma was dead by page 5.  As social commentary, I thought it was a failure.  Sorry Ms. Rowling.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Slogging through it'
body: b"Too many characters with too many nicknames.  I am halfway through and don't know yet if there is a plot."

author: b'DAE'
title: b'Well, You Ask for More Realism'
body: b"Several people that I know were complaining about this book, so I had to read it to see what the hoopla was about. I read the book and listened to it on Playaway. I have never read Harry Potter, therefore I really didn't have any particular expectation about Rowling's writing style. I expected the writing to be decent and when it exceeded that expectation, I was glad. I enjoyed the layers that each character had, and the fact that I could clearly visualize each character as a full fledged individual and not a cardboard cutout."

author: b'Anita Colman'
title: b'A Great Read!'
body: b'Could not put this down! Great plot, characters and writing-full of wit and irony. There were a few plot developments that seemed'

author: b'Elizabeth Wyatt'
title: b'great characters, well drawn'
body: b"A slice of life explored with understanding. Small town tensions and rivalries create tension and laughter. The pace is kept alive with movement and the intricate personal struggles of the characters' interaction."

author: b'Annette'
title: b'Synopsis on Contemporary Life'
body: b'Yes, it does have 30 characters and it is 500 pages long, but the complexity of the human situations are what make it so good.  Although it takes place in England, it could be a small town in any western country with a view of class conflict, child abuse, adoption, marraige, love relationships, and small town petty politics.  Well worth every page!'

author: b'Journalism Teach'
title: b'Not for kids!'
body: b'This is my first digital book. I have the hard copy as well. It was so much easier to pack the tablet for a trip than the book.'

author: b'E. Noller'
title: b'Rowling should not have bothered!'
body: b'I read this for my book club and that was the only reason I managed to finish it. I felt the character development was poor, probably because there were so many characters in the book. It was poorly written, poorly edited and the plot really did not interest me at all. The only person in the town that I even remotely cared about did not fare well at the end. I almost felt as if this was a book the Rowling wrote years ago, before the Potter series, and decided to publish it based on her success.'

author: b'Fayetta P. Weaver'
title: b'captivating and disturbing'
body: b'Captivating and disturbing view of a community of flawed, believable characters.  Not only did I hate the ending, but I hated the book to end!'

author: b'Clare Lonnon'
title: b'Disappointment in reading a J.K. Rowling book'
body: b'I found this difficult to read and could not do so without a dictionary beside me, which slowed down the reading process. The story line left me cold regarding the destructive  attitudes of the characters, and the sexual approach to the younger ones. I know that I am naive regarding the youth of today. I have not read any Harry Potter Books but have seen the movies, and I find the violence in todays movies aimed at the youth is overwhelming. e.g. The hunger games.  It is no wonder we are going to hell in a hand basket.'

author: b'Ron Palmer'
title: b'Great story. Small town at its worst or best'
body: b'I enjoyed it. A good page turner. Small town shown at its worst. Great characters and vey believable. Rowling at her best'

author: b'A. W. France'
title: b'I am glad Rowlings is now writing for adults too.'
body: b'JK Rowlings is an excellent author, perhaps inspiring.  Everything about this book worked.  The basic premises are unsual but  believable.  Her character development works gradually and seamlessly with moments of shrewd insights.  She makes nuanced observations of economic and social class that perhaps reflect personal learning from living in both poverty and great wealth.  I hope she keeps writing...I find I am waiting for her next book the way my kids and grandkids waited for the next Harry Potter book.'

author: b'Stephanie O.'
title: b"Can't I review less than 1 star?"
body: b"I finished the book only because it was our book club selection and I was the moderator for this selection. It seemed this novel never really took off. I couldn't keep the characters straight because they were so unremarkable and poorly developed. None of them had redeemable traits. I wasn't attached to any of them. Even with a predictable tragedy in the end- or maybe because of it- I do NOT recommend you waste any time on this."

author: b'Kristin'
title: b'fantastic!'
body: b"This was an amazing book! I loved all the Harry Potter books and this one didn't disappoint. It's not a very uplifting book but was extremely well written and totally draws you in. I liked how there was no main protagonist or antagonist. Everyone had their good/bad qualities which is what made them so real! I've recommended it to all my friends!"

author: b'C.'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling'
body: b'I am half way through this novel by J.K. Rowling. It is terrific. I have to force myself to stop reading it at night and get some sleep.'

author: b'Mike'
title: b"Pretty Good Book. Recommend reading but don't think it is a clsssic."
body: b'I generally enjoyed the book, although most of the time it seemed like I was reading a soap opera.  The characters, while reasonably well developed, were so obviously flawed that it was difficult for me to see them as real.  I think that the flaws in most people are more subtile but those flaws can still be very damaging to their relationships with their families and with society.'

author: b'Charles Bayne'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b'Wow, Ms. Rowling has come a long way from Harry Potter.  Her new "adult" book has all the dirty talk of policemen and others, some sex, and a most interesting story, to salvage my review.  You can enjoy the book, but be prepared for a totally different kind of characters, plot, and esp. dialog. I don\'t remember all the details of the book, but my impression is of a very adult, strong language, type of book.  If language does not bother you, then go ahead and enjoy it.'

author: b'Gillian Wells'
title: b'Comment'
body: b"Very good story, but too many characters.  Reading on a Kindle, it's hard to flick back to see who is who!!!"

author: b'1075'
title: b'Not worth the time'
body: b'I had a hard time remembering who each character was - with the exception of the teen-aged boy, they all blended together as little people with big egos!'

author: b'Mar'
title: b"It's no Harry Potter"
body: b'This book is awful, it is crude and vulgar.  I stopped reading it and will not finish.  It is pure garbage.  DO NOT GIVE THIS BOOK TO YOUR CHILDREN!'

author: b'Lawrence Baxter'
title: b'Fabulous post-Harry novel'
body: b'There was a good deal of controversy surrounding JK Rowling\'s first foray into "non-Harry Potter" fiction.  Partly, if I recall correctly, this was because residents in various towns who eagerly imagined that the novel\'s primary setting, Pagford, was modeled on them took offense at the characterizations and insinuations in the novel.  I thought Rowling captured, albeit in the novelists\' traditional concentrated format, a wonderful range of characters, pride, hypocrisies and great tragicomic denouements, that were all entirely believable and well painted.  The book builds carefully, in Rowling\'s splendid facility with the English language, into a crescendo of disaster and comeuppances that kept me enthralled and amused to the last page.  I have no doubt that Rowling has proved herself as masterful in character and plot development outside the world of Hogwarts and in our equally jumbled "real world."'

author: b'J. J. Woodcock'
title: b'A CASUAL 500 PAGES ENDS IN DESPERATION'
body: b"I would not recommend this to anyone except those that can take a chance on feeling disappointed after 500 pages of literary perambulation with a dismal conclusion. There was a lot of work devoted to this book and the author is very proud of it. She is definitely a wonderful writer, this just wasn't a good use of my time and will not sustain me in the way a good book does."

author: b'Kelly Mitchem'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This book was all around terrible, I only read it because J. K. wrote it and man was it a huge disappointment. I could barely finish it.'

author: b'S. Armstrong'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"The story, while not great, is generally interesting enough and it moves along reflecting numerous issues of our current society.  It seems Ms. Rowling is up on her current events.  What truly disappoints me is the excessive profanity.  Ms. Rowling is clearly a talented author as evidenced by her Harry Potter series but it seems she does not possess sufficient talent to convey vulgarity without being blatantly vulgar herself.  Too little is left to the imagination on this count. I wasn't expecting a children's book but the English language has too many offerings to limit oneself so often (throughout) to one or two four letter words."

author: b'Char'
title: b'Great read!'
body: b'I loved this book.  Granted, there were lots of different characters introduced at the beginning but if one continues to read, this book unfolds beautifully.  The different personalities brought the story to life and one begins to feel as though they are part of the story.  The ending was unexpected.  I was sorry to finish this book.  I wanted to keep following these interesting lives and find out what happened next.  I hope to read many more books by Ms. Rowling.'

author: b'sandy'
title: b'NG'
body: b"Couldn't get into this book at all.  Didn't even finish it.  Very disappointed.  thought that since it was from JK, that it would be awesome.  It was not."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"True-to-life, sensitive account of life's subtleties"
body: b"Anxious to read JK Rowling's first non-Harry book.  As a Brit familiar with small-town living, the themes were familiar and dealt with humorously and with pathos.  I read this as an e-book on holidays and have to admit to taking a trip into a bookshop to make sure my download hadn't been truncated, because I didn't think the book had an ending...  I still don't!"

author: b'Dermgoddess'
title: b'a disappointment after reading Harry Potter'
body: b'As an avid reader, I was excited to read her new book. Unfortunately, it is not well written and really was a waste of time. Wish I has stopped reading it, but as an optimist, I hoped it would get better. It did not!'

author: b'Mary Ellen F. Dennard'
title: b'Get this book from Rowling.'
body: b'A great story of discord in a small town, and how they are all connected.  I little sad, with the coldness of some characters.  But it is a fun read because of Rowlings writing style and turn of a phrase.'

author: b'Dr Jacques COULARDEAU'
title: b'Too dark to be somber, too sinister to be caustic'
body: b'The authoress tried herself in the social drama with a good sprinkling of politics. But how can you be better than Ruth Rendell in that line?'

author: b'Barbara'
title: b'Very uninteresting.'
body: b'Incredibly boring, with no purpose. It had uninteresting characters and nothing happening.  I wondered what the purpose of this book was.'

author: b'Ryan D.'
title: b'love'
body: b'this book was in excellent condition on receipt. every imperfection (which were minimal) was listed on the page before purchase. no surprises.'

author: b'Patricia Foreman'
title: b'A slow start'
body: b"I was about to give up on this book it started out so slowly. It was very frustrating - but my persistence was rewarded. The authors insight into the children's lives showed real experience with teenagers angst, and the unique way they see the world. The adults turn out to be shallow, while the kids live and learn."

author: b'phoenixfire'
title: b'I did not enjoy this book'
body: b"I didn't like this book. Not because it wasn't Harry Potter--I didn't like this in it's own right! Too many points of view, too long, not enough likeable characters, and damn depressing."

author: b'ron smith'
title: b'Too wordy, not enough action'
body: b'Too "verbose" for my taste. I may have stopped reading too quickly, but after about 20-pages, I gave up and started something else.'

author: b'Laura Schmink'
title: b'A disappointing book'
body: b'Rowling tried too hard to convince the reader that she was beyond the "children\'s" category.  There wasn\'t enough substance to the story.  I didn\'t dislike it, but was disappointed by it.'

author: b'Janine Bates'
title: b'a monumental disappointment'
body: b"This was a monumental disappointment.  My initial eagerness to read the author's first 'adult' book was soon squelched by the random, unnecessary, and frequent insertion of sex in one form or another.  I also was turned off by the foul language.  I gave up in disgust - never finished it. Sorry I wasted the money."

author: b'Carole Astin'
title: b'A Good Interesting Read'
body: b"Very well written.  I've read all the Potter books and enjoyed this one too.  Her characters were very real and quite interesting."

author: b'Shannon M.'
title: b'Not Harry Potter...but So WONDERFUL!'
body: b'This is NOT the book for anyone looking for Harry Potter 2.0 (or well 8.0 I guess!)  However if you miss the sheer eloquence and amazing way Rowling can string together the English language, this is the book for you.  Beautifully written, and I look forward to more adult novels by J.K. Rowling!'

author: b'S. Garber'
title: b'Slooow start but so worth it.'
body: b"This book is 3 weeks late going back to the library because it takes a while to get going. There are a lot of characters and you are very thoroughly introduced to them all. It's hard to keep them straight and honestly quite boring. BUT get through those first 100 pages and you won't be able to put it down. I feel like I need to reread the beginning now that I know the characters."

author: b'Lesley BH'
title: b'Hard Work'
body: b"JK Rowling brings life and death to a cast of the most unsympathetic and unpleasant characters to fill the pages of a book since Dickens, but unlike Dickens, without someone in its pages to care about, it becomes a bit of a slog to get through. Nevertheless, Rowling's turn of phrase, her descriptive prose and her depiction of contemporary life in a small town, persuade the reader to pursue it to the end hoping to find some redemption."

author: b'Snoopy'
title: b'Enviable lightness of writing'
body: b"I liked almost all the book very much. Almost  The book was definitely worth reading for me. I found the characters believable, the little town vividly described and the plot interestingly developing, but And I wouldn't tell more because of the possibility of spoilers."

author: b'Kacey'
title: b'Tragic'
body: b"I am a big Harry Potter fan so I couldn't wait to read this book. I read the reviews before I bought it and I knew that it wouldn't be anything close or relevant to what Harry Potter was like. Just the first chapter was a struggle to get through. I did not enjoy reading it that much and don't even know if I will finish the book. I feel that others might enjoy though..."

author: b'Frash'
title: b'Real Life Can be Hard'
body: b'The plot, a council election in a small English village, seems a bit thin. But the characters gradually grew on me, and even the plot finally got beyond the election. So I stayed with the book. There are several really good scenes, and there is a kind of resolution at the end, if in the midst of great sadness. Some of the characters seem to find something like "salvation". And a couple unpleasant and unredeemed characters at least get a good lesson, and hopefully will learn something. Still, the ending does not tie everything up neatly; it is more realistic than that. A good book and well worth reading if you can stay with it for at least a hundred pages. It is long.'

author: b'lynn aberdeen'
title: b'Language over done'
body: b'Did not care for this style of writing , but understanding the area where it was staged. Would not recommend.'

author: b'Chelsea Hasenpflug'
title: b'Different...interesting'
body: b"Very different than J.K. Rowling 's other books but it is interesting and the characters are very intricate. I appreciated a different writing style...but beware it's not what you expect!"

author: b'Laura'
title: b'Tries Too Hard'
body: b'This was a well done book overall, but it was pretty depressing, and it felt overly crass at times. I think Rowling may have been trying a bit too hard to set this apart from Harry Potter by including so much mature content.'

author: b'roberta secci'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'Disappointing, even though it is a quite well written novel. Good for people, like me, who want to improve their English. The language is very rich and elegant.'

author: b'Ricky Ronkonkoma'
title: b'Not worth the paper its printed on'
body: b'I agree wholeheartedly with another reviewer who called it "500 pages of relentless socialist manifesto masquerading as literature crammed down your throat."  JK Rowling\'s attempt to parlay her Harry Potter fantasies into success in the Adult World of reality simply doesn\'t jell.  The book is chock full of tired socialist cliches, depressing selfishness and an overwhelming ignorance and despicable loathing which she wantonly attempts to portray as an indictment against the hard working and at times selfless middle class folk.  It is basically an insult to ones intelligence - JK Rowling should return to her fantasy World of Wizards and Magic Spells.'

author: b'MotherB'
title: b'Redemption'
body: b'There was nothing redeaming about trying to read this book.  Life is too short to be filling ones mind with the negativity that made up the bulk of this work.'

author: b'CAS'
title: b'She should stick to Harry Potter'
body: b"Only read enough to make me realize everyone had a deep dark secret and weren't really very nice people.  I had enough and am deleting it from my Kindle.  What a waste of $7.99"

author: b'David B. Van Vleck, Jr.'
title: b"couldn't put it down"
body: b'I found The Casual Vacancy extraordinary. It\'s sort of like a modern day Dickens, in a way, in the sense that it\'s that good, in its own new modern way. I kept reading it, then glanced at the number of pages I\'d read vs. the entire novel, and keep being amazed: "I\'m only about a fifth the way through??" That was because it was so entrancing, and rich and full. Not to sound pedestrian but it\'s full of truth: about adults, teens, people posh and not, heroin addicts, families above all; about good people and bad people and all the so-human shades of grey in-between.'

author: b'Nancy Evans'
title: b'A real diappointment!'
body: b"What a disaster. I hope the millions of kids for whom she made literature real and exciting, don't buy this book hoping for more of the same. It was disapointing and depressing, sometime disgusting. The characters were poorly developed in a sort of on going way, very difficult to deep track of who was who, what nickname was in effect now. The plot was similarly ongoing and unpredictable. Who was doing what to whom or why. I kept asking mywelf why I was wasting my time reading it, but continued to see what point whe was trying to explain or explore. I never found out!"

author: b'Steve'
title: b'Interesting, quirky and kind of creepy'
