body: b'Well, actually, the title of the review just about covers it. But I need more words to satisfy Amazon. Like.'

author: b'Joyce'
title: b'Why this story?!!'
body: b"Our book club read this book, as many are fans of her work...but of the dozen women that started it, only three of us read the entire book - -no one liked it.  The story is well written, but there was not a single character to care about.  With J. K. Rowling's talent - -she could write any story - -so why this one?!!  Would not recommend it -- -nor will I buy another of her books."

author: b'Lori Wheeler'
title: b'Great Read!'
body: b'I read this book more than 6 weeks ago and I still think of the characters.  The story resonates and sticks with you.'

author: b'Susan O'
title: b"Rowling's Casual Vacancy"
body: b"The character studies are gradual but astute. The interplay of the Pagford politics is perfect depiction of small towns (British or American) with egos blurring purposes.  Probably lost minor subtleties as I'm American."

author: b'Winter'
title: b'JK Rowling is the ultimate people watcher'
body: b'This book is a wryly observed character study of the haves & the have nots. It shines a stark light on the attitudes, expectations, foibles, vanities, aspirations, failings and flaws of all of its characters, both the middle class Pagforders & the low class Fielders. There are not many characters that come up smelling of roses and most are downright unlikable, but all seem to have some small redeeming trait that makes them human & not just caricatures.'

author: b'Louise L. Galvin'
title: b'Mesmerizing'
body: b'I could hardly put it down as i WANTED TO SEE WHAT WOULD HAPPEN NEXT.  When I finished the book I wanted the story to continue with the rest of the characters.  I told family and friends what I had read.  I immersed myself in the book.'

author: b'zipporah'
title: b"Just doesn't flow"
body: b'I had to force myself to keep reading this one. It felt a bit disjointed throughout the book making it difficult to really connect with the characters.'

author: b'Jo Ruwet'
title: b'Compelling and well written as the Harry Potter series'
body: b'Loved that J. K. Rowling chose to write an adult book, although many of us enjoy the Harry Potter books as much as the children did.  It was a fascinating read and I look forward to more from this author!'

author: b'Louise Clemmer'
title: b'The sins of our parents.'
body: b'I took me a while to connect and care about all the characters. But as the book progressed I became more enthralled with the sins of the parents and the sad affect they have on children. It was a good read, well done.'

author: b'mary i pelletier'
title: b'never read'
body: b"I bought this as a gift for a friend. i'm waiting for her to finish it so I can read it."

author: b'A. Gurvin'
title: b"can't get you out of my head"
body: b"J k Rowling reveals the inner life of her characters. As my daughter said, 'By the middle of the book, you hate every character.' By the end of the book you find compassion for most of them."

author: b'Patricia B. Ware'
title: b'Dullsville'
body: b"This very mediocre novel is so cluttered with minor, and undeveloped, characters, that it's difficult to figure out which ones to focus on.  Slow start, slower middle, but halfway decent ending."

author: b'claudia'
title: b'boring'
body: b'Extremely boring. Life situations that have already been talked about millions of times. I appreciate the spoonriver-style attempt but the result is a bit poor.'

author: b'Mrs. Susan Taylor'
title: b'I was hopeful'
body: b"I wanted to commit suicide while reading, and after reading this book.  I expected better prose.  Want my copy?  I'll send it to you.  I can't give it away."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Not up to previous work'
body: b'Runs hot and cold, hard to keep track of the players. Perhaps too much attention to family squabbles detracting from the story line. Actually the story line was weak to begin with.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Too many other good books'
body: b'If you can read it through to the end there will be a reward for your efforts. On the other hand, there are so many great books out there why bother.'

author: b'Mladen Jergovic'
title: b'Superb!'
body: b'Very fluent naration, great story, impeccable writing, reliably convincing characters, superb insight into what really drives us on, brilliant masterpiece.'

author: b'Shelley Isom'
title: b"J.K. Rowling is this century's Chas. Dickens"
body: b"This novel is a complete departure from the wonderful Harry Potter books, which give me hope for the next generation as I can't imagine the many fans not wishing they could go to Hogwarts School instead of what we call the public education system.  Casual Vacancy is a portrait of a British small town.  There are dozens of characters, all wonderfully detailed, and all of it is somehow tied together by the death of a man of significance (Barry Fairbrother) and his impact on the town of Pagford.  All classes and types of people are represented here in the most complete characterization of humanity in its current struggles.  Nobody has done it better!!  Rowling is a major writer."

author: b'Hovsep Hacopian'
title: b'I liked it very much'
body: b'I liked it very much.  Character study is brilliant and it transfers the feel of the moment in the story very well. I would have liked a little more at the end.'

author: b'Mary M. Helmstetter'
title: b'Rowling'
body: b'The book is okay, but the foul language is totally unnecessary. If there is a next book in the series, I will pass.'

author: b'Kimberly D. Baldwin'
title: b'Good, not great'
body: b"Aside from Ann Patchett, no one seems to like this book. But I liked it. In full disclosure, I wanted to like it. I tend to like the books Ann Patchett recommends; I also love J.K. Rowling. I think Rowling is a great storyteller & develops characters like no other author I've read. I wouldn't go so far as to say I loved it, or that it made me cry, but I liked it & I'm glad I read it. It's a long, winding story with a town full of characters, none of them the protagonist & not a lot happens until the last few pages. It's a beautiful, well written book that I will probably never read again."

author: b'Jean Banks'
title: b'Ms. Rowling Writes Great Adult Books'
body: b'Ms. Rowling writes a great story.  She kept me wanting to come back to the book to see what was coming next.  I really enjoyed her adult books and I never read her Harry Potter series.'

author: b'Nancy Petralia'
title: b'Unimaginative'
body: b'This was a huge disappointment. I only finished it because 1) my mother told me to finish what I started, and 2) a friend said it got better after the middle and had a good ending.'

author: b'Barbara'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Would rate zero if I could.  Worst book ever.  Not one character to like.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Sad'
body: b"I've just finished reading the casual vacancy and I really enjoyed it. It is sad and traffic and not remotely Harry potter, but there is real depth and character development. The story is good. It's not epic or anything, just honest. I don't know that I would recommend it too everyone, but not every book is for everyone. I just know I enjoyed the emotional response this book caused."

author: b'PAM'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Difficult to get started.  Characters a little confusing at start.  But good read. The Casual Vacancy ---interesting to read about politics in small town in England.'

author: b'austinannie'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'Too long, too many characters to keep track of. I love her other books but this one is a big disappointment'

author: b'K. Fox'
title: b'A captivating read'
body: b'I really like this book and did find it hard to put it down. I wanted to read it in one go! The story is believable and the characters have their own distinct voices, reaction guaranteed!'

author: b'Diane Howard'
title: b'authentic'
body: b'the darker sides of Muggles, w redemption at a steep price, told w nuance in a complex structure. worth reading!'

author: b'JD'
title: b'GREAT BOOK!!'
body: b'I am a huge fan of JK Rowling, and this book did not disappoint! Different from her other books, which was a great surprise!'

author: b'penran'
title: b'the Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I found it hard to understand that the author who could create such believable characters and suspense as existed in the Harry Potter books could offer such boring, dull and unsuspenseful characters and story line as existed in this book. It was predictable and trite. Maybe listening to it was part of the problem. Perhaps I could have raced along if reading and skipped some of the overly descriptive passages. I certainly would not have had to listen to the British accent. While I found none of the characters likable or sympathetic I continued listening because I kept hoping it would get better. It did not.'

author: b'Jonie'
title: b'Negative'
body: b"Boring.....I gave up 3/4's of the way through.  The story is boring, the characters are boring. This is a good book to use as a sleeping pill."

author: b'Caseyannie'
title: b'The effects of bulling'
body: b'At first glance I thought there were to many characters to keep up with.  Then I found that the author developed them so well that was not a problem and each had a reason for being there.'

author: b'Sararuna'
title: b'Tough'
body: b"Casual Vacancy has left me speechless and wrung out. It was challenging to keep all characters straight and to find any to like yet the story was compelling and now that I've finished I keep going over the relationships and actions were never quite what they seemed. Rawlings has achieved something thought provoking."

author: b"Nikki's Opinion"
title: b'Ms. Rowling, what were you thinking?'
body: b'I feel strongly that if you write an outstanding series for children, you have a certain responsibility to maintain values in future books, even those intended for adults. Like a child star gone wrong, this book went the wrong way ... Language & situations just way too dark!!!  It dampened my enjoyment of the Harry Potter series.'

author: b'Suzanne E. Frew-Harris'
title: b'Small Town Politics And Lives'
body: b"Seemingly slow because of all the characters involved, the web gets spun and the story takes off and into each home's secrets."

author: b'mel3600'
title: b'Very Disappointed'
body: b'Loved her harry potter books.  Thought I would enjoy a more adult story, but this had too many f bombs for me.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'So Very Disappointed'
body: b'First off, I didn\'t buy this book.  I rented it from the library.  Second, I wanted to like this book.  I really like JK Rowling as an author.  I think she is a good one.  But man was I disappointed in this book and in her.  She seemed to take every bad thing about humanity and put it into one book about one small town, and killed off the one "good" man in the whole story. (And no, that wasn\'t a spoiler.  You learn that he dies from the cover.)'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Odd Book'
body: b"This book is about small town political back biting and scheming. The book is set in England and has numerous English words i had never heard before and had to figure out from the context of the sentences they were in. It's interesting but if J K Rowling hadn't been the author, I probably wouldn't have bought it."

author: b'Emma'
title: b'Not Harry Potter!! :)'
body: b'She can really paint a picture with what she writes.. But felt slightly let down by the way the book ended. But over all good read!!'

author: b'Binge Reader'
title: b'Exceptional take on the fragility of the human psyche'
body: b'Thoroughly enjoyed this well-written examination on life, politics, and relationships in small town England. Have never read J. K. Rowling before so no preconceived notions of old styles and content.'

author: b'KT'
title: b'Well Written'
body: b"There is no doubt that Rowling's can write and weave a tall like the best of them.  She is masterful in her darkness.  I did not love it."

author: b'Lauren Cooper'
title: b'Will Be Awesome'
body: b"I bought this for my husband to read on his Kindle. Though we've not read it yet, I know it will be awesome, odiously because it's by J.K. Rowling!:) After he reads it, I'll be reading it for sure. I know we'll both love it! Can't wait! :)"

author: b'A. White'
title: b'Fascinating, well-written story - difficult to put down once you start'
body: b"While the storyline for this book is completely different in every way from the Harry Potter series, Rowling's pure writing talent shines through as stromg as ever. She takes a narrative that, in the hands of anyone else, would be boring (small town politics and gossip) and makes it fascinating and difficult to put down. Barry Fairbrother is the character who dies at the very beginning, setting off the events of the book. And yet...Rowling makes you care about him, a character you barely meet. She makes you care about all of the inhabitants of the town, and makes you see the motivations and passions driving all of them - there is no objective right or wrong in this little world of Pagford, no true good or evil. It must be said, however, that Rowling does not gloss over harsh realities of life here."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'I was able to put it down'
body: b'This was not an exciting book to read, in fact it depressed me a bit.  I loved the HP books and spent many a sleepless night till I finished each one.  This one I put down and had a hard time finishing.'

author: b'Kelly Gardner'
title: b'Miserable'
body: b'This was a very confusing book with too many characters and too much going on. I do not recommend it at all.'

author: b'Frederic Smoak'
title: b'A small, petty book about small petty people.'
body: b'I felt like washing my hands whenever I put it down. It makes every character look bad, weak or malicious. The only one treated sympathetically dies in the opening scene. She can do better.'

author: b'Vicki L. Butterfield'
title: b'J.K. Rowlings'
body: b'I loved her other books but this book is not as interesting. Hard to follow and not easy reading. Little disappointed.'

author: b'Rick Toboz'
title: b'Do not read!'
body: b'This book basically says life sucks, people are nasty and death is a release. It was too dark. My entire book club hated it! Look for better.'

author: b'Buyer'
title: b'worst book ever'
body: b"It is a terrible, terrible book. I cannot believe the author of the Harry Potter books and The Cuckoo's Calling, which I recommend, wrote this trash. It is horrible. Avoid it."

author: b'Jodi Wibbels'
title: b'An Important Work'
body: b"I finished this book three days ago and I can't stop thinking about it. One major theme of the book is how absolutely trapped disadvantage people are, especially the kids. If they don't get a hand up, they won't make it. It's not a matter of working harder or even of making better choices. It was quite an eye-opener. I think our Judeo-Christian culture is a bit schizophrenic--we have our Puritan heritage that says we deserve what we get, and the words of Jesus that tell us to care for the poor and downtrodden. More often than not, the Puritan voice is loudest and wins out."

author: b'Debbie R.'
title: b'It took a while to realize it was a good book...'
body: b"I never read the Harry Potter series, so didn't know what to expect. It took me half the book to get involved and finally remember who was who and what was going on. But after that I was hooked. I also enjoyed picking up on the British jargon.  Sometimes I was anxious to get through the descriptive parts and get back to figure out the plot, but I realize now that I actually had a picture of the town and the people in my head."

author: b'Lucia Taddeo'
title: b'Could do better'
body: b"I prefer Rowling's writing when she deals with magic. This book got the message across, a very important one at that, but reading it was very tedious, a problem on every page. Rowling can support a cause without necessarily writing fiction about it. She might have done a better job researching and reporting real facts and stories."

author: b'Dr. Jack E. Skiles'
title: b'A book certainly worth reading....'
body: b"This book is surely an auto-biographic of Rowling's life before fame.  It is extremely detailed with the commonplace horrors and abuse that come with small town living.  An excellent read that requires some discipline to wade through to the very end."

author: b'ebs'
title: b'Good read'
body: b'Very interesting characters with a well developed story. Would definitely recommend this book. An easy read but  thoroughly engaging story.'

author: b'Principessa Madre'
title: b'Good Read'
body: b'Enjoyed this novel.  Nothing like Harry Potter so know that before you read it.  JK Rowling is a wonderful writer.  Her insight into human nature is so interesting.  Will continue to read any novels that she writes.'

author: b'belairdebra'
title: b'A dreadful read.'
body: b"It is rare that I do not finish reading a novel.  I tried to persevere to the end of A Casual Vacancy but absolutely could not!  This book was dreadfully boring to say the least!  I would have more fun putting together a jigsaw puzzle of a basketball then to force myself to finish reading this book.  A tooth extraction would be more fun!  If this is how people in a small English town live I would rather not visit it even in a fictional story.  I won't drone on and on about it.  If you have read it you know what I'm talking about, and if you haven't don't bother wasting your time.  Granted JK Rowling did a fantastic job writing the Harry Potter books, I think she would be better off staying in the genre of children's fantasy books.  Good luck next time Ms. Rowling."

author: b'Lelia'
title: b'so depressing'
body: b"i stopped reading this book almost halfway, i found it so depressing. such a bummer, i just read cuckoo's calling and loved it!"

author: b'Vivien Halloran'
title: b'Complex story'
body: b'Lots of characters to follow but it is a good read. Gave me insight into small town England and the welfare and town government systems.'

author: b'Beth Wheeler'
title: b'Even better than I hoped it would be'
body: b"I really don't think that any review written by someone who went into buying this book thinking that the writing would be like Harry Potter should be taken seriously."

author: b'DojoDiva'
title: b'500 Pages of Everything Wrong With the World'
body: b"Dreary and, after slogging through it all, rather uninspiring. It's difficult to connect with the stereotypical characters. I usually enjoy Brit Lit, but I couldn't wait for this one to be over. Didn't care for the HP series either. The writing in both is very one dimensional."

author: b'V. Knocke'
title: b'Well written but depressing.'
body: b"It certainly isn't a cheerful read, and none of the characters were love able or redeemed themselves by the end. Too much like real life to offer an escape."

author: b'G. Russell'
title: b'How the mighty have fallen'
body: b"Originally published under a pseudonym, The Casual Vacancy got the response it deserved. No sale. Then J.K. decided to fess up and her loyal readers flocked to the bookstores. It is a good thing I read it as a library book or I would have wanted my money back! My daughter bought the book on tape and didn't finish it."

author: b'MsStaciNicole'
title: b'I wanted to like it'
body: b'I really really wanted to like this book, but I just could never get into the story or the characters.'

author: b'R. D. Le Vine'
title: b'Engaging but...'
body: b'I chose to read this book because I am a huge Harry Potter fan and thus wanted to continue to support Rowling and her great writing.'

author: b'Zevi'
title: b'to the point'
body: b'j.k.rowling hit the nail on the head with the characters in the casual vacancy.Her understanding of the teenagers in the small town was fantastic together with their interaction with the sometimes unpleasant adults.i felt I got to know almost all the characters through rowlings wonderful literary style.agreat read'

author: b'Paul H'
title: b'Casual Scenario'
body: b"Well written, good characters, reasonably good dialogue, plot a little bit slow so far.  But I'm only half way through."

author: b'JudeR'
title: b'Appalling and heartbreaking story of a dysfunctional community!'
body: b"It's hard to believe so much envy,spite and neuroses could exist in one small village, but Rowling puts it all together to make a compelling and disturbing,yet intriguing story. The characters are complex.  Some will disgust you, some will break your heart.  Some will make you angry and some will redeem themselves. But they will all rivet your heart and mind to this remarkable story.  Bravo, J.K.Rowling."

author: b'Michael Higgin'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"I have to agree with some of the worst reviews and with some of the best reviews.  This is a mixed bag of a read.  It's extremely difficult to like any of the major characters - we may feel sorry for them, but we do not like them.  A social conscience is never a bad thing, but it needs a deft hand if the writing isn't to slip into diatribe and melodrama.  The author is not always successful.  I'm afraid I had to force myself to finish.  There's no need for the length of this book.  Tighter writing would have enhanced the read.  The ending of the book and the attempts to wrap up all the various plotlines, leaves one with little hope and with very little sense of redemption."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'I enjoyed it'
body: b"Overall this was a good book and I liked it.  There was nothing groundbreaking done, and the plot wasn't spectacular.  If you're looking for a good, basic book - then give this one a try."

author: b'Trish'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Just could not get interested in the book.  Did not finish it.  May go back to it later and try again.'

author: b'nan12'
title: b'Thought-provoking novel with few defects'
body: b"In this novel, J.K Rowling boldly picks up her pen to deal with harsh themes, the most important ones being poverty, its consequences such as drugs, prostitution, violence, and society's responsibility for the dire circumstances some are left to live in."

author: b'Amy  Roth'
title: b'HARD ROW TO HOE'
body: b"Most of the characters were unbelievably neurotic, if not psychotic, and there is very little hope in this book.  I don't have to have a happy ending, and the denoument of all this was fairly clever, but it was tough to read it."

author: b'K. Chandler'
title: b'For All The Reasons..........................'
body: b"...................stated in the previous 923 one star reviews, I hated this book. Do not waste your time or money. This book would never have been published if the author's name was anything other than J. K. Rowling."

author: b'Sean Carter'
title: b'Page Turner'
body: b'This books was different from Harry Potter series that she wrote for children but it keep me want know what would happen next to all characters in this book'

author: b'Jennifer G. Loparo'
title: b'boring, boring, boring...'
body: b"I can't believe this is by J.K. Rowling. Couldn't put down Harry Potter, had a hard time picking this up. Not an enjoyable read for me"

author: b'dc metro area'
title: b'slow moving'
body: b'The book should have been shorter. The author is expecting a lot of the reader to wade through 500 slow-moving pages. Three quarters of the book is background, with all the "action" coming at the very end.  Most people would find this book boring unless they are interested in personality studies, particularly character defects. None of the characters are likeable or truly happy. One of the takeaways from this book is the drawbacks of living in a small town. Another point seems to be that we never really know the innermost thoughts of another person, even our spouse or immediate family members. And, if we did, we probably wouldn\'t like them.  The book makes you question whether anyone is really nice deep down. The book is very thought-provoking about the human condition if you can get through it all, but one is left depressed.'

author: b'Genice Dickerson'
title: b'Vacancy'
body: b'So many characters and so much going on, hard to put aside and pick back up.  Good characters relative to this time of our lives and things going on.'

author: b'jmere'
title: b'Enjoyable read'
body: b"Great read. I had low expectations after reading mixed reviews but it's been very enjoyable. Great book for those of us who love looking beyond the exterior and seeing the inner workings of people's lives. Felt rather like a 21st century pop version of George Eliot."

author: b'Nora M'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'Didn\'t expect it to be anything like Harry Potter, and it wasn\'t. But I did expect JKRowling to be able to tell us another fascinating story, and she didn\'t.  This story was boring.  The cast of way too many charactors was hard to care about. Plodding through the book, knowing "something" would eventually happen wasn\'t enough. The deaths at the end were predictable.'

author: b'Lucia Amado'
title: b'A completely different J.K.Rowling'
body: b'I was eager to go on reading and although there were lots of characters in the story, at the end the author managed to find a credible solution to each one of them.  I just found it funny to see so many parenthesis throughout the book.'

author: b'June R from Oz'
title: b'Not my cup of tea.'
body: b"I am still only 50% through and I am finding it long winded and a bit boring.  I feel it is far too detailed and seems to be never getting somewhere.  I much preferred The Cuckoo's Calling.  I also find the amount of swearing rather annoying.  Obviously, the characters who swear most are either the rougher individuals or the teenagers but I feel the writer is over using the bad language, sometimes to the point of my irritation.  This probably does not affect most readers, but my personal taste deems the use of bad language used in this story is a little too much for me."

author: b'Tbenzy'
title: b'A Different Beast Entirely, But a Rewarding Read'
body: b'I was very disappointed to see this book averaged only three stars. I preordered "Casual Vacancy" because, let\'s face it, I\'ll read anything J.K. Rowling writes. I think too many people did the same thing, hoping for and expecting the same type of can\'t-put-it-down experience with a wonderful cast of characters who are either evil or basically fantastic.'

author: b'Steven'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"There's no doubt Rowling knows how to write. Even with a distinct change of genre it's still clear that the author hasn't changed. What has changed is that rather than having great characters and stories like her previous work, this novel is all about petty drama and miserable pathetic people. I was bored from the first chapter, but kept going in hopes that it would get better. I eventually gave up because it was so frustratingly uninteresting. Rowling is better than this. I hope she realizes that and makes a better return in the future."

author: b'Kathie L Johnson'
title: b'Good read'
body: b'Well written, many twist. Reflected human nature and all the complications life has. Was for mature readers, but could be read by well-read younger readers.'

author: b'Semaj'
title: b'A Bitter Novel'
body: b'The Aristototilian theory of tragedy required a hero that the audience invested in, so that the audience then personally felt the hero\'s downfall. Well written and well constructed as this novel is, there is nobody to like, to invest in. This bitter novel, a decline and fall of practically everybody, is quite unlike her other recent adult novel, "The Cuckoo\'s Calling", which had two central characters you immediately liked and invested in. In "The Casual Vacancy." Rowling\'s well-crafted characters range from petty, egocentric, not-too bright through to truly evil. This may be an accurate portrait of the human condition but I would not call it a "fun read." At the end of a satisfying novel, I feel a bit abandoned, as if friends have gone away. At the end of "The Casual Vacancy," I was really glad to get out of Pagford.'

author: b'Lynn Arnold'
title: b'Vacant'
body: b"I did not really enjoy this.  Found it's characters unlikeable in every sense--know I was suppose to feel that way about some of them--but it carried over to all I felt I was just reading about a bunch of snooty people"

author: b'M. Gelfand'
title: b'Hard to Get Immersed'
body: b"I had  difficult time reading this book. Actually put book aside read and finished another book. Came back to this book to give it another go at it. I did finish it but was disappointed; the characters well I could not feel them or their personality. Maybe it's me for expecting too much from Rowling."

author: b'Lyndy Lou 56'
title: b'Well written characters, believable'
body: b'A small village and its many characters.'

author: b'Lynne'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling'
body: b'This is an example of how the life of one citizen of a town/community impacts the lives of the town and how the death of that citizen starts a web like chain reaction that changes lives and the town itself.'

author: b'Marylin M. Butorac'
title: b"Don't bother.  What a disappointment."
body: b"One of the worst books I've ever encountered.  It is nothing but example after example of the WORST traits of human beings.  Poorly organized and generally just a beating.  I finished the whole thing hoping at least ONE character would redeem themselves in some way.  I rather think the author needs some personal counseling.  How does she exist in this sort of world view?"

author: b'C. S.'
title: b'Steady Read'
body: b'The book appears to be set in the early 60s and covers the effect that an "Estate" on the border of a nearby town has on a country village. There are no killings, the plot revolves around a death on the first page and the implications it has on the lives of everyone in the country village and the "Estate", by creating a Casual Vacancy. I did not give it five stars because it plods along to a fairly expected end with hardly any real surprises or plot twists. It doesn\'t compare with the Roger Galbraith crime novel. It certainly brought back memories of my post war life when we had a council estate abutted to our upper class village, just round the corner from me, in a green belt village that currently is in the top ten for house prices in England.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Well written but rather dull'
body: b'I tried to keep an open mind as I read this book, aware that the reviews were not great when it first came out.  I thought the book was well written, almost too well written.  The descriptions are very detailed and lyrical but at times seem to slow the story down as it plodded towards the conclusion.  In the end I thought it was just ok - a rather depressing read that I will soon forget.'

author: b'James Robbins'
title: b'Not of the caliber I have come to expect'
body: b'Lost my interest after 25 pages. Pretty bland and uninteresting. Liked her other book under her made up name of Galbreath.'

author: b'Sabriena'
title: b"Just couldn't do it"
body: b"This book, The Casual Vacancy is by the great author J.K. Rowling but, you knew that by now, didn't you? Now I want to first say that I can't really give this book a totally 100% fair review because I could not finish it. I really couldn't even get through half of it, I got through about 38% of the book before I had to just call it quits."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Love this new book.'
body: b"It's not Harry potter but I did not expect it to be. What a great plot very entertaining, hard to predict. You want to cry, cheer and shout and root for the underdog. Can't wait to read the next book."

author: b'Tara'
title: b'Okay, but not great'
body: b"I'll be honest, I had high expectations for this book; it being her first novel outside of the HP series. She is a fantastic writer and the writing was definitely not lacking. However, I didn't love the storyline and I really didn't like the ending. So, overall, it was an okay book, but not great. If your a JK fan I'd say go for it and read it, but don't expect it to be anything like HP!"

author: b'Bonnie Wagner'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"It was ok but a little disappointed.  Not the kinda book that I just couldn't put down, but I did read it all not just deleted it."

author: b'Jane Douglas'
title: b'Not everyone in my Book Club would agree, but ...'
body: b'I loved the way the author "draws" the characters.  She is a master at connecting the very different lives of each and making their perspectives become visible and believable to us as observers.'

author: b'dancingteacher'
title: b'Save your money.'
body: b'I love JK Rowling. I did not like this book at all. I spent $20 on it at an airport bookstore because I forgot my Kindle and after struggling through the first few chapters, all I can say is I wish I could have that $20 back.'

author: b'Carol'
title: b'vacuous and hollow'
body: b"Boring.....Too many characters....Convoluted and hard to follow! Plot was missing and srung out.....I'll stick to nonfiction from now on...Wasn't my type of story.."

author: b'Jenna Ellsworth'
title: b'Captivating and authentic'
body: b"Rowling's description of the intertwined lives of the people in Pagford tells a story of a small town at war with itself. The different perspectives give the book depth of character and an appreciation for the individuals throughout the story. Well done."

author: b'Maya Craig'
title: b'Strong, scary, uncannily observant'
body: b'An amazing, sad, loving book about people who can be weak, blind, conceited, and some of them redeemed. It talks about the tragedy of life that beats one down and about the magic of resilience and love.'

author: b'lola'
title: b'Good Read'
body: b'Rowling writes great descriptions! The most enjoyable part of her novels. You really "know" the physical areas she\'s writing about.'

author: b'A. Wetzel'
title: b"Love J.K.'s writing"
body: b"I really enjoyed this book. I love J.K.'s writing. This book made me remember how important it is to not judge people. You never know why people do what they do, Crystal is the perfect example."

author: b'written'
title: b'slow start but moving'
body: b'I wanted to put this book down several times at the start but remembered another reviewers recommendation to keep going until the half way point when everything picks up. My advice is to do the same. This book reveals complex characters slowly.  I was able to appreciate the characters existence as a complicated human experience where good and evil were so hard to delineate. Very moving read!'

author: b'Dominika'
title: b'Unpredictable story of a real world'
body: b"A lot of people expected a murder mystery novel. It isn't one. I'm not a fan of J.K. Rowling and her Harry Potter series. I read only the first four books and I was not thrilled. But this one was just the opposite."

author: b'verbose'
title: b'Very sad, very gripping'
body: b"I had expected a good story from Rowling, but I found this more than just an interesting tale. It's moving and even tragic."

author: b'Melinda Kinkel'
title: b'J.K. Rowling does it again'
body: b"It's hard to put down. Easy to pick up because of the author. She doesn't disappoint. It's one of those books you could purchase sight unseen and not be disappointed."

author: b'Happy Gardner'
title: b'A good read'
body: b'A whole village full of disfunctional people, and they are all adults. The children of these adults show just what can happen when their par nets do not pay attention.'

author: b'Linda'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'I am having a hard time with the dialect but feel the story line is boring. I would not recommend it'

author: b'Franaby'
title: b'A chore to read.'
body: b"Sorry to say this was a tedious chore to read.  A real downer!  About the dregs of society.  Wouldn't recommend to anyone."

author: b'Effie'
title: b'No plot, many characters'
body: b'So many angry, discontented characters in a small petty-sounding'

author: b'A. Parra'
title: b'Took a while to get into it, but then could not put it down'
body: b"I was excited to get this book, being a huge harry potter fan. The story was slow in the beginning, and I actually put it down for a few months until I picked it up again a few days ago, and I haven't put it down until I finished it today. Admittedly, I like books some may consider dry or boring, and I love getting very involved in character's lives (dickens anyone?), so this was right up my alley. I saw parts of myself in these characters, even things that weren't so flattering. I think it paints a good picture of how people can get so involved in themselves and their own feelings that they become blind to what other people may be thinking about the same situation, and do not think about where their actions will ultimately take them. Overall, I really enjoyed the book, and would recommend that you at least make it a few chapters in before you decide you don't like it. I can't wait to read more of her work."

author: b'MFutrell'
title: b'Worth the read!'
body: b'Agreed with others, that there is a lot of characters to "remember." As you invest your time into this book, it becomes fairly easy to remember everyone. Excellent story!'

author: b'Susan K Gonzales'
title: b'Hang in there & keep reading ....'
body: b'The first half of the book was a bit slow, but the 2nd half made up for it.'

author: b'Lara Balter'
title: b'its good i think that it is good it'
body: b'its good I think it is really good and interesting i am not done yet but i think that it is good'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Depressing and worthless story, I hated it,'
body: b'If you like to read about the worst of humankind in a part of England then this is the book for you, not that I always want Pollyanna type books but I could not stand to subject myself to one more horrible character'

author: b'prolific reader'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Rowling did a very good job in developing her characters and the story line in this book.  The ending was a bit too neat but I didn't fault her for this. I enjoyed the book very much. I hope she keeps writing for adults."

author: b'Jonnie Johnson'
title: b'I loved this book!'
body: b"I loved this book!! As the reviews show, this book is not for everyone. It's deep! J.K. Rowling is a brilliant author, and I can only hope for more adult novels. I have to admit to writing down the names of all the characters, and would recommend that in a book with so many main characters, it would be helpful to list them."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"This Isn't Hogwarts"
body: b"I just recently began listening to audio books to pass the time during the long commute to my new job. I had been listening to comedy books, but wanted to try something different. I selected this one because (a) I loved J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series and grew to love many of the characters, and (b) I thought it would be a light-hearted read about an English community.  I was wrong about it being light-hearted. This novel turned into a dark story with wonderfully developed characters.  I felt all were very realistic with flaws that drove me crazy. Every one of them reminded me of someone I knew."

author: b'bill2406'
title: b'Rowling does it again'
body: b"I am very happy with this book. Rowling had me hooked with the Harry Potter Series. It is a good read but some people who aren,t acquainted with British Traditions and culture may find it a bit of a bore. So take the story for it's face value and enjoy the intricacies of daily life in a British village"

author: b'R. Shuttleworth'
title: b'Character study of a small town'
body: b'"Casual Vacancy" is a well written novel in which JK Rowlings exhibits her best in filling out characters and presenting scenes. We become familiar with this small town and it big political issues, all made the more prominent due to the death of one of their local political personalities. This leaves the "Casual Vacancy" on their city council.'

author: b'Mountain Mom'
title: b'Hard time finishing this'
body: b"Good friend recommended this read so here I am trying to finish.  I just don't like any of the people in the story.  I like to root for someone and this book just doesn't give me that."

author: b'Jane Roche'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"I was very eager to read something different of J.K.Rowling's because I had loved the Harry Potter series. But I have to say I was quite disappointed in this novel. All the characters were depressed and unhappy at the beginning and they were all pretty much depressed and unhappy at the end. There is some character development and some unexpected turns but I kept waiting for something to happen to change something in this town of sadness. But sadly, it never did."

author: b'Christina Frohock'
title: b'Huge disappointment'
body: b"I have never read the Harry Potter series nor seen a movie. But Rowley'a astounding popularity made me curious. I was shocked and disappointed. Very slow read; started over once to give it a chance to enhance. It never did. So I gave up after less than 1/2 way through."

author: b'Patricia Schenkkan'
title: b'Really?'
body: b'Did the creative brain and intellect that brought us Harry Potter really write this book? What a disappointment! Not a book for lovers of Harry.'

author: b'myrna'
title: b'VERY ENGLISH'
body: b'DYSFUNCTIONAL TOWN, DYSFUNCTIONAL PEOPLE, WHAT MORE COULD YOU ASK FOR. SHE DID WRITE IT WELL HAVEN BEEN TO ENGLAND MANY TIMES I FELT I WAS BACK THERE AGAIN.'

author: b'Heather M Gordon'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I really enjoyed this book and I didn't want it to end but wanted to know what happened.  Wonderful view of peoples perceptions."

author: b'Armando Brons'
title: b'SMALL TOWN  BIG  INFERNO  would have been a more appropriate title...'
body: b"What a deception!, what a waste! It is hard to reconcile that the same author who wrote the brilliant and almost spiritual Harry Potter's books could have written this demoralizing and undignified novel about the tragic and base common lives of the inhabitants of a small English town; a parody of a mediocre and hurting Hell on Earth. It reminded me in some aspects of John Updike's writing at his darkest and most depressive. There is not one single truly loving soul to be found in that inferno..."

author: b'W. A. Bruce'
title: b'A sad commentary (and boring)'
body: b"If the author's intent was to deal a nasty blow to English society, then she has been successful."

author: b'Diane D. Zener'
title: b'I was not expecting more Potter...'
body: b"However, I was expecting some more intriguing reading. I just can not get into this book. I've tried starting it a few times and always end up bored."

author: b'Reader'
title: b'Growing Up'
body: b"I grew up with Harry Potter as well - Jo taught me English, taught me storytelling, inspired me to start writing. The thing I loved most about Harry Potter was that it wasn't really a children's story. There was a fog of fantasy and lightheartedness, but neither did Jo ever hold back on showing everyone how dark life can get. Harry Potter was a dark children's story."

author: b'debbie williams'
title: b'bad book'
body: b"I didn't enjoy this book at all. I thought it was predicable and the people in it were not likeable at all. I forced myself to finish it thanking it would get better but it never did."

author: b'Reader Frank'
title: b'Boring, boring, boring!!!'
body: b'Too much chatter, not enough real story, jumps back and forth too much, never really goes anywhere, very disappointing end.'

author: b'Gardinale Stefano'
title: b'A superb novel'
body: b"I hadn't read any other work of Ms Rowling, so It was with an open mind that I downloaded the sample,,, which grabbed me immediately!"

author: b'Mimi'
title: b'Not good.'
body: b"Just couldn't quite get into this book. I didn't finish it. Just couldn't make myself read it. Hate it wasn't better."

author: b'Mary E, Bois'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Well written, but the sadness of the story and hopelessness I felt at finishing the novel were unexpected.  I was glad I had read The Cuckoo's Calling first."

author: b'Kodemunkey'
title: b"Not Harry Potter, but that's ok..."
body: b"I typically don't have time to write up reviews for the books I've read, but this time I wanted to give my opinion about a book that has (unfairly) received a lot of negative reviews.  I will agree that those looking to read this book in hopes of a Harry Potter-ish type of read are going to be disappointed, as this books focus is much more sociological in nature. However; those familiar with Ms. Rowling's writing style will not be disappointed with this book, as she does a very good job of providing a casual flowing interaction between the characters in the book (much like she did with the characters in the Harry Potter series). Personally, I think being able to create a casual, unforced dialog between characters is one of Ms. Rowling's best gifts as a author."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Hours of my life I will never get back'
body: b"This book was a waste of time. I should not have purchased this as it seemed unlikely to mentally stimulate in any way, however I had read the positive reviews by the Washington Post and others who raved about it. I thought there must be something interesting here... This was an utter bore, I thought if I kept reading it would get better... it did not. When I have time to sit and read, I prefer a book with a story... this is simply a monotonous log of petty small town daily life... don't waste your time."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Too much unneccessary detail'
body: b"The basis of The Casual Vacancy is a simple situation - a town Councillor dies and must be replaced. J.K. Rowling delves in the past, present and future of the people of the town. `Delving' is the right word, because, for me, many times there is too much detail, which distracts from the immediate story behind the simple situation. The best example of this is the Weedon family, with all the attempts at West Country accents on paper. I must admit I thought of giving up a few times (rare for me), but I continued, and in the end I'm glad I did. However, I think if Rowling's name had not been on the manuscript this book would have struggled to get published."

author: b'Horrorchuckle'
title: b'Depressing story by a great writer'
body: b"I found this book to be thoroughly depressing story and I hated the subject matter, but Rowling shows she can write something other than children's books.  One thing I did notice that this book had in common with HP books: Rowling gave the young people the power to try and do something about their situation and, grown-ups are terrible.  The only people who found peace in the end were the dead.  I would have given this book five stars if Rowling would have done something horrible to Obbo. And maybe, the young people will learn from this tragedy and be better people than their parents. Now, I'm looking forward to Rowling's other adult book."

author: b'Rene'
title: b'A moving, superb book'
body: b"I loved this book - not a happy story, but a real, 'authentic' story. Each character see,ed vile at some point, but almost all were forgivable (Shirley excepted)."

author: b'Tom Dumont'
title: b'If you like a soap opera'
body: b"you will like the book.  It's not exactly my preferred reading genre, yet it was good enough for me to finish and the ending was the high point IMHO."

author: b'Sonia Mathew Luvi'
title: b'Surprisingly lovely'
body: b"I shouldn't say I was surprised as I loved the Harry Potter books (not the movies!) but you just never expect someone to make the transition from children's books to adult ones easily.  I decided to try it anyway and was pleasantly surprised.  Interesting weave, colorful characters who stay with you even after you've put down your iPad, pace and rhythm.  Am recommendign to everyone I know (who reads)."

author: b'Debbie Dammeir'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b"can't imagine the writer of the Harry Potter series wrote something this boring.  I was very, very disappointed by this."

author: b'asubtbhm'
title: b'great story'
body: b'this was an amazing story to read. as you read it you get suprised and blown away at the the storyline'

author: b'B. Wieland'
title: b'An intersesting read'
body: b'As always, JK Rowling gives us in-depth and well rounded characters. Nothing to do with a magical world, this one is well grounded in reality, warts and all.'

author: b'Mary M Stevens'
title: b'Not what I was expecting'
body: b'Could not even get into it.  Very slow reading could not get far enough into the book.  Great writer was expecting so much more than it delivered.'

author: b'William I. Griffith'
title: b'Do not read if you have a vacant mind'
body: b'A dark and disturbing novel about many people you have already met one place or another.  This book hits on a host of social issues, including:'

author: b'Allan Inkpen'
title: b'The way it is'
body: b"Anyone who has worked and lived in a small community and not felt similarity with these people haven't had their ears and eyes open. It was a dogged read yet I wanted more and at the end I was quite unprepared for the finale - a huge surprise yet with great insight and depth from Ms Rowling."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Just ok'
body: b'I was expecting more. Well written but mildly entertaining for me.  I have never read any of her previous books.  Not sure I would recommend to a friend.'

author: b'Joann Ross'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b'Wow, what a gripping tale. Tragic. Quite different than the Harry potter books ( although those had a lot of sadness too.)'

author: b'kate'
title: b'THIS BOOK IS ABOUT MUGGLES!'
body: b'Much to my dismay, this book was centered entirely around Muggles.'

author: b'Christopher M Barrett'
title: b'Not bad'
body: b'Starts slow but picks up.  Sort of like the movie "Crash" where there is a few clusters of main characters yet everyone is intertwined.  Good read.'

author: b'L. H. Savage'
title: b'A different side of a beloved author'
body: b"I had read the reviews ahead of time so I knew this was not going to be anything like the Potter series but I love JK Rowling so much that I was willing to give this one a try anyway, and I'm glad I did. It was a little slow on action but the characters are well developed and definitely intriguing. I found myself not wanting to put it down. Not nearly as exciting as Harry's adventures but still worth reading."

author: b'Teresa Wilson'
title: b"Don't waste your money."
body: b'Don\'t waste your money.  I could not even finish the book.  I was so disapppointed in this book.  I am not a fan of the "F" word and this book tries to see how many times you can use this word.  Very, very disappointed in this book.'

author: b'Kathy F'
title: b'Not what I expected'
body: b"I really didn't like this book. It is a tragedy. There are no characters that you can identify with or hope thy do well.  There are just people who are flawed that you can't care about.  To tell the truth, I did't read the middle of the book because I read the end after I didn't care about the beginning, and realized that it didn't get any better."

author: b'Bernie Butt'
title: b"It's no Harry Potter"
body: b"I knew when I bought it that it was not anything like Harry Potter, all of the reviews said as much.  But I did expect the writing to be as good, just targeting a different (adult) audience.  I really think the writing was second rate, and if Rowling had been a first time writer I don't think this would have ever been published."

author: b'Mary Peeler'
title: b'Where is the story?'
body: b'The story line was so hard to follow I found myself wondering where the story line was.  I was never able to finish it and was falling asleep by the second chapter.  Terrible writing from one of the worlds best storytellers.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Boring'
body: b"Hated the book....very depressing....I most assuredly did not expect another Harry Potter but I did expect a book that at least I could finish...she should stick to what she does best....so many more avenues she can take in the HP series by developing the other characters....I also heard they are making a movie of this book....YIKES....can't imagine anyone going to see it...except maybe people in the UK....very disappointed that's all I can say"

author: b'Anna Larson'
title: b'The worst book I have ever read....heed my warning and skip this one'
body: b'I received this book as a gift, and I should have quit reading it after the first chapter.  It was twisted, hard to read, depressing and disturbing.  The end of the book was completely anti-climatic and there was no plot or conclusion that tied the whole thing together.  The entire book consisted of the meanderings and selfish actions of various people in a community. I kept thinking that the book had to get better once I got through the agonizing torture of trying to keep track of all the different characters and their relationships. No such luck!'

author: b'GWD'
title: b'A Very Good Book.'
body: b'While this book will not be in the canon of western literature 50 years from now it is still a good book. The book has characters that are all flawed even the one who is held to be a the greatest man in the town. It also makes you question issues because everything is not black and white.  The end does not end on a sad or happy note but a mix of both. The only complaints I have with this book is that it does not make an impression that will last for years. The other complaint is that a serious situation is used at the end to keep a character likeable at the end which turns it into a plot device.'

author: b'Kathy Brawley'
title: b"It's a keeper"
body: b'An intelligent piece of fiction.  I find the characters very believable and the writing very engaging.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'not for kids'
body: b'this book is not for harry potter kids it for ad. do not think this is about make be. it is about kids in the real w'

author: b'SavannaIce'
title: b'Just so so story.'
body: b'Sort of a soap opera type narrative.  Too many characters with too slow a direction.  Her latest book was very much liked.'

author: b'JimH'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"This book is social commentary.  It is a hyperbole of misfortune and misunderstanding.  The book starts off dark, and things only move from bad to worse.  It isn't for those looking for a light hearted tale of life in the English countryside; it's grim, and it tackles grave topics, most of which have no clear answer or solution."

author: b'Sue Jaqua'
title: b'Book'
body: b'This book is a departure from Harry Potter.  It was a bit raunchy but maybe the author was trying to write something entirely different.'

author: b'T. Campaign'
title: b'Ugh for Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I loved the Harry Potter books.  I hated this book so much that I couldn't get past page 85. I don't find pornography to be entertaining. I never found the plotline."

author: b'SIDNEY M. SENSING'
title: b'J. K. Rowling is the best when it comes to Book experiences!'
body: b"Couldn't help to love anything written by J. K. Rowling and looking forward to her new series of books coming out about the happenings before Hogwarts; bring it on and let me add more of her books to my collection."

author: b'Tracy'
title: b'Haunting and skillfully written.'
body: b"For some reason I'm reminded of Edith Wharton's books when reading The Casual Vacancy. Each character is so authentic and individual but somehow Ms. Rowling is also able to remind us that no single experience is solitary. You might think that you are completely singular and alone with your thoughts in this world, but it's a safe bet that one of your neighbors is having the exact same thoughts."

author: b"John O'Connor"
title: b'Excellent and shrewd'
body: b"Excellent writing. Very shrewd observation of characters. It's not life as we would like it but it's life as it is. Black humour softens the realisation."

author: b'Bobbie Linton'
title: b'F bomb all over the place'
body: b'We were warned that it was an adult book but most adults do not want to hear or read something that has the F word over and over throughout the whole book!  Totally unnecessary.  My husband would not even listen the the CDs.  We only got two CDs in and put it away - unable to finish it.'

author: b'Tomi Alger'
title: b'skip this book'
body: b'I did not like The Casual Vacancy. I found it vulgar and depressing. There was little hope for any of the characters, who were selfish and mean. The rampant use of the f-word lowered my liking of the book. One good point of the book is that unseen ramifications of what someone posts on the Internet is evidenced.  I did read the whole book and was disappointed in how it ends. I do have several friends who started it and did not like it, and, therefore, never finished it. I am interested in viewing the murder-detective mystery that Rowling has also written, but if it is anything like the Casual Vacancy, i will not be interested in anything else she writes.'

author: b'Debbie Marshall'
title: b'Enjoyed the characters and story line.'
body: b"The characters were so intriguingly unique.  The description of the backdrop and character were so vivid for the imagination. Once started reading didn't want want to stop. Initially there was some issues with the number of characters involved and their purpose. Great writing!"

author: b'Sandra Duell'
title: b'Great read'
body: b"Haven't read the Harry potter series as the genre doesn't appeal so was a bit apprehensive before reading this book but was really surprised at how great this book is. Brilliant characters and a great story line. Look forward to her next 'adult' book"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Forget everything Harry Potter'
body: b'There is no Harry Potter about this book. Forget she wrote them. This was amazing, small town secrets, British humour, I loved it. Sometimes sad, sometimes dark and disturbing. All together great. I am looking forward to reading more.'

author: b'Wordsmith'
title: b'slow moving story - a tortoise'
body: b"The story began with a man's death -- then many characters were introduced very soon thereafter.  The story line was the tortoise (to Harry Potter as the hare)  In the first hundred pages I had to go back and read half dozen sections to figure out who was who; basically I got lost with so many characters at once.(e.g. was Shirley related to Maureen or was Howard same person as Mr.Price?)"

author: b'Chrissy J'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"It's all in the detail"

author: b'Maurice'
title: b'Not greatt'
body: b'Far too long for the nature of the content fount it became boreing.Found it good as a sleeping potion.Thank you'

author: b'Robert John Keefe'
title: b'Mistress of a New Agenda'
body: b'In "The Casual Vacancy," J K Rowling demonstrates that she commands the techniques that have given us the great English novels  rich characters, dense social relations that are far too complicated and ambiguous to be called "networks," well-mounted plotting, and the humor with which to grasp the comedy of English provincial life. But she puts these techniques to a new purpose, upending the complacent, status-quo loving resolution of traditional novels. Astonishingly, Rowling infiltrates the English village novel with a trumpeting cry for social justice. Not to worry, though; "The Casual Vacancy" is a lovely read.'

author: b'nat'
title: b'I was excited to get this book...at first'
body: b'I am a huge Harry Potter fan and so I was very excited to read this book.  I was disappointed when first starting the book as it took a while to become engaged.  As I read through the book I found that I enjoyed it more but it was certainly not on my list of great reads.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Awful!'
body: b"I don't even want to give it one star!  It is awful.  I struggled through 50 pages and cannot go on!  Too many characters to follow. I want my money back."

author: b'Joy'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Probably not for everyone (what is)? But I loved it! Maybe because I am an unapologetic Anglophile, but I loved the characters from depiction through interaction. JK is unfailing in her descriptions of English life & surroundings. But make no mistake Rowling fans, this is a major departure. This is a book for grown-ups. So if your stuck at Hogwarts, and can't imagine a writer stepping away from her usual output, steer clear!"

author: b'Joyce Eslinger'
title: b'Disappointed in Ms. Rowling'
body: b'My kids grew up reading Harry Potter, and I enjoyed the books, too. Ms. Rowling created many wonderful,engaging characters along with the necessary awful ones.'

author: b'makelly'
title: b'It was okay.'
body: b'it was Okay. I probably with never read it again but it was an ok read the one time I did.'

author: b'Sherry'
title: b'Rowling does not disappoint'
body: b"J. K. Rowling creates a compelling story with unique characters and intricate plot.  You will have a hard time putting this story down.  Adults will now be the beneficiaries of Rowling's talent as a writer.  I will be watching for the next book!"

author: b'weasel'
title: b'an interesting read'
body: b'Once you figure out the many characters I the story,it became very interesting to follow how they were all tied together.'

author: b'E. J. Lawrence'
title: b'A vacant casualty'
body: b'She\'s a wonderful writer, of course, and the book has its messages--but I don\'t need these particular messages ... and all of the characters are unlikable. Now, The Cuckoo\'s Calling is "a different story," loved it. Didn\'t love this one.'

author: b'Luann o'
title: b'I quit reading after chapter ??????'
body: b"Simply awful. This book only sold because of authors name. So sorry I payed for this book. It's about a bunch of complaining people, hateful people."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Too dark for me'
body: b'I was disappointed with how she made each character out to be some kind of perverted monster, then everyone was fine and dandy at the end.  It was just a bit unbelievable to me.  I felt like I needed to wash my mind after I was done.'

author: b'sanjay m. krishnamurthy'
title: b"Matches Cuckoo's Calling in mediocricy"
body: b'Imagine tons of characters. Twists and turns in the story on every page. All these twists+turns leading nowehere !! Then throw in a totally anti-climactic ending on the 500th page. All that J.KRowling has proved with her 2 latest books are:'

author: b'RexD'
title: b'It is just too dismal'
body: b'This is one of the few books I simply could not finish reading.  The whole setup was too full of disfunctional characters, with some of the main ones being the worst.  It felt like it was set up to pivot around the oped that was sent in by one of the town counsellors just before he died.  He sets up a young (and visibly wayward) girl as a star, and she is set up as a disaster.  Unfortunately, that setup disappears.'

author: b'Criticalthinker'
title: b'A sour view of small-town muggles'
body: b"Full disclosure: I seem to be the only human who detests the entire Harry Potter franchise, and I am no Rowling fan.  So why would I read a 500-page book penned by her?  Curiosity.  I wondered what this billionaire, mega-successful author had to say to and about adults in the real world, after spending so many years in the happy fantasyland of kiddie lit.  Well, she has a lot to say, and all of it is depressing.  A Casual Vacancy could be subtitled Dreadful People Behaving Badly in a Picturesque Town.  It's Britain under a microscope, analyzed by a dispeptic depressive.  It's misanthropy and despair.  The book is bleak."

author: b'Tamera Longfellow'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'The story is slow and the print is so close to the binding that it makes it difficult to read.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Just okay.'
body: b"I don't care for the explicit sex references, but suppose I should get over that.  Otherwise, it is pretty good."

author: b'Elisabeth Forrest'
title: b'Beautifully Character Driven'
body: b"Although I am a big fan of Rowling's Harry Potter books, I was in no rush to read this due to my ever-growing reading wish list. I picked it up as a book on CD from the library and started listening to it in the car driving to and from work. My commute is short and after a couple of days I was so hooked that getting a part of a chapter a day was not going to cut it and I wasn't willing just to drive around town aimlessly to listen to more of the story, so I picked up a copy in order to read it faster."

author: b'Jerry Brookman'
title: b'A good read'
body: b'The author creates some interesting characters and situations.  While parts of it are grim and sad, it kept my attention and I found the ending to be good, though inevitably sad.'

author: b'William Van Gee'
title: b'Sure not Harry Potter'
body: b'A whole new type of writing from the Potter series. It seems that Ms. Rowling has a new dictionary and tries to use new words at every juncture. Story was just OK'

author: b'Brian'
title: b'Not much to enjoy'
body: b'Bleh...  Quit on it. Hated the characters and pretty much everything about it. Might finish it if I have nothing else to read.'

author: b'bookqueenshelby'
title: b'Very powerful book!'
body: b"First of all. I actually can really picture this book coming to life. I live in a small town with lots of the same type people involved in politics in it. JK Rowling nailed that on the head. Back biting and smiling to each other's face all in a day in the life..but anyways..."

author: b'new homeowner'
title: b'Did not disappoint'
body: b"I loved the Harry Potter books and sort of expected not to like her shift in genre. The story line is comletely different but after just a few pages, the characters were completely real and alive and the story engrossing. She has not lost her touch - I came away a true believer in J.K. Rowling's ongoing ability to spin a story !"

author: b"xochitl o'toole"
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Every time I start to read this book, I fall asleep. I was excited to buy it after seeing the reviews, but it is a slow moving book about sleepy towns. I have to keep going back just to remember when the characters were introduce and who they are related to. With the Harry Potter series, I couldn't put the books down and usually finish each book in a day or two. Bought The Casual Vacancy a month ago and I am not even half way. I will finish it though seeing that I spent good money on it."

author: b'Maia Rose'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Had to read a new book by J. K. Rowling.  A complete departure from Harry Potter, it was a great read and well written.'

author: b'SKM'
title: b'STM'
body: b'The character development was great. The people in this book were unhappy but very real. The small town politics were well developed.'

author: b'Arkansas Red'
title: b'Not great, just okay.'
body: b"The story dragged on for way too long, bogged down in local political details.  It just wasn't that interesting, at least to me."

author: b'Sally H. Moore'
title: b'Politics as usual?'
body: b'This story kept my interest, sounds like welfare in America, sadly.  I did not like the "F" word and the way the kids and parents reacted to each other, but I am elderly and my children are grown.  It\'s a different world out there!'

author: b'Susanna Chastain'
title: b"What's not to like?"
body: b"Don't compare, just sit back and read and enjoy.  Well conceived characters, interesting plot.  Like a play you want to give a standing ovation."

author: b'melissa keller'
title: b'slow getting started'
body: b'I really liked Casual Vacancy, except there was a bit too much background information at the beginning. it took me half way thru the book to really get into it.'

author: b'Finnbar2001'
title: b'Great Read'
body: b'Loved the narrative, such a studied observance of human thoughts.  Relevant and it took a while to read so lasted a while.'

author: b'Parrywinkel'
title: b'Intriguing & Socially Informative'
body: b'I enjoy novels that step beyond the \'politically accepted\' and challenge us to think of our society on a deeper level.  Harry\'s story required us to face the issues of bullying, evil, and dishonesty and look at bravery both socially and emotionally.  "The Casual Vacancy" requires us to face our prejudices, our attitudes, and the social classes.  It is not different but very much \'the same style\' which JK Rowling has used to address issues about which no one wants to talk.  Rowling is a clever writer with the gift of storytelling.  I will read anything she cares to write because she cares enough to write about it.'

author: b'M. Sander'
title: b'AWFUL'
body: b"If you were somehow unaware that the world can be a hard, cruel place, or you just can't get enough of reading about it in your leisure time, this is the book for you.  I can't even finish it, it was so disturbing.  Sad, sick people and their sad pitiful off spring make you go diving for the razor blades.  What a downer.  And a big disappointment from someone who has so much talent."

author: b'SarahLawrence Scott'
title: b"Shows off Rowling's strengths and weaknesses in a non-fantasy, adult format"
body: b"While considerably different in subject matter and content, the Casual Vacancy exhibits many of Rowling's traits, both strong and weak, familiar to readers of the Harry Potter series. (And face it, you probably are thinking of buying this because you know Rowling from that series.)"

author: b'Rosalie Cranston'
title: b'Not Harry Potter by a long shot.'
body: b'I was less than impressed with this book.  It has so many characters that I got tired before I finished reading the book and gave up.  I loved the Harry Potter books, but thought she had too many different story lines going at once in this one.'

author: b'nancy brickner'
title: b"The language was so bad, though I could have finished this if I tried.  It was better than the Cucoo's Calling."
body: b"Language too crude for my taste; otherwise I might have liked it. I stopped reading it as I did the Cucoo's Calling."

author: b'Diane V. Murrell'
title: b'Crude content and depressing'
body: b"I loved the Harry Potter series and purchased this solely on the strength of the former books excellence. I found the Casual Vacancy, however, to be crude in it's vocabulary, depressing and poorly written. None of the skill of story telling or descriptive writing or character development were evident.  I could not bring myself to finish the book. Regardless of this opinion of this book I remain a huge fan of Ms. Rowling's other works and consider her Potter series all time classics."

author: b'G. McMullen'
title: b'Not quite Harry Potter but very good'
body: b'Interesting, good characters, did leave you hanging a bit at the end, could have used some closer on some of the issues at the end of the book'

author: b'Brian'
title: b'Uninteresting characters'
body: b'I read 250 pages and finally skipped ahead 50 pages at a time, then to the last few pages to see how it concluded. The ending was boring and too easily predictable. At almost 500 pages, this novel could have been half that, as there is little positive character development.'

author: b'Jaclyn L. Wenner'
title: b'Clarity weak'
body: b'Characters were not developed enough to really feel involved in the plot or care what happened to whom.  I had a hard time finishing it.  I always try to finish and find a redeeming grace, but found none this time.'

author: b'Daniel P'
title: b'Poor story, good writing'
body: b'Writing is good, story chopped up and very depressing.  I finished it only because the writing was good, was my first Kindle read'

author: b'Patricia A. Goss'
title: b'Bad Language!'
body: b"The language was to raw for my reading pleasure. I started it and read only a few chapters and put it away. I wouldn't consider giving it as a gift!"

author: b'Janice P. Baker'
title: b"It's Okay"
body: b'I liked it, although I felt it could have had more drama, rather than so much in-depth psychological aspects of the characters.'

author: b'Glenys Rockell'
title: b"I don't do reviews, but..."
body: b'Easy read, and I enjoyed the multitude of characters and each of their stories. Good bit of escapism, and not too heavy.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Characters to care about'
body: b'I am not normally a fan of the English novel but this drew me in with complex characters and a marvelous setting.  These people are flawed and muddling through their circumstances which makes them interesting.  I picked this up because it was written by J. K Rowling but after the first chapter, I forgot all about that and just enjoyed the story.'

author: b'Sunny Day'
title: b'Depressing'
body: b"I did not like this book. There were too many characters, none of whom you would want to know. The chapters were too short, resulting in a choppy story. I kept wondering what was the point of the entire plot? The characters started out as unlikable people and ended that way, with maybe one or two exceptions. The story is about a horrible town with very flawed residents! Hopefully this small town only exists in Rowling's imagination. Don't waste your money on this book."

author: b'Sue W. Elliott'
title: b'Better than I expected:'
body: b"Haven't finished it but I find it well written and good character study of life in a small English village.  Interesting people with paths that cross in the geographic place they are planted."

author: b'Aaron House'
title: b'The End Justifies the Beginning'
body: b"First off, I admit that I had to start this book twice to get through it.  Rowling takes a long time (the first half of the book) setting the stage for the action that comes in the second half.  But, having now read the entire book, the first half is justified.  At its core, I think that The Casual Vacancy is a character study.  Rowling is delving deep into the human heart and the human condition.  She doesn't paint a rosy picture of humanity (she didn't in Harry Potter, either, by the way).  Instead, she is candid in revealing a portion of humanity as it is: fallen, flawed, often limited by circumstance, and self-centered.  Rowling takes the time necessary to explain and examine the human beings she portrays.  These character examinations make up much of the first half of the book.  I think the difficulty in starting this book and staying with it is the lack of focus on plot in the first half of the book.  In the end, that's a great thing."

author: b'Carole Valentine'
title: b'I hated it'
body: b'That was the worst book I have ever read! I kept reading in the hopes that it would improve. It did not!'

author: b'Ellen Hamilton'
title: b'An Amazing Author...not just for kids anymore'
body: b'J.K. Rowling is a phenomenal writer.  However, "Casual Vacancy" was not one of her best.  Check out "Cuckoo\'s Calling" for a really great read.  You\'ll never guess \'whodunit!\''

author: b'Kathleen C. Lehman'
title: b'Characters and Plot are a downer'
body: b'While the writing is lovely, the characters and the plot are not.  The village is full of mean spirited and bitter people doing mean spirited and bitter things.  I could not find anyone to root for as the story unfolded.  Too bad because the prose itself is nice.'

author: b'Katie C.'
title: b'Excellent read!'
body: b'J.K. Rowling writes great characters, she demonstrates diversity, humor, education, and drama. I was very entertained throughout. She is a smart writer.'

author: b'SS'
title: b'The greatest mistake of J.K.Rowling'
body: b'By having the 2nd ever sold book (HP series) in terms of quantity in the history of the humankind, Rowling created a brand for her name, possibly one of the strongest brands in the world and definitelly in the literature field. Million army of fans was ready to buy Hogwarts library books, the tales of beedle the bard, and the foresaken Harry Potter encyclopedia that will never appear, unfortunately. So what does she do? She destroys that brand by going in completely different niche. From childish, teen type of a book that actually suited perfectly even adults into some dirty and nasty book that made me vomit. It is like, if Maybach started to produce Smart type of cars from tomorrow. Totally illogical, nonsense. Who is she now? What can we expect from her? Another adult book that depicts the ugly parts of our lives? Instead of being number one in the teen niche of the book shops, she digged a grave for her name and her brand. It does not matter whether you liked or not the book so much. It matters that Rowling moved into another direction. It is up to you to like it or not. However, it is utterly disappointing that the possibility of seeing HP like books is vanishing year by year. And who else, if not Rowling, could give us those magical hours of reading and rereading the book?  Excuse me, but there are thousand of writers in the same adult genre and if I want something more realistic and criminalistic, I will 100% find a good book in the nearest book shop. But WILL YOU FIND A GOOD book for your children that will keep them away from computer? I doubt that.'

author: b'TJM'
title: b'Good read, well written.'
body: b'Good read. She tells a story really so well. This being said, the story  did not go anywhere and it seemed to be just a 500 page book that could have been written as a kick ass 150 page one.  I love this author so it is hard to not like anything that she writes and of course I will buy her new one.  Instead of buying it, borrow from a friend is the way to go or library it for sure.'

author: b'Dan Thompson, Author'
title: b'Not Just a One Trick Pony'
body: b'After being won over by the hype of The Casual Vacancy, her first adult novel, I decided to give this a go and thankfully I was proven wrong.'

author: b'Dolores Christensen'
title: b'Ironic Title'
body: b"The title is ironic......the vacancy caused by the council member's sudden death is not unimportant as casual implies. His absence effects the Council and the entire town.Ms. Rowling knows psychology and the characters react in a realistic way.Also,as a retired Social Worker, her descrcriptions of problem families and how we TRY to help are real.Subtracted 1 star for a bit too much obscenity for my taste."

author: b'Nelda R. Wellard'
title: b'Great'
body: b'It is a good read!  JK Rowling has done it again!  Keep up the good work cause I love your books!'

author: b'Roxanne Townsend'
title: b'read the first 50 or so pages could not get into this story!'
body: b'I am very disappointed! Finally set it aside for another book. Life is too short to waste on an uninteresting book. Disappointed'

author: b'Amazon customer'
title: b"Couldn't finish"
body: b"Don't waste your $$'s on this one. I rarely put a book down, but this one was so bad I had to stop reading it. No redemptive value."

author: b'oweihyoiqsgI'
title: b'very boring'
body: b'Expected more action  and drama.  I had to make myself finish it.  Felt like I was wasting my time eavesdropping.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Excellent read!'
body: b"What a good read!! The setting and characterisation of a small rural village and it's people are great. The story includes humour, drama and a wide variety of characters to make it more than interesting."

author: b'Joyce Easton'
title: b'Not what I expected'
