body: b'Having never read any of the Harry Potter books, I was looking forward to reading this book.  Our book club, the Novelettes, selected this for our August read.  When we met to discuss the book, no one had anything good to say, and some of the members stopped reading after a few 100 pages.  I continued to read it, because I kept expecting it to get better.  Having been an elected official on a council, I was amused by some of the antics when trying to fill a vacancy.  But it was not worth the time it took to read 503 pages.'

author: b'Karlynn Kern'
title: b'Very Entertaining'
body: b'I felt like a resident in the small town of Pagford, England. I'

author: b'DEE P.'
title: b'A domestic small town thriller in a different vein.'
body: b'This book was a page turner and the details of everyday life, especially for the impoverished was so accurate.'

author: b'Amazon Customer.  amott'
title: b'J K hits  a fresh unexpected home run'
body: b'Wonderful book filled with deep quirky characters who  repel the reader as well as mesmerize.  Exactly the well woven story we have come to expect from this author!'

author: b'S. Hays'
title: b'Long slow start, good finish - worth the effort'
body: b"I gave up on this book twice before starting over and finally finishing it. In the first 300 pages or thereabouts, the characters seemed to me to be unrelievedly and unrealistically bleak, as though the author herself was mistaking poverty and meanness for authenticity, like her adolescent character Fats Wall. The omniscient framework that let the reader into every character's head showed only the worst of each person: fear, pettiness, and selfishness, with the only pleasures coming from sticking a pin in someone else. The offscreen Barry Fairbrother was apparently the only decent person in town, although even he was a bit of a jerk in the first couple of pages before he died and created the casual vacancy."

author: b'Rachel Jensby'
title: b"I didn't care about any of the characters until the book was almost over..."
body: b"I loved the HP series (I read them to my children as they were growing up).  It is THE most fun I've ever had reading a story.  So, when JK Rowling had another literary offering, I wanted to read it.  I was looking forward to finding out what she would write for adults."

author: b'Susan Corda'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'I found the book hard to read I had to work at it to read and I only read the first four chapters. It was like going to school and doing homework'

author: b'G. Little'
title: b'Not what I expected'
body: b'I kept waiting to get to the good part and suddenly the book was over.  Took me 2 months to'

author: b'Cynthia Snowden'
title: b'Yuck!'
body: b'I confess -- I read to escape.  And to escape to a better place, or at least a familiar one.  This book starts off with unpleasant people doing unpleasant things in unpleasant places.  Who needs this?  Pas moi.'

author: b'Roland D. Fesmire'
title: b'Reminded me of Sinclair Lewis'
body: b'Great writing and great characterization. Read only if you intend to slowly digest the plot and character interactions. Not a quick read.'

author: b'Philip Osborne'
title: b'Fantastic Read'
body: b'A real page turner. The characters are so real and their stories so realistic. JK Rowling has tapped into village life an written about people we meet every day. The Casual Vacancy is an amazing book.'

author: b'meranda'
title: b'Decent'
body: b"The hype on this book really worked against it. Since it was the first post-Potter book, a lot of assumptions and expectations were made that it couldn't live up to. An okay story, just not one you'd expect from the world's most famous author today. Definitely not for children."

author: b'T. Wendt'
title: b'Engaging'
body: b'Overall, engaging reading. There are lots of characters and it takes a while to understand the family and social connections.'

author: b'WilmaNC'
title: b'Excellent!!!'
body: b'Having never read any of the Harry Potter books, and only being able to tolerate the first movie, ( I am an adult...) I thoroughly enjoyed this book. In this age of complaining about poor people acting entitled, it was refreshing to read about the way life really is for some people, and to show some of the compassion that can be given, if people just open their eyes to what is around them. I loved the book, loved the characters, loved Ms. Rowlings writing style. I hope she writes more books for adults in the future. Highly recommend this book!!'

author: b'Ann'
title: b'Thoughtful and thought-provoking'
body: b'This is a complicated story about people being there for each other, and failing each other. The story unfolds subtly with humor and pathos. I came to really care about the characters and went back to re-read parts and make sure I understood what happened and what was said. There are no magic wand solutions, but the author shows the same understanding that we all are neither inherently evil or good, but defined by our choices as in her earlier books. Very well written.'

author: b'Sandy P'
title: b'definitely worth your time'
body: b'I have never read a Harry Potter book, so I can be objective and make no comparisons. Plot kept my interest.  Good character development and interesting ties between the characters. Gave new meaning to "living and dying by our actions and decisions.". The last few pages left a bit to be desired.  Felt like a quick wrap up and could have been better structured.'

author: b'Jane G.'
title: b"Don't like it"
body: b"It read like a teenage novel.  It was way too simplistic.  I really didn't like it at all."

author: b'Pen Name'
title: b'Ms. Rowling disappoints'
body: b"I couldn't believe that the person who had such a wonderful way with language and plot could have written this novel.  I had to force myself to finish it, and then I wondered why I actually read the whole thing,  It never got better."

author: b'CM'
title: b'Okay'
body: b'This book seemed like J.K. Rowling was trying too hard to write for adults. The book is about a town no one would want to live in and all the messed up people who live there. Apparently the one "good" person has died creating the Casual Vacancy on the town board which causes everyone\'s secrets to be exposed. Not something I would recommend reading.'

author: b'Andrea  L Heath'
title: b"It's just okay"
body: b"Still reading this. It is not one of those books that you can't put down. Not Potterish, but not great either"

author: b'CLAIRE BIRNBAUM'
title: b'a different type of reading!'
body: b'It is amazing how from a simple day to day small town occurence, an excellent writer can create a compelling story! Kept me wanting to read to the end.'

author: b'Lisa  A.  Garcia'
title: b'I love it!!!!'
body: b"Amazing! Fantastic! Seriously awesome! Way to go, Ms. Rowling!!! You rock the pages of any story and allow the reader to jump into you imagination for many warm fuzzy's!!!"

author: b'keason'
title: b'such a depressing take on society'
body: b"I guess it tells an ugly truth, but i was hoping for more humor and less commentary on man's inhumanity to man."

author: b'Robert J. Landy'
title: b'A bit too confusing'
body: b'Have a problem  keeping the characters apart.  But I have not finished the book yet.  Doubt if I will change my mind at completion.'

author: b'Wayward Kitsune'
title: b"It was ok but didn't captivate me like HP has"
body: b'Plot'

author: b'Julie Susan Wood'
title: b'a great read'
body: b'I really enjoyed reading this this book. I was different from the Harry Potter series but just as well written as as they were.'

author: b'D. Gustavson'
title: b'Whew.'
body: b"This caught me by surprise, getting more intense as it went along. I'm going to recommend it to some social worker friends."

author: b'Virginia Beasley'
title: b'J. K. Rowling - Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I did not read this book.  I purchased it for my granddaughter, age 15.  I know that it was'

author: b'Lori'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'If you enjoyed any of her hobbit stories you will definitely enjoy this mystery a quick read  very interesting storyline. she is a master at creating characters you grow to dislike intensely as you continue...I loved it'

author: b'Mike'
title: b'A sad story!'
body: b"Too many characters right from the start; it's a little confusing! A third through, I finally figure out the different families! The story is very dark, and it's haunting to read about all the dysfunctional families, and how the young ones are affected by them! Quite sad actually!"

author: b'KayN'
title: b'I Read The Entire Book!'
body: b'Yes, I read the entire book, even after I had to go back and reread a hundred or so pages because the author had so many different characters in this book and went into such great detail that it ended up being a lot of telling and not showing.  If this would have been a series, perhaps it would have been acceptable, but not in a single book.'

author: b'Beverley Gutscher'
title: b'A great read.'
body: b'Ms Rowling has an amazing command of the English language.  SO well written, you can "hear" the characters speaking.  A wonderful book, incorporating and acknolwedging many aspects of typical English small town life previously not recognized in anything I have read.  Don\'t expect a precise plot or a definitive beginning, middle, end.  This book is about people, and life with all its turbulance and peculiarities.  A great read, especially if you have any experience of small town English living.  I hope there will be more like it to come.'

author: b'What A Nerd Girl Says'
title: b'Full Review on my Book Blog!'
body: b'I currently run my own book blog and you can check out my full review of the book here. All of my reviews are spoiler free, unless otherwise noted!  [...]'

author: b'Mary Balacuit'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy is no Harry Potter'
body: b"As opposed to all the negative reviews for The Casual Vacancy, my opinion for the book is that it is one of JK's yet another good books."

author: b'sharon bunker'
title: b'would not recommend this book'
body: b'The story is not well developed. The characters are introduced in such a way they confuse the reader. None of the characters is developed into either an agonist or protagonist. It is hard to get involved in a story when you feel no investment in the characters or story line.'

author: b'Jennifer Harness'
title: b'nothing casual in this writing.'
body: b'Written with the care and detail of writers from the past. I feel as if I know the individual characters personally. I was a little disappointed with the ending, I would have preferred the final insight to have come from one of the other characters.'

author: b'Nimish'
title: b'Trash by JK Rowling'
body: b'It has been couple of weeks since I bought this book under a dollar fromkindle. It has been a journey of pain completing this book. The book lacks excitement and has multiple characters going in circles around the death of a councillor. I would not recommend this book to anyone.'

author: b'William W. Mouroux'
title: b'Not an easy read to relate to'
body: b'The style of this story is very different from the well liked Harry Potter series and difficult to relate to any single character. Almost seems like another version of "Catcher in the Rye" with all the swearing, coarse language, and criticisms. As usual, the kids are'

author: b'CalvinHobbes'
title: b'Different'
body: b'I enjoyed this book, but I found it slow, (Unlike Cuckoo Calling, Robert Galbraith aka JK Rowling) It had a good moral but I felt a bit let down with the end.'

author: b'Fran'
title: b'Great Read'
body: b'I really liked the story that shows the dynamic of a small village.  I live in a small town and know how people think they are so much better than everyone else because of their property or if they are on council.  They have the same problems as everyone else.'

author: b'Jack Hansen'
title: b'Too depressing; not what I expected.'
body: b'Brace yourself to hear offensive language in this British account of misery, helplessness, and hopelessness.  I made it through the 2 CD set but it was not enjoyable.  If anything, it describes the treatment people receive when the government is expected to provide for its citizens in a socialistic manner.  No evidence of philanthropy anywhere and a statement that life is meaningless without the morals and virtues taught in the Bible.'

author: b'kathy'
title: b'GLAD I READ IT!'
body: b"I read the book she wrote after this one and I liked it.I had read that the reviews were bad on Casual Vacancy . I 'm glad didn't listen.I think people were shocked because this was so different from HARRY POTTER."

author: b'Ted and Donna Rogers'
title: b'Casual confusion'
body: b"Too many characters, some with two names, that are not fleshed out until too late to make this interesting.  I wouldn't recommend it as a must read."

author: b'EK'
title: b"Wouldn't want to live with those folks...."
body: b'It was really hard to want to get to know any of the characters. I found them all mean spirited, small minded and nasty. Not at all what I want to believe about bucolic small towns where neighbors are kind, thoughtful, and helpful to one another.'

author: b'Sharen Metz'
title: b'A gripping story that grabs your heart'
body: b'This wonderful story begins in an unassuming way, to develop character, plot and conflict, all emanating  from the death of one man in the town of Pagford. The author skillfully draws us into the complexity of behaviors and actions by juxtaposing one character to another and raising unresolved issues in every chapter. As the "plot thickens", tensions rise until a bitter ending causes change within the town and its people. This story is a highly satisfying "read". while also drawing  one\'s attention to the frailty and flaws of human nature.'

author: b'Sheri'
title: b"This is NOT your kid's Harry Potter"
body: b'I am BEYOND tired of people comparing this book to the Harry Potter series.  People.  JK Rowlings is a WRITER, which means she will write what comes into her imagination, not just continue the same old, same old to satisfy readers who hold repetition dear.  This same criticism was railed agains Elizabeth George when she stepped back from her Dectective Inspector Lynley character and wrote a novel from a different perspective (although Lynley was tied in at the end).'

author: b'Charles W. Brice'
title: b'Worth the Effort'
body: b"A Casual Vacancy is structured like a Victorian novel: many characters written in the omniscient point of view so that the author can slip in and out of the minds of each character. The book is complex and multilayerd. JKR begins with the death of Barry Fairbrother, a councilman in the small down of Pagford. His death causes ripples to move through the cauldron of pettiness that is Pagford revealing the truth behind the facades of many of the most prominent members of the community. This book comes the closest of any I've read in years of replicating the experience of being a psychotherapist, of learning what most lives are really about behind their appearances. JKR's psychological acumen is outstanding, especially when portraying the dynamics between prominent hypocritical parents and their mostly dramatically disturbed offspring. In the character of Simon Price, she presents the best depiction of a malignant narcissist I've ever read. The first 60-80 pages are difficult because the author presents many characters (reminiscent of Richard Russo) and the reader must work to keep them straight, but the labor involved is more than richly rewarded. I'm afraid that the books mixed reviews are coming from reviewers (even from some of our most prominent newspapers) who simply don't want to spend the time on complex novels that can't be speed read. God knows what these reviewers would have done with Dostoevsky or Tolstoy. They certainly lose patience with other brilliant authors - Murakami, for instance. Anyway, A Casual Vacancy is a brilliant novel, worthy of the woman who created the Potter series."

author: b'M. Falcon'
title: b'Slow start, heavy ending'
body: b"This one was just okay, nothing fantastic. I enjoyed how the story flowed smoothly from one character to the next, rather than jumping around like a lot of books do to follow each character's story line. The transitions were natural and made reading comfortable. That being said, I felt the book had a very slow start. I was disappointed when I reached the halfway point and we were still talking about the same man's death. Then we jump forward to the end and everything happens all at once. The events naturally needed to happen to end the story, I just wish they were spread out a little, I felt like I was being rushed out of the story by the end of it. It also seemed as though JK has lined the ending up to make a sequel, which bugged me a little with the open ended-ness of the different characters' happenings. All in all I'm disappointed I bought it full price and won't read it again HOWEVER, I probably would pick up a second if it turns into a series."

author: b'Jennifer M. Resendez'
title: b'Enjoyed this book'
body: b'As an American I know little about your typical English village so was very interested in the details and background story.  The story itself is bleak and to me thought the ending was cut short.  I would recommend this book b/c I was quickly pulled into the story and characters.'

author: b'texas girl makes good'
title: b'Just forget about Harry Potter...'
body: b"Aside from her usual fine, sophisticated writing style, JK Rowling has left Hogwarts behind. The good guys don't always win. The bad guys don't get their due. It's not a book for kids."

author: b'grandma flo'
title: b'good read'
body: b'This book was very well written. The story is about the  lives and politics of a small English village. It is a microcosm of'

author: b'Patricia W. Golde'
title: b'A great but difficult read'
body: b'J K Rowling is one of the great writers working today. She develops her story line with care and ingenuity. Her sentence structure is beautiful.  However for me the simultaneity of the story lines and the intertwining of her characters is a chore to handle especially since my reading vehicle is a kindle.'

author: b'judy davis'
title: b"JK's Dark Side"
body: b'Rowling spent too much time building/describing/listing features of characters that were neither interesting nor important to the plot.'

author: b'Leona Ramsay'
title: b'I thought she was a better writer tthan this'
body: b'This book was so dreary I could not read it all the way thru.  It would be very nice if she would write something as livly as her Harry Potter books.'

author: b'Coup183'
title: b'I found a new writer'
body: b"She's off to a great start and I'll be watching for the next one. I like the format she's using and the chapter headings."

author: b'Christine Goode'
title: b'Hard to read yet hard to put down'
body: b'My husband downloaded this book for me since I am a frequent traveler and thought it would be an "easy" read - meaning I wouldn\'t miss my flight because I got engrossed in the plot. All I can say is that I would have had to have read all 1000+ pages to get to the plot because this book is NOT a casual read. You have to really pay attention to the people and who belongs with whom or you will really lose the impact of the characters and their interaction.'

author: b'Gwenniepoo'
title: b'Good story'
body: b'I like JK Rowling, I like her writing style.  but I could not figure out what was going on in the story and have not been able to finish it.  I will try again.'

author: b'Chelsea'
title: b'Still havent finished it'
body: b'Had this book almost a year and cant seem to get into it. Its got a good story line; Its just slow moving.'

author: b'Frankie'
title: b'TRASH, see my review of Cuckoos Calling'
body: b"same as Cuckoos Calling. This is like walking, (running once you get the aroma) through the final level of Dante's Inferno. It is a sewer of excrement. Rowling had better return to more intellectual pursuits. The Potter series was excellent, this is stupid."

author: b'NinaRyb'
title: b'disappointing'
body: b"Unfortunately this book didn't meet my expectations. I started reading it and have put it down multiply times. It's a difficult read because there is nothing captivating or wanting you to read more happening in this book. Waste of time and money"

author: b'Ash the Flash'
title: b'Great story and characters, but sloppy editing dragged it down.'
body: b'I really liked the story that Rowling crafted in this book, but I have to say I was very surprised/disappointed at how many issues there were in the writing that could have been easily fixed if an editor had bothered to give the narrative a good look. (I could be wrong, but I\'m assuming her editor didn\'t give this much thought and perhaps just figured "It\'s JKR, of course it\'s good" and sent it to print without a thorough reading?)'

author: b'Diana Roberts'
title: b'A lumbering read, with excellent writing and depressing characters'
body: b'I got to the 32% mark in my Kindle before this book started flowing for me. The first third of the book just lumbered along introducing one unlikable character after another. The only thing that held my interest was the strong prose. Finally, a few of the younger characters came alive & I was rewarded by finishing one of the most depressing novels that I have ever read. If I did not love my EReader so much, I would have thrown it across the room after completing this very disturbing book.'

author: b'HopewelLibraryofLife'
title: b'Vivid portrayal of gritty small town life'
body: b'From the reviews here on Amazon I expected to throw this back. We all know J.K. Rowling (Harry Potter) can tell a great story, but the average for this one was only 3 stars. I think that\'s an injustice!! Once again, though, it maybe a case of the book being better on audio. Tom Hollander is a great voice for this story. Rowling\'s story begins when Parish [Town] Councilor Barry Fairbrother dies in the Country Club parking lot of natural causes in his wife\'s arms. This then creates a "casual vacancy" on the Council. What happens next is WHY the Bible tells us God keeps vengeance strictly for himself!!'

author: b'G. C. Pender'
title: b"Couldn't Finish It"
body: b"I couldn't get into this book. I forced myself to plod through a few chapters before giving up."

author: b'Carol N. Doty'
title: b'A boring story with lots of gossip'
body: b"I was eager to read a JK Rowling novel that wasn't about Harry Potter, and what a great disappointment it was.  I was bored from the beginning and then saddened to find her handling of interactions between the haves and the have nots predominantly with gossip.  I am sorry I purchased the book and was happy to give it to the library book sale rather than to a friend or family member.  Lots of authors burn out after their first book or best series.  I felt Rowling burned out before she got to this one."

author: b'dawn carter chambers'
title: b'MUCH Less than expected.'
body: b"I so looked forward to reading this book... Bought it in soft cover to take to the beach.  I'm an avid reader, and generally read on Kindle, but wanted to hold this one in my hands.  What a disappointment.. The characters were predictable, the plot was slow to develop, and the book was too long.  Only because I always finish any book I begin, I read to the bitter end of this dismal and depressing failure."

author: b'UScustomer'
title: b'Drawn-Out Soap'
body: b"Still absorbed by teenagers and unrealistic fantasies-- author seems to have little understanding of deeper adult emotions. If it's supposed to be a character study, none are very well developed, and the story is so thin you can skip entire sections without losing the thread. I wouldn't have bothered if one of my friends had read it first and warned me off"

author: b'Marie P.'
title: b'Surprised with not enjoying a J. K. Rowling book!'
body: b'I agree with some of the others that read this book. It is so boring and hard to really get into the story since I was not enjoying the read. There was too much jumping around from one family to another. I thought that since I thoroughly enjoyed all the Harry Potter books, that I would enjoy Casual Vacancy also...not in this case. I would definitely not recommend this book!'

author: b'Fran Griffis'
title: b'Good, but I expected more'
body: b'Knowing JK Rowling wrote this, I think I had very high expectations.  It is an engaging story and the writing is in her usual fluid style.  Many of the characterizations were full and well drawn, especially the young people.  I found the adults less well limned and occasionally had to back track or retrace in my head who was who.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Great character study'
body: b'Instead of "Casual Vacancy," this novel could have been called "Casual Unkindness" or even "Casual Cruelty." It shows the ease with which many people take out their own unhappiness on each other every day. J.K. Rowling, with her gift for bringing even minor characters to life, also gives them all chances to act differently, to choose the path to being a better person -- but as in real life, most of them don\'t. With evocative language and dialogue and striking turns of phrase, Ms. Rowling pulls you into the interior lives of the characters and their families.  As a long-time Harry Potter fan, I really enjoyed this complete change of tone and direction from Ms. Rowling.'

author: b'Sadie M.'
title: b'Kindle Format is Terrible'
body: b"I have very much enjoyed this book, but reading it on my kindle has been a nightmare--I have to have my font setting on the largest setting available, and even then, the font is tiny and difficult to read (I'm 29, by the way, and do not have vision problems).  I tried deleting it off my kindle and re-downloading it several times, but that didn't work, leading me to believe the font size problem is related to the e-copy itself. I would recommend going with the print edition of this."

author: b'Jeddy'
title: b'Never got beyond the first chaper'
body: b'Too wordy .  Too many characters introduced rather poorly.  Actually boring with a slow pace that never picked up.  Would not recommend.'

author: b'Fran'
title: b'Sorry I bought it'
body: b"The WORST book I have ever read! Can't believe it is by the same author as the Harry Potter Series."

author: b'Kathy Mair'
title: b'Great characters'
body: b"Rowling's gift for creating real life characters on a page is as evident here as it was in the Harry Potter series. The ending was a little flat, for me, but it was an entertaining read nonetheless."

author: b'Ellen Murphy'
title: b'Characters Without Passion'
body: b'I knew from the first that this would be a departure from Harry Potter, but I was disappointed in the entire book.  It was very hard to get started, but since others seemed to have reviewed the book without finishing, I decided to see if I could get through the text.  I did, but I am not richer for it.  There were too many characters and I simply could not keep them all straight, especially since some of the names were frequently interchanged with nicknames.  The tone of the book was quite melancholy, which was fine, but the greatest failing is that the characters were not interesting.  I simply did not care about them.  The author managed to write a pedantic book without passion, and I know she has the capability to do better.  The book is a disappointment and I can think of many other ways to spend your time.'

author: b'maryw'
title: b"Didn't like it"
body: b'Too much bad language .  Story boring. Took to long for story to develop. I have enjoyed her other novel under a different name'

author: b'Christine'
title: b'I just want to say that I did enjoy this book - the author wrote with such insight into these families - amazing.'
body: b'It was as though you were part of each different family - such insight - a book really well worth reading.'

author: b'Susan Peck'
title: b'A Casualty of Boredom'
body: b'So many characters who I care nothing about. Boring, lifeless, self serving. One star is one star too many. So disappointing'

author: b'Desmond Keats'
title: b'Average book.'
body: b"Much like her new book, published under the fake alleged SAS agent turned author Galbraith; this book is a little boring and filled with prose that just elucidates useless details that have no take on the matter at hand, and although this is treasured in Harry Potter, which is a fantasy rich with details that we are unaware of and hence love to read about...Rowling's venture into other genres seem forced and unnatural: her characters seem real but not really, you can never shake the feeling that the whole thing is fictional, that things happen as they're supposed to happen, with very little elements of surprise or thrill. Plot use elements of chaos and randomization to get characters into, and out of tough situations, and although the former is obliged, the latter feels like cheating."

author: b'Dee'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I found this book hard to capture my interest; it wasn't until the middle that I became serious about finishing it. Maybe her next novel will be more captivating."

author: b'louise a. kerr'
title: b'she needed  a good editor'
body: b"It was to long and very repetitive. She should have cut down on the number of characters--they were hard to sort out and mostly unlikeable.  It seemed uniformed about the social situations she was trying to high-light.  This might have been a good read if the publisher had not been so anxious to gain from her famous name.  I have no doubt that she has sold many books but I don't think this book was of a quality that she should be very proud of.  I advise her and her editors to take more care next time out."

author: b'Linda R. Wheeler'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I bought this book immediately after reading 'The Cuckoo's Calling', this book wasn't as enjoyable in my opinion.  I couldn't decide if it was a teenage book or what.  I found it hard to keep up with who was who, and who was married to who.  I stuck with it through the end but it wasn't one of my favorites."

author: b'friendlyfire'
title: b'Casual Vacancy still haunts me'
body: b"It is JK but not Harry, more adult and more internal. No quidditch here. It's also a lot more British. Some of the terms stumped me and the Kindle dictionary. It goes quickly and keeps the reader wanting more. It's dark too. I cried."

author: b'me'
title: b'interesting'
body: b'Not the quality I was expecting but interesting view of contemporary British village life and social issues.  Another complex plot with a multitude of interesting characters.  I prefer a writer to let the characters reveal themselves, as we know Rowling can masterfully do'

author: b'Andrew Harrison Mcminn'
title: b'Very unique.'
body: b'Jkr always is very discriptive writter. Although i would rather be reading another harry potter book. This story will tide me over.'

author: b'S. Boyer'
title: b'Audiobook is Excellent!'
body: b"This review is based on the excellent audiobook. First, my JKR background. Yes, read all HP's with my son and loved them. Thought Rowling really evolved as a writer from Book 1 to final in the series."

author: b'Beverly Rojas'
title: b'British setting'
body: b"Loved being in the small town with all the intricately woven characters.  Vocabulary was different and much more interesting that most books I've read.  Would definitely recommend it.  Left it in Thailand with a newly wed couple for their enjoyment after I finished reading it.  Definitely recommend it.  I really enjoyed J. K. Rowling's first attempt at adult fiction."

author: b'Dorothy'
title: b'This is a wonderful story.'
body: b'I could not put this book down!  Rawlings writes about real people, with all their illusions, unfulfilled hopes, hurts and self deceptions,as well as their skills, intelligence and compassion.'

author: b'Tamara'
title: b'Author'
body: b'I loved the Harry Potter series and thought I would enjoy anything she wrote.  Could not get into this particular book.'

author: b'Chrisy Loves Cows'
title: b"J.K. I'm so disappointed"
body: b'It was filthy. I was so excited to see what else she could come up with but it was hard to see past all of the language and sexual content to see if it was good writing anyway.  She distracted from the story instead of enhancing it.  So disappointed.'

author: b'Michael Tobis'
title: b'An unexpected gem'
body: b"I was stuck at an airport layover with nothing to read and the bookstore selection was small. I had not heard of this book and did not have any prior interest in it. I picked Rowling because I was in need of distraction. I think I intended to read a quarter of it and leave it behind in the Atlanta airport as I've done with Harry Potter books and other airport purchases."

author: b'Marilyn Andersen'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Hard to follow all the many characters and took me 200 pages into reading before I found this book worth continuing.  The British city govt. system is not easy to comprehend to American readers.  Adult situations.'

author: b'Marilyn'
title: b'Appreciate the literary skill but plot dragged'
body: b"I probably shouldn't review books that I don't finish but I was all primed for a winner and after plodding through a couple of hundred pages I put it down.  Very possibly it comes to life in the middle so know that I didn't finish this book."

author: b'RTK123'
title: b'Classic Rowling'
body: b"The descriptive writing and character development are unequaled; it's a bit of a dark story and its hard to find someone to like or root for but nonetheless its a great read."

author: b'Pat N.'
title: b'Different'
body: b'I have not read the Harry Potter Books, though my grandchildren love them. Decided to read this mystery of hers. It is an interesting book and a good mystery. I did have a little problem with the British words and accents, but I did enjoy it for the most part. Adult readers of The Harry Potter Books would surely enjoy it. Definitly not for young people.'

author: b'Melanie'
title: b'total disappointment'
body: b"I was so excited to hear JK Rowling had a book out after the Harry Potter books - I loved the whole series (although I think JK got a little lazy in the middle of the 7th, I mean really... how long can they wander around not knowing what they were looking for?) but.... casual vacancy was the most boring book I ever forced myself to read. I don't mind dark, I don't even mind a little depressing if the story piques my interest, but this book was a hellacious waste of my valuable time. I give it 0 stars... we KNOW she can do way better than this piece of trash!"

author: b'Naseberry'
title: b'Very entertaining'
body: b'I enjoyed this book a lot. Good plot, good characters, the gradual revelation of past secrets made for suspense, I wanted to know how things would turn out.'

author: b'Donald Vincent'
title: b'Very Casual'
body: b'Rowling wrote a book that when I finished I said, "An interesting story".  Very good descriptive writing.'

author: b'Tina Hayes'
title: b'Tragic Tale of Personal Struggles'
body: b'J.K. Rowling\'s "Casual Vacancy" is a story about what happens in the small town of Pagford when Barry Fairbrother dies, how the people he knew coped, and who will take his place on the town council.  This is a very tragic tale that shows how everyone fights some sort of daily battle in their lives, whether against bullies, fear, addiction, loneliness, or society itself.'

author: b'S. Anderson'
title: b'Good book, very strong language and adult content'
body: b'Definitely not for anyone under 18.  Her characters are well flushed out, although I can\'t say I care much for these people; gives humanity a black eye.  I had to keep reading though because I wanted to know how the story ended.  I was torn between 3 and 4 stars but thought it was better than just "ok."'

author: b'MAX WENGER'
title: b'Vacancy denighed'
body: b"I thought the language was too vulgar.  The book was not rated that I cpild see, and probably would not have purchased it if I had.  I'm not sure her purpose was for writing the book, except maybe don't  be a poor slob living in"

author: b'Dreamer10'
title: b'Very Happy with Purchase'
body: b'Even though this book got mixed reviews, I really liked it. I found it very interesting reading and could hardly put it down. I think J.K. Rowling did a great job with the very different venue from Harry Potter series. (I totally loved Harry Potter!) I plan to purchase her next novel "The Cuckoo\'s Calling".'

author: b'Charlotte Bolthouse Bartelt'
title: b'Fantastic'
body: b'I\'ve read the Harry Potter Series multiple times so I was, of course, excited for this book. It was a little slow starting, but then had me hooked. Growing up in a small, pretentious town I can say that J.K. hit the nail on the head. She also was able to get me so invested in the characters that I cried more than I probably should have, but I wouldn\'t expect anything else from the "queen."'

author: b'Catherine Griffin'
title: b'What a disappointment!'
body: b'The reason I read books is to enjoy a bit of fun outside my own life.  How disappointing to read a book mired down in miserable circumstances and socially inept people with crummy and competing agendas....this book reads like LA politics!'

author: b'Barbara Tompkins'
title: b"didn't like"
body: b"I think the book is not one of her best.  I didn't think it is"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Casual victory'
body: b"This book was quite a disappointment, keep waiting for it to get better ,but it never did. Boring !  I'd take a refund on this one."

author: b'Lagunadeb'
title: b'J K Rowling does it again'
body: b'Outstanding book with heart'

author: b'Ann'
title: b'interesting character study'
body: b"I have never read the HP series and was not frightened off by those fans who did not like the book. I found it to be an interesting study of caste and character. Don't listen to those who say that there are too many characters, if you enjoy a different, interesting read, this book is definitely worth your time."

author: b'Sister Louise'
title: b'Vulgar language was too much!'
body: b'I barely made it through the first three chapters and then stuck the book on the bookshelf.  I\'m no prude but the overuse of the "f" word was very offensive and quickly lost any intended emotional ambience.  I hope I can find some poor soul to give it to.'

author: b'Cloggie Downunder'
title: b'a brilliant read.'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy is the first adult novel by popular British author, J.K.Rowling. This contemporary fiction is set in the seemingly idyllic English village of Pagford, where the sudden death of Parish Councillor, Barry Fairbrother creates a casual vacancy on the parish council. As subsequent events are narrated from the points of view of various different characters, the picture emerges of a village whose inhabitants are not all satisfied with their lot in life, a village of simmering tensions waiting to boil over. Rowling's characters are easily recognisable as the denizens of the typical English village, but at the same time, show individual depth and appeal (or repugnance, as the case may be). And it seems quite a few of the characters have a secret (or two). The setting, characters and events will resonate with readers, and these same happenings drive the characters to desperate actions that ultimately result in tragedy for some. Rowling manages to pack quite a lot into this novel: she has an obese megalomaniac, drug addicts, computer-savvy teens, a fawning wife, a violent husband and father, an anxious teacher, and a caring social worker, to name just a few. There is domestic violence, rape, racism, corruption, self-mutilation, bullying, gossip, teen pregnancy, child abuse and SQL injection. But if this sounds depressing, it is relieved by the underlying black humour that fills the novel.  This all comes together to make a brilliant read."

author: b'A. Barree'
title: b'Anthony Trollop redux'
body: b"In the tradition of Anthony Trollope, Rowlings develops a seemingly simple situation in small town goverment into a full blown drama.  The story evolves from the various characters' reactions to the sudden death of Barry Fairweather, a man who provided support and stabilzation for many of his fellow citizens. As the story unfolds, these individuals' backgrounds and feelings are revealed.  While some unravel to the point of crash and burn, there are those whose dignity is preserved or restored. I particularly enjoyed the author's technique of revealing, largely through internal monologue, the inner lives and feelings of not only the adults but the adolescents of the town."

author: b'Rita Vanek'
title: b'Complex Characters and Relationships'
body: b'Great book, engrossing character development.'

author: b'*tella'
title: b'surprse! The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I was pleasantly surprised that I enjoyed this story as much as I did.  I have not read the HP series or seen the movies, there was always so much talk about them, I felt as though I had.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"Couldn't get into it"
body: b'I wanted to like it, but after a couple of chapters I quit reading. Nothing grabbed my interest enough to want to continue. I got as far several finding out this man died, how they each had a connection in a different way...I decided it might be one of those books better listened to than read. If I change my mind and pick up the book to try it again and like it, I will get back to you:>)'

author: b'Deb'
title: b"Fascinating character study of the evil in people's hearts"
body: b"I absolutely loved this book and couldn't put it down.  Every person had multiple layers of deceit, envy, cravenness,  self-importance.  The character study and interplay is fascinating.  Truly the dark side of a beautiful English village.  The writing is fantastic as you might expect."

author: b'KAREN  Levy'
title: b'The  Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Did not like it all!!!!!!!! I Did not like the story, people or anything about this book. I was very disappointed,'

author: b'derek strine'
title: b'Sucked'
body: b'Its was boring and a huge let down. I think rowling should not write if shes not goig to try.its not like she needs the money... Just a huge let down no where near as good as harry potter'

author: b'Ashley'
title: b'bor-ing'
body: b"I only bought this book because there was so much hype over it. I didn't care for any of the characters, the plot intersted me zero, and it was too slow. I always finish books and this one was torture."

author: b'Tennlady'
title: b'Not My Cup Of  Tea'
body: b"I couldn't get past the second chapter.  Boring and lots of unnecessary bad language.  I wouldn't recommend it.  A waste of money!"

author: b'AR'
title: b'Well crafted character study'
body: b'I read this book on holiday.Unlike some other reviewers I quickly got hooked on the individual characters and how the initial event causes a ripple effect through the local community.Some of the villagers were a little stereotyped but overall her description really captured the characters for me and whilst few were likeable all felt human and real.For the first time in ages this book left me choking back tears - a sign of good writing in my book !'

author: b'Lottie Mixson'
title: b'Excellent story of interconnected lives in a small town'
body: b'The death of an individual sends ripples throughout a small town. Superbly written, excellent character development - the story and writing should qualify it for classic status.'

author: b'Jennifer Larson'
title: b'All the action in beginning draws you in'
body: b'Reminiscent of the girl with the dragon tattoo with introduction to so many characters so quickly.  It was hard to keep straight who was who and how tied together and that is important to me so it was slow for me as I had to go back and re-read to get how the characters were related, not necessarily by blood but in some cases by location or profession, etc...she is a spectacular author, just takes a lot of work for me as I said I have to know how all tie together to make me happy, so not a good afternoon read just for leisure, I had to think to keep up.'

author: b'Ann'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b"Can't really recommend.  Well written but no likeable characters.  Realistic, but depressing subject matter.  Barely finished it -not sure why I did."

author: b'JoAnn'
title: b'Disappointing and Depressing - Skip It'
body: b"What a disappointing read! I hoped it would get better, but was disappointed until the bitter end. There was no character in the book that I cared anything about. It was not at all appealing; too many pages of drugs, sex and people hating each other. Even those sad topics could be, and have been presented by authors in an interesting story.  Wish I had read some reviews before we bought the book. Hopefully JK Rowling finds her voice in something readable in the future. A final note, I've read a few of her Harry Potter books and they were pretty good. I was not expecting anything similar, but I did expect an interesting story."

author: b'Amanda Storlie'
title: b'Not my favorite book'
body: b"So, I'm not sure what I was expecting, but I couldn't finish this book. In fact, I hope I can still return it. It was slow, there were a LOT of characters (the character that ties them all together is dead), and it was just so meticulously detailed that even half way into the book nothing has really happened. Not going to finish it if I can return it; I'd suggest checking it out from a library if you have to read it. Don't waste your money on it. Sorry, J.K. Rowling, maybe your mystery series is better?"

author: b'Jennifer Willmott'
title: b'Ok'
body: b'I found this book was well written and I found myself getting into the characters, but I was unhappy with the ending, I felt that most of the characters that were introduced did not get a proper ending, I was left wondering what would happen to a lot of them.'

author: b'Carol DeCrescentis'
title: b'Book is not as interesting as I expected.'
body: b'I am finding it hard to stay with the story. I will try and finish it but I am not sure I will.'

author: b'Smileysativa'
title: b'Sssooo slow'
body: b"Only got interesting after the first half. Took me nearly 6 months to actually get through the first half. Don't think I'd recommend it unless you have absolutely nothing else to read."

author: b'Jesse'
title: b'diappointing'
body: b'I was excited to read another book by JK Rowling. This book was tedious and lifeless. I do not recommend it.'

author: b'Jeanette Kerr'
title: b'Amazing Relationships'
body: b'This book has all the ingredients that one can relate to. The interactions of teenagers with parents at their worst. And thinking that everyone else has great family relationships looking from the outside. But... the old saying about what goes on behind closed doors....'

author: b'Sabbykoala'
title: b'A book that is really about nothing'
body: b'I was surprised it was this short. Nothing fantastic about this at all. I was waiting for some kind of storyline  to appear when  I realised that it was about to end.'

author: b'weeping willow'
title: b"Don't think about the author - just read with an open mind"
body: b"I really enjoyed this book.  I devoured it in a few days and was sad to turn that last page.  The subject matter is far from gay but that's what life is, isn't it?  We're all trying to make our way through this world, in our own little lives."

author: b'jallen'
title: b'Casual Vacancy is not a casual read'
body: b'Excellent character development with devastating realism. Rowling develops compelling story lines that draw you into a dark story of small town prejudices and infighting. Well worth the read.'

author: b'Thelma Meyer'
title: b'The "real world" of dreary Muggles?'
body: b'Maybe 1 1/2 stars,  I stopped reading after a few chapters.  I suppose its all about "Muggles" and we know how awful they are. Perhaps Rowling grew up with Muggles -- and had to create a magical world to escape them.  She\'s better off writing about her created world.  The "real" word she tries to enter is dreary.  The people in this book, as much as I\'ve read are not exactly awful - but they are not interesting - and there are just too many of them.  It wasn\'t worth the effort to get to know one dreary individual after another.  I - sigh - put it down.'

author: b'Joanne Tailele'
title: b'Cumbersome'
body: b'Way too many characters to follow, 30, i believe. I would have given it a one until book club, when one reader found some redeeming quality that upped it to a two.'

author: b'Yildiz Sethi'
title: b'A psychological and social read'
body: b'shows how people interact and how entanglements and character comes to the fore and how w are all connected in an intangable way'

author: b'educ81'
title: b"Don't Get It."
body: b"I picked this book because it was rated number 1 fiction book. Honestly, I don't get it. I tried to struggle through it. I kept thinking it would get better. It never did. Finally, I had to stop reading half way through. This is very rare for me not to finish a book. Quite a disappointment."

author: b'Sisyphussays'
title: b'Disappointed in Rowling'
body: b"THE CASUAL VACANCY is a beautifully written book.  It's a pleasure to read a book that uses the English language in such a wonderful way.  Unfortunately, by the time I reached page 150 I was fed up with all the backbiting, dislike/hatred and temper tantrums of husbands toward wives and wives towawrd husbands, parents toward their own children, neighbors toward neighbors and so-called friends toward friends.  I know what Rowling was trying to do but it was deeply disappointing and disgusting to waste such beautiful writing on such a negative book."

author: b'Robin Snyder'
title: b'Definitely a Departure'
body: b'So I finally finished this book. It took me much longer to get through than a normal read.'

author: b'xansgram'
title: b'Very Disappointed'
body: b"After reading all the Harry Potter books, I had never read a writer with such a vivid imagination.  Unfortunately, I didn't see it in this book, I got half way through it and couldn't read any more.  Very disappointed."

author: b'Gabrielle V'
title: b'Not for everyone. Obviously.'
body: b"I am one of those who read HP on-time (I think I was about 10 when the first HP book got big). I enjoyed the series, although in the end I started to feel it got a little too battle-friendly. I enjoyed the boarding school atmosphere the same way I enjoyed Enid Blyton and Tom Brown as a child, not magic battles. I'd go to other authors for that."

author: b'SaucyKatLady'
title: b'heart wrenching'
body: b"JKR knows how to writing is magical even if there is no magic in it. Don't expect Harry Potter but a story that is real and realistic to communities that we live in every day and the realities we choose to ignore cause we can."

author: b'bookgirl'
title: b"don't go into this book thinking you will find HP"
body: b"This is a well written book but it is not the magical world of Hogwarts. It is the ordinary world of Pagford and yes in this small town there are some crappy people who have crappy things happen to them but that's life. I have to say it is refreshing to read about characters with real flaws, especially the teenagers. I work in education and yes kids do drugs, bully, drink, have sex, hurt people (including themselves) and aren't always the hero. And so called pillars of the community usually have skeletons in the closet. This is a story that intertwines several families through a series of tragedies."

author: b'Tamara Olsen'
title: b'Okay'
body: b'Not the normal JK Rowling. Takes a bit to get into it. Good read eventually. Nice drama and mystery read'

author: b'lin'
title: b'Trust J K Rowling to build depth. Keep reading. It will stick with you.'
body: b'If I hadn\'t trusted what an incredible author J K Rowling is, I would have tossed the book. She seemed to have dispensed with her skill to engage the reader into a main character, but trust me, she pulls it off in a most backdoor fashion. The characters are flawed, human, and eventually... vivid. Only well into the book, do we get the insights and compassion we have seen in good ole Harry & company. It\'s a side of life we don\'t usually seek out for casual escapist reading. Nearly half the book is spent in giving us the seamy side of her characters before she lifts the veil and we see beneath the sheen of their delusions of themselves. In the end, they recover some deeper introspection to their attempts to appear perfect. This is not a perfect world. It is a world of "work in progress" and a messy business it is. I find myself assessing how giving and caring I\'ve been and will become, as this book distills itself in the trickle down aftermath of reading. It\'s a tough read and poignant to the point of painful, but Rowling always takes the higher ground, bringing depths to the most vile, uncovering the twists of fate that created the Snapes and Vordemorts. Even our beloved Dumledore emerged with flaws. In "Casual Vacancy" we come to know the deceased Barry Fairbrother through his profound influence on others\' lives. She shows us that we are all capable of more... more depth... more compassion... more humanity... more beingness... and gives us this excruciating set of examples of what not to be and do, and then, what we could... if we dared... BE.'

author: b'Dolly'
title: b'I loved this book.'
body: b'I can not wait until she comes out with a second book. this was the most amazing read I have had due to the fact'

author: b'vmcla'
title: b'Perfect Storytelling for Serious Readers'
body: b'Any reservations I had about reading this book were blown-away in the first few pages where readers who love unusual storytelling will be hooked and launched into an absorbing reading experience.'

author: b'Bonnie'
title: b'And they all lived miserably ever after'
body: b'Well. J K Rowling wrote a legendary fantasy which beguiled the world. Not me, I never got further than the first Harry Potter, but I had nothing against it, it was just not my kind of magic, I prefer Zelazny for that genre.'

author: b'Elisabeth'
title: b'Definitely not your run-of-the-mill book'
body: b"With 3806 reviews already posted, there isn't much more that can be said.  My comment:  the book is brilliant!  I expected to like it, I wanted to like it, but found myself struggling at the beginning, not sure what was going on and disappointed. Then, things started falling into place and I realized suddenly how cleverly the characters and plot were being fed to me and everything started to make sense.  Yes, I agree that it could be considered a dark comedy but it isn't a pretty book.  Get rid of your expectations before reading this book because this book is something different.  The writing is superb.  There were times where, after reading a passage, I had to stop and read the passage several times aloud marveling at how those plain and innocuous words could be assembled in such a manner as to create such powerful expression.  I loved it.  I am impressed.  I look forward to more of the same."

author: b'Lady Rain'
title: b'Purchased as a gift'
body: b'Purchased as a gift for my daughter who is a JK Rowling fan.  Arrive new and on time.  She was happy.'

author: b'Barbara D'
title: b'The storyline was dull.'
body: b'The ending was good... it brought the book full circle but the plot itself was lacking. You did get to know the characters well.'

author: b'Julia Padgett'
title: b'the kids are alright'
body: b"I think the biggest problem I had with this book is that the younger characters have depth and dimension to them while the adults (mainly) suffer from just facet --- and that facet is bad. Only one or two adults do you have any sympathy for in the entire book (and one of them dies at the beginning). The rest of the adult population seem to be line drawings of what is wrong with humanity --- delusional expectations, overwhelming desires to escape from reality, self-righteousness, narcissism, corruption, drug addiction, me-me-me-me. It just doesn't strike true that an entire book could be made up of such a sorry lot of humanity. The kids do come off slightly better and are definitely given a range of emotions, struggles and shades of depth. However, again, the person you are holding out hope for also dies. I just hope the next book by Ms. Rowling applies the same rule to the adults that it does to the youth --- we are complicated creatures, write it so."

author: b'bh'
title: b'ugly, cynical, disappointing'
body: b"I admire the writing; it's nothing short of brilliant. What I did not like at all is any of the characters. They are all seriously flawed, and I do not believe that reflects real-life people. I wish I hadn't bothered to finish it. It left me sad and bummed. And, I'm afraid, it's put me off Rowling."

author: b'Jann Cassady'
title: b'Depressing'
body: b"Not Harry Potter that's for sure...just seemed like a lot of messed up people and lousy situations.  Not what I expected."

author: b'sandra vandehey'
title: b'I love the British!'
body: b"Though I don't think this book is for everyone, the inner personality of the small British town was an an interesting read."

author: b'Michael R. Pease'
title: b'Life behind the masks.'
body: b"I'm amazed at the intimate and detailed knowledge of small town life Rowling brings to her story, especially of such a wide range of social strata.  She makes the reader feel compassion even for the most despicable of her characters.  I can hardly put it down, and I don't have a clue how she's going to end it."

author: b'Lilia'
title: b'Just not that good...'
body: b'I loved the harry potter books growing up, and as I became and more discerning reader, I was able to set aside the problems with the writing to enjoy the story.'

author: b'Carol Mathis'
title: b'Tragic, Insightful Comedy of Manners'
body: b'I have read A Casual Vacancy at least 4 times.  Each time I have found something new to be amazed by, something new to be touched by, something new to learn from.  It is certainly more Dickens than Wodehouse, a serious work of fiction about social inequality and cruelty and the results of that cruelty.  Rowling is an acute observer of human behavior, and her criticisms are right on the money. The more comical aspects of the story are rather tart; I can see why people missed the dry humor.'

author: b'Mayor Mom'
title: b'Mayor Mom'
body: b"Bought the book, not because of the well known author, but because I thought the subject matter would be an interesting and fun concept.  What a depressing slog to get though this book.  There was not one character I cared about, but made myself finish the book just to see how it ended.  Can there really be a town so filled with vile people, even in the author's mind? Not one redeeming page.  It appeared that the author was trying for an ending that left you with some hope, but even that fell flat.  I will be dropping my copy off at the second hand book shop for credit to buy something that is worth reading.  I have to try and get an remnant of this read out of my head."

author: b'Chana'
title: b'This was a disappointment'
body: b"I bought this as a gift for my daughter who loves Harry Potter. She was disappointed with this. I asked why she said this just isn't her genera."

author: b'AM'
title: b'Not recommended'
body: b"I have not read any Harry Potter books and had no particular expectations. I got the audio book at Cracker Barrel for a long road trip and hoped for the best. I was amazed at how bad this book was. I thought the underlying premise, setting, and characters could have made for great drama. But, ultimately the book is about six dysfunctional families and you pretty much want to strangle all the adults. There is rape, incest, domestic violence, and other unpleasant actions. However, there is no suspense or mystery--when anonymous things occur, she tells you who is doing them as they happen. There are no likeable characters, just unhappy parents, unhappy teenagers, and a lot of bad results. The moral to the story is apparently that at least some people will appreciate each other more and get past their anger once really, really bad things happen. I found the plot boring and probably shouldn't have hung on until the end."

author: b'Texas Girl'
title: b"Disappointed and couldn't finish the book"
body: b"I couldn't finish this book.  There wasn't one character that I really cared to find out what happened to them.  Most of the time I was very bored with the story line and would fall asleep.  I loved Harry Potter but the creativity that Rowling displayed in creating the world of Harry Potter was lacking in this story."

author: b'Mario'
title: b'Casual Reading'
body: b'I was never a "Harry Potter" fan so when I noticed'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'inrigue in the every day life in the UK .'
body: b'Realistic portrayal of life in a small community in the UK  an official dies unexpectedly  many vie to succeed him .  Great look into small town especially the school system'

author: b'Theresa A. Behrens'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'Being a huge fan of the Harry Potter series, I was disappointed. I might have enjoyed it more if it had been written under a pseudonym, but do understand Ms. Rawlings wanting to write a different type of story.'

author: b'Michael Speers'
title: b'great'
body: b'Loved it, well written, great characters, story line is clever, sad, wise, insightful and funny. Bring on the next one soon,'

author: b'Toni Osborne'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'I have not much to say on J.K. Rowling first novel for adult readership. Rarely do I give up on a novel "The Casual Vacancy" made the list. After labouring through 250 pages I simply couldn\'t waste more precious reading time on a very boring story concerning a parish council election in a small West Country town. This story is an unadventurous study of provincial life with some superficial excitements. A large cast of young characters taking drugs, swearing and having sex weaves through a multiple and interlocking plots that are flat-lined by predictability. I wasn\'t able from the start to immerse myself in the people I found them very frustrating and a real farce. I gave up....that is all I can say.'

author: b'Reader Girl'
title: b'Dissapointed'
body: b"JK Rowling is a great author - no denying that - she has a way with words. And it's understandable that she wants to stray from the HP series. But I had to force myself to get through this book. Way too many characters, and the material just wasn't interesting. It was depressing. I hope her next non-HP book is better."

author: b'Larissa Masterson'
title: b'Mixed Feelings, but I think I am glad I read it.'
body: b'I downloaded the book without reading the description or any customer reviews. I bought it solely because of the author. I am an adult and a huge Harry Potter fan. I was not expecting this to be anything like Harry Potter, but was excited to see what else JKR wrote.'

author: b'Thoughtful Reader'
title: b"OK. it's not war and peace"
body: b'It is a quite well written and well plotted novel. The characters are interesting if not particularly deep. I thought it was a good effort by a skilled writer.'

author: b'Pippa'
title: b'a struggle to read'
body: b'I had anticipated this on the basis of a good friends review. Sadly it is one of the very few books that we will have to disagree on. Whilst parts were insightful the depth was lacking as the story covered too many characters with a similar level of intensity, so no one had any greater depth or meaning in the story.'

author: b'Barising'
title: b'Slow moving with to many characters to keep track of them.'
body: b'I found this book boring.  It\'s a small village with many various different characters, but little too distinguish one from another until you are very deeply into the book.  The ending portion is when the book finally comes to some point about the individual characters.  The most difficult thing about the book is much of it is written in "Cockney"  and many words were half the word with the apostrophe for what the character wasn\'t saying.  If you are British, this book would probably be more enjoyable. Cockney is not in the dictionary on your Kindle.'

author: b'Kaci'
title: b'Very Disappointed'
body: b"I bought The Casual Vacancy hoping it would be just as good as Rowling's Harry Potter series, as I'm sure everyone else did.  However, it was hard to make myself keep reading.  There were too many characters, so they were hard to keep up with.  Also, I felt like there was no real climax.  It was more like several smaller stories put together.  There were too many subplots.  It seems like Rowling tried to put too much into one story.  The writing style was not nearly as clear as the Potter series either.  I didn't enjoy the book at all."

author: b'L. Steidl'
title: b'I was so excited to read this book.'
body: b"I read the Harry Potter series well into adulthood, and loved every book. I was excited to see what Rowling would do with adult fiction. This book was just dreary. It's as if every character in Rowling's fictional village were a Dursley. Now, I think the Dursleys were well written and necessary to the Harry Potter series, but you couldn't build an entire book around them. I disliked every character in this book, and I didn't care what happened to any of them. This story contained some good writing, and was obviously well-researched, but the unrelievedly boorish characters ruined it completely. I cannot recommend this book."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A Brilliant Book!'
body: b"In a wide departure from her previous work she has written a complex commentary on English society in a small village and the innermost thoughts of the people living there. It's a social commentary on class structure, a deep analysis of the inner secrets and public faces that the individuals possess, and an intricate plot.  It has stayed with me for days after finishing it. I think it has all the elements of a classic."

author: b'Vicki Noble'
title: b'Totally Cynical'
body: b'I don\'t know what all the hype is about this author writing a book "for adults." She approaches her characters in the most cynical way, as if she can\'t stand any of them and they deserve whatever they get--they are caricatures, at best. It\'s as if none of them has any spiritual center at all; they exhibit only the most negative character traits: envy, jealousy, hatefulness, cruelty, indifference, arrogant self-focus, crippling self-loathing, competitiveness, ruthlessness, and general heartlessness. I read to the bitter end, thinking that surely she was going to pull something out of the hat--but no such luck. Ruthless herself, she tied up each pathetic little life in a paragraph and brought the book to a merciful end.'

author: b'Marissa Richardson'
title: b'An uncomfortable read, but worth it.'
body: b"This book is a very uncomfortable book to get into. Let's just get that out of the way. And I think I know why."

author: b'Franci A. Washburn'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"I tried to approach this novel as if I had never read Rowling's Harry Potter books, as if this story was written by a new author whose work I had not read.  I would be disappointed if this were an author new to me whose previous works I had never read, but with my experience of reading Rowling's Potter series, I am doubly disappointed.  The best I can say about this book is that it is well-crafted.  Rowling seems to follow all the rules a student learns in a first year creative writing workshop, but like those novice writers, following all the rules doesn't breathe life into the story, which is devoid of life.  I simply don't give a crap about any of these characters or what happens to them.  Yes, as some reviewers have pointed out, there are some poetic lines here and there, but even a blind hog can find an acorn now and then."

author: b'Donald R. Stephani'
title: b'A book review of sorts'
body: b"Perhaps Ms. Rowling had to write this novel to free herself of all the good in Harry Potter, but it is my belief that she should have never sent it to publication. To me it's like the letter you write when you are totally mad at someone, you write it but never send it."

author: b'Wendie Vanderwater'
title: b'Better than I expected!'
body: b"I loved the Harry Potter books and wasn't sure how this story would go.  It was a very interesting story that had some excellent characters.  I may read it again."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'So, so disapointed'
body: b'Expected so much more from this book. Too many stories going at once with a thin plot line. Really one of the worst books I have ever read. Considering that the Harry Potter books were some of the most enjoyable.'

author: b'Jocie'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'Tried three times to read it. The characters are unlikable and this prevented me from being able to continue on. It was a disappointment.'

author: b'Timo'
title: b"Thankful it's over"
body: b'This book made me miserable, but curiosity kept me reading what felt like hundreds and hundreds of pages.'

author: b'Anne Marie Brun'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'I loved the Harry Potter books. But this book is neither a trilling fantasy, a great detective novel nor a literary masterpiece'

author: b'Geraldine Thalen'
title: b'Which of these people is Rowling?'
body: b"I wasn't expecting Harry Potter.  I was hoping to be lured into a fictional world with real people.  If Rowling thinks the world is peopled with the likes of her characters, I feel very sorry for her.  Yes, we are all flawed.  But the only characters with a modicum of goodness are ridiculed by the narrator for being dumpy and bad dressers, or tightly wound outsiders.  These are the only possibilities for humanity?  The disdain her narrator expresses for these bumbling do-gooders (Kay and Tessa and Parminder) in her descriptions of them reveals to some extent her own attitude.  Why else would the narrator describe them in such negative terms?  Howard Mallinson (ok, she kind of got the name right) is beneath contempt because he is obese?  This is the narrator's perspective.  Yes he is selfish and inconsiderate and a lecher.  Focus on those qualities, not his obesity.  Did Rowling think we could forgive the others but not the obesity?  I just don't understand the malice she carries for less-than-attractive people."

author: b'Hans van der Meulen'
title: b'Where is Harry?'
body: b"I'm still reading it, when will it ever end? I know it's J.K. Rowling, but where is the suspense, excitement or Lord Voldermort? Please return to Hogwarts once more..."

author: b'Nix'
title: b'Expect nothing familiar'
body: b'Oh this book! I know many people did not like it or perhaps expected something different. Having heard all the hype before reading the book I went into it with an open mind, expecting nothing familiar.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'This whole story could have been written in  30 pages, certainly expected better from Ms Rowling. What a depressing cast of characters.'

author: b'UCLA Steve'
title: b'Amazing.  But, started slow and got worse before turning incredible.'
body: b'This is one of the best books I have ever read, although I almost gave up on it for good - twice.  Keep on reading and the story eventually, while admittedly quite dark, ends up turning absolutely brilliant and uplifting.'

author: b'Brooke Davis'
title: b'Review'
body: b'Very interesting. You really get involved with characters, they are so well written. Definitely a page turner, with a sad abrupt ending.'

author: b'Marsha Carry'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'J.K. Rowlings threw everything but the kitchen sink into this book.  I guess she was trying to be current, so she included cutting, drug abuse, verbal abuse, poverty, etc.  As a result, the plot was barely there.'

author: b'Craven'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'The dialog is about as riveting as watching paint dry. I bought this book because of her success with her other books but I think she should stick to writing for adolescents.'

author: b'Soren'
title: b'Really enjoyed it'
body: b"Thanks, JK, you've made me SO happy I don't live in an English village"

author: b'Rod M. Holland'
title: b'If you want an engaging tale about the underside of a small British village, this is it'
body: b'I have not read any reviews of this book and will not read any until I finish my own review. I also did not read a description of the book either, I wanted to leave myself without preconceptions, and let Rowling stand on her own two feet and be able to give an honest review without bias.'

author: b'Del Rio Sue'
title: b'Casual Vacancy & Harry Potter'
body: b"Rowling raises social conscience in this work and deals with many human frailties. In retrospect these same themes are evident in the Henry Potter series if one looks below the story line which was truly engaging.  It gave me even more respect for her as a writer.  Can't wait to read her newest under her pseudonym."

author: b'Easterner'
title: b'Horrible'
body: b"Terrible book - long and drawn out, took forever before anything happens, just about one of the most depressing  books ever. She was definitely trying to do a 180 from Potter, but , my God, this was too much! Don't read!!!"

author: b'Virginia Girl'
title: b'Unpleasant'
body: b"I have a rule that I must finish any book that I start, this book was agonizing to read!  I certainly did not expect Harry Potter, but I did not expect disgusting!  I generally read an eclectic variety of books, all types! I do enjoy books with in depth characterizations and certainly not fairy tale lives!  This book was misery heaped on misery a pathetic view of humanity.  Some might say that it was a 'realistic' description of life. I disagree!  So basically I hated it!"

author: b'C. Mannino'
title: b"Interesting, but don't expect great literature"
body: b"J.K. Rowling's first novel for adults is a far cry from Harry Potter.  At times, it felt almost like she was trying to prove that she could write for adults.  There are graphic scenes of drug use, violence, and sex.  It reads almost like Trainspotting at times."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A Microcosm for Modern Britain?'
body: b"Rowling's first foray into the world of adult fiction was an entertaining read. The Casual Vacancy deals with events following the death of Parish Councillor Barry Fairbrother. The little village of Pagford turns out to be a hot bed of political back biting, bigotry and ignorance as the residents squabble over the vacant seat."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Boring, I had no empathy for any of the characters'
body: b'I had great expectations, and was completely disappointed.  There was just very little story here, boring from page one to the very end.'

author: b'Maria Lerro'
title: b"JK Rowling 's The Casual Vacancy"
body: b"This is a powerful book. Rowling 's characters speak to you in flesh, blood and soul. Their torments and joys are yours, and you'll worry and pray for them between reading sessions. The Casual Vacancy tells a tale of gritty realities with wrenching compassion and humanity. With its depiction of the modern day distinctions between the lives of the middle class and the poor, it's likely to become a classic in the tradition of Charles Dickens. Although it deals with mature themes, it also belongs on high school required reading lists alongside The Catcher in the Rye and The Lord of the Flies."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'really good story'
body: b"J.K. Rowling should have written THIS book under another name. The readers were ridiculously hard on her.  You cannot compare a children's book series with an adult story.  Now when she did use another name with her latest book people thought she was horrid for doing so.  Anyway..."

author: b'Markus'
title: b'Give it a fair shot!'
body: b"I started Casual Vacancy the week it came out, and I'm ashamed to admit, I didn't give it much of a chance. I got around 30 pages in when I put it down and decided it was boring. I can look back now, and honestly say, that I probably was not giving it the proper attention that was necessary."

author: b'Lisa Smith'
title: b'A little tricky to keep characters straight'
body: b"True to her style with the Harry Potter series, Rowling pulls the reader in right away, within the first few pages. However, I found it rather challenging in the first quarter of the book to keep all the characters straight. Once it was clearly established 'who was with who', the story picked up speed and got better with each page."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Loved the book. Try it and see if it fits your reading style'
body: b'With nearly 4,000 reviews of the book, it is hard to say something new. I agree with the two "most helpful review" authors of the 4* and 5* reviews. The book is excellently crafted, and the characters are compelling. JK Rowling is a masterful writer. She takes a toxic brew of plus/minus 20 important characters, puts them in the pressure cooker of a small town in England\'s southwest (money and conservative politics), and turns up the heat. It\'s not a happy book, and pretty much all the characters are flawed. The heat and pressure bring out the worst.'

author: b'debbie schaefer'
title: b'debbie'
body: b"I never would have finished it except that it was my book club's choice for the month. She was taking advantage of her fame."

author: b'Laura Farr'
title: b'Story-telling at Its Best'
body: b"If you're looking for the magic of Hogwarts, try a different book. However, if you're looking for the rich feel of complicated characters, beautiful settings, lifelike situations, and fantastic plot twists, look no further."

author: b'Renee C Stroup'
title: b'Wow'
body: b"I've never left a review before but felt this deserved one. It is so well written and moves along quickly. Yes, the topics are difficult and disbursing but she handles them well. The climax completely undid me, which is what a great novel can do. Such talent! Not the book for a light easy read but one with guts. I applaud Rowling for stepping so faraway from Harry (even though I adored them). Bravo!"

author: b'Luv2Hu'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Wonderfully written. You cannot put the book down. What often looks calm on the surface of human emotional life can be horridly twisted at depth. Bravo JKR!!!'

author: b'Sherry'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'LOVED this book.  J. K. Rowling is a fantastic storyteller/author..  Highly recommend this book to anyone who wants a good read....'

author: b'Maria'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'In my entire reading "career" there have been only two books that i have left unfinished. The Casual Vacancy is the third.'

author: b'mivy'
title: b'A Story About The Dursleys'
body: b"I really tried to get into this book. Kept picking it up and reading a few more pages but ultimately, I felt like JK took the first few chapters of HP and embellished upon them to create this. It's like reading about Vernon Dursley and the drivel that is his life. I understand that some people enjoy this as a character study and maybe if I was so invested in the miserable lives of the lowest of society, this would have been fascinating but I don't take time out of my day to get depressed by the sadness of characters in a book.
