I don't feel that there is a clear protagonist and antagonist in this book so it makes it hard to grasp on to anything going on or to even care for this collection of people. Just really depressing and sad. Better to escape to a world of hope."

author: b'Amy Robbins'
title: b'Makes you think'
body: b'While this book was not without its faults, I did enjoy it. It takes a while to get into, since there are more than a dozen main characters and you have to get to know them well enough to tell them all apart. Once that is accomplished, you can sit back and enjoy the wealth of social issues Rowling addresses. The characters are realistic and relatable, and though the overall feel of the book is one of pessimism of negativity, it has its moments of warmth.'

author: b'LRDUKDOG'
title: b'Hoping her next book is better, no matter what name she uses....'
body: b"Tedious, boring - and a real chore to finish, which is unusual for me.  Kept hoping it would get better, but it didn't."

author: b'morgan miller'
title: b'Terrible!!!'
body: b'After reading the entire Harry Potter series, I was in love. I loved her writing style and her imagination. I was excited to receive this book from a friend. I opened it and started on my journey in Pagford. Much to my surprise, this was not what I bargained for.'

author: b'LA'
title: b'Heartbreakingly Human'
body: b"I have never read Rowling's Harry Potter books (nor have I seen the films). I'm certainly aware of who she is, and I was curious about this book because she'd specifically written it for an adult audience."

author: b'Frenchbluehen'
title: b"I never read Potter, so I can't compare it; I just read it."
body: b"I'm one of the few, I guess, thirty-somethings that never read any of the Harry Potter books, nor saw any of the movies.  That being said, I didn't have those to compare it to.  I had the pleasure of just reading it for pleasure.  And it was a pleasure to read, despite the gritty subject matter.  Not everything is wizards and roses.  What I liked about it is that each of the main characters seemed to have equal time in the book.  They all had something to add to the story, and being that this takes place in a small town, I find it very true to heart.  Everyone knows everyone else's business, and that business is not always good.  I just completed it last night, and I can't stop thinking about it."

author: b'Mariann Hohe'
title: b'entertaining book'
body: b'I thought this book was interesting and very entertaining. However there are some disturbing scenes and mature themes so if you are not expecting something very different from harry potter watch out!'

author: b'J. Rytina'
title: b'Great character study. LOVED IT!'
body: b'I loved how the characters mixed good and bad; all were flawed. Also captured English village life perfectly. A very good read.'

author: b'ANGELA PETERS K'
title: b'Disturbing and depressing'
body: b'I had to go back many times to finish reading this book. Altough well written the different characters are very depressing and a little too harsh for my taste.'

author: b'Antonio C'
title: b'Why waste your time?'
body: b"I started this book thinking that it would be engaging and a good read.  Instead, it is far from interesting and filled with so many boring characters you can hardly tell them apart, or want to.  Don't waste your time with such a silly story.  Drugs, rape, etc. are used as a spice to try to liven up this poor excuse of a book.  I kept waiting for the story to get better.  It didn't.  Stick to Harry Potter.  Loved that series."

author: b'savmar21'
title: b'great'
body: b'lover her work. quick service to the delivery service of amazon. thank you so very much. keep making it easy'

author: b'BMS'
title: b'Very disappointed'
body: b'I found this book very hard to get into and boring. I made it to Chapter 5 and gave up.'

author: b'shirley moore'
title: b"It's not Harry Potter by a long shot"
body: b"If the mystery written under her pseudonym is like this one, it's draggy and slow. Rowling hardly adheres to the precepts taught in writing classes. Harry Potter is her genre. She should stick to it."

author: b'Robyn'
title: b'Great view into small-town politics'
body: b'As a huge Harry Potter fan, I had no idea what to expect from this book, especially after the mixed reviews. But I loved it! I think many who didn\'t like it expected it to be like HP, but what a wonderful surprise to see how talented Ms. Rowling is that she can produce something totally different, but also excellent. Anyone who has ever lived in a small town anywhere in the world will be able to relate to the goings-on in this story. So put aside any preconceived ideas of what Ms. Rowling "should" write, and enjoy this nuanced story and all-too-recognizable characters.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'My Opinion of "The Casual Vacancy"'
body: b'The book was a very slow start and a bit confusing because there were so many characters.  It did not get really interesting until Part 4 but by the end of the book I did not want to put it down.  The ending left a lot of unanswered questions so there must be a sequel coming.  There was way too much foul language.'

author: b'Molly'
title: b'Cant get into it'
body: b"I started this book with high expectations but it seems to go nowhere. Some guy dies of a heart attack and there is a poor socialist suburb and a nice town and after many many pages I am done. I don't like the characters they are boring and the story is going no where fast. or should I say, slowly. To add to this is the fact that this story is taking place in England and the idiosyncrasies of the British dialogue and mannerisms isn't charming it is also boring. I can imagine getting back into it.  I do have to say in all honesty I have just been on a Stephen King Bender and have read several of his including, Cell, Full Dark No Stars,Fire Starter, the Dome, Joyland, Plus Dan brown's the Inferno which I can recommend  all of the above highly. I also read the Trilogy by Heitzmann the Michelli  Family, While not a Stephen thriller it was a very nice story and I wanted more so ended up reading all three. Her characters are likeable and developed quickly in the story unlike Rowling. Now that I think of it I never did finish the 3rd Harry Potter book and never bothered with the others after that."

author: b'Bob Hebrink'
title: b'did not disappoint!'
body: b"Wonderful pace of story telling. Near the end I couldn't turn the page fast enough to see where this story was going!"

author: b'BradSF'
title: b'pretty good so far'
body: b"slow reader! pretty good as I had borrowed it from the library and read in it till I had to take it back with a waiting list I couldn't renew it! now I have started all over again! be warned it is a romance novel and not for kids! it is geared towards adults and has adult sex scenes described in it! can't put it down! about to where I left off last time!"

author: b'Kelly Williams'
title: b'deeply touching'
body: b"all the hype and then controversy over the reception of the new book made me get aroud to reading this one.  so glad i did  i'll never forget it."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Excellent book but not for everyone...'
body: b'All politics are local proves true in this unusual offering by J.K. Rowling.  This story of a small town and its residents is both subtle and hard-hitting.  The layers of the story begin to unfold as the sudden death of a council member, Barry Fairbrother, leaves what is called a casual vacancy on the board.  Rowling pulls no punches as she allows the reader to get to know each of her dozen or so characters.  On the surface some are drug addicts, adulterers, and over-ambitious small town politicians.  Yet, as Rawling slowly peels back the layers of the story, we begin to understand how each character came to be.  More importantly, we begin to understand the casual vacancy created by Fairbrother was not only on the council but also in the lives of the townspeople.'

author: b'Rosalind'
title: b'Real worts and all citizens'
body: b'Two communities fighting for representation in a fictional area of Britain. Characters are well drawn and flawed, mostly unlikeable though.'

author: b'L. Thayer'
title: b'Disappointed story'
body: b'What a miserable group of people in this story. Not my kind of book at all. The only redeeming character was the one who died. I was so disappointed.'

author: b'LindyLouMac'
title: b'Sadly probably pretty near the mark when it comes to home truths about society today!'
body: b"It was a relief to know that J.K. Rowling decided to to write a completely different kind of novel after her success with Harry Potter. Her first venture into the adult market has proved that she can write and entertain us in the real world as well as fantasy. I am actually not sure if I would have chosen to read this novel from the blurb had it been by an unknown author, but because it was written by J.K Rowling that was a different matter. She has always claimed that she uses real people as the basis of stories and this comes across with totally believable characters in 'The Casual Vacancy' which is an interesting bird's eye look into life in a small town in the UK, sadly probably pretty near the mark when it comes to home truths about society today! I was not surprised to read that the BBC are already planning an adaptation of the novel for television, where its realistic drama will come across well. The character development is excellent but the plot is purposely slow so it takes time and patience in your reading as you need to get to know the individuals personalities in this character driven novel."

author: b'Valerie Hughes'
title: b'Vacancy'
body: b"Not my cup of tea at all.  Did not like the narrative style and just couldn't get into it. Tried till chapter 4."

author: b'Hoodlum51'
title: b'Good read'
body: b'I felt the Harry Potter books were difficult to read as I felt they were geared towards young readers, even though I absolutely loved the movies.  However, The Casual Vacancy is an adult read.  J K Rowling is a fabulous writer.  Great character development.  I first listened to this with Audible then had to actually read the novel.  LOVE IT!!'

author: b'Buckeye Rider'
title: b'Could you cram in more profanity or dubious situations in one novel?  I think not'
body: b'I was really looking forward to seeing J. K. Rowling branch out into other subjects and I had high expectations of this novel.  Unfortunately, it felt like it was the work of someone who had never previously been published.'

author: b'James I Vansandt Jr'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"The book was hyped by the written reviews I saw yet when I purchased the book I was sorely disappointed. Filthy language, boring characters, and a maddeningly slow plot. Don't waste your time or money is my message to others."

author: b'Kate in Maine'
title: b'Very well written'
body: b'This is a very well written book. It draws you in from the first page and is a wonderful examination of people\'s motives and emotions. I can understand why people who were expecting another Harry Potter experience would have initially been surprised by the difference in tone, but certainly it is just as well written and I think more interesting than the HP stories. It\'s simply a more "adult" examination of the world.'

author: b'Ragtag Reader'
title: b'Skipped most of the 2nd half'
body: b"I became tired of the story - it was slow and depressing to see people be so ridiculous and cruel in their dealings with each other.  After getting past the halfway point I decided I'd like to know how it ended, so skipped most of the rest of the book and read the last 60 pages.  It filled me in enough on what I didn't read and gave me 'closure'.  I was glad I didn't spend the time on the rest of the book."

author: b'William R. Little MD'
title: b'A Casual Vacany - Not What I Expected from the Author of Harry Potter'
body: b'"A Casual Vacancy" was not what I expected from the talented author of Harry Potter.  I realized that this was her 1st attempt at adult literature but if this had been her 1st book, I doubt anyone would have read it or Harry Potter.  It was slow, crude, dark and long.  I listened to the audiobook on a long road trip.  After the 1st couple of disk, I kept thinking it would surely get better...it did not.  After getting approximately half way through the book, I felt I had invested so much time in it already that I had to finish it.  I kept trying to determine where she was going with the story and what was the point she was trying to make.  After 15 disk, I still did not see the point.'

author: b'Rufescent'
title: b'Plow Through!'
body: b'I bought the "Casual Vacancy" when it first came out, but it took me a while to actually sit down and read it. And even then, it took me thirty pages at a time, until I hit about page three-hundred, to actually get hooked. But once I was, I couldn\'t put the book down - each character was developing nicely, and the plot had picked up to an interesting speed. The ending was perfect and had a semblance of happiness to it. I was so happy when all the lies and deception that surrounded the characters was pushed out in the open and they were forced to recognize it. (When I first started, there was not a single character I liked - they were all disgusting. But, taking in mind that the "Great Gatsby" is also like that, I ploughed through, and I am grateful I did.)'

author: b'MamaLawyer'
title: b'Swinging too hard and missing'
body: b"Akin to the stereotype (or perhaps reality) that says that child actors have to take some grown-up rolls to stop being seen as children, Rowling confessed that with this novel she aimed to demonstrate that she can write books for adults. Unfortunately, this is so over the top as to be equivalent to Emma Watson becoming a hardcore porn star to prove that she's a big girl now. This book is so dreadfully overdone it's difficult to read. Character after character is one-dimensional and completely self-deluded. Yes, I know all humans are flawed and that we all have faults that could be put under a microscope. Rowling seems to believe that every single person is nothing but flaws utterly without redeeming characteristics. If she intended this effect, this is a terribly cynical and simplistic novel; if she instead intended to provide some positive character traits and complex personalities then she failed miserably and the book was poorly written. Either way, characters this uniformly bad and, well, uniform, cannot amount to a good story."

author: b'Cbok'
title: b"It's no Harry Potter..."
body: b"I must be too dumb to appreciate all the nuances within this book.  It has taken me forever to figure out the complexities within each of the characters and how they relate to one another.  I am so over it and don't think I'll even attempt to finish it."

author: b'Susan'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Was not at all what I expected.  It was drawn out over detailed to many complicated characters.  If I read this book as my first JKR book I may not have read any more of her books.  Maybe this story line wasn't for me but I found it a bit boring.  sorry.  I loved her Harry Potter books (which I read many times) I feel that sorry was the most imaginative creative story ever thought off.  Let's see what she writes next."

author: b'Kshopper'
title: b'Not my Cup of Tea'
body: b"While I appreciate the author's attention to detail; I found this book to be filled with stereotypical characters which I tried to care about, but in the end just could not. It was chore to get through the first third of the book. As an avid reader, I've been re-reading Shakespeare, Melville, Dostoevsky and Tolstoy so the previous statement holds some weight."

author: b'JoAnne Platero'
title: b'fascinating insight in class relations in England'
body: b"I loved the book. I found the description of social classes fascinating, especially her treatment of the less fortunate. I was quite taken with how she captured the speech patterns of the young people in the story. All of the characters were well formed and interesting. It was a moving story and very engaging. I've recommended the book widely."

author: b'candyapple22'
title: b'interesting but long'
body: b'It runs a bit long at times, and sort of feels like a preachy rant about class & poverty.  A whole lot of muggle drama, but picks up near the end.'

author: b'Kristin'
title: b'Brilliant'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy is the epitome of literary brilliance. Laced with realism and wit, Rowling took a seemingly mundane topic (that is our everyday lives) and turned it into a masterpiece. The characters were plentiful and complex, and she managed to intertwine their lives with the realism and originality that is indicative of only a truly great author. It is a stunningly raw portrayal of human nature and its response to the political and social atmosphere of today. If you are looking for a happy ending or a light read, this is NOT the book for you. That being said, I devoured this book! It is one that you will stay up late reading even though you have to be up early the next day. Absolutely brilliant.'

author: b'Kamilah Abdul-Alim'
title: b'Departure from Potter'
body: b"My husband bought the book for me.  I have read all of the HP books and have a ton of collection of novels from the same author.  If I like something someone has written, I'm fairly likely to pick up his/her next book.  So it wasn't a stretch to read a 'different' book from Rowling.  I certainly wasn't expecting it to be anything like Harry Potter in the sense that there would be magic, fantasy or separate worlds.  I did however expect magic - as in being transported into an enchanting town and mesmerized by the interweaving of the character's lives.  I was therefore disappointed because there were far too many characters and they were rather flat.  Krystal Weedon was someone I was truly pulling for because her life was so truly depressing.  She was the underdog and unfortunately, stayed that way.  Simon Price? Omgoodness I wanted so badly to see his true demise and his family get even with him.  Since I'd been very pleased with the majority of the Harry Potter books, the content, the growth of characters and their emotional register, I was disappointed by this book and the writing in general.  I was expecting a little Steinbeck or Carson McCullers but ended up getting far, far less."

author: b'mkoch'
title: b'Lovely'
body: b"Great read. Moves very quickly just like the Harry potter series. I didn't want to put it down and couldn't read it fast enough"

author: b'Watchung Hills'
title: b'I wouldnt want to spend time with the people in that town.'
body: b'I kept waiting for the story to get better--for at least ONE of the  characters to become likable, or at least get some better insight into how they got to be the way they were.'

author: b'b.jones'
title: b'I enjoyed reading it'
body: b'I truly and utterly enjoyed reading this book although or even more it definitely is not some light reading.'

author: b'E. Phelps'
title: b'This Book Sucked!'
body: b"This book is one of the worst novels I have ever read. It is tawdry, petty and banal, and if there was such a thing as an anti-tourist bureau for England, an agency charged with making you not ever want to go to a place, this could be their star publication. If you want to be depressed, read this novel. I skipped ahead and read the end, hoping for something better, but did not find it. Don't waste your money or your time on this book, it's just awful."

author: b'Stephen P. Newton'
title: b'I liked it. I really liked it!'
body: b'It\'s not Harry Potter--not even "Harry Potter for Adults."  Great characters, well developed, and many a great turn of phrase.  I\'ll read anything by her, now.'

author: b'jennifer'
title: b'A bit pointless, unnecessarily long'
body: b"The only reason I picked up this book is because it is written by J.K. Rowling.  I was warned beforehand to expect something completely different than HP, so at least I didn't have that disappointment.  The sad, disturbing subject matter made it unenjoyable (for me) to read and the awful, selfish characters left me nothing to care about or relate to.  There was a sort of moral at the end, but because of the self-centered nature of the characters, I don't believe that many or any of them would take that tragedy to heart and make real changes in their lives.  I won't read this again and I don't recommend it."

author: b'HNArizona'
title: b'NO plot, lots of F bombs and trash'
body: b'I was so excited to dive into a new story by JK Rowling. Within the first 50pages I was already getting the sense that this book was heading nowhere...and the F word 5 times on every page was getting really old. I tried to suspend judgement and kept on reading in the hopes that the plot would pick up. However, another 50 pages or so later and I realized that the book was just smut and not worth finishing. I dumped it in a trash can at the airport--not even worth reselling! So disappointing and trashy, without a trace of the creative brilliance in Harry Potter.'

author: b'H. Davis'
title: b'Much ado about nothing'
body: b"Incredibily boring account of forgettable folk.  After the first 10 pages I put it down for 6  months until it surfaced again on my bedside table.  Vowing to see why my pal recommended it, I spent an hour or so slogging through tawdry,dreary,colorless descriptions of characters going nowhere, doing nothing.  Quite perturbed, I skipped to the last 50 pages of the same drivel and felt no remorse in chucking the book.  Don't waste your money or more importantly, your time."

author: b'Cynthia'
title: b'Not a Casual Read'
body: b"Loved this book! A tale of two cities without hope of resurrection or redemption. We've swept the aristocracy aside only to find a banal acceptance of a social order that still leaves the youngest and weakest vulnerable to abuse and neglect. A brilliant comedic tragedy masking a razored grit lit. I admit that I started with Harry Potter expectations, making the first chapter difficult. Before the tears dry, start reading this book again. You will appreciate the writing even more."

author: b'SheWhoMustNotBeNamed'
title: b'Yeesh!!!'
body: b"It took me six months to finish this book after reading the first couple of chapters.  That's actually good, since it took me two YEARS to finish the 5th Harry Potter book.  As in that book, this story stopped me cold -- the characters who were so unlikable, the political bickering, the junkies, the alleged pedophilia, the paranoia -- I'm surprised I actually forced myself to finish it."

author: b'Denveriter'
title: b'Vapid and vacant'
body: b"It has none of the stellar qualities of her wonderful Harry Potter books.  What a disappointment!  I'm sorry I bought it."

author: b'C. Logan'
title: b'Brilliant'
body: b"Amazing novel. Moving, powerful, you come to feel like you know all the characters. I'm very glad I read this book."

author: b'Kvphilli'
title: b'Loved it!'
body: b"This is a great book!  I am a huge Harry Potter fan and loved reading another of JK Rowling's works.  The tone and voice of the work are very similar to the HP books but this is clearly mean for adults.  The author is an amazing story teller and she really draws the reader into the lives of the characters.  Somewhat explicit and parts and the plot is a bit dark."

author: b'Robert A. Bilow'
title: b'surprise'
body: b'J.K. Rowling had shown real ability with the Harry Potter series but, that ability was diminished with "A Casual Vacancy". It contains excessive and unneeded profanity and some sections bordered on pornography.  Rowling is capable of great writing without resorting to such things.'

author: b'Z Hayes'
title: b'Difficult to get into, but has its moments'
body: b'Although I am a great fan of the Harry Potter novels by J.K. Rowling, I knew that this was going to be very different just from all the synopses and reviews I read but I felt compelled to check it out anyway. I wanted to experience for myself how well Ms. Rowling transitions into the mature, grown-up fiction genre after having written so successfully for the Young Adult fantasy market (though the HP novels are ageless in that they appeal to readers of all ages).'

author: b'Anna L. Luznar'
title: b'SO VERY DISAPPOINTED'
body: b'Addicted to Potter, but understood this would be completely different.  I believe I approached it with an open mind.  Ordered it as a gift for my adult daughter, also a Potter fan.  She had read only a little when she said, "Mama, I don\'t think you are old enough to read this".  I am 76-years old, but she was right.  The language is vulgar and coarse in its entirety.  The characters were people I recognized from my own experience, nearly all a bunch of losers.  In Rowling\'s hands, none of them seemed able to get a grip and rise above their situations.  I found no redeeming value in this work.  An acquaintance told me she read only a few pages and discarded the book.  I wish we had been that smart.  I was so certain that Rowling would come through with something to lift and challenge the spirit. I gave the book away with instructions to not return it. What a waste of her talent and my time!'

author: b'hpylori'
title: b'Excellent'
body: b"Stick with this one.  I was at least around 100 pages into the book before I was really captivated.  There are many characters to introduce, and it was only after quite a few pages that their interconnectedness became clear and I got a deeper understanding of their personalities and motivations.  Once I reached that point, however, I couldn't put it down."

author: b'Adrian'
title: b'why?'
body: b"I don't know why we need such depressing books. Boring and slow to read. The worst book I have read."

author: b'A. Morris'
title: b'Flawed, but Well-Written Nonetheless'
body: b"I know a lot of people were let down by the Casual Vacancy. It's quite a departure from the fun and exciting world of Harry Potter. This story focuses on the lives of 20 or so people in a small town in England and how they are all affected by the passing of a beloved town councilman. The thing you'll notice first about the book is how much more violent and sexual it is than expected. The story starts off rather slow and may confuse some because it goes through the process of introducing us to each of the main characters. This takes up the first third of the book or so. While I was reading the first third, it didn't seem like there was much of a story to tell. The main plot doesn't really set into motion until the middle of the book, and then it becomes very interesting. The second half becomes exciting and sad, and it expands greatly on the connections between all the main characters. This makes having so many characters confusing for some, but when Rowling goes further into their lives, you will be impressed by how well thought out and well-handled the characters are. Ultimately, this isn't a book for people who need happy endings, or a book for people wanting the next Harry Potter. It is a sad story with a very large scope that will either shock you or just leave you feeling disgusted."

author: b'Elizabeth M. Beagle'
title: b'A Far Cry from Harry Potter'
body: b"While this book received mixed reviews from professional critics, it was an interesting view of English law. Language was a bit over the top and unnecessary. Perhaps it was the author's way of separating from children's books. I would recommend it."

author: b'Ian Gordon Malcomson'
title: b'Fighting Over a Seat'
body: b"When I first started reading this novel, I wasn't quite sure Rowling, the mastermind of Harry Potter fame, was up to writing a real-life story. Now that I am almost finished, I have nothing but praise for her literary efforts. She has very cleverly taken an ordinary life situation in small-village England and turned it into an affair that packs a lot of energy balanced by an equal amount of pathos. The town of Yarvil has never really generated a lot love within its ranks, simply because its members would rather hate than help each other. There is no civil behavior here, especially when the future of the town is at stake and about to be settled in a by-election for a seat on the parish council, vacated by the sudden death of a popular teacher-advocate. There is a piece of land that is currently being used as the home of a popular drug rehab program, which has now come to the attention of a group who want to sell it for housing development. While the campaign heats up, all the innocence that we come to associate with backwater England disappears. There is a fair spate of nastiness in this story because its citizens don't empathize very well with the needs of its more vulnerable citizens - a generation of young druggies who are going through the rigors of rehab. To keep this novel current, Rowlings introduces the Internet as that weapon that will be used by both sides to wreck the other's chance of winning. In the end, all the political mudslinging will lead to disastrously unintended consequences. Someone who has no interest in dirty politics will lose bigtime only because she can't cope with the changes this vote will bring to her fragile life."

author: b'Kenneth B. Clark'
title: b'Just terrible'
body: b'Let me begin by saying that I loved the Harry Potter books. I have read and re-read them many times. My wife cried when Dumbledore died. The Seven Harry books are filled with the things that make books great: character, plot, story, etc.. I wish that JK would keep writing them, I would buy them. That being said, I had high hopes for this book. (I never felt that Harry Potter was a "children\'s" book. There are many adult themes and topics, not the least of which is the death of a beloved central character, Dumbledore, and the death of many secondary beloved characters in the final book.) Sadly, this book is awful. It has no redeeming qualties. Don\'t waste your money. What makes this especially sad is that this is an author who has given me hours and hours of joy. I wish I had liked this book. I wanted to like this book. I hated this book! Re-read any of the HP books instead. I have not given up on JK tho. I intend to buy her latest detective novel. I hope I like it, I want to like it.'

author: b'boys mom'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'While I knew this book was written for adults, I though JK Rowling really failed.  The story line is non existent, especially given what a great storyteller the author is.  The story is really just a loose character development with gratuitous sex, bad language and random violence thrown in, I suppose to make it "adult".  I repeatedly put this book down, not really caring what happened next.'

author: b'captkeano'
title: b'Not very good for all the wrong reasons'
body: b'I think it\'s quite interesting that the general critical consensus about Rowling\'s _The Casual Vacancy_ is that it\'s not fun. I quite disagree, there were parts of the book I very much enjoyed reading. It is because of this I call it "OK" rather than saying I outright disliked it. The problems inherent to the story are that it\'s just not very well written. I adored the Harry Potter books and thought that it was marvelous to have the chance to watch a writer grow in confidence over the course of a series--the books went from being relatively awkwardly paced but wonderfully imagined (the first), to confident, detailed, gripping, well-plotted texts. None of this confidence is on display in this novel. Full of point of view lapses that may be failed attempts to move the story cinematically but end up making the writing seem a touch amateurish, the story is ponderous, riddled with holes, and leaves a lot of the more powerful ideas it sets up early on unresolved or unexplored before ending predictably, leaving the reader lost as to the intent of the tale. As the novel unfolds, it becomes more of an understated soap opera than a piece of literary fiction. It\'s unfortunate, as the book starts wonderfully, creating a vividly painted imagery of the town the book is set up to study, but then relies on cliched character and setting work that, in the end, tells more of a non-story than that fascinating one it promised from the start.'

author: b'Connie V'
title: b'Excellent Adult Read'
body: b"Yes, I loved the Harry Potter books.  But what a complete change with this well-written adult novel.  Rowling's prose is flawless, and her stories entertwine in the most unique ways.  This tale of what happens to a community upon the death of one individual includes hope, tragedy, responsibility, and again, hope.  I loved this novel."

author: b'Raphael Klarfeld'
title: b'A Little Vacant'
body: b'I enjoyed the character descriptions. I found the subject matter and the subjects a bit morbid. That is not in line with what I usually enjoy reading, and it left me feeling empty and hopeless. I do think it is well written and would call it a literary novel. It defines a certain perspective on how the world works.'

author: b'Dan LaVigne'
title: b'a mean book'
body: b'If Rowling is setting out to prove she can write a non-Harry Potter story she has done so. This book has none of the warmth, charm, cleverness, or love of craft so visible in her earlier work. In fact, it is the very antithesis of those things, seeming to revel in its meanness, lack of sympathy, incoherent plot line and social nihilism. All those pages of problems and shortcomings and then not even a satisfying ending.'

author: b'Annie'
title: b'DISAPPOINTING'
body: b"I read this book as one of the books for the year for our Book Club.  I was looking forward to reading J K Rowling's newest book but I found the book very disappointing. The writing style is poor, the characters at times confusing, did not enjoy the book at all.  I think I will wait to hear more reviews about her newest book."

author: b'andrea b.'
title: b'Incredible!'
body: b"If you're expecting Harry Potter you won't like this.  The only obvious similarities are fantastic writing and expert character development.  These characters are all flawed but you like most of them anyway and care about what happens to them.  It's truly a stunning and profound book if you stick with it for the first few chapters.  It might seem cynical but it's full of hope and redemption as well.  One of the best books I've read in ages!"

author: b'Sarah'
title: b'Not bad'
body: b"This wasn't a terrible book, but it was hard for me to read at times and to get through. Obviously, I'm a huge Rowling fan, and I always zoomed through her other novels. This one however, took a bit of time. Overall, I enjoyed this novel. If you are looking for something like her Harry Potter series, this book is not like it at all- it is much different."

author: b'jjwriting'
title: b'I enjoyed it'
body: b'It took me a little while to get into this novel but ultimately I enjoyed it. Felt like i got to know the characters.'

author: b'Lynda Browning'
title: b'Awful, simply awful'
body: b"Boring, crude, depressing and totally uninteresting.  I can't believe people actually gave this piece of trash 5 stars.  Won't read any more of her novels."

author: b'sukiyaki'
title: b'So disappointed'
body: b"I have been a great fan of  Rowlings' Harry Potter series and gave this book a lot of latitude as a result. The book has well developed characters and fluidity, but is so dark. I did not expect to find negativity in all the characters. I left reading sessions with a sense of unease and discord. I have no desire to read another book like this. I gave it 2 stars on account of being well written, but give the story itself 1/2 star. Had this been written by another author, I wouldn't have continued to read it"

author: b'Seymour Hamilton'
title: b'An Engaging Chronicle'
body: b"JK Rowling's A Casual Vacancy is a compelling novel that deals with the tension between the smug inhabitants of a postcard-perfect little English town, and the marginalised, welfare-dependent and often criminal people who live in the neighbouring public housing estate."

author: b'Blackdawn'
title: b'Different but good'
body: b'This is quite a break from JK Rowlings usual Harry Potter novels. I liked this overall. I thought she really captured the small town atmospher'

author: b'Mermaidsinc'
title: b'wow'
body: b'Harsh reality not wizard fantasy but just as engaging and involving amazing characterisation and creation of a discrete world. Powerfully written.'

author: b'Rachel A. Flavin'
title: b'Gets better'
body: b'Although starting a little slow, I grew to really enjoy this book.  The characters started out all the same, but became distinct characters in themselves.  Makes you really think about the class distinctions in your life.'

author: b'Jb'
title: b'Good once you know the characters'
body: b'I liked the book once I was about 1/3 in. Then I really enjoyed how all the characters were intertwined. Very graphic and makes you think about poverty, drugs, family and belonging.'

author: b'Beverly Wassouf'
title: b'Read on a cruise'
body: b'I enjoyed this book even though I was sitting by the pool, with all kinds of distractions, on a cruise.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Depressing'
body: b"The book started off with a depressing event and ended with one too! I enjoyed all of the characters and how they were linked. I couldn't wait to see how things turned out, I just love her style of writing and how developed her characters are. Can't wait for her next book whatever it may be."

author: b'diane k'
title: b'She must need to write volume-wise'
body: b"I didn't read the Harry Potter books, but I gather they really always needed the next volume and then the next, etc.  This story seems to wrap up too tidily, too suddenly, too unbelievably.  She develops the characters pretty well and doesn't make any glaring errors in continuity, but then she doesn't know how to wind it down comfortably.  Or maybe she just got tired of keeping all of the balls in the air.  It doesn't end with a klunk but it lacks some sort of a better wind down."

author: b'Erika C. Purtell'
title: b'Brilliant, but devastating.'
body: b"I must say it wasn't at all what I expected, but I was very impressed.  Like many who loved Harry Potter, I was anxious to see what she would do next.  My only complaint is that the beginning was a little slow, but as it unfolded and I realized how detestable the majority of the characters are, I still found them intriguing.  That alone should be a turn off for anyone looking for something as light and fun as Harry.  With this book she delves into a place that simply makes people uncomfortable and for that I applaud her.  Where Harry was fantasy, The Casual Vacancy is hyper-real.  Truth of the matter is that people do live in crippling poverty.  People are addicted to drugs.  This is the world we live in and it's a heartbreaking portrayal of neglect, dysfunction and how ugly human beings can actually be."

author: b'Sydnellie'
title: b'Brilliant!!!!'
body: b'I knew before I began reading this novel that I would not be disappointed. The skill of her prose, vivid language, and characters that got into your head made an enjoyable read. Yet, I do have to say it became just s tad elementary and slow about 84%of the way through, but to pick back up with such a climatic ending made up for it. I know some people cannot get the amazing composition of HARRY Potter out of their minds as they read this novel for an older audience, but I think it is a good thing. For readers that grew up reading Harry Potter and her other books this book was published just in time for us who are now adults'

author: b'BritRuth'
title: b'Disappointing Trip Back "Home"'
body: b'JK Rowling\'s foray into non-Harry Potter writing. As a British expat I had been craving a touch of "home" and thought this would give it to me. It didn\'t. It\'s heavy, hard to get into and it took me months to read - I kept putting it down to read other books, and only came back because I hate to leave a book unfinished. It\'s done now. Thankfully.'

author: b'J. W. Mcmanus'
title: b'An adult novel'
body: b'Ms Rowling has succeeded in writing a novel for adults which is as readable as her famed Harry Potter series!'

author: b'Natasha Holme'
title: b'Precision humour'
body: b"Acutely observed, and expressed with precision humour. J.K. Rowling has created a whole world of delicious dysfunction. I was utterly absorbed. I feel awed by the weight of attention she must have given to building plot and characterisation, and to the interweaving of the countless, complex elements of this story. I loved this book. It's a masterpiece."

author: b'Elizabeth Rouxel'
title: b'Slow at first'
body: b"A bit slow in places didn't grab me early enough. When I persevered it picked up and was in the end a good story."

author: b'Sarah Izzi'
title: b'Takes a long time to get into, but worth the wait'
body: b"I ended up loving this book, I would absolutely recommend it to anyone. That being said, it took a good 100, 150 pages to really get into the story. I almost stopped reading twice. So glad I didn't though! By page 200, I couldn't put it down!"

author: b'Mack Steele'
title: b'Pretty good'
body: b"Honestly, it's pretty good! Takes a little time for the reader to get adjusted to who is who and to get the flow of the story but otherwise it was quite great!"

author: b'Kevin Cheezum'
title: b'Casual Disgusting Flop'
body: b"Really disappointed. After the Potter series, I thought I was in for a fresh and thoroughly enjoyable read. However, I was introduced to a despicable and disgusting piece of literature. We need something that makes us feel good, not dirty and empty. If this was Rowling's 1st book, I would probably not read her again."

author: b'HH'
title: b'Where did J.K. Rowlings go?'
body: b"I don't know, but it doesn't seem like she wrote this book. I've had it for weeks now and can't even get to the halfway mark!. I'll force myself to finish it but do yourself a favor and start rereading the Harry Potter series"

author: b'Bill Thomson'
title: b'gritty and current'
body: b'Local politics aside the "Fields" issues are a very current problem worldwide. I work with methadone clients and have been lucky to not have had to deal with any difficult ones but I know they are out there. The book highlights current issues with internet privacy and hacking. Could have done with some of the characters being more developed. It was almost as if there was some abridging of some of the sub-characters'

author: b'willgirl'
title: b'Interesting and complex'
body: b"I first started the story on tape in the car, then, since I reached my destination long before the story was over, I downloaded it.  To some extent, it was better narrated, when you could enjoy the rhythm  of the language and the vocabulary , but even it print the multiple and intertwined layers of the story were well worth the time. To some extent, Rowlings' descriptive powers reminded me of the Potter series, but otherwise there is nothing similar. It's fascinating to me that an author can write such a different genre."

author: b'Marilyn Ann Puglisi'
title: b'Midsomer Murders revisited'
body: b'The writer shows an intimate knowledge of social and economic disadvantage and the attitudes of those "better off"'

author: b'Amanda'
title: b'Expected better'
body: b'It seems Ms. Rowling is trying so hard to write an adult novel she forgot to write a story. I am not impressed, sadly. If I had not been reading this for a book club, I would have quit reading it.'

author: b'christie'
title: b'gripping and shocking'
body: b"There are a lot of mixed reviews about this book, so I wasn't really sure what to expect when I started reading. This is first adult novel by J.K. Rowling, the author of the Harry Potter books. It was quite the detour from those books, so I think lots of the readers when into it assuming it might have a hint of HP in there, and I think the Amazon reviews show this (around 800 for each of the stars). I've read a lot of witty, British novels, and compared to those this was a pretty good book."

author: b'Lauren McKelvey'
title: b'JK'
body: b'It was hard to read this novel after Harry but it was good. I cried. Such strong words and feelings but nothing will compare to Harry. It was hard reading an adult novel from her'

author: b'Holly W.'
title: b"Garbage - don't waste your money"
body: b'I wanted to write a review on this book after the first 50 pages and not finish reading it but after reading reviews by people condescendingly declaring that they actually read the whole book before writing, I decided to gag it down and eventually write one. If I can spare just one person this distracted and ill-conceived tome, it will be worth it.'

author: b'Lone Driver'
title: b'Casual Vacancy Frightenly too Real'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy is a bit slow at the beginning as we learn the main characters of the book.  Sadly many of these people are unhappy with their lives and it is like a Dursley neighborhood from Harry Potter. It is painfully descriptive and tragic especially as people ignore the obvious in front of them.  It was very well written but I would rather read more fantasy than reality from Ms. Rowling.'

author: b'W.C. Toans'
title: b'drags on endlessly'
body: b'i found this book tedious to to the extreme, i am an HP fan and i will admit a bias but that does not change the fact that it is as entertaining as reading a 13 year old girls diary. the characters are incredibly well developed and feel very real and very believable but there is no story.'

author: b'Dylan Choice'
title: b"Don't buy this because you liked Harry Potter"
body: b'This book was not gripping at all.  I actually could not finish the book.  I received this book as a gift from a friend, due to my love for the Harry Potter series, however, I was left frustrated and let down.  I was 120 pages into the book before I decided to stop reading it, so I gave it a solid chance.  I just felt like the concept was great until I felt bored and wanting more.  The so called "Casual Vacancy" wasn\'t even addressed much in the pages that I did read and I felt that I was 120 pages into a book I knew nothing about.  I had no idea where this book was going or why I was even reading it.  I know there are readers out there that did like the book, but if you are a fan of Harry Potter and a fan of a book that gets you pumped up to read the next chapter then this book isn\'t probably for you.  I feel the need to share this with people, because one, I was excited to read this book and two, I hardly ever give up on a book...but unfortunately I had to on this =('

author: b'Claire'
title: b"Excellent book , if you don't mind heavy reads"
body: b"I grew up with the HP series and didn't really know what to expect from J.K. Rowling's adult novel, so I dilly-dallied and only yesterday finally sat down to read a copy a friend had loaned me."

author: b'nancy elliott'
title: b'tough start'
body: b'I thought it took a while to get into the book, but enjoyed it after a tedious character development phase.'

author: b'Harriet Damen'
title: b'Great'
body: b'Wonderful storytelling, realistic characters. I loved the book.'

author: b'Kristian'
title: b'A very new direction for her'
body: b"It has a complexity we're used to from HP, but on a far more intimate scale."

author: b'L. Clark'
title: b'Beautifully written and makes you think - great combination'
body: b"The subject matter of this book is fairly intense - Rowling really gets into the seamy underbelly of life and doesn't pull any punches when it comes to describing secrets that are hidden behind closed doors. As a fan of her writing in the past, I wasn't entirely sure what to expect with this...and I was very pleasantly surprised. I particularly appreciate the author's ability to really make you feel like you're there, in the middle of the experience - touching, tasting, smelling, feeling, hearing - yet her words never feel overworked. Some authors need to write long, run-on sentences with lots of adjectives...and you're usually still left wanting more. I feel like Rowling puts you there in a situation, forces you to respond, to think, and to wonder...what would I do if that were me? How would I feel? Realistic enough to be disturbing, but still make you hungry to read the next page. I loved it."

author: b'Susan'
title: b'Stick to stories for kids!'
body: b'I read to the end of this because I wanted to find out what happened (and I had bought it instead of borrowing it from the library) and I was glad for a satisfying ending - but what hard work in the meantime!'

author: b'Cyndi L. Smith'
title: b"Language masks writer's brillance"
body: b"I LOVED J.K. Rowling's work in the Harry Potter series and was very excited to get her newest work. I believe she is a brilliant writer, and could see her style (which I love) in the 20 pages I read - however what I couldn't get past was the language. The over use of the F bomb and other such language plagued the dialog so badly that I just couldn't read it. I am sorely disappointed and believe that Jo is a much more brilliant writer than this garbage shows."

author: b'E Bell'
title: b'Pleasant surprise'
body: b'I was expecting to be underwhelmed and was surprised - in a good way - not a literary read but I enjoyed the story and angles.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'alot of characters'
body: b"I heard J.K. say if you didn't cry at the end you had no heart, but really you knew what was going to happen well into the book. As usual way to many characters, no depths in any of them, and a little hgard to understand if your not British!"

author: b'P. Marshall'
title: b'Waste of good paper'
body: b"Words can not describe how disappointed I was with this book! No, I was not expecting Harry Potter characters, but I was expecting relatable characters that would draw you in to the story. I have never left a book unread once I start it, but I was truly tempted with this one. The only thing that kept me going was the hope that it would get better....it didn't...it just got more depressing :-("

author: b'p.howard'
title: b'Great read'
body: b"Started slow but came together amazingly at the end. Nice follow up to the Harry potter series. Can't wait until her next book."

author: b'karenmpbrandon'
title: b'This book is a dementor - it will suck all the joy out of you.'
body: b'I listened to every word of this doleful, vulgar, seamy book while driving across the country. I knew it was an adult book and not intended for children but it is as though Ms Rowling set out to prove that in spite of her previous wonderful books she can write one that is as depressed and depressing as she is.  The book is a bloodbath of death, dark events, the foulest of language (how can a WOMAN so casually and frequently use a nasty word that denigrates all women???). There is not one happy person or one happy event in it and it rapidly sucks all the joy out of the reader. Most of the characters die, including an innocent child. It is not just gritty, but grimy. All the characters hate one another, cheat on one another, kill or want to kill one another, and there is no humor or lightness of tone anywhere in it.  I\'m glad I only rented the CD set and didn\'t give her very much of my money for producing this kind of writing.  I knew it was an adult book but I wasn\'t prepared for it to be an expression of Ms. Rowling\'s ongoing clinical depression.  Good literature raises one up and inspires one to greatness; it doesn\'t drag one down into mud and guts and misery like this book.  Skip it altogether until she writes a decent one, and read one of the pieces of great literature that explore the development of GOOD character and have exciting, rewarding plots, like "Shane" or "Rebecca". Neither of these have happy endings, but they are well written, well plotted, and well developed. I\'m not a prude and I\'m not hung up on political correctness, but how can we condemn Paul Dean for using the N-word decades ago and not condemn  J K Rowling for currently using - PUBLISHING, even - the C-word repeatedly in this horrible, awful, depressing, joyless book???'

author: b'Jamie Phillips'
title: b'Lots of characters'
body: b'At first glance, this book is about a "casual vacancy" (caused by sudden death) on a local town council. I almost gave up because I don\'t care about small towns and know nothing about British politics.'

author: b'Machelle Hill'
title: b'Not your kids JK Rowling'
body: b"Delivered quickly and condition was as described. A bit different from what I was expecting but the characters were well drawn, the plot interesting, and the ending wonderfully predictable - you knew it was coming but denial isn't just a river in Egypt."

author: b'medea'
title: b'a must read'
body: b'This is a great book by J.K. ROwling. This books focus is not fairytale and magic of Harry Potter land but the harsh reality of classicism. She came from a very meager background and I am certain she used that as inspiration for this complex stories where most of the characters are flawed but complex. The story is not a far stretch from what it is like to loive in slums that are just a stones throw from the Upper Class and how the poor are marginalized and vilified. Many do not like the book because they want more of her Harry Potter writing but this book demonstrates her fluidity as a writer and her compassion, she is a very large philanthropist and has opened centers for disadvantaged children.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Wonderful style. Rough content'
body: b'Like her style more than her content. Pretty rough, especially since those characters acting out the content are mostly teens.'

author: b'Scott f Borgstadt'
title: b'Yuk!'
body: b"There have only been 2 or 3 books in my life that I haven't finished reading and this is one of them.  Ii was very disappointed in the book."

author: b'Ellen @ The Canon'
title: b'Amazing Debut by Rowling for Adult Fiction'
body: b'Originally posted on The Canon!'

author: b'Laurel'
title: b'A dismal story'
body: b"There's a single word that perfectly describes J.K. Rowling's The Casual Vacancy: dismal. Not dismal in the sense of particularly bad, but more in the sense of depressing or dreary. What's interesting is that the word dismal does not actually appear in the book. But just about every synonym for it does. I chose one random chapter and took down all the words that contributed to its dismal feel. Here they are: stupid, nervous, dread, anxiety, overcast, irritated, anger, poxy, bitterness, misery, guilty, frustrated, shock, disappointment, cold, nasty, furious, disgust, horror, dull, dislike, intimidation, rages, frightening, insolence, gossipy, taint and exhausting. That's one chapter. There are lots of other chapters just like it. This book is a one-note symphony, Hogwarts without the magic, an unvaried slog through stifling, never-ending bleakness."

author: b'Phil Prendergast'
title: b'Good holiday read'
body: b'A very different but good read , awfully sad in places , telling a good story of various characters , whose lives all intertwine in a strong  but ultimately exposing prejudice in all its ugly forms.'

author: b'Alyssa Karounos'
title: b'Okay.'
body: b"The serivice was great, and although I love JKR, the book was not for me. I am a 17 year old girl (16 when I read it) and it's just not for my audience. I enjoyed reading JKR's writing again, which was beautiful. I would recommend this to someone over the age of 40."

author: b'Richard L. Kendrick'
title: b'Not too bad a first try at adult fiction'
body: b"It was hard to get into and I thought I wouldn't like it, but I did.  Not a great read but above average."

author: b'millmarc675'
title: b'Nothing casaual about this book'
body: b'Characters welldrawn.  Rowlands is a masterstoryteller and thisbook is probably thebeginning of her "adult" career. The ending is alittle unexpected.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'well written characters'
body: b"But I don't watch soap operas on tv and I don't need to read them either.  I wonder how long Rowling was chewing on these characters...."

author: b'Keith'
title: b'The Anti-Potter'
body: b"I'm really torn with this one. On the one hand, the writing is dazzling. Ms. Rowling really shows her talents, particularly toward the end, when she pulls all the plots together. Unfortunately, at least for me, I find the story itself too down beat for my tastes. Almost, I feel as if I'm reading about what happens to the Dursley's after they leave Privet Drive. The characters are all variations on Harry Potter's Aunt and Uncle, with their failings, mean spirited personalities, and foibles. I wanted one character to root for, but sadly, that one person created the casual vacancy and is missing for most of the book. This is not to say Ms. Rowling's failed. I believe she succeeded in her intention--bringing to light a serious problem in her native England. Much the way I recognize the brilliance of Schindler's List, but did not enjoy it, The Casual Vacancy leaves me hollow. Is it good? Yes. But I can't bring myself to say I liked it."

author: b'John M. Grohol'
title: b'Now we know...'
body: b'What if you were to take all of the characters in the Harry Potter series, removed the magic and wizardry and spells, and transported them to two little towns somewhere in England? Would anyone care to read the ensuing story of small town politics, and smaller-town lives?'

author: b'connie r'
title: b'Sad commentary on the human condition'
body: b"It's hard to find a character to care about in this book.  Most have no redeeming characteristics at all.  However, J.K. Rowling's flawless writing kept me I interested to the end."

author: b'gabriela pascal'
title: b'Excellent description'
body: b'It is an excellent description of how peopel tend to see others people miseries and forget their owns.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Gritty characters and good story'
body: b'Kept me turning the pages.  Real life gritty drama.  The hopelessness of parts of society and the failure of those supposedly in charge trying to change things for the better is neatly described.  Definitely no fantasy here.'

author: b'M. Kerwood'
title: b'Not what I was expecting'
body: b'After having read the Harry Potter Books I was expecting something else.'

author: b'Charles Gill'
title: b"Book was in okay condition, not 'like new'"
body: b'The spine had damage and there was writing on some of the pages.  The cover also had dirt and wear.  The book can certainly be read, but not suitable for a gift.'

author: b'Margery Leonard'
title: b'Rowling Should Have Quit While She Was Ahead'
body: b"I've started this book 4 times now--and stopped reading it 4 times because its boring.  Rowling introduces so many characters that its hard to keep them straight--and none of them--so far--have been compelling.  In fairness to the author, this review should wait until I've finished the book.  Maybe things will improve.  The thing is, I don't know if I will ever finish it.  There are so many more entertaining books out there--including a re-reading of the Harry Potter series."

author: b'A. Wise'
title: b'Be ready to keep track'
body: b'As usual her descriptions and characters are deep and interesting, but there are so many characters to learn for this one story that it is not a quick and easy read.  It takes about 1/4 of the book to introduce all the players and their motivations, so you have to be ready to concentrate and remember each one and how they are connected.  Definitely not a beach book.'

author: b'Dai-keag-ity'
title: b'Where Dickens Meets Coronation Street'
body: b'J.K. Rowling was always a great storyteller, but with this novel she proves herself to be a writer of rare insight and talent. Managing to avoid what in other hands could have been reduced to a soap opera, the best-selling author in the world delivers up a genuinely interesting and at times quite powerful take on a socio-political war that flares up within a West Country village where the abrupt death of a loved/needed/resented leftist council member suddenly throws a once delicately prevailing balance into the heart of a whirlwind. Exploring as she does every facet of middle and lower class society, Rowling somehow pays homage to the grand Victorian epics, but does so without losing touch with exactly what motivates various groups of people in a particular era: in this case post-New Labor Britain. Filled with memorable characters, some of whom are downright nasty and others incredibly tragic, The Casual Vacancy is as intelligently composed as it is addictively readable, and deserves the five stars I am giving it.'

author: b'Claire Lemay'
title: b'Disqappointed'
body: b'I thought I would love it since it was by JK Rowling but the writing was so differnet than the Potter series that it was disappointing.'

author: b'S. Lockwood'
title: b'In an interview she said she wanted to write a book for adults.'
body: b'This book does not read easily.  More than once I wanted to put it down because I did not feel I cared about the characters and did not care where the book was going.  Not at much fun to read as her Harry Potter books.'

author: b'LB Palmer'
title: b'Unexpectedly good'
body: b'Even after reading good reviews in a number of magazines, I was taken aback at the maturity of this novel. It is hard to separate your expectations of content from this author. The storyline was gritty, real and bitter sweet'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Not a book for the faint of heart.'
body: b"If you are getting this book because you loved Harry Potter, DON'T! If you are getting it because you wish to read a good story by a phenominal authur, DO!"

author: b'Alex C. Telander'
title: b'"The Casual Vacancy"'
body: b'After the unfathomable success of the Harry Potter series, with over 450 million copies sold worldwide, likely making it one of the biggest phenomena of our lifetimes, J. K. Rowling is now back with her first new book in five years.  She now turns to a much more adult story about a quaint little English town where everything is most certainly not as it seems.'

author: b'tcern'
title: b'Fantastic Characters'
body: b'J.K. does it again with a story that will propel your reading simply by the characters. The ending is tragic, but leaves you feeling full of emotion, as the best stories always do. Nothing like Harry Potter, and yet everything like Harry Potter, when it comes to the story, Rowling sends you weaving through a seemingly endless maze of small-town gossip, politics, and lives. Yet when finished, the book will leave you reflecting on these characters, their lives, and the true realities Rowling uncovers in a most heart-wrenching way.'

author: b'Dr. Donna'
title: b"A great writer but the worst book I've read in ages"
body: b"How do you say it's well-written, but horrid? I just did not get into it. It starts off interesting, but a few chapters in, it goes downhill. I have not been so glad to finish a book in a long time and almost gave up several times, but the reader in me won't let me."

author: b'Lee B.'
title: b'Darkly Grand'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy is the first book I read after finishing the Harry Potter series. And I must say this book is not a disappointment from such a talented author. Any adult can closely identify with the very real personalities in this book. I saw a lot of my younger self in Andrew Price and enjoyed the sinister dynamic among the citizens of Pagford and Yarvil. Reviewers calling this book a failure for its too many characters or crude language have failed to recognize a truly splendid novel. The Casual Vacancy is about the realness of life and the darkness that touches everyone regardless of wealth/gender/age/etc. Rowling still has her magic touch.'

author: b'Edward O. Wolcott'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I listened to this book as a book on CD, so I may have some names misspelled, but I felt it was one of the best fiction books I have encountered in many years.  It is not Harry Potter (It is not even close to it, but is a whole different type of book) , but the plot, character studies, and the interactions of the people involved in it are as good or better than what you find in Jane Austen or Charles Dickens.  JK Rowling has done a superb job of looking below the pretty, peaceful surface of the village of Pagford, and has shown it is really a seething cauldron of interacting characters, who attack, take advantage of, and support one another in a variety of ways.  And, the touch at the end, where Howard Mollison\'s favorite song "The Green, Green, Grass of Home" in which a man awakes to find his homecoming to his lovely old home town was nothing but a dream, and the reality is that this is the last morning of his life on death row, is a beautifully done touch as a foreshadowing of what will happen next.  In the next 24 hours, the dreams of many of the characters are shown to be just dreams and are replaced by reality, either better or worse than their dreams.  I think this book deserves to be one of the English classics, and it certainly shows what a great writer JK Rowling is.'

author: b'kb5xg'
title: b'Not as good as Potter'
body: b'Really hard to get into the story line,  too much character development not enough interest.  I have never finished it after reading 150 pages or more.'

author: b'angela6132008'
title: b'Long & Winding Road'
body: b'I picked up and put this book down so many times. 60% into the book it finally moved along and the storyline really peaked my interest. I understand the need to flesh out characters and situations but boy was it painful in the  beginning hence the three stars.'

author: b'L. Thompson'
title: b'Brilliant'
body: b"I loved this book. The first few chapters were a bit boring, but after that I simply couldn't put it down. Well done!"

author: b'Jon'
title: b'Well done'
body: b"Good read! Complex, heartbreaking, funny.  A book that you won't soon forget. In depth and realistic characters help to send a message about love, compassion, and the consequences of indifference towards those in most in need"

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Great read!'
body: b'Rowling delves into her characters in The Casual Vacancy with the same eager curiosity I found in the Potter books.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Aweful'
body: b'Honestly, I am a HUGE fan of Joanne Rowling....this book was horrendous. Too many characters, the language is foul...please just read the harry potter series again, and forget you even heard about this book!'

author: b'Carolyn Smith'
title: b"Too much 'vacancy' for my taste!"
body: b"Can't help feeling JK Rowling needs to stick to her formula for writing for children which works so brilliantly. For me this just didn't come off. She has a tale to tell, but the telling is laboured and predictable. Not a literary masterpiece!"

author: b'M. Stark'
title: b'Book Of Muggles'
body: b"I was excited to see what JK would have for a mature audience.  Within a few chapters, I found myself disgusted and hard pressed to know why I should care about any of the characters.  They were well drawn - they seemed almost real, but in a nasty, depressing sort of way.  I didn't finish the book."

author: b'Jeremiah'
title: b'Not for everyone, and my opinion: not for under 18'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy'

author: b'Suzanne Ward'
title: b'no mercy for muggles'
body: b'Wow, what a downer.  Not one sympathetic character and she kills off the only person you are rooting for.  Very sad and depressing'

author: b'Smadar C.'
title: b'Incredible'
body: b'This was one of the most real,heart breaking books. I found the characters so human, vivid and tragically touching. I would recommend to anyone.'

author: b'Meghan Haines'
title: b'Boring, boring, boring'
body: b"It's a shame how much of a let-down this book was. Clearly Rowling was trying to create something entirely different from Harry Potter, understandable. Unfortunately it's clear that Rowling' s strength is a good, plot driven story. This was meant to be character driven, going to explore human nature and human interactions. At times I felt engaged with the characters, but mostly they came across as pretty, mean, and quite honestly, boring. I was very disappointed. If this is all I had to judge by Rowling, I would say she is an extremely mediocre author."

author: b'Lilly'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b'It was an interesting book not at all what I expected. It was 500 plus pages. It took awhile to get. Into it. So many characters to try and keep up with.  It easily could have been two books.  Very graphic language. I found that distracting.'

author: b'S. Shamma'
title: b"Let's just agree to disagree (spoiler alert)"
body: b"It hurts me to write this review, but it has to be done. One star may seem a little harsh, but truth be told, I am just mostly frustrated. It took me about a month to get through this book, when I usually breeze through them, and the only reason I couldn't is because J.K. Rowling gave me nothing to look forward to."

author: b'rita a'
title: b'interesting story'
body: b'Author created a village of human shortcomings, vices, virtues,and universal social problems that arise therefrom.  I found the English countryside terms charming.  A good story, a good read, redemption, but not all tied up with a pretty bow.  Would recommend.  Hope Rowling continues to write for adults.'

author: b'Ginger Cunningham'
title: b'Wonder why I kept reading'
body: b'The book seems to exist for no other reason than to point out social injustice and the callous disregard of most people for anything outside their narrow self-interests. I was not really drawn in to any character. The lot of them seem self-absorbed. My dogged determination to finish what I start got me to the end, but for naught. I do not feel edified in any way for having completed the laborious journey through this narrative.'

author: b'Cathy Jaynes'
title: b'Good read'
body: b'Thought it started a bit slow - lots of characters and took a while to know them. But then, as I got to know the towns and the people, it became much more interesting. Wanting to see connection, wanting them to care and care for each other. To set aside the struggle for power to really see their neighbors.'

author: b'Rodney Browning'
title: b'Casual Vacancy -  An adult book and different from the Harry Potter books.'
body: b"It was a great read and different from her other books.  It is all about life in a small British community but could be anywhere in the United States.  I read it because it was a book club selection, but it was one of those books you couldn't put down.  The characters were vivid and I am sure other readers will recognize how similar the people in the small town were like people that you know in your church or neighborhood.  The book that I ordered was used but was in excellent condition and was shipped very quickly."

author: b'jestonmiller'
title: b'Absolute trash'
body: b"I have to say this: I am a huge Harry Potter fan, & I fully realize that this book was supposed to be completely different. I have no issues with that. I'm a SAHM, educated & read a variety of fiction. I thought this was supposed to be a dark comedy, but there was no comedy. It was extremely dark, extremely foul, and if anyone really thinks that's real life, I sincerely pity them. There were a lot of characters, but they all were rotten & most boring, so the book dragged on like it'd never end. I don't know if JK Rowling felt she had to prove something (after HP???), or sadly, if this is who she really is, but I found the book deplorable and actually threw it away. It is not for kids, she wasn't joking about the adult theme. Sadly, I don't know or want to know any adults who would want to read it. I am so upset I read this; I really admired JKRowling, and now my view of her has been completely tainted. I regret reading this book."

author: b'Ogawak'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I expected quite a bit more from one of our favorite authors. I hope she decides to explore the Harry Potter world more, maybe not Potter himself, but other aspects of that world'

author: b'Lucky Reader'
title: b'Depressing and not very complex'
body: b"So like many other people, I bought this feeling like it would be worth every penny if it were even a fraction as brilliant as Harry Potter. And like so many others, I was sorely disappointed. Even by the standards of lower expectations, this book is one depressing read, confined to a claustrophobic community where there are few heroes and many villains. I admire JK Rowling's ability to create brutal circumstances for her most admirable characters; this necessarily adds drama. That works especially well when leavened with the fantastically imaginative worlds she is capable of creating in all their impressive dimensions. In a stuffy little suburb, not so much. There won't be a movie version of this one, I hope."

author: b'Kathryn Miller'
title: b'Well-written transition into adult fiction'
body: b'I purchased this book because I genuinely enjoyed J.K. Rowling\'s writing style in her Harry Potter series. I was not disappointed. This novel is very well written and she has created some truly unique characters (though they are many, I had no trouble in distinguishing them). Suffice it to say, this book is definitely very "British," which (I believe) accounts for a few of the less-than-positive reviews. American and British humor is very different, especially when it starts to creep into the dark comedy territory. I thought the petty conflict she created to serve as a stage for her characters to come to terms with themselves and each other was brilliant. I would highly recommend this book to those who like character-driven fiction and don\'t mind a writing style that intermingles comedy with the macabre.'

author: b'MGS'
title: b'Waiting until the next one...'
body: b"Although there were a few droll clever humorous bits, the main flaw in this work is that you don't like any of the characters, nor do you care what happens to them after the first 40 pages. In order to write a biting social commentary, a writer must first make us care about something or someone, and that doesn't happen here. I stopped after the first 50 pages, skipped through and read the final few pages. Unfortunately it ends as dismally as it starts. Perhaps her muse fled after Harry. Too bad she didn't stop with Harry because that series was brilliant, and she needn't have written anything else to have been remembered as a light in literature. For real insight into contemporary Britain, read the Adrian Mole series. It isn't really for kids..."

author: b'BigSister'
title: b'A Lot of Work to Read'
body: b'When I heard Joanne Rowling interviewed as this book was coming out, I was absolutely fascinated by her and by her life story.  Finally I read the first of the Potter books, enjoyed it, and could see why the concept and series of books would be such a hit among so many, young and older.  I made sure to see the movie based on that first book, as well.  I was finally in the world millions had entered years earlier.  With that step behind me, I eagerly turned to "The Casual Vacancy."'

author: b'Lorien'
title: b'Incredibly detailed character driven story.'
body: b"This book may fall a little flat on American audiences, so all reviews by US readers need to be looked at a bit carefully to be certain they do not criticize this book for it's extremely English world view."

author: b'Joseph Doolin'
title: b"Rowling should stick to kids' lit"
body: b'This is really a YA book with some attempt at foul language and adult issues thrown in.  Only got through half of it.'

author: b'Margaret Mitchel'
title: b'Yuck!'
body: b"It's hard to believe that  a writer with Rowlings skill could produce this.  There is not one character that I cared about.  The writing seems to be of a forced intensity.  Save your money."

author: b'ruxandra pauna'
title: b'Definitely a book worth reading'
body: b'The book depicts life in a small English town and the characters are well portrayed.'

author: b'Catherine Mastrangelo'
title: b'Great reading'
body: b'Nice book with a twist. I enjoyed reading this, and loaned it to my sister for her reading pleasure and enjoyment.'

author: b'Sapphire Guenther'
title: b'J.K. Rowling'
body: b"J.K. Rowling is one of my all time favorite authors, and is high up on the pedestal next to Edgar Allen Poe and J.R.R. Tolkien. This new book of hers is definitely an adult book, but nothing to graphic at all! It's an interesting read."

author: b'Isral Debruin'
title: b'Fascinatingly tragic character study'
body: b"I thoroughly enjoyed reading this well-written character-driven book about the politics and difficulties of living in a community. Rowling's engaging and witty writing style and her ability to flesh out characters in every way make this a fascinating read. My favorite aspect of this story was how many angles of the narrative are explored. The reader is provided with enough information and vantage points to carefully turn over and examine each of the many primary characters, their thoughts and motivations. Throughout reading this book, I found my internal opinions and suspicious about characters shifting back and forth. I liked this aspect a lot, though I'll admit that it was sometimes challenging to not have a true MAIN character to mentally hold on to. Still, this is exactly what made this book so interesting."

author: b'Jamie A. Scott'
title: b'Harry Potter'
body: b"It's no Harry Potter, but JK Rowling is a gifted writer and if you enjoyed her work on the Potter series, it's not a bad read"

author: b'C. Grennes'
title: b"Wanted to like it, but didn't"
body: b"Honestly I just really didn't like this book. It was slow, soo long, and had way too many characters to keep track of . I quit halfway through, which I almost never do."

author: b'Sybille Schaufler'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy - a disappointment'
body: b"Most boring book I've read in a long time. The foul language was no redeemer. I think J.K. should stick to Children's/young adult books."

author: b'Scott Michels'
title: b"This Ain't Your Kids' Harry Potter"
body: b'I first discovered my love for reading through Harry Potter, and JK Rowling has reignited my passion with The Casual Vacancy! Other critics were upset with how many different characters there are in this novel, but if you stick with it she will rotate in between the same characters over and over until it becomes easy to remember who is who.'

author: b'L. Kelley'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy by JK Rowling'
body: b"I am still reading and I wonder why.  It is like a soap opera.  I can't seem to put it down because I feel there must be something that is going to happen but it's a long time coming."

author: b'Writergirl'
title: b"Excellent writing but story is perhaps too 'real'"
body: b"Rowling has done an outstanding job in creating a multitude of characters that all have their own passions, ideas, hurts, idiosyncracies and agendas.  In other multi-protagonist novels I have read, usually only one or two characters really get developed and the rest are filler.  Rowling has not created a single character that she doesn't know intimately."

author: b'Kindle lover'
title: b'Great Character development'
body: b'I really felt like I knew the characters and needed to know what happened to them. It was Thoroughly enjoyable'

author: b'Anonymous'
title: b'So terrible!'
