body: b'I recommend this book that is relatable to any large urban city in America.  Many characters to keep straight at the onset, but each develops with the plot. I enjoyed the book but it was a dose of depressing reality'

author: b'JM'
title: b'What was that?'
body: b"With a mix of miserable characters, far too many to keep track of, I'm surprised I read the whole thing.  At the end, I asked myself 'what just happened?  What was that? '"

author: b'Gulliver'
title: b'Parish Councils!'
body: b'Every Parish Council has a story to tell.  This got a big bogged down, far-fetched, call it what you will, but nevertheless a page turner. Did you engage with the characters... no, perhaps they were too much a distillation?'

author: b'MrsMonastra'
title: b'Not what I expected...'
body: b'Although I had heard very little about this book so had no preconceptions. I enjoyed this slow burner. I found it easy to pick up and read a small bit at a time without forgetting the story line.'

author: b'Merlin'
title: b'Overload of charac'
body: b'An interesting read although a little confusing with all the characters to keep track of. Having sorted them all out I was a little disturbed by the "dark" nature of some of them. Held my interest enough to finish it.'

author: b'Ela Ronndy'
title: b"Truly dreadful book - don't waste your time"
body: b"Of course, like most people, I love the Harry Potter books so I was really hoping this would be a good transition for JKR to an adult audience - boy was I disappointed!  The characters are awful, there are too many of them, none of them were ever fully developed.  But worse was the stereo typing - those from the  'posh' part of the village were narrow minded, spiteful, snobby, mean-spirited and downright unlikable.  Even worse was the depiction of the people from the 'poor' side of the town - if you believe JKR then everyone in social housing (or council estates as we call them in England) are badly educated drug addicts with poor hygiene, bad teeth, no self esteem and of course should not be allowed to breed because they can't take care of their children.  I live in a similar village to the one in the book and I was appalled at the portrayal of the characters.  Please don't waste your time on this book.  It has nothing that redeems it."

author: b'Patricia Avila'
title: b'Not very fond at first'
body: b'It took me weeks to read. The book has a slow slow start but after the first chapters the story and the characters are appealing. JK is an amazing writes, but I often felt in this book she overdescribed things that were not interesting and didn`t bring anything to the story.'

author: b'Barbara'
title: b'Life'
body: b'The language is rough , but I felt it was necessary for the story.  Our Book Club picked our favorite characters and discussed why we liked them , and then we discussed other characters and situations.  It made for a great discussion about life...ups and downs...good and bad, etc.  Several members did not finish it ,and one said she just could not read it at all. The rest of us thought it was a very good book.  The writing is excellent.'

author: b'Georgia Weatherhead'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"The reader is introduced to all the residents in a small town so it is necessary to keep notes to remember who is who. It is a 'who done it' novel."

author: b'Kathleen Cianciola'
title: b'Casual Vacancy Hits It Out of the Ballpark'
body: b'Rowling has once again wowed the reading public with her genius...great novel.  So insightful and entertaining at the same time.  A must read.'

author: b'carinya'
title: b'Different'
body: b'This book was a stark novel, very black with some characters more believable than others. The rawness of some community life in Britain was very sad.'

author: b'dsnymum'
title: b'Fantastic'
body: b'Rowling has proven, without a doubt, her ability to move you into a different place.  Leaving the young reader and fantasy genre behind, she has shown us a place that could be anywhere and people that are everywhere.  Honest, raw and real, she lays it all out in beautifully designed story that sucks you in and holds you until the last word.'

author: b'Charlotte Freeborn'
title: b'Casual Vacancy was a complex problem made clear through characterization.  Rowlings is a great writer.'
body: b"I really liked Rowling's portrayal of the complexity and sadness of poverty and drug addiction and its influence that lasts for generations."

author: b'Marie F. Gaudette'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'It was a sadly boring book that left me disappointed.  I expected a much better story with better character development from her.'

author: b'C. W.'
title: b'Incest, rape, pedophilia, explicit drug use, soap opera of a small english village'
body: b"I felt mislead by the description of J.K. Rowling's latest book. Had I known the true content would contain such topics as incest, rape, child abuse, pedaphiles, suicide, explicit drug abuse; all wrapped up in the lives of extraordinarily petty individuals I would never have purchased it. When doing a cursory review on line the topic headings say things like humor and satire? No where in my world do those words cover the above topics. One sight even suggests it for teenagers?  A very disturbing read unless one likes swimming in the underbelly of of very sick individuals lives."

author: b'havy'
title: b'Solid story'
body: b'I read the book and liked it. J. K is a wonderful storyteller. I like the blend of emotions i felt during the reading. Tough situations like the one these characters go through are all to common for all members of society. Great work. My only complaint about the book is that not much time lapsed in the character lives from start to finish. After reading this i will certainly be purchasing any other novel she decides to put out.'

author: b'Merrilyn C. Avila-Gauld'
title: b'A tedious read'
body: b"Although the author has depicted characters that reflect personality flaws we all have I found it difficult and tedious to get through the book.  It wasn't one that you couldn't put down and one that didn't call me back to read more."

author: b'Kris Fisher'
title: b'Excellent Read!'
body: b"Great storytelling!  Very interesting read.  Would highly recommend this book.  Rowling proves she doesn't just write for the wee little ones."

author: b'K. M. Sullivan'
title: b"Rowling's nod to a Dicken's topic=Worth it"
body: b"I loved this book. For a few months I hesitated to read it because I heard such mixed reviews, but I finally decided my curiosity was greater than my fear that I wouldn't like it. It was worth it."

author: b'Oposum in the Garden'
title: b"WOW from someone who didn't read Harry Potter"
body: b"Harry Potter wasn't my cup of tea, I stopped reading after 1/4 of the first book.I am in awe with this one. Hard subject,very much like XIX. Naturalism in French literature after 1860, admired Zola, it is likely that you may admire Casual Vacancy also."

author: b'Kathleen Polkinghorn'
title: b'Bleak Village'
body: b'Like most others I looked forward to reading this after the masterful HP series.  It almost seems like it was written by a different person, or perhaps was written before the HP series as her first book but now she was famous enough to get it published.  I suspect that she experienced some of these things and had these frustrations as a single parent, possible even a social worker, like the character Kay.  Everyone and everything in the book disappoints which at least explains why she would want to escape the Muggle world and create an imaginary land one for herself and her children where good has power.  It took me until page 142 to have a sense of what the book was about and possible another hundred pages to get to know some of the characters.  There is almost no character development and very little description of the characters so they are hard to visualize.  The narrative seems truncated too frequently by changing circumstances and individuals.  Like many, I struggled to keep various people straight.  In the end, the surprise plot being about computer hacking could have been introduced much earlier.  This book needed a decent editor.'

author: b'James Norstad'
title: b'why? by V Norstad'
body: b'Why would the much loved and respected author of Harry Potter punish her readers with a more that painful venture into a world so ugly. Is it possible to give less that one star? I finished this novel because I too finish what I start. Could there be one bright light in the small  petty villages she wrote about? Even the ending was predictable. She has acted ruthlessly with our emotions. I have warned other Harry Potter fans to stay clear. Are there recovery groups for fellow readers?'

author: b'Stephen T. Hopkins'
title: b'Cruelty'
body: b"The gloomy town inhabited by the troubled characters in J.K. Rowling's novel, The Casual Vacancy, presents the worst possible components of community. People here are cruel to each other, neglect their needs and live close to one another but in separate worlds. The most appealing character in the novel dies in the first few pages. I slogged through all 500 pages immersed in the sadness of the many lives Rowling presents to readers. Some of the teens are more mature than the adults, and all characters have something to hide or are dealing with one struggle or another. I found that I finished the novel feeling depressed and saddened and concluded that the time I spent reading it could have been spent in better ways."

author: b'M.Foley'
title: b'What a disapointment'
body: b'I looked forward to reading this novel when it was suggested for my book club.  The author has had amazing success with her young adult books and is an experienced writer.  The reviews were excellent that I had read.  So I thought I was in for a wonderful read.  I was mistaken.  Do not waste your time on this book.  It was extremely depressing with so many characters that it takes over half the book to understand who they all are much less keep track of how they pertain to the story line.'

author: b'Debbie Witte'
title: b'Confusing at First'
body: b'There are so many characters in the first several chapters that I had a horrible time keeping straight the storylines for each character.  By the end of the book; however, I definately knew all the inter-related characters and their storylines.  The end came as a complete shock!  Enjoyable read.'

author: b'Joan Niquette'
title: b'Disapppointed'
body: b"I had not read any of J. K. Rowling's previous books, which I knew had been extremely popular in different age groups, therefor I was expecting something much more interesting.  I read probably no more than the first 3 or 4 chapters & decided it was not going to hold my interest."

author: b'Sam'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'This book just was not for me, beginning was confusing keeping up with the long character list. Small town where everyone knows everyone and all their drama. a character dies in the first few pages and the whole book is about all these people in town wanting to take his seat on the council. I did enjoy the story of the young girl taking care of her little brother while her mother was hooked on drugs. I did become very attached to her and enjoyed only the parts where she was involved, which was basically all intertwined with the other characters in the book. That was the only thing that got me though it was wanting to know what would happen to her. all the other mini stories were boring and just fluff.'

author: b'G. Cranford'
title: b'J.K.'
body: b"My review isn't totally honest at this point because I've just begun reading it. Having never read any of the Potter series, I was interested in reading her first adult book."

author: b'Chloe Eastham'
title: b'Okay'
body: b'bit hard to get into and nearly stopped reading it but prefered the Harry Potter series better! Will try another one.'

author: b'Twinkletoes'
title: b"Didn't finish it"
body: b'Got all bogged down with all the people and nobody was happy.  Not up to Harry Potter standards at all - we were seriously disappointed.'

author: b'Carol Wyllie'
title: b'Hmmmm'
body: b'No too sure about this - found it a bit hard to read at times and thought, on occasion, that I would stop but after resisting I got through it.  It was interesting how it all knitted together and also very, very sad how society judges.'

author: b'Cathy W.'
title: b'Get past the first hundred pages...it gets better!'
body: b'As a Harry Potter fan, I really, really wanted to love this book. I ended up liking it a lot, but I have to say that there\'s a bit of "forced march" reading required through the first hundred pages or so before the meat of the story develops. Once you do get through the beginning sections, you\'ll find the characters very compelling, and the story to be intense. I liked it a lot, and cared for the characters. I recommend it to my friends who like to read and are willing to give a book a nice long try. I just wish it had been a little more tightly edited. Not intended for children under 18, I\'d say, because of the intensity of some of the scenes.  But it\'s good! Read it!'

author: b'Daniel D Daugherty'
title: b'Not just dull, but unpleasant'
body: b"Like others, I wanted to see what the author of Harry Potter had to say in a whole new genre. I've gotten through 80-some pages of this 400 page novel, and--MY GOD!--when it's not being dull, it's just plain unpleasant and depressing. Most of the characters seem rather depressed, except the ones who are too arrogant and self-absorbed to be so."

author: b'Paul'
title: b'Not for Fans of Harry Potter'
body: b'J.K. Rowling has shown us she can write a good story entirely different than her earlier Harry Potter series. She tells a realistic tale that is a slice of "council flat" daily life in England. These are ordinary people living their ordinary lives with all their human faults and their own selfish concerns. These people live at the lower levels of the economic and social scale and their stories are not the stuff of magic and adventure.  Vacancy is gripping in the way it reveals the thoughts and emotions of the characters, and tells how their interactions with each other drive the story to a sad end. J.K. Rowling has written a story of real life that is just as interesting as Harry Potter\'s imaginary world.'

author: b'Len'
title: b'Not my reading style'
body: b"I bought this book after all of the hype and decided to give it a try. It's a good book just not my reading style. I've only gotten 30% finished in a month. Good writing just not my reading preference."

author: b'michelle paquette'
title: b'Rowlings first adult book'
body: b'slow getting started,but a good story of how one persons life can impact a whole town, both positive and negative.  Very interesting, and written in the English tongue and some english slang.'

author: b'ChelseaW'
title: b'Not what I had expected.'
body: b'Enjoyable but I found The Casual Vacancy to be dry at times. Very interesting character dynamics though. Not what was expected but it provides a good story none the less.'

author: b'MWeglinski'
title: b'Wizzardry Grown Up'
body: b'I was pleasantly surprised that JK Rowling could appeal to my grown up taste. I read every Harry Potter book she wrote and was never dissapointed. This novel was just as well written.'

author: b'Anna'
title: b'Surprised'
body: b'I lovede the Harry Potter books and wondered if she could write a book for adults.  She can.  I really enjoyed. She has a great eye for detail on life in the UK'

author: b'Wendy Dillingham'
title: b'Disappointed in NH'
body: b'I was disappointed.  Found the constant use of the "F" word offensive.  Character development took too long...didn\'t ever really grab me at all...kept waiting to "really get into it" and never  did.'

author: b'writer1'
title: b'Grimy'
body: b'Even with the forewarnings that J.K. Rowling had written a book for her now grown-up readers, not for the children they once were, "The Casual Vacancy" is a huge disappointment.  The characters are mean, vindictive, wife- and child beaters; the book is filled with drugs and teenage sex, all of which add little to the story -- but in fact become the story.'

author: b'Beach Reader'
title: b'Funeral to Funeral'
body: b'What can you say about a story that starts and ends with a funeral.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Excellant read'
body: b'First time through I felt it was a good book.  Second time through I got a much better grasp of the personalities of the varous characters.  Third time through I realized what an amazing job Rawlings had done to interweave the lives of  all these evolving (or increasingly static) personalities.  On the fourth time through I am simply enjoying the book.'

author: b'Gillian Archbold'
title: b'An Enjoyable Read'
body: b'An enjoyable read.  Was interested to see what the author could come up with after Harry Potter.  There was an interesting collection of characters whose lives were entwined around a small village and the effect of tradition versus liberal thinking.'

author: b'joan denton'
title: b'And the brilliant writing continues.'
body: b"When I was reading the entire Harry Potter series, I couldn't wait for the next one to come.  Reading and becoming acquainted with each of the characters in the Casual Vacancy; I didn't want to the book to stop either.  I truly wanted to know more about these people.  Brilliantly written!"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A different Rowling but just as good...'
body: b"I am a bit surprised by all of the negative reviews surrounding this novel. Yes, the characters are often unsavory, immoral, self-centered buffoons, but does that make a book any less good? The characters, despite their less redeeming qualities, are well-crafted, believable and sometimes sympathetic. This novel isn't all hearts and flowers--it reveals some of the really ugly aspects of human nature and it will stay with me for a long time. I absolutely loved it and will read it again later on down the road."

author: b'palmetto1'
title: b'lighten up'
body: b"Perhaps the author wanted to prove that she could write fiction for adults.  The result is a grim, depressing story.  If you want this type of unrelieved bleak hopeless story telling watch the news,  it's free.  I am not looking for Mary Poppins, but this book is nothing but a dull gray window on a world not worth the view."

author: b'Romeo'
title: b'Worthwhile reading'
body: b'Good read, interesting characters, moving story-line, i enjoyed the unpredictable events it kept me guessing where things would end up'

author: b'Sandra Matthews'
title: b'Slow to start'
body: b'Slow to start. Really found it hard to like or appreciate anyone. Good ending, closing all the loose ends. Well written.'

author: b'Terese h. McLaughlin'
title: b'DISAPPOINTING'
body: b'i THOUGHT THE CHARACTERS WERE NOT VERY WELL DEVELOPED AND SCATTERED THROUGHOUT THE BOOK. i WAS DISAPPOINTED AND EXPECTED MORE FROM THE AUTHOR AFTER READING THE HARRY POTTER SERIES.'

author: b'Diane Machuga'
title: b'An interesting and thought provoking read.'
body: b"I couldn't put  this one down.  I suspect this is story is true in a lot of our towns.  Though maybe not all at once.  You'll have to read this and decide for yourself."

author: b'GG'
title: b'Exceeded my expectations'
body: b"I'd read previous reviews and ratings of J. K. Rowling's first adult targeted novel before I bought the Kindle edition. Most of what I read was luke warm about book, so my expectations weren't very high. Now that I've read The Casual Vacancy, I can say without reservation that I am looking forward to Ms. Rowling's continued exploration of non-fantasy fiction. The characters were well drawn, the narrative was well done, and the story line was interesting. Much in the style of Maeve Binchy, we get to look at the same events through the eyes of different participants, each person's story weaving a clearer image of what happened while filling in more details about the back-drop of the community and the relationships between the characters."

author: b'V. Falzon'
title: b'boring'
body: b'boring, all it is is people bitching behind one onother. It took 50% of the book before a story started to emerge. I will never purchase another book by her.'

author: b'Lynn2443'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"There are so many characters, many with nicknames being used interchangeably.  The author is taking so long to get to the point of the plot, I can't even finish this book although I have tried several times."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Would need a chart to follow all the characters'
body: b'The writing is very much what I would expect from J K Rowling, but trying to follow the myriad of characters for the first 1/3 of the book was too confusing and seemed somewhat meaningless.  The story itself lacks any real substance and by that I mean it seems like a chatty, soap opera of the British sort.  It was disappointing for me.'

author: b'Pucci mom'
title: b'Smartly written'
body: b'The small town setting and local characters were well captured. A little lengthy, but a worthwhile read. Not another Harry Potter, but nothing is or will be.'

author: b'D. Locicero'
title: b'Not Harry Potter, for Sure!'
body: b"A completely different genre for Rowling.  I waited to read this for fear I'd be disappointed (because I love all of the HArry Potter books so much).  This is definitely adult fiction, with interesting characters."

author: b'Lisa'
title: b'A waste of time and money'
body: b"I wasn't expecting Harry Potter, but I also wasn't expecting a dismal tale of unhappy, unappealing people.  The only redeeming characters die, and the rest just go on being incredibly unpleasant.  I kept waiting for it to get better, but it only continued its downhill slide.  I know that Ms. Rowling is attempting to attract a more adult audience, but more like this is sure to drive them away."

author: b'Heather'
title: b'The Casual Bomb'
body: b"Not good. I couldn't finish it. I would read and reread pages trying to figure out what I just read because my mind just wondered all the time. To many people for me to keep up with. Loved her Harry Potter series but not this one"

author: b'MnMorris'
title: b'HORRIBLE'
body: b"So boring, our entire book club could not believe this is a best seller. Don't waste your time or money. Not worth it!!!"

author: b'Avid Reader'
title: b'a bit crude'
body: b'This book has been easy to put down and hard to pick up.  I feel an obligation to finish it, but it is not really holding my interest.  There is a lot of obscenity and I find it a bit crude.'

author: b'Betsy Cass'
title: b'Snapshot of rural life'
body: b"The characters were interesting but too one demential.  The story meandered into their lives but they didn't grow or change based on events.  Nice snapshot of rural English life.  I felt no reason to continue reading except that my book club was going to discuss the book."

author: b'barrim'
title: b'No HP'
body: b'Definitely was nothing like like the harry potter books as promised.  Good for a mindless beach read but thats about it'

author: b'kelm29'
title: b'A Real Page-turner'
body: b"I loved this novel and greedily gobbled it down in just two days. You can just visualize the small English village and the characters therein. Now i can't wait for her next book."

author: b'Priscila Molina'
title: b'Pretty good'
body: b"I love the way J.K. Rowling writes. I wasn't expecting much after all the so so reviews, and maybe that is the reason I liked it so much. Comparing it to the Harry Potter series is just a bad idea.... I liked it."

author: b'kDiva'
title: b'Not What I Expected'
body: b"This was a story of a town. It had a couple minor climactic points, but the ending was not satisfying for me. Can't say as I would recommend this book."

author: b'Sharon Douglas'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Can hardly believe it is the same person who wrote Harry Potter.  A group of sad people in a small English town and when all is said and done, no one is better off in the end.'

author: b'pam zikan'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b'I was looking forward to an "Adult" book written by this author. It was very hard to get into. Couldn\'t relate to very many of the characters, or division of the 2 town areas. The weathly against the impoverished. I really wanted to like it, as her Harry Potter books were so enjoyed by all age groups. Maybe I wasn\'t "English" enough to appreciate it.'

author: b'Mayi'
title: b'Completely let down!'
body: b'What it is about'

author: b'BRENDA WIGGINS'
title: b'First Time Rowling Reader.'
body: b"Although it is taking me a longer than usual time to read the book, I am enjoying it.  It is the first book I've read by Rowling and I am liking this particular style.  I find the characters interesting and diverse and enjoy a bit of suspense as to what will happen  next."

author: b'helena'
title: b'Excellent'
body: b'This book is well written with beautifully rich characters, honestly drawn. The plot flows smoothly at a good pace.Great read.'

author: b'Terri'
title: b'Society Labeling'
body: b'Totally caught off guard with this book.  Loved all the twist and turns, had a hard time trying to keep up with whose who and what family they belonged to.  Thought more about the book the next day after finishing it and how TRUE society labels people.  My eyes are wide open.  Great start on new writing adventures J.K....'

author: b'Cactuskicker'
title: b'a huge snooze fest'
body: b"Two thumbs down. I am so disappointed in this book. After reading her Harry Potter series, this was a huge boring waste of time and money. Normally I love dry British humor and drama, but this left me dumbfounded.  I understand this was to be nothing like the Harry Potter series, I read most of the books in the top 100 best selling books lists  and I read the write ups so I wasn't expecting a fantasy book. Rowling wrote so beautifully before with such imagination that I was expecting this work to be good, or at least slightly interesting. I now believe I have read instruction manuals and ancient ship manifests that were more entertaining than this read. Must be when they say it is a novel for adults, they meant It's a bedtime story due to the fact that  in 30 minutes you'll be snoring."

author: b'Lynn, PA'
title: b'Great Book'
body: b'Wow.  In the beginning, a little wordy and hard to follow who is who.'

author: b'Maureen in CO'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b"I'm only into the first few chapters and it's not really grabbing me.  I'm not sure"

author: b'Tina Torsey'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Disappointing.  After reading Harry Potter with my grandson and enjoying them as much as he did this was not what I expected.'

author: b'Sandy Henson'
title: b'Christmas gift'
body: b'My daughter requested this book as a gift for Christmas. It was a great savings over the cost in the book stores and it arrived promptly.'

author: b'Joyce Erickson'
title: b'Book The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I was able to get this book at an excellent price.  It's not a book that I will keep forever, so cost was important.  I will probably give it to a friend."

author: b'MARY LOU MORAN'
title: b'colorless'
body: b'Waiting to find out who would fill the vacancy was not something I cared about or identified with even though I love politics. I enjoy stories of people living in small towns but this one did not interest me.It was colorless.  I stuck with it to the end but it was'

author: b'jerbook'
title: b'Confusing.'
body: b'It was hard to keep track of the characters and who was related to who.  I guess I expected it to be as good as the Harry Potter series, but the writing is entirely different.  There was a predictable ending...depressing but some lessons were learned.'

author: b'Joanne Vogel'
title: b'Love it'
body: b'Really like the story of this little town in England..The characters are really fun and the family dynamics are so interesting. There are a lot of characters in this story so keep a pencil handy just to remnd you of their relationship to each other.'

author: b'Carole R. Stepanek'
title: b'Great book to read while snowed in!'
body: b'Enjoyed this book....great to have a good read while snowed in.....I did not read any of her Harry Potter books...not my style!  But I was interested to read this book....will probably continue to read other books she might publish..'

author: b'Lynn B. Schornick'
title: b'Very different'
body: b"When you've devoured all seven of the Harry Potter books by Miss Rowling, you have certain expectations about the kind of books she will continue to write. The Casual Vacancy took me rather by surprise. This isn't a kids book. It deals with a very interesting and highly controversial subject. I recommend it highly. Rowling has offered us a great deal with this new book."

author: b'Nola Barrett'
title: b'Enjoyed'
body: b'JK has made the transition from "children\'s writer" to adult fiction with great ease.'

author: b'P. Goel'
title: b'Loved it!'
body: b"I loved this book.  It transported me to the little English village when I was reading it.  It is a great study of characters. I would highly recommend Anne Tyler's novels to everyone who liked this book."

author: b'Donna S. Carter'
title: b'not to american'
body: b'I was really disappointed in the book.if in england maybe, but i am not in the uk, go back to the harry potter series and pick up with the families, much better.'

author: b'Alicia Legg'
title: b'Loved it!'
body: b'I missed the characters when it was concluded.  Reminded me of a darker Maeve Binchy.  Well done!  I really enjoyed it and hope for a sequel.'

author: b'Cherylsue'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b"Not a bad story but it doesn't keep my attention. Seems like it's rambling on about not a whole lot most of the time. I guess I had higher expectations."

author: b'Margaret Little'
title: b'Heartless'
body: b"What universal contempt this book holds for all of its characters portrayed in various shades of dumb, pathetic, meek, self-destructive, pretentious, selfish, dishonest, depraved, loathed and loathing.  I'm simply baffled with by the heartless misanthropy that animates this author's attempt a portrait of provincial life when that same author delighted so many young readers in fantasy.  The adults in this novel are shallow Muggles at best, when they are not depraved monsters, and the children, damaged and doomed."

author: b'Heidi'
title: b'NOTHING Like Harry Potter'
body: b"But I loved it! I don't know why so many people didn't like it - maybe because they were expecting something like Harry Potter? It's not a happy story, but it's really well written. It was a little tough at the beginning to figure out/remember all the characters, but other than that, it was great!"

author: b'LindsayN'
title: b'Fantastic Read'
body: b"I have never been drawn to Harry Potter but this book piqued my interest and did not disappoint. Beautifully written, I became immersed in this story largely due to Rowling 's brilliant character development. Such an enjoyable book with a lesson or two about life. I would gladly follow these characters through a series of books.  Anyone who enjoys Coronation Street will love this book"

author: b'C Dieckmann'
title: b'The Casual Va'
body: b'Lets just say it is not what I was expecting!  I suppose we have been spoilt with the fantastic writing in the Harry Potter novels, however I did not really enjoy this book but it was okay.  When I got to the end of the book I felt that it ended rather abruptly and left me wondering!!!!'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Agatha Christie without the murders?'
body: b"While a perfectly acceptable storyline this book did not meet my expectations of a J.K. Rowling story. I found it slow moving and not really to my taste. I prefer murder mysteries but thought I would have a change of pace and try something different. It reminded me of an Agatha Christie novel without all the murders.I found it to be very 'wordy' in that it comes in seven parts. I like the challenge of a good, fast moving who dunnit. Those who prefer a more sedate story will really enjoy this book."

author: b'MS'
title: b'a GOOD READ'
body: b'Worth reading and very well written,  Alot of characters to follow so you have to stay awake.  Would be good if JK wrote another adult book.'

author: b'Robert Schipul'
title: b'A New Rowling'
body: b'So different from Potter that Rowling seems to be trying to change her style from the Potter Series. From the mystical to the reality of interpersonal relationships in a real world she relates how people "live and move and have their being" trying to cope while both falling and rising. No fantasy here but the real world which demands valuing human life or watching it self-destruct in front of us. Her next book with be interesting and we shall see if there is a new direction or just a divergence for a while.'

author: b'Patti Wilson'
title: b'Hogswart Redux'
body: b'All these folks needed were a few wizards around to straighten out their entirely too messy, ordinary and banal muggle existences. Rowlings told a great story and actually made implausible Brits believable to this Yank.'

author: b'NEPAmom'
title: b'Extremely disappointed'
body: b'This book was all about the white trash in a small town in England.  Included drug use, rape, incest, adultery, etc.  I kept reading in hopes that things would get better but it was a complete disappointment.'

author: b'Oderda Giuseppina'
title: b'quite boring and not interesting'
body: b'its OK, but I was expecting more from the Author of Harry Potter: she can do better than that. even the writing style was not as I expected'

author: b'alohapatti'
title: b'Dysfunctional lives intertwined'
body: b'A great story of how the way we appear to the outside world isn\'t always what it seems behind closed doors.  The secrets and experiences keep the reader interested all the way through this book.  It reflects the reality of the expression "every front door bleeds a little".  Compelling read.'

author: b'Josh Mauthe'
title: b'Set aside your expectations and savor this cynical, heart-breaking, honest look at the world'
body: b"It's best to put aside any preconceptions you might have about what The Casual Vacancy will be like before you read it. That's hard to do in any situation, but when the author is J.K. Rowling, author of the Harry Potter series, that's even more so; no matter what, you'll have certain expectations or ideas about what The Casual Vacancy might be like. It's to Rowling's credit, I think, that the book defies almost any expectation anyone had, delivering not a genre book, not a light-hearted book, but a cynical, dark look at modern society, politics, poverty, strained family relationships, and more. Nominally, The Casual Vacancy is about the aftermath of a death in a small English town, a death which opens up a seat on the ruling body in the town (the titular vacancy). But in reality, Rowling uses the death as a way to open up this insular world and its dramas for the reader to explore. Rowling's working with a sprawling cast of characters here, and her effortless gliding between perspectives, dialects, philosophies, and thoughts is just one of the many joys for someone like me who was curious how her prose would differ as she took on the adult world. Indeed, Rowling's prose and craft is generally superb, weaving between the past and present, sliding between characters, and juggling dozens of plot threads only to collide them at unexpected moments - it's a masterful performance from a technical perspective, and left me impressed with just how far Rowling had come from the first Potter novel so many years ago. The subject matter has been more problematic for some people, with some feeling lost in just how ferociously cynical and vicious The Casual Vacancy can be. While Rowling has created dozens of rich characters, none of them are heroes, and not one is without a flaw - sometimes, there are a multitude of them. That's led some to discount the book as being without likeable characters, which is an absurd charge to me; while there are no doubt some despicable people here, it's not hard to feel that Rowling has a surprising amount of empathy for all of them (albeit some more than others). Similarly, the subject matter here can be dark, but that's appropriate; with much of the book revolving around the town's effort to rid itself of the government housing for the poor and the drug clinic that's helping many escape their addictions, it would be absurd and offensive to minimize the suffering and difficulty that comes along with such a life. Instead, Rowling focuses beautifully on both sides, attempting to understand those who look down on the inhabitants of the projects while also attempting to be a voice for those who had no chance at anything better. If you take The Casual Vacancy as, in effect, a debut novel, you'll be deeply impressed; while there are no doubt a few missteps (for example: there's a subplot about hacking that feels a bit repetitive and a bit like a deus ex machina, and occasionally the massive cast gets a bit overwhelming and confusing), what you have here is an assured, confident step into the literary world. Rowling is taking a huge gamble here, trading her genre work in for something more literary, trading her hopefulness in for brutal realism, and focusing a lot on the many ways that human beings can find themselves lacking in empathy for even those they love. The end result is a fantastic novel, one that I read pretty much any time I had free moments, and one that hit me pretty hard as it came to its powerful climax. It's not often enough that novelists are willing to write about social classes and the conflicts between them, or the way that politics can obscure our basic humanity towards each other, and yet Rowling takes both issues on, all while spinning tales about parents and children, the way we cope with loss, and so much more. For its short length, The Casual Vacancy is an ambitious, complex novel, but it's also a very human one underneath that - and to me, that may be the most important thing."

author: b'Sherry F'
title: b'Compelling characters'
body: b'While reading, I kept being reminded of "It\'s A Wonderful Life", except there\'s no Clarence. And instead of a man being shown the difference his life had made, here the other characters see how different life turns out to be when he is no longer part of the equation in village life and politics. Unlike a Harry Potter tale, there is no hero being groomed to sacrifice himself and destroy the arch-villain, and, indeed, there is no arch-villain. There\'s only the ordinary greedy, self-centered, well-meaning-yet-deeply-flawed folk left to sort it all out.'

author: b'Fay Proffitt'
title: b'Unputdownable!'
body: b'I was unsure about this book with all the negative reviews, but I found it "unputdownable."  Yes, maybe it\'s dark, maybe it\'s sad but it was also riveting from the get-go.  True to life happenings in a small town.  As one other reviewer put it, it was thought-provoking, and definitely not a mindless read.  I\'d highly recommend it for some entertaining, albeit sometimes sad reading.'

author: b'ProfessorLala'
title: b'Heartbreaking and technically savvy: A Triumph!'
body: b'I never write reviews, but I did feel compelled, having just finished listening to this book, to write one. JK Rowling is AMAZING in her ability to tell a tale with interesting and unpredictable turns of plot, believable and painfully human characters, all while tackling themes of privilege, obligation and the complexities of the human heart. Beyond mere entertainment, this novel is impressive both in the scope of its ambition, and the dexterity of its execution. While it might take a good 50 pages or so to settle into its quiet rhythm (the only reason it has 4 rather than 5 stars) it is completely worth it. Do yourself a favor and read this book!'

author: b'Froda'
title: b'Small British town politics and relationships. A compelling read.'
body: b'My only encounter with JK Rowling was a brief attempt to try "Harry Potter" - I couldn\'t get interested in that. But this was quite different.'

author: b'Red Rose'
title: b'Casual Vacancy - VACANT'
body: b'Casual Vacancy - VACANT'

author: b'bw'
title: b'Great book'
body: b"I didn't really enjoy reading this as it was depressing and dark, it was a fascinating read. She pinpoints the strata of the classes in the UK and the hypocrisy well. The characters are so well drawn. I wasn't that interested in the teenagers but still you felt such sympathy for them. Excellent book."

author: b'Pura Vida!'
title: b'A mess of a book'
body: b'Simply stated, this is the worst book I have ever read.  I did finish it, hoping in vain for redemption at the end.  Now if I could only erase the knowledge of the miserable characters from my mind.  I have not one good thing to say about the experience of reading A Casual Vacancy.  What would prompt a writer to fill so many pages with meaningless drivel about mentally ill people?'

author: b'Phyllis N Kincaid'
title: b'Evaluation of "Casual Vacancy"'
body: b"I've been disappointed in this book.  In my opinion, the plot doesn't reach out and grab you.  The Harry Potter books were so outstanding that I expected Ms. Rowling's next effort to be stronger.  I do realize that genius has its mediocrity at times.  I look forward to her next book."

author: b'Patrick A. Zottoli'
title: b'I thought it was terrible'
body: b'The author never got to ah point.  I read about half of it and was so bored that I putti down, and really want to ask the author for a refund.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Abosolute disappointment'
body: b'I finally finished Rowling\'s "the Casual Vacancy".'

author: b'pfisher'
title: b'summary'
body: b"I chose this rating because I didn't have any problems with the delivery. I am reading it now and am enjoying it."

author: b'Karen Hall'
title: b'Stick to Harry Potter'
body: b"This book was hard to read with too many tragic characters. It seemed to meander without much direction and changed who was telling the story so often that it was hard to get a clear picture of an overall theme. I thoroughly enjoyed every Potter book. It's hard to believe this book was written by the same author."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'J.K. does it again'
body: b'Another all-night page turner.'

author: b'SK'
title: b'Fantastic but maybe not for all readers'
body: b"I absolutely loved this book.  I can understand why some people may not like it, though.  There are a lot of characters and it takes some effort in the beginning to keep people straight.  And there certainly are no good guys and bad guys and maybe you won't be able to identify strongly with any single character.  But I thought these were the strengths of the book.  I love getting to know many different characters and different perspectives around the same events.  It's just like in an extended family where people are looking at the exact same events from vastly different perspectives.  But unlike in real life, you get a glimpse inside all the characters in this book."

author: b'Reader'
title: b'A DISMAL disappointment.'
body: b'What a bleak, dismal, cliche of ugliness.  Not one fresh, alive, or compelling character in this waste of a megabook.  Graceless, boring writing.  Presumptuous of Rowlings to impose a waste of reading (and living) time on those of us hooked on the originality of Harry Potter and curious about next efforts.  A shorter bomb would have been kinder to and more respectful of readers.'

author: b'glpjr'
title: b'Well written'
body: b'I enjoyed this story in spite of the fact it was somewhat dark at times. Families and people are complex and I felt she captured this.'

author: b'Leslie Krauss'
title: b'Good entrance into adult writing'
body: b'This book was well-written and had good flow.  The subject matter was very depressing.  It was very much a character study in human frailties.'

author: b'Hoosier Grandma'
title: b'Worth the read'
body: b"I found the characters well-developed and the multiple plot lines kept my interest. Didn't predict the ending, so that's a plus."

author: b'KELLYM'
title: b'Great Start......But'
body: b'I enjoyed the first third, love the descriptions of poverty, depravation: Equally the shrewd description of social climbers. Next third is a bit of a drag.....hoping for a big finish!'

author: b'Mom'
title: b'Interesting!'
body: b"J. K. Rowling uses her skill to delight adults in this English book about a vacancy on a local council.  It's interesting to see how things are done across the pond, and to compare it with local politics here in the USA."

author: b'Lenor'
title: b'Awful'
body: b"Very seldom do I not finish a book, but this was one that I struggled to page 180 and then quit.  The problems with this book included disconnected story line, the author kept skipping from one character to the next, so you had a hard time keeping track of what was going on.  Her use of the F -word was ridiculous, throwing graphic descriptions of the teen boys fascination with porn, does not make the book an adult reading.  Many of the character names were so similar which made the reading confusing.  Additionally, the characters were ALL so negative that I ended up hating the book (there was not one redeeming character in the story). Finally, much of the writing seemed forced and some of the sentences seemed like she threw together a bunch of long words which, in the end, made no sense. I found myself rereading some sentences to try and figure out what she was trying to say.  JK needs to stick with children s' books and stay away from any adult writing."

author: b'Matt'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'My wife purchased this book because she liked the "Harry Potter" series of books. She told me that she got only half way through the book and finally gave up on it.'

author: b'margaret clare'
title: b'Casual Vacancy disappoints.'
body: b'The story started ok but quickly became bogged down with too many characters . I found it heavy going and quite dark with few characters having any likeable qualities. The style of story telling was rather too fussy and had unnecessary detail which slowed the progress somewhat.'

author: b'Jabberstone'
title: b'Brilliant, Powerful, & Introspective'
body: b'I put off reading this book because of mixed reviews. I\'m so glad I finally decided to give it a chance. This book shines a light on middle class-small town hypocrisy & prejudice, as well as the "under belly" of society. You will finish this book with a heavy heart & you may look at yourself a little harder in the mirror. Good on you Rowling......good on you!'

author: b'by sjp'
title: b'Definitely not Harry Potter'
body: b"I realize this novel was written for adults and not children but I found it to be gloomy and depressing.  I am sure that some might say that this is a true literary piece that was intended to show the darker side of life and how our choices affect others, however, I am already a student obtaining my Master's degree and when I read for pleasure.....it is intended to be for just that...pleasure.  This book is okay if you read to have something to discuss in a book club but if you want to enjoy a book this is not the one to read."

author: b'FW'
title: b'Didnt finish :('
body: b'Im a huge JK fan but I couldnt finish. I couldnt get involved with the characters many because there were too many with no focal point. Im disappointed and hope that she goes back to adventure stories'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Not at all what I was expecting'
body: b'Having never read a Harry Potter book I had no preconceptions. I described it to my husband as 90% of the book establishing characters who were people we wouldnt want to know, then last 10% exciting but a real sad let down. Too much sad drama for me!'

author: b'Laura'
title: b'A real disappointment'
body: b'A real disappointment.  I found this book extremely tedious with no real plot.  Loved her Harry Potter series, but this was a mess.  I would not recommend this book.'

author: b'HMKeating'
title: b"Sadly I wanted to like it but it just didn't work for me."
body: b'I really wanted to love this book as I have heard so many people knock it and felt that this was just sour grapes and not wanting Ms Rowling to have a success outwith Harry Potter.  Sadly, it seems, the detractors have a valid point.'

author: b'Rafic Kamaleddine'
title: b'A deep dive into human psyche'
body: b'I was hesitant to start reading The Casual Vacancy. Whatever I have heard about the book up to that moment was not encouraging. Then my son read it and summed it up in two worda "complicated and messed up". That got me interested. While the book is a total departure from her previous writing, it is truly a strong attempt to enter the world of real people and go beyond the obvious. Though set in a small village somewhere in England, the situations and personalities could be anywhere. The ulterior motives and the quick  and partial judgement people put on each other is a universal case. The story is so revealing in its analysis of human personalities that it leaves you with a sense of wanting to understand in your own life what drives you and everyone around you  and what is it that they are thinking beyond the obvious. You start to think about their fears and aspirations as well as the hidden feelings and actions. You also start to face your own self.'

author: b'Peter Minchin'
title: b'Disapointment'
body: b'Asan adults book I was very disapointed.  Poor character evelopement, trite theme and lacking structure. Badly needs help from n editor.'

author: b'dcrdmr'
title: b'JK ROWLING Casual Vacancy'
body: b'How can I like it when I never recieved the book. It never down loaded to my Kendle, thank you.'

author: b'Kar-Jersey Girl'
title: b'Reading this...other reviews are pretty much accurate.'
body: b"I am reading this now and can't wait to finish.  I bought it for my Kindle more out of curiosity, I should have respected the reviews. I am another who has not read any Harry Potter or seen any of the movies. I finish 98% of what I start to read. I probably will not recommend as a must read. It is well written but the story is sort of predictable.  I get bored with stories about total dysfunction and it is hard to believe a whole town can be this dysfunctional. None of these people communicate."

author: b'stephanie fine'
title: b'This is NOT Harry Potter'
body: b'Sad and depressing this small West England town has nothing to redeem it.  I was sad to read this hopeless tale of families so dysfunctional they make The Manson Family look good.'

author: b'Janet Carson'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b'Not at all what I expected.  The story line was dull and uninspired.  The characters were confusing and quite boring.'

author: b'b'
title: b'Confusing and slow'
body: b'This book is very confusing and a slow read.  The characters keep jumping all over the place, have difficult names to remember, and the progress of the book is very slow.'

author: b'Critic'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"Having thoroughly enjoyed the Harry Potter series and appreciating Rowling's success in engaging a generation of new, young readers, I was very disappointed in the book. I expected a similar level of engagement with the characters.  Perhaps Rowling should stick to writing for kids."

author: b'Paula Clair'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'It was difficult to keep track of the story lines of so many  characters. The author used too many words to tell not much of a story.'

author: b'Rachel'
title: b"Not what you're expecting"
body: b"It's definitely provocative, but far too sexual for my taste.  It is worth a read, but don't expect too much."

author: b'Sally H. Clark'
title: b'BORING!'
body: b'Super boring. Terrible transitions between chapters. Next to no action in first half of book. A very, VERY disappointing read! If Rowling submitted this book as an  unknown author, I doubt if an agent or editor would have taken it.'

author: b'LORI TURNBACH'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I was very much looking forward to reading something different from J.K. Rowling.  It is taking me forever to read.  Nothing drawing me back to it.  That is how I know I am enjoying a book...when I cannot put it down and finish very quickly.  I have been reading this book on and off for several months. Sorry, but I was disappointed.'

author: b'Alisha'
title: b'Not my type of read'
body: b"Not my favorite work from J.K. Rowling. It's a dirty grimy read focusing on the depravity and self absorption of the average joe. I couldn't read past the first three chapters."

author: b'StephenS'
title: b'awash in detail'
body: b'i chose this book because of the author.  parts of it were very good, especially the character descriptions.  the plot line about the teenagers was particularly engaging to me, since i am a teacher of at-risk youth.  the local politics took up much of the book, and it became tedious.  overall, it was worth reading, but there was too much detail for me.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'welcome to reality'
body: b"After reading the reviews with people whining about this not being like Harry Potter...it's not supposed to be! It's an adult book with adult content and I for one, was very impressed. Ms. Rowling knows human beings. I'd say it's one of the best mirrors of human nature I've ever read. I love Harry Potter, truly, but I went into this book knowing there would be no wizards or love conquers all fairy tales. It's gritty, it's real, and maybe some people can't handle coming face to face with the things they don't like about themselves that are represented in her characters. She pulls no punches in showing the dirty underbelly of polite society. It's honest, something lacking in most modern authors and I commend her, for not just that but for showing the world she's got the range to be more than the children's author so many have pigeonholed her to be."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"It's not Harry Potter, but it will do"
body: b'I liked "The Casual Vacancy". I enjoyed the simultaneous plots because I like to be challenged. The death of a character running through it gave it some poignancy. As a first attempt after a series of wildly successful children\'s books, I thought J.K. Rowling did a passable job.'

author: b'Margie Berman'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Ugh. A real snoozer. Too wordy.  Confusing. Too many characters being introduced early on. Story jumps around. I couldn't even finish it."

author: b'toughteach'
title: b'A bit disappointed'
body: b"I can not say I dislike the book BUT its  only about the 6th chapter and I am still not involved. There are quite a few characters and I almost feel like  i need to make a character map. At this point I don't get anything from the book, no excitement and no reason to write it. Perhaps this will change if I get any further but I really don't have a desire to pick it up at this point."

author: b'Donna J Lindahl'
title: b'Hard to get into...'
body: b'I\'m still trying to read the "set up" - I get lost in the many characters being introduced & have to go back and try to remember who is who.'

author: b'Kate Clark'
title: b'Yup, loved it'
body: b"Didn't really know what to expect going in, but I definitely did not feel let down.  I became so absorbed while I was reading the book that I over shot my train stop by 7 minutes before realizing my mistake."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Tedious'
body: b"I was disappointed with the book  Slow moving and  tedious. Final chapters quite good but otherwise not a great read. I don't recommend it."

author: b'Linda J Rasmussen'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy - still vacant'
body: b'I thought it might be as much fun as the Harry Potter series. It was a good read but sad, very sad. It left me wanting to read something that was funny and ended happily.'

author: b'Amanda Cosgrove'
title: b'Well written story'
body: b"I really enjoyed the character development as I could relate but first half was bit slow. I'd consider 3.5 stars."

author: b'James P. Monroe'
title: b'A Cautionary Vacancy'
body: b'This book had a very cynical view of youth and community life.  I kept waiting for some kind of word of redemption, but it came very little, very late.  I am not sorry I read the book, but would be cautious in who I recommend it to.  I think it ended about one chapter too soon......or about thirty chapters too late.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Each character just came alive!'
body: b'Who knew!  I loved this page-turner and feel like the folks I "met" in  Casual Vacancy are family and friends (friends?... well, you have to read it to understand!)'

author: b'La Belle Aurore'
title: b'Not my cup of tea'
body: b'The story is good but it takes too many pages to start.  I was expecting so much more from this new book.'

author: b'LOL'
title: b'Good read'
body: b'I really loved this book but it does take a while to get into it, with a lot of characters to keep track of.'

author: b'Avid Consumer'
title: b'Rowling Has Done Much Better!'
body: b"This book is the biggest disappointment I have had from J. K. Rowling.  She must have used up all her inspiration with the Harry Potter books.  Although I have not finished this, I am only continuing to read it hoping that the plot is going to improve or something interesting will happen.  So far it's terrible!"

author: b'jmay'
title: b'Neat book'
body: b"I love the feel of the book jacket. It was a good book, though plenty of foul language on every page. Not for prudes, that's for sure. Interesting how it all pulls together in the end."

author: b'Kirrily Auchter'
title: b'It is a rare day when I stop reading a book before the end'
body: b'Its simple, this is one of the worst books I have EVER read, there is nothing compelling, nothing enticing you to turn the pages.  It is drab and boring, the characters awful.'

author: b'joe Maassen'
title: b'Nothing Casual Here'
body: b'I did not read the other J.K. Rowling books.  She has great command of the written word and that is reason enough to read her.  This work, my humble opinion, is nearly devoid of a functional character.  It takes away, for me, from what otherwise has the making of a great story well told.'

author: b'Pat Vick'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'expected book to be better, took too much time before getting into it.. thought JKR would write a better book for'

author: b'Hanne Ejsing Jrgensen'
title: b"The Casual Vacancy -- who's to have it ?"
body: b'J.K.Rowling describes the impact of a sudden death of a county member in a small community. This sudden death immedately sets off the fight for power and as always power corrupts. During this power struggle minor and major secrets are revealed among the adult population of this small town, but among the adolescents similar struggles for power and survival take place just as the beginning sexuality is rearing its ugly head.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Surprisingly Enjoyable'
body: b"First off, I didn't have any 'want' at all to read this book ... one of the many book clubs I was in was reading it and I had every intention of abstaining and then someone made a comparison with Maeve Binchy, whom I love.  The characters are all pretty flawed (but isn't everyone?) and I had a difficult time finding anyone that I truly liked.  The entire story somehow reminded me of watching one of those late 70's early 80's British shows on PBS - think Ballykissangel.  Everyone seems headed toward some kind of personal disaster and it's a bit like you're reading juicy gossip and just waiting for the other shoe to drop.  I liked it - it's certainly not like any of the previous books and I didn't expect it to be - but, it's was a great read about normal people and how everyone has their own agenda be it good or not so good."

author: b'noreen raney'
title: b'Great for Falling asleep'
body: b'so boring tedious. If you love Downton Abby skip this. If these characters were in my life I would not want to wake up.'

author: b'Siggy'
title: b'depression inducing, slow moving dirge!'
body: b'This is a very dark and depressing tale, no hope, no light at the end of the tunnel, a description of a council estate inhabited by generations on the dole.....thats it!'

author: b'Jaykay'
title: b'Too Graphic'
body: b'I was surprised by this book. It wasn\'t what I expected at all. I kept thinking "did JK Rowling really write this". There is no disputing that this is a well written book with well defined characters, however, {I don\'t mean to sound prudish) I thought there was too much swearing and graphic detail. Out of such a mundane topic (Council Elections) comes all this ugly bleakness and grittiness. In trying to show us that she can write books for adults I think JK Rowling has gone way over the top.'

author: b'Rebecca'
title: b'Great book'
body: b"I loved Harry Potter and this book shows Rowling is not just a children's author.  The characters and plot intricacies in this book were fantastic."

author: b'KnD Henson'
title: b'Depressing but intriguing'
body: b"At first I was sure JK Rowling had let me down. The book was so dark and full of filthy language.  It was like a bad accident; you didn't want to look but couldn't stop yourself from wanting to know what happened. I kept reading in spite of my disgust and surprisingly the book was a good read. It portrayed the negative  aspects of humanity. At first I thought; are British really this way??  But then I recognized that all humans have those elements.  It just depends on our choices and circumstances."

author: b'apollo8'
title: b'Thoroughly Engaging'
body: b"I had only read The Philosophers Stone from the JK Rowling stable before purchasing The Casual Vacancy. The Casual Vacancy is the best book I've read for ages-a real page turner. It was incredibly readable, the characters were painted exquisitely and the way the author overlapped and developed the characters was very clever. Every sentence was important and relevant, the subject matter unexpected and unique, any Tory wife would relate to the character of Samantha-absolutely brilliant.I challenge any of the critics to have come up with such an original plot for a book-just accept Harry Potter is at an end and move on...."

author: b'Cathie@84097'
title: b"WORST BOOK I'VE EVER READ"
body: b'This is definitely the worst book I have ever read (and I am a voracious reader.)  I can\'t believe Rowling wrote it!  Too many characters to keep track of - even by the end of the book when you should be familiar with them.  My daughter told me she even made lists to keep track of who was who!  On top of that, the story wonders aimlessly with no purpose or goal in sight.  I actually really thought, "Thank God I\'m finally done with that one" when I finished it.  No redeeming value at all!'

author: b'Brian Watson'
title: b'Definitely a New Direction'
body: b"I wasn't sure what to expect when I ordered this book, except that I knew that Rowling was a good writer."

author: b'Karen Heesacker'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy:  language, sexual content, and incest; this is not what I expected or read. I would not recommend this book to anyone I know.'

author: b'Josea22e2eph Montgome3e4fa3w232d222a33232a22eq2d2awwa22ew23r2wDwdw2wdWe3d2RwAr2y3'
title: b'Mature'
body: b'This is a book for a mature audience, in stark contrast with her traditional focus, and that might turn off some people who expected otherwise, but this is a compelling, beautifully written, engaging story'

author: b'Amy E Cissell'
title: b'Okay'
body: b'It was really weird to read a book where I disliked every single character! The book is well written and the story is interesting but odd. I just could not get passed the character issue.'

author: b'Dunia Zamora'
title: b'Very slow, very shocking at the end.'
body: b"It was strange after reading the Harry Potter series, full of fantasy and stuff that you can't even dream about come by with a book by the same author that deals with very normal, very common and very real stuff. At the beginning of the book it took me a long time to actually find a taste for it, sometimes two or 3 days went by without me reading the book (And that normally doesn't happen to me) but right in the middle of the book I started to get more and more interested, I finish it yesterday and now I can't believe there's no more of that book and those characters to read about."

author: b'Renee Litke'
title: b'Tragic Story'
body: b'Very different from the Harry Potter stories. Nicely written. You feel for the characters and find yourself hoping for a happy ending. Worth reading.'

author: b'DS'
title: b'Do not read'
body: b'It was painful to read this through to the end.  It dragged on and on and I thought it would never end.'

author: b'cathie pfaff'
title: b'The Casuel Vacancy'
body: b"I thought I'd try this book since I loved the Harry Potter series.  JK Rowling didn't disappoint with a huge array of characters and sub-plots.  If she writes another book, I'll give it a read."

author: b'Terry in Portland'
title: b'ho hum'
body: b'A bit disappointing. I found it hard to keep all the characters straight and the plot was only mildly engaging.'

author: b'soph12'
title: b'Loved it'
body: b"Though I grew up with and love the Harry Potter series, I'd put off buying The Casual Vacancy because of the resoundingly lukewarm reviews. I even decided to purchase the Kindle version to avoid paying 25 dollars for the hardcover. I began reading it during a flight to Costa Rica and subsequent downtime on the vacation. I wasn't immediately impressed. The plot seemed so-so and the abundance of characters was really annoying. However, as the novel progressed, I found myself more and more drawn to the characters and their individual (but intertwining) stories. It didn't take long to get me hooked. Rowling does a great job with character development, as well as building the ever-present suspense. Despite what I'd initially thought, none of the eighteen or so main characters ended up seeming superfluous. I cried, laughed, and thought about the book for awhile after finishing it. This, by my standards, is the sign of a truly well-written work."

author: b'tom k'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'overall story line was too drawn out. Obviously being paid by the word. Should have read Killimg Kennedy. Maybe next time.'

author: b'Lydia Ingram'
title: b'A masterfully written book!'
body: b"The plot revolves around an important man's death, which sets off a series of events that prove cataclysmic for all the people involved. But essentially it's about the seedy underbelly of a seemingly idyllic small town in rural England. Everyone knows each other's business, and the people are all pretty dysfunctional. The characters are all hopelessly flawed and each is struggling with untold amounts of baggage and difficulty. There are at least a dozen protagonists, yet all are intricately developed and all but a couple are extremely sympathetic. I loved it because all of the subplots are delicately interwoven, the characters are round and complex, the writing is skillful, and the harsh reality of it all was somehow immensely satisfying to lose myself in for awhile. There's some vulgarity in it, and it's probably not for everyone, but I absolutely loved it. (By the way, not that it matters, but I'm also a HUGE fan of the Harry Potter series, and while some people are strangely bothered by Rowling's venture into adult lit., I can't help but feeling that it's silly to be bothered by that - there are TONS of authors who write both adult and kid lit.  It's an impressive author who can do both as successfully as Rowling has done)."

author: b'Genevieve R.'
title: b'Kudos to Rowling on a job well done.'
body: b'No one writes characters like J.K. Rowling.  Although this is a drastic move away from wizards and quidditch matches the characters and intertwining storylines are just as fascinating.'

author: b'Ali'
title: b'I love this book.'
body: b"Though it's completely different from Harry Potter, I love this book. I couldn't put it down! I'd recommend this to anyone 18+."

author: b'marysalvas'
title: b'boring'
body: b'it was boring.i did not finish it for weeks.that is unusual for me. i had hoped it would be much better.'

author: b'shirley hudson'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I really didnt like it at all. I stopped readying into the 3rd chapter. I just couldnt get into it. I was reading it and it was so confusing and the story didnt make sense to me. I read all of her Harry Potter books and they were really awesome. I just think she missed the mark on this one.'

author: b'Tim O'
title: b"One of the best books I've ever read"
body: b'First some background. The first 3 Harry Potter books came out when I was in elementary school, so I got to grow up with Harry Potter. Now I am 22 and in college. Because I loved the Harry Potter series I decided to check out Rowlings new "adult" novel. I absolutely love it. Rowling\'s writing skill is unparalleled. I could picture and feel every scene in the book. I also never felt so many emotions while reading a book. You get to know each character down to their core.'

author: b'Stephanie Granger'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'If it wasnt for pure determination to finish this novel, for within the first 100 pages I fell asleep every time I picked it up, I may have put this one down and never picked it back up. That determination came from the name on the front cover. I am extremely disappointed in my lack of praise of this novel for I had been enthusiastic about it leading up to its release. The main problem was that with the introduction of so many characters it took a long time to become engulfed in the story (perhaps a map of all the characters at the beginning or end may have helped). The use of overt sexual references felt pretentious, like Rowling was trying to distance herself intentionally from her previous audience without adding much to the story. Like Rowling is so good at, she wound the web between the characters brilliantly, but her need to prove that she is not a one-trick-pony backfired. One of my biggest disappointments is that she wasted time working on this novel when she could have brought us another classic from the world of Harry Potter. I wasn\'t looking for Magic in the novel, but I was expecting the Magical way in which Rowling writes. There were moments when I detected her voice, but mostly, I just was itching to finish and get to the next novel. I am so discouraged by "The Casual Vacancy" that I won\'t be reading another Rowling work that is not HP based on her name alone.'

author: b'Wicca J Davidson'
title: b'Forget about the 7 Harry Potter books, but do read this one.'
body: b"Forget about the 7 Harry Potter books.  They have nothing in common with this one. The only similarity for me was that I was engaged immediately, as I was with Rowling's other books."

author: b'Laura J Riviello'
title: b'What a disappointment'
body: b'Hard to believe this book came from the same author as the one who wrote such spell-binding and intricate tales as the Harry Potter series. The book lacked imagination for one and absolutely nothing redeeming- feel I have lost precious hours of my life in my quest to finish it since it was our book club pick. This is the first book that got a 1 star out of five from every member of our club.'

author: b'Ronald W. Durham'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Not the usual fun J.K. Rowling read.  I think she should stick with magic and let someone else write about strictly muggle life.'

author: b'savvyshoppers'
title: b'wonderful'
body: b'J.K. Rowling is a creator of amazing characters, as anyone who has read her Harry Potter books can attest.  Reading this book I felt as if I were in the town of Pagford watching the story unfold.  Each character, male and female, ranging in age from 3 to middle age, is fully realized, diverse and believable.'

author: b'Kadkins'
title: b'Rowling should stick to young adult books'
body: b'This book lacks any type of climax.  The book is filled with to many adjectives and has numerous pages of pointless information that leads no where.  I love Rowling but this book is not worth it.'

author: b'NS'
title: b'Great'
body: b'If you are expecting a Harry Potter for adults then do not buy this. I was surprised that she could write something like this. Yes the book is hard, maybe depressing but really portrays a situation that exists in a lot of countries. I did not read any reviews before buying it, so maybe I was not disappointed like some of the other readers. Definitely not a comedy.'

author: b'Sandra'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'It just wasnt what I was expecting from the author. It was boring and just not my type of book. Harry Potter was way better'

author: b'Janet Kloppenburg'
title: b'Dreary and depressing'
body: b'JK Rowling is a brilliant writer and character developement is exceptional.  Of course the Potter series is beyond compare and she is delving into different territory, but that being said this book to me was dismal and depressing.  I think her writing so far only seems to portray such darkness and despair.  I cannot name one character that has any likeable qualities nor am I sympathetic to what happens to any of them.  I completed approximately half the book and moved on to another,  I found that the prospect of an additional half of the book still to be read to be a burden.  I may pick up the book again at some point and hope that there is some brightness in the second half.'

author: b'Juice'
title: b'A little tedious'
body: b'I am quite enjoying it, but it is rather tedious or pedantic. I think it could be a much shorter book if JK cut to the chase instead of laboriously bringing in every detail of the different characters.'

author: b'Janice E. Patten'
title: b'Most readers are prepared for this kind of book, written in the English 19th style.'
body: b"I have read and taught to adult teachers almost all of the Harry Potter books.  When the first HP book came out I hailed it as a wonderful new trend in children's literature, with semi-colons and long sentences and intricate themes.  I received a great many nasty letters telling me how wrong I was, that children would never read books that were so long and involved. Okay?  Who is right now?  I claim again that Rowling's latest is of a piece of classical 19th century literature, with a Swiftean touch. Yahoos?  Perhaps...A non-too casual look into the lives of people who seem to be admired....and those who would be on the other side of the tracks....takers, not givers....off the system. I look forward to investigating the book on a second read: folks today want instant satisfaction, action and violence, trite resolutions, not the kind of Dickensian characters we see in TCV....They are Everyman....failure to care for his fellow man....except perhaps for the one already deceased person, Barry Fairbrother....One who actually cares about others.  Let's take this book seriously."

author: b'Bonnie G.'
title: b'Yada, yada, yada...'
body: b'I grew up in a small town and this book reminded me of the endless gossip that would go on after a death.  It was interesting in the last 10% of the book only.'

author: b'Ginger Thompson'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I was very disappointed in the book.  Undoubtedly, J.K. Rowling is a very talented writer who does an excellent job of character development.  I just did not like the characters she developed.'

author: b'Sheri'
title: b'Good character development'
body: b"Casual Vacancy was a surprise for Harry Potter fans!  Present day portrayal of one man's influence on a small town.  Great character development, but slow at times.  Seems to end abruptly although most loose ends are wrapped up."

author: b'J. Michael'
title: b'JK Rowling goes blue and busts'
body: b'I Figured that it would have more adult themes started reading and within the first few pages F bombs started flying.  Great.  Just what I wanted to read.  All that repressed profanity from 7 Harry Potter Books has taken its tole.  Just because a book is geared towards an adult audience does not mean that the language needs to be perverse.  It takes more talent to write without profanity.  Apparently, success does not breed class.  Good thing Ms. Rowling had ghost writers helping her with the Potter series.'

author: b'QuilterCA'
title: b'Are you kidding? No Magic here.'
body: b'The protagonist is named Fairweather, the daughter of the meth addict antagonist Krystal Wheedon.  Need I say more?  Trying to imitate the sex sells formula works only if there is good characterization and a plot.'

author: b'diane d. rangen'
title: b'OK'
body: b'I WAS NOT SURE WHAT TO EXPECT BUT I DID NOT EXPECT SUCH GORE AND GUTS. I WAS DISAPPOINTED BY THE STORYLINE; BUT IMPRESSED AT HOW WELL JK ROLLING JUMPED INTO A WHOLE DIFFERENT STORYLINE.'

author: b'Student 7/25/05'
title: b'nice book'
body: b'Though I prefer the Harry Potter book and was a little disappointed.  But I would recommend it for light reading.'

author: b'Catherine A. Mormoris'
title: b'One dimensional'
body: b'I really love the imaginative Harry Potter series, but I found Ms. Rowlings writing for adults very one dimensional.  Everyone has their own personalities, negitive and positive but Ms. Rowlings definately chose to express the down side of life and with only the negitive ideas expressed.  Even in the worst life, people are not as negitive and shallow, as Ms. Rowling expresses.'

author: b'allison whelan'
title: b'bland'
body: b'very disappointed. after the rousing success and enjoyment of Harry potter, Rowling simply tried too hard with too little on this one.'

author: b'TCL'
title: b'Great book!'
body: b"Rowling's CASUAL VACANCY shows that she is capable of writing interesting adult fiction."

author: b'DONA JONES'
title: b'review'
body: b'It was not as good as exspected.'

author: b'Library lady'
title: b"When's fix meets grim reality"
body: b'Reality of childhood abuse, personality disorders, teenage angst, small-town politics and family dynamics all combine into a someway confusing, but valuable read.  Found myself laughing and crying while reading and  then thinking about the characters days later.'

author: b'Josh'
title: b'Pagford is no Hogwarts'
body: b"I felt while reading this that Rowling wrote it to be the opposite of Harry Potter. And she did that well. It was we'll written and the end really saved it and pulled me in. Otherwise I don't really choose to read books like this, life is too much like this. Too sad. Too much full of unfulfilled hopes."

author: b'Joanne Lovett'
title: b'It was okay'
body: b'I struggled to read this book, loosing interest frequently it has taken me over 8 weeks to read and I read everyday.  The biggest issue that I had was that I would read a few pages and then fall asleep ( that is not normal). The basic plot was well written and the characters intertwined, but the storyline left a bit to be desired.  It was readable but a real struggle.'

author: b'CLT'
title: b'Social Awareness'
body: b'Good story, involved character development, pretty serious social issues discussed.'

author: b'Rusty zane'
title: b'A True View of the Village'
body: b"While it wasn't the murder mystery I was expecting, I disagree with those who felt it was too long.  J.K.
