body: b'Rowling is exceptional at character development, and is now showing great prowness in her ability to weave a "normal" length story.  Unfortunately she made every effort to create a cast of characters that are all somewhat or very undesirable.  I cannot say that I found any attachment or desire to get to know any of the characters any better, and feel that they all have such depressing lives, that I do not want to visit their little hamlet ever again.  Maybe that is the point Rowling was trying to get across?  Still a master, but I hope her next venture finds a more endearing cast, and less foul language as it does nothing towards the story line, only creates an unecessary distraction for the reader.  Bottom line is, any book that leaves me with this strong of a reaction, good or bad deserves at least 4 out of 5 stars!  Glad I read it, glad I\'m done with it!'

author: b'Helen'
title: b'Well written book with horrible emotional impact'
body: b"While there's no question of Rowling's ability to write and to develop characters, the emotional impact of reading this story was, well, like encountering a Dementor... the story sucks away what seems like every joy and happiness.  I'd only recommend reading this in order to study a well-written novel or if someone finds themselves too happy and optimistic about the world."

author: b'Pam Curry'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"I was hoping for a great read but sure didn't find it. Too many uninteresting characters and a head-shaker plot/story. I finished with grim determination and the ending was in-line with the rest of the book. Boring. She can do better than this!"

author: b'Ronald Auerbach'
title: b'Rating for Casual Vacancy, buy R.K. Rowling'
body: b'Very disappointed in Casual Vacancy.  I found  this book. to be very boring.  I had expected so much more from J.K. Rowling.'

author: b'Stephanie Raghavan'
title: b'Rowling holds her own in adult fiction'
body: b'I need to be upfront here and admit something to you all - I hated the beginning of this book. As in I almost put it down. But the thought of shunning Rowling like that made me a little sad (I mean come on, the woman created the single greatest wizard series that ever existed - where was that magic hiding??), so I powered through. And then about 150 pages in (which is really quite a lot of pages to struggle through), something clicked and I really started to enjoy myself.'

author: b'Old Dancer'
title: b'The seamy side of English village life'
body: b"It's as if Maeve Binchy went on a bender, became a mean drunk and found the seamy underbelly of English village life."

author: b'Thomas Richardson'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b"Definitely not Harry potter, not a murder mystery but an amazing thriller. I couldn't put the book down for anything#"

author: b'CCW'
title: b'Not up to the hype its been given'
body: b"Casual Vacancy left me disappointed. Disappointed that such a huge runaway success of a book could be so poor in literary content. To me it was just a paper-thin story, perhaps even a fantasy of the author that she now felt safe in committing to paper. There is too much emphasis on telling us about the multitude of characters and not enough on allowing the story to tell itself to a point where the plot disappears under the weight of the characterisations and the cloying social comment. It's that weak plot that destroys the book; the political manoeuvring to fill the casual vacancy on the council and in turn control the jurisdiction under which a particular community will find itself administered. Really, it's not that exciting."

author: b'Debbienz'
title: b'Interesting Characters, Relationships and Agendas'
body: b'Life in an English village as a vacancy (throught death) occurs on the local council. Seemingly unrelated people prove to be linked in unexpected ways, as the fabric of their community dissolves and then rebuilds'

author: b'Deborah Rivas'
title: b'Loved it'
body: b"Took a while to get to know all the characters, but once I did it was one of the best books I have read. I can't beleive that it got bad reviews, she is so honest in her writing and I can't wait till she writes another novel. I didn't read her Harry Potter books but I will make sure after reading this book that I do. This is one of those books where you carry it around with you, ignore your husband and are not happy to be making tea when you could be reading the book. I am 53 but I woould recommend it to any age group from 16 up.Loved it Loved it"

author: b'Danielle Starr'
title: b'Mirror into often overlooked humanity'
body: b"If you're looking for fanciful and fun this is not your book.  This is about reality.  The thoughts and feelings that motivate our behaviors.  Are you a good person if you do the right things for the wrong reasons?  Are you a bad person if you have good intentions but your actions cause harm?  And it also takes a good look at society's treatment of our most vuneralble members.  A true look at how the lack of knowledge of choices can affect us and the tragedy that can cause.  How grown people can read this book and not feel for the Krystal Weedon's of the world is beyond me.  I can only assume that they are ignorant of other people's reality and arrogant in their belief that they could do better if placed in the same situation.  It's easy, but ignorant and arrogant, to look down at people who have not been given all the knowledge and chances in life that we have had and believe that we could do better."

author: b'B. Kim'
title: b'Great quick read'
body: b'Great character development and commentary on social issues. Quite a departure from her series for children and young adults, but same high quality of writing.'

author: b'Sam Hunt'
title: b'A boring experience.'
body: b'Being a Harry Potter fan, I kept reading the book in hopes that something would happen.  Alas, it never did.  A slow and boring book.'

author: b'Roll-On U Bears'
title: b"Not the best book out there, but it's okay"
body: b"I know this is not Harry Potter and I didn't come in with those expectations. However, I found this book very tedious. It tried to be too much instead of just focusing on telling a good story. By the time the election rolls around, I could care less about it and even more about the characters. It's an okay read, but I wouldn't recommend it unless you really like J.K. Rowling."

author: b'Melanie Garrison'
title: b'OK'
body: b'I loved the Harry Potter books, I read all of them from July 22 to Oct. 23 an number of years ago. ( work full time as well as all my other obligationa)'

author: b'Stan L. Riggin'
title: b'Not a bad read'
body: b"I forcibly made sure I had no real expectations for this book, since I'd read a number of mixed reviews--many of which said that the Harry Potter orientation toward Rowling would work to a reader's disadvantage.  Having now completed this book, I have to say that it was very well written and fundamentally interesting.  However, it is a bit of a downer overall with just a little redemption in the final pages."

author: b'Priscilla Mertel'
title: b'Hard time reading this book'
body: b"i've been having a hard time getting into this book.  I've started reading it twice now and just doesnt keep my attention."

author: b'Bookworm'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"A real analysis of the dark side of people's nature. Focusing on how just a few people can be so destructive to a community with gossiping, spreading rumors, racism, elitism. Fighting between stinginess in heart and pocketbook versus some characters who were deeply generous and committed to the community as a whole.  Interesting and easy to read. A departure from the author's previous books which is fine with me.... just different and from what I understand a little biographical in the most susperficial sense."

author: b'Linda S. Jones'
title: b'anxious to read'
body: b'Thses must be waiting for me in my knidle queue.  My wife is a faster reader than I am but am sure I will enjoy when I get to them.'

author: b'littlechloe'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'"The Casual Vacancy" Great Book.  My daughter loves J.K. Rowling and her writting.  Glad I was able to get it for her.  Thanks.'

author: b'algugel'
title: b'...Life is real, so real...'
body: b'J.K.Rowling is a Brave & Noble Writer of Magnificent Books.Let us let literary critics establish the place that J.K.Rowling holds in The English Literature, after all it is their business, for the rest of us-can we imagine how our lives will be without the Harry Potter saga?'

author: b'Robinowitz'
title: b'Unnecessary Filthy Language'
body: b"I read up to 89% of my Kindle version and then quit the book.  I was so tired of the filthy language and the contrived plots and shallow characters, that I'd just had enough."

author: b'Rissa-J'
title: b'So very different but I fell in love all the same.'
body: b"It was hard to read this at the start of the story, because all I could think of was 'When will the magic start?'."

author: b'nutmeg'
title: b'Disturbing Content - Brilliant Writer.'
body: b"Be warned if you are a sensitive reader.  This is a gritty, gritty novel.  There was no positive resolution at the end (if you are the kind of reader who hopes for that).  J.K. Rowling is  an extremely gifted writer - there is no question there.  This novel makes me think of others that are brilliantly crafted but have scenes that are so disturbing that I wish I had never read them - for example: Fall on Your Knees by Anne Marie MacDonald, A Find Balance by Rohinton Mistry, The God of Small Things by Arundati Roy.  Brilliant novels - wanted to bleach my memory after and am haunted by them occasionally.  In Casual Vacancy, I didn't like any of the characters; I felt no affinity for any of them - in fact they repelled me.  I found it all too much - too much gnarly grit.  However, I am a pretty sensitive reader - especially since having children of my own (toddlers now), so I understand that not everyone is looking for a more gentle or more comic read."

author: b'deborah rothenberg'
title: b'Very Entertaining!'
body: b"Although I have never read any books by Rowling, I decided to try this anyway. The story has many different characters and kept me going back again and again to find out more about them.  Rowling is excellent at making these characters so real to me that I felt as if I was actually in their heads.  I found this book very entertaining and am looking forward to reading more of this author's work in the future."

author: b'Andreas M. Antonopoulos'
title: b'Give it a chance and it will reward'
body: b"It's definitely not an *easy* read. It doesn't kick into action until halfway, setting off with more than a dozen character arcs. If it was anyone but JK Rowling, I might have given up. But, I'm really glad I didn't, because the book is rewarding. The characters are deep, full of nuance. Everyone is a villain and a hero and deeply flawed, utterly, richly human."

author: b'Sirius'
title: b'I did not expect it to be Harry Potter'
body: b'I loved Harry Potter books, I really did, but the last thing I expected from this book is to be anything like Harry Potter. I expected the book for adults which has nothing to do with magic and everything to do with reality of our existance. I expected something along the line of Dikkens, along the line of my beloved Russian classics of 19 century. Based on the reviews I expected something maybe not as well written, but with similar subject matter like Dostoevsky.'

author: b'Psyche53'
title: b'Very different'
body: b'Well written, but rather a depressing tale of life in a middle class town in England. She does a good job of tying the various people who live and interact with one another together, but there is no happy ending here.'

author: b'Wirth'
title: b'Reality in a book'
body: b"I know some people may be taken aback at the content of this book. As usual J.K. Rowling writes a beautiful story woven with many characters. This is not a kids book. This is a book that could easily be someone's reality. No character is sainted. Everyone is flawed. It was thought provoking and sad. I loved every bit of it."

author: b'Christine M. Moellering'
title: b"Haven't read it yet."
body: b"But it showed up quickly and in time to give my husband for Christmas.  I can't wait to read it myself."

author: b'Supberb!'
title: b"She's done it again!"
body: b'ROWLING writess an unforgettable tale showing that she is a multiple genre weaver of attention holding stories that have not only strong story elements but also true to life characters who keep the reader turning the pages. I look forward to her next endeavor.  This book is an excellent read.'

author: b'Deborah A. Bradley'
title: b'Reading the text'
body: b"I like the idea of how you can change the format of the font.  It is easy to read on one's eyes/"

author: b'biq'
title: b'An excelent book!'
body: b"I m reading it just now. It's for adults only, not young people. Shows a deep social interest. it is very Good"

author: b'avid reader'
title: b'Powerful, witty, compelling adult read'
body: b'I was stunned by this book. On the surface, it had everything I love about an English village mystery, with all sorts of colorful characters, but Rowling explores all the darkest problems of our present-day world. Compulsively readable, funny, and tragic.'

author: b'travelengineer'
title: b'Sorry I spent time on this book'
body: b'Although the writing is impeccable and the characters detailed and real, I was disappointed with this book.  There is no character that I felt like I could root for, they were all too flawed.  I had a difficult time getting through all the endless descriptions of small time gossip.  I only hoped that the ending would justify the time I spent reading the rest of the book.  Unfortunately, even though I cried at the end, the resolution was not entirely satisfying.'

author: b'Mariam'
title: b'Dark, but enjoyable'
body: b"First off, I have never read a single Harry Potter book, nor seen any of the movies.  I did not purchase this book because I was a fan of the author.  The Harry Potter series doesn't interest me, and from the reviews I read before buying this book, the author completely deviated from her norm here.  That being said, this book had its moments.  All in all, it was very good, albeit depressing, however, it was steeped in reality.  The author excels at making you feel for the characters, some good, some bad, some downright pathetic.  The reasons I did not give it 5 stars were twofold: first, there was a point about midway through the book where it dragged a little and I started to lose interest, but it did pick up and the ending was very fast-paced.  I couldn't wait to finish it to find out what happened to the characters. Secondly, there were so many characters that there were times it was hard to keep track of them (especially on my Kindle; it's much easier to flip back to a pages in a book when you need to go back and check on something).  I would definitely read other books by this author, but not any Harry Potters."

author: b'gustavprellernovelist'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Initially absorbing and a pleasure to read such good English, but I became bored with the subject matter. Too long to retain reader's interest"

author: b'D. C. Theron'
title: b'disappointing'
body: b"Certainly not near Rowling's capability . Portrays the British in a very bad light  . I hope it is not too factual ."

author: b'Charlotte Schmidt'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I thought that this book was a little harder to read than the Harry Potter series, but still a very good read.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'boring, dirty'
body: b"I read a lot.  I couldn't finish this book - it was extremely dull and gratuitously filthy. Frankly, if the author wasn't already famous, this would be a non-starter.  I tried, really, but finally happily put it down about one-third through with complete lack of interest."

author: b'Andrew Trapani'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Every author tends to deal with a sophomore slump, and while this is technically Miss Rowling 's 9th book, she's spent all her time in one universe that the jump to a brand new one is a little shakey at first. This story really does seem like it's The Dursley's own book, everyone is a tad boring in that charmingly English way. The best review I can give this book is that I had to finish it,for good or I'll I had to finish"

author: b'S. Molina'
title: b'Really, 2.5 stars'
body: b"It's like Rowling was trying to get as far away as possible from the HP series as possible. Like when a child star poses for Playboy as soon as she turns 18."

author: b'M. Bucer'
title: b'Haunting and Unforgettable'
body: b"I am a person who will read a book and never re-read it.  I try to re-read books and even years later I will find it difficult to find something new, something I missed.  With Vacancy I could not stop thinking about it.  I could not read another book, I tend to read one after another, after another never being satisfied.  It has been a month since I finished Vacancy and after attempting to read 4 or 5 other books which I just could not get lost in I have begun re-reading Vacancy.  The characters in this book have been haunting me since I began reading it and I am finding it just as thrilling and exciting to re-read it.  This book is full of so very many people, deeply flawed, real people.  I have found something in common with each and every character, even the ones I didn't want to.  The book does not end well and nothing is settled but each and everyone of these characters has had their world flipped upside down and been forced to look more closely at their own lives, instead of trying to sustain themselves on the gossip of others in this small town. I have never read a book that left me so moved and full of so many different emotions all at once.  I don't think this book is for everyone but for those like me it will be an experience not soon forgotten."

author: b'DD Burlin'
title: b'Impressive'
body: b"Nasty, self-absorbed, petty people living in small-town England.  Ms. Rowling seems to have done what she set out to do:  prove that she is not only a great writer of young adult literature, but also a talented writer for a more mature audience.  The writing is excellent.  Her way of creating a sensation of the smallness of Pagford by having one character's vignette segue into another's was very well done.  My only criticism is that each time she wrote about a character's baser behaviors it was though she was trying to show how un-Harry Potter she could be."

author: b'Kindle Reader'
title: b'So Far not finished reading'
body: b'Hard to review when my reading is not complete.'

author: b'Jo-Carroll'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Such a leap from the Harry Potter series. Did a nice job going to a different genre. Makes you look at people in a different way.'

author: b'E. Scoles'
title: b'Not for the faint of heart'
body: b"One of the main things separating J. K. Rowling from many authors of Literary Fiction is that she doesn't pretend to pull her punches. You pretty much know at the outset what she does and doesn't like, and yet, like any of the best writers of social satire (T. C. Boyle comes to mind) she can show us how much she dislikes someone without demonizing them -- while at the same time avoiding the sanctification of heroes."

author: b'Centavo'
title: b'Disappointing reading....'
body: b'I was very excited to read a book from JK Rowling since the end of the Harry Potter series.  Unfortunately, this book  went nowhere fast and I finally put it down after 100 pages.  Too wordy with lengthy descriptions about everything unimportant--- very disappointing.'

author: b'OliveB'
title: b'Harry Potter has moved on and so has JKR.'
body: b'If you can get past the fact that this novel in no way resembles the Harry Potter series, then you can start to appreciate this book for what it is.  It\'s a big departure for JKR, everything that readers associate with her - complex plot, scene setting, character growth, action, finding meaning in adversity - is not in her new novel (although the latter point is debatable).  Neither is magic, the supernatural, or tidy, happy endings. It\'s a social commentary on modern society, about how people interact, and about the "authenticity" of the folks that make up a community. It\'s a study of a microcosm that represents western attitudes on a macro level. It isn\'t whimsical, or sugar coated (the cover art of the book leads you to believe otherwise); JK actually swears which can be jarring at first, and she talks about sex (gasp).  People do ugly things to one another, think ugly thoughts, some characters are irredeemable, all are flawed.  I had mixed feelings about this book up until the first quarter of it.  The story telling is not as strong as her previous work, but her character exploration is intriguing. In the end, I found this book compelling.  I hope that her next adult novel can combine the honest look at humans in their environments with some of the story telling finesse (stronger plot and a little more action) that she had developed while writing the Harry Potter series.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'No magic spells'
body: b'I expected magic spells and wizards. But none of that. Casual Vacancy is about real people and real situations.  No waving of the magic wand.  Amazingly written, JKR shows a whole different side of self in every chapter'

author: b'jewelry galore'
title: b'okay'
body: b'Not what I expected...I thought the book was okay, but the book was somwhat interesting. I hate to say it, but I would not recommend this book.'

author: b'Michel Gascon'
title: b'Darkness rvle'
body: b'Although very dark his book is ncessaire to make people think about the solutions to the social maseries of our times'

author: b'Mike McGrath'
title: b'Poorly written novel with a weak story'
body: b'I thought the book was poorly written , the story was weak and pointless.'

author: b'Sarah'
title: b'Not my style, but well done'
body: b"If you like gritty, real stories that delve into the intricacies of the human mind and soul -- especially the parts we all try to keep hidden -- I think you'll really like this book."

author: b'G. Wells'
title: b'Took a while to get into'
body: b'It took me a while to start to get the large cast of characters straight, but this then turned into a very gripping (if sad) tale.  Good to see that she can write good books for adults as well as the hugely successful HP series.'

author: b'sarebeth'
title: b'Interesting'
body: b'This book kept me hooked and had many subtleties that were hilarious and/or thought-provoking.  I enjoyed seeing another side of Rowling and think she pulled this off very well.'

author: b'Marie Morrison'
title: b'Time is Precious; Select Another Book'
body: b"My children read Harry Potter, loving the series. I thought the author would be writing an uplifting book for adults. Even with chapter one having a death, I imaged characters of a small town collaborating, getting along, learning lessons from one another. Instead, I found a book packed with filthy language, druggies with detailed scenes because of drug use, disgusting sexual images (take the obese man, for example, and what he cannot see), screaming, violence, everyone angry all the time. Why do I want to read a book that leaves me with a headache? What a huge disappointment. Don't bother to read it. Take your precious time and find something that has clean language and is a joy to read."

author: b'Stephanie DB'
title: b'Stick with it'
body: b'Stick with it- it may start slowly but Rowling creates thoughtful characters as the story Unfolds and builds momentum. Interesting glimpse into British small-town life and the common pettiness and hypocrisy that is the human condition.'

author: b'nanajean'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I enjoyed it I havent read the Harry Potter books so may read them some time soon.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Hard to read'
body: b"I tried to like this and be open to J.K. Rowling writing something other than Harry Potter, but this story was so slow, depressing and heavy, I honestly could not finish it.  I want to say it was too many characters, but I was able to read Game of Thrones with it's huge cast with no problems. I just can't say for sure what the problem was other than it was almost as if she set out to prove she could write adult fiction but tried too hard."

author: b'Loui'
title: b'Long winded and boring'
body: b'After the Harry Potter series which I really enjoyed, this book is a let down.  It is bogged down in long winded detail and slow to get into the story.  It is also often repetative to the point that I thought I had lost the page.'

author: b'Mary Dell Donelson'
title: b'Disappointing story and characters'
body: b'This book was well written, but it was tiresome to read about so many characters that had no (or few) positive qualities.'

author: b'Mom of R and B'
title: b'Enjoyed this book'
body: b'I enjoyed this book.  Pretty much everyone in here is dysfunctional, so it was a bit like the National Enquirer, but it was entertaining and well written.'

author: b'J. Norden'
title: b'not impressed'
body: b"Too many characters are introduced early on and it can be confusing if you don't take the time to sit and really work on memorizing them and how they tie in to eachother. The story was pretty slow moving and lacked a real climax."

author: b'Emilee Fisher'
title: b"Read if you're curious"
body: b'The story line is mediocre, but I was entertained enough to read it all the way through. Rowling has always been good at developing strong characters, but that may be the only aspect of this book I really thought was above average.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A better read for Brits perhaps?'
body: b'What an odd book!  The adolescent characters are fully formed; the adults are all cartoon characters.  The adolescents, wounded and noble and confused, enjoy full humanity while the adult characters are predictable, boring, and soulless.  The theme seems to be a rant against materialism, racism, and class warfare in the English towns and villages, and some of the details and vocabulary probably resonate best with an English reader.  To my eye, however, this is an poor-to-average effort by a talented writer - a lack of nuance and sloppy character development.  Are we to conclude that anyone over the age of 19 does not deserve anything but cardboard cut-out development in a novel?  Odd.  Seems like so much more could have been done with some guidance by a good editor.'

author: b'denny'
title: b'Stick to potter'
body: b'Slow and confusing to follow easily....each chp uses characters names as if you should know about them, but little is revealed until towards the end....Peyton place, anyone?'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Casual Vacancy Hits Adult Market Bullseye'
body: b"Yes, I know this book isn't for kids; it's J.K. Rowling's first attempt at writing a novel for adults. But as a died-in-the-wool fan of the Hogwarts clan - I've devoured every single page of every single Harry Potter book, seen all the movies and bought all the DVDs - I figured if she can work her magic that superbly on books that appeal to just about all ages, her new one is bound to be pretty good at the very worst."

author: b'Charl van Heyningen'
title: b'Brilliant study of human relationships'
body: b"A simply exceptional portrayal of interpersonal and sociological relationships in small town England. Rowling has firmly established herself as an 'adult' author of note. Unable to put down this book."

author: b'Joan C. Blount'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b'Started reading but could not get interested in it. Maybe will go back to later & try again later on.'

author: b'Elaine Falkenberg'
title: b'Very disappointing'
body: b'I was so disappointed with this book. I have never read Harry Potter, so had no expectations except that she was writing a book for adults that got a lot of press. I found it tedious, slow, redundant, boring and focused much too much on the adolescent characters rather than the adults..'

author: b'K. Goodwin'
title: b'You showed them Rowling!'
body: b"She can write a book thats not fantasy!  Too bad it was depressing and made me feel like a piece of crap.  Everyone knows life sucks and isn't fair but...  Life was so much better when we were fighting for good and when Voldemort was involved.  What!?!?! Life is better with Voldemort?  Yes! This book made me want Voldemort back.  At least he just outright killed children.  Ugh."

author: b'Donna'
title: b'Fabulous Novel!'
body: b'I absolutely loved this superb  "first novel for adults" by J.K. Rowling! I hesitated to purchase "A Casual Vacancy" because of the numerous negative reader reviews (although there are also many positive reader reviews) here on Amazon.com.  I\'m so very glad that I didn\'t allow the negative reader reviews to influence me too much!  Perhaps some of the negative reviews were from readers who were hoping for more fantasy novels or for more writing intended for juveniles from Ms. Rowling. Regardless, I\'m delighted that Ms. Rowling has put her excellent writing talents to work on serious adult fiction, and I hope she writes many more adult novels! Her writing skills are superior, her characters seem real (faults and all), and the plot is very well-developed, if disturbing (realistically so) at times. I highly recommend this novel to readers who enjoy quality literary fiction.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"Don't Read it Just because you like HP"
body: b'First of all, if you are thinking of reading this book because you loved Harry Potter and are hoping to reconnect with that character through the another one of Rowlings books, you will be very disappointed. Now that we got that out of the way, The Casual Vacancy, Rowlings first venture into the world of adult literary fiction, showcases the writers talent in a very different way. As always, whether you like the book or not will depend on your literary tastes.'

author: b'missy'
title: b'disappointing'
body: b'I purchased this book, as my husband so enjoyed the Potter books and thought the author talented.  Her literacy skills are superior, but the story line very ordinary.  Too close to the ugly side of life we live now'

author: b'Z. Baldwin'
title: b'Only 100 pages so far'
body: b'I find it well written but so far I dislike all the characters. Not sure if I will finish it. I understand the desire to be realistic but give me ONE sympathetic person!'

author: b'CyberFiberGal'
title: b'Disappointing - characters and writing style'
body: b'I wanted to like this book, truly I did, unfortunately I was not able to.  I was not able to care about any of the characters.  I found the entire cast to be tiresome, annoying and wholly unsympathetic.  I understand an author wanting to create "real" people warts and all, but this bunch of characters seemed to have nothing but warts and lacked any endearing quirks, vulnerabilities, or other traits that makes you care what happens to them.  I was also disappointed in the style of the writing.  I expected to see some of the humor and charm the Harry series had, perhaps a Terry Pratchett-esque sense of humor peeking thru, but this was not to be.  I gave up  two thirds of the way thru and jumped to the end to see if the ending hinted at any reason for slogging thru the remainder of the book - it didn\'t.  It felt as if JK is trying to put out a book as far from Harry Potter as possible and in that I believe she succeeded.'

author: b'nena626'
title: b'JKR-'
body: b'Harry Potter - genious! Now with this story, I have to say she really is taking the reader into a different reality. She does have a way with words. A must read!!!'

author: b'Patti'
title: b'Casual Vacancy is vulgar and depressing'
body: b'My book club picked this novel to read, based solely on the reputation of the author.  In my opinion, this novel is an unhappy, vulgar novel made up of trite characters using trite elements of conflict.'

author: b'Nicky Parvaz'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'Not a page turner & uses too many words that need to be looked up in dictionary - really not needed!  Quite a tiresome and boring read!  Disappointed in author.....'

author: b'Betty Nelson'
title: b'the casual vacancy'
body: b'a great story of various characters and their secret lives.  the story of haves versus havenots in society.  the psychological thinking of the main characters was interesting.'

author: b'Susan'
title: b'Another home run!'
body: b'Rowling continues to deliver in a new genre. She paints a beautiful picture of every character.  Listening to this provided the feel of the real characters with the accent, tone  and slang that one misses when reading.  I found this book compelling and heartbreaking.'

author: b'Zach'
title: b'Not Intended for Children'
body: b'Recently, I have read this latest book by J. K. Rowling whose "Harry Potter" works were absorbed by everyone a world over. "A Casual Vacancy" is profoundly darker than the "Harry Potter" series and seriously not intended for children.'

author: b'Lauren Broskow'
title: b'Not her best work'
body: b'Was very disappointed, was like reading Peyton Place 50 years later.  Would not recommend this to Harry Potter lovers. Ugh.'

author: b'Philip Berns'
title: b'Good and sad'
body: b"Interesting, weird characters, studies in neurotic pettinesses, and a telling examination of the British Children's Protective Services. I think a sequel is implied, if not a series."

author: b'Freedom Fighter'
title: b'I tried...I really did.'
body: b"I was excited to read this book and had no expectations other than enjoying a different read from a talented writer.  Even though the review is two stars I cannot say the writing in itself is terrible.  It's just the way the story is laid out.  It skipped around too much and took way too much time to get to the point."

author: b'Jan Dean'
title: b'mandatory reading for behavioral scientists'
body: b'JK Rowling does a classical study in defining parental toxicity, its effect on teenage children and ruinous political policies beset with destructive self agendas.'

author: b'Mary Courtney'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy ebook version'
body: b'I really had to concentrate to get into The Casual Vacancy.  At times I felt there were too many characters.  The writing was OK but it read more like an outline for a script than a straight novel.  I am sure someone will make it into a film, but that was not what I was after.'

author: b'CMCwvu'
title: b'Amazing'
body: b'Such a good story, shows that everyone has problems and needs help in life no matter how young or old. JK Rowling is brilliant.'

author: b'veroman'
title: b'Dull and Disappointing'
body: b'Basically, Rowling must have been just trying too hard to put out a "grownup" book. If you take out the F-word, the tome would be 200 pages shorter. The characters are unlikable and the situation too mundane to be of any interest. Too bad.'

author: b'Linda Taylor'
title: b'Book Club Selection'
body: b"This book was excellent and I really didn't want to put it down.  We picked this for our book club choice and we will be having our next meeting soon.  J.K. Rowling is a wonderful author!"

author: b'JACKIE HUBBS'
title: b'The Casual Vacany'
body: b'I gave this as a Christmas gift and am distressed to learn that it has'

author: b'Manie M. Hinson'
title: b'Boring'
body: b"I wanted to read Casual Vacancy because I'm such a huge fan of Harry Potter. I've got to say I thought it was one of the most boring books I've read or  listened to in this case.  It had entirely too many characters in the book. Honestly, the entire town was in the book.  It was hard to keep the characters apart, especially since the author kept flipping back and forth with them. I was very disappointed.  She should have stuck with Harry Potter. I got it as a free audio book on Audible with a trial membership.  I would  have been ripped if I had actually paid for it."

author: b'Easy rider'
title: b'Surprisingly Good'
body: b'Not sure what I expected from Rowling but was pleasantly surprised to find it to be about the lives of normal people -- if there is such a thing.  I would read anything else she writes.'

author: b'BookChick'
title: b'Not a fan'
body: b'Confession: I would have bought a copy of this book regardless of what it was about or how it was reviewed.  I adored the Harry Potter series, and I was interested to see what Rowling would chose as the subject for her first "adult" book.'

author: b'Allison L Palmer'
title: b'Really slow moving book'
body: b"She introduces far too many characters... it's hard to keep track of who they are and their importance to the story.  i didn't get through the book.  I won't be trying to pick it up again either."

author: b'J'
title: b'Perfect Condition'
body: b'The book was in new condition and arrived on time. It was just as we expected it to be, and made a great Christmas gift. Thank you.'

author: b'Nancy Hundt'
title: b"Really can't get into it!"
body: b"I had never read any of Rowling's books. I saw in interview with her on TV and thought I would try this.  I just cannot get into it."

author: b'robert g sawyer, jr'
title: b'Five Stars'
body: b'What I expected.'

author: b'mom of Sondheim fan'
title: b'Enjoyable read'
body: b"This book is well written and the characters nicely drawn. It's very, very British and might not be for every American reader. A character-driven rather than plot-driven book, and with the mixed reviews I wasn't sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. Hope she keeps writing..."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A very different subject and style for Rowling'
body: b"This book is totally different from the H. Potter series.  She handles the social issues like bludgeons, and none of the characters are very likable. I started but don't think I'll finish it."

author: b'Lyn'
title: b'good book'
body: b'good book'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'rowlings book'
body: b'My daughter loved the book, it was a gift. She read through it quickly. She said it was a good read and nice change for Rowling'

author: b'Randia'
title: b'Lack of interest'
body: b'The writing is tideous and does not catch your interest! I downloaded it on my Kindle and was very disappointed.'

author: b'BLeary'
title: b'Interesting read, unexpected'
body: b'As an ardent fan of this author, I was eager to read this obvious divergence in her literary genre. I was pleased to enjoy her depth of character development and plot, stimulating and captivating in an odd and rather disturbing manner. Clearly this seemed the intention of the author, executed with mastery and literary skill. Her skill in character portrayal is obvious yet again, creating a likeable and identifiable character out of a very ordinary and even boring protagonist.'

author: b'rabid monk'
title: b'Purchased as a gift'
body: b'This book was purchased as an impulse gift for a co-worker who had expressed an interest in reading this new JK Rowling book. It arrived on time, in perfect dondition. I did not read it!'

author: b'CK'
title: b'Awful'
body: b"I tried to like this book, but it just didn't happen. I could barely get through it. And I am not comparing it to H. Potter. This book was awful. It was boring and sometimes confusing. I understand, not every book can be a mega-seller but this book should have been sent back to the writer before going to print. Save yourself some time and pass this one by. There are lots of great books out there."

author: b'Kindle Customer Arial Parker'
title: b'Happily surprised'
body: b'When I started reading this book, I felt like it was boring and had way too many characters of too diverse of lifestyles for the author to ever bring it together in a cohesive manner.  WRONG!'

author: b'Kelly Stack'
title: b'Fab!!!'
body: b"This book had a really slow start for me but it ended up being one of the best books I have ever read! I was so sad when it was over! Give it a chance you won't regret it"

author: b'Leona E Manor'
title: b'Miss Rowling is an amazing writer'
body: b"I haven't finished - the Holidays and work - but so far  it is very interesting.Some of the phrases used are so different than we are used to reading."

author: b'Scotty'
title: b'hmmm'
body: b"Very slow start, did like it a bit more toward the end and did sympathise with the characters, but I feel JK's lovely descriptive writing was just a but ott for somewhere like Pagford"

author: b'Cliente Amazon'
title: b'I can see a lot of Harry Potter in it'
body: b'I read a couple of the reviews here before I was given this book and I was curious about it. But the one thing thjt almost all those reviews said, either the ones that praised it or loathed it was that it was completely different from Harry Potter. And that was not at all what I felt reading it. I see in this book a lot of what I liked in harry Potter and also what I disliked in it.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Nobody to love'
body: b'JK sure is an ace storyteller, no doubt about that. Unfortunately, it was impossible to like any of these characters in a small English town; As we watch them jockey for position, lie, cheat and steal, there is much ugliness on hand. Though the pacing was such, and the plot so intriguing that I had to keep reading, it nonetheless gave me the creepy feeling of the guilty pleasure of reading sordid gossip. But at least I kept reading. Could not get far into Harry Potter at all.'

author: b'Ruth Canessa'
title: b'Good book'
body: b'Extremely well written.  Not much of a plot or story, but excellent character development and writing that compels the reader to continue and to look closely at human nature.'

author: b'Lea Booth'
title: b'Give it some time'
body: b"By the end of this book, I was hooked, but it takes a while to hit its stride. It's very, very sad, as well, but I thought it worth the read. DEFINITELY not in the Potter genre."

author: b'Cora Bennett'
title: b'books'
body: b'ordered two for daughters for christmas...great read. i just love the book and i know they will too. thank you'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Great read!'
body: b'It was a great story, very nicely woven together, and definitely for grown-ups. JK Rowling has quite a range as a writer. Highly recommended.'

author: b'Salvatore'
title: b'The Feel Bad Book of the Year!'
body: b"I was so excited to read Rowling's newest book. What a huge disappointment! Pagford is a town I would never want to visit and there is not one character there I would want to get to know better. Such a shame! What the heck happened to one of my favorite writers?"

author: b'Hilary Kavanagh'
title: b'disappointed!'
body: b'After reading all the Harry potter books I expected great things from this, the first of Rowlings adult books. This is dragged out and the characters are not the slightest bit endearing to the point that you just want to put the book down -which I did in the end.'

author: b'Mimis'
title: b'Great gift for an adult Harry Potter fan'
body: b"Made a great gift! Came in great condition; better that if I'd bought it at the bookstore! The person I bought it for really enjoyed it"

author: b'SAM'
title: b'Too Much Information'
body: b'JK Rowling was obviously trying to distance herself from Harry Potter.  She paints an overly rich picture of a lower-middle class town and the seamy details of the lives of her characters.  Unlike the Potter tales, which were hard to put down, this story was slow-going and unsatisfying.'

author: b'English Teacher'
title: b'What a disappointment!'
body: b"I am a voracious reader and an English teacher. I feel that I can set aside opinions about an author's previous works and judge a book on its own merit.  That is why I was so disappointed in THE CASUAL VACANCY.  I kept reading because I wanted to find the purpose of the book.  There is no one main character for the book to revolve around, except the dead guy with the highly metaphorical name, Barry Fairbrother.  All of the characters are minor characters and the wait is on for the story to come together for a single denoument. Instead...but I don't want to give anything else away.  I loved the Harry Potter series and I was ready for something more adult.  All of the skill, talent and organization from HP are missing here.  I find it ironic that she was so critical of E L James and her fluffily pornographic 50 Shades series.  While those books are not great literary masterpieces, at least you could follow the story and skip past the dull and repetitive sex passages and pick the story back up.  I admit, after awhile, I was skimming this book rather than reading it word for word. To read too closely was to fall asleep. This is definitely a book that got published, not on merit, but based on the author's name and previous success.  I am so glad I got it from the library and did not buy it."

author: b'Meagan Kelly Bufano'
title: b'A name is just a name sometimes'
body: b'I felt as if this book was hyped up because of who the author was and not based on the content.  I didn\'t actually enjoy reading it or get "into it" until I was about 50% of the way in.  If you have to struggle through half of the book before you even care what\'s going on, then there is a problem.  I don\'t think it lived up to the Rowling name!  The story lines were boring and the people we just not that interesting.  I didn\'t care about them at all.  Better luck next time...'

author: b"mac's back"
title: b'Casual Vacancy by J.K.Rowling'
body: b"It just didn't hold my interest. The book's premise was clever but I found it plodding, put it down and haven't finished it."

author: b'Zookeeper Susanne'
title: b'great'
body: b'i love it. thanks so much. wonderful. thanks. thanks. thanks. thanks. keep it coming. love it for sure. thanks. thanks'

author: b'Linda Davis'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Not as good as I thought it would be. Kind of a slow read. Somewhat hard to follow-- haven't finished it yet."

author: b'Sonja'
title: b'Poor Read'
body: b'We chose this book for a book club. Unfortunately, no one could get through the book. It was not written well and there were too many characters to keep up with. There was very little action and I found myself wondering when something good was going to happen.'

author: b'Booksmartie'
title: b'A pretty heavy read - for a young adult!'
body: b"I thought I'd make a big spectacle over the new Rowling book. I mean, I started reading it the day it came, even thought of pulling an all - nighter to make it more special or at least post this review with a bunch of special features. The reason I decided to treat this book like any other book was because it felt like any other book to me as I read it. A good novel for adults, I'm glad I read it and here's why:"

author: b'Yvie'
title: b'loved it...do not read if youre expecting harry potteresque writing.'
body: b"I thought the book was great. Kept me interested as a reader and as someone who has experienced much of what was written about I can honestly say she hit the nail on the head. She had me laughing and crying. If you're someone who doesn't really enjoy books about things of a real life human nature then this isn't for you. But I still recommend everyone read this. It'll make you think twice about judging people prematurely."

author: b'Joe'
title: b"It's Rowling."
body: b"It's Rowling's writing style, which is both a blessing and a curse.  You can tell that she wrote it, but her talents are not well suited to an adult style."

author: b'K. Faraday'
title: b'An Incredible Story... One You Will Never Forget'
body: b"When I heard that J.K. Rowling's first adult book would be the story of an election in a small town, I was, like many readers, puzzled. As someone who read each of the Harry Potter books with great expectations, I suppose I always expected her first book away from the wizarding world to at least be similar. I could not have been more wrong."

author: b'Emily H.'
title: b"It's so-so"
body: b"I think I finally found a book I didn't like, unfortunately. I was somewhat under the impression that JK Rowing's new book was going to be a mystery and it's really not. It's completely unlike anything I've read before, and there seems to be no reason for me to stick with it. I don't like to give a book a negative review. The woman can write, don't get me wrong. Casual Vacancy is just not my cup of tea."

author: b'I. Gribble-Neal'
title: b'Wonderful author.'
body: b"J.K. Rowling develops complex characters to fit her complex plot. At first I thought, I'll never keep track of all these characters, but as Rowling slowly weaves them closer together, each character becomes clearer. They become more and more real and rounded. These are no romantic characters she has created; she allows them all the foibles of genuine people. With that comes genuine life. Anyone raised in a small community, either in England or the US, will recognize many of the people who inhabit these pages. The Casual Vacancy contains surprises that the reader is not expecting, even when foreshadowed. I haven't finished it yet, but it becomes more difficult to put down the further into it I become."

author: b'Charlotte Waters'
title: b'Rowling Writes For Adults'
body: b"J.K. Rowling has left Harry Potter behind with this interesting adult novel.  Great characterizations and  plotting.  Didn't know there could be such intrigue in a small English town."

author: b'L.A. Rikand'
title: b'Interesting Moralistic Character Novel, Absent of Plot'
body: b"Liked it, didn't love it. Wickedly difficult to get through--way too many characters too soon, POV changed often and abruptly, and no plot to speak of, really. This book took months to read instead of the hours or days that I can finish epic fantasies or classic novels."

author: b'AttyCW'
title: b'Yuck!'
body: b'If you are looking for a dismal and depressing view of humanity, this is your book. I was a pre-teen/young adult when the Harry Potter books came out and had high expectations.  I was very disapppointed.'

author: b'V. James Lamphear'
title: b'Quality vs quantity'
body: b'I love detail and interesting characters  I love tightly woven plots and the Quixotic tuns of events. I love fine writing'

author: b'Carol'
title: b'Casual Vacancy on Christmas List'
body: b"I purchased this for my daughter for Christmas. I can only tell you that she was eager to read it and happy to receive it. She has begun Rowling's book. I trust she will enjoy it."

author: b'Megbee'
title: b'This is not for Harry Potter fans'
body: b"While I'm sure Rowling would be the first to say so, this isn't the next book for Potter fans to enjoy, child or adult. I so looked forward to reading this, but I had to put it aside. Rowling's writing was just as brilliant as it's always been, and I was quickly drawn into the story. What stopped me short was the incessant profanities. This won't bother some people, and most of time I can look past a few, but by page 15 there were innumerable F-bombs, and a C-word. Ok, we get it J.K., you're not writing for kids anymore. But is it necessary to be so foul-mouthed? Too much for me, and I just wanted to warn other people that might be buying this book for their little Potter fans, who are now a little older...they'll be picking up some new (unwanted) vocabulary if they read this book. Otherwise, I'm sure it's fantastic."

author: b'Mary Anne Richards'
title: b'She needs to stick to Harry Potter'
body: b"Barely made it through.  Uninteresting characters and story line. There's nothing about this to recommend in my opinion. Can't even give it away as it's on my Kindle."

author: b'Daniel J. Harp'
title: b'Kindle Book'
body: b'The book is not as interesting as her previous books. I will try again reading this book but so far it is not the same as her other books.'

author: b'Eden Richardson'
title: b'Interesting'
body: b'I think thats the best I could come up with. I liked the book and it was well written. Apparently this is to become a movie of sorts which i am looking forward to. The characters were very well thought out and so was the story line, to be expected of Rowling.'

author: b'JAK'
title: b'Great gift.'
body: b'This book was a gift. Never has a gift, gifted so well before. I am the king of gift giving thanks to this gift that gifts so well.'

author: b'E. Alexander'
title: b'awesome'
body: b"I'm still crying, I've grown attached to all the characters. I'm truly impressed with Rowling's newest and most stunning piece."

author: b'Annaleah Atkinson'
title: b'Engaging writing; pathetic characters'
body: b"Rowling has a wonderful style with pen, but the subjects of this book were depressing, self-centered and pitiable. Subject matter matters. I wouldn't buy a painting of a trash pile, even if a master painted it."

author: b'Michael Scott'
title: b'Painful'
body: b'I tried my best to put Harry Potter out of mind when reading Casual Vacancy, trying to let it stand on its own without any baggage or expectations; yet the book is powerfully influenced by the Harry Potter legacy, in that Rowling -- now writing a novel purely for the adult audience -- is able to do all the things a decade of writing "all ages" novels precluded her from doing.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Excellent read'
body: b'Very poignant account of how lives of different backgrounds intertwine and affect for good, bad, and produce the minutia we call existence.'

author: b'Rilynne'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I was very disappointed.  The town and people are no different than many other books written.  Everything about this story was old news and boring.'

author: b'Ambacat'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"This book was very negative, not a lot of good stuff going on.  It was quite tedious to read but I kept going because I thought it would get better but I was sadly disappointed.  Don't think I will be reading any more books by JK Rowling.  I think she should stick to writing children's books, they were much more fun."

author: b'A reader from California'
title: b'Mixed'
body: b'This review will be short, as many others have said the same thing in longer posts.'

author: b'Jeana'
title: b'Not that interesting'
body: b'Tried to get into this book...not too interesting...will have to keep trying...the first chapter is not even caught my interest'

author: b'Speed Reader'
title: b'Glad I persevered'
body: b"I found the book hard going at first but I'm glad I kept going because it all came together in the end. I've seen reviews where people say the characters are horrible but I disagree because the more you learn about them, the more you understand why they are like they are. The book did make me think about how we judge people because you do form certain opinions about the characters in the beginning and then you change your mind as you get to understand more about their background. I didn't expect a fairytale ending because that's not real life - and I think that's what makes the book really thought provoking. It will make a brilliant BBC series."

author: b'Kelli Lorraine'
title: b'Brilliant!'
body: b'I absolutely love the detail that Rowling puts into each character. Her writing style is absolutely perfect! A must read for all adults.'

author: b'Mel'
title: b'Harry Potter meets Mr. Sad Reailty'
body: b"Rowling's dark and mysterious way taken us through many adventures and while I appreciate she is now advertising that she is writing for adults starting off a book on hum drum death is just depressing. The whole time I am thinking why did this man who dies in the beginning of this book have such a crap life? Isn't reading supposed to help you escape from the crap reality that surrounds you? It is thorough and well written just depressing."

author: b'B. Harrison'
title: b'Not my preferred type of reading...'
body: b'I have never read any of the Harry Potter books though I believe they must be very, very good, and I am in favor of anything that interests children in reading.  But when someone told me a bit about the premise of "Casual Vacancy" I ordered it for my Kindle application.  I would hope that my not liking the book would not stop anyone else from reading it, though, since my less than stellar opinion is based purely on my own tastes in reading, and I know that the author is very well received and is a genuine talent.'

author: b'Gail E. Ackerman'
title: b'I am not impressed so far - have only read the first 5 chapters'
body: b"I don't know what I expected after reading all the Harry Potter books but this one is a bit too busy with characters and I am not impressed."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A very depressing story line'
body: b'(spoiler alert) I had to give this at least two stars, because J.K Rowling is an excellent writer and though the story line is terribly depressing, the quality of her writing itself is certainly good.  It is just the story line she created that I could not enjoy.  The main character of the book dies in the first few pages, and then you have to learn about his character through the eyes of everybody else.  None, absolutely none of her characters are likeable.  There is nobody you can get behind and pull for; and then the one character that you end starting to hope that good things will happen for; commits suicide.  I could not even finish reading it and after I closed the book I put it in the trash.'

author: b'P. Martin'
title: b'Simple and profound'
body: b'No more wizards and owls nor spells and wands. No real line between good and evil, right and wrong.  This wonderful book deals with the messiest subject matter of all; people and relationships.  And it is brilliant!'

author: b'OzPhan'
title: b'Fabulous character development but depressing plot & tedious storyline.'
body: b'Although it was not a "great" read, I felt so interested in the plot and the characters\' lives that I definitely HAD to finish the book. Ms. Rowling masterfully created three-dimensional characters in this book - unfortunately, a few too many. I was also impressed with the extremely-involved and intricate plot - and part of wanting to finish the book was just plain curiosity at how she tied off all of the loose ends, which she artfully managed to accomplish. It is not a happy read, although it is amusing at times. It seemed like most, if not all, of the characters frequently had downright demoralizing and demeaning interactions with each other -- and eventually this became so tiresome that I could not wait for the book to be finished. It did not make for "uplifting" reading, but I was glad to experience another facet of this amazing author\'s talent.'

author: b'Nancy Drew'
title: b'Life in Merry Olde England'
body: b'JK Rowling surprises by focusing on small town life & all the many human foibles inherent in a town divided by class "warfare."  Not easy adjusting to English idioms & speech patterns, but the author apparently has the inside track on the welfare society she had experienced on a personal level in her own life.  No matter, we can still see our own families & social circle in the various characters she explores with much insight.  A definite must read.'

author: b'Kasey Dorris'
title: b'Rather depressing.'
body: b"I love JK Rowling. Harry Potter is by far my favorite series I've ever read. I was excited to read this. But I haven't finished it and don't know if I will. It has too many characters and is pretty depressing."

author: b'cindy s'
title: b'Too graphic'
body: b"I was very disappointed in the book. The details were shocking descriptions that were unnecessary and added nothing to the development of character or story line. I expected the authors gift of storytelling to at least have some existence. I understand that people can live in hard times but still have character.  The details were too graphic not to mention the foul words that were way too frequent. I have only read her first Harry Potter book and knew her capability to write was a definite gift unseen in many years, (i chose not to read the other books because of the topic) but have been very happy with her success at story-telling. Just don't waste your valuable time or money on this book."

author: b'Foxy101'
title: b'Awful'
body: b"J K Rawling should stay with Harry Potter stories. This book was an awful disappointment.  Shallow plot.  Very difficult to read and follow.  I guess if you are a Brit you might enjoy.  But any other, just a big struggle.  Don't spend the money or waist your time."

author: b'Jane in NYC'
title: b'Try to Forget Who Wrote It'
body: b"I loved this book. I'm now reading it for the second time. When I read it the first time, I was looking for similarities to her other books but half way through the book I realized just how amazing it was on it's own. It's definitely an adult book and is NOT a feel good story but the reader slowly begins to care about the flawed characters. I was disappointed when I reached the ending because I wanted to hear more about them. I'm now reading the book again slowly and just enjoying the language, scenery and characters. Read it! ...Just pretend that some other author wrote it."

author: b'Avid Reader'
title: b'Reality Show'
body: b"I was excited to find this audio book to listen to while driving across four states and back.  I was disappointed.  Maybe it's worse when listening than when reading, but the constant gratuitous spewing of four-letter words was an assault on the ears.  So far it's been a pointless meandering book about mean, unhappy, ugly people with few to no redeeming qualities.  JK Rowling is good at putting words together, but a story, especially one this long, has to go somewhere.  I wouldn't want to know anyone in this book.  The author sounds angry, but doesn't use her anger constructively.  I could watch a reality show to see people behaving badly.  I gave up less than half-way through."

author: b'Julie Henry'
title: b'the casual vacancy'
body: b'this book took 6 weeks to read  it was so boring.  meaningless and pointless.  i just hate leaving things undone so i had to finish.  not a lot of character development.  kept waiting for something to happen which did not until the very end.  please skip it and get 6 weeks of your life back'

author: b'Brandon Dillinger'
title: b'Awesome'
body: b'Great book, very intense and deep. Would definitely like to see this book also be made into a movie. Intense.'

author: b'T. DeBrock'
title: b'Casually Entertaining'
body: b"I'll start by saying that I have not read any of J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter books, so I was not biased by her themes or writing style from the immensely popular series. I kept seeing Casual Vacancy at the bookstore and had read and heard good reviews of the novel so I gave it a whirl. The book starts out with the death of a council member, Barry Fairbrother, from a small town called Pagford in England. His death affects the entire town where he lives in both positive and negative ways. It's hard to keep all of the townspeople straight in your mind for the first few chapters, but once you delve further into the book it's fascinating to see the chain reaction Barry's death has as it impacts more and more people's lives. Harry Potter fans be warned that there are some VERY adult themes in this book, it's NOT a children's/teen's book by any stretch of the imagination and it quite morbid at times. That being said, I enjoyed reading Casual Vacancy because all of the characters were so well formed that you felt you had a real understanding of who they are and could sympathize with the struggles they go through (even if they are totally foreign to the struggles you have in your own daily life). I would recommend this book and will definitely read Ms. Rowling's next adult novel."

author: b'Book Smart'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"First of all it would be hard to change genres after the success of Harry Potter. I wasn't sure what to expect after such a successful series of books that were so well-written and clean since they were aimed at a younger audience. Also I did not finish the book, I stopped after part I. Good things - some wonderful phrasing and descriptive passages; really insightful renderings of human nature. JK Rowling is so very talented and the Harry Potter books made so many youngsters into readers. It's always fun as an American to read from the British point of view, I am fascinated by the subtle cultural differences and words for things. Things that made me bail before the book was over, (which is extremely unusual for me) - all the way through part 1 I had hardly met a character who wasn't manipulative, selfish, predatory, promiscuous or abusive, to include the children. Although these characteristics are typical of the human race, you don't read a book to roll around in it, it just got to be overwhelming. There needs to be at least one character who is likable and decent enough so that the reader doesn't feel creepy stepping into their persona. Maybe the person who passed away filled this role and I didn't stick around for it, but after the last scene in part 1 I didn't have the stomach to continue. Also I agree with some of the other reviews that the characters were hard to keep straight, I had to review a couple times to figure out who was married or related to who. There were a lot of people introduced very quickly."

author: b'Love to read'
title: b'Very Disappointed!'
body: b'The writing was not what I expected. The characters were confusing and I had a hard time keeping focused on the book.'

author: b'Victor L. Jordan'
title: b'More than that.......'
body: b"First, let me be clear. There is no challenge from this viewer of Rowling's writing skills and talent. They certainly speak for themselves to the tune of a billion euros plus, but.........."

author: b'Silvia'
title: b'The boring vacancy'
body: b"Well to sum it up, this book is extremely boring... It is well written, I'm not even going to question the characters are very well described but still the story is not able to be a page turner... it is good if you have insomnia... for sure your sleep will come right back..."

author: b'Eugenia'
title: b'Great book, amazing writer'
body: b'After some months have gone by and the buzz has died down, I still dont understand why everyone hasnt loved this book. Rowling dazzles with a plain story turning it into a book you cant put down. She has clearly passed the test.'

author: b'mhduncan'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy by JK Rowling'
body: b"Surprising good adult novel by JK Rowling. I think the bad press, is a personal grudge against her, at not giving ' ad nauseum, numerous interviews to promote her book' by the press."

author: b'Lindajane Thomson'
title: b"I'm recommending this book as a good read"
body: b'An excellent story line. Well written with good use of English language. Hope J k continues to write more adult books.'

author: b'Whitney Izzy'
title: b'would recommend!'
body: b'great character development and unexpected twists later in book. a bit surprisingly sexual for rowling. small town drama will keep you turning pages.refreshingly different read with an ending that makes you think.'

author: b'astrid l sinclair'
title: b'modern dickens'
body: b'getting into the many characters took some effort.  once there i was wholly involved in a really good read.  rowling adhered to the commitment she made the reader at the beginning, and even as complicated as the story became she neatly resolved all of the issues satisfactorily by the end.'

author: b'Marcia Abelson'
title: b'YUCK'
body: b'Boring, not esay to read and a big failure after Harry Potter.  Stick to what you can make interesting J.K>'

author: b'Susan'
title: b'great reading'
body: b"I thought it was the perfect British novel, and hope she writes many more.  It's great that she is writing for adult fans."

author: b'Greenman'
title: b'What a rollercoaster'
body: b"OK Harry Potter.  There that's all you are going to hear about that in this review."

author: b'Lobuche East'
title: b'details'
body: b"This book is all about character details. You will know every tiny detail of what each character thinks and feels. I enjoyed it for sure but I didn't love it and race home to read another chapter after work. At times I wondered if anyone in this town could be happy for five minutes and a little variety with all the nasty character traits would have been a nice mix to throw in. Overall, I would definitely recommend it."

author: b'sharon'
title: b'not good'
body: b'i found this book very long winded maybe JK should stick to childrens books, as Harry Potter was a great read'

author: b'Shonita Joshi'
title: b'A journey into the human complexity'
body: b"One cannot stop being marveled at JK Rowling's literary brilliance, and for good measure. Words flow in the book so eloquently and naturally that you're left astounded that they could be mixed up in such a brilliant manner."

author: b'H. Mayson'
title: b'Rowling was trying to write for an adult audience and failed'
body: b"So I made it to about the half way point in this poor excuse for a book before I decided that I had had enough. There were far too many characters to keep track of in a short period of time that it made it impossible to connect with any of the characters, even a little. And maybe because I don't hang out with people who swear that often, I found the swearing, especially the repeated use of the f-bomb, to be offensive."

author: b'K. Schell'
title: b'I really did like this book'
body: b"The first 1/3 is drudgery I must admit, but once you get (and remember) who the main characters are, it really takes off. It's not really an adventure book, it's more of a thought-provoking book about living in a small town and how those people affect the others, in ways never seen. I look forward to her next adult book."

author: b'Larry Barnard'
title: b'Ms. Rowling may do well to target a younger audience.'
body: b'Started out okay and then seemed to bog down in lengthy descriptions. This story could have been told in fewer pages. I will, however, try her again.'

author: b'possum'
title: b'Not read it yet'
body: b'In would love to give a review but unfortunately I have not been able to download the book onto my Kindle and very disappointed'

author: b'Julie-ann Swords'
title: b'First adult book'
body: b'Found this book a little hard to get into to start with but once I did it was a great read.  Look forward to further books by this author'

author: b'ginnyinct'
title: b'DISAPPOINTED'
body: b"Boring, too many names and characters, keep putting it down, can't get into it. Read 200 pages and i'm only 46% done. Want to finish it but can't get into it."

author: b'collector 6'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Casual vacancy sounds like a great book.  I haven't read it yet.  I am taking it with me on my vacation."

author: b'borneveryminute'
title: b'Superbly observed characters, thought provoking story'
body: b'Brilliantly penned account of small town life and politics. The teenage children of the main protagonists steal the show with their own interactional politics with their parents and fellows.'

author: b'Red Rock Bookworm'
title: b'WWIII HAS COME TO PAGFORD'
body: b"THE CASUAL VACANCY will undoubtedly be compared to J. K. Rowling's Harry Potter books but be advised that except for the underlying grimness in both books, VACANCY is a different from Potter as night from day and this novel is definitely not for children or teens."

author: b'drosen9'
title: b'Boring & Confusing'
body: b"10's of characters, their spouses and children.  Not much of a story.  Just a lot of characters without depth or explanation of their backgrounds.  Seems to be set in white, lower class UK suburb.  A lot of foul language and uneducated conversations between adults and teenagers.  I stayed with it and found it extremely uneventful and downright boring.  Never read the H. Potter series, but was intrigued by the fact it was on the best sellers list.  Good luck find your way through to the end."

author: b'Sarah Broad'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'For the fist time every, gave up reading this book. Only read a third but there seemed to be no real plot'

author: b'MJP'
title: b'I do not like it at all - I bought it because it was at the top of chart on "Good Reads" list - what a mistake'
body: b'This book reads like an absolute chaos...so many characters and it is hard to make connections between them.....I read 16% of the book and know only that the guy dropped dead and different people have different feelings about his death and different expectations from his death...so what?'

author: b'Jeannette S More'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy.  I would have enjoyed it much more without the profanity!  The story was a bit weak and long and it just didn't hold my interest."

author: b'Mary Verdick'
title: b'Not what it seems'
body: b"On the surface the small town of Pagford seems to be the quintessential English village with its charming market square, cobbled streets, and centuries-old abbey. But when council member Barry Fairbrother, well-liked and respected, dies of a stroke in his early forties, the town is left in shock. It's also left with a plethora of candidates ready to fill his vacant seat, and that's when the fun, or the trouble, begins. Because the inhabitants of this little town, so warm and friendly to all appearances, have deep-seated resentments and agendas--rich hate poor, teenagers defy their parents, husbands and wives disagree violently, and teachers despair of ever teaching their students anything! This ia a black comedy, well-written and amusing, and if you admire J. K. Rowling of Harry Potter fame, you'll probably like this book, her first adult novel. But there are ao many plot lines and such an abundance of characters this reader, for one, had trouble keeping it all straight."

author: b'Monica'
title: b'After a few pages, just deleted. Awful read.'
body: b'Expected a lot more from J.K. Rowling. Could not get into this book, very slow paced, and just plain boring.'

author: b'luvbooks'
title: b'Not a Harry Potter Fan'
body: b'I am not a Harry Potter Fan, but was excited to read something else by this authuor.  It was really a great book, I knew she had to be a good writer, with her  fan base from the Potter books.  Liked her writing style.  Enjoyed the book.'

author: b'Sonja Krohn'
title: b"J K Rowling is not just a children's author any more!"
body: b'It was a brilliant read.  Rowling has such insight into human behaviour.  Really believable characters.  She managed to bring a town to life.'

author: b'joseph mlaker'
title: b'Coarse Language not needed'
body: b"Disappointed with the language.  Rowling has already shown she can write without profanity in the Harry Potter books but for some reason has chosen to believe that an adult book must have juvenile coarse language.  Didn't get past the first chapter before putting the book down for good.  Too many expletives."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'not what I expected'
body: b'I could not get all the way thru it. Too boring. Moved on to another e-book. The life of Abraham Lincoln.'

author: b"Puddin'"
title: b'Dark and Twisty'
body: b"I really enjoyed this book. I felt that it showed a completely different side of this multi-faceted writer. I normally wouldn't choose a novel that is marketed the way this one was; I tend to lean toward more cheerful fare. However, since I am a huge HP fan, I was quite curious to see where Ms Rowling would go with this new book."

author: b'Sree'
title: b'Liked not loved'
body: b'Really love the detail but the story takes forever to pick up. It is super depressing,too. Still a good read with an important message'

author: b'charlie'
title: b'A good read'
body: b"I really enjoyed the book I haven't red any of her other books and din't know what to expect. Pleasantly surprised!!!! Lots of twists . very enjoyable."

author: b'Avid Reader'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I respect the authors efforts in exploring a new venue but she may have tried to do too much here.  There are a lot of themes, a lot of characters, and a lot of different social issues.'

author: b'Christine Campbell'
title: b'Gutter language was depressing'
body: b"If JK Rowling was intending to shock with this book she definitely reached her mark.  The language was vulgar and unnecessary.  I lived in the UK in the 1960s and the book had a very retro feel to it; it felt vaguely familiar yet it was supposed to be set in current times.  It was as though the author was trying to drag images from her past and make them current.  The UK I see now does not resemble her descriptions.  A total waste of money and time.  Unfortunately I was reading it as part of a book club study or I'd have given up earlier on it."

author: b'Susie'
title: b'A book that makes you think long after you finish it'
body: b'This was a good book and kept my interest.  I had trouble keeping the characters straight for about half of it. It is a powerful book and makes you think about our society.'

author: b'Stephanie R Hunt'
title: b'To many directions'
body: b'The book was really more confusing then anything. To many people were introduced at the beginning and the story line seemed to jump around too much. I could not follow the story to make it enjoyable to read. I would consider reading other books written by this author, however I am hoping that they are easier to follow. This story I believe could have been enjoyable if it was more clearly written.'

author: b'Elle'
title: b'Well. That was Intense.'
body: b'Being that Harry Potter was the definition of my childhood and I still carry it with me to this day, of course I quick to jump on "The Casual Vacancy". Not entirely what I expected from Miss Rowling. Not only did I love the story, but it showed me that J.K. can write just as easily for adults as she can for children. Though I think this only narrowly missed the margin of most f-bombs dropped ever, I still thoroughly enjoyed it. I would recommend this to anyone that won\'t get confused with multiple plot lines.'

author: b'PCowden'
title: b'Not too fond of people'
body: b'What a disappointment that the writer of Harry Potter should write a book in which she dislikes every single person in the book except the girl who is prostituting herself and making decisions for the most noble reasons, but every one a disastrous decision.'

author: b'Val B'
title: b'Heartbreaking, raw, and incredibly well written'
body: b'When J.K. Rowling first announced that she was writing a new book for adults, I vowed that I would read anything she wrote, no matter what it was about.  I knew it would be hard to keep my expectations in check-- I love the Harry Potter books-- but I also knew Rowling to be a truly great storyteller and I was excited to see what new direction she might take.'

author: b"Scott's Two Cents"
title: b'Fun Read'
body: b'Ending seemed a bit rushed, but a fun read. I apparently need to add 11 more words here they are.'

author: b'Myna Harris'
title: b'Disappointing for Potter fans'
body: b'Had very high expectations for this novel but found it to be disappointing and depressing...don\'t bother if you are expecting "grown up" Harry Potter story.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
