body: b'This was a pleasant surprise. Not having read Potter, I tried not to have any preconceptions. Even without the baggage, I had expectations however vague. I found myself thinking over and over."this isn\'t what I expected" even though I wasn\'t quite sure what that was.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'what??'
body: b"too many characters are introduced with each chapter.  I couldn't even finish the book, which is very rare for me!  I expected the author to be able to utilize a great editor, perhaps she didn't listen."

author: b'E. Pichon'
title: b'Too slow'
body: b'Too slow to get started. Could not finish it. Maybe it picks up, but I gave up. I could not connect with it. I tried it because I loved Harry potter.'

author: b'Eleanor Duelley'
title: b"I couldn't even finish it."
body: b"i couldn't even finish it. it was boring and seemed to drag on. I was hoping it would be as interesting as harry potter, but i was wrong."

author: b'Shazza M'
title: b'Great reading'
body: b'This was an excellent read with good humour some twists and turns that made you want to keep reading. Was certainly worth reading.'

author: b'Susan Wolfe'
title: b'Brilliant book.'
body: b'Certainly not for the faint hearted. I bought the book for two reasons - firstly because of it being Rowling\'s first novel since the Harry Potter series, and secondly because I\'m an English woman living in America and wanted something to "take me home" just for a little while. And that it certainly did. It\'s raw, bleak, desperate - just like my old home area of Liverpool. Her characters are alive, and I absolutely LOVED how she could write different sections of the book from different characters\' personal viewpoints with such vivid insight into how they felt. I\'ve read several books where this was a prominent feature, but "The Casual Vacancy" is by far the best for that split-personality aspect.'

author: b'Ingrid Corbett'
title: b'Not so casual reading'
body: b"It took me a long time - most of the book - to get into it. My fault - I was expecting a fantasy genre. This is more real and closer to the bone. How people's greed/arrogance/self-absorption can lead to so many disasters."

author: b'Carole Duvall'
title: b'Gutter language does not make good adult novels.'
body: b"At first I thought the story was interesting.  I did not need the sexual escapades of juviniles or the extreme use of words that I find offensive.  I refer to the use of a derogatory word used to describe females, whether they are adult or teenagers.  I read halof of it and deleted ilt from my collection.  I will not bother reading anymore of J>K> Rowling's work.  Low class adjectives are the work of a lazy mind."

author: b'Ash1ey81'
title: b'meh.'
body: b'I have had a hard time getting through this book which surprised me so much seeing as I loved her writing style in Harry Potter.'

author: b'Vegada'
title: b'Fair'
body: b"This book is ok, although I lost interest in it after the 3rd chapter! I am sure the book probably improved as the story continued, but, it just didn't hold my interest!"

author: b'JH'
title: b'Awful'
body: b"I am a huge Harry Potter fan, and loved the way the author developed characters and story lines in that series.  This book fails to come anywhere close.  I'm glad I got my copy from the library."

author: b'Wanderer'
title: b'Boaring'
body: b"It's a slice of life not to my taste.  Obviously she is a talented writer however I kept waiting for an interesting story line, I never found it to the end.  Sorry."

author: b'Robert F Lawson'
title: b'J.K. Rowling, Casual Vacancy.'
body: b"J.K. Rowling. Casual Vacancy.  Basically, I think she should stay with Harry Potter.  It catches one's interest, and has some redeeming social message in conveying what everyday British society has become -- the scum left of our heritage.  I read it all, but was unsure to whom I would recommend it."

author: b'Phyllis Feinberg'
title: b'Not crazy about J.K.Rowlings new book'
body: b'I thought I would enjoy reading "Casual Vacancy" because I enjoyed Rowlings Harry Potter books, but I find it very detailed to the point of annoying.  I am enjoying the insight in a small town in England since England is one of my favorite places to visit.'

author: b'igbarriga'
title: b'The Casual Must Have Book for Rowling Fans'
body: b'Die hard J.K Rowling fans (myself included) should get their hands on it as soon as possible.'

author: b'stewyann'
title: b'A Very Good Read'
body: b'J. K. Rowling proves that she is up to the task of writing an enthralling novel that appeals to an adult audience. Very well written - the story takes you into the lives of a small community in the UK and explores very forcefully some of the issues at play in that country today.'

author: b'Israel Drazin'
title: b'A weak and uninteresting plot with characters who are difficult to identify with'
body: b"Although no longer a youngster, I read two or three of J. K. Rowling's Harry Potter books and enjoyed them. I felt that the stories moved along quickly, and had good plots, suspense, and likable characters. I also thought they were clever. With all the hype about this book which she wrote for adults, I thought I was in for a treat. I was disappointed."

author: b'Latrice Phillips Brown'
title: b'Nice read'
body: b'I enjoyed this book and I liked that it switched point of view often. I liked the social consciousness that was woven into the book and how there\'s an underlying "brother\'s keeper" theme.'

author: b'W  HIESLMAIR'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I do not like to wallow  in greed, abuse and poverty. Dissappointing. Well written, but depressing.'

author: b'CAROLYN WRIGHT'
title: b'CASUAL VACANCY'
body: b'CASUAL VACANCY:  I returned this item. I did not like it. I found it boring and the readership too developed. he  languarge ws too specific and too hard.'

author: b'JGBJ'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'An eye-opening look at issues of race, class, social services and dysfunctional relationships in the UK. I found it thoroughly enjoyable if at times uncomfortable.'

author: b'John Adams'
title: b'Great book'
body: b'It starts out slow and I wonder in what direction it will go.'

author: b'Pat_the_dino_and_run'
title: b'This is not HP, this is not HP, this is not HP'
body: b"This is not HP and thank God for it.  I love HP and have read all the books twice, but after hearing some interview with JK you get the feeling that this is the book that means the most to her.  This is her view of the world lost but with hope if we can all not only see but also promote the good in others.  Causal Vacancy depicts the gritty underbelly of a town that is seemingly ideal, and how local politics are made from petty emotions rather then logic.  Great book that is 'magical' in a very different way from HP."

author: b'Sandra Jones'
title: b'A lot going on!'
body: b'Well written, but confusing going back and forth between the characters in the book. Realistic, well-written, but took me a long time to get through. Not an easy read.'

author: b'ScarpyJax'
title: b'Great Follow-Up'
body: b"Being an avid Harry Potter fan, I was hesitant to read this book, knowing it wasn't another HP novel. But it was a wonderful book with a pertinent message for today's readers. As if there was any doubt, J.K. Rowling can definitely do more than children's books."

author: b'georgia'
title: b'Hard Identification'
body: b"I am having a hard time with this book.  I keep trying but I don't get it.  The jacket mentions that there is pre-history with this story, maybe it should be a pre-requisite."

author: b'Peter Suszanski'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'A very raw story that portays the social and political structure and lives of British suburbs. No happy ending. The characters were all unhappy and lacking love in their lives.'

author: b'Susan Sorlie'
title: b'Waste of time...'
body: b'I am sorry because I am a big fan of J.K. Rowling and her imagination and writing in the Harry Potter series, but this book was such drivel.'

author: b'Christine'
title: b'Well written but overlong'
body: b'JK Rowling just writes well. All the characters are distinct and so well described you can visualize them.'

author: b'Sean Grimes'
title: b'Cheerless'
body: b'Well written but bleak and cheerless. No character seems to have any positive character traits. This applies to adults and children alike.'

author: b'DJ'
title: b'Not what I was hoping for.'
body: b'I suppose After the Potter series I expected more. I just can not get into this book.'

author: b'Robert A. Rutan'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I bought this book thinking that J.K. Rowling did such a wonderful and captivating series as Harry Potter, this book would be a wonderful read..How wrong I was.'

author: b'Sunshine1'
title: b'Great book'
body: b'As always JK is a great writer. It was a very fast download. I have read it several time now.'

author: b'Littleprobie'
title: b'Perfect'
body: b"I've been waiting for a book to sweep me off my feet and consume me for months and I honestly didn't think this would be the one to do it. I understand there have been mixed reviews about Rowling's first offering to adults and thought it may take a while for her to get into a rhythm but I was wrong."

author: b'tanya jones'
title: b'HOOKED FROM THE FIRST PAGE!'
body: b"From the opening sentence to the final word, _The Casual Vacancy_, had my full attention.  If there was any doubt about JKR's skill as a writer before picking up this book, it's been dispelled and is one of the best reads I've come across in a while.  From intricately developed characters to an expertly woven storyline there's no want of content to hold the reader's attention.  I only hope I don't have to wait very long for her next book."

author: b'Kathy T'
title: b"Didn't really enjoy The Casual Vacancy"
body: b"Every character in this book is miserable. I didn't really like or relate to anyone. The storyline about the council seat and the issue dividing either side is boring. I kept hoping it would get better. Even after the pivotal scene happens, it really went nowhere. It continued on its depressing way telling the story of these miserable people leading their miserable lives. I would not recommend it and have actually discouraged someone I know from bothering to read it. Sorry JK - I  looked forward to reading it and wanted to like it but I ended up really NOT liking it at all."

author: b'Nettie F.'
title: b'Fast shipping'
body: b'bought this book after watching the JK Rowling based on reality movie. Have not read it because it seems so far off from magic and Harry Potter. Wish it was based on a distant aunt of Harry Potter having tea with her friends. Dony=t quite see how this is a book with the same passion as Harry Potter. Not super interesting even from the cover but maybe I was expecting magic?'

author: b'book junkie'
title: b'depressing'
body: b'There were no likeable characters in this book.  I felt like Ms Rowling was trying a little too hard to prove she could write "serious" adult literature.  It was seriously depressing, and unentertaining as well. I would have moved away from this dreadful little town.'

author: b'J. P. Urban'
title: b'J.K. Rowling'
body: b'Purchased this book as a gift for my daughter - in - law and I am waiting for my chance to read this book. I was very interested in the last series from this author and this book is a little different than that series.'

author: b'Sonnenblume'
title: b'Depressing'
body: b'While J.K Rowlings writing style is as fascinating as always, the whole story was utterly depressing. Lots of people responsible for their own misery. I was glad when I finished it and am even more glad to trade it away now.'

author: b'Michael'
title: b'A generally boring book.'
body: b'A small view of the lives of some very pitiful people.  Generally a boring book.  I do not recommend this read.'

author: b'Cj'
title: b"Not terrible, but didn't feel the need to finish it"
body: b"Had me hooked for a little while, then it got bogged down with so many characters and their sad lives that I didn't feel the need to finish it. I probably will someday, but I'm not in a rush."

author: b'gina goss'
title: b"Hope it's good"
body: b"Haven't had a chance to read this yet, but I'm really looking forward to it. Keeping my fingers crossed. Yay!"

author: b'Purple Bear'
title: b'J.K.Rowlings book for grownups.'
body: b'A slow burner to begin with but well worth perservering with. The ending is captivating, you wont be able to put oit down'

author: b'LC San Diego'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I got Casual Vacancy from the Library today.  Thankful I did not buy it.  It goes back to the Library tomorrow.  It is boring, lifeless, depressing without any let up or purpose; no powerful characters;  nothing to like or relate to.'

author: b'nan333'
title: b'This auther is fantastic!'
body: b'JKRowling has a wonderful way with the English language and I really'

author: b'acudoc67'
title: b'Ok read'
body: b'Three quarters of the book was just ok. It did get more interesting and intense at the end. I would recommend it. Although, I think it would be better as a movie.'

author: b'Buzz'
title: b'Good characters.'
body: b"It's not Harry Potter!  This is a grown-ups story!  Interesting story with good characters.  Worth reading and worth writing! Write more"

author: b'FX-Tabscob'
title: b'As expected, great service by amazon'
body: b'I am still reading the book and it is an exciting writing so far. I have no doubt that it is a great book'

author: b'S. P. Lee'
title: b'This is a good book'
body: b'This book is what it is....a book by an author who had something specific to say about a subject. And she said it clearly, and often painfully.'

author: b'Gayle'
title: b'Quick delivery.  Excellent condition.'
body: b'This book was pre-ordered and came so quickly, it surprised my daughter, a J.K. Rowling devotee, before she got the idea in her head to purchase it.  She loves it!'

author: b'sheepoo'
title: b'Queen of Darkness'
body: b"From the dark, mythical world of Harry Potter Rowling moves on to the dark and disturbing world of human relationships and its ultimate morphing into what we call a 'Human Society'."

author: b'MamaMia80202'
title: b"So Awful I Couldn't Finish It"
body: b"I absolutely loved the Harry Potter series and was eagerly looking forward to J.K. Rowling's first book targeted to adults.  What a terrible disappointment.  There is no spark to the story, the characters are small minded and dull, and there was simply no engaging hook.  I plodded through 75 pages hoping it would get better, but finally I just had to end the madness and stop torturing myself with this book."

author: b'aggiemom2015'
title: b'Lots of characters'
body: b'This book was a bit hard for me to get through. Especially at the beginning. Once I got about halfway through, it started to come together and get more interesting.'

author: b'tessdives'
title: b'A Little Too Casual and Vacant in the Plot Department...'
body: b"I was quite disappointed in this book from the beginning. The writing is shockingly juvenile, choppy, and repetitive. It was actually surprising how poor the writing really was in a lot of places. It also just felt like Rowling was so happy to finally be able to use profanity, that she overused it, rendering it pretty much cliche. Ditto for sexual content. Both have their places in a good storyline, but sloppy overuse is just off-putting. It came across as trying too hard. The point of view within sections switched from character to character so quickly, it became impossible to know who was doing the speaking/thinking. The characters all seemed pretty one dimensional and cookie-cutter. The domineering family man who is also the town big shot. The teenager who can't stand his parents (this was overdone in multiple characters). The 'bad girl' with the heart of gold. Boy with crush. Woman unhappy in relationship. Mamma's boy. It goes on a little too long. The book never seems to figure out what it really wants to do. The plot, which is almost nonexistent, peters out way before the end of the book. We're introduced to this town and large number of its citizens, but we're never given a reason to care about them. The most dynamic character in the book is the guy who dies after the first few pages. I kept wishing this character was around because I didn't like any of the other characters. No one was sympathetic, no one was interesting, no one had any redeeming qualities (except maybe the dead man, Barry Fairbrother). A lot of the characters also did or said things that didn't seem to jive with the way the author described the characters earlier in the novel. At the end of the book, I breathed a sigh of relief that it was over, even though nothing really happened at the end. I mean, it did, but, like most everything else in the novel, the ending was rushed, unbelievable, and forced. I can only be thankful I borrowed this book from the library and didn't actually put out any money for it. I won't get back the time I spent reading, but what can you do?"

author: b'Wesley  Wallace'
title: b'not worth reading'
body: b'This is the first book I have read by Rowling.  It is the Polar opposite of her Potter books.  The plot line is very thin and the story convoluted with gutter language.  I read it only due to her reputation as a writer.  Since I had the Kindle version I felt obligated to read it.'

author: b'Ginchen'
title: b'No redeeming characters in this novel'
body: b"I have to admit that I never read any Harry Potter novel, even found the movies somewhat boring. Having said that, I was so looking forward to what the author would do with an adult novel. She can write, no doubt about it, however why she seems to revel in these dark and disgusting characters and scenes is beyond me. Except for the poor little toddler, who is horribly abused as all the adults in his life fail him, there is no one who seems to have any redeeming qualities. The british underclass is portrayed as criminal, drug addicted, foul mouthed and lacking any compassion or ounce of responsibility. The middle class denizens of the town do not fear much better. They are portrayed as greedy, crooked, selfish, child abusing folks. I could not really enjoy this novel, because it was so dreary, OTT incidents, rape, incest, ugly characters and no bright light at the end of this long slog of a novel. Husbands disliked wifes, wifes hated husbands, and the teens are hating almost everyone who is an adult. Could the author not have found one single human being in this fictional town, that I could admire or want to care about? J.K. Rowling penned a novel that might appeal to some, but I believe the majority of readers will be whoefully disappointed by this book. Overpriced, overrated, not a novel you'll want to read twice!"

author: b'SoCalGal'
title: b"J.K. Has to Try Again:  This Isn't It!"
body: b"Not ever having read her HP books I thought I'd give this novel a try.  Patience, fortitude, resolve -- I needed all of them, but to no avail.  Got half way through and decided that these characters didn't warrant any more of my time.  But this is just J.K.'s first baby step away from HP.  She'll read the reviews and hopefully start again in some other direction.  She should at least include one character you'd like to have tea with -- and that would be one more than I found in Casual Vacancy."

author: b'pokely'
title: b'This book is so depressing'
body: b"Not a single character to really like, not even much of a story line.  I know it wasn't going to be Harry Potter but really it took forever to read just because i found all of the characters so distasteful.  The only reason i finished it was J k Rowling should deliver a good story.  Well she delivered something something gritty, and not at all like the HP books, maybe she should have stuck with fantasy"

author: b'TGDC'
title: b'Brilliant'
body: b"JK Rowling does a brilliant job of weaving together the complex stories of individuals in a small town. I couldn't put it down and finished it in 3 days. This book is most certainly for adults. If you're expecting a magical fairytale you will be sorely disappointed, which is why I found it quite refreshing to see this masterful story teller bring out the complex humanity in each of the characters who inhabit our every day lives. Someone wrote previously that we already know each of these characters. It's true, but Rowling peals away the facade of a small town to reveal what we all know to be true of ourselves. I can't wait for her next one!"

author: b'Laurie Reynolds'
title: b'disappointed'
body: b"J.K. Rowling's writing style in this book is very different from that of her Harry Potter books - more language and sexual references.  The main problem for me is that it wasn't until I was half way through the book that I found much action.  The second half does have some punch, but it takes 250 pages to get there."

author: b'galia'
title: b'very slow and dark'
body: b'Too much confusing details about different sad, angry and hateful families. There is no kick at all and it just drag you down.'

author: b'Fred H. Freeman'
title: b'A not so Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I am a fan of J.K. Rowling. I was used to her plots in the Harry Potter series. I was surprised to note the interplay of Sex and drugs in the storyline. It was an interesting story involving smalltown politics and the interactions of several people. From the way the story played out, I\'m not so sure how "casual" this vacancy on the Pagford City Council was. Every part of it was interesting'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Put me to sleep'
body: b"I started reading this book with great hope and expectation. I was disappointed. Too many characters to keep track of. The characters were recognizable, but I just didn't care what happened to them. I got though about 7 chapters and fell asleep on it. I tried again when I woke up. Put it down and don't plan to touch it again."

author: b'FayetteLady'
title: b'An enjoyable read'
body: b'I Thought the story was engaging and the characters very believable.  It was a bit long (503 pages), but a fairly quick read because you were eager to find out what would happen next, with and to the people of this small town.'

author: b'Kay'
title: b'So different and yet so very good in a different way!'
body: b"I love the way Ms. Rowling creates believable and compelling characters. This is not a fantasy England but a gritty struggle made very apparent by the haves and have nots. It is England and it is Kentucky and most everywhere where the lines of class and wealth are drawn not only in which side of town, what county, etc. that people live in but what they perceive their options and dreams are. There is a sadness to Casual Vacancy. I have just heard that the BBC is making a series of the book, hope it makes it's way here."

author: b'momof Paige'
title: b'waste of time'
body: b"I was so disappointed by this book.  I found it depressing & vulgar.  Even beyond this, in a book chock full of characters, Rowlings fails to create even one that the reader cares about.  Couldn't be more different than HP, but not a good departure in my opinion."

author: b'Mark Goodwich'
title: b'Did Not Do It For Me'
body: b'First, I would like to state that I never read any of J.K. Rowling\'s "Harry Potter" books. I felt since she was so famous and this book keeps it place on the best seller list, I would give it a try. Now I found out that it make the "Good Reads" Best Fiction of 2012. I dislike the book and gave it only 1 star.'

author: b'Emily'
title: b'Bor-ing!'
body: b"It's an awful story about awful people.  Couldn't finished it.  I do not recommend this book. Though might make an interesting movie."

author: b'Lisa Gruszynski'
title: b'this was OK'
body: b"The book was OK.  Too much swearing for me, but an interesting plot.  I knew it wouldn't be Harry Potter, but that said this wasn't my favorite book."

author: b'L. Gaspardo'
title: b'I was Impressed ...'
body: b'I was impressed by the leap JK Rowling took from a young adult author to adult lit.  The plot was intriguing and an interesting take on human nature and interactions.  She does a good job developing her characters and setting and revealing the hidden predjudices in her characters.  It was worth the read.'

author: b'Paul Munro'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'One of the most boring books I have ever read (well I have read 46% of the book so far).  Can this woman have written Harry potter?  A b'

author: b'Paul in Cleveland'
title: b'Trash'
body: b"Very Disappointing - I expected much more from JK.  I won't give up on her but I hope the next one has more likeable characters."

author: b'K. A. Hohman'
title: b'Was So Excited About Rowlings New Book...not so much now...'
body: b"Really excited about her first new adult novel.  Began reading it, kept thinking it would get better, kept thinking it would get better....  Only one redeeming character in the entire book.  Have never read a book with so many characters that I truely didn't care if they lived or died.  Petty little people with little to intrigue the reader."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'very dark'
body: b'What is up with europeans being so dark?'

author: b'Kimberly Cox'
title: b'Oh my...I could have spent this money better on chocolate'
body: b'Depressing...turns up the ugly underbelly of life without balancing it with positivity.'

author: b'Gloria Kennedy'
title: b'Good Book'
body: b'This book moves very slowly for the first half and then gets much more interesting.  Lots of characters who all come together toward the end.'

author: b'S. Webster'
title: b'Wanted to love it'
body: b'It took a long time (about half way through) for me to really get into this story and to figure out how some of the characters were intertwined.  The beginning felt somehow disjointed.  But once I got past that the end was the type of compelling read I had been looking for.  Glad I stuck with it instead of giving up.'

author: b'Richard B. Lanoue'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b"Well I had great expectations for this book. I haven't read the whole thing but it's slow to start so I'm not tempted to keep reading. Well, that's my opinion."

author: b'deanna finch cohen'
title: b'Kept me interested'
body: b'Her style of writing keeps you interested.i usually read mysteries,and enjoy being shocked.I was'

author: b'pam york'
title: b'Too quick to judge'
body: b'I want to say that I really liked this book but I am not sure that like is quite the right word considering how despicable so many of the characters are!!!  It had me coming back for more though which for me is a sign of a good read.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Small town life'
body: b'This book has had bad reviews and good reviews. The former seem to relate to shock that the JK Rowling can forsake the world of mystery and magic to write about small town politics, and that there could be an autobiographical slant to the divide between a self-satisfied upper middle class local pcouncil politicians, and those on benefit who live in new housing on the periphery of this conservative idyll.'

author: b'Kate Jackson'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy VACANT'
body: b'Was looking forward to reading J.K. Rowling, but found the book disturbingly poorly written and conceived.  I was disappointed, I really wanted to like it. I did read to the end, where it pulled all the plots and sub-plots together, however, it was too little too late.'

author: b'A Wern'
title: b'nothing like Harry Potter series'
body: b'I am having a hard time reading this book. It is very boring and all the characters are  introduced in a confusing manner making it hard to follow.'

author: b'Marsha Roepe'
title: b'oh no!'
body: b"I really really wanted to like this book.  I really did.  But I've just stopped because there are too many characters and I can't get a point of view.  Is the hero the dead guy?  It keeps jumping around from person to person and flashback after flashback.  Maybe one day, when I'm not so busy, right after I finish my two volume set of Proust, I'm going to finish this. And I'll love it, and I'll regret not reading it sooner."

author: b'Kathy Maxcy'
title: b"Can't put it down ..."
body: b"Great intrigue, some romance, teen angst, jealousy and more. What is not to like? Good for curling up by a fire on a cold winter's night or a lazy day at the beach."

author: b'Mary L. Ferson'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy - four stars'
body: b'Covered a lot of lives,  maybe a few too many, as the situations got confusing, but the writing was excellent.'

author: b'Marcy K'
title: b'A Disappointing Read'
body: b'I was anxious to read this book when it came out.  It was th 50th book are little book club read...most of us were not terribly impressed.  It was OK, but not a blockbuster at all.  It dragged ever so much...it was the type of book you could read, put down for days, pick up and plug away.  We were glad we read it after all the Harry Potter stuff, but a great disappointment.  Characters were OK, story was slow to develop, a little twist at the end....just not engaging.'

author: b'Kara Weiner'
title: b'Great'
body: b'This was an excellent book that came on time. It was very convenient to preoder it online so I could receive it the day it came out.'

author: b'cafare'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'I struggled to read this book. It is very long and drawn out. A great disappointment from an avid reader.'

author: b'RisaA'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"I was so excited to read this book because I love Rowling's other work.  I knew she was definitely trying to create something that was completely out of the genre of Hogwarts but I found this book to be trying too hard. It seemed as though she spent so much energy trying to make this NOT Harry Potter that some of the quality of writing she is known for was also thrown out with the bathwater.  I found this story to NOT be that interesting. I know that it isn't fair to keep comparing this to the HP series, but that is what this author is known.  People are going to read this book because they love her other work. People want to know if she is capable of creating a world as interesting and charming as the other world she created.  Sadly, this book falls very short. I didn't even finish it.  It was a disappointment for me."

author: b'Eleanor May'
title: b'CASUAL VACANCY'
body: b'After a few chapters, I decided that my precious time is wasted reading this book.  A popular author\'s name does not necessarily beget a good book. F words are just "fillers"...and unfamilar long words send me to the dictionary. Life is too short!'

author: b'a good reader'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Could not get past the first chapter, totally uninteresting; I thought this book might be different from the others she has written.'

author: b'Megan'
title: b'No Magic, No Problem'
body: b"As a young adult who read and devoured Rowling's previous works, I was a little wary of reading her newest title, afraid that entering a non-magical world with one of my favorite authors would be somehow disappointing. And while I cannot say that I found an enchanting and familiar story inside this book, I also cannot say that I was disappointed."

author: b'Cindra L. cochran'
title: b'very disappointing'
body: b"if you find profanity offensive, you will not be able to read this book.  I expected something dark given Rowling's Potter books, but this was seedy, sordid, and i felt like i needed a shower for my mind after reading a third of the book.  Kept hoping it would improve, it didn't, it's gone."

author: b'big nose'
title: b'nice read'
body: b'Fun read for the kids. began to get lenthy and boring towards the end. Still would reccomend the kids out there.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Great Read'
body: b'I really enjoyed it, but I think it\'s a book meant to appeal to a much smaller audience. It\'s not really anything like Harry Potter and very much a book for adults. There\'s very little plot (I\'m pretty sure I could summarize the whole book in one sentence). There\'s not a ton of action or anything out of the ordinary. Instead this book is a character study. Rowling captures Life. It\'s that simple. Just life. What it means to live, what it means to have hope, to love, to feel pain, to be ashamed etc. etc. There\'s no need for anything "major" to happen because life in itself is a series of celebrations and tragedies. It\'s hard to like any of the characters because we see what they think, but then again, it\'s hard to like anyone once we get a glimpse at what they\'re really like. It\'s simply humanity: we\'re not perfect, no one is. And so, Rowling is brutally honest about what society is really like. She plays with the way people perceive others and even the way, people perceive themselves. This book is proof of her great writing skills because by the end, I found myself really caring for some of her characters, even with all their imperfections. And isn\'t that one of life\'s biggest challenges? Learning to love others, learning to trust people even when we know that they will eventually fail us? Not all the characters change. Not all the conflicts are resolved by the end. It\'s more like Rowling captured one moment, one glimpse, in the much-less-than-perfect lives of the citizens of Pagford.'

author: b'StrayDataPoint'
title: b'But when it does pick up...'
body: b'"The Casual Vacancy" follows a rather large number of characters and the relationships between them, against the background of a local election for a position vacated by a sudden death.'

author: b'Bill'
title: b'Slow Starter'
body: b"I love JKR's writing style. She could write the instructions on how to assemble IKEA furniture and find a way to make it an enjoyable read."

author: b'musicwife'
title: b'The Very Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I have not quite finished the book & can't decide where it is going. I must say that JK has a good idea of the seedier side of life & the people who live it. To be fair she does have a great deal of insight into the minds of her characters."

author: b'Eva'
title: b'Hard to get into'
body: b'The difficulty is all the British references and verbage.  The plot is somewhat slow in developing.  Having read all the Harry Potter books I can say this is not page turner material.'

author: b'Joan'
title: b'difficult read'
body: b"I enjoyed some of this book - but found that it required constant reading, not one for dropping for a few days.  It's a real life story, sad and difficult at times."

author: b'Penny Kotze'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Now wonder J K Rowling is so rich because she can sure spin a good yarn.  She deserves every penny she gets'

author: b'cindy'
title: b'Slow start...'
body: b'Story was wrapped up in the end....only disliked the disturbingly realistic homelife of all!  Four out of five given because of the slow start.'

author: b'Jacqueline A. Conney-forero'
title: b'ok read'
body: b'More adult than her other books, nothing like Harry Potter.  Obviously not as good as the teen books she writes'

author: b'Dslaz'
title: b'Waste of time & money'
body: b'I was really disappointed with this book. I love to read & I was looking forward to this novel. I must say, it is one of the worst books I have read. It took long to actually understand the story.  Too many characters. Story all over the place. Not worth the money or the time to read this.'

author: b'Catherine'
title: b"Don't Even Bother"
body: b"Let me begin by saying I LOVED the Harry Potter books!  Rowling created a fanciful world in those books in which one could lose oneself.  Her language was so rich, and she painted such amazing word pictures in such deep hues.  She brought children's books back into the category of literature.  So it is with GREAT disappointment that after forcing myself through almost half of The Casual Vacancy, I close it and give up; I will not and cannot finish this book.  Boring, boring, BORING.  There is not one character in this book (and there are probably too many to choose from) that I remotely begin to like.  The language feels forced; the word pictures are dingy at best.  If this books paints a picture of the English countryside and its people, I don't want to visit.  (If I could give it no stars, I would.  But they won't publish without at least one.)  Can I have my money back?????"

author: b'libby'
title: b'We expect Rowling to be great and she does not disappoint'
body: b"This book reminded me of Monica Dickens who was Dickens' great grand daughter. She wrote great stuff about social work in English communities. Rowling really knows how to break the heart  when she deals with this subject. She brings it right up to date with how mean messages on the  Internet can dis rupt an entire community. The main focus is on a single mother and her children..If this doesn't make you keep, you have heart of stone. On the lighter side, her use of dialogue is superb."

author: b'J. Matlock'
title: b'Could put it down'
body: b"I'm certainly not an accomplished literature critic, but I definitely did not like this book. I could discern no plot other than a multitude of dysfunctional characters and their interactions. I, like others, did not see any humor in the 30% of the book I muddled through. If I knew that many dark and troubled people in my life, I would get a new life! It may be shallow of me, but I read to be entertained and not bombarded by the foul language and cruelty that is abundant in this book. I very rarely give up on a book, but I did give up on this one."

author: b'Jennifer Gatling'
title: b'Better than expected'
body: b'I was so curious to see if J.K. Rowling had other stories in there and she does! This was a good book and an excellent departure from the HP series. I hope she continues to write because she is a great storyteller!'

author: b'Linnea'
title: b'I had to stop after three chapters'
body: b"I can't believe the same person wrote Harry Potter and then wrote this!.  I wish I could return it for being sooooooooooo bad."

author: b'kat27'
title: b'This is a book is one that encourages the reader to think and examine their own blinders to the social position each of us bear'
body: b'The characters in this book cause the reader to pause and reconsider their own preconceived concepts they hold about the people in their own communities'

author: b'Mark J. Stang'
title: b'Seller great - book so-so'
body: b'This seller is a keeper - Rowling was way better with Harry - but the book was in perfect condition and just as described.'

author: b'Trish Schiesser'
title: b'COMPLETE DISAPPOINTMENT, AMATEURISH WRITING'
body: b'I HAVE ONLY READ THE PAGES WHICH ARE AVAILABLE AS A "PEEK A BOO" INTO THE BOOK.'

author: b'Sandra'
title: b'very disappointed'
body: b'I am certain that her success with the Harry Potter series gave her first adult novel a major boost.  I was disappointed in the choice of "bad" language and I did not see the humor at all.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A Hilarious Read!'
body: b"This book was a surprise birthday present from my husband and I must admit I approached it with trepidation since I had already read the mostly mixed reviews it had received.  I am about a third of the way through and I have to say that it only took me about 20 pages to fall absolutely head over heels for it.  I LOVE THIS BOOK!!!  As someone who has read the books of Christopher Buckley (Thank You For Smoking, etc.) and Carl Hiaasen (Skinny Dip, etc.), I can tell you that this book is probably not for everyone, but if you enjoy your humor as black as a moonless night in the desert - then this book is for you.  Also, an appreciation of dry English wit would go a long way.  If this is the direction Rowling is taking, I can't wait for the next novel.  And yes, I was a huge fan of HP and read every last one of them.  I never expected this would be along those lines since it's for adults and anyone who reads this book with that notion needs to grow up."

author: b'Matthias'
title: b'Good book'
body: b"It's very entertaining to read. I see the ingredients for a great novel there, but I wouldn't call it one. It's not as balanced as J.K.Rowling's previous work."

author: b'Invisible'
title: b"Sadly, couldn't finish it"
body: b"It isn't that this book isn't well written -- it is.  I think that I got about halfway through, expecting that something, anything would happen.  It's interesting enough in terms of everyday life happenings, but my own life is probably as interesting.  I just gave up, which I hardly ever do."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Not comparable to Harry Potter!  Many obscenities & provocative situations.'
body: b"Let me start by saying I didn't get very far in this book, so I can't say whether the plot itself was good.  I'm a huge Harry Potter fan - this was completely different.  Adult situations, with lots of profanities.  Although I wasn't expecting Harry Potter, I didn't expect this.  I was very disappointed."

author: b'GV'
title: b'J.K. is an excellent author'
body: b'J.K. has a way with character development that really engages a reader quite quickly. Something about her innate sense of people, and the depth with which she touches upon personal and social issues is outstanding. This book is a sort of series of vignettes so that the reader gets a whole understanding of the characters and issues that make up the small, fictitious town of Pagford. I could not put this book down and found myself not only attached, but relating to the characters.'

author: b'Samantha'
title: b'Could not get into it.'
body: b"I loved the Harry Potter series and I wanted to see what Casual Vacancy would be like. I had a terrible time getting into it. I didn't even finish and feel like it was a waste of money. Very disappointed."

author: b'Jean Turicik'
title: b'She has done it again!  Have patience!'
body: b'This is a wonderful story--despite some of these reviews.  You must have the patience to allow the Author to develop all of the Characters--this is what ultimately makes it such a wonderful tale.  As Ms. Rowling did with the Harry Potter series-she introduces you in great detail to each important character, and she has done the same with "A Casual Vacancy".  I know that I began to wane a bit as well in the first part of the book--but don\'t give up because once you know everyone and their role in the entire story-it is so very worth it.  Parminder, and Fats, and Andy,Tessa, Samantha, Howard--and Krystal, they all must be introduced to the reader so you understand what\'s to come.  The story really takes off halfway through and it becomes the "book you can\'t put down".  The ending is fascinating--how all the different personalities and actions people took affect the outcome is, well, real life.  And the small town aspect of it is very true.  I think Ms. Rowling did a wonderful job as always with this story-she is truly a gifted writer and I can\'t wait for her next novel to come out!!'

author: b'RoniH'
title: b"Didn't even get to 100 pages"
body: b'This books reads like Rowling read Franzen\'s "Freedom" and said to herself "I can do this too". "Freedom" in an English village. Couldn\'t finish "Freedom" - couldn\'t read this either. Boring interfering characters.'

author: b'EllipsisBooks'
title: b'I was not disappointed'
body: b'I knew from the get go that this book was going to receive mixed reviews. I am very acquainted with British literature and humor. I also love a character driven frame story and I am an adult that read Harry Potter as a kid. I hate to even mention the Potter series in conjunction with this book because they are two completely different genres and really should not be compared side by side. So all I\'m going to say is that Rowling\'s style is present in "The Casual Vacancy."'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Expected So Much More'
body: b'I expected so much more from JK Rowlings first book outside of her Harry Potters.  The writing was good...the characters were really hard to like and there were so many of them I needed a map and a geneololy chart.  Perhaps the tone and cadence of the book was a bit "british" and sent me off to the confusion Parrish. There was a vacancy there just for me... JK. I love you...I have MS and I like your mother am so proud of your work. This one....well....it was just too busy for an adult and too dark for a kid. In my humble opinion.'

author: b'Tracy Moore'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'This was probably one of the worst books I have ever read. There was not one enjoyable moment. I kept reading, thinking there was going to be something, but it never delivered. It was dismal & depressing.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'This book was ok.'
body: b"Small town, lots of stuff going on...if you don't mind a relatively depressing story how this town clicks becomes interesting enough. Not quite what I expected but held my interest."

author: b'Julia A. Mariani'
title: b'Quite surprised!'
body: b'I did like this much more than I expected.  Nice surprise.  The story is timely no matter what side of the pond you live on.'

author: b'JD'
title: b'I did not even plan to read this but I loved it.'
body: b'No, it is not Harry Potter, it is Jane Austen - "three or four families in a country village."  No there are no high waisted gowns or rose gardens or eligible bachelors, but this story of ordinary people trying to survive ordinary life kept me riveted.'

author: b'Heather Prillaman'
title: b'Not as good as expected.'
body: b'This book is long, and confusing. It switches viewpoints so quickly, and it is difficult to discern who is talking. I would not recommend it. I am an avid reader and am a big fan of JK Rowling, but this was not at all what I was expecting.'

author: b'Cherie Nef'
title: b'Had to put it down'
body: b"I really wanted to like this book.  I was prepared to think of JK Rowling as just another author and not compare this to her Harry Potter books.  I wasn't prepared for the amount of foul language in it.  Characters toss out multiple F-bombs in casual conversation.  Other very foul words show up from time to time.  It was jarring to read with so many swear words.  Unfortunately, swear words don't make a book and adult one.  Neither does this lack-luster plot.  There aren't that many books that I haven't finished, but this is one of them."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A good read'
body: b"I really liked this book about life in a small town in rural England and the drama that ensued but i'm not sure how much it would appeal to someone who has never lived in England."

author: b'carole'
title: b'Well constructed story'
body: b'very good read which made you think at the end.  The characters are very complex and well formed but must admit I did get a bit lost in the first couple of chapters with the number of characters introduced.'

author: b'Pamela Sinclair'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"OK. what is up with this book???  JK Rowling must have been surrounded by dementors when she wrote this.  It's like all the happiness was sucked out.  Reading this I felt like she will never be happy again.  She needs CHOCOLATE!!"

author: b'Deb Murzyn'
title: b'Not a mystery'
body: b"JK Rowling's Harry Potter novels were wonderful reads! Unfortunately,  her adult novel, The Casual Vacancy, has a plot encumbered by too many descriptive details (which worked in Harry Potter novels) and moved at a glacial pace.  As she SLOWLY meanders through the story, it is difficult to care about each character and instead wish the end would come soon."

author: b'Daniel R. Durrett'
title: b'Not Harry Potter ... but there are echos of Hogwarts'
body: b"As in the Potter series, Rowling is telling a story of prejudice and collusion. Good wins out - after a fashion. But the journey is grittier and more believable. It wasn't as much fun as Potter. Is it an accurate look at not-so-merry-old-England?"

author: b'Nancy M. Harris'
title: b'us humans'
body: b'What a book: a scathing roust that reveals the human failure that can be in all of us: As Walt Kelly has Pogo says to Porky Pine as they are surveying the destruction of the primeval forest on Earth Day: "Yep son, we have met the enemy and he is us."  I would agree. This is a fantastic book written by a fantastic writer.'

author: b'Lorraine Lowe'
title: b'So so'
body: b'I found this a little boring in all truth.  I think I found all of the characters very hard to relate to from my own experiences, so found it hard to connect with the book in any particular way.  I was disappointed.'

author: b'Paul Beusterien'
title: b'Rich Characterization and Page-Turning Story'
body: b'At times, the black and white, good versus evil themes of the Harry Potter series can make the characterization cardboard-like. That is not the case with The Casual Vacancy. The richly-colored lives of flawed people enable Rowling to create interesting characters. Combined with her compelling story-telling skills, she write her best novel yet.'

author: b'william parsons'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Buyer Beware, if anyone other than J K Rowling had written this mess, it would be tossed into the editor's rubbish bin with great justification. I feel I have read this book twice, for all the sentences I had to re-read due to the change of subject midway thru. If Ms Rowling believes that the overuse of the F word makes for an adult book, Sorry. It is an ugly place, inhabited by uglier people that she has taken us to. I made it to page 308, when you think that things can get no more depressing, turn the page."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Realistic Portrayal of Human Thought and Interaction'
body: b'The characters, their dialogue, actions, and inner thoughts are all very realistic.  It took a few chapters for me to become oriented and interested; but once I did, I looked forward to bedtime reading every day.'

author: b'Colleen Inskip'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b"I was very disappointed. I didn't like the story line at all. Child abuse, rape, drug use, poverty, foul language etc."

author: b'D. Cumberland'
title: b'Rough read for Rowling fans'
body: b"I believe this is the book and style JKR would have written had HP not become an epic success. Once successful in a children's genre, she was hampered from using her character skills to show all the dark sides of human nature. She makes up for it in this book, but it's difficult for a huge HP fan to accept this very adult subject matter. The constant, endless cussing was hard to bear. The lack of redemption at book's end casts a pretty severe shadow over the whole book. Is JKR saying that humankind never does rectify? That people never do supersede their prejudices? It seems to be the theme, which is a hopeless and sad theme."

author: b'Sue Maj'
title: b'A Bitter Disappointment'
body: b"I could barely wait for Rowling's first adult novel, but was bitterlky disappointed.  While her writing is excellent, the content is so incredibly depressing.  In the village of her novel, there is not one person that I cared for or cared about.  Each one was self-centered or miserable or immature or just plain mean-spirited.  Two young people, Krystal and Robbie, were sympathetic enough but could not make up for all the nasty adults in the book.  What a disappointment from a great writer."

author: b'ZanninVT'
title: b'Nasty, brutish, but not short'
body: b'I wanted very much to like anything written by JKR as I did read the HP books to my kids & loved them for their craft as well as the "ripping yarn" quality.'

author: b'Kristen'
title: b'Not what I expect'
body: b"I'm only on chapter two. It hasn't engaged me or made me want to continue. The wording isn't something you'd want to quote like in her previous books. She's trying to make you think about relationships. She should have done it differently."

author: b'Carol'
title: b'Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling'
body: b"I can't seem to get into this book.  It moves slowly and I don't know if I'll finish it.  I loved the Harry Potter books, so thought this would be very good.  Very disappointing."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Surprising!'
body: b"I never read any of her books and was a little concerned when our book club chose this book for the month.  I was concerned that I wouldn't be able to finish --it is  long, but once I started reading , it didn't take me long to finish.  There were parts that were a little boring, but they were few and you read through them to find something on the other end very interesting.  I enjoyed it very much, although, not fond of the ending, but realized after a couple of days, that is the way it had to end."

author: b'Clodagh Barwise-Smith'
title: b'boring'
body: b'never got into the story really - slow to take off, slow to continue - not her best book.  Sorry'

author: b'Christine'
title: b'Excellent'
body: b'Totally different than Harry. JK Rowling knows how to write an entertaining story, this has everything going for it. Heartwrenchingly sad and gritty.'

author: b'SR'
title: b'Rolling Rowling'
body: b"I liked it! I can understand people saying that it was difficult to read due to the many characters. I had to reread the first few chapters to learn who was who, what they do, and who their family members were. It took quite a few pages (over 100) to get the plot. Once I got it, it became easier and I did not want to put the book down. I identified with some of the characters, cheered for some while hating others. I like the fact that the story has no mystery for the reader to uncover. There is mystery within the story however, but the characters are the ones left to wonder and ponder. The reader is not lost trying to figure out anything, we can ride along knowing what's happening. There are some shocking elements throughout the story. It's not a book for everyone. I liked and recommend it."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Amazing'
body: b'Completely and totally different from J.K. Rowlings previous works but still amazing in a totally different regard. Highly recommended to any Rowling or literature fans.'

author: b'Music Mari'
title: b"I love J. K. Rowling's writing."
body: b"This is J. K. Rowling's first foray into writing for adults. The story, set in an English village is a good romp. The good, bad and ugly of politices, small village life, bigotry and gossip all make this book a page-turner.  This story could have been set in any town, USA and is relevant to what goes in on the world in 2013."

author: b'Mark Gunnells'
title: b'Tour de Force'
body: b"Wow, just wow!!! I just finished this and I thought it was nothing short of brilliant.  A tour de force. I heard some say this was boring.  Boring??  I thought it was anything but.  I thought she could make a tense dinner party just as exciting as a wizard duel.  The writing was top notch, very polished, and the pace flowed beautifully.  I also thought the characters were so well realized and believable. I've heard the complaint that so many were unlikable, and that is fine with me.  I don't need saintly characters, there are so few of them in real life, but I want characters that read real and are complex and interesting and I personally found this to be the case here.  In even the worst characters, she gave me insight into why they are the way they are.  I didn't think she excused anyone's behavior in the book, but at least gave some understanding of what led to the behavior.  I found the ending incredibly moving and emotional, just a powerful book.  And the story was very relevant.  Not an American book, not set in America, but after this past election I thought the exploration of rich and poor and how the rich views and treats the poor was handled very well.  The book had something to say without beating the message over my head.  I for one think her first non Potter book was a stunning success."

author: b'liquid_glass'
title: b'useless'
body: b"This book was dull and didn't have even one original thought in it. The characters were repugnant in their small banal cruelties to each other, but that would have been all right if at least the story was propulsive and engaging or if Rowling had given us a reason to root for or sympathize with any of them. Instead, she seemed to ooze contempt for these small-town folk."

author: b'pink'
title: b'Awful'
body: b"Never read any Harry Potter books but thought this would have to be great because she's such a great author.  Found it boring and cumbersome - gave up half way through - then read a review saying anyone who wasn't moved by the last chapter had to feelings so I read that and it seems perhaps I am one of those that has no feeling - totally disappointed and won't be reading any more of her books"

author: b'J. Julio E. Herrera V'
title: b'Relevant and timely'
body: b"As a disgruntled Harry Potter fan, I read this novel more out of curiosity than real interest. I'm glad I did, since I got a very positive impression out of it in several ways."

author: b'Jabes'
title: b'Makes Me Miss Harry Potter'
body: b'Its Just Not the same, JK Rowlings attempt to write an adult novel falls short and probably would not be recognized if she had not been the author of Harry Potter series.'

author: b'Joanna Mechler'
title: b'Superficial'
body: b'For a character study of a town I found the characters to be one dimensional.  Story line was promising that is why I gave it 3 stars.'

author: b'J. Wainwright'
title: b'No warmth!'
body: b"Rowling obviously did not intend to paint working class society in UK as a warm and fuzzy bunch, but immediately, in the first chapter, killing off the only individual who seems to have had some warmth or charitable quality, results in a book full of rather unlikable individuals.  None of the long list of characters have any genuine affection for each other, so it is very difficult to root for anyone.  Self distructive, on the road to nowhere, the characters become rather cartoonish, like the Dursley's in 'Harry Potter'.  I would even go as far as to say that her characters are so mean, they are unrealistic.  Life has redeeming aspects to it as well as tragedies, so despite the love of the acerbic, this book disappointed me.  Clearly able to weave a tale, I wish Rowling would break down her wall a little and let us find the heart so I'll want to dive into another one of her books."

author: b'Love2read'
title: b'Slightly recommend'
body: b'It started out very slow. Took a while to get my attention. Book is okay. J.K. Rowling is still a favorite author of mine so I will read more of her books if and when published.'

author: b'Jill'
title: b'Too long'
body: b'This book needed to be pared down considerably in order to give a slice of English life.  The beginning was slow and finishing it a chore.'

author: b'Katherine Keckeisen'
title: b'No Harry Potter'
body: b'I had a hard time with this book.  It just did not grab me at any point.  I struggled to get to the end.'

author: b'RICK'
title: b'great book'
body: b'bought this for my daughter, she loves it. i am thinking anything from J.K will be a great book. must read.'

author: b'Stephanie Tucki Bailey'
title: b'4.5'
body: b"I was bored at first. Small town gossip, I did take not of Rowling's interesting vocabulary, but kind of felt it was forced. By the end I was involved and loved how she presented the story."

author: b'Sue'
title: b'A nice read'
body: b'I was amazed by the Harry Potter series and was looking forward to the adult offering from this writer.  I was a bit disappointed, the characters were less rounded and more stereotypical, the moral messages were less clear and the writing less spell binding.  This was a good read, but not what I had expected.'

author: b'Joel'
title: b'This is J.K. Rowling?'
body: b"Like anyone I've ever talked to who has read them, I loved the Harry Potter series. The story, the writing, the characters, everything was just a perfect compilation of what a fantasy book should be. Completely plausible within it's own world, great descriptions, and page-turning suspense at times, Harry Potter obviously inspired a generation to read. So, when I heard that J.K. Rowling was writing a completely non-fantasy, adult drama, I was skeptical. But, as a fan, I believed she could do it, and I was interested in seeing what she did with it. I work in a data-entry, so I have a lot of time to listen to audiobooks. Once it came out, i got the audiobook and got through it in about 2 1/2 days. And its okay. Its not amazing by any stretch, but i wasn't really expecting it to be. I came into it with a completely blank slate, because children's fantasy and adult drama are very different genre's, and i was equally prepared to be disappointed or awed that she had done it again. That said, I wasn't disappointed, but I also wasn't really impressed either."

author: b'Eugenia'
title: b'Casual Vacancy Disappoints'
body: b'This dark, rather predictalbe novel depressed me all the way through.  I realise that it si an adult novel and would have none of the charm and excitement of the Harry Potter series, but did it have to have such miserable characters?  If J>K> does another, I hope she finds a cheerful village next time.'

author: b'christa green'
title: b'I loved this book!'
body: b'I absolutely loved this book!  I have seen all of the Harry Potter movies but never read the books, perhaps that is why it was so easy for me to love this book!  Its very well written, nothing left to the imagination, and it leaves you wanting more.  Kudos to JK and I hope she continues on with her adult book writing.'

author: b'Margaret Gniewosz'
title: b'Brilliant study of human nature, superb writing...'
body: b"Listening to an audio version of this book, I realized that i can only do it in the complete privacy of my car! Compelling, brilliant and shuddering at times. Sometimes i will ask myself: how does she know and how could she write in such a precision and pointedly about each character and the complexity of their interactions. Myself, being in Andrew's shoes very long time ago, it literally shocked me - the exact detail and the similarity of situations. I thought that it was all behind me and all forgotten......it took my breath away....."

author: b'john mccormick'
title: b'j k, write another please'
body: b'was a great read. never read any of the harry potter books but i can understand why they were so popular.the way the book ended i hope there is another book in the offing'

author: b'Alex Knight'
title: b"Well, actually, I haven't read it yet"
body: b"Because the book arrived dirty, and I'm just disgusted.  It seems like somebody with dirty hands who was eating potato chips must have handled it.  NOT what I expect in a new book!  It makes me wonder if Amazon is just going down the tubes. I do want to read it, maybe after I've gotten around to washing it.  But I'm busy resenting the condition of it right now.  Yuck!"

author: b'Nancy'
title: b'I Trudged On'
body: b'I will be the first to admit that when a book does not hit me as either good or bad, I have a hard time writing about it. I am sorry, but this will be a very dull uninspiring review. I cannot help it, that is how the book left me.'

author: b'Lori J. Miller'
title: b'OK'
body: b'This book was just O.K.'

author: b'Judy'
title: b'Not up to speed'
body: b'I loved the books Rolling wrote previously but Casual Vacancy was a disapointment for me.  It seemed to go on and on without a purpose.  To much information for me almost boring in detail.  I was really surprised.'

author: b'avidreader'
title: b'Typical English Plot'
body: b'This book needs to be read in one sitting or you will be completely confused about who is who and have to start again.'

author: b'bill in NH'
title: b'Was great until the end'
body: b'It felt that the author had come to a point of saying, "Time to wrap things up," and in the last few pages tried to tidy thing up in a most unreal manner.'

author: b'OldJaniceinKansas'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'I was so excited to receive the book.  As I read, I kept waiting for it to get better.  I felt like it was an assignment that I had to complete.  Perhaps I am not a sophisticated reader.  When I finished, I felt like I wanted my money back.  I have read all of the Harry Potter books multiple times.  I know this was an adult novel.  Since I am 71, I think I qualify as an adult but this book was a waste of my time and money.'

author: b'L. Walker'
title: b'Felt I owed this talented writer a read of her latest offering'
body: b'Oh my. A town of sad, bitter, emotionally stunted, tainted, tragic characters. This kind of story line is the reason I rarely read much contemporary fiction. Everything is so down-in-the-mouth and everyone is so disfunctional. Lots of characterization and very little action which worked because Rowling is very good at using motive to move the story. If you read Harry Potter, the people in this book are nearly all Dursley types...well drawn but just so awful. There are a few sympathetic characters but you just know something terrible is going to happen to them. I read 3/4 of the book then happened upon a review of it in the New York Times which gave away the ending and I was grateful that I did not have to read the horrifyingly sad end to this sad book.'

author: b'Mrs Bridge'
title: b'Fast, not funny'
body: b"I find this book entertaining but very put-downable. The characters are amusing but the author seems to be standing on a separate planet, looking down at them, laughing at them. Actually, I did put the book down about three weeks ago and haven't gone back. The atmosphere is kind of mean."

author: b'Beans'
title: b'Wish I had a time-turner to give me back two days of reading this book'
body: b"I loved the title. That's the only good thing I can say about The Casual Vacancy. It reads like a pay-back, like JK Rowling had some zoning-board dispute with the locals who didn't want her to put up a gazebo or some such and decided to vent her vitriol at them with a vapid laundry list of their limitations as human beings. It's a cruel book. Cruel to the characters, who are egregiously depraved each in their own way, and cruel to the reader, who keeps plowing through pages with the belief that something must happen, that this story must matter in some way or would not have been allowed to be published. What we have here is a famous author who has too much power to be told no. This should never have been given the green light to publication. It's a vanity project with a real mean streak. Don't bother to buy it."

author: b'Susan K. Schoonover'
title: b'The Ghost Of Barry Fairbrother'
body: b"THE CASUAL VACANCY is an above average book that has a great deal to say about some of the more negative aspects of human nature.  Of course the reader has to be willing to stay with the novel past its very confusing and uninviting start to get to the interesting character studies and darkly humorous main plot that centers around the pettiness of small city politics.  The book begins with the unexpected death of the saintly Barry Fairbrother who served on the town's parish council.  We are introduced to many of the townspeople through their reaction to his sudden passing and by the time of his funeral we have a pretty good understanding of the identity and foibles of the main players.  Parents and their teenage children are a major component of the book and J.K. Rowling shows the same understanding of the difficulties of coming of age that she did in the Harry Potter books. However THE CASUAL VACANCY is definitely a book written for adults or very mature adolescents as it is much more graphic in its depictions of some of the realities of life than the Potter books.  I hope J.K.Rowling continues to publish novels for both adults and children as she is a very talented storyteller with a great ability to create realistic characters. Rowling has a lot of  insight in to the human condition and it able to convey this in a manner that connects to a wide audience."

author: b'Nicky'
title: b'Unexpectedly casual'
body: b'Amazingly different to her previous books. A quite long story about the different inhabitants of a small English village. There is much detail about the emotions of each person, particularly the adolescents and about the relationships they have with each other and their parents.'

author: b'Jill Leathers'
title: b'Loved It.....'
body: b'A mature J.K Rowling novel.  She has really come a long way from her first Harry Potter novel becoming a great author/story teller.'

author: b'Serenity'
title: b'If I could give it no stars I would'
body: b'I am a prolific reader and could count on one hand the number of times I have given up on a book.  After  2 attempts I gave up on this one. I found it dull and boring. Admittedly when I read what it was about I would not have normally picked it up anyway, but as it was "J K Rowling" I thought it would be worthwhile. I am only grateful that I borrowed this from the library and did not purchase it.'

author: b'Patricia Perkins'
title: b'Dark Side of Life'
body: b'Although there were times when I was reading that I felt depressed by the dark side of the lives of ordinary people that were depicted,  I found the book well worth reading. J.K. Rowling is a keen observer of life and her ability to portray the young people in her story gives them a realism that is gripping. She is an excellent writer. Her interest in working for the benefit of under-privileged children has clearly contributed to this novel.'

author: b'Carol A'
title: b'Just not keeping my interest'
body: b"I had high expectations but I've had to start it over a couple of times because I put it aside for so long that I needed to refresh myself.  I hope I can make it through."

author: b"Cheri d'Uzes"
title: b"Well written. JKR's lovely humble voice"
body: b"I always loved the H Potter books because JK Rowling's voice is so matter-of-fact and unpretentious. This book is not a fantastical thriller. I was able to set the book down, yet I was intrigued enough to continue. When one considers that the entire story takes place in a small, seemingly boring down, it is amazing that the author succeeds in showing the reader that small is anything but boring."

author: b'Michele T. Toniatti'
title: b'No Harry Potter for sure!'
body: b"I was very disapponted with this book. Didn't like the language or some of the content. Didn't finish yet but what I have read is not what I enjoy reading!"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Something to prove'
body: b'A detailed, introspective story about the rich and the poor. The inward battle of a few select characters leads to both growth and tragedy. J.K. Rowling continues her excellent story telling although there is no comparison to be made to the Harry Potter series.'

author: b'food lover'
title: b'Disappointed in Rowling'
body: b"I tried a sample for this book because I was impressed by Rowlings's series for young people. However, this book is poorly written; which surprised me."

author: b'Shopowner26'
title: b'So honest'
body: b"First off, know that I'm a hard core Harry Potter fan. This book was difficult to get into because, I think, I was having trouble dissociating it from Harry Potter. I think if you're going to try it, which you should, then go into it forgetting that J.K. Rowling wrote it. It is 100% different from Harry Potter. You've been warned, don't expect it to be."

author: b'Carol J. Richardson'
title: b'I ike the author'
body: b"I enoy reading books by this author. Reminds me of the Harry Potter books but for adults. I'm glad I discovered these books."

author: b'Tammy Scott'
title: b"She's Awesome"
body: b"I didnt know what I was getting into when I purchased this book because I had heard both good and bad about this book. When I started reading it, it seemed like I was kind of reading about parts of my life. If she wrote any a quarter of this book about her life I'm glad she has finally found peace and joy because she deserves it. I would only recommend this book to mature adults that can understand life. Its not really for young people that havent been through life just yet."

author: b'Staci Foss'
title: b'Very Enjoyable Read'
body: b'I like that this book is much more character-driven, relying on the motivations of the many characters more than the action to compel the reader.  There are actually two sets of characters, the adults and the teenagers, with equal importance given to both in terms of character development and plot.  While there is clearly good and bad in everyone, the teenagers proved to be the most likeable characters for me.'

author: b'Happy Shopper'
title: b'No as good as expected from this author'
body: b'Tons of characters found book hard to follow.  Read for book club, had to make myself read .. not an easy read.'

author: b'Jessie'
title: b'So dull!'
body: b"I know that this wasn't supposed to be another Harry Potter book, but this was so incredibly dull. I can't believe that J.K Rowling wrote this! I'm not sure how I forced myself to finish, but I did. It was painful."

author: b'Barbara Berg'
title: b'Not what I expected'
body: b'I had a hard time getting into this story.  Once I did though, it is o.k.  Not one of my favorite books.'

author: b'PSC Gear'
title: b'really?'
body: b'did you really have to go trashy? would not let my kids or very worst enemy read this.  very much disappointed'

author: b'Stella'
title: b'Brilliant'
body: b"There is no doubt J.K. Rowling knows how to tell a story.  It was a pleasure to follow all the characters and their intertwining lives. I truly enjoyed this look into a British village and it's social fabric.  This is social commentary at it's best, the story was interesting, sometimes funny but also touching and thought-provoking."

author: b'JC'
title: b'Awful'
body: b"The characters are self-absorbed and unsympathetic. Not one is capable of making a smart choice and overcoming adversity.  If you are curious about a world where there is no hope, no happiness, only the shallow joy of feeling superior to other people, you'll like this book."

author: b'Susan Z'
title: b'big disappointment'
body: b"It is hard to imagine that the writer who gave us Harry Potter could write a book this bad. This may  be one of the worst books I've ever read."

author: b'Lanae'
title: b'Dry humor if humor at all'
body: b"I was curious to read this book by J.K. Rowling, if for only to see how different her writing would be from Harry Potter. Whoa, I didn't expect to be so bored that I finally gave up and stopped reading the thing. My fear is that someone in my book club will choose this book. I'll go to the meeting of course, but it's going to take a lot of wine poured to get me to stay."

author: b'bev menzies'
title: b'not good JK'
body: b'what a letdown,  did not enjoy it at all,  the language and descriptions  used was not waranted, feel the writer was trying to keep up with other writers who turn out garbage .'

author: b'Katie Jones'
title: b'Insightful, heart-breaking, and incredibly well-written'
body: b'I really enjoyed J.K. Rowling\'s new book, "The Casual Vacancy."  It is the antithesis of Harry Potter, which shows that Rowling\'s storytelling skills branch out far beyond fantasy fiction.  While completely pessimistic, the book carried a dry wit and a perfect illustration of human nature that made the book very difficult to put down.  Rowling did such a perfect job capturing the vulnerabilities and oftentimes subtle cruelty that are so familiar that they could be those of people that any of us know or even of our own selves. I would recommend this book to any adult to read because it is a great, touching story of human nature where there is no black and white, good and bad, but just a grey area where we all are trying to live our lives in the pursuit of happiness, sometimes getting lost in the process.'

author: b'Tomas Ullrich'
title: b'Unclear characters'
body: b"It didn't work for me. A had to give up reading this book after approximately 100 pages. I got lost in the mixture of characters and the plot didn't capture me."

author: b'Portland reader'
title: b'JK Rowling should be allowed to write a bad book once in a while and she did!'
body: b'I only read half of this book and then not only stopped reading it but I deleted it from my library.  There was not one character that I cared about and that made it a difficult read.  I will still read the next book JK Rowling writes because even the best writers should be allowed to blow it once in a while.'

author: b'Liz Van Brunt'
title: b'Gratuitousness'
body: b'Seems like the graphic nature is gratuitous or just added with the assumption that that is what it takes for an adult book story formula. I thought there would be more creativity.'

author: b'Bill Hopkins'
title: b'The head hopping left me dizzy'
body: b"I finished the book. I didn't want to, but I finished it. All 512 pages of it. I was disappointed, to say the least. I didn't find a single character that I cared anything about. I won't provide a spoiler, because I don't feel it's necessary. I have to say that this is definitely a character driven book. And there were so many characters all interacting and all having a point of view at the same time that I never did know who was telling the story. The head hopping left me dizzy. There wasn't any real plot. J K Rowling is indeed a masterful writer, but her style in this book left me high and dry. It is very dark, but that was all right because I knew that going in. The English phrases and expressions may leave a lot of readers confused, but the writing is authentic. I read all of the Harry Potter books and thoroughly enjoyed them, so I am a fan of Rowling's. Just not of this particular book."

author: b'Coffee Lover'
title: b'The darker side of small town life'
body: b'This 1st venture into adult fiction is a captivating  journey into small town life beyond the Disney dream. Whether in Scotland or the US, the jealousies and prejudices of people are caught in a realistic manner.  The young characters are drawn the best with all their flaws and tributes.  This book could provide exuberant discussion in a book club.  Good vs. selfishness is an ample theme throughout the very believable plot.'

author: b'pipergirl33'
title: b'Hard to keep track of the characters but worth a read.'
body: b"This book was really hard to follow at first. It wasn't until half way through the book that i even remembered all the characters names and how they related to each other. However, if you can read it through to the end it really is every interesting how everyone's lives affect the people around them. This book is NOT for kids! It talks about drugs, sex, rape, and death. This is definitely an adult book"

author: b'Nancy Solak'
title: b'A lesson in compassion'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling. Warning: This book is full of flawed characters. In fact, in the first 150 pages, I nearly went mad trying to keep them straight. But indeed, I did "sort" them out. I kept wondering, why do I keep reading about these extremely flawed people? There\'s really no one to whom I can identify. But continue reading I did. And I was rewarded. The ending made me cry ... a lot. It\'s quite sad. I don\'t often read fiction, much less 500 pages of it, and I rarely cry, so Rowling hit a nerve. I even gained an insight. One of the characters reminded me of a "ne\'er do well" I attended high school with. Because of this book, I see her, 45 years later, with more compassion. I\'m not promising this will happen to you, but it\'s amazing how some stories can change your perspective.
