If a book can make me even a little bit more compassionate, I give it all the stars I can, since learning compassion is one of life\'s hardest lessons.'

author: b'Natalie Saunders'
title: b'Enjoyed it but thought it got a wee bit tedious in parts'
body: b"I can't decide whether I would recommend this book to friends, even though I did enjoy it and thought it portrayed some of society's current problems in a sympathetic way.  I felt it gave me a better understanding of what underprivileged families (especially the children) go through to-day."

author: b'Harkey'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'Although the premise is interesting, I found the British terms and entire piece a little difficult because it was mainly for an English audience.  Most of the time the books I read are generic in wording and easier to understand.  One needed a glossary or dictionary to get the complete immersion into the storyline.'

author: b'David Terraso'
title: b'Very well written - just not for me'
body: b"After reading this book, I am convinced that J.K. Rowling is a great author and not only a great children's author. Her characters were extremely well developed with proper motivations and back stories. The story too was interesting, but the hero of the book, we'll we don't get to know him all that well and he was the most interesting of all. Everyone else in this tale (or almost everyone else) are people I couldn't stand. So, although it was very well written, the story just didn't speak to me because I couldn't stand the people I was reading about. If they had been terribly interesting and surprising, that would've worked for me, but they weren't they were just petty, sickening and disgusting. Very realistic and a good story, just not one I care to revisit."

author: b'Barbara Knickerbocker'
title: b'Not a book I want to pick up and finish'
body: b'Good writing, but with sporatic reading the characters are hard to follow.  Think I will begin again and take notes about the characters, hopefully the story line will flow together better.'

author: b'Glen Duncan'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Not a very exciting story and not one of those books that I could not put down. Did not like the broad accent evident in much of the text.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'well written, just not upbeat enough for me'
body: b'... enough said! I love JK Rowling, she writes humanity very well.  This book was a heart breaker for me ( and yes i have a bleeding heart :).  I loved her characters, and hated the ending.'

author: b'Sylvia Steiner'
title: b'Too slow'
body: b'The book takes too long in describing dozens of characters and at the end it appears that there are too many descriptions and characters for not such an important story... The author, of course, writtes wonderfuly well, and for me, as a foreigner, it is a pleasure reading books so well written, but the story itself is, in my view, kind of weak, uninteresting.'

author: b"Emma's Parent"
title: b'Worst book read this year'
body: b"This is one of the worst book I've ever read. Unfortunately, it was not interesting enough to be thought provoking. Overall, it seemed to up offer a series of cynical snapshots of small town life.  The main characters were a boring cast of petty, superficial, self-serving, and sociopathic individuals whose social interactions blended together to fuel an assortment of human tragedies. It is the last J K Rowling book aimed for adults that i will ever purchase. It left me wondering if Rowling created such a magical  fantasy world in the HP series as a therapeutic escape from the world of mere muggles  (humans) which she clearly views with a disgusted and nauseous eye within The Casual Vacancy. The book could have been somewhat of a success as a dark comedy if only it had had a trace of humor. In short, this novel was a waste of time and money, and a complete disappointment."

author: b'Kalala'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Another good one from Rowling. Not Harry Potter, but an interesting change and she can curse like the rest of us. You go girl!'

author: b'O'
title: b'Depressing'
body: b'It was so bad I had to stop the miserable journey she was trying to take me on. It was sooo depressing!'

author: b'B. E.'
title: b"Don't Waste Your Time Or Money"
body: b"Rowling cashed in on her name to write a book with no substance whatsover.  It took more than half the book to develop the characters and the plot, and then once you figured the plot out, it was pretty predictable.  The characters?  Every one of the characters was unhappy, depressed and emotionally unstable.  There is not one redeeming, believable character in the entire book.  Take any social awareness issues that have happened in the last 30 years and put them in one book; unhappy wives, abusive husbands and fathers, rape, drugs, prostitution, pedophiles, child molestation, suicide, unsafe sex, teens suffering from angst and depression,  and you have a Casual Vacancy.  The ending left me with lots of questions because none of the characters' issues were resolved.  Is she writing a sequel?  I won't buy it.  Because quite frankly the casual vacancy about this book is exactly how it leaves you feeling, vacant."

author: b'M. F. White'
title: b"It takes a bit to get into it, but then it's hard to put down."
body: b"Once you get past the fact that it's not Harry Potter, or the detective story suggested in the early publicity, it's quite a good book. This is, definitely, a bleaker world than that of Harry Potter. The adults are highly imperfect, even the good ones, and the bad ones are kin to the Dursleys and Cornelius Fudge. The natural world, to the extent it's present at all, is under attack, and drugs abound.  Nevertheless,it's a story of how the most unpromising looking adolescents can be interesting and lovable and even good.This is not all that common with any writer, but English writers, in particular, tend to come down pretty hard on the young. Rowling's sympathies and gifts with respect to adolescents, so evident in the Harry Potter books, do continue here"

author: b'J. L. Bradley'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'Found the book difficult to get into. It was really a very depressing book. Really expected something different from this author. Was a very disappointing read.'

author: b'Mary Ellen Collins'
title: b'Rather Boring'
body: b'"A Casual Vacancy" was too long and convoluted.  I got bored with it.  It was not what I expected from her.'

author: b'Elizabeth Larson'
title: b'Slow, surly and depressing....'
body: b"I hate giving negative book reviews but I am going to do it anyway.  I love J.K Rowling and am a HUGE Harry Potter fan.  I had high hopes for her adult novel but alas was disappointed.  All of the characters seemed miserable and the story just never seemed to go anywhere until the end which was a whole lot of sadness crammed together.  Despite not liking the story itself, I do think she writes extremely well.  Bottom line, if it doesn't have a wizard in it next time, I won't be reading any adult novel from J. K."

author: b'Karen'
title: b'Hmmm, was someone rushing this?'
body: b"The things I liked; the premise and setting. Perhaps I've been so spoiled with being spoon fed the character development in the Harry Potter series that I'm not giving this book its due. However, I felt like I didn't get a chance to get to know the rich character pool she built. In fact, I must admit that I had to make a character list when I started the book in order to stay up with her."

author: b'David R Hayes'
title: b'Reminds me of Dickens'
body: b'I think I liked this novel better than most folks because I have been reading through Dickens for the past year or so. While Rawlings writing style is nothing like Dickens (which is all to the good), the structure and topic reminded me of Dickens. Like many of his novels, this one starts out introducing a bunch of seemingly disparate charcaters and then slowly brings them together into a loose narrative with a healthy dose of social meaning.'

author: b'Knighteagle'
title: b'A slow start to a good story, but it picks up great!'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy is at first glance a slow paced political drama. However as you continue reading the characters become more interesting, and very real. With no true heroes or villains. (Ok maybe one or two 'Villains') there is something in any of the main characters that the reader can relate to. The more you read the less important the political aspects of the story become to the reader and the characters."

author: b'Avid_readerSS'
title: b'So Disappointed'
body: b"I was looking for a book with characters about which I could care, not a book filled with cardboard cutouts. I was looking for a plot with risk and daring and challenge, didn't happen. Even an arresting setting would have helped, but Pagford is as dull as everything else about this novel. Unfortunately, I could never read more than two pages without falling asleep. Perhaps this book appeals to readers in Great Brittan, but I don't think it will appeal to most of us in the Colonies. The only thing to be said in favor of this book is that the grammar and spelling are correct. That fact is the single quality that prevented me from giving this book only one star."

author: b'BJ'
title: b'JK Rowling\'s "novel for adults".'
body: b'J.K. Rowling\'s "Novel for Adults"'

author: b'FarHorizons'
title: b'A worthwhile read, but Rowling is on a hiding to nothing with this one'
body: b'Everything that can be said - good, bad or indifferent - has already been written about this book.'

author: b'Susan from Perth'
title: b'Could not put it down'
body: b'Even though I read constantly, this would rate as one of the best novels I\'ve read in ages. When not reading it, I constantly thought about the characters. I was very sad to reach the end. Rowling has created such "fat" characters.  She has imbued them with some of the most realistic characteristics we humans possess, from unsolicited compassion to spiteful self -interest. I\'ve never read a Harry Potter, as that style of fiction does not appeal to me.  So therefore, it was with a little reluctance I embarked on The Casual Vacany. I sincerely hope Rowling continues with adult fiction. Sadly, I\'ll have to try to locate my next read, knowing it will probably not capture me, the way the people in Rowling\'s town of Pagford, did.'

author: b'A. Smith'
title: b'Gritty, moving, not for children'
body: b'It\'s not Hogwarts, but what Rowling accomplishes in revealing the heart and darkness of racism in the Harry Potter series, she accomplishes similarly about poverty in "The Casual Vacancy."  This is not a book appropriate (or written) for children.  Parts of it may make you sick if you\'re squeamish or prudish or sheltered.  But it\'s important.  It\'s the sort of story that needs to be told, is engaging in the telling, and will leave you different than it found you.'

author: b'DLewis'
title: b"JK Rowling's latest book The Casual Vacancy"
body: b"I loved JK Rowling's Harry Potter series and was hoping this would be a similar style of writing.  I have had a little trouble getting into the story but have only read 75 pages so far.  I am hoping that this books starts to captivate me but not yet.  The delivery was very quick and right on the date they told me."

author: b'Jana'
title: b'As Un-Potterish As It Is Possible To Be'
body: b'I\'m obsessed with the Harry Potter series. I\'ve read each of those books more times then is ok to admit. I grew up with them, and because of this I feel a little like I know J.K. Rowling. I sometimes refer to her as "Jo" and I was so excited that she was writing a new book. In my mind, the worst case scenario was that it would be a total flop and she would go back to writing Harry Potter novels.'

author: b'Kiwi Alice'
title: b'Potentially great, but...'
body: b"The world knows J.K Rowling is an amazing writer, but this one just didn't do it for me. Beautifully descriptive prose to the point that I felt I knew all the characters personally, but sooooo much of it! Just too much extra information tucked away in brackets too often. The plot was interesting, characters well thought out, but to me, this should have been heavily edited down to a snappy short story. It was just too long winded."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Not my cup of tea'
body: b'Not what I expected of this Rowling. I loved her Harry Potter and expected more here. Very disappointed in this one.'

author: b'Grandma Becky'
title: b'Dissapointed!'
body: b'I guess I expected too much out of the Harry Porter author.  It was a whole different kind of story.  Very sad and depressing.'

author: b'Tracy'
title: b'Kind of slow at first...'
body: b'You really need a character map to keep up with all of the characters and the relationships between them.  It is not a light read, but it is well written.  Stick with it...I hear that it goes pretty fast once you get through a couple hundred pages...if you can.'

author: b'Darryl Noble'
title: b'ending'
body: b'ending was blah just stopped why why why why why why why why why why why why why why 18'

author: b'Fiona Millar'
title: b'Does not get my vote!'
body: b'Peopled with charmless characters who inhabit a bleak landscape,this novel lacks the whimsy and humor which so delighted fans of the Harry Potter books.'

author: b'bert olthof'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b'She\'s a good writer of the English language, but this story is boring and not well told. I had expected much better, considering her "fame". Maybe she should stick to kid\'s fairy tales.'

author: b'Connie'
title: b'Not a bad read'
body: b"It's not her Harry Potter series but it's good.  I'm sure I'll read it again in the future but not right away."

author: b'Karen Beacon'
title: b"Hope she'll write even more for adults"
body: b'Think a little less raunchy language could have been just as effective, but I loved and adored the characters and it was a super book.  A little hard to get into, so stick with it.'

author: b'Pamela Jameson'
title: b'Rough start...'
body: b"I found the first part of this book hard to get into.  It was depressing and all the characters were at war.  Because it's JK Rowling and I'm a Harry Potter fan, I stuck with the story and was not disappointed.  Once you get thru Part 1 and you get back into JK Rowling's writing style the story comes together.  Actions and consequences throughout.  Really an amazing story."

author: b'Chickensoup'
title: b'JK Rowlings Hates Muggles!  Unless you are wealthy, academic or magical you are a Muggle'
body: b'JK Rowling Hates Muggles.  Who knew?'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'the casual vacancy'
body: b'very poor i wish i could get my money back'

author: b'Gypsy At Last'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"I'm only half way through this book so perhaps there's something coming that will make me be glad I struggled to get through to the end.  The only reason I've continued to plow through it was the author's obvious literary success with the HP series."

author: b'Ksan'
title: b'One of the most boring ever'
body: b"I thought that I would enjoy this after reading the Potter books. Shows how wrong you can be at times. I'll give her a second chance if she does another book, but it will have to be low priced!"

author: b'ISO'
title: b'Casual Vacancy - Too Casual!'
body: b'Ms Rowlings attempt at writing a book for adults suffers from her background as a writer of books from younger persons. The plot is simplistic and the vocabulary is rather limited. Perhaps my expctations were set a bit too high but this transition for Ms Rowling stills needs a bit more work - it is hopefully still a \'Work in Progress"'

author: b'Alexandra Kuznetsova'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'This is a very good book. The book is read at one breath - although I wouldn\'t say it\'s "easy" reading'

author: b'PerttiJS'
title: b'"Mugglemarch" was ok'
body: b'Although this J. K. Rowling\'s adult novel has been nicknamed "Mugglemarch", I found this small-town-story compelling. The starting point idea: remove suddenly (by death) a central character from a small community and see what happens, is a good one. The suddenly died councellor had friends, enemies and people in between. Rowling makes her characters lively, And as in Harry Potters, the teenagers become the heroes of this novel.'

author: b'Randy Everette'
title: b'I miss harry'
body: b"The writing is great...Rowling is brilliant with the English language, but i feel like i've been waiting for something to happen for the whole book.  Every time i pick it up, i wonder why i'm still reading it. Like a bad movie that you just want to end so you can say you know how it ends.  Too many characters that develop too slowly.  Seems like Rowling just wanted to prove she can cuss and overuse sex in a book. I hope parents don't it would make a good gift for young Potter fans."

author: b'Julia K. Whitlow'
title: b'Great read'
body: b'I really enjoyed this book. It is nothing like Harry Potter though, so if that is what you are expecting then you might be disappointed.'

author: b'jglaser'
title: b'Thanks J.K.Rowling'
body: b'Thanks J.K. Rowling for transcending me back to the crappiest reality of our everyday lives.  I like to escape reality when I read fiction, not have its darker truths shoved in my face. Awesome.'

author: b'Timothy J. Taylor'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'The story provided a realistic insight into what life in small town England.  The focus on rich vs poor, hostility on the local government council, family relationships, and life in the "projects" was well done.  I was curious about Ms. Rowling\'s ability at writing a story without magical characters and was quite pleased.  It was an easy read, interesting, and held my attention.'

author: b'squirrely'
title: b'super read'
body: b"I do not understand those who said the characters were slow to develop and were too many. This book is a really great read, taken in slowly to develop the complex relationships between all of the many characters. A real slice of life from low to high and the real lives led by so many different people. It is not a cheerful feely good book, tragic in it's content, but truthful to life."

author: b'Luz'
title: b'too many characters introduced early on'
body: b'Too many characters are introduced at the beginning and it is difficult to follow the plot otherwise the book became very interesting towards the end.'

author: b'Mel L Whitehair'
title: b'i was very dissappointed'
body: b"I didn't get past 95 pages. It went absolutely no where, slowly. I was very disappointed. The people in the book just did'nt have any action for lack of other words"

author: b'Judy L'
title: b'well totally different'
body: b'I have only started reading this book and am not sure of it but its totally different from her other works of course as its targeted to "grown ups" and I need to get into it more but so far nothing spectacular.'

author: b'FlyeMom52'
title: b'I found it to be a good read'
body: b"I normally would have been put off by the overall 3 star rating; however I downloaded a sample.  I didn't even bother to finish the sample before ordering the book, because I was hooked.  I enjoyed this book. It kept me reading.  While it wasn't the most uplifting I've ever read, it certainly was realistic, and I found it to be very well written.  Perhaps because I never read the Harry Potter books, I didn't have expectations.  Initially, I had a little trouble keeping up with the characters, but reading on, they became familiar and I continued reading to see how their individual story-lines would play out.  I had absolutely no trouble reading this book through to the finish."

author: b'SusieNYer'
title: b"It's Extraordinary"
body: b"Although I had not read the Harry Potter series, I was eager to try her effort for adults, as I surmised that she must weave a wonderful tale.  Not only was I not disappointed, I loved every word.  I very seldom read fiction, but I can't recommend it highly enough.  It's the first time in years that I couldn't put a book down, and I only wish that it had been twice as long."

author: b'Papa Smurf'
title: b"JK Rowling isn't just for kids anymore"
body: b'I had very high hopes for the first "adult" novel from Ms. Rowling.  I was not disappointed in the least.  The story was intriguing and the characters well developed. I wanted to know more about them with each page. Bravo!'

author: b'Roberta'
title: b"It ain't harry Potter!"
body: b"Haven't finished it yet, probably because I don't really care what happens.  We know JK Rowling can do better, and should."

author: b'Doris'
title: b'Not  as wonderful writing as The Harry Potter series'
body: b'So much of this book is drugs, sex and abuse.  I am disappointed. I had been looking forward to this book for quite sometime. Boo.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'brilliant dissection of human nature'
body: b'J. K. Rowling proves herself a master of her craft in this novel.  With her characteristic razor sharp wit she shows us the thoughts, motives and inner monologues of a rather large array of characters.  Male, female, teenagers to grandparents, her characters are gradually developed in such a way that we understand (even if we dislike) the actions they take... or do not take.  In so doing, Rowling offers a brilliant and unflinching commentary on human nature as well as a compelling story of the profound effects humans have on one another, both positive and negative.'

author: b'angies favorites'
title: b'Not at all what I expected!'
body: b'I had heard all the reports about this book before it came out. Saying it was entirely different than her other books was an understatement!!  I bought it though thinking since I liked her other books so much I would like this one. Boy, was I wrong.  It is so hard to follow.  Jumps all over the place.  And characters, oh my goodness you need a pad and pencil at your side to keep track. And some of the expressions she uses are definitely from where she lives.  I will finish it though as I am one once I start a book I do.  I am hoping that it will get better but being as I am half way through it I doubt it.'

author: b'Daniel'
title: b'Well written'
body: b'Solid plot, compelling characters and smoothly written. While somewhat depressing, this book is also very enjoyable and worth the read.'

author: b'carol irvin'
title: b"She could write Benson's Mapp and Lucia here instead but went darker"
body: b'This is a fairly dark work.  That is not to say that HP was not dark too but the fantasy in it was so entertaining that the darkness was more palatable.  This is very well written and is about the adults and the children of a small town in England who are thrown into control and class issues when one of the local politicians dies suddenly.  This is a town which was once all prosperously middle class or better but due to a political deal annexed some other territory which brought in lower classes. Those two classes are thrown together in this book, both teenagers and adults.'

author: b'arak86'
title: b'A Tragically Honest Portrait of the Human Condition'
body: b'J.K. Rowling wrote a novel for adults. She wrote a political statement. Most of all, she wrote a novel about humanity. Written from a third person omniscient point of view, Rowling granted the readers glimpses into the innermost thoughts and emotions of over fifteen different citizens of the small town of Pagford. The result presented itself as a tragically honest portrait of the human condition.'

author: b'dellinoHIo'
title: b'Had to put it down'
body: b'Sadly, 4 letter words and coarse vocabulary are not to my liking.  The imagination and creative author of Harry Potter series has gone to a place I prefer not to visit.  If I were able to mail this tome back to her, I would.'

author: b'Sandra'
title: b'Quite the characters!'
body: b'I enjoyed reading this book.  The characters were a  sad bunch...no redeeming features...but I enjoyed the way the story played out.'

author: b'lyly'
title: b'Much ado about nothing'
body: b'A very long book, difficult to get into the story. Not a page turner, rather a sleeper. Too bad. The Harry Potter series was so exciting...'

author: b'Sara Lewis'
title: b"Haven't been able to keep my interest."
body: b"I have tried to read this but can't get interested but will try again soon. Anxious to try to give it another chance."

author: b'G. Cooper'
title: b'Adult writing by J. K. Rowling'
body: b'I found this book informative about a slice of British life and certainly for mature readers. It was not, however, captivating or riveting to this reader.'

author: b'Douglas'
title: b'A must read!'
body: b"If you looking for muggles, and magic, you might want to reread Rowling's Harry Potter series because you will not find that here.  What you will find is the same beautifully developed characters who attempt to meet the challenges of their sometimes joyous and sometimes profoundly painful lives.  This story is a tragedy.  And it is not for children.  Kudos J.K.!  Loved every minute of it!"

author: b'j.'
title: b'ZZZZZZZZZZZ'
body: b'Ahh. New Book, by JK Rowling.'

author: b'Jill Giovan'
title: b'dreary, depressing, lackluster - skip it!'
body: b'This novel is so dreary, depressing and hopeless.  The multitude of characters are almost all unlikeable and not well-developed, the tone cynical. Rather shocking, considering how good the character development was in the HP series.  The HP characters seemed like real people to me, but these characters are cardboard caricatures.  I came away with nothing of value.  This book is not worth the time it takes to read it.  Very disappointing.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Worth the read'
body: b"This novel has had mixed reviews in New Zealand and a number have implied that it doesn't have the impact of Harry Potter so it isn't worth reading. They will have missed out. This is small town connections and in each of the characters we can see (unfortunately) aspects of our own lives and the lives of those around us. JK Rowling takes one incident, the death of Barry Fairbrother and then proceeds to see how this affects the lives of his family, friends and acquaintences. The characters I found were realistic. It was an easy, interesting read and one I recommend."

author: b'Nancy F. Willems'
title: b'WAY OVER RATED!'
body: b'The characters were developed very slowly which gave you more time to dislike them.  This book was like watching grass grow.  Total waste of time and money.'

author: b'Liz Wright'
title: b'A huge cast of characters and a decent plot line'
body: b'I enjoyed this book more than I expected to, given some of the prior reviews.  The book contains multiple intersecting story lines concerning a whole cast of characters.  I almost needed a score card to keep track of how everyone was related.  But I did find I was interested in all the different story lines. And it was a quick read.  My main complaint was that I found the ending unsatisfying.'

author: b'briante'
title: b'Very Interesting'
body: b'I had tried to read Harry Potter years ago and could not get past page 10.  This book, while not great, held my attention because of her wonderful writing.  I hope she does more adult novel.'

author: b'readlikebreathing'
title: b'Disturbingly and Gloriously Human'
body: b"I definitely waited a while to read this one, and then had to give myself a day to recover after finishing it before I could attempt a review. Initially I scared myself into thinking it wouldn't live up to the standards of Harry Potter and I would come away feeling disappointed."

author: b'Colleen Frobose'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"I was looking forward to this book. I thought it had the possibility to be great having read all the Harry Potter books and expecting the same depth of plot and richness of characters. However I found Barry Fairweather's death disappointingly early.  The teens lacked authenticity. The adults were confusingly indistinct in some parts of the book and local politics are just not that thrilling. The plot was enough for a short story but not for a book. Rowling used her usual rich description but I found myself wanting more story line.  I bought it at the airport and put it down well before the end of my eight hour flight..."

author: b'charlesehenry'
title: b'A work in progress'
body: b'I have not finished this book yet - only 1/3 done - but it is an interesting departure from the Potter series, and I will be interested to see where she goes with this mini-societal adventure. Quite British (what a surprise!)'

author: b'avid reader'
title: b'another well written book from J.K. Rowling'
body: b'I thoroughly enjoyed this complex set of characters set within the confines of an English country village. I am from England and totally related to the local dialogue and social mores of citizens in a small village. I could see perhaps that American readers might have difficulty understanding some of the slang or colloquial language used in the written dialog. I so enjoyed the book that I read it straight through. As usual, J.K. Rowling writes about interesting characters and the complications in their lives, both secret and public. This book is  written about the common human conditions,  and aspirations, and personal secrets,  that are found everywhere in life, whether in a big city or small village.'

author: b'Carolyn'
title: b'No Harry Potter Magic here!'
body: b'I was hoping to break my antipathy towards the Potter goddesses writing but no such luck! I found the first four chapters so hard-going that I have had to take a break to regain my strength...I may try to reread it when I feel I have nothing left to read in the world and/or lose the will to live ~ until then, I can manage to live with this drivel.'

author: b'Cara'
title: b'Great novel'
body: b'This book is extremely sad, and not at all like HP. Rowling is a brilliant writer... The beginning of this book was quite slow, but it definitely picked up and amazed me. Very sad ending, vulgar writing, but very realistic. Must read.'

author: b'Mona L. Stokes'
title: b'Not a likeable character in the book.'
body: b"Have to admit, I expected it to be more interesting.  I kept reading just to see where she was going, I guess I hoped it would get better.  It didn't."

author: b'Richard L. Thomas'
title: b'What happened?'
body: b"Way too many characters to keep track of, had trouble following who was who, what they were doing and how it related to the story.  Finally gave up.  Surprised because couldn't put the HP series down."

author: b'Blueheeler'
title: b'Ho hum'
body: b'Stop at Harry Potter. Bought this for the Rowlings name and really cannot think of any comment other than it was ordinary.'

author: b'P. Oberlander'
title: b'pretty Good'
body: b'I was interested in reading this book because I was interested to see how J.K. Rowling would come out from the shadow of Harry Potter. I was pleasantly surprised. It was more adult than I expected and touched on very important social issues.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Still my favorite author!'
body: b"This book is a study of characters. The plot serves that end. Beautifully written, well-planned, and carried to an ending that left me thinking for days. I'm only sad that I don't know when there will be another J.K. Rowling to read!"

author: b'ebaston'
title: b'snore.'
body: b"I Couldn't get through the first 5% of the book. There were to many characters and not enough substance to keep me interested."

author: b'Isabela Cantos'
title: b'The book is awesome, even though is way too different from Harry Potter. J. K. Rowling shows us the marvelous writer she is.'
body: b'Even though this book is way too different from Harry Potter, J. K. Rowling is still an amazing writer. You should totally read it!'

author: b'Rachel'
title: b'Welcome to Pagford!'
body: b'Yes, Pagford. No, not Hogwarts. Pagford.'

author: b'selinz'
title: b'Brilliant, engaging, and superbly entertaining'
body: b'I was anxious to read this as I was thoroughly entertained by the HP series. I have listened to close to 300 audio books over the last 10 years and as such, have been exposed to many styles of fiction and non-fiction. My figure of merit is "am I pulled in." Do I finish my 50 mile each way commute and think "I don\'t even remember it?" Well, this one passes that. Rowling is the queen if villians and victims. This was certainly the case in HP and we see much of the same thing here. You are compelled to hate some characters, love some characters, and change you mind through the reading.'

author: b'sundaymorning'
title: b'modern empathy'
body: b"The NYT reviewer didn't like the book. The book may be better read by someone not expecting more Harry Potter (me), someone interested in the limits and craziness of politics (me again) and someone trying to grasp the evils of poverty and disconnection in the modern world (yup, me). I think of Rowling here as a modern Dickens who doesn't allow the reader to put child poverty, human misery and risk into the nostalgic mists of ye olde times. The book hurts."

author: b'sg'
title: b'tough read'
body: b"This book is confusing with multiple run on sentence, stretched allusions and characters who are hard to follow.  I am half way through the book and don't think I will even finish it"

author: b'juliette hamilton'
title: b'Fabulous book'
body: b'I highly recommend it, it shows how selfish human beings are and how they only really think about themselves. Am impressed with J K Rowling.'

author: b'G. Moerschel'
title: b'Too Bad...'
body: b'After reading 194 pages and still not "into" the book, I quit.  What a huge disappointment for me on Rowling, I expected so much more.  Maybe she should have taken Harper Lee\'s advice.  "I\'ll put it this way. When you have hit the pinnacle, how would you feel about writing more? Would you feel like you\'re competing with yourself?"'

author: b'Irene'
title: b'Great characters'
body: b"I really enjoyed this book and loved the author's character descriptions, although can't imagine that I would want any one of them to be my friend."

author: b'Momof7'
title: b'Outrageous language'
body: b'I realize author branching out but this was branching too'

author: b'Nancy Kerr'
title: b'How could J.K. Rowling be so disappointing?'
body: b"I truly didn't think it was possible for J.K. Rowling to write anything but outstanding works of literature which is why I plodded through the most boring ,badly written  book I have ever read in The Casual Vacancy. The characters in this book were dull, uninteresting, and in all cases the most unappealing mean spirited people that could possibly live in one town. The entire town of Pagford and The Fields was at war ,and one could only deplore man's inhumanity to man as represented in all of Rowling's characters in this book. We can only hope that Rowling  gets back to writing in her true genre of magical characters in a world of fantasy ,as opposed to dwelling on depressing characters living in their dull and uninteresting world."

author: b'Ella62'
title: b'Kind of Like A Soap Opera'
body: b"While The Casual Vacancy must have required a lot of effort and skill to write, it just did not work for me.  It was complicated, too busy and confusing.  It reminded me of a TV Soap Opera with all the different characters (most of whom also had a nickname...hard to keep up with) and all of the plot lines.  Every time I picked the book back up I would have to reacquaint myself with all of the characters.  Also didn't care for the ending.  Don't want to give anything away but didn't really think it needed to end that way and it did not leave me wanting more."

author: b'Deb'
title: b'Rowling is a winner!'
body: b"Rowling's ability to delve into her character's motivations for their actions is spot-on.  The class structure these characters adhere to it so true......this story could have been set anywhere, and the characters would act the same.  Great literature!"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Give it a chance!'
body: b"I realize I'm in the minority, but I thought it was a fantastic book. A little depressing, a little more vulgar than Harry Potter (okay, a lot more vulgar), but I thought it was written well and had great character development through the way. If you go into it expecting HP, you're going to be thoroughly disappointed. If you go into it with an open mind, you might find that you enjoy it."

author: b'Megan'
title: b'Another Harry Potter Please'
body: b'Only worth reading due to her being the author of Harry Potter.  Feels like she is trying to hard to depart from Harry Potter and be a "real" author with a grown up novel.'

author: b'Sammy'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy - JK Rowling'
body: b'This book was described as new and in excellent condition but there was markings all over the front cover like dried glue or something had taken the new "sheen" off.  It was a gift, so I was disappointed that it didn\'t look new.'

author: b'Clair Weiss'
title: b'Just got started with the book'
body: b"I got interested in the book after I saw Ms Rowling's TV interview with Charlie Rose. She came across as a sharp observer of people's lives in their day-to-day situations (despite of her billionaire status and fabulous success with Harry Potter)."

author: b'V. Vollmer'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'I was expecting so much more from this author.  I did read the whole book but it was a struggle.'

author: b'Kindle Customer Patricia Bruner'
title: b'Not what I expected'
body: b"After having read all of J.K Rowling's Harry Potter books I expected more from her than this.  Because of the price I paid for it, I had to finish the book."

author: b'C. Uhres-Todd'
title: b'A breath of fresh air'
body: b'Not what you expect after reading the Harry Potter books. Very British writing, dry humour, wonderful insight. Loved it. Disturbing and shocking at times, but good to challenge your thinking especially in regards to teenager world. Recommend!'

author: b'S. L. Walker'
title: b'Village life down to a tee'
body: b"Most of us will know someone like each and every character in this book. Great observation of archetypal English behaviour. It's what makes you keep on reading an otherwise unremarkable story."

author: b'Wendell Corneil'
title: b'disappointing'
body: b'You would think the woman who wrote the Harry P. books would have a larger vocabulary than just filth.  Very disappointing.'

author: b'Sissy'
title: b'Shame on Little Brown!'
body: b"Clearly, Little Brown was intimidated by Rowling's stardom and failed to critically edit her work.  With nearly 30 characters introduced in as many pages, there is no development or distinction to any.  The dialogue, written in some form of British local dialect, is difficult to understand and requires slow reading to figure it out. The plot develops ever so painfully slowly...to the point where the reader seriously considers calling it quits numerous times. Save your money...save your time. So many excellent books to read, including the Harry Potter stories....but this is definitely not one."

author: b'J. Bergauer'
title: b'BLAND PROSE NOT FOR CONSUMPTION'
body: b'Best part of the book is the title!  Unfortunately, this is a dull book with limited character development, weak dialogue and sexual references that take the narrative nowhere. I\'ve read a few reviews saying the last 100 pages are good but there are too many great books published to spend hours getting there so I won\'t give "Casual Vacancy" anymore of my leisure reading time.'

author: b'ola fityani'
title: b'Genuis'
body: b'Rowling sculptures her characters.You feel them , you visualize each and everyone of them.Reading The Casual Vacancy is a pleasure in every aspect. Made me feel I was watching a movie with my own vision of the characters. Rowling has a magical way of expressive language and choice of words..What a pleasure.Brilliant author, brilliant read.'

author: b'Ssloane'
title: b'Depressing --- take Prozac before reading'
body: b'I pre-ordered the book on audio CD\'s to listen to in the car.  A fan of Rowling\'s work, I greatly anticipated "reading" it.  But the only redeeming feature of this book was the narrator, who did a brilliant job. The book is told over a set of 15 CD\'s and I loaded them into my vehicle\'s CD player five at a time.  At the end of the fifth CD I contemplated tossing the whole thing in the garbage, but my desire to find out what happens to Krystal and Robbie Weedon forced me to soldier on.'

author: b'Stephen Zack'
title: b'A Breakdown of Communication in an English Town'
body: b'One of the main characters drops dead on the second page.  You spend the next couple hundred pages sorting out the large cast of characters, their children, all their connections and their nicknames.  JKR should have a glossary for names. It is very entertaining and hard to put the book down once  you learn the names and relationships of many characters.  It almost seems like a sequel.'

author: b'Chiquita'
title: b"Where's the Harry Magic?"
body: b"As an avid Harry Potter reader, as most of the people that rushed to read this book are, I had high expectations. I felt extremely let down, though.  Rowling seems to forget that she only has one book to introduce characters, not 7.  The amount of people and their stories gets confusing, especially in the first third of the book. It takes a long time to keep track of who's who, and by the time I figured it out, I think I had lost some of the plot.  The storyline is so-so, but the last 30 pages or so were probably the only really good part of the book. Don't read it just because you're a fan of Rowling. You might find yourself very disappointed."

author: b'robin'
title: b'Unbelievable'
body: b"I looked forward to reading this book as I devoured her prior writings with glee. However, this book was depressing, violent, sad, disgusting, with no redeeming qualities. I love to read and Hated reading this book. I just don't get it. Rowling is a great writer. Why this? Why in this manner?"

author: b'Dark Knight'
title: b'Below expectation'
body: b'This is nothing compared to Harry Potter Series. So as a fan of Harry potter I bought this book but was highly disappointed. the story is slow and boring. Revolves around a small town politics.'

author: b'Jean Myles'
title: b'Great Character Development and Plausible Story'
body: b"Great characters, not lovable, but developed extremely well. JK Rowling is an amazing writer, Harry Potter or otherwise. Some reviews are criticizing the lack of plot, but for me there doesn't always have to be a profound, dramatic, or twist ending plot.  The characters, relationships, and plausibility are what make Casual Vacancy a good read.  My only criticism is the length, it could have been shorter without losing it's power."

author: b'George A Kennedy'
title: b'A realistic, satiric view of small town English life and classes.'
body: b'This is a well written book, a page-turner. The female characters are treated with more sympathy than the male characters, in general. My only real objection to the work is the excess of foul language. It may be realistic (though how would Rowling know?), but colloquialism could be suggested more subtlily.'

author: b'Angela Liefer'
title: b'Something different'
body: b"I truly enjoyed the characters in this book.  They were real, more real than we would like to admit.  The story lines moved along at a good clip. I had some trouble, at first, keeping the characters and various relationships straight, it was worth it in the end to pay attention.  As a social services professional, the story lines struck me as being sadly realistic.  As much as I hated that the ending was not a happy fantasy, it was true and plays out all too often in the world today.  This book explores some of the same themes as Harry Potter but in a much more mature and frank way.  It is a book I will probably read again and will recommend to anyone who asks (even those who don't ask, unfortunately for my friends)."

author: b'Ann'
title: b'Just okay'
body: b"I was curious how this writer of the great Harry Potter series was going to make this transition to adult fiction. I was less than impressed. It didn't move along as well as I might have desired. The characters and their situations, which were many, had been given too much description. You had to wade through this novel."

author: b'MiddleK'
title: b'stereotypes galore'
body: b'I was very dissapointed with this book. It was a bore and so full of stereotypical characters it was annoying.  Barely made it all the way through. Not worth the $$$but the cover art is cool so at least it looks good in the bookcase.'

author: b'karin wiles'
title: b"Don't rush to read"
body: b"I thought it was interesting but the characters weren't as detailed as JK Rowling's characters from the Harry Potter books. It left me unsatisfied."

author: b'SadieHMayfield'
title: b'A Rowling World Without the Magic'
body: b"I loved it. I was an avid Harry Potter fan as a child and was reticent to read something by Rowling what was not related to the books I had loved so dearly but I am glad I did. I think it was a brutally honest book about the world that people think that they live and the realities that they refuse to accept because it may not be what they had pictured their life looking like. It does have a heavy amount of swearing and sexual references, but then again it is written for adults and not young adults so let's hope people can handle it. If you are not a fan of books such as Girl, Interrupted then don't pick this up. It is well written and the multiple voices weave together a beautiful story that is heart wrenching and wonderfully written."

author: b'Valerie J'
title: b"If I hadn't read Harry Potter"
body: b"If I hadn't read Harry Potter, I'd give this book 4 stars so that's what it's getting. I had to really separate myself from the stories I grew up with and loved in Harry Potter. Enough about HP though... this was actually a good book in the end. It's not an easy read and the characters were not very likable at first. The first half of the book was really slow but once you get past part three, it really picks up and becomes interesting. The ending was not what I expected and overall the book was very dark. I'm glad I pushed through to the end though. JK Rowling's writing style in this book is totally different than what I am used to. I love the way she switches which character's mind you're in. It makes reading the book kind of fun once you get used to it."

author: b'Brenda J. Barnett'
title: b"I wouldn't spend the money a 2nd time"
body: b'I read it because I invested in it - but otherwise I would have set the book down.  Not a quality book by any means.  So disappointing!'

author: b'H J Crymble'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'Dragged on too much, too many different characters, gave up quarter of the way through as story never seemed to get going.'

author: b'Sherry Price'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'I loved the Harry Potter Books because of the positive tone to them.  This story was just too dark for me.  The humor eluded me - which might be due to the fact that I am an American instead of British.'

author: b'Mg Gallegos13'
title: b'Well written but I hated the characters'
body: b"I eagerly looked forward to Rowling's first adult novel. I must admit, I did not finish it. It is very well written but I couldn't like any of the various characters (and there are a lot of them). Quite frankly, I don't like books with f-words and cranky teen-agers and selfish housewives, and brutish husbands. So this could well be a classic book that stands up to the ages (like I said, it is very well written) but it is definitely not one that I want to read so I'm not going to finish it, except maybe the last chapter to see where it all ends."

author: b')'
title: b'I think I was expecting more from this author'
body: b'In this book there were no people with noble intentions.  I think you\'d have to believe that people are inherently bad to have written like this.  The only "good guy" is someone who is dead.  It\'s not realistic and it\'s a big big downer.  I coud not wait to get through this book, constantly hoping for some goodness to shine through.  In the end...I just got to the end.  It was a complete waste of time.  No redeeming features.'

author: b'AE'
title: b'A waste of time'
body: b'This is a terrible book. I bought it after hearing Ms Rowling\'s evening with Charlie Rose and found her charming, unpretentious and totally honest. The book has been a great disappointment, I suspect that had she tried to publish it before the Potter books and resulting fame The Casual Vacancy would not have been published. The language is appalling, the characters \'universally losers" and a total lack of a meaningful message. Don\'t waste your time or money!'

author: b'Charles E.Hogan'
title: b"You've got to be kidding!!!"
body: b"Really? I don't care who the writer is, when every other word is the f-bomb and we turn horrid sexual encounters of rape and incest almost to the point of erotic, someone has a sick mind.  And a resolution ends with a drug overdose of a 16 year old after her 3 year old brother drowns because the teen sister was shagging in the bushes and left him unattended??!!!?????  Every sick and twisted event that parents dread their teens might get involved in is in this story so parent beware! Your teens that grew up reading Harry are going to want to read this. Don't go there.  She should have used a pen name, but then the book would have never sold"

author: b'Sarah'
title: b'I ended up liking it!'
body: b"There are many things JK Rowling is good at but I think one of the best is how she writes teenagers. She did it well in Harry Potter and she's done it again here, though here the teenagers are a little less magical and a lot more realistic and sometimes dark."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Was just okay'
body: b"It wasn't anything like I thought it would be. I have not read the Harry Potter books so I wasn't comparing this work with anything else the author had written. I didn't really find any redeeming qualities to the characters in the book. Nothing redemptive as far as I could tell."

author: b'Cindy Ratliff'
title: b'J.K Rowling is a diverse as well as talented writer'
body: b'As with her first endeavor, I wait anxiously for her next. Her whimsical humor and depth of understanding human nature shines through her writing; she never fails to entertain and move her readers.'

author: b'Meg Cox'
title: b'Now that she has got this off her chest....'
body: b'.. Maybe the next non-Harry Potter novel will be good. I neither expected, nor wanted, the book to be just like her kid wizard series, but I found it a really difficult slog. I only pushed through to the end due to the strong critical reviews, and I only give it three stars out of respect to her intentions.'

author: b'Robert Merrill'
title: b'sucks'
body: b'Its no Harry Potter... I was very disappointed. Not at all what I expected after reading all 7 Harry Potter books.'

author: b'Linda Murray'
title: b'Ok not interesting to keep my attention'
body: b'Ok, not as good as the Potter series. I could not get into this book. I found it boring. I would not recommend it.'

author: b'Clare albrey'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Well I didn't want to read this book but it was chosen by our Book Club.  It is an awful story but very well written and you do want to get to the end to find out what happens."

author: b'Kay'
title: b'Started out slow and got better as I read.'
body: b"I don't usually care that much for stories set in London, but this one did get to me after a few chapters. More of a charactor study than I would have thought."

author: b'geordie'
title: b'This is no Harry Potter.................'
body: b"...........and thats a good thing! Totally different and depressing but a beautifully crafted novel about the inner workings of a small English village and the social and economic differences that lie within. Its not without its humour but don't read it expecting to be uplifted, its dark and gritty and nobody comes out of it smelling of roses."

author: b'Margaret L Dawson'
title: b'Not my cup of tea'
body: b"If I don't connect with a book within the first 50 pages, I usually abandon it. There are just too many books to be read without wasting time on one I don't like.  I stuck with this all the way through because of the author. Wish I'd quit after the first 50."

author: b'Connie'
title: b'What a disappointment'
body: b'I was really excited about reading JK Rowling\'s first novel for adults.  As a huge Harry Potter fan I was sure this book would live up to the standard set by that book series.  I was seriously disappointed.  "The Casual Vacancy" was unremittingly dark and depressing.  There was exactly one sympathetic character in the entire 500+ pages and she was killed off at the end.  Should I consider buying one of her books in the future I will buy a print copy so I can return it if it is of similarly poor quality.'

author: b'Dr. Barb'
title: b'Extremely immature writing.'
body: b'Not a book for adults but a book with a childish theme written around adults. J.K. Rowling should stick to writing for children and young adults not the mature reader.'

author: b'Monty'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'Over verbose and under-edited. Full of characters which were poorly explored and universally devoid of any empathetic character. However, a successful observational exercise of collective human failure.'

author: b'Shari Luckhurst'
title: b'It truly is vacant!!!'
body: b"I am 2 thirds through and am struggling every day to get to the end. I normally plough through a good book, but have been trying to finish this for 6 weeks. It still isn't going anywhere. I am waiting for the crescendo, the interesting tidbit, that keeps me wondering and looking forward to reading the next chapter. It is deadly boring, banal and leaves me asking why I paid good money for it. I am forever hopeful that the climax is worth it. Perhaps, it will not get there. Maybe, I won't bother finishing it......that would be a first."

author: b'WOW Girl'
title: b'What a disappointment'
body: b'This worthless book only got one star because I had to give it one to submit the review.'

author: b'blueann'
title: b'It was so hard to get into'
body: b'I found the Casual Vacancy very hard to get into from the start. It was just okay.  So many characters to remember.'

author: b'Annette Loebach Bater'
title: b'Variety of interesting characters and plots'
body: b'I liked everything about it, including the non-Hollywoood ending.  Great writing, rich characters and interesting story.  A screenplay MUST be next!'

author: b'Discerning Shopper'
title: b'Bored to tears'
body: b'Absolutely nothing to keep your attention.  I thought that I understood her writing style and was looking forward to a different venue, but, the storyline was boring and trivial.'

author: b'Kathie'
title: b"Don't waste your valuable time."
body: b'Disappointing.  Depressing. Disgusting.'

author: b'bkamiens@lawrenceville.org'
title: b'Book just ok'
body: b'The book was just ok. It was hard to follow in the beginning with the introduction of so many characters, but the book did fall in nicely at the end.  I must say that I was  A little disappointed since the Potter books were so great.  I think J.K. needed an outlet to swear and introduce sex.'

author: b'twinreader'
title: b'Pleased'
body: b"First off let me say that not too many people take their time to write about and get to understand how the less than perfect side of society think, feel, function and live.  This book is hard to get into.  The first hundred pages are bogged down with many characters and happenings that intertwine and make the story great in the end.  I found it difficult to put the book down after that though.  I thought Ms. Rowling did an excellent job portraying the many characters in her story.  The ending of this book is stomachable if you've read it before you begin, then you know what's coming.  You certainly feel invested in the town by the end, I'm just not sure Rowling wrapped the characters' individual stories as well as she could have.  I think she served what she thought as justice to their shortcomings and left it at that. I would have liked her to finish it better all around."

author: b'Shae L'
title: b'Slow Beginning, Great Ending'
body: b'This is a side of J.K. that was not seen in any of the Harry Potter books. If you are expecting wizards and trolls, or charms and curses, this is NOT the book for you. If you can manage to get past the first half (which starts off very slow), where the whole gang of characters and their relationships are introduced in minute detail, then you are in for a wild ride. Some of the darkest, cruelest, and most vulnerable sides of all people are put into full spotlight in this scandalous book. Page by page I found myself not only questioning the characters, but myself and my beliefs as well. What is done in the dark literally comes into the light throughout the story. And, if you give it even half the chance (and manage to cast anything to do with Harry Potter completeley out of your mind) then you will enjoy this as much as I did.'

author: b'K. Ponce'
title: b'Small Town with Big Problems'
body: b"This group of humans with flaws, put together with their small town politics is so very real in a way which is frightening at times.  The characters' stories click together piece by piece, building to a clear need for some serious soul searching or certain catastrophe.  You can't stop in the middle of the book!"

author: b'Kim Rizzi'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I was so disappointed in this book, mainly becacause there is not one like able character. Rowling does not disappoint with her writing style.'

author: b'Erica Bell'
title: b'an almost perfect novel'
body: b"I'm a little perplexed by the mixed reviews this book is receiving.  I was never a Harry Potter fan, although my children devoured the books (I found myself disturbed by his bratty messiah complex), and I opened this book with no real expectation of pleasure."

author: b'Stan'
title: b'OK for me'
body: b'I enjoyed the book. Being English I could relate to the characters and the local situatation. American readers might find it difficult.'

author: b'Natalie'
title: b'Well-written, great storyline.'
body: b"Despite being a devoted fan of the Harry Potter series, I read this book without Potter and friends in mind. I knew this book was intended for adults and that it was supposed to be completely different than her previous books and I went into the story knowing this. That is my first suggestion for potential readers: don't expect Harry, this is a completely different book."

author: b'KaytiAnne'
title: b'Oh, Jo!'
body: b'When JK Rowling was on Charlie Rose, she said that the central theme of this novel was about who is worth saving, and what price the saving is worth. That is important to keep in mind as you are introduced to so many unlikable, and yet entirely realistic characters. Each of them needs to be saved from something, and each of them believes salvation lies down a different path. Discovering what lies at the end of each path is the joy and the heartbreak of this complex, emotional novel.'

author: b'Duncan'
title: b'A good, casual read'
body: b'Inevitably, this was always going to get a huge level of interest from critics, and it would have had to have been outstanding to stand up to expectations.'

author: b'jo merrill'
title: b'great read'
body: b'i never read harry potter - i loved this book . . . she is an excellent writer . . . i hope she does more along this story line . . .'

author: b'BettyBoop'
title: b'Love it'
body: b"Good book by a Great author. Far from her Harry Potter seruies, It's nice to see something for us aduts,"

author: b'Neil Henderson'
title: b'Hard going'
body: b"Not a particularly well written story - I'm finding it hard going compared to East of Eden by John Steinbeck."

author: b'endekleva'
title: b'Wonderful Character Development, Intriguing Small Town Politics'
body: b"I was so curious about this book, after being (obviously) a Harry Potter fan and reading the critics reviews and reviews on Amazon, I had to read it.  I had no expectations at all when I began the book, and certainly didn't expect any Harry Potter influences and I was rewarded with a great reading experience.  JK Rowling did an excellent job of developing her characters, drawing from their background and childhood experiences and revealing more and more about the characters as the plot developed.  The heart-wrenching scenes involving the Weedon household as well as the inner turmoil of all the characters were so well written you felt like you knew everyone personally.  The politics surrounding the 'casual vacancy' were very intriguing.  I couldn't stop reading this book and I completely disagree with the negative reviews about it.  I eagerly await the next installation of JK Rowling's fabulous career."

author: b'Rama Kocherlakota'
title: b'A great novel - better than Harry Potter'
body: b"I have been a fan of J.K. Rowling since I first picked up Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone but I've never enjoyed anything she's written as much as The Casual Vacancy.  It appears that being freed from the fetters of her imagined magical world has allowed her to show us a view of the real world, the one in which we all live, that is more vibrant and alive than anything Harry, Ron and Hermione could experience."

author: b'Melinda'
title: b'If we forget about wanting Wizards and Magic, this is a fine story with lessons to teach.'
body: b'Well written, interesting charters, insights and tragedy.  Not magic and mystery, but a Barabara Kingsolver type review of social issues from within a story.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Dark'
body: b"If I had realized this book was so depressing, I never would have ordered it. I like to read books that improve my life, entertain, or a can't put this book down until I finish it even if it is 2:00 am."

author: b'Lisa  Connors'
title: b"Couldn't finish it..."
body: b'I really tried hard to continue with reading this book, but it just didn\'t grab me.  Thank goodness I read it on my kindle as I often had to use the dictionary to work out what she was on about. It felt like she was trying too hard to write an "adult" book, and used her thesaurus to through in grown up words. characters and plot did nothing for me - but I have to admit I didn\'t finish it and it may have gotten better.  I just couldn\'t force myself to go any further. Sorry. Still love J.K. Rowling.'

author: b'Jacqueline Gum'
title: b'Dismal'
body: b"I can think of few books that I have disliked more. It's dreary and overly long filled with characters that are dismal and remain so until the very dismal end. I'm positively miffed to have spent money on the audio version for a long drive. This book made that drive twice as long. Would not recommend."

author: b'L. Polin'
title: b'Meh'
body: b"Okay, it's her first departure from the Potter series. I hope she keeps writing. This was good enough for the Kindle price but borrow it rather than buy it if you can."

author: b'Glenn S. Brauer'
title: b'Nobody home'
body: b"O.K. Count me as yet another reader who happened to enjoy the whole Harry Potter thing, but this one is a doozie of a bore. J.K. couldn't be more pedestrian now that she's decided to come down to the grim world most of us inhabit. Makes you wonder why she decided to become so darned dull."

author: b'SAS'
title: b'Pass on this one...'
body: b'I was really disappointed in this book. All the characters were so unhappy, and the book ended up in my unfinished pile. Loved the Harry Potter series and would definitely recommend it!'

author: b'JC'
title: b'Hated it, now love it.'
body: b'I started off reading the negative reviews, because after finishing the book last night, I was left feeling sickened, sad, and angry.  So naturally, I thought I must not like this book.  With some time to mull it over, I am really starting to appreciate the truth of the story.  A peek behind the curtain is often hard to stomach, and JK Rowling nailed that feeling, and then some.  American audiences are used to a happy ending and lots of comeuppance.  You will find none of that here.  Almost all of the characters are despicable, petty, judgmental, and cruel, yet there is good reason for their behavior.  Pagford is anytown anywhere, and Rowling has deftly unmasked what lurks silently in the hearts of human beings.'

author: b'S. Beck'
title: b"I'll Say No More about A CASUAL VACANCY"
body: b"I found this to be a complete bore.  Rowling's writing was brilliant throughout the Harry Potter Phenomenom but this - this was an absolute waste of my money.  I didn't expect the wizardry of Hogwarts nor did I expect Harry to make a cameo but I did expect writing that took me into another interesting world created by JKR - NOT SO.  I was taught that if I had nothing good to say, say nothing at all.  This review will end now before I go off on my REAL thoughts about A Casual Vacancy."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'brutal'
body: b'one amazon reviewer questioned what had happened to Ms Rowling to make her hate humanity and write about characters who have no redemptive qualities.'

author: b'Boyko Ovcharov'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"JK Rowling's style and narrative skills are really enjoyable. This is a definite and dramatic shift from her usual target audience, i.e. children; which is really brave and worthy of praise. I know good things come at a price, however, some price reductions or promotions would be warmly welcome. At the end of the day, I acknowledge it is a matter of marketing and PR."

author: b'Mon Dobrin'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I'm not sure what I was expecting when I picked up this book but I did find that she relies too much on two very strong themes that she focused on heavily in the later Harry Potter books. It is possible to write a good, moving story that isn't focused on death and teen angst, however she leans very heavily on these devices. The messages about the world we see and the lives that are actually behind them are strong, which is why I'm plowing through to the end, but it drags. It almost feels like she is trying to beat us over the head with the grit of life and death."

author: b'Tinny'
title: b'Great read, sad subject matter.'
body: b'Having a toddler myself I found this book tugged at my heart strings.  I did enjoy the book thoroughly however it left me feeling rather sad and I needed to read something upbeat to cheer myself up.'

author: b'George Mitchell'
title: b'Unremarkable, but certainly not terrible'
body: b"This is not so much bad as just not great.  JK Rowling shows off her strengths -- particularly being able to get inside the head of middle-aged wives and adolescent boys with stunning authenticity -- but the weakness here is the lack of any real compelling storyline.  In some ways, that is the most disappointing part of this book because that was exactly what she did so well with Harry Potter.  It is also dark to the point of being the anti-Potter.  Rowling sought to write an adult novel and she ended up taking tragedy to an extreme her fans were probably not expecting.  Worth a read, but don't expect a masterpiece."

author: b'jeanette scheetz'
title: b'Good'
body: b'Found it interesting was eager to read her new style away from Harry Potter - was impressed and a good read'

author: b'Karen A. Wyle'
title: b'Jane Austen redux'
body: b"Coming from Rowling's Harry Potter series to her first book for adults, I had not anticipated how much it would remind me of the novels of Jane Austen.  Austen famously worked with a small canvas, focusing on the foibles and concerns of residents of small and insular communities. Rowling does the same. If one imagines Austen transplanted to the present, freed from any pressure to adhere to romantic conventions, and urged to give reign to all her darker and more cynical impulses, we might have something like this novel."

author: b'Elizabeth A. Garvin'
title: b'Completely different and yet distinctively Rowling'
body: b'Rowling is a compelling storyteller, and though this setting is far from the magical world of Harry Potter, it is another hard-to-put-down book. Approach it with an open mind, and you will find a well-written, well-told contemporary novel.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Riveting in its realism'
body: b'This book is the antithesis of fantasy. It should be read separate and apart from Harry Potter. There simply is no vestige of Harry Potter in this book.'

author: b'George C. King'
title: b'Rowling rocks!'
body: b"I'm not a fan of Harry Potter, but I'm now a fan of J.K. Rowling's The Casual Vacancy. I read the book compulsively on my Kindle, and my interest never lagged. The town of Pagford, England, is peopled by Rowling with a wide-ranging assortment of characters, whose thoughts propel the story. I'm reminded of John Updike and early Stephen King (before verbosity took over), who are unsurpassed at getting inside their characters' heads. Some who didn't like this novel have complained that the characters were unlikable, that they had no redeeming qualities. I would ask these critics about the innermost thoughts of their own friends and neighbors, and even themselves. If we knew what everyone was really thinking, would we find them likable? Would we want others to know our own innermost thoughts? A writer does not operate under these constraints and is under no obligation make her characters user friendly. Rowling's characters wish ill of others, swear, have sex, smoke and drink, abuse those close to them, and even take drugs. In other words, they are real people."

author: b'lejan'
title: b'Good read'
body: b'Very small townish - not sure we have towns quite like this in Australia. I had to keep going back to check on the characcters.'

author: b'B. Rice'
title: b'It was okay'
body: b"I think her characterizations are very good, but the plot is lacking. I could get a good take on the characters, but she didn't make me care about them."

author: b'Kamijear'
title: b'Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling'
body: b'"Casual Vacancy"'

author: b'Kathy Moore'
title: b'big disappointment'
body: b"I honestly thought that anything that J.K. Rowling wrote would have to be great, after the Harry Potter series.  Boy, was I wrong!  I would love to have my money refunded for this book.  I kept waiting for the good stuff.  It never happened.  All I got was a headache.  This is like the longest, most disappointing bad soap opera ever!  What a waste of talent to put this kind of trash into a novel.  I'll probably never read another of her books."

author: b'Lea'
title: b'Better than people give it credit'
body: b"I actually really liked Casual Vacancy, though I can see why others don't. Yes, it does have some sexual content and swear words, but I feel like those aren't too important when considering the book as a whole. I think the main difference between this book and the Harry Potter books (if you were to compare them) is that the HP books were more for entertainment... Casual Vacancy has a larger, more significant message - or two. I wouldn't recommend it as an entertaining read though. Find something else if you're in that mood."

author: b'Tony'
title: b'A mirror on our divided society'
body: b'An extraordinary novel showing the true genius of J K Rowling. A courageous attempt to depict the damaging effect of the deep seated divisions that still exist in British society. Even more remarkable that it should have been written by the most successful and richest British author.'

author: b'Suzanne G. White'
title: b'very dark .'
body: b"If you're feeling too good- buy this book. The characters are universally unhappy and many are down right mean. Oh, for some prozac for this cast."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I found this book bland, slow and not very interesting. While JK is brilliant at describing different characters, the plot around them was just disappointing. Expected more :('

author: b'John B. Scofield, M.D.'
title: b"Mrs Rowling's story is too causual and too vacant"
body: b"This is a poorly constructed story.  Too many poorly developed characters move slowly thru petty, boring lives.  JK is trying too hard to escape her children's book writer  identity. Her title choice I think was an unconscious book review."

author: b'vetterun'
title: b'New genre;  but the same excellence and beauty of prose'
body: b'Thoroughly enjoyed the book.  She builds several parallel story lines that intertwine throughout the book and evenually come together at the climax.  Well written and pleasurable to read.  As always her prose paints vivid mental  images.  Good story even though its based on the mundane lives and happenings of several residents of a small, non-descript village without any "super-stars".'

author: b'E'
title: b'Rowling is so much more than just Harry Potter'
body: b'I am of the "Harry Potter" generation. I grew up eagerly awaiting book after book. I was never disappointed and Rowling certainly has not let me down now. The Casual Vacancy is not the next HP. Don\'t read it looking for magical creatures or for a new brand of He Who Must Not Be Named. Instead, read it to enjoy Rowling\'s superb story telling skills and to appreciate the intricacies of her well considered plot. If you consider yourself a fan of fine modern literature, then The Casual Vacancy is sure to please.'

author: b'R. Bhakta'
title: b'worth the read'
body: b'Put aside any thoughts on Harry Potter. she still has the attention to detail on characters. very good book but takes awhile to build all the characters and then it is over.'

author: b'Erica Bonomi'
title: b'Bland soap opera'
body: b"I really found this book to be a bland, tawdry look into British suburbia.  It reminded me of Days of Our Lives (British style), but much lower class....  I really couldn't get into it at all.  If you were expecting mystery, magic, or even characters you could love...... You'll be disappointed."

author: b'Dance the Night Away'
title: b"Good adult drama.  So what if it's not HP?"
body: b"This is a good drama story set in a provincial burg in the UK.  It's probably a four star book but I gave it five to offset the critics that didn't read it and rated it low or commented that it wasn't HP/Fantasy/Children's book or were expecting something else and were therefore disappointed.  Love JK's style and the Kindle version was well edited.  JK enjoys writing with a large cast of characters and it was nice to have the Kindle version to so I could keep up with the characters.  I bought this for my Christmas Book Club book exchange."

author: b'dover beach'
title: b'Manage your expectations!'
body: b"This isn't Harry Potter. Your heart won't soar while reading this, ever."

author: b'Curious but Cautious'
title: b'J K Rowlings Latest'
body: b'I was curious to see if Rowling\'s writing style would carry over into a more adult content.  I was happy to see that, although it doesn\'t "sweep you up" in quite the same way as the Potter series did, it still captures  and holds your attention and makes you want to know more about this widely divergent cast of characters. ( I see sequels a\'coming!)'

author: b'Patricia Sauerburger'
title: b'NOT Harry Potter'
body: b'I found this book to be a really long and tedious read riddled with minutia.'

author: b'jenn'
title: b'Not done Yet'
body: b"Loving every word of this book! I can't read fast enough! I have never met more despicable characters with such everyday dark secrets... To make matters worse, every characters flaw is undeniably human nature.... you can't help but see yourself in some of their thoughts and rooting for the downfall of each one anyway"

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Sometimes, Different Is Good!'
body: b'Okay, so...okay.'

author: b'Sharon Dean'
title: b'Sophmoric interlude.'
body: b'I went through some of the reviews for this widely anticipated book. JK Rowling, the totally famous author of the Harry Potter books, I even excepted something different because she had not previously been an author writing "adult" books.'

author: b'Catty'
title: b'Potential classic'
body: b"I was so psyched to read this book that I paid the exorbitant asking price.  Then I began reading and I found it a slow starter.  Usually, this would be death to a book for me, but I plowed on.  I wasn't going to give up on such a talented writer and I'm glad I didn't.  The book is about the ripple effects the death of one man has on a small town, and it was very interesting.  Rowling's talent is evident in bringing the lives of many characters into one story showing how the lives intersect and influence each other.  This is a very European story.  Americans like bright, light, entertaining stories, but Europeans...not so much.  They usually prefer movies and books that are more realistic, and The Casual Vacancy fit the order.  Even though I started out reading as an American, I adapted and really enjoyed the downhill half of the book.  It's worth reading."

author: b'Frank McGowan'
title: b'Small - like Hell itself'
body: b'I have often struggled to describe my view of heaven, but when it comes to depicting hell, read The Casual Vacancy.'

author: b'Vicki Appleby'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b"It arrived very fast, and is in great shape. It's a gift for Xmas, I'm sure they'll love it!"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'slow and boring'
body: b"i have only read 30% of the book and I don't like it. there a lot of characters and I am having hard time keeping them straight. I am also not crazy about the story. I will keep reading the book because I like to finish books I started. If my opinion changes i will edit my view."

author: b'Crystal @ I Totally Paused!'
title: b'A lovely piece of literature from a well known author'
body: b"Like many other readers, I was delighted to hear awhile back that JK Rowling had an adult novel for us...adult like it was written for adults, not that it was going to be some erotic romance or anything like that.  I preordered a copy the day it became available, and lamented the fact that I couldn't pick it up as soon as it arrived, since I was traveling overseas at the time.  Meanwhile, as reviews started popping up around the internet, I was disappointed to read that people seem to have quite mixed opinions about this novel."

author: b'bookologist'
title: b'the Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Rowlings educates readers about a London they may not know exists. The adolescents are dark and needy like their adult counterparts. Vengeance proves futile and sad. The broken are never fixed, but the survivors are stronger and more compassionate as a result of their travails.  A fast-paced and engaging book.'

author: b'Gary Severance'
title: b'Social Vortex'
body: b"J. K. Rowling's novel, The Casual Vacancy, is a very good British village story that captures the atmosphere of a setting US readers may never experience directly. There is a long history of novelists writing in this tradition, one that comes to mind immediately is Simon Brett whose novels involve local mystery stories. I enjoy this style because of the detailed descriptions of the characters and their interactions. A key to this type of fiction is the sharply drawn images of individual emotions of the characters.
