The presentation of the emotional reactions of the characters is precise, and it is clear to the reader exactly what the characters are going through. This is very difficult to do, and Rowling writes with insight demonstrating a mastery of the technique."

author: b'james d. thomas'
title: b'Promising Debut Novel'
body: b'Try to think of this is a "first novel," instead of the new book by Rowling, and you just might be impressed.  Ultimately it is too maudlin for my taste, and might have been better with some level of "hook" to the plot (a mystery, for example) but Rowling proves herself a master of small detail and the hypocrisy of small-town life.  None of the characters are especially likable, but then that is the point.  I found myself more impressed in retrospect than while I was reading it.  So although it is not totally successful there is more than enough good writing to make me look forward to her next book.  In spite of some of Ms Rowling interview comments, by the way, it sure as hell isn\'t Dickens.'

author: b'Jay Ocean'
title: b'Engaging, good read'
body: b"I have to write a review because this book is getting a bad rap and I hated Kakutani's review in the NY Times (read after I finished the book)."

author: b'ball1ball2'
title: b'Half way through'
body: b'I am half way through and I hope it picks up for a faster read. I will let you know later.'

author: b'Victor Martin'
title: b'Aa'
body: b'jKRowling should stick to the Harry Potter style of writing. This was slow and I did not see the point of the story line'

author: b'harleys girl'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'The book was ok, but it was to wordy and at times it lost my interest prefered the Harry Potter series'

author: b'raesdays'
title: b'R-E-S-P-E-C-T'
body: b'I finished this book with a glass of wine and a box of tissues. My tears fell for the characters in the book, and their injustices, their pain, and the knowledge that real-life people are going through the same, and worse.'

author: b'Jim South'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b' The language while generally true to the characters being portrayed really got a bit much.. to many *!#@# words.'

author: b'Bearwife'
title: b'Surprising and well done'
body: b"I loved Rowling's Harry Potter books.  This very grown up novel shares the ability to introduce a sizeable cast of characters and make them distinct, to tell a complex story, and to plot tightly, with every thread tied in the end.  But it is a book for grown ups, with an adult understanding that there are no wholly good or bad people, that little matters loom large for those who are directly affected, and that terrible consequences flow from indifference.  A very good book."

author: b'Christine'
title: b'Exceeded my expectations'
body: b"Well written, interesting characters, very insightful. That there was no main character didn't bother me at all. I didn't want it to end!"

author: b'Bob Flisser'
title: b'Disappointing. Bored me to tears.'
body: b'Perhaps J.K. Rowling wanted to write a modern-day Dickens novel. It had a large cast of characters, some trying to maintain firm control, and others destitute and adrift. Unfortunately, what she wrote was the most tedious and boring sections of my small-town newspaper that I usually skip over.'

author: b'MF'
title: b'OMG!'
body: b"IT IS NOT HARRY POTTER! IT WAS NEVER MEANT TO BE ONE, so don't assume that just because it was written by the same author, you'll like it."

author: b'december'
title: b'Love the Honesty'
body: b"There are two camps when it comes to The Casual Vacancy. The first camp finds the book slow and very dull. These people might be the ones that are angry that this book isn't related to the world of Harry Potter. The second camp love the book and find it fascinating. These might be the people that will read anything that J.K. Rowling writes just because she's J.K. Rowling."

author: b'S. Al-Amri'
title: b'Readable but just barely'
body: b'I loved the Harry Potter books, some more than others but read them all.  So I was expecting the same level of page turning with this.  I was disappointed.'

author: b'Kim S'
title: b'not sure if I can go on..'
body: b"Loved Rowling's Harry Potter Series.  Not sure I can continue on with this one.  Trying to.. not sure what the plot is - all over the place.  The Middle School age sexual bits are too frequent.  Assume all the intertwined various stories will all make some sense in the end... hoping."

author: b'C. R. Beresford'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'Reads like an aga saga.  Disjointed story and far too many tedious and similar characters, none of whom I care about.'

author: b'roger c goupil'
title: b'Boring!'
body: b'Could not get into this cause I kept falling asleep. Author was too wordy with descriptions of the various scenes.'

author: b'Reader_SLC'
title: b'Gave up 15 pages in'
body: b'Perhaps I should have done more research before picking up this book, but after 10 vulgar words in the first 15 pages, I decided this book is not for me. The F bomb and even the C word...really, really not for me.'

author: b'tarbaby'
title: b'PHEW!!!! Thought it stunk to high heaven!'
body: b'Not one character to like even a tiny bit..they were all nasty, selfserving !'

author: b'Lucy VanPelt'
title: b'more derailment than departure'
body: b'Ok, I loved the Harry Potter series. Every word in those books had a reason and purpose. That being said, this book has more words than it needs and I found the frequent use of the "f word" gratuitous and grating. There are too many characters circling around each other and it takes way too long for the story to gel. It meanders along for hundreds of pages. I found most of the characters vapid and predictable. The ending is inevitable and essentially it all comes down to everyone spending too; much time minding everyone else\'s business and ignoring those closest to them.  I was disappointed to say the least and I doubt I will read any other of her adult novels. If J K would like to explore the characters she left behind in the HP series I could be persuaded to give her another try. Until then, I would rather reread Harry.'

author: b'Mr Fie'
title: b'This is like The Road but with people instead of ashes'
body: b"I experienced similar (and strong) emotions to The Road by Cormac McCarthy. That's because it is relentlessly bleak, yet somehow uplifting. I don't know how she did that, but I'm glad she did."

author: b'D. Michael Strain'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'After reading all of the Harry Potter novels, I was very disappointed in The Casual Vacancy. The plot was weak, and the ending was very predictable.'

author: b'mom of three'
title: b'loved this book'
body: b"Def not a Harry Potter book. I loved Rowlings writing style as well as the story in Harry potter. This book as her same unique way of describing the setting and characters so well that you can really envision them. But the story is dark, the characters flawed and sad. I did wish there was one character that I could root for but you dont really 'love' any of them. That said, I couldn't put the book down, waiting to find out what horrible thing would happen due to the awfulness of the characters! Def worth the read."

author: b'goldengal330'
title: b'Modern Day Les Mis'
body: b'There is no doubt about it: JK Rowling remains an expert at her craft.  That being said, this is one of the most difficult books I have ever tried to read.  There are many characters with intersecting plot lines, and most of them are unhappy.  I continued to read hoping for a triumphant ending, but mostly what I found was more misery.  That being said, I found her overarching message of social responsibility very powerful, and one that will hopefully inspire others to look past outward images, and understand how others have been shaped by their environments.'

author: b'Momustang'
title: b'Momustang'
body: b'I have never been a fan of the Harry Potter series but I considered  J.K.Rowlings to be an excellent writer. Just the subject matter was not for me.'

author: b'klsantini'
title: b"Brilliant characters, really captured 'small town' mentality"
body: b'Huge JK Rowling fan, have read and reread all of the HP books.  I knew this was going to be different and loved it for being so different!'

author: b'LiniAyre536'
title: b'A tad bleak, but worth the read.'
body: b'With the sudden death of Barry Fairbrother, the Parish Council of Pagford is thrown into turmoil. His unexpected passing frees up a position and this vacancy is very much a coveted one.'

author: b'readsgoodbooks'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Obscene language does NOT improve a book.  Graphic language not necessary.'

author: b'Camilla S. Feliciano'
title: b'NOT worth the price of the book'
body: b"Like others I wanted to read this book by this author.  What I got was disappointment. I would not recommend anyone spending their money nor their time on this one.  It took me almost the whole book before I thought it was getting interesting, but it let me down.  I finished it only because I had invested my time and wanted to see how it ended....well that was a disappointment too. Ms Rowling can do better....we know this....but her venture outside of Harry Potter was a let down.  I wanted this to be good, but it just wasn't."

author: b'ginger2008petlover'
title: b'Reading'
body: b'JK Rowling brings her writing talent to contemparyt fiction, book is ver well written for contempary fiction. iIf you remeber her teaser, "no sequel and no movie, read it and you will know why."'

author: b'MaggieT'
title: b'I really wanted to like this book-- FINALLY!!!'
body: b'I commute quite a distance, so often listen to books on cd.'

author: b'Chach'
title: b'disappointed'
body: b'I was very disappointed in this book, kept thinking it would get better but it did not.kept kicking myself for paying 14.95 for it.'

author: b'Barbara Noronha'
title: b'Depressing book'
body: b"I knew it was for adults but wasn't expecting such a downer.  Not sure what the authors purpose was. Life in a small town?  No happy ending here"

author: b'Bibliophagist'
title: b'English Adult is Much Different than U.S.A. Adult'
body: b"So I read this not knowing what to except. I knew it wasn't going to be Harry Potter, but had no idea what this was going to be. Rowling showed again that she is a great writer. Be warned though, this book is graphic in language and details. It was a good commentary on society. It was interesting, the characters were very real. if you read it, read it with an open mind and don't expect Harry Potter."

author: b'Remedi588'
title: b'The Casual Read'
body: b'Welcome to Pagford the home where politics is king, angst is in the air and gossip is second nature.  Barry Fairbrother has died and left a hole in the main frame of the political dynasty that has captured Pagford.'

author: b'Mumstheword'
title: b'Too many characters!!!'
body: b"This book introduces way too many characters, doesn't explore them deeply enough and leaves the reader with a sense of incompletion. Casual Vacancy needed more serious editing and someone should have been brave enough to tell J.K Rowling. She would have been better off going back to the drawing board and putting more work into this novel so that it had more depth and a stronger heart beat. If this had been her first work, I don't think she would have had the phenomenal success she had with Harry Potter. People paid to read this book based on her previous work. I can say that as a writer moving in this direction she has potential - in many ways her work resembles P.D James in that she shines a spot light on people as they really are, warts and all. But J.K Rowling has some distance to travel if she is going to move more in that direction and this is a book that doesn't cut it. My advice: borrow it from the library if you're curious, otherwise, send J.K Rowling a message: could do better."

author: b'Deborah Woehr'
title: b'Better Than I Expected'
body: b'Having read and enjoyed the first two of Rowling\'s Harry Potter books, I was curious to find out how well she would do with The Casual Vacancy. It took me a little while to read because the adult characters were so over-the-top snobby, vicious, and petty that they quickly bored me. What I enjoyed most was reading from the point of view of the teenagers, especially Krystal Weedon and Andrew "Arf" Price, who lived in less than ideal homes.'

author: b'Linda Gerig'
title: b'A different book'
body: b'It took a while to get into it. Maybe not understanding English ways. Once I got the people straight I did like the book. It took a while.  I would read it.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Casual vacancy.Very dissapointed with this book. so many different people in it it really chops and changes too much for me'

author: b'L. Keller'
title: b'Just "okay" reading'
body: b"Since I'm such a fan of the Harry Potter series, I was expecting great things from this book.  However, it's not that exciting to read, and I am fully able to put it down and not pick it back up for several hours, if not days!"

author: b'Ronnie D. Murphy'
title: b'J.K. Rowling can write something besides magic'
body: b"The characters in this book were so well written.  Some I didn't like and some I didn't like at all!  At first it seems like a lot of people, families, and teenagers to keep up with but in the end they each have a significant purpose to one another."

author: b'J. Sallee'
title: b'Finally finished'
body: b"I put this down and read other books because I couldn't get into the story. It took till the halfway point before it got interesting and longer till I was actually wanting to see where the train wreck was heading. Not what I thought it would be."

author: b'Danielle'
title: b'Great Book'
body: b'This was a great book. It drew you in immediately, she developed the characters fabulously which some authors have a hard time doing with so many different characters.'

author: b'Shelley'
title: b'A real page turner'
body: b"I wondered about JK Rowling's ability to pen an adult book after so many years of writing for such a different audience (p.s. I've personally never read HP book so my expectations weren't swayed in any particular direction), but I was not disappointed. She's a brilliant writer and I was hooked into the story from the first page. A real insight into the intricacies of life in a small village, The Casual Vacancy is funny, sometimes sad, and overall an entertaining read. I started the book wondering how she would develop an interesting story based on such a small village and a relatively simple plot, but she did it well. The characters developed as the story evolved, and it wasn't long before I was picturing the people, their houses, their families, hating the horrible ones and loving the lovable ones. Don't overanalyse this book - just enjoy it for what it is - entertaining."

author: b'Azadeh'
title: b'Amazing characters'
body: b'I love reading about relationships and how it affects the society, people different points of view and how they just see same things in different ways. J.K. Rowling has demonstrated her power again!'

author: b'Nicola Jones'
title: b'Characters are alive'
body: b"I absolutely loved this book. My first of this author's, maybe I should read Harry Potter after all. The characters were a fascinating study of people watching. I felt I knew these characters and where the lived. I couldn't put it down and wanted it to go on forever. I hope there's more adult fiction coming our way"

author: b'Rebecca S. Mccurdy'
title: b'A beautiful, but difficult, read.'
body: b'This is a beautifully written, and heartbreaking, book.  Rowling does an exquisite job of painting a picture of the depth of sorrow and pain lurking beneath the surface of people\'s lives in many different walks of life. In contrast though, she also shows the amount of good a single kind person can achieve.  The man who has died, leaving the "casual" vacancy, leaves such a desperate hole precisely because of the influence for good he was in his life.'

author: b'Bob'
title: b'boring and confusing'
body: b"I restarted this book several times and still coudn't get into it.  I only bought it because of the author."

author: b'Tanya'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Very disappointing and difficult to read.  Did not like it at all.  Sorry I spent the money to get it.'

author: b'Ben V'
title: b'Casual Vacancy-relentlessly dark'
body: b'It was fun to see Rowling other than in a HP role.  I was surprised by the relentlessly dark tone of the book.  It is difficult to think of a single admirable character.'

author: b'Christine Stone'
title: b'If this gets made into a movie, I could see Gurinder Chadha directing...'
body: b'This novel was very psychological--the kids are infected by and actually embodying the unconscious of their parents--very dark, but there is a bit of redemption in the end. I think the characters might come to life better on film than they did in the book actually. I could see Gurinder Chadha directing this movie, based on how she has handled family dynamics and redemption themes/strong female characters in past works, and especially since an Indian family plays such a big role in this work.'

author: b'carol'
title: b'Rowling shows admirable range as a writer'
body: b"In spite of reading negative reviews ahead of time, many people who attempt to read the Casual Vacancy are probably hoping that they will have an experience with it comparable to their enjoyment of the Harry Potter books. Where it was hard to put the Harry Potter books down because we liked the characters so much, it is hard to keep reading The Casual Vacancy because we like the characters so little. What was fascinating to me was just how different the two worlds are that Rowling has created. Harry Potter is about good vs. evil, friendship, loyalty, self-sacrifice,  and survival on a grand scale.  The Casual Vacancy is about the life of a small village of no particular importance filled with dysfunctional people who are destroyed.  Most of the characters are petty and self-absorbed, doing what they think they need to do to survive regardless of the havoc it causes for someone else. There is shocking meanness in the book. There is disturbing, raw vulgarity and exploitative sex. There is no love, and almost no charity. Yet, to my surprise, I cried at the end.  The Casual Vacancy is in many ways the antithesis of the Harry Potter books.  As such it shows Rowling to have quite a range as a writer. I didn't enjoy reading The Casual Vacancy the same way I enjoyed reading Harry Potter, but I'm glad I read it.  It was thought-provoking.  There are 3, maybe 4, women who are admirable in the book,who try to help others.  I think they will be what sticks with me, plus Rowling's point that it is easy to judge a person's actions but hard to understand them if you don't know their secrets or motives for acting."

author: b'Peter Erskine'
title: b'Open ended'
body: b'Slow start building up the story characters . Story takes hold about half way through the book. The ending is rather sudden leaving the way open for a follow up book'

author: b'Simona'
title: b'Too many words'
body: b"While Harry Potter was a remarkable achievement - JKR has been proving throughout the whole series how much insight she has into the adolescent mind presenting her enchanted world in rich colours, smells, layers of texture... (I devoured all of them first in English, then in the excellent translation into Czech, buying them the day they were published and reading overnight,so my children could start to read them the next morning)...I could hardly wait for  Ms. Rowling's next book to come out, it didn't matter if it was for children or adults..."

author: b'Jean moran'
title: b'JK Rowling at her best'
body: b'Here is JK Rowling in real life with grown ups in mind.  The story takes a look behind the lives of a small English village and views the inner lives of families that are not what they seem to be'

author: b'Stanli'
title: b'Very poor story line'
body: b'This book has very little going for it. I bought it as most people probably did because I enjoyed the Harry Potter series. The story line is boring and the sexuality is offensive. I would not recommend it to anyone.'

author: b'D. N. Pritchett Jr.'
title: b'Very Disappointed'
body: b'This was a crummy book and I could not even finish it....I knew it would not be Harry, but it did not hold interest'

author: b'Sue V'
title: b"Don't listen to the negative reviews - it is excellent!"
body: b'Put aside your preconceptions about the author and just enjoy the book. It is dark and gritty but very easy to read with well-rounded interesting characters and cleverly written set-piece encounters. I found it a bit like The Slap.'

author: b'Becca Scott'
title: b'Mid-book feedback'
body: b"I was a bit shocked in the first few chapters by the adult themes - they almost felt forced, coming from an author famous for exclusively youth novels. However, Rawlings does a great job of drawing the reader into this little town and its complex web of residents. At the halfway point, I got ravenous for the next page and I'm LOVING the 2nd half of the book!"

author: b'oscardog1'
title: b'casual vacancy,  jk rowland'
body: b'I am enjoying the book - however, some of the characters are overdone.  Minutiae about appearances in the lesser characters is distracting to me.'

author: b'K Tribb'
title: b'A Casual vacancy'
body: b'I enjoyed the new work by J.K. Rowling,,A Casual Vacancy. She really knows how to get your attention when telling a story. I have been a fan for many yrs reading the Harry Potter series and this was so different and I enjoyed the characters greatly. Getting to know the people in a small town was amazing.'

author: b'Desert Girl'
title: b'If Only I Could Give It No Stars'
body: b'What a monumental disappointment. None of the characters are likable. The plot mires itself in quicksand from the very first page. If I were able to leave a one-word review, it would be "awful."'

author: b'F. Pieterse'
title: b'An odd book...'
body: b'I will (like many others here) preface my review by saying definitively that "The Casual Vacancy" couldn\'t possibly be further removed from the land of Harry Potter. This is a mature book that aims to some extent to strike at the literary fiction market. One gets the feeling that Rowling has somehow made a challenge to herself to write something that is significantly more challenging (to read) than anything else she has accomplished; the challenge in this case lies in the equivocal portrayal of people in "TCV". It\'s this subtle point, I think, that many one-star reviews have failed to grasp: the human psyche is complex and can\'t help what it thinks - people are not simply "good" or "evil". Of course I sympathise with the expectations of her fans and their adventurous excursion to non-fantasy realms (many of my friends who only have read fantasy have dipped their toes in other waters for the first time with this book), however one must not approach a book with your own prejudices - absorb and discard that which appeals to you or has truth to it.'

author: b'checkers'
title: b'Utterly depressing'
body: b'Fortunately I got the book from the library.  I spent a weekend reading it, got about halfway through and realized that the overwhelming depression I was feeling was coming from the book.  Returned book to library.  If you liked Confederacy of Dunces you may like this book.  There is not a single bright point in the (first half of the)book, no hope, no love, nothing of a positive nature.  I did skip towards the end to see if it picked up, instead it got even worse.  If you like dark, depressing and hopeless this book is for you.'

author: b'PJMA'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I really liked the book.  I think Rowling did a good job fleshing out her characters and resisting the usual "happy ending".'

author: b'G a ford'
title: b'Pedantic, boring, adolescent and crude'
body: b'To sum it up, this was a very disappointing book.  Pedantic, boring, adolescent and crude would be kind words for this rambling book.  It does tackle some of the social issues and how country England works to focus on the gnat while swallowing the elephant, but the presentation of the arguments gives you an illness of the soul.  This is just not a good story.'

author: b'Cassondra L. Cole'
title: b'Good Read'
body: b"Book starts out really slow providing background on all the characters, but that's how Harry Potter was as well.  Very good book and I would read again.  I couldn't put it down once we got through all the background information."

author: b'Glenn Coco'
title: b"One of the few reviews I've bothered to do."
body: b"My sole intention of writing this review is to counteract some of the baffling one star reviews this fanatic novel has received. It's painfully obvious that 90 percent of the negative reviews for this novel were either expecting Harry Potter Part 8 (seriously, did you not even bother to see what the novel was about before buying??), did not read the book, or have a very low attention span to go along with a low reading level and expect books to all be happy stories with a nicely laid out moral code and traditional hero and villain. If you want to read a very well written novel that deals with real characters, real social problems, and real life then don't hesitate to buy this. If you're expecting fantasy land with a happy ending, stay away, don't buy this, and don't give your negative opinion about something you were destined to dislike."

author: b'jzsomm'
title: b'Perfect Book Club Selection'
body: b"I, like many, loved Harry Potter and couldn't wait for Rowling's latest book to come out.  To say this book is very different from her previous work would be a massive understatement.  For a lot of the book, it seemed like Rowling was trying to prove that she could write adult fiction, complete with swear words and disturbing images.  I almost stopped reading this book several times, but something kept me coming back."

author: b'Amy Yao'
title: b'forced myself to finish it'
body: b"Ok, so it's no Harry Potter, that's for sure.  I made myself finish the book just so I could say I finished the book.  I will say it was well written.  I felt like it was a reality tv show, but I was reading it instead of watching it.  Apparently high school didn't end for some people.  All that back-stabbing, plotting, hate, etc...it is quite a depressing book.  Maybe it's just me and I've been reading too many young adult books lately, but I wanted at least a somewhat happier ending.  I won't give it away, but ugh.  And there's just toooooo many people to keep track of!  I felt like I was back in high school reading one of William Faulkner's books (Absolom, Absolom?  As I Lay Dying?) where there was just so many people to keep track of that you almost couldn't.  I hope the next book she writes will be less depressing."

author: b'Mohamed E. Elaraby'
title: b'Rowling Post "The Boy who Lived": The Man Who Had Died'
body: b'First of all Please give it a try ... It\'s not fair that most of the "One Star Ratings" are just based on the first couple parts of the book which -I admit- a real exhausting read specially the first part which is over 170 pages but afterward it\'s really deep, emotional and interesting story.'

author: b'Carol Bura Al-Nsour'
title: b'Two words of advice: "Don\'t Bother!"'
body: b"So very sadly, I was completely revolted by this book before I had gotten through the first 50 pages. I quit reading it, and I rarely - if ever - do that with a book. Leafing through it just to see if I might be able to give it a second chance, I discovered that it's absolutely loaded with vulgar imagery, crude language (the f-bomb is dropped about every other word) and graphic descriptions of sex fantasies and scenes, and drug use. Rowling seems to believe that she can prove herself a worthy adult author by acting like a teenager that's trying to be adult by using naughty words and talking about sex. It's crude, coarse, boorish, and ultimately - BORING. The characters are under-developed, unlikeable, and completely flat. A huge disappointment from one of my long-time favorite authors. I think Rowling's strength is really as a children's author. She should stick to it."

author: b'Meredith Miller'
title: b'Most boring book ever!!'
body: b"I admit, I give up, I surrender!! Rarely do I give up on a book. I plod on even if I am not overjoyed by the writing, the plot, etc. But, life is too short & the books on my shelf to be read piled too high to spend any more time on this book. This author has gone from writing the most interesting wizardry books ever, to writing about the most boring town in the world filled with the most boring people in the world. It is just not interesting!! With all of the vampire and witch books out there, why didn't she dip her toes into something for adults with some fantasy. I hope someone on Ebay wants to buy this, because I certainly wouldn't recommend it to a friend."

author: b'Helen E. Downing'
title: b'Casual Vacancy Makes You Think'
body: b'I am really disappointed in the reviews given here! What were you looking for, the next Gone with the Wind? Give me a break! Harry Potter was a wonderful series, but life goes on, and adults need to get over it.'

author: b'MLD'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'More profanity than necessary.  Theme is very dark and depressing.  The ending is also very depressing.  After all the negativity of the U.S. presidential election this was a bit too much.'

author: b'Danielle La Paglia'
title: b'Excellent Read'
body: b"This is the first book I've ever read by J.K. Rowling. I know I'll get flack for that, but there it is. I love urban fantasy and paranormal romance and young adult books, but Harry Potter never appealed to me. Rowling has received so much ridicule for this book because it wasn't another Potter-like story, but I applaud her for stepping outside that world and doing something incredibly different. So many of my writer friends love to write and read in different genres. I love to write and read in different genres. And I think it was incredibly brave and had to be liberating to step into something new and, well, different."

author: b'EPS1919'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"If all adult fiction were this dreary, I should probably stick to children's books or find a different hobby. What a let down after all the fun, magic, villains to hate and many likable characters in the Harry Potter books. The one character who might have been a half way nice guy in this novel died on page four. I slogged through all 503 pages of the dismal, dysfunctional lives of this community, toddlers through grannies. Having a few rays of hope for some of these folks in the last chapter isn't enough. What a bummer. If I read another book by J.K. Rowling, I'll borrow it from the library rather than purchasing it. I'll also stop by page fifty if I don't like it. That said, Rowling still writes well, but do we really another cheerless tale? Life is already so full of them."

author: b'Greenista'
title: b'Worthwhile Read and Smart Ending'
body: b"JK Rowling's first adult book is certainly a deviation from her Harry Potter series, but her character development and insight into the lives and inner thoughts of the characters is insightful and entertaining.  The book is slow for the first 100 pages or so as she spends time exploring the motivations and personalities of all those involved in the book's plot, but once she sets the stage the second half of the book is captivating and a quick read.  The way she demonstrates how the actions of one character determine the fate of another is impressive and leaves you thinking about the book long after you're done.  Keep reading until the end and you will not be disappointed!!!  Overall, I highly recommend this book."

author: b'Nancy J. Umstead'
title: b'AWFUL!'
body: b'I think she needs to re-invent Harry or maybe a new family of Hogwarts.  I read the 1st 65 pages and had no clue where she was going with so much detail and what a mess it seemed.  I kept trying and found myself forcing myself to read on..finally I had to stop.  Its on my when I retire and need a project shelf.  Honestly what really made me stop and think was how did she write all the Harry books and skip all of the profanity she is so well versed in! She certainly does not hesitate to use her library of "bad words" in just the first few pages.  But I fell for the buy me and learned a lesson to never jump at a book just because it has so many great previous books.  The theme changed and maybe that was the problem, I was looking forward to a JK I knew and the profanity was not her and the endless chatter added to the fact that I should not of purchased this book.'

author: b'Courtney withers'
title: b'Great'
body: b"Got the book on time. Haven't read it yet, but I had no issues with the product. Plan on reading it soon"

author: b'Donna Kelley'
title: b'Worst book I ever read'
body: b"This book was awful. Could not go any further than 95 pgs and that was a chore. I skipped to the last 50 pgs just to make sure there wasn't some great twist I would miss and what a waste!  Like a friend of mine said, good thing she has Harry potter seris to pay the bills.  Don't waste 16 bucks on this book"

author: b'Danelle Udovich'
title: b'dissapointed'
body: b"There isn't a single character in this book who is likeable.  Having read the Harry Potter series several times I was so dissapointed in reading this depressing book."

author: b'Paula Mallia'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"Very slow read was expecting more from the author.  I just old not get into this one don't even know that I will finish it"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I am about half way through with this book and am not impressed. I find this book hard to follow,unlike the Harry Potter books that were so hard to put down. With all the English terms I find myself having to use the dictionary on my Kindle to find the meaning of simple words. Maybe it will get better.'

author: b'Rapid Reader'
title: b'Reading The Dictionary Would Be Less Boring'
body: b"Just because she's J.K. Rowling and became the richest woman in England from writing the Harry Potter series, doesn't mean you should read this book. Had this been her first,it would never have sold like it has, believe me!  503 pages of boredom.  So bad, so very bad, I only got to page 100. If a book hasn't started to become interesting by 100 pages, it's time to give up. Besides excruciating, extraneous detail, I found this to be geared more toward the level of a teenager."

author: b'L. Jamieson'
title: b"Barry's Ghost is a Pearler"
body: b'I loved this book.'

author: b'HollyGoLightly'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Have been a long time fan of J.K. Rowling\'s writing and I must say I\'m a bit shocked by the use of the "C" word. Every time I read the word I cringe. I found the story to be real oppressive and slow moving. I have yet to finish it, while with her other books I couldn\'t put down. It\'s disappointing.'

author: b'reader'
title: b'Interesting repercussions'
body: b"I am a fan of what I deem low-key english literature and I would recommend The Casual Vacancy to all who want a quiet read on a cloudy afternoon. J.K. Rowling has made the characters  quite interesting in that you begin to care about them. Many things are going on in the small town, but it's all handled with british dignity."

author: b'Froniga'
title: b'Try a library copy before purchasing!'
body: b'Luckily my copy is from the Library. The beginning chapters were boring and I read less and less each night, wondering how many mean spirited people is she going to throw at the reader. Not only mean spirited but totally UNINTERESTING! How truly boring the same lines became, chapter after yet another \'opening\' chapter.  I read on trying to find the story.  As this is  JKR, I kept at it, wondering how many nights will I continue until I find something to capture the imagination. After a week,  I admit to speed reading whole chapters finding them sordid and not conducive to late night reading. Not that all books have to be uplifting, but the banality of the characters gave no insights, no compassion is evoked by the miserable lot of them. I tried to pick up later in the book, looking for a crumb that would inspire thoughtfulness and inspire me to quit this skimming.  ( I was already well into the book before this search for meaning, I finally read the last 3 chapters) Today I discovered that Amazon reviews, in the majority, agree with One Star, and I can quit plodding through trying to find the "There" there in story. Being a fan of Dostoyevsky I can take multiple characters and depressing subject matter. But not this book\'s drivel. Don\'t waste your money! Check it out of the library first.... you could disagree, but just in case.'

author: b'Cassandra Robinson'
title: b'I really wanted to enjoy this one...overall a disappointment!'
body: b"I am an avid reader, and read a variety of different genres. I do not give up on books...I read to the very end of every book, hoping the author will pull out something of value. I was interested in reading The Casual Vacancy to see what JKR had to say to an adult audience. My first thought upon finishing this book was that JKR should stick with fantasy children's books."

author: b'Jude'
title: b"Harry Potter's Author's Casual Vacancy"
body: b'After reading "Harry Potter" I was disappointed in this "adult" book.  It was somewhat confusing and hard to keep all the characters in order.'

author: b'mags'
title: b'Boring and tedious'
body: b'I kept plodding on through the beginning of the book to find where it it would get interesting, unfortunately it never did interest me.  If the book had been described as a modern tragedy, it might have fulfilled that expectation. I felt that the book was a waste of my time and a waste of my money.'

author: b'Rudy'
title: b'Depressing'
body: b"No doubt this is a very well written book. We all know Rowling is an great writer but I really didn't like this book at all. I gave it 3 stars only because it was well written, the subject was too depressing for me. Left me feeling disturbed for days."

author: b'Parv'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Boring. Too many people to follow, no flow.  She should stick to what she did best and leave the adult world to itself.'

author: b'mcp'
title: b"consequences of a good man's death"
body: b'I read the whole book, it is about the dislocation of the lives of others when the one good person in the community dies. Barry (the dead guy) is the about the only person in the book who is not trashed. There are far too many characters, you must make a list. The book is also about class and politics in a small town but the focus wanders. Because the book takes place in England it is loaded with vulgar English slang, I think many Americans would not understand some of it. Like many others I kept giving the author the benefit of the doubt because I had so enjoyed the Harry Potter series; I think the book is a waste of time and money.'

author: b'konn'
title: b'Like a D grade movie'
body: b"D grade is also for depressing. I never liked a single character in this book. They were either hopelessly drugged, stupidly silly, grossly featured, brutal mostly weak. The book reads like a page in the news about people you don't really know or care to know because their lives are so squalid. I was very disappointed by the ending which went even further to the depths of depression without any potential resolution except for the memory of one and only seemingly human person that died at the beginning of the book. Give it a miss and hope that J.K. Rowling can cheer up."

author: b'IBCoconutty'
title: b'Brilliant Book for Adult Readers (if you like Roddy Doyle)'
body: b'I listened to the audio version of this book(narrated by Tom Hollander.)  It is a masterpiece that propels JK Rowling into another dimension of artistry.  I am a huge fan of her Harry Potter series and was aware that this novel was a deviation from children\'s lit into a more mature direction.  It is gritty, realistic, profane, sadistic, deeply disturbing in parts.  It challenges the reader to understand the characters motives and not judge them only on their actions.  At it\'s core, it is a character study that totally engages the reader and makes you care about the outcome for each character.  This book inspires comparison to some of my other favorite authors, Roddy Doyle and even Barbara Vine (minus the mystery).  Tom Hollander\'s narration was perfect in every way.  His vocal gymnastics portrayed each character with it\'s own voice and personality.  I have contemplated some of the negative reviews on this site and wonder if these reviewers would have been so harsh had the author not had another book series that had such an impact as HP.  Some reviewers seem almost angry that Rowling would deign to "turn over the rock" of the human experience and explore the ugliest aspects of life.  However, after reading this book, one comes away with a deeper compassion for others who we may have judged unfairly.  One sees her profound respect for the teenage trial --the terror and humilation of the teenage years that as adults we slowly forget.  Rowling allows her characters to adapt and to change for the better or worse. This book has inspired me to be more compassionate toward others and less judgemental.'

author: b'Joann Lynn Keister'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'i read 4 chapters and wonder why i spent 14.99. it has alot of f--- word and taking our Lords name in vain. also i think you should be a  professor to read it, i enjoy reading but this is a no no.'

author: b'JAN'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'One of the worst books I have ever  read.  Ms Rowlings should stick to Harry Potter books.  Why is it necessary to use the F word in any  form when writing, Movies etc. It turns a good story into a trash novel or movie.'

author: b'John A. Morris'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'As an "ex-Brit" I understood the setting for the book. However, I can\'t imagine it being very interesting to anyone who is not familiar with the UK public housing scene. Although the book \'dragged\' you along with the exploits of the various characters, I didn\'t feel as if it was really going anywhere. The fact that it all ends in a series of tragedies was uninspiring and not the ending I expected. Overall, it was somewhat disappointing.'

author: b'Mom Who Reads a Lot'
title: b"Too Depressing, Too many characters, Couldn't Finish"
body: b'It was just too depressing, and somewhat boring.  I decided to cut my losses and return the book to the library.  Why keep reading when I was not enjoying it?'

author: b'Deb'
title: b'Liked it, did not love it.'
body: b'Overall, this book was rather depressing because of how it portrayed faulty personalities.  Author capitilized on each character\'s flaws.  Story line basically spoke of each class level and the turmoil that living together brings.  The only character who appeared to be a "good guy" died in the first few pages.  Not what I expected from J.K. Rowling.'

author: b'Christopher Johnson'
title: b'Wow.. Amazing depth of characters'
body: b"I loved this book. I was thrown by the completely drastic style change of the H.P. writer I love, but as I got into the book, I felt torn. After every chapter, especially towards the middle on, I wanted to read more, but at the same time, I saw the downward spiral this book was taking and didn't want to face the pain that was inevitable. The characters are real. They are flawed and you see that honesty behind them that people hide from everyone else in their lives and to an extent, even from themselves."

author: b'William R Brown'
title: b'not as good as its publicity'
body: b"Author seemed to want to write the opposite of a child's book. Nothing but dysfuctional  families and f words , every family with a secret"

author: b'Barb H'
title: b'Good Read, But Too Many Characters to Follow'
body: b'In typical JK Rowling fashion, the book draws you in right from the start. However, there are a lot of characters to follow and keep track of. Some of the British dialect is a little hard to follow as well, but overall, a very good read!'

author: b'Family'
title: b'great book!'
body: b'Very different from The Harry Potter series, obviously, but I love her writing style and the book is very engaging so far!'

author: b'Jeanne Ellis'
title: b'Very dark,twisted,morbid'
body: b'You spent the whole time reading the book waiting for the dismal characters to resolve their issues in a positive manner... only to be dissapointed...'

author: b'sundance'
title: b'Rowling had a miss here'
body: b"I admit, when I heard Rowling was coming out with a new book, I got a bit excited. Despite knowing it wasn't a HP, I still had high expectations. I figured with the success she had with the HP series, there was no way anything she put out could bomb. Then, I started to read this book. Fortunately, I'm thankful that, despite this bomb, I mean book, she is such an amazing author, this book did not kill her career. Please, Ms. Rowling, just publish the HP Encyclodpedia so your fans don't disappear."

author: b'Jane Manning'
title: b'Recommending it to everyone I know'
body: b'First, after doing a quick glance at others reviews from 1 - 5 stars, I would love to be able to filter out any that didn\'t mention "Harry Potter" within them. I guess it is too much to expect, but I am curious how people who didn\'t like this book would have felt if it was written by someone else. Clearly they have nothing in common and there should be no comparison. In any case, I really liked this book. I want to say I loved it, but I had a few issues, so I won\'t go all \'5 Stars\' but it\'s close. In the beginning, I did have trouble keeping the characters straight but by the end of the book, it was no longer an issue. Maybe it\'s because I live in a small town that I found the entire story completely believable. The political alliances and back room shennanigans with regards to local elections is intense to say the least. I loved the way all these lives intertwined, even though the people themselves don\'t realize it. I couldn\'t help but remember the line from "It\'s A Wonderful Life": "One man\'s life touches so many others." My one complaint is that I wish there was more closure on some characters storylines. But then again, maybe that\'s why she left it that way - life goes on. And so it will in Pagford and The Fields.'

author: b'S. Pitt'
title: b'Not Harry Potter, but not bad!'
body: b'It took me awhile to get into this book (I listened to the audiobook), but I am glad I stuck with it! I am a HUGE fan of Harry Potter, so I think it took me awhile to separate that JK Rowling material from this JK Rowling material. I find her descriptions of small town life and politics honest and interesting. If you are struggling with this book, at least read through pt. 1 before giving up.'

author: b'Reader in the Caribbean'
title: b"Writer's Block is a Good Thing"
body: b'At my time of writing this review, about 1700 other reviews have been forwarded. I have noticed over the last few months that the rating of a casual vacancy has been falling.'

author: b'LD 7'
title: b'A Boring Read'
body: b"A very dissapointing read - where did her magic go? Where did the wit go? Knowing what J K Rolling has produced in the past, I was truly let down by' A Casual Vacancy'.  It was all character development no real plot line and boring. I wasted my money!"

author: b'Lya Auslaender'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'This is the worst book i have ever read, but i did read it from cover to cover, perhaps to punish myself for buying the book after reading its bad reviews. I shall try to forget it, also forget what it shows about the author, whom i really liked after reading all her Harry Potter books.'

author: b'patty'
title: b'Teen book with adult language'
body: b'A lot of teen angst with an over abundant use of the f word. The hormone driven sex got annoying after a short time.'

author: b'Kuhoo Edson'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy - vacant!'
body: b'I devour books - good books. I have had this book for 8 weeks now and I cannot, for the life of me, finish it. It is boring. It is often confusing. The character development takes ages. I am determined to finish it, still hoping it will surprise me in the end.'

author: b'Happy Reader'
title: b'happyreader'
body: b"Very good character development, but very slow on plot development and action.  It's taking forever to read this book!  Was expecting better."

author: b'The Young Georgian'
title: b'A definite departure, but not a failure.'
body: b'So many people have attacked Rowling for "The Casual Vacancy," but I don\'t believe they\'re entirely grounded in their accusations. People were expecting something with the genius and creativity of Harry Potter, and, no, this book doesn\'t have that. It is very dark and not as humorous as it was advertised to be. It is certainly not for children. However, it was never supposed to be Harry Potter, and if that\'s what people want, then they\'ll just have to stick with those seven volumes until Rowling decides to write more from the magical world.'

author: b'Susan'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I enjoyed this book very much. Bit diffuclt getting head around all the characters in the 1st couple of chapters but from then on WOW excellent.'

author: b'Tallsue'
title: b'Very slow reading'
body: b'I started so I finished it, boring !!! It got a little better in the last part. Not very good'

author: b'Faye Sharpe'
title: b'That was brilliant'
body: b'Judy finished reading casual vacancy and I must say I am very impressed, jack rowling never fails does she.? Just wow.'

author: b'Ruth'
title: b'A Sad Tale of Truths'
body: b'I picked up this book with no expectations.'

author: b'J. Richardson'
title: b'8.5/10 - Great'
body: b'Five years ago J.K. Rowling closed up the Harry Potter series with The Deathly Hallows and now she is back with her first book outside of that series. While I still have the subject of Harry Potter fresh in your mind let me dedicate this first paragraph to a complaint. How come in almost every negative review I have read the reviewer has made some comparison to the Harry Potter franchise? And if it\'s not a direct comparison it\'s some lame joke like "there\'s no magic here." Is that supposed to be clever? You wouldn\'t compare two different movies a director made would you? No. So don\'t do that with this book. It\'s not fair to the writer who put so much time and effort into making this piece of literature and it\'s not fair to you because you aren\'t allowing yourself to enjoy it. You\'re setting yourself up for disappointment. If you don\'t like it, don\'t like it because you didn\'t enjoy it, not because it lacked magic.'

author: b'Mary Boyer'
title: b"Language in JK Rowlings' New Book Disappoints"
body: b'If you have not purchased JK Rowlings\' new book "The Casual Vacancy" for adults, do yourself a favor - don\'t.  Although many of the reviews are very positive, I could not manage to plow through more than fifty pages.  The setup of the story is long and disjointed.  Vulgarities flow from the author\'s pen like ink.  Every page seemed to have `the F word\' at least once or twice, plus other similar words.  The language does not serve a purpose that I could see.  Does she think that is what she needs to write for adults?  I did not continue far enough to discover what the story is.  I was too disgusted by the language.'

author: b'Claire'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I hated this book, it was vulgar and depressing!  I finished it only because it was on the Kindle during the hurricane.'

author: b'Bud Sanders'
title: b'Not Harry'
body: b'I think she did a good job but not as good as Harry Potter. It was quite suspenseful. I would be glad to recommend it.'

author: b'Amy F.M.'
title: b'rather dry'
body: b'I agree, it is difficult to not expect more HP excitement, but this book really was more dull than anything.  Perhaps if it had been trimmed 30-40 pages, it would have worked out better.  I remember a number of times wanting to skip ahead, get to the point, the interest... and until the very end there was really none of that.'

author: b'EJSV'
title: b'Brilliantly written!'
body: b'Just finished this last night and had to post my first-ever book review on Amazon.'

author: b'Farida Mestek'
title: b'It made me cry. It broke my heart. But it gave me hope too.'
body: b"I was quite honestly fascinated by this book. I started reading it because it was J.K. Rowling who wrote it and she is my favourite author. However, I kept reading it because it captivated me. I liked, loved, pitied, despised and hated the characters. I raged against some and cried with the others. This is the kind of book that makes you think. It makes you evaluate your own self, your own worth, your own values. What would you do? Would you do anything at all? Would you just go past, not caring, because it's not your problem, not your fight? Would such circumstances make you crumble or rise? Would they bring out the worst or the best in you? I think that these are all very important questions and I applaud J.K. Rowling for raising them in such a brutal, honest way, not being afraid of using the language and the imagery that will appal and repel, showing the ugly side of life that so many of us pretend not to see, though it exists right next to us, and the inevitability of tragedy that comes from neglect, irresponsibility and abandonment. I think it took a lot of courage to write about all of this, knowing, as she did, that such a book would raise many objections, that its worth would be overlooked because of who she is, its language would be abused, its subject matter misunderstood and ridiculed. It made me cry. It broke my heart. But it gave me hope too. I know that the story didn't come to an end with the full stop. I know that it lives on and that there are characters there who will try to make a difference, who have found their worth and their path in life."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"Do Not Judge her new book by the fact that she's written the Harry Potter Series"
body: b"I thoroughly enjoyed this book! Before I purchased it, I did read the reviews and mostly everyone was continually comparing it with Harry Potter. WEll, this is not Harry Potter. It's adult contemporary fiction, and very good fiction at that. The story kept me interested all the way through, I stayed up a few nights reading into the wee hours. If you love a good book about a lot characters intertwined in a intimate setting, you will like this book. I defintely have and will reccomend to others. Do not however buy this book if you are strictly a fan of Harry Potter type books only. It is the same author but has nothing to do with it. It surprised me how many people bought this book than voiced their dissapointment about how unlike Harry Potter this book is."

author: b'Esther'
title: b'Stick to fantasy!'
body: b'I preordered this book because I so enjoyed the Harry Potter story.  This book had colourless characters, no protagonist and no plot.  I think it was supposed to be the intrigues of a village which unexpectedly has a vacancy to fiil on the village council.  The vacancy on the council was the entire story!  This book was tedious, boring and extremely disappointing.  J.K.Rowling should find another fantasy child to showcase her great talent.  This story did NOT cut it'

author: b'George W. Newport'
title: b'more great j k rowling'
body: b'once more j k rowling entertains us with her really fine writing style, a really high writing goal for other writers to aspire to, and fall way short'

author: b'Patricia Blough'
title: b'Remarkable'
body: b"You could feel the pain of they were going through. Ending was so powerful unexpected. When I saw her interview she stated if you don't cry at then end of the book somethings wrong. She's right.  She is a brilliant writer. This book just sucked me in"

author: b'Josephine S. Dorval'
title: b'The Casula vacancy'
body: b'I also purchased this book for my RWC women book club.  Terrible language... too many difficult names to remember.  Only read 1/3 of this book, not sure even if my 15 years old nephew would like to read it... He read all the Harry Potter books and saw all the movies.. Such a bad language..Did not like it at all'

author: b'ME Good'
title: b'J.K. is trying to make up for lost time with foul language and vulgarity.'
body: b"Amazon was great, as usual, with getting this product to me. I now buy almost everything from Amazon. But the book is such a let-down. I was expecting the same talent shown in Harry Potter series, but all she is doing is trying to make up for lost time with foul language and vulgarity. I am about 30% into the book and still haven't discovered the plot."

author: b'Polly H.'
title: b'Good, if interesting view, on English life!'
body: b'I had never read a JK Rowling book (Harry Potter etc) before, nor seen a film so this was a leap of faith for me.  It took a while for me to figure out who all the characters were but I found them sympathetic, amusing, thought provoking and realistic.  I am a Brit so perhaps I found the characters and towns more familiar than Americans would.  The language is "blunt" and could be shocking to many, and the behavior, actions and attitudes of the teenagers in the book could also shock.  Some may think it reflects badly on English society but JK Rowling works hard to explain the real world and circumstances these young people find themselves in.  If you can get past the language and subject matter, the book is in parts hilarious and a real page turner.'

author: b'Alley'
title: b'Expected more'
body: b'Book was definitely not as engaging as her previous works. Found some parts of the book a bit tedious to get through. Was expecting more from this author than just documented gossip.'

author: b'Bobbi'
title: b'A TEDIOUS, PLOTLESS  WONDER'
body: b"Like most die-hard fans of the Harry Potter series, I eagerly looked forward to J.K. Rowling's next book.  It is my hope that she sticks to children's books where she shines like the brightest star in the solar system.  I have, in fact, tried to emulate her ease of conveyance of ideas and descriptions in my own writing."

author: b'Marion'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'I was very disappointed in this book.  Felt it was weird and that I should have waited to read from a library.  I would very much have preferred not to have spent money on it....especially when my space is limited and there are FAR better novels to make part of my permanent collection.'

author: b'Booker2'
title: b'Well, on to the next one....hopefully'
body: b'Dear Jo,'

author: b'Carol Waterer'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"Casual Vacancy reads too much like a daytime television soap opera. I kept waiting for the real story to kick in. The plot highlights today's preoccupation with mundane gossip. But the door has been left open for at least another three editions of pap."

author: b'RebeccaRian'
title: b'Wonderful Book'
body: b"I am a HUGE Harry Potter fan, so I've been looking forward to the release of the Casual Vacancy for quite some time to see if Jo's writing continued to be captivating outside of the magical world. I have to say I was not disappointed in the slightest. It's definitely not anything like the Potter books, but she maintains her talented writing style of having twists and turns and creates wonderfully realistic characters that you can relate to. I wouldn't recommend this book for anyone who's expecting her to continue in the style of Potter, but for fans who truly love her writing, this book is a gem."

author: b'K. Webb'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'It was one of those books that you keep reading because you just know it will have some kind of a surprise ending but it never delivered.  It was very dark and dismal and I feel sorry for all of the people that lived there...LOL.'

author: b'TLS'
title: b'Loved Harry, so disappointed in this very boring book'
body: b'I thought the writing in Harry Potter was wonderful and I admire Rowling but I could not push myself past the first five chapters of this book. I was really disappointed.'

author: b'Sandra Clark'
title: b'A downer'
body: b'Even though I knew this would be nothing like Harry Potter, I did expect some plot, or something to actually happen to make the book exciting. Neither plot or excitement exists; however, there is a moral to the story, which is demonstrated by how cruel and petty people can be to each other. Mrs. Rowling must have had a passionate reason to write this book, perhaps based on personal experience at some time in her life or perhaps just an observation. Nevertheless, it is a downer. If you still decide to read this book, I recommend the audio version over the printed version so that the proper tone/accent is given to the printed word, especially if you are not familiar with the British dialect.'

author: b'Doctor D.'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Ms. Rowlings in her first attempt to write an adult novel has felt that the copious use of four-letter words will make this book appeal to the mature audience. She is mistaken. I found it abhorent!'

author: b'Samantha'
title: b'Literary fiction'
body: b"Although I only read the summary and a few pages of The Casual Vacancy, it is comparable to Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil and Sleepy Hollow. There are hidden things that are right in front of the eyes, whose owners still fail to see. Barry Fairweather's empty seat is the ignitor for the town's war of social classes, families and learning institutions."

author: b'Judith Miller'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I could never get too interested in these characters.  Perhaps it is best for those living in England.  Maybe next adult book will be better.'

author: b'lynnhuff'
title: b'Slow read with too many names and story lines.'
body: b'Very disappointed with this book.  Expected a faster read. Had too many'

author: b'Shirley K. Greene'
title: b'Not really worth the read'
body: b'As a fan of Harry Potter books, I was curious about the first"adult" novel by J.K. Rowling. It was very hard to actually like most of the characters in the book.  The writing and the subject matter are very dark and depressing.  I wanted to feel sorry for some of the characters, but most were so unlikeable that I didn\'t even feel sad when bad things happened to them.  I was determined to finish the book and I did...but I was not satisfied.  I somehow wish that I had the time and the money that I spent on it to use for something else.'

author: b'JByam'
title: b'Exceptionally disappointing'
body: b"Very foul language and hateful relationships and that after only a few pages!  I think I'll take my $15 loss and move on."

author: b'Grace'
title: b'The casual vacancy by jk Rowling'
body: b"This book is shear poison.  Imagine a whole cast of characters like aunt petunia and uncle Vernon.  This is a mean spirited dig at British society, bitter and profane.  It made me depressed the whole time I was reading it and I intend to destroy it so no one else will suffer through it. A big disappointment, I will never buy a book she wrote again. don't waste your money."

author: b'anne11301'
title: b'Warning! Sexual Violence!'
body: b"JK Rowling's voice is the only bright spot in this grim tale of unsatisfying marriages, child abuse, drug abuse, and rape. Well-written, but I didn't want to finish it."

author: b'N. Lilly'
title: b"Don't miss the Casual Vacancy"
body: b"The Casual Vacancy is the story of a town. Every family, every person has a history and a life that is affected by the others and by the death of one man. It is complex and fascinating to see their lives develop. It's particularly interesting to note all the logical misunderstandings and their consequences. I thought this was a wonderful comment on the human condition."

author: b'Sharasa Kerbouchard'
title: b'Give it a Chance'
body: b'Yes, I am a huge fan of Harry Potter. Yes, I knew it was not a children\'s book. Yes, I found it difficult to begin and to sustain through the first portion of the book. Yes, I found it immensely good after I got into it. I knew going into this novel it was not a children\'s book. I was also, for some reason, expecting a mystery type book (this isn\'t), and that, too was difficult to work through as I began to read the book on its own merit.  It is hard, though, to distance yourself from Rowling as Harry\'s creator and Rowling as the voice of Pagford. However, I really reminded myself that it was a different book with a different purpose and if I kept reading I would find something of merit. Was I ever right. I am amazed at Rowling\'s ability to distance herself from children\'s literature and write a very adult novel using very adult language and themes. It was a huge break from the past and one that took bravery and daring to write. I was also amazed at the development of the characters and the plot lines. Each character had a unique and distinct voice. I think what was difficult for me at first was keeping them all separate, however, once they are all introduced and you are moved between them and among them and introduced to each of them through the other characters, I was amazed at the intricacy with which it was written. As far as writer\'s craft goes, it is excellent. As the plot continues to unfold, Rowling continues to tie one person\'s observations and interpretations into another character\'s reality...and let me say...they are not always one and the same. Truly, things are not as they appear in Pagford, and the necessity of "keeping up appearances" hides a lot of pain and misery. No, it is not a happy book (although there are moments of lightheartedness and wit), but just because it is not happy and does not sugar coat reality does not make it any less compelling. It took me a long time to read it. I began in September when it came out and I just finished in mid-November. Mainly because the beginning was difficult for me to sustain. Once I determined I was going to go back to it, and got past all the introductions, it flew and I finished the remaining 2/3 in just a couple of days (my reading time is limited). If you are a Harry fan, please try to separate yourself from the other series. If you give the book a chance on its own merit, you may be surprised at how involved you become in empathizing with (or hating) some of the characters. I am convinced to go back and re-read the beginning, now that I am more in touch with the characters...I will enjoy it more the second time around. The 4 stars are because of the slow beginning. The remaining was a 5.'

author: b'vonners'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Very disappointing. This book only got vaguely interesting when Rowling was describing the lives of the teens. I never felt any connection with any of the characters and couldn't understand why this was a topic she chose for a book. I am disappointed her editor and the professionals surrounding her would even let this book go to print."

author: b'Larry'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b'The storyline was disapointing. Why do I want to read about a long list of dysfunctional families. None of the characters were any better off at the end than at the beginning. It was like watching a reality show on tv.'

author: b'Betty Smith'
title: b'Do not read'
body: b'This is a book that I started but did not finish I could not work up any interest in the characters. Ii is far from the level of Harry Potter.'

author: b'art and book devotee'
title: b"Didn't disappoint"
body: b"Having read the Harry Potter series when my kids were growing up with it, and enjoying it tremendously, I was thrilled that J.K. Rowling had written an adult book.  It did not disappoint.  Rowling knows how to draw you into a story and have you become vested in the characters pretty quickly. The writing and story are truthful and gritty. Although the plot revolves around small town British life, it digs deep into the psyche of the picture postcard town exposing it's pretty nasty underbelly. I listened to the book on CD and enjoyed every minute of it.  Can't wait for J.K. Rowling's next book."

author: b'Kramers8177'
title: b'Very disappointed'
body: b'Disappointed in the story. It was not what I expected.  I did not care about the characters ir the events of the story'

author: b'Karen'
title: b'Recommended'
body: b'It took me a while to really like this book; The characters are revealed early on to be mostly unlikeable, and the blunt, often vulgar language can be off-putting at best. At times I found myself being pulled away from my emotional investment in the story to wonder why the author had to include such dark behavior, such language, as she did. Like, where are the redeeming qualities of these people...whom can we  root for...was this novel merely a vehicle to distance JKR from her Harry Potter persona, do average teenagers really say, think and do these things, etc?'

author: b'jenniferkelley'
title: b'Definitely Not Harry Potter'
body: b"I am a big fan of the Harry Potter books, and I bought this book knowing that it was for a more mature audience. It is definitely darker. You can still see J.K.'s writing style throughout the book with the same depth of character, but this took me a while to get into. Once I forced myself to sit down and read it I got caught up in the characters and the story. I finished it not really knowing if I liked it or not and kind of depressed. I'm glad I read it, but I will never re-read this one like I do with Harry Potter."

author: b'Shirley Evans-Lombe'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I enjoyed J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter Series.  I thought that I would like her new book for adults.  The language she used with her characters was offensive and I did not care for the story.  She is a good writer, but not in this book."

author: b'Marci'
title: b'I really enjoyed it!'
body: b'Yes, I truly read Casual Vacancy...not once, but twice now. I also attended the NYC event where J.K. Rowling spoke about her new book, got to meet her and have my book signed. It was very informative and gave me many new perspectives to think about once I read it a 2nd time. When I first started reading the book I thought..."What the F?..."did she just say that?" and "we are not in Hogwarts anymore"...and it was quite slow at the start, however I pushed on, and as I kept reading I became more and more engrossed in the story. This is NOT a book for Kids! Sorry,  if that is what you were expecting,you are in for a huge surprise, and J.K.Rowling warned us all about it too. Nothing is "sugar coated" here. J.K. tells a gritty, risky, and at times disturbing tale, about the reality that is life in many places in the world. Though there where many moments and scenes that I (as a HP reader) could just not believe that this was the same writer of that magical books we all grew to love, however there were also many scenes where J.K. Rowling\'s humor and genius truly shines. She did not write this book purely for shock value or because "she could"...she wrote it because she truly believed in her story, and in her characters. The book makes you think, it makes you have to see what potentially you might not be ready to see or swallow. This is one of the reasons I think many people find it off-putting. There are many things through out the story that could have happened to ourselves, or to people we know...ugly truths that most people don\'t want to face. By the time I was 50-60 pages in I just could not put it down. I laughed and I cried, and though it was not fantasy, or Harry...it was wonderful. I highly recommend it, to anyone "GROWN UP" enough to face the truths within it.'

author: b'bailey'
title: b'very different from Harry potter!'
body: b"it is a unique book that is nothing like Harry potter, so please don't expect that. however, her style of writing remains simple but full of character depth. I really enjoyed it!"

author: b'Macey White'
title: b'Do not waste your money'
body: b'This was a very big disappointment.  Try as I might I could not get through it. From the start it is chalked full of details about a slew of people that is both tiresome and boring. I barely made it three quarters of the way through and still nothing, and I mean nothing, interesting has happened. One of the girls I work with actually returned her copy on lunch hour as she was so disappointed in it also. As the title says, do not waste your money.'

author: b'Elbie'
title: b'Depressing!'
body: b'A big disapointment. So negative.  Not one single thread of positiveness or cheerfulness..'

author: b'Donna Fitzgerald'
title: b'Too dark, too vulgar'
body: b"If you are looking for a feel-good experience, this book isn't it."

author: b'Hollis Fuller Morris'
title: b"One of the best novels I've read in a long time"
body: b'I absolutely devoured every word of this book. while this is deemed a tragicomedy, Ms Rowling kept it light enough (amidst very serious topics as drug addiction, cutting, suicide) to make this a true pageturner. Each character was so thoroughly devised you feel like you know them. Her ability to equally get into the mind of a teenage boy or an overweight pompous man, a woman in midlife experiencing restlessness or an addict are incredible. She creates characters you can hate, love, can cheer on, can laugh at or with.'

author: b'KB'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I think many people who read this book were under the impression that it was going to follow in the footsteps of the Harry Potter storyline. I went into it without this expectation and enjoyed the book. It is a simple story that conveys the stark realities of class distinction. The characters are believable and easy to like or dislike.'

author: b'ranhana'
title: b'Excellent'
body: b"I've seen many reviews about the slow plot development and convoluted character web, but Jo just does such a fantastic job vicariously creating the world such that the reader is completely overwhelmed into the story itself. The characters are brilliantly developed, the societal criticism sharp yet subtle, and the environment thrilling. It is truly what has set her into the adult literary world."

author: b'Charlotte Hansen'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'J.K. Rowling is not the first author to make the jump from youth fiction to adult fiction.  Others have done so with varying degrees of success.  However, I don\'t believe I\'ve ever known of an author who tried so desperately to distance themselves from their former work that they were virtually guaranteed to alienate 80% of even their adult fan base.  Harry Potter attracted plenty of adult fans; I\'m not sure who Rowling thought she was going to attract to this book.  I had heard before I started reading that there was going to be offensive language and sex; but the book sounded interesting, and I had so much respect for Rowling as a story teller that I decided that I was willing to put up with that if the story was good.  I\'m no prude, and this is certainly not the first book I\'ve read with "R" rated language in it.  However, it will go down as the single most offensive book I have ever attempted to read.  By page 26, I found that I was unwilling to wade through any more garbage.  The characters were not even remotely likable.  I felt like I was watching maggots crawl through rotting flesh - some might find it interesting, but I was revolted.  I\'m afraid that with "The Casual Vacancy",  J.K. Rowling has lost much of the respect I had for her as an author.'

author: b"Ann's Kindle"
title: b"Ann's kindle"
body: b'On finishing this book, I went right back to the beginning and reread it!  Beautifully drawn characters.  J.K. has a bit of a jaundiced eye but can she tell a great story.'

author: b'John Umland'
title: b"a maker's case for compassion towards the takers"
body: b"If Holden Caufield's soul was divided into seven horcruxes, each part bringing with it one aspect of his character, and put into new characters and set it in the English country side instead of New York City, one might discover Rowling's new world in The Casual Vacancy. What took J.D. Salinger to describe in The Catcher in the Rye, Rowling does in The Casual Vacancy, but across more characters and age groups. I am not saying that Rowling's work is inferior at all, but she can plumb the depths of the human soul with all it's earnestness, hypocrisy, pain, vengefulness, passions high and low, like Salinger. However, Rowling uses a dozen major characters, almost all well developed and tangible, instead of two. Rowling does develop the story around one character who dies at the beginning of the story, yet had provided a foil for so many citizens in his town."

author: b'Nancy A. Taylor'
title: b'Different BUT better than I expected.'
body: b"I had heard mixed reviews about J.K. Rowling's new book, so it was with great reluctance that I finally decided to purchase it.  Actually, after I had lunch with a proper Brit, who described the book as a modern day Trollope novel, I took the plunge and ordered it."

author: b'J & L Rigod'
title: b'A Look Into Small Town Politics and Life'
body: b'One lovely evening in Pagford, a councilman and his wife go out to dinner to celebrate their wedding anniversary. The man, Barry Fairbrother, aged forty four, suddenly dies right on the street. Leaving behind, his shocked wife and a town in turmoil.'

author: b'Lynn'
title: b'Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling'
body: b"I really struggled to be enthralled by this book and it is one of the most boring books that I have ever read. I read on average 2 books per week but this one did not give me the enthusiasm to not put it down. I kept waiting for the action thinking the next chapter would be it, but it didn't gain my interest really until almost the end!!!"

author: b'Kim'
title: b'Waste of time & money'
body: b'My reading time is precious and this was a waste. I slogged thru but found little, if any, enjoyment. Perhaps I\'m not "intelligent" enough to enjoy page after page of petty small town politics carried on by petty small town people. The large cast of characters was real enough - we all know & hate people like the pathetic sods in this book. Apparently the snobby town of Pagsford doesn\'t have a single decent human being within its boundaries, because I couldn\'t give a jot about any of them. Cry? Nope...crying requires caring and I just didn\'t.  The ending was an "are you kidding me" moment - I read thru all of this for THAT? I also failed to see ANY humor - I guess I am just not amused by bullying, self-mutilation, drugs, rape, adultery, child abuse, etc.  A huge disappointment from a favorite author. I\'ll be getting any future books from the library.'

author: b'sskwert'
title: b'This is a town in need'
body: b'This book would be a great read for those interested in psychology or sociology. Much material is presented that would be quintessential for a class paper or report.'

author: b'Thomas O. Morrison'
title: b'Clever adult read!'
body: b'This is a great little story about a small town and how much people are tied to each other, for better or worse.'

author: b'konasmama'
title: b'Vacant and disappointing'
