body: b'I hate to come on here and write a bad review of an author that I admire and respect so much.  J.K. Rowling is a brilliant writer who can create an intricate universe with just a few words.  However, this time her words obliterated my interest entirely.  I don\'t mind characters that are not all rainbows and puppies.  I\'m a fan of Gillian Flynn and her characters are very dark.  However, they need to have at least one redeeming quality.  These characters, including the children, were horrible people that I didn\'t care about in the slightest.  Nor did I care about their whiny plight to be unified in their hatred and disgust of those less fortunate and less "perfect" than themselves.  There were so many charachters I could barely remember how they were connected to one another.  I only finished this book out of respect for the author and on sheer hope that the story would improve.  But in the end I found myself skimming through the pages and continually looking at my Kindle to see how much closer I was to the end.'

author: b'Moosie'
title: b'Best read this year'
body: b'Wow, just finished reading The Casual Vacancy.  There should be a warning that the contents can can make the reader think very deeply about the issues covered.  J K Rowling begins quite mildly letting the reader get to know the characters and the countryside in which they live, then I was hooked and could not put my kindle down.'

author: b'Jeffrey X Kaye'
title: b'This should be a text book for fiction writing classes'
body: b"I must be one of the few people on the planet who has not read any of the Harry Potter books.  That said, I also have never been to the city of New York.  The characters seemed to real as well as their interactions with each other.  I loved Samantha's Mrs. Robinson routine.  It's what every teenage boy and young man dreams of.  By the end of the book I felt I had lived in the town.  J.K made it seem so real.  As a budding writer, I wrote my former teachers about the book, (I have never done this before) and said they should use excerpts from the book to freshen up their material for the classes they teach.  While some reviewer complained about it being a sad story, I say much of life is sad.  J.K. Rowling just did a fantastic job of painting it with words.  Hopefully I have the chance to meet her someday."

author: b'vwilson'
title: b'the casual vacancy'
body: b'I love this book!!! JK Rowling is an amazing writer, the way she set up the character and keeps you hook!! Read this book'

author: b'Denise A. Christensen'
title: b'not up to my expecations'
body: b"Maybe I'm just spoiled by the Harry Potter series, but I didn't enjoy this book. I think it was clearly because the only character I could even kind of like died in the first chapter. I'd skip it if I had to do it again."

author: b'C. McGowan'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy - A journey worth remembering...'
body: b"And here we thought we'd never get to this point. The review of The Casual Vacancy."

author: b'SMac'
title: b'A Dark Story'
body: b"While critics are not impressed, this is a well written complex work but the very dark point of view feels as a burden the reader must carry.  It reminds me of Elizabeth George's What Came Before He Shot Her, another tumble of characters living in fear, poverty, and despair.  The inevitable comparison to Potter is that while he, too, lived a dark life, he had the magic to rise above, literally and figuratively."

author: b'Michael Haig'
title: b'Rowling Is An Accomplished Writer'
body: b"Rowling proves that she can do what J.R.R.Tolkien could not: write about the 'real' world, the one inhabited by you and me and not by an imagination-boosting array of elves, dwarves, orcs and other creatures. Tolkien was dejected by his inability in this regard, and Rowling has every right to feel elated by her newly discovered ability, for she acquits herself superbly in _The Casual Vacancy_. In fact it's hard to believe that the writer of the Harry Potter books and the writer of _The Casual Vacancy_ are the same person, since _The Casual Vacancy_ is so far and away superior to the noxious fantasy/reality mix of Harry Potter (so distasteful to the Tolkien devotee)."

author: b'lado'
title: b'An Oscar for Boooorrrrring'
body: b'I am at age of 62. Ever since I learned to read, I read (consumed?) a minimum of one book per week as minimum, sometimes as much of three or four per week.'

author: b'Jay Legenhausen'
title: b'compelling and touching'
body: b'I saw snippets from two reviewers saying "don\'t pick up this book if you don\'t like sad books" and "I read the first 100 pages and won\'t be finishing it."  There is something true in each of those statements, however it will be a great loss to those who are too influenced by them and thus miss the opportunity to understand and feel what this book will make you understand and feel.  After 100 pages I had remarked to a friend that it was enjoyable to read so far because it was very well-written and sharp-witted, but that I hoped it got less dreary soon.  It didn\'t necessarily get cheery, but the storylines and characters certainly got compelling, thought-provoking and emotion-provoking.  What I thought of as "dreary" early on became something else - something I can\'t name, something which made me think that the world is not always so nice a place, and that it\'s good to have compassion for others in it.  Neither of these messages are delivered by being pedantic or using cliches, though.  Instead they are conveyed by simply telling the stories and presenting the characters as-is, almost as if it\'s a documentary or bit of journalism, and letting the stories and characters\' actions lead you to your own reactions and conclusion. In the end, there is a lot to learn by letting yourself be put into the minds of the characters, especially the teens, as incredibly well as JK Rowling does.'

author: b'Joan Schrauwen'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy- J.K. Rowling'
body: b'Although not expecting a fantasy adventure for adults, was still taken aback at the bleakness of this novel on small town politics.  Certainly black, but no humour.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"While the story was intriguing, and I am a huge HP fan, who couldn't fault that series, I found this book very difficult to get into and follow.  In the early pages I was turning back to refer to who was whom.  More than once I felt like giving up on the story, or worse, going straight to the back to see how it ended.  Very pleased I didn't in the end though."

author: b'Ange'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Initially this book was somewhat confusing due to an overload of charachter introductions.  Once I had sorted out who was who and how the charachters were either related or interconnected it became very intriguing.  Being an Australian I found the concept of the Parish Council a little bemusing.  Once I realised they hold more power and importance than just a "church group" I began to understand the attraction of gaining  the seat vacated by Barry\'s death.'

author: b'Just Me'
title: b'In Need of Negative Stars for a Rating!!'
body: b"Within the first couple pages of Harry Potter, I fell in love with how J.K. Rowling wrote. The vivid characters, the effortless way the story moved, and the overall ease she had with painting a picture you could almost touch... The Casual Vacancy is the polar opposite of that. I was so excited to see a new novel but Rowling, but that excitement was quickly squashed. Honestly, you could have told me that anyone wrote this book and I would've believed it. It's much harder to swallow that this is written by the author that created such incredible images with her writing in any other novel that she did, an author that had me glued to each page of her book(s) from the very first sentence. If I didn't know better, I would think that someone was lying about the author of this book."

author: b'Amanda Cole'
title: b'Engrossing and dark'
body: b'The only reason this book received 4 stars instead of 5 from me is that it subverts expectations brought on by the nature of who authored it. If you think of this book as authored by someone you don\'t already know, then you will likely enjoy it more. It is dark (and depressing, as others have noted) and it does take quite a while to get oriented to the vast array of characters that switch back and forth faster than you can get used to "who was that again?"'

author: b'Robert A. Balyeat'
title: b'Great Read'
body: b'I just finished reading this book and it was great! It was a little slow starting out, but once you learn the characters it really gets interesting. I had trouble putting it down each night and having to wait till the next day to continue reading it. Great book!'

author: b'JCooper'
title: b'This is no Harry Potter'
body: b'After loving the Harry Potter series I was expecting more from J K Rowling.  While I knew this was a more adult book I thought that it would be more interesting than it was.  Over half of the book seemed devoted to introducing the miriade of characters and then hardly anything happened with them.'

author: b'Todd Zen'
title: b'Powerful Writing with Depth'
body: b"Rowling digs deep into the dark underbelly of the mind and of the ego itself. Her characters are self centered and often nasty people but they are also very human. As someone who works in Social Work I felt her description of drug and poverty addiction was very accurate. I was never a fan of the 'Harry Potter' books because I am not interested in Fantasy and Wizards but I can see now that Rowling is a major talent."

author: b'Bill'
title: b'Rowling Misses the vote'
body: b'Harry Potter catapulted Ms Rowling to top as youth oriented writer. That is her genre! This book has disappointed me. I did not find the characters endearing to me. The story line takes forever to develop and is without the excitement that was the hallmark of "Potter". I look forward to getting back to what she does best - teenage fantasy.'

author: b'armybrat'
title: b'What a mess!'
body: b'Calling Rowling an author is an insult to even the most limited high school senior.  This book is nothing but a "passive" aggressive attack England and the mddle class.  The women are all crones, the men all disreputable --- there\'s not one likable character in the whole book, or at least the portion I read.  It\'s so poorly written, so full of gratituous vulgar terminology and expressions that I couldn\'t even finish it, so if there is a  character who redeems the rest, it must be smoeone who appears after the first 150 pages...!'

author: b'CathyL'
title: b'Pageturner'
body: b"I have never read Harry Potter, but when I saw she had written a book for adults I had to read it. I loved the book,and couldn't put it down. It does have alot of characters and goes back and forth, but I couldn't wait to see what was next with them. Its a thought provoking book. I finished it 2 days ago and still thinking about the different people and their lives."

author: b'eZmoney'
title: b'Why, Jo Rowling, Why??'
body: b"Ms. Rowling, I adore you. Your HP books were just so amazing and have provided me with about 12 years of entertainment. So when I saw you were releasing a new book, I honestly felt I owed it to you to purchase it and try it out, in thanks for the years of enjoyment of your writing. I was truly excited about it. I counted down the days to the release. I in no way expected it to be a Harry Potter-level masterpiece. I did, however, expect your novel to be interesting and enjoyable. I regret to say that, though I go typically through books with enthusiastic fervor, it took me over a month to finish your book. I can finish just about any book in two days flat if I'm enjoying it. I soak up the written word like a very thirsty sponge. But I just could not get into this book. I could not in any way get excited for what would happen next. It seemed to me to be an overall aimless plot, topped off with a sad and dramatic ending that in no way matched the pace of the rest of the book. It was like boringboringboring, then BAM- dramatic, tragic ending. I really cannot understand what possessed you to write it. The petty happenings of small town life simply do not strike me as engaging subject matter. I feel there were too many characters (boring ones, at that). It took me at least until halfway through the book to even differentiate between them all. Overall, this book gave me a sad face :( At the least, I expected an entertaining read. This book was, simply put, a drag that I had to force myself to finish."

author: b'Jill'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'A great book by a great author--obviously different than Harry Potter, but still so worth it! Jo has done it again!'

author: b'KarenEm'
title: b'Not impressed'
body: b'The book was ok but I had a hard time keeping interest in it. I was glad when I finished it.'

author: b'NancyLynn'
title: b'Disappointment after high expectations'
body: b"Like Rowland's previous work, there are some wonderful phrases and clever writing.  However, the story meanders and fades into boredom, never seems to go anywhere and cannot sustain interest.  A disappointment when so many have looked forward to a new book by this author."

author: b'Jill  D McDowell'
title: b'What was that all about!'
body: b"There are not many books that I neglect to see through to the end,  but even after 100 pages I just couldn't get into this one."

author: b'CJC'
title: b'I was sooooo disappointed.'
body: b"I hate to give Ms Rowling a bad review because I loved the Harry Potter series but I simply could not get into this book.  I saw an interview where Ms Rowling said by the time one gets to the end, if one is not crying, one is not human (or something to that effect).  I tried really hard but could not get past the first few chapters.  I did not care about any of these characters and I got the impression that Ms Rowling's idea of an adult book is one full of expletives and characters who  have serious psychological problems."

author: b'Diane Habell-jower'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'I have read all the Harry Potter books and enjoyed them all.'

author: b'BJNL'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy was ultimately a very good story. However, I found it very difficult in the beginning because there were so many characters and they all seemed somewhat disconnected. In the middle of the book the plot became very thick and again I had some difficulty with all the people but the story was so interesting that I had a hard time putting it down. The affect of one man's death touched so many people in so many different good and bad ways. I could not give it 5 stars because of the disconnection I felt in the beginning. The last half of the book was the best."

author: b'AvidReader'
title: b'Awful Book'
body: b"Could be one of the worst books I have ever read.  Overblown caricatures of characters, each more horrid, repulsive and unrealistic than the next. It's an effort to care what happens to these people.  Terribly melodramatic, obvious, overblown.  What a disappointment.  Do NOT purchase."

author: b'Salamet'
title: b"Not a children's book, but still an excellent read"
body: b"This is not a children's book, but it is an excellent read. Jo Rowling has crafted another heartbreakingly good story that you won't want to put down. It's gritty and very real-life. (Try not to compare it to the Harry Potter series!)"

author: b'3573'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Although I was very hopeful about Rawling's new book, it has been a terrible disappointment.  It rambles, it's depressing, and just not enjoyable."

author: b'chezbonheur'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'the book was boring and difficult to finish. Characters are confusiong and difficult to keep straight. the plot is actually rather dull and nothing that keeps you reading until the end. Several times I put it down not planning to finish it. I hope she tries again in writing another novel.'

author: b'Utsov D'
title: b'Not as bad as people say it is, though i found it interesting. Besides, you gotta read a rowling book.'
body: b'It was an interesting peek into the lives of Pagfordians.'

author: b'A.R. Hecke'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"To me, the mark of a good book, is if the writer can draw me in, making me want to read on with anticipation; I want to be apart of the little world that is created in a book!  However, with this book, I just wanted to get away, it was dull and full of characters with no redeeming qualities...I kept saying to myself, 'it'll get better', yet by chapter 10 I still had not found one thing that made me want to continue reading this book and I finally said to myself.....life is to short to continue reading bad novels when there are so many good ones out there."

author: b'Donna Lash'
title: b'Worst Book'
body: b'If you are a Harry Potter fan you will not want to believe the same author wrote this book. This was one of the worst books I have read. I kept thinking maybe it will get better and it did not. I would not tell anyone to waste their money on this one. I bought this book on the strength of her name and the fact that I loved her Potter series and would be hard pressed to buy any further books she writes till someone else spent the money first and said it was ok. Sorry J K Rowlins but I know you can do better.'

author: b'Lance Torne'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"J K Rowling has shown us all what a versatile writer she is with this wonderfully crafted book. The characterisations are breathtaking. Having read some other, less favourable, reviews, I agree that this book doesn't have the page-turning qualities that the Harry Potter books have and the action is very slow to develop until the last quarter or so. Also, the sheer number of characters unfolded so"

author: b'Elsa Bayly'
title: b'Fantastic'
body: b"This book was fantastic from start to finish.  The insight into the personality and feelings of the characters was miraculous.  I kept thinking that somewhere in my life I have met each of these characters.  Most books have characters with 'created' feelings and reactions.  The people in this book have the real loves and hatreds and fears and insecurities that everyone lives with to some extent.  They are loving and protective, vicious and cruel, kind and sympathetic until threatened and then duplicitous and nasty.  The separation of class status and the hopelessness of the downtrodden and weak is brilliantly depicted."

author: b'Jill'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I love it, T'

author: b'cyd'
title: b'the best book ever?!'
body: b"this is a very well written book about the human condition.  it shows that no matter your sociial status or where you live that we are intrinsically the same and bad thin ttgs and good things can change our lives equally.  I was especially taken with the portrayal of thecase worker.  as a socialogy major myself I think j.k. rawling'was spot on.  overall the very best book I'm read in a long time!"

author: b'GoldenMemories'
title: b"More proof of Rowling's skill as a writer"
body: b"This is a book to come into with an open mind and a willingness to read past 80 pages. For those who do make it past the slow beginning, the book is definitely rewarding. This is not the 8th Harry Potter book, and it's important not to have the expectation that it will be like Harry Potter. This is a stand alone book that is amazing not because of its plot, but because of the depth of the characters. No character in the book is black or white, and just when you think that you have correctly classified a character as weak or mean, J.K Rowling throws something in to change your mind completely. The Casual Vacancy draws the reader into the complex relationships of a town in England. The town is so realistic that I found myself thinking of the people in the book as real people. This is a book will stay with you for days after you finish it, and will make you question the way you live your life. The Casual Vacancy proves J.K Rowling's exceptional writing skills and shows that she can make anything interesting to read."

author: b'tiger01'
title: b"Good adult book from a children's author"
body: b"I enjoyed this book, although the language was surprising. I never read the Harry Potter series, so I don't know if this is common for the author. Happy endings for the characters were not the norm in this story."

author: b'MoeNY'
title: b'slow going'
body: b"So far this is very slow reading and quite confusing.  There is not enough character development so I forget each character from one chapter to the next.  Story is not captivating.  Expected much more from this author, I think she should stick to children's books."

author: b'Donice'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I personally felt the language was rather excessive. The same point could have been made without the overused F**** word.'

author: b'S. Diviney'
title: b'Honest and real'
body: b"I really enjoyed this book.  It was extremely tight and well edited, and showcases the authors skill at composing beautiful visuals.  Not to mention her insane ability to pick apart the human psyche.  This is literary fiction.  It's not about plot, it's about people.  Snarky, backstabbing, troubled people."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'No real plot, tiny bit dark, and an amazing read.'
body: b"I am continually amazed at J.K. Rowling's ability to create another world with very real characters. You are sucked into a small country town with immense problems. The only issue I had was there seemed to be no real plot. It was more a look into the twisted and sad lives of the towns  people. This book is not suitable for younger readers. It is a tiny bit dark but a great read. I look forward for her next book."

author: b'Morning Star 23'
title: b'Not an easy book to read'
body: b"I, like many others, was very excited about the release of The Casual Vacancy and was going to read it regardless of what it's reception was.  And my overall reaction is one that is hard to describe.  No, it did not meet my high expectations and no, this will never be confused with the brilliance of Harry Potter.  Still, I can't say that I regret reading the book.  It was worth reading and I do suggest giving the book a try."

author: b'Avid Reader'
title: b'Yuck'
body: b"Well, I finished it. Pushed through to the end, hoping it would get better. It didn't."

author: b'toothpayne'
title: b'dissapointing'
body: b"I had high hopes for this book since the Harry Potter series was so entertaining. There were no characters that were likeable, the plot was mediocre, the language was annoyingly crude and foul.  I almost didn't finish the book but I did and it was a waste of time."

author: b'Dan in NYC'
title: b'Enjoyed It!'
body: b'Looked at the initial reviews here on Amazon and did think twice about buying. My feeling was to "forget" the success of Harry Potter and act as if the author was new to me and give it a try. I enjoyed it...sure, some of it is sad and shows the darker side(s) of modern life....but it is a good read!'

author: b'Pamela L. Boedeker'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'Had I not known the author of this novel, I would have thought it a novice attempt at a trashy novel intended for an unsophistacated reader.  Ms. Rowling shows NONE of the extraordinary imagination of her previous Harry Potter books.  Casual Vacancy is a dull, gossipy story of a small village of disfunctional families. Abuse of teen-agers seems to be the central theme.  One star is too many for this book!'

author: b'Sunny'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Maybe it's just me but I was expecting so much more. I haven't found it to be exciting yet. I'm very disappointed."

author: b'jdenault'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Ms Rowling writes well. I had a good grasp of all the characters' personalities, the places and the underlying problems, but after reading 40% of the book (Kindle version) I did not care enough about the outcome to continue reading. (I read all the Harry Potter Books and enjoyed them so I know she can plot well.)I felt she was trying to create a slice of life book but didn't understand the importance of creating characters and/or happenings that intrigue the reader."

author: b'jg'
title: b'Dull'
body: b"First of all, the Kindle Version was $14.99! Only giving in one star, and would not recommend it. Could not get into this book. Too many characters, little action. She should stick to children's books. Very disappointed."

author: b'Bruja'
title: b'A Purposeless Writing'
body: b"JK Rowling's trend toward the negative and misery started about the 4th Harry Potter book (about the time she married), culminating in this much-too-long epistle containing nothing but the awful, jealous, disrespectful, jaundiced and crass views of life. It is a string of gossipy events typical of the British, given their love of tabloid drivel."

author: b'N.Hoffman'
title: b'Not Harry Potter Anymore.. Rated R'
body: b"J.K Rowling is a fantastic author from her Blockbuster hits with Harry Potter. This book wasn't too bad- FOR ADULTS ONLY. I am afraid parents might be mistaken with this author's previous childhood book series, and buy it for their kids. This book has very vulgar material in vivid detail relating to sex, drugs, and pedophiliia. Please read other reviews before make the choice to buy this for someone or someone underage!!! It needs a Rated R rating!!"

author: b'Michaela_SVK'
title: b'A surprise, but a pleasant one'
body: b'When I read the synopsis of the to-be-published J.K. Rowling\'s book I immediately fell for it and decided for a pre-order. Having started to read I doubted a little whether the book was a good purchase but as the story evolved & unraveled I liked it more and more and, having finished, I was able to appreciate even the introduction I had found less appealing before. The author indirectly attacked not only today\'s society but also secret fears of many individuals as well as "illnesses" the contemporary society bears upon its shoulders. Unlike many books written these days, this one leaves a message behind.'

author: b'love to nap'
title: b'I wanted to love this book'
body: b"... but I just couldn't."

author: b'redhead4000'
title: b'Totally depressing'
body: b"What a bummer of a book. Are people really like this? What a waste of time. I can only think of how depressed Jo must have been spending months with/creating these characters. I expected amazing from her. Didn't get it."

author: b'Caleb'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy - A Serious Book'
body: b"This book is so good!  As I am sure many were, I was afraid that Rowling would flop outside of the Harry Potter realm.  However, it's as good if not better writing than ever before.  I got the hardcover for a great deal (better than anywhere else was selling it, anyways).  I would definitely recommend the book and definitely recommend buying it from Amazon!"

author: b'S. D. Wright'
title: b'I expected better'
body: b"First, I'm glad JK Rowling plunged in with a non-Harry Potter book, and avoided anything supernatural.  And i think she is a good writer, all things considered."

author: b'R. P. Jennings'
title: b'what was she thinking ??????'
body: b'I LOVED all the Harry Potter books and still do.  This is simply a horrible book.  How could the same author produce such confusing, depressing and meaningless non plot no redeeming value book?????  do not waste your time or money.  Paul'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'waiting for it to get interesting'
body: b'i love her harry potter series, but with this book, i keep waiting and wondering when it will get interesting....'

author: b'Natakali'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"I really expected more from J.K. Rowling and perhaps that was the problem.  She is a good writer in her description of characters and events...it is just that in this case the plot was not very good and I found the book rather boring.  It began promisingly and the ending was okay, but so much more could have held the readers attention for the duration.  I would have put it down halfway through if I was not one of those people who finishes every book, hoping it will redeem itself.  I would not recommend this book.  I am hopeful that J.K. Rowling's next attempt at adult literature will be more entertaining."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A Quarrelsome Rude group of neighbors'
body: b'Reminds me too much of the evils of small town politics among adults combined with belligerant teenagers. Nothing good or happy ever happens to these people.  A miserable lot.'

author: b'Donald F. White'
title: b'Deep character involvement'
body: b'In small-town western midlands of England all the men are not good looking, all the women are not resourceful and all the young-uns are not exemplary - but they are believable actors in a sordid tale of prejudice and politics.  The locale of Pagford village struggles to  overcome it\'s Victorian distaste for those in poverty and those of different ethnic family backgrounds. Only the ghost of a main character, Barry Fairweather, who dies of a brain aneurism in the first few paragraphs, offers any reprieve from the humorless problems and tribulations of the others left to play out the destiny of Pagford politics. Realism seems to be the reason that frequent use of the "F" word becomes common-place by  characters seeking to get attention to their difficulties. The evolving story envelopes the reader, if for no other reason than to find out how the characters can possibly overcome their state of affairs and reach a brighter future. Fortunately there is a healing ending that is also believable thanks to the careful character development of the author, J. K. Rowling.'

author: b'Di'
title: b'Addictive black humour'
body: b'JK Rowling is an observer of human beings and particularly astute about teenage boys who have nothing whatsoever in common with Harry Potter. This is a character-driven book, with lots of sad people to choose from. Funny, insightful, and depressing in equal measures. A gripping and grim read, but memorable and I look forward to more from Rowling for a post-Harry audience.'

author: b'Lee Misch'
title: b'Packs an emotional punch!'
body: b'It is true that The Casual Vacancy is not Harry Potter, but then it is not meant to be. I decided to read it primarily because I love the Potter books and given the mixed reviews began it with some trepidation.'

author: b'LP'
title: b'enjoyable book'
body: b'JKRowling is a fabulous writer.  I am glad she has written an adult book.  Her writing is simply "delightful."  I enjoy her descriptions of each an every character. I\'m sure there are many parts of the book that will be etched in my mind.  It\'s a great book.'

author: b'Cornygal'
title: b'Full speed to...'
body: b'Rowling\'s tale started "fast" but then slowed "dramatically" as it became muddled with the various threads that I found difficult to tie to the opening.'

author: b'Aray117607'
title: b'Disappointed Harry Potter Fan'
body: b"I was highly disappointed with The Casual Vacancy. After reading the Harry Potter series, I was curious and excited to read an adult novel by J.K. Rowling. However, in the first few pages of the book, I was shocked by the amount of language and sexual content, as well as the drug scenes and dark plot. It seemed to me that J.K. Rowling was trying way too hard to reach an adult audience, and the ending was what I expected, but didn't want to expect. I do not recommend this book, especially to fans of Harry Potter or young adult readers. This definitely is not one of her finest works."

author: b'michele crawford'
title: b'Very difficult read'
body: b'We read this book for our book club. Four people manned up and pushed their way through it.  About 12, myself included, could not stick with it. Slow, slow, slow....'

author: b'Rigel'
title: b'Sordid'
body: b'I had a terrible time reading this book.  It was so sordid and I kept confusing some of the characters.  What a nasty bunch of people.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Ms. Rowling's novel gives the reader real insight to the inner workings and relationships within a contemporary British township.  The characters are diverse and painfully real.  The plot, which seems quite simple at first, is really a complex puzzle that comes together as a result of events mainly initiated by a group of high school kids.  It took me a while to get into the book, but once there, I could not leave it!"

author: b'Majesta'
title: b'Brookside re-write'
body: b'Brookside was a soap about boring people leading somewhat less boring lives. The casual vacancy is on par with that. What a waste of time. J.K needs to go back to what she is good at. This book just stinks'

author: b'Wits End'
title: b'Harry Potter, Not'
body: b'This was an entirely different genre from this author.  It is about a village in England with small town mentality.  The residents know everything there is to know about each other.  When one of the residents dies unexpectedly, it leaves a vacancy on the town council.  This causes competition between the varying factions in the village.  One faction, who are trying to retain the village way of life and the other faction, who recognise things are a-changing and they have to incorporate others into their locality and lives.'

author: b'jan'
title: b'dissappointed'
body: b'very disappointed with the book. confusing, story was so childlike. the cursing was too much,the subject matter was confusing. maybe it was too u.k. english for me.'

author: b'A. Beardslee'
title: b"Couldn't even finish it..."
body: b"I loved the Harry Potter series, not just for the stories, but for Jo's brilliant writing.  She had a way of making you care about the characters so much that you could not wait for the next page."

author: b'Chris H.'
title: b'Too many boring characters'
body: b"I have never written a book review before but I just had to for this book.  Bought the book based on the name of the author.  Wish I hadn't especially at full price.  WAY too many characters to keep track of that were all flat and boring.  Save your money and borrow it from the library.  I'm sure there won't be a long wait list to get the book."

author: b'i devour books'
title: b'I wanted to like it...'
body: b'I loved all the Harry Potter books, and I knew going into this book that it was going to be VERY different. But honestly, the Harry Potter books are solid and engaging writing. That is really all that I expected of Casual Vacancy.'

author: b'smiti'
title: b'not too impressive'
body: b'Being a die hard hp fan and a lover of good books, I obviously was looking forward to the release of Rowling\'s first ever adult novel. I have practically read everything she has published till date, even the extra books outside the hp series (like quidditch through the ages and fantastic beasts and where to find them). Why, you would ask. Because I love the way she writes. Classy and giving immense importance to details which not a lot of writers do. Even tiny details like what the character is eating gives a very personalized feel to the reader and practically takes him inside the book,as if everything is happening for real. But I guess my expectations were higher for this book. I expected a political story, as the name suggests, some dirty politics and an exciting climax. Till the very end I was hoping that something would happen which would make me think "ooh i did not expect that". But nope, even the last page did not make me believe that the novel had actually ended. Its just a story of different people living in a town dealing with family and work issues. Honestly, had this not been written by Rowling I wouldn\'t have read it till the end, but that\'s just me, I am not particularly a fan of plain jane novels and I expected a lot out of this book. Her writing is still brilliant, I still loved the way she wrote the book, if not the story itself.'

author: b'T oz'
title: b'Kind of boring'
body: b'It is a very long story. Lots of characters to follow. Most of the time I had go back to find out who was who. Not very interesting story. Stopped reading after couple of hundred pages.'

author: b'Frxta11'
title: b'Depressing, tedious, generally unpleasant.'
body: b"I really wanted this book to be so much more than it was. It's hard to top yourself when you start out with something like the Harry Potter series, and it's understandable that Rowling would want to distance herself from that genre as an author, but its almost as if she wasn't even trying for a good story here. It had none of her charm, her humor, her voice. Rowling is trying to make a political statement here and maybe she accomplished what she intended to, but it was far from an enjoyable read."

author: b'Joanna Grayson'
title: b'Multiple faces of each character'
body: b"Just when you think you have the characters divided into protagonists and antagonists, those you sympathize with versus those you disdain, you learn a bit more about them and sentiments change. As in life, there are multiple sides to every issue and many faces to most people. This novel illumines some common social issues in a localized setting and the people (some not so common) who address these issues. Couldn't put it down!"

author: b'Thuan Nguyen'
title: b'Amazing ending'
body: b"You probably won't know how good this book is until you finish the final page.  It's awesome.  Such realistic characters.  Some of the scenes are just pure magic they are written so well.  Its a very sad story but very very good. Krystal Weedon was a great character.  Jo is an amazing writer!"

author: b'BarbaraL'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This is a book that was chosen for our book club..I am probably the only person in the world who has not read J.K.Rowling before but this book was very compelling.  It is a difficult read in some ways full, of disfunctional families and people but  all intertwined so well - I really enjoyed it.  It brings out a full range of emotions - disgust, sadness, empathy.  I would highly recommend it.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Peyton Place Gone BRITT ! ! !'
body: b"A small English village populated by strong characters with all the flaws and insecurities endemic to the human race...blended in a highly contested political arena...all spiced with the ubiquitous foibles of mankind...It's the perfect recipe for a delightful read. I would highly recommend this book!"

author: b'c. who'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I found this book hard to get into and once there I didn\'t like the tone of the book. I found it to be somewhat "reality show" based with bickering husbands and wives and the foulness of the teenagers was actually appalling. Don\'t misunderstand, I realize her book is written in an updated societal way. However, I don\'t generally read books like those, regardless of who the author is. I read it to the end, hoping for at least a better ending but I felt I was left hanging, not wanting more, but glad it was over.'

author: b'Jennifer McElyea'
title: b'A very depressing story.'
body: b'This was the most depressing book I have ever read.  I was excited to read another JK Rowling novel, but next time I will take there views more seriously...'

author: b'Deborah Korinis'
title: b'Good Read'
body: b"This book was compelling and held my interest.  Obviously a departure from Rowling's Harry Potter series but no less entertaining.  I would recommend this book to anyone interested in human weakness."

author: b'angel'
title: b'good read'
body: b"I wondered what kind of a book J.K. Rowling could write for adult reading having read the Harry Potter books which by the way I enjoyed. The Casual Vacancy was not a disappointment but rather a most interesting read. There were many characters but the author described them in a way that you got to know each one.  I hope it doesn't become a movie because I can picture what each character looks like in my mind's eye. The story"

author: b'L. L. Talbot'
title: b'Stick to children/teen literature'
body: b"Not engaging at all.  Down right disgusting in some parts.  Skipped through it and it doesn't appear to get any better--time to get money back."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Dissapointed.....'
body: b"This book leaves a great deal to be desired, for sure.  However, after slogging through to the end, it haunted me for a long time.  The characters were difficult to keep straight, but there were a couple who grabbed your heart and wouldn't let go."

author: b'buddy'
title: b'Do Not Waste your money on this book'
body: b'This book really just stinks.  I bought it because, of course, Harry Potter, figuring she could come up with a good story or two.  But not this time around.  It is a boring book, about boring, uninteresting, flacid personalities that she is unable to lift off the floor of this no real plot, stupefying ill-written and complete waste of your time.  Heed my warning, do not waste your money, wish I could mine back plus penalties against the author for torturing us all with this crap.'

author: b'eclectic reader'
title: b'Dark, Deep, and Thought Provoking'
body: b'I had heard that the casual Vacancy was nothing like the Harry Potter series.  This is a very accurrate assessment.  The book deals with very heavy topics that are both disturbing and thought provoking.  I found it well written.'

author: b'James E Riley'
title: b'Worst book ever'
body: b'this had to be the worst book I have read it 20 years! This lady needs to stick to Harry Potter.  Extremely depressing read with no let up all through the book.'

author: b'drnicole'
title: b'booorrringggg'
body: b'This book started slow, and I had hoped it would pick up. It never did. the book dredged on, with a boring english voice narrative, focused on character development- only all of the characters are extremely depressed, filled with anger, some suicidal. This book depressed me! It was a struggle to get through- just a meandering tale about the lives of these horrible people in a small english town. would not recommened- but would LOVE to sell my copy to someone else- for cheap!'

author: b'Nerine Dorman'
title: b'A cautionary tale'
body: b"I purposefully avoided most of the reviews written about JK Rowling's new novel, The Casual Vacancy, while I was reading the book myself. I wanted to experience the novel without any of the preconceptions of others. To a degree I was successful, and in retrospect I'm glad I made the effort."

author: b'Dana Sweeney'
title: b'A forgettable and unsatisfying read'
body: b"The Harry Potter books are a stunningly well-written work of literature.  I am sad not to have enjoyed the next work by JK Rowling.  It's unfortunate that the cast of characters, though ably drawn, are so (almost without exception) unlikable.  There's just nothing to hold onto in this book, no one to root for, no moments of joy, and ultimately, no moments of real tragedy, unless the book has succeeded in its one transparent goal: to make you feel very very sorry for heroin addicts.  I have rarely read a book where the author's political beliefs got in the way of telling a good story quite so much."

author: b'Nancy G.'
title: b'Difficult.'
body: b"As an English teacher, I know that the ultimate goal is to include the reader on the author's journey; however,  Casual Vacancy was very difficult to read.  It did not flow for the reader.  Also, the English semantics (Great Britain) was challenging and difficult to follow in several places."

author: b'Jon (Scott Reads It!)'
title: b'Extremely Disappointing!'
body: b'After rereading my review of The Casual Vacancy I realized it sounded sloppy and very unprofessional. I decided to edit my entire review and start from scratch.'

author: b'Michael Stafford'
title: b'Hard to finish'
body: b"I'm a huge Harry Potter fan, and I had hoped that Rowling's first attempt at an adult book would be good.  I had a hard time getting through this book- the characters weren't that interesting, and I found myself putting the book down without much joy in picking it back up again.  I only finished it b/c I sincerely hoped that she was going to have some wonderful twist or SOMETHING to make it worth my while.  At least I got it from the library and didn't waste my money.  I think she's better suited to children's literature- surely with her creativity and imagination, she could write another interesting children's series."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Great Read'
body: b"I think it was very much her style. Yes it unique and dark. But real life doesn't always have a happy ending so I enjoy the realism that it portrays. I have a hard time getting into books like this but I loved this one. Great start into her adult line."

author: b'bookworm'
title: b"Don't Bother"
body: b"I was really disappointed in this book.  It was one of the worst books I have ever read.  The main event happens right off the bat.  Then most of the book is just getting to know the people.  There is no happy ending, and the main event becomes moot at the end.  I didn't see a story being told."

author: b'Dorte'
title: b'True J.K.Rowling style'
body: b'I think the story is great, it takes some time to get properly familiar with all the persons. True to her style J.K.Rowling has a very large number of characters and they are described in every detail. Great but it slao makes the beginning of the book a bit jumbled.'

author: b'Salford75'
title: b'Real Life England'
body: b'I thought is was fab - i real snapshot of life in an English Town, it had me in tears..............for all the Weedon families out there...........'

author: b'KimD32'
title: b'Not her best work.....'
body: b"I was really excited when I saw an adult book published by J.K. Rowling. I even pushed my book club towards reading the book this past month. Unfortunately, all of us have agreed that the book is awful. It is so redundant and goes no where. I just can't bear to finish it. Sorry J.K., better luck next time!"

author: b'Crio'
title: b'Surprising Departure'
body: b'I did not read all the Harry Potter books because I like more realistic stories. This book revolved around the lives of a community that was in a bit a turmoil. She did weave an interesting story line involving both young and old. Slowly intertwining the lives of the people who lived in this small village. There was a slow build to the story. As I started to read the book the word mundane came to mind but the more I read I must say I enjoyed it!'

author: b'larry'
title: b'Much like an unsuccessful first novel'
body: b'For those who are thinking that the Potter series makes this a worthwhile read, save your money, and more importantly your time. The writing style that was the most impressive part of Potter is totally lacking in this novel: multiple characters-poorly defined, scenes blended into scenes without cohesion made for a very confusing book. As a big fan of John Irving, I enjoy depressing stories. But the characters have to mean something. What you have here is a story of town full of miserable people who have nothing better to do then be mean. Very disappointing-I was expecting so much more.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"Best book I've read in ages"
body: b'From start to finish this was a brilliant book.  Not having read those other J K Rowling books I had no preconceptions about the style of writing.  She gets you involved with the characters and amazed at how a life altering event for one person in a small town can affect so many others.  Definitely worth reading.'

author: b'Bruce Tabor'
title: b'JK get back to Harry'
body: b"This book tries to flesh out too many characters and does not succeed very well.  It is long on character building and short on a moving plot.  Don't buy this book.  There are much better reads out there."

author: b'Charill Pierce'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Truly something completely different from J.K. Rowling- Characters get confusing at times but the story line holds the reader's interest."

author: b'PAW1105'
title: b'Interesting First Novel'
body: b'The book was hard to get into and as you persisted it started to get better. By the end of the novel you could not put iyt down. You had to know how it ended.'

author: b'M. N. Wold'
title: b"Don'tBother"
body: b"There was not one character in this book who was likeable (well, maybe Mary). So who cares what happened to them? If people can change as quickly as these characters did at the end of the book, why didn't someone simply set them straight years earlier?"

author: b'Susan R K'
title: b'very disappointing'
body: b'I am an adult, I enjoyed all the Harry Potter Books and was looking forward to an "adult" book by J K Rowling.  I was very disappointed.'

author: b'Jules'
title: b'REALLY!'
body: b"This can't be the same J.K. this book is unreadable.I gave it chapter after chapter to get going and eventually gave up."

author: b'Uma'
title: b'Causeless Vacancy'
body: b'eewww[...]'

author: b'jjm3fp'
title: b"Don't expect Harry Potter"
body: b"If this had been Ms. Rowling's first book, it would have been received reasonably well. It's a complex story because of the multitude of characters. In my Kindle version I referred often to the character list to remember what the relationship was among many of them. I was more than half way through before I was comfortable with the associations. Frankly, I think some of the characters could have been combined to make it less complex but as a counter argument, life is not simple and this story is a life story above all."

author: b'Fantasy Fan'
title: b'Hated it.'
body: b"This is a dreadful book, and I'm not just talking about the wretched, completely unsympathetic characters or the really awful language. Novels, whether for children, young adults or adults should all be about the storytelling. Having given us fully fleshed out characters with great story lines in the HP series, I was disappointed and appalled at the banality of the storytelling in this book. I couldn't keep all the characters straight because apparently they were ALL drawn from the same cesspool and boring.  Really boring. I squandered my precious reading time slogging through 200 pages and threw the book across my room where it made a most satisfying plonk as it rebounded off the wall and fell into my wastepaper basket."

author: b'Myrna Moran'
title: b'Right To the Heart of the Matter'
body: b"Ms Rowling starts her book with descriptions of some singularly petty and unlikeable people from a small English town.  They are squabbling over some of the seemingly inconsequential issues that tend to crop up in small towns everywhere.  As the story builds, the characters begin to fill out and the reader (one hopes) starts to become cognizant of the very deep cruelty and deprivation that results from social policies made by securely self righteous people.  The author brings it all down home to the costs in human suffering that are the result of self-seeking policies.  Her characters are rich and interesting, noone escaping her xray vision for foibles and flaws.  Suspense builds as the book goes on and the reader takes sides.  Her adolescent characters are particularly well-drawn, with nothing held back in her depiction of the dog-eat-dog world of adolescence.  The author could certainly not be criticized for glossing anything over.  This writer read the audiobook, which was very capably performed by Tom Hollander.  The design on the jacket and the CD's is the best I've seen."

author: b'jeannine'
title: b'a casual vacancy'
body: b'very slow an not interesting until 3/4 the way through. After reading felt it would be a good book for book clubs, lots of'

author: b'J. Webb'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Joanne Rowling has a way with words that makes reading her books a great pleasure.  Her style transcends the age for which she is writing and is the reason she can write for all readers.  She proves this with The Casual Vacancy, her first adult book.  I look forward to all of her future works.'

author: b'Enid S. Norris'
title: b'Very disappointing book.'
body: b"This book is very disappointing, definitely not Rowling's best.  The characters are two dimensional and the plot is weak. Rowling certainly is not at her best."

author: b'Paige Castle'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This is Very Slow to develope characters and plot lines. I am half way through the book and have lost interest.'

author: b'Jeanne B.'
title: b'Disappointing and dull'
body: b"I bought this book for my Kindle and I'm sorry I did because even though I can remove it from my Kindle it will still exist in my Cloud somewhere. If it were a traditional book I could just burn it."

author: b'MysteryFanatic'
title: b'Great writing, unlikeable characters'
body: b'I opened the book prepared to love it, and, in fact, The Casual Vacancy is well written, begins with an interesting delimma, and introduces several characters who ultimately wind together in interesting ways. Ms. Rowling describes people and their personal tics as well or better than anyone and I had no trouble picturing them in my mind.'

author: b'Marcia R. Todd'
title: b'Intriguing Plot'
body: b"I was glad to read this on my Kindle because the book is over 500 pages long. It has received mixed reviews but I really enjoyed it - couldn't put it down. As I was reading it, I watched an interview with the author on Charlie Rose and was interested that she put an emphasis on the main story that was completely different from mine."

author: b'caitlin torres'
title: b'Men, not measures'
body: b'Choppy throughout and hasty toward the end, Ms. Rowling\'s new novel nevertheless demonstrates the  extraordinary powers of characterization that were so apparent in her Harry Potter stories. The scenes she creates are mostly nothing special, nor is the language she uses to shape them particularly compelling. But the people who inhabit those scenes haunt the mind.  In presenting us with "A Casual Vacancy," JK Rowling exercises a remarkable gift, but it is a little hard to define its terms.  The real work here is not that of a writer, nor even of a storyteller -- it\'s rather as if she were the author of an invisible play, with the object being our cathartic experience of fear and pity, and the mechanism being the interstitial grip that the heart of the imagined has on the heart of the real.'

author: b'seajay'
title: b'Nothing like Harry Potter'
body: b"this is definitely not for the children! I think it is a jaded look at the new British social structure. The book itself is very difficult to put down, once you have started reading, due to the twists & turns in the plot. As with the Harry Potter books, the author is able hold the reader's attention fully. I thought it was a jolly good read."

author: b'Broyds'
title: b'Not the best, but probably not the worst either.'
body: b'I knew that I was going to get this book, because the fact that its written by JK Rowling is a massive selling point.  However most of the book was unfortunately rather dull.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I couldn't finish it.  It was just too boring.  It just dragged on and on and on forever.  Certainly not Harry Potter!"

author: b'John'
title: b'Depressing People Living Quiet Lives of Despair'
body: b"I bought this book expecting J.K. Rowling to transport me on an exploration of British society. I got quite an exploration of a side of Britain I hadn't seen before; but one I would have rather not explored."

author: b'TMS'
title: b"Likely would not have been published if she weren't J.K. Rowling"
body: b'Whew! Managed to slog my way through that!  I wouldn\'t recommend this book.  The first 100 or so pages, in particular, are just interminable.  Nothing is happening except the introduction of characters - ALL of whom are boring and annoyingly dysfunctional.  Also, the author is trying way too hard to prove that she can write an adult novel.  Unfortunately, her definition of "adult" seems to be simply crude and/or profane.  Things do pick up a tiny bit after that, but, in general, the book is simply tiring, ponderous and depressing.'

author: b'DanT'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"Bought this book, in spite of the brief description, because it was written by JK Rowling and I've been quite pleased with her previous works.  Any book described as this one was by any other author would not have been considered for purchase; unfortunately this one was."

author: b'JenniferDZ'
title: b'the ending makes up for the beginning'
body: b"The book was difficult in the beginning.  Many characters to keep track of.  I was probably more than 100 pages in before I really started to enjoy the book.  Don't give up on it.  Holy crap, the ending was great.  Such a good book.  BTW, I have never read any of the HP."

author: b'Beverly J. Leach'
title: b'Really wanted to like the book'
body: b'I really wanted to like Casual Vacancy, and of course I read it because I had liked the Harry Potter series.  And I was willing to cut Rowling some slack, because how do you write a book after Harry Potter?  But I was really disappointed, and I struggled to finish it.  Too many characters introduced too slowly, no interesting plot, no main protagonist, no one to care about or to cheer on.  Rowling is good at describing details, especially about mean and self-centered people.  But not enough loose ends were tied up at the end to make it a satisfying story.'

author: b'FunSize870509'
title: b"Not Twilight or 50 Shades if that's what you are looking for"
body: b"If Twilight or 50 Shades is more your speed, don't challenge yourself.  Now for readers of actual books such as Lord of the Rings, The Great Gasby, The Giver or even The Notebook, this book isn't for everyone.  It is pretty difficult to read for the average reader because it jumps from one character's story to the next, all relating to this devestating event.  What makes this book so intense is that it deals with real life.  You can pretty much take these characters in these different situations and apply them to any city in any country.  We all know the Howard and Shirleys in our town; people who need to be kicked off their high horse.  We all know the Barrys in our town that try to make it a better place.  We all know the variety of teenagers like Andrew, Fats, and Krystal.  Some of J. K. Rowling's writing style is meant to be read as a Monty Python actor with a sense of British humor.  I will have to admit, I was shocked by the first 100 pages with the words and phrases J. K. Rowling used.  It is also why I liked this book because it is so different from Harry Potter, and I LOVE Harry Potter.  Its a shame that people judge a book by its cover rather than the actual story.  This book just shows that J. K. Rowling can write very different stories and still be so enchanting as an author."

author: b'Sue Cohen'
title: b'A difficult book for Americans'
body: b'I would not have understood The Casual Vacancy at all if I hadn\'t just revisited the entire "Prime Suspect" series on Netflix.  (A very worthwhile thing to do!)  Having seen the poverty and destitution, as well as the crime, delinquency, and terrible language and attitudes of the "estates" poor Jane had to deal with in Prime Suspect, I could at least understand what JK Rowling was talking about in terms of The Fields.'

author: b'lil-m-m'
title: b'Aga Saga with bite'
body: b'I have to be honest I had only read the first Harry Potter book, and thought "if I was ten years old I probably would have really enjoyed that", but I haven\'t been inclined to read any more.  Curiosity moved me to buy A Casual Vacancy, and I\'m so glad I did, I couldn\'t put it down, initially it seems to start like the typical AGA SAga, set in an English village, but it\'s so much more than that, darker, but there are some seriously funny  moments, and the many twists in the plot, before an in your face ending, don\'t sant to spoil it by saying more.  The characters are great, so totally beleivable and of the age.  I\'m almost inclined to try a few more HP books.'

author: b'bluepony'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b"I read for entertainment, this book is very depressing. I loved the Harry Potter books but this one is to much like watching the news or reading the paper with the worst kind of news. I didn't finish this book, I couldn't."

author: b'Danielle Mildge'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"Rowling's attempt at writing for adults was incredibly disappointing.  Repetitive, boring.  I expected more.  I won't be purchasing any future novels."

author: b'Book Lady'
title: b'If anothny Trollope and Sainclair Leiws wrote a book together'
body: b"They would have enlisted Sherwood Anderson and produced A Casual Vacancy.  JK Rowlings has captured Trollope's detailed and precise analysis of provincial British life and combined it with the mordent cynacism of Sainclair Lewis' trenchent study of self-satisfied,small minded, small town Americans who in Babbit grapple as ineffectively with personal and social issues as the residents of Rowlings self deluding small town.  This proves she can write for adults even when the real focus of her story are the children, struggling through adolescence, vulnerable, and as agents creating the tragic story arc that leads to unpleasant truths, tattered relationships, self awareness, and death.  This  isn't hogwarts and the ending is bleak and unsettling.  Her individual portraits rival Sherwood Anderson's masterful collection of grotestiques that he created in Winesburg Ohio.  Each is sharply drawn and their fobiles and failures clearly drawn.  Krystal, of course, is the real and tragic heroine of the story.  She is the Hary Potter-Hermoine surrogate, fighting the dark forces of the adult world and because this is an adult novel, losing catastrophically."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'J K Rowling great adult writer as well.'
body: b'Casual Vacancy was an enjoyable read. Her characters were well developed and believable. It was an easy read which I couldnt put down. Well worth the purchase.'

author: b'Dennis  Crabtree'
title: b'Nothing like the Harry Potter books.'
body: b"I haven't read it myself, but my wife has---or at least she tried to.  She gave up on it about halfway through; she tells me it's infested with misspellings, mispunctuations, omitted words, incomplete sentences, gaps in the plot---inconstencies in the story, the action, the characters and the overall logic.....not to mention all the foul language.  I know my wife's likes and dislikes, and I respect her opinions in matters of literature, so I'm reluctant to read the book myself---at least, for now.  One day, perhaps, when curiosity finally gets the better of me....."

author: b'Charis L. Combs Lay'
title: b'Not a fantasy book, but a bead on reality'
body: b"This isn't Harry Potter.  True enough.  But, Rowling builds a layered picture of family life in small towns.  Politics, drug abuse, sports, bullying, obsessive compulsive disorder, the private lives of parents and teenagers, domestic violence, betrayal, surprising love and morality are all in these covers.  As always, Rowling is a fine story teller.  I live in a small town in America, and I can see her characters around me.  It's not a fantasy and it's not really for children.  Take the book on it's own terms."

author: b'Paula Sue Cosentino'
title: b'Fun read'
body: b'A quick read with lots of intriguing twists. Below the fun there is an honest, gritty look of life in the UK.'

author: b'Pamela A. Selkirk'
title: b'JK Rowling - Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I was bitterly disappointed in this book.  I admit i probably was expecting far too much. A rarity for me, but, I did not even finish reading. The story line took far too long to get anywhere.'

author: b'Virgil Howarth'
title: b'Great Writer for Kids, but....'
body: b"A great writer for kids with deep imagination and mystery, but this latest novel aimed at adults is wanting. A detailed intrigue in a small village that is too deep and self absorbing, with shallow characters that are not interesting. I'm for devious characters in a book; but not boring, which these are."

author: b'Kay Eifert'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"I am about 3/4 finished with it and so far I have not been impressed.  It sure isn't one I can't put down.  Stick to Harry Potter."

author: b'HeatherM'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"A really good read. The characters are very real and the storyline is woven in a believable way. Laughter and tears for the reader but a book you don't want to put down. Awaiting Rowling's next book with interest."

author: b'jennwit'
title: b'A Fantastic Character Study!'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy was every bit (& even better!) than I expected. The character development & story had me thinking about them long after finishing the book. It was difficult to put it down as the story was so compelling. It was truly a tale of the "haves and the have nots". J.K. Rowling does not disappoint.'

author: b'wikathie'
title: b'worth reading'
body: b"I wasn't sure just what to expect from this book.  I am an HP fan and was willing to give it a try out of curiousity.  It was well written and the characters were interesting.  If she wrote another, I'd buy it."

author: b'Daphne'
title: b'satisfying character studies'
body: b'This story is full of very unlikable people yet characters are so well developed that the reader likes and pities them..good and bad.  There is a dearth of good people herein, and they do shine through the murkiness eventually.  I really loved her  depiction of time and place, as I had never read any Harry Potter stuff, disliking fantasy to the max.  I will read anything else this masterful storyteller writes for adults.'

author: b'ElizabethLee724'
title: b'Not Disappointed'
body: b"I was skeptical about getting this book because 1) I am a die-hard Harry Potter fan and I was afraid that this just wouldn't be it. 2) I had heard from friends who had already started reading that it was just not good and they couldn't get into the book and story. So I started read. And I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, this book is nothing like Harry Potter but I like that she branched out so much. She gives a depth to these characters that actually left me with some tears in the end. If you are looking for an in-depth look into how a tragedy can affect people in different ways, then this is your book."

author: b'Patricia'
title: b'Starts strong but fizzles'
body: b'When I started reading The Casual Vacancy I was excited by the level of writing, the detail to character development and building suspense. But so far, at over half way through, has not progressed beyond this basic scene setting phase.  Hopefully it picks up in the last half!'

author: b'Sparty'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"A complicated story with too many characters, quickly revealing itself as the author's thinly-veiled social commentary instead of an entertaining fiction novel.  Harry Potter fans will be disappointed with this piece of work."

author: b'BarbM'
title: b'Diappointing'
body: b"I was pretty bored. I just kept waiting for something to happen or even a hint that something exciting would happen. Things started to move at the end of the book, but it was too late. Bravo to the author for going a different direction, but Casual Vacancy didn't hit the mark for me."

author: b'Acorn'
title: b'Well written and engaging'
body: b"The difference between JK Rowling and many other authors to find success in print and screen is this: JK Rowling can actually write. The Casual Vacancy is not the page-turner that Harry Potter was, but it's still engaging. You feel for the characters and care about what will happen to them. Each has a complexity that you don't expect, making the book fascinating, even if the story is a little boring. Her use of the English language makes you wish you had paid attention to your Word of the Day calendar, and serves as a reminder to be grateful for the Kindle's built-in dictionary."

author: b'Frode Stiansen'
title: b'Utmerket bok p orginalsprket'
body: b'J.C. Rolwling leverer ogs for voksne. Spennende beskrivelser av dagens England. La oss hpe at hun ikke beskriver Norge ogs!'

author: b'LVW'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Soooo many characters it is hard to keep straight! Good story line all in all but a real let down ending!'

author: b'lmbjk'
title: b'Not Great'
body: b'I was less than thrilled with this book.  The character development was weak.  The plot was not well thought out.  It was disappointing because I enjoyed her other books so much!'

author: b'DH'
title: b'Too Many Muggles, Not Enough Magic'
body: b'While the ending of the book was poignant, and I respect the point Rowling was trying to make, it was too difficult getting there. "Casual Vacancy" is jam-packed with characters, virtually none of them admirable, so there is no one to empathize with. The bare bones plot details the power struggle that ensues after a member of the parish council dies. As the characters plot and scheme for his now-vacant seat, their children are neglected and sordid secrets come to light. "Casual Vacancy"\'s potential might have been realized had the book been better edited. A few sympathetic characters among the many, or fewer characters overall may have allowed the plot to gain momentum. As it is, Rowley imprisoned us in the petty, social-striving world of Harry Potter\'s muggle family, the Dursleys, with no magic.'

author: b'Blah Blah'
title: b'Not for me!'
body: b'It\'s okay, but too much backstory is introduced after the initial "hook me to read more", and I keep falling asleep. The characters are ok, but some are a bit...well....made up! I do like the touch on social issues, and how they affect a community, but over all it\'s not a good read. Maybe she should have used another name on this book, because I expected so much more from this author!!!'

author: b'fishnroo'
title: b'Let Down'
body: b"After reading the Harry Potter series to my kids over the years - I looked forward to this book.  Can't even bear to finish it."

author: b'Kathleen S. Ross'
title: b'Definitely NOT Harry Potter'
body: b"It took a bit to get into the book.  It's not an easy read the way the Potter books are, but a compelling story."

author: b'Joyce Ann Jacobs'
title: b'She knows her kids!'
body: b'I enjoyed reading this book mostly because I used to teach children this age and I feel that Rowling really understands the way they speak and think. The adults do not come off as well - sometimes I could barely tell them apart. Still, I did finish reading the book because I wanted to find out what happened to the people.'

author: b'book lady'
title: b'the casual vacancy'
body: b'I found this book to be very slow and  boring and did not read past the first 3 chapters. I saved it to Archives and perhaps will go back and finish reading it at another time. marilyn anthony'

author: b'Dave Shick'
title: b"We're not at Hogwart's anymore"
body: b'This book starts out with some promise of being interesting, but quickly becomes laborious and predictable.  Even generous doses of "sex, drugs and rock and roll" don\'t help.'

author: b'A Mom'
title: b'Very disappointing'
body: b'This is the first J.K. Rowling book that I will not be holding on to. I finished reading it, and am ready for it to leave my house. I never want to set eyes on it again.'

author: b'mybestfriend'
title: b'terrible language'
body: b'I would NOT have purchased and read all the Harry Potter books if she had written this one first. I managed to get as far as page 53 and took it back to the library. It was boring and the use of foul 4-letter words was offensive. The X on the front of the book is a definite rating.'

author: b"Kinx's Book Nook"
title: b'Sad & Depressing'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy was a very difficult book to read. I say that based on  storyline, not the actual writing. Ms. Rowling has a beautiful writing style and can tell amazing stories. However, in her first book written specifically for adults, she tells a very depressing tale of a town at war with itself.'

author: b'marybea'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Considering the world renowned status of the author, I was appalled at the choice to use dirty little four letter words repeatedly.  By the time I got to page 14 I closed the book and threw it away!!!!  Of course I will never again purchase a book by this author.  There should be a warning noted very prominently when foul language is used in a publication!!!!'

author: b'Elena Ceballos'
title: b'It just did not hook me at all'
body: b'I only read about 1/8th of the book because i had absolutely nothing better to do. Dissapointing after reading all the harry potter books and being absolutely hooked by them'

author: b'Elisa'
title: b'Not for those who want a quick read'
body: b"Let me emphasize THIS IS NOT AN EASY READ. I had moments when I didn't want to pick it up. But it is rewarding if you finish it. I'm sure that I will find many reviews of people complaining about every aspect of this book simply because it is NOT Harry Potter. Others will complain because of the language, the grim realities of these character's lives and the drug use. Surely those people have watched an R-rated movie before."

author: b'Ellie'
title: b'Rowling can write for adults, too.'
body: b'This book is darker and bleaker than you might have wanted, but she creates a place and time that you can visualize and then she creates characters that are so real you feel you are watching a real story unfold in a real place.  Magic.  She made us believe in Hogwarts and Harry Potter, and now she proves she can bring the same skills to an adult novel.  I hope she writes more adult fiction.'

author: b'Karen Rodriguez'
title: b'BOOOORING'
body: b"I couldn't wait to finally read an adult Book by JK.  Much to my regret I find it terribly boring.  I make myself read a chapter or two each day. Painful"

author: b'Vicky'
title: b'I enjoyed this book'
body: b"It must be difficult to decide to do a completely different book after receiving such acclaim for the Harry Potter series, but I think J. K. Rowling did a wonderful job.  This was completely different from Harry Potter and there is really no comparison.  This book's characters reminded me a bit of the characters in Ruth Rendall's books, though perhaps not quite as quirky.  They all had their issues and problems and even though other people may have thought certain people were a certain way or had perfect lives, we were able to see into their lives and to see the issues and problems they all were grappling with. I found it a very good read. I think a potential reader needs to put Harry Potter completely out of his or her head before starting this book and then it can be enjoyed on its own merits.  Well worth the time."

author: b'Scout'
title: b'It rambles a bit...'
body: b"I think fewer characters... each well developed... rather than many characters, often revisited but never for long... may have been better. I'm almost to the end and still having difficulty caring about any of these people."

author: b'B. Klink'
title: b'Worst book I ever read'
body: b'I bought this book based on the popularity of the author from the Harry Potter series of which I read the first three and half of four and stopped as they got too dark and I did not enjoy them anymore.  The Casual Vacancy did not have one smile in the whole book.  Not one character to like or champion.  I read about 40 books a year and have for many years.  I took this book to the trash masher dumpster to make sure no one could take it out to read.  I have never done that with a book before.  The book is all about bullying.  The parents bully the kids, the kids bully the parents and their teachers and their peers, the parents bully their friends.  And there is no saving grace in the whole book.  What was the point in writing it?  It gave no hope that this practice could be contained or ways to change it. It seems like the author is promoting bullying.  I have never been so disappointed in a book and I read across all genres.  I am 84 years old and have been an avid reader my entire life since I learned to read in grade school.'

author: b'Shel'
title: b'Sadly disappointed'
body: b"I will admit upfront, I read the HP series. My reading enjoyments are widely varied, however, so I started this book with an open mind and no expectations other than I like this author's previous works."

author: b'Diana'
title: b'No casual relationships here'
body: b'A common thread among the characters appears to be the need to cling to relationships, resentfully, for fear of being alone.  Who appears to be the happiest, most together, person in the town meets his demise early in the story. There are some funny moments but the ending is dissatisfying. Self-absorption seems to derail any chance of a life well-lived in Pagford.'

author: b'Sharon S'
title: b'No Harry Potter here'
body: b"J. K.Rowling (or her editors) must have catered to American audiences when writing the Harry Potter series. There weren't as many British idioms in those books. The Casual Vacancy has the charm of English vernacular throughout--beginning with the book's title. While this book isn't as much of a page-turner as the Potter books, it provides a close up look at modern English society and the day-to-day challenges of living in and running a small town. The problems facing Pagford are mirrored in American society and the characters could be our next door neighbors. As with the Potter series, there are unexpected twists and turns, albeit on a decidedly adult level. A thought-provoking read."

author: b'J. Matis/Boca Raton, Florida'
title: b'Extremely Disappointed'
body: b'After reading all of J.K. Rowling\'s books (and sometimes more than once) I became an enormous fan of hers. Ms Rowling\'s panache for character development in her Harry Potter series was so impressive and captivating that I couldn\'t wait to read her new novel Casual Vacancy. I wish that I had waited and waited and actually never bought the book. Simply put, Casual Vacancy is the worst book I have ever read. There is not once shred of goodness in this book at all. Walt Disney once said, "For every laugh there should be a tear." Well, Casual Vacancy is nothing but tears. Even though, Ms Rowling is known for her keen sense of character development, there is not one character in the book that is likable or has any redeeming qualities, much less a character that the average reader could relate to or give empathy. I had high hopes for this book, but those hopes were dashed after about the first fifty pages. I actually thought that the more I would read, the book would get much better. Instead it became more difficult to get through and, of course, the ending was the worst. I am shocked that Ms Rowling would write such a second rate novel when her other works are first class.'

author: b'Frugal shopper'
title: b'Disappointment'
body: b'This is going to be a short review.  I loved Rowling\'s Harry Potter series of books, but this was the worst book I have ever "tried" to read.  I got about halfway through it and realized there was no plot at all.  It was just page after unnecessary page of "blah".  I finally fast forwarded to the last 3 chapters and still it was boring me to death. I probably could have made myself sit and read the complete book, but why bother?  I hated every single one of the characters and frankly didn\'t care if they all were killed by some mass murderer.  At least that would have made it interesting!
