But no, it just went on and on with the ridiculously boring, selfish, dysfunctional and loathsome people! I feel like I need to wash my eyes after delving half way into it to remove the filth and sadness they endured.'

author: b'Brandy'
title: b'A good but depressing read.'
body: b"This is a very well written book with fascinating characters and a very interesting storyline that pulls you in right up until the tragic end. This is book is not for you if 1)you need happy endings 2)you need any sort of happiness in a book 3)you're expecting Harry Potter or any sort of fantasy. This is a sad look into the lives people leave, the secrets that they keep and how they can be destructive."

author: b'Karen55phd'
title: b'Disturbing.............shows what greed can do inside and out.'
body: b'Another winner from J.K. Rowling, but if you are looking for Harry Potter, you have picked up the wrong book.  This is the story of a town where the vacancy of a council seat moves people to act as if at war with each other.  It shows what can happen when the need for power goes astray.  Each character in turn must come to grips with their own truths before the ending reveals who wins.  Yes, it is good vs evil (which Harry Potter has too), but this is at the adult level, which is more dangerous.'

author: b'Reading Mom'
title: b'sadly disappointed'
body: b"The only good thing about this book is the language. JK Rowling can write. She could write about raindrops and I would read.  However, I think the point of this book is that Rowling wanted to make sure people knew that she could write an adult book. She did. It's just not a good one. Flat, uninteresting characters, and a VERY predictable plot. I wanted to like this book. I knew it wasn't HP. I didn't want it to be HP. And I am very disappointed."

author: b'Judith Barcik'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I have mixed emotions about this book.  I do not feel it has the quality of writing that I enjoyed in the Potter series. I found it to be very dark, almost depressing.  It was also very "English."  Had I not read a number and variety of English novels in the past I would not have understood some of it. It didn\'t necessarily relate to American life.'

author: b'JOCO'
title: b'A world I want no part of'
body: b"I'm having the hardest time reading this book!  Oh, it's written well, but unlike Potter's world, a world in which we want to dwell in this is a world you are indifferent to at best and dislike at worst. We are use to compelling and interesting characters from J.K. alas there are none here!"

author: b'Bonnie'
title: b'Amazing writing'
body: b'After reading the Harry Potter series, this was such a chane, and she is an amazing writer, I always knew tat, but I thoroughly enjoyed this book.'

author: b'Anzia'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"I was interested in seeing how Rowling would write for adults.  She didn't.  Although the central plot involved adult community bickering, most of this novel centered on young adult issues.  The plot was predictable, and the characters lacked depth.  I would not recommend this book to friends."

author: b'calisimon'
title: b'Interesting read'
body: b'I would recommend this book. If you are not familiar the UK language it will be enlightening.  The plot is slow and predictable.'

author: b'Dean'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I have not yet finished, am about 60% thru.  I am somewhat disappointed, finding it difficult to stay focused.  Seems to lack continuity. I find myself bored and can only get thru 1 or 2 chapters at a setting.'

author: b'Christine'
title: b"Just a regular ol' book. Not great not awful."
body: b'I just finished this book. I bought it on September 28 and finished it on Nov 3. So, if it took me that long to read it, that means I am doing other things at reading time. Like looking up reviews of chip clips on Amazon. Which, of course,  means the book is not interesting enough to get me off the computer doing worthless activites to go and read it. Lots of characters, and I didn\'t really care about any of them, long and boring.... It wasn\'t terrible - but nothing to write home about either. I never would have picked it up if it wasn\'t this author. I was not expecting another Harry Potter - but it\'s really hard to believe this was by the same person. I would have read it no matter what - just to see what she wrote next, out of curiosity, but I would never tell someone "Oh - you must read "Casual Vacancy", it\'s so good!" It\'s not that good. I am glad to be done with it, when I read a book I truly love - I don\'t want it to end.'

author: b'Wandering Traveler'
title: b"don't bother!"
body: b'I was so excited that JK Rowling had a new book...until I began to read it. Too many story lines to try to keep straight.  Lots of local British dialect to decifer. Far too many needless f- bombs for my taste.  I am only 3/4ths through the book. I keep hoping if I keep reading it will get better but so far that is not the case. Harry,Ron, Hermione... where are you?'

author: b'DancingPrincipal'
title: b'JK Rowling does it again!'
body: b'A dark tale is woven by this master storyteller this time round!  Rowling knows how to create colorful characters, an interwoven, complex plot, and a small town setting to keep the reader riveted until the unexpected end!  Brilliant!'

author: b'avid reader'
title: b'The magic was missing ...'
body: b"I found I could put the book down without wishing I had more time to read. In the Harry Potter series, especially in the first few books, I was totally entranced and intrigued by Ms Rowling's imagination, her quirkiness and her ability to draw the reader into the story.  This did not happen to me in the Casual Vacancy. Found it somewhat pedestrian."

author: b'Sandybeach'
title: b'I Still Love Harry Potter'
body: b'I know J. K. Rowling will write other books.  Her talent is exceptional!  This was just not my "cup pf tea".  Unfortunately, this hit close to home as to how society and teens react today.  I won\'t read a sequel.'

author: b'David'
title: b'Great novel'
body: b"It has been a pleasure to read this book. While certainly a different work than the Harry Potter series, Rowling's cast of characters is often reminiscent of Agatha Christie...albeit much more adult and less racist.  I began to read this with hesitation, but was soon lost in it's pages.  Worth a read, but don't expect anything like she has written before."

author: b'HLL'
title: b'Depressing'
body: b'This book was so depressing.  I did not like one character, was not rooting for one character and could not find a reason to care about their depressing lives.  If I was not reading it for my book club I would have stopped reading it because it made me feel so depressed every time I picked it up.'

author: b'Rosekeet'
title: b'Very Dark'
body: b'I will preface this by saying I am a HUGE Harry Potter fan.  I grew up with Harry Potter and love it even more as a young adult.  I was excited to read this book, even knowing it was not about Hogwarts.  I was disappointed, but NOT because it isn\'t another Harry Potter.  The book is very dark and really a huge downer.  Harry Potter was often times dark and dealt with death.  However, the Harry Potter novels remained hopeful.  There was a light at the end of a tunnel and a continuing belief in the ultimate goodness in people.  I did not find any kind of hope in the Casual Vacancy and this is what bothered me the most.  Also, Harry Potter is full of memorable, likeable characters.  I did not find any of the characters here very likable.  A few I felt very sorry for (Krystal, Sukhvindar) but there were none I was really rooting for.  Most of the characters were desperately selfish and almost pitiful (like Samantha, Gavin).  All this said, Rowling is a tremendous writer.  Despite my dislike of the characters, I finished the book and found parts of it compelling.  I will qualify all this by saying I don\'t really read "sad" novels.  If that\'s your thing, you might like this.  I felt very blue after finishing the book.  I like novels that leave me feeling uplifted or hopeful.  I won\'t be re-reading this one.'

author: b'Scrappy cozy lover'
title: b'Booorrrring'
body: b"I have been working at finishing this book for over two weeks now.  I've managed to get half way through in that time, despite the sleepiness that overcomes me after an hour or less.  I really should read it during the daytime!  I'm trying really hard to like the book.....I keep waiting for the story to pick up.....but, it looks like it is what it is, and that's a depressing depiction of a town full of wackos.  I have yet to find a character who is even remotely likable and I just don't look forward to my reading time with this book."

author: b'Maria'
title: b"Put off at first by its coarse slice of life.  After all I really don't care to read the erotic fantasies of pimply boys!"
body: b'I kept thinking- is this what best selling fiction is like these days?  But I pressed on ONlY because I had enjoyed HP.  Turned into a page-turner, but I am not the better person for having read it.'

author: b'venturareader'
title: b'too depressing'
body: b'After reading the sample, I elected not to buy the book because if I want to be depressed, I would watch the news.  It was very dark and even with a good imagination, I did not see it getting better.  PS- I did not expect a Harry Potter look-alike, so that was not the issue.'

author: b'Michael'
title: b'Semi autobiographical ? Vacant of any value'
body: b'This was lousy. Finished it just to see if there was redemption somewhere. Heard that on NPR the author said it was semi autobiographical.. Guess that means that she is getting revenge - sort of?- on the muggles who looked down on her as she struggled prior to becoming the uber successful international best seller.  This is a sophomoric shallow depressing negative book.'

author: b'Kimberly Fox-moran'
title: b'Enjoyable'
body: b'Not sure why no one else seems to like this book but I have enjoyed it immensely.  only problem with it was there were so many characters at first that I had a hard time keeping them straight but I figured it out soon enough.'

author: b'Lee'
title: b'authentication fail'
body: b'Does realistic equal bleak? Sometimes when reading this book I felt Rowling has something in common with her character Stuart Wall whose "slumming it" by seeking out "authentic" experiences-- such as unprotected sex with a junkie\'s daughter--is a reflection of his search for "true authenticity" - "this, he knew, was real life." Rowling\'s determination to write about real life and move beyond her roots in fantasy makes me think of a child who consciously makes herself  the polar opposite of her parents and is therefore still under their influence. Sometimes Rowling\'s story seems to exist only to connect the dots between every disturbing issue imaginable, and I do wonder how much firsthand experience she has with some of these issues.'

author: b'Barbara Dean Lipes'
title: b'JKR has an extraordinary range as a story teller'
body: b'Just finished this.  Found it gripping and quite moving.  The characters and setting are rendered in exquisite detail.  The pace of the plot was perfect.  Looking forward to her next novel.'

author: b'Lexie'
title: b"Can't say I loved it, but ..."
body: b'I spent the first hundred or so pages waiting to run across a character I could care about.  I kept thinking, "What is she DOING?  Where is this GOING?"'

author: b'Virginia Campbell'
title: b'the casual vacancy'
body: b'there was good character developement but the language of the people who lived off government subsidies was a bit foul.  Do people not try to edit their speech when in school or when official representitives come to call?'

author: b'BMoH'
title: b'Well Written'
body: b'This was very well written. Ms. Rowling has an incredible penchant for developing characters. The storylines were developed and written with well studied knowledge. Shes proven that she can cross genres with ease and do it quite well. Well done!'

author: b'Brack'
title: b'Snoooooooring...'
body: b'I\'m not impressed with this book at all. It\'s dull and unnecessarily crass. I had hoped for a good read like her Harry Potter books, but for adults. Apparently, in Rowling\'s "adult world," people are thoughtless and vulgar. Don\'t waste your time and money.'

author: b'R. Kaufman'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"I wish I had been able to read the reviews before I bought this. It has taken me this long to get a third of the way thru the book and can't go on.  With the Harry Potter series, I read each one from start to finish in one sitting, I was hoping for that kind of experience again."

author: b'anthony mcgarvey'
title: b'Dull and disappointing'
body: b'Pathetic little people with pathetic little problems in a picture book village. There is apparently not a normal person to be found in this West Country village. There are heroin addicts, child molesters (both real and imaginary in one OCD character), rapists, self mutilators, unbelievably cruel bullies, wife beaters, adulterers, and the list goes on and on.  There are so many main characters ( identified by the fact that Rowling allows us to see some  of their innermost thoughts) and secondary characters (described by other characters) plus a few cardboard figures, that I needed to make a list to keep track of them all.'

author: b'Gwen S.'
title: b'Can NOT wait for her next one!'
body: b"I can't help gush! Rowling is a natural born story teller. The characters are so realistically drawn and the story has incredible depth."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Why JKR even wrote this book!!!'
body: b"I bought kindle edition on my tablet because I have been travelling a bit and thought to enjoy JKR's new masterpiece during one of the flights! Haven't seen these many F*** and curse words in One Book, probably, 20% of all words are such!"

author: b'Bookphile'
title: b'Dark and affecting'
body: b"As a rabid fan of Harry Potter, I wasn't quite sure what to anticipate as I dove into this novel.  While I didn't expect it to be anything like Potter, I also didn't quite expect it to be anything like it is.  I can understand why some Potter fans don't like this book, as it is quite different, not just in subject matter (which I think everyone anticipated anyway, as Rowling was quite clear all along that this book was very different), but in tone.  Some minor spoilers to follow."

author: b'OBXers'
title: b'Forget Harry Potter -- Casual Vacancy is about REALITY'
body: b'The back jacket of this book reads, in part, "She [JK Rowling] supports a wide range of causes and is the founder of Lumos, which works to transform the lives of disadvantaged children."  This book is about that reality along with class system/prejudices/small town/small minds. If you want a warm/fuzzy book this is not for you.  If you want "reality" this is for you.  Great read with definite impact.'

author: b'Ellen Mitchell'
title: b'This is not Hogwarts'
body: b'Rowling creates a tale interweaving the lives of various citizens of Pagford through vignettes of each character\'s life. Initially the many names allow for some confusion for the reader (which one was Fat\'s father? Is Samantha Miles\'s wife or someone else\'s?) But, give it a few chapters. As the names and roles are fleshed out, the tale comes together nicely. My expectation for this book was for it not to be remotely like Harry Potter and Rowling meets that. The conversational and situational crudeness may be realistic, but come across as over-the-top after awhile--an exclamation point to "this is not Hogwarts!"'

author: b'Skull Flakes'
title: b"Brilliantly written. Literary Genuis. Must read. I couldn't put it down."
body: b"Brilliant. Literary Genuis. Must read. I couldn't put it down.Give it to your republican/bible thumping relatives at their beloved Christmas."

author: b'frankandopen'
title: b'Wowwwwwww!  The Casual Vacancy and then some...'
body: b"JKR has done it again!  Fabulous book!  As usual, great writing style.  Her characters and places are very vivid.  You become omnicient as you read; and it is really easy to become completely immersed in this tragic story,  which is, essentially, a seamy, but real slice of life.  I was gripped from beginning to end.  The characters remain with you long after you've finished reading...  (And yes, I had a good bawl.).  Loved this book!  I recommend it for mature readers.  I can't wait for her next book!"

author: b'Clair Jones'
title: b"Don't bother"
body: b'I found the book very depressing and far too long, not what I expected at all from jk rowling. Would not rush to buy another of her books.'

author: b'S. Robertson'
title: b'Missed the mark a bit'
body: b'So I finished reading the new JK Rowling book The Casual Vacancy last night. I must say it was a difficult read. While I was not expecting another Harry Potter novel I was expecting to at least see a bit of JK\'s humor and style of writing a bit more. The subject matter was not edge of your seat interesting and she jumped very quickly from charactor to charactor (so much so that I often found myself re-reading paragraphs in order to see who I was reading about) and it all seemed a bit forced and jumbled at times. I still found myself wanting to know what happened to the charactors but not so much thatI would call this a "cant put you down" book.  While I still look forward to more from her I must say that her first offical forray into "adult reading" missed the mark a bit. I think she may have tried too hard to branch away from her HP image with this one. JK, I still love you and will still wait with bated breath to see what you write next, I just hope you put more of your quirky style into it, and show us again why we fell in love with you in the first place.'

author: b'S. Richardson'
title: b'character development'
body: b"Countering the negative reviews on Amazon, I enjoyed the book. It is heavy on character development, which many seem to decry...the Amazon reviews lament that and lack of plot. Well..in my humble opinion too few authors develop their characters, and she does a smashing job here :-) had to sound a tad British. You will recognize many of the characters in your families, friends, neighbors; I cared deeply for many, loathed quite a few, and feared for others. At one point, when you see what is going to happen, you will be shouting through the pages for characters to see what is right in front of them..as you would in a horror movie when someone is about to go off alone etc. Point of view is expressed beautifully...along with it denial, rationalization, and justification. She is depicting life, and despite it hitting close to home, and perhaps not the escape some Amazon readers want, I truly admire her writing for so, so many reasons. Yeah, a traditional plot line would be hard to summarize here...but if you can't stand the cardboard characters in so many novels you come across, pick this up, and read it."

author: b'Queen MAB'
title: b'Vulgar and boring...'
body: b'I so looked forward to this book. I was an early fan of the first Harry Potter book and got many people interested in the series. I thought I knew J.K. Rowling as an author and person, but I was wrong. This book is completely different, and it is gratuitously vulgar as far I am concerned. I made it through the first 60 pages, but someone would have to pay me a lot of money to finish it. I have really lost respect for J.K. Rowling. She obviously does not care about her loyal readers who got her where she is today. Her books can be completely different from Harry Potter, but there is still a need for an interesting plot, sympathetic characters, and some sense of understanding not everyone wants gross sexual references in their fiction. This was a complete waste of money.'

author: b'Yelena V Gamblin'
title: b'Excellent service'
body: b'The delivery of this product was prompt! Started reading this book right away. Quite different from JK Rowling "Harry Potter". Describes everyday life as it is. A lot of characters and personalities to be acquainted with. Very good intelligent read.'

author: b'Natalia Erehnah'
title: b'I wanted to love it'
body: b'This book was the opposite of HP.  Instead of read-through-the-night exciting story, there was none.  In place of characters who were clearly good or horribly evil, everyone was grey.'

author: b'Marlan'
title: b'Boring'
body: b"I can't get into this story.  J.K. introduces too many characters at the beginning and I can't keep track of them all. She goes off on tangets about someone and then returns to the story line.  I find it confusing and hard to follow.  Not impressed. Would not recommend it."

author: b'Mr. Kelly Taggart'
title: b'You can judge a book by its cover.'
body: b'First off, I did not buy this, but rather borrowed it from the library.  Never would have given a thought to reading it based on the little I had heard about it, except for the Potter books.  I am finding this story boring and uninteresting.  Was going to give it at least 100 pages, but think I am done at 79.'

author: b'J. Jackson'
title: b'This book is absolutely horrible.'
body: b"I get it J.K. Rowling. There is a class divide in Great Britain, as well as in most of the world. But the people who you've written about- those people who most need to realize that there is a great and horrid injustice- they are not reading your dismal book. Even if they bought it, after the first description of teen-aged sex, they would stop reading it. The people who are reading it, like myself, are well aware of that miserable world, and read to escape it. I am a great fan of your earlier work. It seems amazing that all of the joy that you have given me in the 10 years of the HP series, has been abruptly taken away by this horrible, horrible book."

author: b'shelly'
title: b'boring'
body: b'I thought this book was definitely geared to a British audience and was mostly boring. I do not reccomend it. I hope she brins bak Harry potter as head master.'

author: b'Bunny'
title: b'Well.....a little disappointing'
body: b"Unfortunately, I was a little disappointed with 'The Casual Vacancy'.  It was all over the place and lacked clarity with plots and characters.  I give it points on surprises but little else."

author: b'Tony Blair'
title: b'So disappointing!'
body: b'I was really enthusiastic when I heard that Ms Rowling had decided to write a non Harry Potter book; my feelings were short-lived. This is a 400 page book and I thought that it would take a hundred or so pages to get into it; I then said "OK -- let\'s try 200 pages, because something must happen soon!!"'

author: b'sg smith'
title: b'there is....'
body: b'nothing redemptive about Casual Vacancy. Though the idea is interesting, Rowling has been writing for adloescents too long, and there are no redemptive characters in this book!'

author: b'Irene C'
title: b'Disappointment'
body: b"Having enjoyed the Harry Potter books so much over the years, and reading them again and again, I was agog to see how J.K. Rowling wrote for adults - and I was absolutely horrified and disgusted.  I found the book boring, with foul language throughout and uninteresting rude, selfish and crude characters.  Let's hope her next excursion into writing for adults is better."

author: b'Julie'
title: b'Fantastic!'
body: b'This book was so amazing!'

author: b'T. A. Southern'
title: b'tnecvol'
body: b'The book is slow and boring at times.  The first part, while introducing the characters is confusing.  Alot of English slang that might not be understood by some on this side of the pond.  The ending was sad.  Would rather have seen this character and others overcome their obstacles in a different way.'

author: b'Jane Parks-mckay'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I had heard about J.K. Rolling's first adult novel and had not heard good reviews so I put off buying it. However, it was given to me recently as a gift and I was thrilled to read in Rolling's pioneer effort. As a writer, I like to support other authors, even when I am not sure about the book at first. The first few pages with too many characters thrown at the reader confused me. I had to refer back and forth time and time again and went on ahead. By page 149, I thought good heavens, when is a PLOT going to happen. Rolling's talent is definitely with character development and I came to know them well and pictured them in my mind. The plot finally did unravel and at a fast speed, and the book was worth hanging on with. I always like to see a moral angle in a book and I was not disappointed. I certainly applaud Rolling for stepping into new territory and would support her in anything she does as many of us do. This book? Glad I read it, I would be very hesitant to recommend it without saying to other readers know that in my view, it's a long read with paydirt coming way down the line. Also, my largest objection is the profanity from seemingly EVERY character had; it was not necessary. It got tiresome and offensive, frankly. I would love to sit down with Rolling or hear from her as to why she made everyone so profanity speaking, it really wasn't necessary. I look forward to seeing Rolling's next book, she's done a lot to bring reading to the youth and I really appreciate that."

author: b'forest haven'
title: b"Couldn't Get Into It"
body: b'Tried so hard to like this book...but perhaps a person shouldn\'t have to try hard to like a book at all.  As a person who loves using four-letter-words, I found the use of them in this book unnecessary.  It was as if Rowling was trying too hard to write an "adult" book.  Mostly I was a bit bored and quite honestly, I didn\'t get past page 65.  I also tried very hard to forget about the Harry Potter books, which I absolutely loved.  But The Casual Vacancy just did not grab me, as Potter did, in the very first chapter.  Perhaps one day I\'ll pick up The Casual Vacancy again and give it another go.'

author: b'F George'
title: b'Loved it!'
body: b'I have never read any Harry Potter books so this was a first for me. I loved the depth of her writing, totally left me wanting more. A great writer, the reason for 4 stars is I dont know if it is possible to give 4.5 stars. The only reason for not giving 5 stars is i wanted even more depth on some characters & i wasnt ready for the book to finish. having said that i am very picky & have up to now never given a 5 star rating.If you are into real English village life with great characters & a great story you will love this!'

author: b'John E'
title: b'Got What I Wanted'
body: b"In ordering Casual Vacancy I wanted first to get the book quickly and with little hassle through Amazon and then to find it lived up to the hype as a worthwhile read that didn't try to fly on Harry Potter's broomstick.  The service was a tad better than the book, but both lived up to expectations."

author: b'mom'
title: b'Well - what should we do about Krystal?'
body: b"No spoilers - it's a story brilliantly told by the author. The Casual Vacancy is not an easy book to read but one I found impossible to not to return to every time I put it down. Not at all what I expected even after reading the initial reviews - deeply moving and very uncomfortable in the way it held my own attitudes and behavior up for scrutiny."

author: b'Karenpsl'
title: b'So sorry JK, but I hated it!'
body: b"I was so excited about reading this book since I am a fan of JK Rowling's work.  I'm just really disappointed with every aspect of the book.  It featured a bland storyline with really scummy characters.  There wasn't enough reconciliation in the end to justify reading it.  If I want to hear a depressing story without a happy ending, I'll watch the news."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Not my cup of tea'
body: b'The premise was good: effect of a death on various members of a village, but I found it too complicated to follow to savor the intended portrayals.'

author: b'Courtney C Ide'
title: b'Confused and disjointed.'
body: b'J.K. Rowling has fallen below her usual fine standards in this book. The characters do not develop well and there is a great deal of confusion as to who is who. However,in all fairness this may be the seperation of two peoples by a common language. Apologies to W. S. Churchill'

author: b'N. Cano'
title: b'Ripple Effect in Life!'
body: b'A well woven tale of how one death in a small town has strange and unpredictable ripple of events that affect the whole town!'

author: b'Susan D.'
title: b'Loved it'
body: b"I could not put this book down. Intriguing plot, engaging characters, unexpected twists. i'm looking forward to her next book."

author: b'carokahn14'
title: b'Plodded though.'
body: b'I was so disappointed.I plodded through boring stuff waiting for something to happen.'

author: b'Sharon Ho'
title: b'Not for fans of Harry Potter'
body: b'I am no Harriet Klauser, but I count myself a wide reader who reads an average of two to three books every week. I have never been compelled to write a review for any of them until now because this is the first time that friends and family members wanted to know my opinion of a book that they are interested in checking it out themselves.'

author: b'Jeanine'
title: b'Ridiculous amount of profanity'
body: b'I have never reviewed a product on Amazon until now, but I am reviewing this one just to make sure the overall product rating goes down at least a little more.  No, I did not expect this to be like Harry Potter. What I found only a couple chapters in, though, was enough profanity to make me stop and wonder what the rest of the book was like. I randomly flipped to various pages throughout the book. Every page I turned to had the "F" word or another vulgar expression/subject on it.  That was enough for me.  Ms. Rowling, you may have written a wonderful children\'s series, but that does not make your adult literature great, too.  This book belongs in the trash.  How sad that such a gifted author chose to write like this.'

author: b'BettyBetsy'
title: b'BIt of a disappointment...'
body: b"I was really looking forward to this novel as I have read all of the Harry Potter books and enjoyed them immensely.  This book was really not up to par, and didn't really grab my interest until near the end, and then it was over.  I hope that future books are better!"

author: b'Daniel Deronda'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'The story line is simple the essential quality of the book is the cast of characters their individual  circumstances and interaction.. The result is a telling warts and all picture of UK today.'

author: b'CW'
title: b'Good read'
body: b"It was a good read, totally different to Harry potter and not a kids book. Bit confusing at the start with the introduction of lots of characters but keep at it, it becomes a lot clearer as you learn how their lives intertwine. Really enjoyed its humor, detailed insights to people's darkest thoughts & feelings. I enjoyed it."

author: b'Richard C. Cheatham'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I expected more from the writer of the Harry Potter series, but I  found it tiresome and stopped reading rather early on. It was tedious and rather vulgar in sections.  Perhaps it "took off" later on, but I was not wiling to waste more time on it.'

author: b'Lisa'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I am sorry to give this review, but this book is such a bore, that I can't even finish it!!  I painstakingly made it to 20% in the book and simply cannot go any farther."

author: b'Tammy'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Casual Vacancy  by J.K. Rowling, my kindle edition.'

author: b'Tacmom'
title: b"Can't get into it"
body: b"I was so looking forward to this novel. I found that there were so many names to keep track of in the first two chapters, that I wasn't enjoying the story."

author: b'Barbara Whitesides'
title: b'J.K. hits the mark'
body: b'In the manner of the time honored novel "To Kill a Mockingbird", J.K. Rowling has penned a classic look at small town pettiness and prejudice.  In "Casual Vacancy", Rowling holds our hidden agendas up to us for examination.  It is impossible not to be moved by this first adult fiction of a marvelous writer.'

author: b'Lady Lauren'
title: b'Horrible Book! :('
body: b"If you are a true JK Rowling fan, do not buy this book. It is so saturated with too much sexual information that even as an avid romance reader, I was cringing. This is such a disappointment that I actually ended up returning it before even finishing. The plot is ok, but the sexual details don't classify it as adult to me, just unnecessarily crude."

author: b'GMN'
title: b'Grim story well written'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy is a compelling read once you get into it. It is a grim story about self-serving and struggling characters -- no doubt real and not at all flattering. While I was hooked, I couldn't wait to finish reading it and get on to something else. It is raw in places but that's how life is. Good character development woven into an interesting story -- the conniving and maneuvering to fill a vacancy on a town council and the struggles of individuals to survive amid the mess of low level politics and strained-to-the-limit relationships. It is a story about life being hard enough with people and circumstance making it worse. If you think your life is bad or screwed-up, read The Casual Vacancy. You'll feel better about yourself and your life."

author: b'cj'
title: b"enjoyable but questons about author's motives"
body: b'Good character development. I felt as though i really knew these people. I enjoyed the book. I was surprised, however, at the many vulgar words. I would think yhat a writer of her caliber could tell a compelling story without the use of vulgarity.'

author: b'kld666'
title: b'Not Good'
body: b"definitely not up to a harry potter standard. I wouldn't buy anymore of her books after reading half of this one."

author: b'Patricia M Braun'
title: b'Disappointing!'
body: b'Filled with unlikeable characters that are hard to keep straight, Rowling has squandered her considerable talent on this incredibly boring, difficult-to-finish book. A diagram of who is who in Pagford would have been helpful, but without characters to care about, A Casual Vacancy has left me...um...vacant, and longing for Harry, Ron and Hermione. I have two friends, one a librarian, that simply chose not to finish, rather than struggle through the mire any longer.'

author: b'Jim Getten'
title: b'Not What I Expected'
body: b"No Harry Potter. I'm not sure what I expected but I didn't care for this story. I guess I'll stick to her wizard stories."

author: b'firegirl'
title: b'I liked Harry Potter Better'
body: b'Despite all the bad reviews and the dark theme of the book I myself do not think this is a horrible book. J.K. Rowling is a very talented author, and her style of writing is - as always - colourful and witty. The reason I gave this book three stars is becase it was so painful to read. Oh my god, it was painful. I am not the kind of person who puts down  a book, but about fifty pages into the book, I was filled with inexplicable hatred for everything in my life  - my friends, my family, even myself. It is amazing how manipulative this book can be. The absolute absence of even a hint of happiness within the characters and the plot is one of the reasons this book makes me rage for no apparent reason. That all of the people in this book have hearts of coal and reflect human selfishness in every aspect is another. I was seriously tempted to stop reading midway, because this book was ruining my mood and destroying my faith in humanity. After finishing, however, and looking back, this was actually composed pretty well. It had the touch of philosophy I value the most in books, and the vocabulary was splendid. I wouldnt recommend this book, but it still is a great item. Kinda like Damien except with a more pessimistic overlook. All i hope for is that Rowling will release another young adult masterpeice, of which the literal world is lacking.'

author: b'maj'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Parish Council elections have lttle general appeal. Too many superficial characters create confusion in the poorly constructed plot. Plentiful action in the last chapters remains unresolved. Not up to Harry Potter standard!'

author: b'Bron Papas'
title: b'A cracking roller coaster of a read'
body: b"Who would have thought that such an apparently quiet little English town would have so many intricate tales!  When a member of the local council dies it has far reaching ramifications for a number of the residents - it's game on for the casual vacancy on the local council..."

author: b'BobaGreenTea'
title: b'Superbly Written, Definitely Not for Everyone'
body: b'I have to say, I can understand why some readers would give this book a low rating. Rowling does not pull any punches in this work. To say that it is "gritty" or "edgy" makes her treatment of the characters appear to be dry and banal at times. While I do find Rowling\'s style to be stiff at times, I think what she has presented is a matter-of-fact presentation of what heartbreak and damage the social and emotional chasms in our lives can produce.'

author: b'Mitchell'
title: b'Loved Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Just finished reading Casual Vacancy and I loved it.  It reminds me of Charles Dickens or Jonathan Franzen type novels about human nature and behavior.  This book is also very humorous and had me almost laughing out loud- some of the plot twists are that funny.  Yes, the book has its tragic moments- vivid scenes of poverty, violence, drug addiction- but all very realistic portrayals that are essential to the plot development.  This is sort of an expose on arrogant behavior, elitism, sexism, insensitivity- and its effect on the children and disadvantaged that are targets of these abuses.  This is a book that is serious in its intentions and execution.  I highly suggest reading it if you are a serious fan of fiction and literature.  Gotta say I was surprised how readable and riveting this novel was for me- now on to Back To Blood by Wolfe.'

author: b'SJJM'
title: b"A story firmly centred around the book's characters"
body: b"The Casual Vacancy is not a story about a magical place, or an exciting adventure full of action. It is one that is firmly centred around the book's characters."

author: b'G. Leslie'
title: b'Very Sad Story'
body: b"I read the whole book. It was well written, but I didn't find any of the characters to be likable. There was no one to root for. Just a sad story about petty, small, selfish people. Certainly not my cup of tea."

author: b'MJ'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I expected better writing from Rowling. The story was too predictable.  The characters were well developed but the overall story was not as interesting as I had expected.'

author: b'Liana'
title: b'Great read!'
body: b'This is a fabulous read. If you\'re looking for Harry Potter, or an exciting world of fantasy, this is not the book for you. It is entirely different, though is slightly similar in some of its dark themes. The character development in this book is incredibly interesting, and you are left to form your own opinion of characters. There is no clear "good guy" or "bad guy", but rather you experience different views of the same character and come to your own conclusion. This is far more reflective of real life, and I found this to be a very interesting way of conveying the storyline and really differentiated it from other books. I found myself staying up late at night to read more, and delve more into the lives of the people in this town. While some have said that you don\'t fall in love with the characters, this is correct to an extent, in that you don\'t in the same way as in many other books. However, I did find that I found a connection with some of the characters, as they are more real than in many novels and have many flaws.'

author: b'Elaine'
title: b'Great Read'
body: b'This book was great.  I could not put it down - amazing development of characters keep pulling me along to see what the next connection or cross-over event would be and how it would take place.  I never read Harry Potter but was happy I choose to read this novel.'

author: b'bookie'
title: b'Why oh why do I have to give one star'
body: b'We expected much much better, one hit with the potter series I guess, We hope not, young kids these days need as many chances to read as possible.'

author: b'WKB'
title: b'My Mom did not enjoy this book'
body: b'My 85 year-old mother read this book; I have yet to read it.  Mom did not enjoy it.  The only "likeable" character was the one who died in the beginning of the book.  Mom also told me that while in the "Harry Potter" series the details that made Harry\'s world come alive simply made this book boring.'

author: b'carol kiranbay'
title: b'Review by someone who has not read the Harry Potter series..........'
body: b"I enjoyed this book very much as I'm something of an Anglophile and the village of Pagford sounds like somewhere I'd like to visit.  It's one of those idyllic British villages.....or at least that's what it seems.  The death of a local councilor leads to revelation of the worst characteristics in the most unlikely people.  Racism, prejudice, addiction, greed, child abuse, marital infidelity, snobbery and dishonesty abound -- all beautifully revealed by J. K. Rowling's prose.  It's a keeper!!"

author: b'Birch Lake Mama'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'Thin characters, boring predictable plot.  sorry I spent the money.  boo hoo, JKR!  wish it had been  a better read.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A book for our age.'
body: b'A perfect "political fairytale" for the raging arguments long heard, but not heard, on both sides of the aisle and The Pond.  I hope the heartless amongst us will read and take heed, but I sincerely and painfully doubt it.  The urge to shame and blame just runs far too deep with its attendant dire consequences blamed on rich economy\'s victims.'

author: b'Sillymeg'
title: b'Review from a ex-pat English Woman'
body: b"I was intrigued in buying this book because I am an avid Harry Potter fan and I enjoy the storytelling abilities of JK Rowling.  When I started this book it wasn't what I expected, it was completely the opposite and I wasn't a fan originally of the book. I felt that it was lacking a conherent plot and no action or a story line.  However, as I read on I felt like it was more a social commentary on modern day English life, and the politics and problems that plague England and could be applied to other parts of the world.  While I was in love with the book like Harry Potter, I felt that JK Rowling is an excellent story teller and the ending was super exciting and amazing!!!! While I would agree with other reviewers that it was a great book but I throughly enjoyed it and would recommend it to people to read!!"

author: b'LPW'
title: b'JKRawling writes for adults'
body: b"I was surprised to find the new J K Rawling book not only entertaining, but well written  I have not read all Harry Potter's books, one was enough. As her books have had such phenomenal success, it is not strange that her new book will have success too. I highly recommend it, if you like books, which begin with the death of one of her positives characters and end with the death of the second one. The book, as any contemporary novel vying for commercialc success, contains all modern ills:school bullying, the resulting (?) self-mutilation, addiction to drugs and all the modern explanation of it--poverty, maternal elect ... The admiration for promiscuity ( the characteristic of her main  character) , the disdain for middle class virtues... The comparison of the obesity of  one of a major taxpayer in the community and the expense of the NHS to treat it with the expense of the treatment of a drug addict , made by an Indian GP! (another bow to a modern novel with diverse characters!). Anyway, it is a realistic portrayal of modern England and its welfare state!"

author: b'kindlebandit'
title: b"if you loved Harry Potter, don't purchase!"
body: b"I had J.K. Rowling sharing a pedestal with only deceased authors...until this abysmal book.  I didn't find one character to be likeable and felt like the narrative rambled on and on.  I kept wondering when the book would 'get good'.  It didn't.  I'm very sorry for Ms. Rowling that she didn't stop her literary career with HP.  Alas, don't struggle through wondering if there is something good here.  There is not!"

author: b'Rachel Kowalski'
title: b'Not what I expected...'
body: b"I wasn't really sure what to expect from a book written by J.K. Rowling aimed at adults and without magic, but this was not it. To me, this book was a rambling plotline about a small foreign town, all of its politics and character flaws. No one in this book was even vaguely good or slightly wholesome in anyway. It was like she tried to write the opposite of her Harry Potter series and ended up with this unattractive mix of British slang and bad attitudes. Nothing was resolved by the end of the story and I am not really sure where she was trying to take the readers. Overall, I was underwhelmed with the end result. I have been told that J.K. Rowling is going back to children's books permanently, and if that is the case not only is it for the better but she also realizes where her strengths and weaknesses are. This book is apparently wonderful to some people, as I have seen other reviews, but it is definitely not for me. Good luck with this read!"

author: b'Alice L Murray'
title: b'The  Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This book is wonderful and I just hope J.K. Rowling will write more like it.  From page one I was "spellbound" and did not want to put it down for anything.  The characters were so \'real-life\' and all the events were believable.'

author: b'runcix'
title: b"It's rare I don't finish a book but this is one I put down"
body: b"I had high hopes but only made it 27% in before I gave up. Maybe I didn't give it enough time but so many other good books in waiting."

author: b'Kathy'
title: b'not Harry Potter'
body: b'Rowling let you see a small English town, its politics, people and problems from the inside out.  I think in the same style as the Harry Potter series (detailed, a bit dark) - only written for a decidedly adult audience.  Interesting the way she linked together the fates of seemingly unrelated lives, demonstrating the profound effect that their past and present situations, beliefs and actions had on others around them;  intended or not.  Somewhat depressing, a little slow in the beginning, then I wound up trying to stay awake one night to finish it.'

author: b'dvaryu'
title: b'Have patience'
body: b"I admit it, about a third of the way through, I was ready to give up.  Character development was fine, but I didn't really care about them...and plot was missing."

author: b'67suns'
title: b'Deeply Disappointed'
body: b'When I began reading Casual Vacancy I knew would have to adjust my brain and not expect Harry Potteresque writing.  However, I was so disappointed in the book.  I hated it.  I tried valiantly to like it and I kept reading, but I finally gave up.  It was very disappointing.'

author: b'Bob Poe'
title: b'Terrible'
body: b'Waste of time and money'

author: b'EdPlatz'
title: b'Offensive literature'
body: b"I could only get through one third of the book before I had to put it down and give it away. I loved the Harry Potter books and looked forward to this new book. The language is extremely offensive as well as sexually explicit. I tried to overcome this but found the underlying story to be too slow moving. I'm not looking forward to any further 'adult' books from J K Rowling..."

author: b'JustaName55'
title: b'I wanted to like it..'
body: b'I tried so hard to like this book but 200 painful pages in I had to give up.  There are too many characters with basically nothing going on...it just drags and drags.  I understand that she is unraveling the dynamics of small town life but holy crap batman, enough is enough.'

author: b'R ELLIOTT'
title: b'What a fantastic book'
body: b'After HP I like a lot of readers wondered if JK could do it again well if you were in any doubt, she has.'

author: b'Diane'
title: b'Dissapointed'
body: b'I was hoping for so much more from Rowling.  This book left me shaking my head in disbelief.  It was sad and depressing and so british that I didnt understand some of it.  Sorry JK, but you should have stayed with the genre you were so successful with...get back the magic!'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Uggg'
body: b"I purchased this book because I loved the Harry Potter books and so did my kids. I had high hopes, but am sorely disappointed. I have been reading it for a week and am only a quarter of the way through. I usually read a book this long in a day or two. Very hard to get into. Sorry, JK Rowling needs to stick to children's books."

author: b'Sacramento'
title: b'Interesting in theory'
body: b"Having done a lot of work with foster kids and families in situations like the Weedon's I appreciated J.K. Rowling using her influence and writing to shed light on the complexities of this subject. And I also found the interactions between the teenageers and parents in this book interesting. About halfway through the book it got interesting with the ghost and as the ending came to a head the reader is interested to see if it will end as they suspect but other than those moments it is dull and depressing. Rowling does a good job describing people and situations but somehow the characters and events are not compelling enough. There is no easy solution to poverty, addiction, prejudice, or teenage angst and so the reader knows the book will not provide solutions to the key problems highlighted in the book. And so the reader is left feeling depressed at the parent-teen relationships (which are all bad to terrible in this book) and at the poverty, addiction, and prejudice. The book is useful in shedding light on this subject for those who are naive or not already familiar with the complexities of these issues but for those already daily familiar with these topics, it provides no satisfaction at all. So I both congratulate Rowling for her courage to tackle this subject and have to admit to not really enjoying the book all that much as I pushed myself to finish it."

author: b'Theresa Edwards'
title: b'My Cup of Tea'
body: b"Harry Potter was not my cup of tea; realistic fiction and nonfiction suited me much more than fantasy.  But thanks to the relentless urging of my kids to read the books and see the movies, I am now an unlikely Potter fan; I think they're called Potter Heads.  So I was intrigued when Rawlings came out with a more realistic piece of fiction for adults.  I just finished The Casual Vacancy, and it was GREAT.  Just a caveat, that the first few chapters will throw out a lot of characters and back story.  Some books include a summary of characters, and that would have been helpful with this one to get all the players straight.  But about a quarter of the way through the book, everything starts blending together, and the political intrigue, plotting and conniving between the villagers build deliciously.  Almost everyone has an ax to grind, skeleton in their closet, or some petty self-serving motivation.  You may see yourself in some of the characters.  Due to adult subject matter and language, it is not suitable for children or teens in my opinion.  Many of the villagers grow a bit, some remain stagnant, and some come to a terrible end.  I find myself wanting to read a sequel to see how everyone evolves, perhaps with new characters, like a thinly disguised Snape as the new school headmaster . . ."

author: b'd7012'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"The Casual Vacany did not keep my interest. Since I did not read the Harry Potter series Iam not use to J.K.'s style. Iam use to the Enlish writing style as I  did lived in England for several years."

author: b'reader'
title: b'disappointing'
body: b"I was looking forward to this book. I'm a great fan of J.K.Rowling but believe she missed the mark with this book. It is more of a political statment/sociology study than a work of fiction. The story line was slow, the characters messy and there were no clever twists or turns. Disappointing!"

author: b'Love In Malaysia'
title: b"It's a so-so book!"
body: b'Yesterday I read about 10 pages of the book. All the words that sprang to mind were: so-so, mediocre, boring, dull, lifeless...'

author: b'reader'
title: b'Horrible'
body: b"I, like others, purchased this book based on the author's reputation.  I usually cannot be without a book to read and I will choose to read over anything else.  With this book, I cleaned my house, played solitaire, anything except go back to reading the book.  It was horrible, boring writing, no redeeming characters, etc."

author: b'Suzanne P.'
title: b'So much finesse !'
body: b'Simply loved it ! An intrigue well tied up around a township feud. Several well pulled characters. Intricate personnalities ... seems to be a real story. Bravo.'

author: b'Good reading'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I am really enjoying this book i am not quiet finished it as yet but so far it is really good'

author: b'A. Pearson'
title: b'Review of Casual Vacancy'
body: b"This was book good. Definitely not Harry Potter but that's not a bad thing. It's just totally different. The interaction between the kids and their parents was a difficult read at times."

author: b'LauraMae'
title: b'simple explanation'
body: b'Enjoyed what I have read but got sidetracked and need to go back to the story.....I do like the complexities of the seemingly simple story line.'

author: b'Judy Irving, Executive/Leadership Coach'
title: b'Not her finest'
body: b"I didn't care for Casual Vacancy - I stopped a little more than half way through. The characters just are not interesting to me. I was disappointed."

author: b'Geordie Girl'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I am so disappointed with this book. I have not finished it as I am finding it really hard to get into......I never let a book defeat me but this might be it! Next time I will think twice before rushing to buy one of her books.'

author: b'SBdoc'
title: b'Tried to like it'
body: b'I really wanted to like this book. I tried to not set my expectations too high, and tried to give it a fair shot as I would any offering from a new author.'

author: b'HvD'
title: b'An Adult tale'
body: b"Rowling, famous for her Harry Potter series, has written a book about small town England and its citizens and it is definitely an adult read; the intrigue and goings-on in a place where everybody knows each other, usually quite surfacy, and in a sense doesn't know each other at all. It is quite vulgar at times especcialy when the teens are talking and also remarkably spitefull; bullying, ethnic problems and especially the bad relationships between parents and their off-spring is documented with a great deal of detail. Politics even in this small town and people chosing sides are the leitmotiv, but the relationships between teens and their surroundings, school-parents-classmates is written well and the book is not easily put down. Sofar I like it!"

author: b'Stacy'
title: b'Superb Writing and Excellent Character Development and Analysis!'
body: b'I loved this book! I actually read aloud several sections of the book to co-workers because the writing was so good. Every word was perfect and it was a joy to read. Now with that said, about 100 pages in I thought I would need to draw out family trees to keep all of the characters straight both as to who they were and how they fit into the larger story. As I continued reading, I figured it all out and actually thought that if I were a newcomer to Pagford that is exactly how I would have felt anyway.'

author: b'gamesrfun'
title: b"don't bother"
body: b"I'm about 1/2 way thru the book and I'm giving it up.  The characters are boring, the plot line is dull.  If you are looking for some entertainment, keep looking."

author: b'OconeeBelle'
title: b'No Wizards Here'
body: b'To be absolutely truthful, I\'m only halfway through this book.  Harry Potter it isn\'t.  So far it\'s bad people (Muggles?) behaving badly, or perhaps merely humans behaving like humans.  The book is short on nobility, self-sacrifice, altruism, and fantasy does not exist, except in the minds of some characters, and such fantasy has thus far been either violent or sexual.  Ms. Rowling knows some four-letter words, too.  But I intend to finish it, because she can definitely write, and I want to know how it ends.  I care about many of the characters, venial and flawed though they be.  I hope she will attempt other "adult" fiction (not that the Harry Potter series was kiddie lit), and find her voice in that genre.'

author: b'tpmccombs'
title: b'Brilliant! But definitely not for kids.'
body: b"Brilliant character development! Mature subject matter so definitely not for kids...but fabulous novel for adults!  Can't wait to see what Rowling does next!"

author: b'Kristin Vasser'
title: b'Not a Ride To Hogwort'
body: b'Slow to start, characters hard to follow,unnecessary foul language. Disappointing after the reviews it got. I did plow through it.'

author: b'T. Mack'
title: b'A Homerun!'
body: b'J.K. Rowling has hit it out of the park once again.  She has the wonderful ability to make you feel, taste and smell everything the character tastes, feels and smells.  A must-read!'

author: b'Reader'
title: b"David's review of The Casual Vacancy"
body: b'J. K. Rowling is such an accomplished author but in my opinion "Casual" did not live up to her previous efforts. I struggled the whole way through and in fact had to put it down and read something else for a while. For me, the characters never came alive like in her Harry Potter series and they never had the persona\'s that would keep me reading.'

author: b'Emily'
title: b'It was Okay...'
body: b'I had high expectations that this book would have a better and more interesting story line. However- I just never felt "drawn" in. I expected a better story line than this book provided. I don\'t see this being a best seller.'

author: b'Michelle Lando'
title: b"Don't waste your precious time!"
body: b'I purchased this book knowing it would be a bit different from the Harry Potter series. It is all over the place and so disjointed. I am finding it hard to finish. I am also recommending to our book club not to waste their money by paying for it either!'

author: b"Pete's Books"
title: b"Pete's Books"
body: b"I loved it! I thought it was vastly entertaining and a smashing commentary on modern society. A very sharp mind at work here with so very much to say. I'll certainly be watching to see what else she does in the future. I do not understand the highly critical and negative reviews, which inevitably raise the HP series in comparison. Rowling is an talented writer and I think it is fantastic to see her pushing the perceived boundaries. In some ways it reminds me of Bob Dylan going electric way back in the mid 1960's, when some people went ape because he was expressing himself outside of the public perceived boundaries of his previous (folk music) genre. Do people really expect Rowling to write HP and similar the rest of her life? That would be a shame as I think this effort was really top notch."

author: b'tankgerl79'
title: b'Worth a read, but not bursting with fruit flavour!'
body: b"I wanted to read this out of curiosity initially and subsequently because of the very harsh reviews it was getting, and so I approached it with ambivalance not knowing if I was reading to spite the critics or to join them. The results are fairly anticlimactic, I enjoyed reading it - it kept my attention, but that was about it. The only other thing was that it kept reminding me of Irvine Welsh books, nowhere near ANY of their violence, foul language or drugs but just the storyline of 'The Fields' and its people I guess. Overall I say its worth a read regardless of who wrote it, and perhaps I would feel more strongly either way if it wasn't JK, who knows! The price of mega-fame I guess!"

author: b'RAM'
title: b'Not an overwhelming book..'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy indeed is a nice book. The characters were well described and represented different personalities which we deal with in our daily lives. What I liked about this book is that it reflects alot of the insecurities that poeple have. What did not feel so genuine is that the author focused more on the ugly sides of their personalities and occasionally mentioned any good sides, which anyway, could be intended by the author. Also, I felt that sometimes the events of the story would suddenly go to extremes without adequate preparation which is why at some points I was not emotionally connected to the plot. At some points I felt I can not put the book away, at other times I felt a bit bored and forced myself to continue reading. However, I had an overall positive impression about the book and would consider reading another book for the author.'

author: b'M VIJAYAN'
title: b'Total Disappointment!'
body: b'To sum up, I read the Harry Potter series before deciding to buy this book. If JK Rowling had published this book before the HP series and I had read it first, nothing would have convinced me to purchase and read the HP series subsequently because I would have been quite convinced that it would be horrible.'

author: b'Hank M.'
title: b'A Complete Disappointment'
body: b'Were it not for the author\'s name, I doubt that it would have been published in the USA.  I am forcing myself to finish it; but I don\'t know why.  The book is a "soap opera" of the dullest sort.  Maybe it will appeal to some females who like such things.'

author: b"It's my time fl"
title: b'Totally awesome book!!!'
body: b'Go get the book , awesome ! Great gift for your family members ....mom , dad, sister, brother, everyone will enjoy this book! Very unexpected read ! Worth It!'

author: b'Stephen T. Wishnevsky'
title: b'The Book She Wrote, Not the Book You Wanted Her To Write'
body: b"An odd, very understated slice of life novel, touted as Rowling's first adult novel. About half of the main characters are teenagers, but they are not as uncomplicated as Harry Potter and friends. They have lots of problems, both real and imagined, self-inflicted and imposed by their parents. A couple of good solid cases of abuse, some drug and alcohol addiction, most parents, at least the males, are suffering from delusions of various sorts."

author: b'pbr'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'After the 7-book Harry Potter series, Ms Rowling has made a successful leap to an adult novel filled with intrigue, adventure and humor.  Well done.'

author: b'Hussion'
title: b'Pulitzer Worthy'
body: b"I can't believe anyone would give this book less than five stars.  This is a book about the dark side of human nature with a glimmer of hope strewn throughout.  The characterization is incredible, including the fact that Rowling  personifies both Yarvil and Pagford.  The apex of the story is worth several reads.  All the characters lives are intertwined in insidious and unavoidable ways.  Forgiveness is possible, but comes with consequences.  This is an intense, thought provoking read that is creative in its ideology and needs a serious, intelligent reader to appreciate its breadth and depth.  I anxiously await Rowling's next foray into the dark recesses of the human spirit."

author: b'nancyv'
title: b'Gave it a whirl!'
body: b"Interesting story. Never read anything by this author before. Who is she? I do not read fiction very often, so 'twas a change."

author: b'Peter Collinson'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Enjoyed reading this book, but I really found that there were too many characters, and sometimes it was very hard to remember who was who. However an enjoyable read'

author: b'Maria Sisson'
title: b'Great Author, shame about the book'
body: b"I tried and kept trying and I'm pretty sure it would have eventually turned into something but I just couldn't get into it. Sorry but it wasn't for me, and for the record, I was a HP FAN."

author: b'Nargles Away'
title: b'Great Title Great Book'
body: b'Almost finished reading book.  So far I like it very much.  It is such a different storyline from the Harry Potter series.  Those books really taught kids and some adults, hopefully, some life lessons.  This one seems to be doing some of that too.'

author: b'George Svoboda'
title: b'Abnormal Psychology I'
body: b'The characters are carefully drawn but I am about half way through the book, and we seem to have gone through about half the examples from a course in Abnormal Psychology I once took. I really do not believe that a child has to be assaulted early on to produce a mean or poorly adjusted adult. In other words, I don\'t believe that acts of my generation are responsible for all the flaws of the next generation. Thus, the book gets a bit tedious and I am searching for a few "normal" people.'

author: b'Hajabeg'
title: b"JK's new book."
body: b"I don't care if this isn't about Harry Potter, the book is magical in its own way and JK still is one of my favorite writers ever. Amazing story, totally recommend it!"

author: b'M. Austin'
title: b'Thoroughly Enjoyable...Until the end. [Spoilers]'
body: b"Until the end, this book was great. It had a sizable amount of characters all of which are relatable, though not likable. I have to admit that reading this book was very enjoyable to me, in the same way that watching an MTV reality show becomes a guilty pleasure. You got to become engaged in all of the characters' lives and knew what their motives were. Though dark, this book contained a concise yet well thought out world that was great to escape the mundane outer world."

author: b'Thomas F. Coonelly Jr.'
title: b'Tedious'
body: b'The new Rowling book grinds on and on. A slow read at best. The teenage characters are well developed and Krystal in particular is very well written /compelling. But the story and the adults? Boring.'

author: b'Deputy'
title: b'One of the worse books I have ever tried to read'
body: b"I read 2/3 of this book hoping it would get better but it never did.  There are many boring characters and I quite frankly decided I didn't care what happened to any of them.  I love reading good books but this is not one of them.  I am sorry to have wasted my time trying to read this one."

author: b'Megan'
title: b'The haters wanted another Harry Potter'
body: b'This book was absolutely fantastic. As I was about to enter my own review, I caught the title of another one: "A searing social commentary." How very apt.'

author: b'Sandra M. Felix'
title: b'The Casual Vacany'
body: b'I really feel that a quote from Thoreau just about covers this novel.  "Most men live quiet lives of desperation".  Hard to find much hope in this story.'

author: b'Happy Nana'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Takes place in a small town in the U.K.  Lots of terms in the text are British but you can figure them out.  There is a cast of characters in the small town that are all effected by the sudden death of a city councillor and the vacancy it creates.  The cast of characters have varied issues in their own lives besides the death of the councillor but all these issues come together in a moment of awareness for many of the characters. The overlapping of the stories, I thought, was very good, quite clever and made the reading interesting.  I thought alot about the story after I finished it. I have recommended it to my friends.'

author: b'Lynn'
title: b'Astonishingly average'
body: b'I am sad to say this book read like every other "social commentary" novel written in the last 50 years.  I say this not because of the subject material, but because every last character was made grotesque in some way.  It should be noted that this is a tragedy in the classical sense - e.g., each character\'s downfall was inevitable, given their personal characteristics and the situation.  There is no grace or mercy for anyone here, just regret.  This may have not been the author\'s intent, but this is how it read, and it made me depressed, rather than burn with the desire to help people trapped in similar situations.'

author: b'Jo'
title: b'Big Disappointment'
body: b"A depressing read.  It took forever to get into the story such as it is.  Character and character is introduced.  There was no one to like or care about.  I finally started skimming the book and was glad when I looked at the end that I hadn't wasted anymore time on it.  I wasn't expecting Harry Potter but a good exciting adult read.  I can't decide whether to donate the book or trash it."

author: b'B. Wise'
title: b'Soulless muggles'
body: b'I really looked forward  to reading J.K. Rowlings\' first book written for adults. I love the Harry Potter books, which have countless well-shaded interesting three-dimensional characters that adults and children can care about, and colorful riveting storylines. Unfortunately the same can\'t be said about the Casual Vacancy. Its characters are shallow, grasping, self-interested, manipulative "muggles" with nothing to care a whit about. The story is so small-minded that by the time I struggled to finish the book, I wondered why I bothered. Such a disappointment.'

author: b'Cheryl Grimshaw'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I pre-ordered "The Casual Vacancy" as soon as it was available on Amazon and could not wait to receive my copy.  J.K. Rowling absolutely enthralled me with the "Harry Potter" series; I\'ve read them over and over.  The characters in that series are multi-layered and each has SOME redeeming point of character some where, or, are all bad and you loather them, as with Voldemort.  Not true with "The Casual Vacancy." All are about as boring as you can get.'

author: b'Valerie Jones'
title: b'Dark, unexpected, and vivid'
body: b"In the small English town of Pagford, everyone knows everyone else's business and privacy is a luxury. When Barry Fairbrother unexpectedly dies, the town is left with much unanticipated circumstances. A casual vacancy, as it is known on the town's Parish Council.  The town has been going through a long term political struggle over who is responsible for the costs of supporting the poverty stricken area, the Fields. Fairbrother was an ally of those who wanted to maintain support for the Fields, and with his death, the two opposing sides square off. The politics of the Parish Council only set the stage for the book. The turmoil is the stage for the real story about the variety of people who call the town home and their daily struggle in life."

author: b'James Palmer'
title: b'I Like it a Lot'
body: b"I like this book, and had a hard time putting it down. Yes, it was long, but because of JKR's writing skills it was a much quicker read than many other more turgid books with fewer pages. Yes, there were a lot of characters. That worked for me, too. It took a while to keep all of them straight, just like when one joins a new family, however ultimately they became a most interesting mosaic which clearly illustrated life in a small town. Yep, many of the characters were unlikable, but isn't that often the case everywhere? The book clearly paints the conservative versus liberal positions (in which we in the U.S. are a few years behind Britain, where their austerity program isn't working out well). While the book had a sad ending, it clearly showed that even the most disadvantaged of us have dreams of a better life."

author: b'iLu..'
title: b'Reality on a book'
body: b"It's excellently written."

author: b'Oneirophobia'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Another great story from a wonderful storyteller! While The Causal Vacancy has a very different writing style and plot then from J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series, it holds it own! I was captured from the minute I picked it up and had I not had to work early the next morning I would have probably stayed up all night to finish! As always her characters are very well developed and nothing disappoints! I hope you enjoy this book as much as I did."

author: b'sarmstro'
title: b'JK Rowling out did herself!'
body: b'I think some people will not like to read about the subject matter. It was very real and it made me think. Sometimes we believe that those less fortunate souls are less fortunate by choice.  This is a clear reminder that is not always the case. It shows the day to day difficulties of lower socioeconomic politics and those who are quick to pass judgment upon them. Harry Potter this is not.'

author: b'J. Barnes'
title: b'Complex Plot'
body: b"I was very curious to read how Rowling would transition to adult books.  She did it!  This book is definitly not for the faint of heart as these characters are real and raw.  The language is sometimes harsh.  I listened to the audiobook and had a little trouble keeping the multiple plots, each with a cast of dysfuntional characters, straight.  However, I couldn't turn it off as I remained interested in how the story would play out.  The story is a realistic reflection of life in a small English village, and we who live in the US can relate to how local politics become such a big deal to those who are involved.  The teenagers were sympathetic (and horrifying) as they attempt to survive the antics of the adults who govern their lives.  Yes, the ending is sad for one of the characters, but I was hopeful for the future of others in the book.  Rowling provides rich language, vivid descriptions, and a captivating story."

author: b'LEGEND EJK'
title: b'what happened to Harry Potter ??'
body: b'first let me stress how good the service was getting this book- Thanks The book is one of those you cant put down because it is so interesting. Also, its great bathroom reading.Thanks'

author: b'SF Reader'
title: b'Hogwarts it NOT!'
body: b"I loved the Harry Potter stories and I looked forward to reading something by J.K. Rowling written for adults.  Unfortunately, I couldn't finish the book--in fact, I couldn't get past the first couple of chapters.  It's just too dark."

author: b'ANGELA C'
title: b"DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!"
body: b"Can't believe the same person who wrote the Harry Potter series wrote this nightmare.  It's probably the most boring book I've even tried to read, but I'm determined to finish it."

author: b'Betty Joyce'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Jk Rowling is a prolific writer.  She makes up words and names and I found this to be'

author: b'Michael D. Osborn'
title: b'Structural problems'
body: b'"Casual Vacancy" seems to have some structural problems that get in the way of my enjoying the book.  I think the book should begin with Barry Fairbrother\'s funeral, which would introduce the pretty extensive character list, followed by the various set pieces and character sketches leading up to the funeral.  The book could then move through Barry\'s post-funeral influence and its redemptive qualities and humane vision (as well as its occasional feebleness against stubbornness, stupidity and ignorance) and then end, as it does, with the other funeral (I\'m trying not to spoil the ending here), with narrative symmetries of good changing into evil and evil changing into good--and life going on.'

author: b'Phunnyphella'
title: b'Not as compelling as Harry Potter stories'
body: b'I waited with eager anticipation for the release of this book.  I did manage to finish it but was so disappointed in the chopped manner that the story was told and that there were so many confusing characters.'

author: b'JenLiz'
title: b'Characters I know'
body: b"I continue to be impressed by JK Rowling's ability to create truly real characters. While most of the characters in 'The Casual Vacancy' are not people I particularly like, they are people that I have met in my life and that ring absolutely true on the page. This is a novel that presents humans as their messy, selfish selves but that also demonstrates that despite their many flaws, they can occasionally rise above their nature. It's an excellent piece of writing."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Disappointment'
body: b"Couldn't even finish it, which is unusual for me - kept thinking it was going to get better & it didn't. Expected so much more from J.K. Rowling."

author: b'Luanne Ollivier'
title: b'Well written, but it just made me sad'

author: b'K. Thomas'
title: b'Thought-provoking read'
body: b"Can I just suggest to people that if they find long books with lots of characters difficult, that they don't read this? While you're at it, don't read Middlemarch, Bleak House or War and Peace."

author: b'K. Schoen'
title: b'Hooray for Rowling!'
body: b"I didn't read all the Harry Potter books because the magic was just a little bit too much for me but I loved this well-written, down-to earth chronic of a small town in England with all the characters who live there."

author: b'Lastbornfive'
title: b'Worth the time'
body: b'Once you get to the second half of the book, and put all the characters in place it is an enjoyabe read. Looking forward to her next book.'

author: b'Carlos T. Mock'
title: b'Dissapointed....'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy by J. K. Rowling'

author: b'Patricia Hoban'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'The characters/plot were a bit predictable. Nothing further needs to be said. Requiring a response of a certain number of words will not make the evaluation any better.'

author: b'AmyK712'
title: b"JKR's knack for writing interesting characters create a tragic but compelling story...."
body: b'NO SPOILERS'

author: b'Eleanor Vystrcil'
title: b'Boorrriiiinnnnngggg'
body: b'I am half way thru the book and find it very gossippy, if that is a word.  Not much of a story line.  Maybe it will get better.'

author: b'Yvonne Luke'
title: b"I definitely don't want to live in Pagford..."
body: b"A Casual Vacancy left a rather morbid impression on what daily life in Pagford and the Fields is like; from abusive & neglectful parents, cheating spouses, unruly teenagers this book covered different facets of daily life in the small, rural English town.  There's definitely no real plot to speak of, it's just a very interesting character study of how vile & petty people can be. If it were any other author, I'm not sure I would have given as high a rating, however, it gets 3-STARS mainly because it's JK-freakin'-Rowling."

author: b'C. Wheat'
title: b'The End is Worth It'
body: b"Rowling made an incredibly smart decision going with an adult novel as her next endeavor, but I was surprised just how mature the content of this book was. However, it did not bother me at all because it fit the characters and the world she was trying to create (and I'm a George RR Martin fan, so it's pretty hard to shock me with adult content)."

author: b'mKB'
title: b'Different, but enjoyable'
body: b'This is not the typ of book I would normally read. I am all about fantasy and science fiction, but I love Rowling so of course I read her lastest novel. The writing is superb. Yes, I am biased because it is one of my favorite authors, but she does have the ability to paint a picture with words like few can. There were some portions that were tedious to read, but that may be because I am not used to books about everyday life.'

author: b'Michelle Watson'
title: b'Page turner'
