body: b"The introduction was a little difficult to get through because of the introduction to all of the characters and their positions but the book gains momentum shortly afterwards. Mid way through the book I didn't want to put it down!"

author: b'Jonathan J Albers'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"Well, she said she wanted to write an adult book but I didn't expect QUITE that adult! I'm not one who enjoys reading this sort of what Mom used to call trash! I REALLY liked the Harry Potter series, and expected,----well not this. I think I will pay a bit more attention to the reviews next time. Didn't finish it. Just NOT my cup of tea."

author: b'B. Isaacs'
title: b'Not my cup of tea'
body: b'The "Casual Vacancy" is a story about the characters of a rural English town.  The character development was intense and in depth.  The story line was somewhat difficult to follow although I did manage to figure out how the story would end several chapters before the end of the book.  I realize I was affected by the "Harry Potter" series, but although well written, I did not enjoy the story.  The characters were much too intense and the story, maybe too close to real life for pleasure reading.  Maybe I\'ll like the next one better.  I won\'t give up over one book.'

author: b'Bill'
title: b'A Dark Story'
body: b"The book tells us about muggles who live a very distastful and petty existence.  And there are still plenty of children to entertain us -- mostly nasty teenagers. It's a very much about the Brits and their social with social justice."

author: b'Helena'
title: b'Nothing like Harry Potter'
body: b'A great holiday read. JK really got inside the heads of the teenage characters giving some insight to why and how both adolescents and adults deal with with issues like bullying and its consequences. Recommend a comfy chair and a cup of tea for this book.'

author: b'GH'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I was sorry about this - it had such a negative view, rather than any sense of the uplifting.  I am baffled - even though the author explained the reasons why people were they way they were, the sum was good or bad.  There was no deep belief in humanity, not much pulling it out of the day-to-day.'

author: b'TBM'
title: b'Shame on you JK Rowling'
body: b"Do not read this book.  Absolutely loved the Harry Potter books and while I recognize this is an entirely different type of story to be read by an entirely different group of readers I still would not recommend it.  About 3 chapters in the language turned filthy and pornographic.  I gave it another couple of chapters and it did not improve.  The book seems to bring out the worst in all it's characters.  It's a shame that someone who wrote such brilliant children's literature writes such awful adult fiction."

author: b'susan cochrane'
title: b'VERY DYSFUNCTIONAL TOWN'
body: b"At first, I wasn't  sure if I liked it, the characters seem very dysfunctional, but I kept reading and then couldn't put it down. I can see this being made into a movie."

author: b'pmfergie'
title: b'Casual vaancy could not keep me turning the pages.'
body: b'I ordered the book based upon by reading all the Harry potter series.  However from the begining of the book I found it trying reading.  It did not keep my attention nor did I want to turn the next page to see what was coming.  I did not finish the book.'

author: b'Zew crew'
title: b'Dissapointed'
body: b'I really tried hard not to compare this book to the H. P. series ( which I thought was fantastic and superbly well written). This book was a let down. I really wanted to like this book however,  I found the characters somewhat difficult to follow, the storyline rather choppy and slow and the ending disappointing.'

author: b'Ger Byrne'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Absolutely the best read of the year.'

author: b'elizabeth'
title: b'good read'
body: b'I really enjoyed this book, although I must admit, I wasn\'t really knowing what to expect, with all the different reviews here on Amazon. It is a LOT different to the Harry Potter series ( of which I am an avid fan), But it is an Adult book, not a child\'s nor tweenagers. It has adult themes, ranging from drug use, sex, and self harm, BUT all are pertinent to the story. Yes, there are heaps of characters in the book, but so has the Harry Potter series, and I had no trouble keeping up with them all.It is all about village life, the politics of a small community, and between those who think they are "top dogs" and those who know they aren\'t. The story goes along at a brisk pace, and I did not once get bored, or read something else. I would recommend this a a good read, and have no hesitation recommending it. I am really looking forward to her next book, and hope it is not too long before it is written.'

author: b'Bebe74'
title: b'very disappointing :('
body: b'The casual vacancy was the title we were waiting for maybe cause we were expecting another harry potter or that we were thirsty for another book from the Famous JK ROWLING.'

author: b'gummi'
title: b'sooooo disappointing!'
body: b"this new book was the most depressing book i have ever read.  i cannot say it was not well written but it made me very sad and i like to read drama that has a bigger percentage of happy endings. i read all the time. i have been a heavy reader for 50+ years. i read all types. i love books but not 'casual vacancy'."

author: b'GoodSouthernCook'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Casual Vacancy - I was so looking for J.K. Rowling\'s new book, but was slightly disappointed.  I\'m not quite sure what I was expecting but I felt let down.  I did not expect a "Harry Potter".  I was intrigued by her characters, I just wasn\'t that interested in them.  I was able to put the book down and really didn\'t care if I finished it or not.  I did finish it and thought if was just O.K..'

author: b'CANDICE HUGHES'
title: b'Totally trashy!'
body: b'Please do not waste your money on this one! I realize this is supposed to be a novel for adults, but really?!  She is trying so hard to distance her self from the potter books that she went way over the top with the vulgarity. I am very unhappy with this book.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Too long'
body: b'I was not thrilled to turn next page in any point. Nothing exciting in the book. Characters are too many but depicted in a shallow manner. The narration is dry and dispassionate.'

author: b'In Love with Editing'
title: b'Decent'
body: b"I enjoyed this book.  However, I've given it only 3 stars because I thought it was entirely too long, laboriously detailed in some sections, and did not wrap up the story well.  I also gave it 3 stars b/c I enjoyed the author's bravado in creatively bringing to light the social ills of current day society in many parts of the world...though it seemed to be set in England.  Good read...if you have patience with minutiae."

author: b'RLA'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'As an avid HP fan, I was looking forward to seeing what JKR would come up with in her first adult novel.  Although the characters (especially the teens) are rather interesting and well developed, the story itself is weak and more than a little boring.  I found that I was having to force myself to keep reading which is never a good sign.  I would recommend that anyone interested in reading this book not fall for the hype-wait and borrow it from the library.'

author: b'Dr Donna.'
title: b'What is all the shouting about?'
body: b'I did not read the HP series of books by this author but I was so thrilled that kids all over the world lined up to buy the books and read them voraciously. That is truly wonderful. I have been enthralled with the author\'s rags to riches personal story as a result of her talents as a writer. She has shown above all that taking a risk to do something you love can change your world. It did hers and she is a wonderful role model for those very kids she inspired to choose to read over everything else. I am a voracious reader and I absolutely love to read.  I bought Casual Vacancy expecting to have a singular reading experience with one of the world\'s leading authors. Instead I could not finish the book. I found it dull, slow paced and difficult to relate to. I felt guilty about those feelings because the media and reviewers had spoken so highly of the book. I am left to wonder what is wrong with me. I am wondering if it is a case of because the author is so well regarded most folk don\'t want to say that in fact with this book "the emperor really doesn\'t have any clothes".'

author: b'LeahChristine'
title: b'Slow, depressing writing'
body: b'I have never read any of the Harry Potter books, so I\'m not biased toward the author one way or another, and I didn\'t expect anything because of Rowling\'s prior success. For that I am glad, because the book would have fallen short of my expectations, undoubtedly.  It is a boring story that draws on and on, and the entire plot is extremely depressing.  The only character in the book with any redeeming qualities dies in the first few pages.  I would not want to live in the town of Pagford, nor would I want to be friends with any of the characters. I have to scratch my head and ask, "Why?"  She could have written any book imaginable and it would have sold copies because everyone expected greatness.  Shoot, I even bought it and I hadn\'t ever bought a book of hers before.  The problem for Ms. Rowling is that I\'ll never buy another one of her books again, and I wish I could return this one.  If this had been her first published novel, she never would have gotten a book deal for Harry Potter.'

author: b'Ann'
title: b'Fabulous, Even if Not My Normal Fare'
body: b"I am one of many 50+ years old people who bought this book because I was smitten by the writer over a decade ago, and cannot stop re-reading her. I wanted some fresh material, from her pen, about love. About complicated relationships, darkness and light, loyalty and fear. I was not disappointed. I've never been a reader of novels like this, so it took me one reading to understand the form. In the second reading I am able to recognize the richness of character, subtlety of story, and was left wanting to know more about the fall-out in this small town around the events that unfolded. I purchased the book, and the e-book, and continue to explore the details and turns-of-phrase throughout both versions, which seems to reaffirm, for me, the brilliance of Ms. Rowling."

author: b'AllieS96'
title: b'Surprised'
body: b"I was really excited when I saw that J.K. Rowling released a new book! I was excited to read her excellent writing, but I have to say that I was disappointing. The characters made me upset, the language was shocking, and the plot couldn't pull me in. I am sad to say that JK Rowling has disappointed me."

author: b'J. Myers'
title: b'Read the Reviews Before You Buy'
body: b'I bought this book without reading any reviews.  I really had no idea what to expect, except a book for adults from a writer I trusted.'

author: b'Kitkat'
title: b'This is NOT Harry Potter! Get over it.'
body: b"This book took me awhile to get into it--so many characters whose lives are all intertwined in some way. But I was enthralled by the small English town setting. Having lived in England for three years near a small rural town I well remember the people and the class differences--not much different really than small town rural USA where I grew up. The story was depressing at times, but I feel Americans have this idea that we should be happy all the time (could be the advertising campaigns we see / hear on TV, radio and in print), but most of our lives are mundane interspersed with moments of happiness. I liked the way the characters lives and histories were brought forward bit by bit. How well do any of us know our neighbors or where they came from; why they have made the choices they have in life and what they'd like to forget? How many of us see injustice around us and turn a blind eye? How many of us live our lives without ever leaving our safe confines, whether physical or intellectual? This book takes us out of our comfort zone into a world we may be interested in, but certainly wouldn't want to live in. Or are we already there and don't realize it?"

author: b'Oregon Skier'
title: b'Powerful, discomforting, compelling, lacking simple answers, and a good read for adults only.'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy uses small town politics, a high school, and a low-income housing project to survey all that is petty, obsessive, sexually subversive, repressed, judgmental, easily-offended, addicted, neglectful and downright mean in human nature.  It is not comforting reading, but then it is plainly not intended to be either.'

author: b'arley'
title: b'rowling'
body: b'I found "Casual Vacancy" to be a novel that was more about the agenda than it was about the characters.  I could not find a person or a plot that encouraged me to read on.'

author: b'Eva Arnott'
title: b'A sadly accurate portrait of modern England'
body: b'This is a brilliantly written examination of a modern society which maybe focuses a little too exclusively on the unpleasant creatures that are under the rocks in the flower garden.'

author: b'L. Hastings'
title: b'Bring on the next one!'
body: b"Since there are over 1,000 reviews upon this writing I can skip the preliminaries, you all know the premise of the story.  It took me awhile to get through this book. I believe I dragged the reading out, intentionally, I was too busy laughing out loud  and shaking my head in dismay  and overall being shocked by all the backstabbing and dysfunction.  Nevertheless,  I am going to miss these awful and too real-like characters.  Some of them, I absolutely despised.  There was nowhere for me to hide in this book, no one individual that I clung to that I could fall back on when things got rough.  J.K. Rowling made no apologies for these people, she was bold  and tossed out all of their dirty laundry, paragraph after paragraph.  Wow! I love this kind of writing.  I repeatedly asked myself how did she come back to these people and pour out their miserable souls on a daily basis, then realized that as dreary and wretched as these folks were, I kept coming back and wondered about them even when I wasn't reading."

author: b'vfkpfk'
title: b'the Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling'
body: b'The book was filled with characters who were hard to like.  Perhaps the only person who was a positive force was the character who dies in Chapter 1.  Throughout the first half of the book I often thought of not finishing it, but having paid for it, I kept plugging along.  The second half of the book begins to tie all the characters and loose ends together.  I kept wondering, who is going to die here.  It was obviously coming with all the people in this small town in Britain so self centered, conniving and unhappy.  Very British, I think!'

author: b'JC'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I was excited to read it since the Harry Potter books were so very good!!!!  I tried and tried to read Casual Vacancy, but finally just started a new book.  So flat...........first few pages were the best.  Boring slow!'

author: b'FLP'
title: b'This is the book for those who like profanity.'
body: b'It is hard to believe that the person who wrote the Harry Potter series would be unable to write a book with out using the "f" word so much.  Without the profanity the book would be half as thick and the story would still be below average but better.'

author: b'angelray'
title: b"couldn't wait to get it, didn't mind paying more for it..."
body: b"I intended to get this book no matter what the cost, simply on the brilliance of the author's gift for writing. I also did not expect to find any vestige of Harry Potter.  However, I am still in awe of the author who could write a series of books, where each one was better than the excellent one you just finished reading, culminating in the last book being one of the most profoundly satisfying books I have ever read."

author: b'Artlady07'
title: b'Slow Reading'
body: b'Found to be boring, slow reading, can tell she has written for younger readers in past. Think this book will sell just because of her name. Sorry I bought this book.'

author: b'Karyl Carlson'
title: b"It isn't Harry Potter!"
body: b'Do not expect a magical adventure. This book is a gritty look at life, death and politics in a pair of small English towns. That said, Rowling is still tops as a wordsmith and I look forward to more from her.'

author: b'Miki'
title: b'Slow, rambling start'
body: b"I wanted to like this book.  But it didn't work out that way."

author: b'DDK'
title: b'Nothing like Harry Potter'
body: b'I purchased this book because I read the entire Harry Potter series and had come to love the writing of J.K. Rowling. I did not expect this to be anything like the Harry Potter series but I was curious to see what this talented author would write next. I was not disappointed at all.'

author: b'Ann Mintz'
title: b'Easy to read, tough to like'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy takes some getting into with lots of characters, mostly fairly unsympathetic middle-aged people with teen-aged kids. Until I had everyone settled in my head, I kept having to go back to remind myself who was who.  Once that was sorted out, the plot moves along and definitely engages the reader, at least this reader.  If you're bothered by casual profanity and strong adult themes-- and I do mean strong, domestic violence, hard drug use, rape, brutal bullying, to name a few-- this is not your book.  All the characters are flawed, some more than others, most are not very nice and some are outright vicious.  Once I got into the book, I really could not put it down, and the complex plot resolved itself satisfactorily although certainly not happily.  It can only be unimaginably difficult for a writer to work with a monkey on her back as enormous as the monumental success of the Harry Potter books; Rowling long ago showed herself to be brilliant at creating deeply unsympathetic characters.  I could have wished that at least a few of the dramatic personae in The Casual Vacancy were a bit more likeable"

author: b'pato'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Enjoying the recording very much. The reader is doing a very nice job of the various voices which makes the book come to life.'

author: b'judy'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy by J K Rowlings was a powerful look at politics at work and how it influences peoples lives, for better or worse. I thought it was excellent and would highly recommend it.'

author: b'Endeavour'
title: b'Harry Potter, years later (yawn).'
body: b"I bought a Harry Potter book years ago, but just couldn't get used to the style, which was, I reminded myself, written for children. This book is written in the same stilted style, with words more usual to adult reading. Where I write 'couldn't' she writes 'could not'."

author: b'John T. Savage'
title: b'Loved It!'
body: b"I checked this novel out from the library, and I will be buying it. I loved it. The characters were so well developed, and, although most characters were not likable, I really liked Andrew and Kay characters. Some readers' reviews claim there were no likable characters, but that is not true. And I did tear up at the end of the novel."

author: b'litcritabc'
title: b'absent intention'
body: b'This work is a disjointed and nonsensical treatment of a grubby English small town.  It is impossible to like anyone.'

author: b'Collin Garbarino'
title: b'Not Very Good'
body: b'I expected that Rowling\'s latest book would contain some wit and humor. These magical characteristics must only belong in the young adult genre. Rowling has written us an "adult" book, which I suppose is coded language for "boring." I did, however, find it ironic that an "adult" book could be so juvenile.'

author: b'Ken Moe'
title: b'Jane Austen Lives!'
body: b"Jane Austen has come to life again in the 21st century, this time unfettered by 19th century literary conventions curtailing sex and foul language. Ms. Austen was not afraid to write about unlikeable people, and J. K. Rowling has shown that same courage in this work. Having served as a pastor and denominational official in rural Pennsylvania, I had no difficulty transposing the inhabitants of Pagford and Yarvil to America. Rowling's characters are real. I've known these people by other names with different regional dialects in another country. This is not a book to assuage one's hunger for a simple triumph of good over evil, but rather to motivate commitment for social justice. The realistic nature of this novel is not for the faint of heart but is bracing for those who seek truth in fiction."

author: b'KJM'
title: b'Loved it'
body: b"Fantastic read! I could not put it down. J.K. Rowling's character development is outstanding. Would recommend this to everyone!! I look forward to more books from her."

author: b'E. Collier'
title: b'Casual Vacancy missed the mark'
body: b"Stick to the age group that garnered so much success with Harry Potter.  I was extremely disappointed.  The plot doesn't move fast enough and when everything started to come together, it simply fizzled out.  British readers probably understood the slang and the profane words, but I didn't think that they added anything to the story.  The ending really made me wonder why I had read the book in the first place."

author: b'road reader'
title: b'Gifted and Grim'
body: b'Rowling writes a "Casual Vacancy" with the ambition, imagination, and scope of a multi book series. In this delivery, her amazing gift is her downfall. There are too many characters: multiple unlikeable families of age stepped, flawed participants who yell, scream, complain, whine, or moan their way through the chapters of the book. Most chapters are depressing and exhausting. This overly ambitious statement of contemporary life in the small, seemingly charming, English town of Pagford is neither kind nor uplifting. In many instances, the introduction of yet another ugly, grave, social issue made me want to stop reading. Woven throughout the lives of the Pagford inhabitants is the theme of class and caste preoccupation in it\'s very English way; by the middle of the book the town of Pagford, itself, has become an ugly character. This may be the most telling statement of all about contemporary English life. The book provides a rich tapestry of social issues in Pagford, and that feat is Rowling\'s genius. Unfortuneately, it does not translate to a compelling story. Too often, the story is repelling. As an avid reader of convincing yarns, I am disappointed in this effort. As a writer, I am envious of Rowling\'s seemingly endless gift.'

author: b'Anne C. Entsminger'
title: b'A fan from the first page.'
body: b"I think it has been a long time since I have read a book that is as honest and raw as this. She unabashedly shows the lives of all kinds of characters in such a masterful way - people complain that she shows so much negative, but I think she shows the positive just as well. I would even venture to say that I haven't seen a social commentary this well written since Jane Austen."

author: b'Valda Joy Anderson'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy by J.K.Rowling'
body: b'If someone had said, "here\'s a story about a local council election" I would have yawned and said " You have to be joking!"  HOWEVER, this book grabbed me and hooked me in immediately. I loved it. All the characters were rounded out, the main story flowed even though it was made up of lots of threads that would all tie up at the end. It may not be Harry Potter but then it was never meant to be, nor is it a children\'s story. I would definitely recommend it as a damned good read! A cup of cocoa, a rainy day, a warm fire...and A Casual Vacancy. Yep, it\'s a winner.'

author: b'Paige'
title: b'Lovely sociological novel!'
body: b"Casual Vacancy was phenomenal! At first, I had trouble following the characters, as there are certainly many of them, and they are introduced wicked fast, but JKR did a great job reminding you who was who without being repetitive. It is a very deep, very adult-themed novel, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. With all of the different sociological issues (rich at war with the impoverished, parents and children, adults and adolescents, and even racial tensions, as well as exploring domestic violence and bullying), it was a page turner to the very end. It was stark, realistic, and a far cry from the Wizarding novels of JKR's renown, but it was fantastic. I just wouldn't recommend it to someone under 13."

author: b'Fishy!'
title: b'Not Harry Potter but Still Amazing'
body: b"It's true that this book is NOT Harry Potter and if that's the world you're looking for then you will be sadly disappointed. I must admit that I wasn't immediately hooked but if you keep reading beyond the Kindle sample, the book becomes hard to put down.  The characters are very human and realistic, the story is compelling, and the end will trigger many feels."

author: b'John T. Lowry'
title: b'Cast of main characters'
body: b'Some reviewers asked for a Constance Garnett Russian novel translation sort of list of characters and I had already prepared this for my own (forgetful) use:'

author: b'orange kiwi'
title: b'Unexpectedly unbrilliant'
body: b"I had expected this book to be as brilliant as the first Harry Potter book but it wasn't. Not because there was no magic, not because it was an adult book but because I expected JK Rowling to surprise me and she didn't."

author: b'B. Morris'
title: b'Not as good as I had hoped'
body: b'I was looking forward to this book. As a reader of the Harry Potter books I had high expectations for The Casual Vacancy. No I was not expecting Harry Potter but as described I was expecting a funny and enjoyable book. What I got instead was a plodding read on subjects that one would hardly call comedic.'

author: b'K. Worthington'
title: b'I made it through the book'
body: b"This was a hard book to finish.  I kept waiting for something to happen and waited and waited and waited.  I was tempted to just stop but I hate to do that 'cause then I would wonder if something really did happen.  Also, because it was written by J.K., I had faith that it couldn't be as plodding as it seemed and that soon she would wind it all up into something.  Didn't happen for me at all.  I really couldn't identify with any of the characters or even sympathize with them."

author: b'Jennifer A. Slater'
title: b'My kids got the best of her...'
body: b'The Harry Potter series was a once in a lifetime experience, one that will probably continue as long as there are children who continually reach the age where they can read a book of that size, and as long as there are adults who realize they never experienced it.  I had to buy 3 copies of each of the 7 books in that series, one for each of my children, because they couldn\'t wait to dive back into the magic they knew they were about to experience.  After the first book came out, the remaining six found me camped out in a lawn chair and a sleeping bag with my kids waiting for Target to open their doors so we could race inside and grab the next installment.  Even as an adult these books blew me away with the depth and unfathomable imagination that Ms. Rowling possesses.  Which is why, when I heard she had authored a book for grown-ups, I absolutely could not wait.  I was now going to be able to experience the can\'t-put-it-down ride that children across the world had been enjoying for years.  I\'m telling you all this because this fierce expectation I had for an adult version of Ms. Rowling\'s talent may be part of the reason why I was so disappointed with The Casual Vacancy.  Or at least that\'s what I told myself as I was trying to come up with a reason to keep reading.  Certainly, I thought, it had to get better.  But sadly, it did not.  The first impression I had of The Casual Vacancy was that it seemed to be a poor imitation of Mauve Binchey\'s classic style, a collection of different characters that eventually came together at the end of an intricate but interesting story.  Unfortunately, the difference between these two authors is that Ms. Binchey\'s characters were fascinating, fun to get to know (even if they were evil) and her stories were often punctuated with a dry and unexpected sense of humor.  Totally delightful.  The characters in The Casual Vacancy were never really described in depth, possibly because by page 112 there were already 27 main characters.  I spent so much time flipping back and forth trying to remember who everyone was, who they were related to, and what their emotional handicap was, that I finally created a cheat-sheet of names.  However, by that point, I realized I had already lost interest in the entire book.  If you\'re a fast reader and can get through this novel fairly quickly I say go for it, if for no other reason than to see what Ms. Rowling has created.  But I highly recommend that as you start reading, you stick a post-it at the front of the book and jot down a brief description of each character as they are introduced, or feel free to print off a copy of what I typed up for my daughter, which I added as a hidden document entitled "Roadmap" on my webpage.  I pray that Ms. Rowling\'s feelings aren\'t hurt by the reviews this book has received, she is so obviously a kind and sensitive person, and so incredibly gifted.  And I truly hope she publishes another adult novel because I still adore her as a writer and a storyteller and would be the first in line to buy a copy.'

author: b'Terry Deneen'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy left a big vacancy for JK Rowling'
body: b'I was extremely disappointed in this book!  The characters were boring.  The crude language on most every page the teenagers spoke were offensive.'

author: b'EC'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'I am a fan of JK Rowling but this book is dull, uninteresting and frankly boring.When you read you want to learn. The subject matter of the "Casual Vacancy" and the characters can be found in most of our daily newspapers. Why on earth JKR thought that a death of a parish councillor and the subsequent battle for the vacant seat would be interesting is beyond comprehension. The characters are stereo types of people we all come across during our daily lives.What a shame. I was hoping for fun and laughter, excitement and tension and instead the story was dull and boring. I had difficulty finishing it!'

author: b'Candace R. Thompson'
title: b'Extremely well written'
body: b"I had read that this book wasn't as compelling as the Harry Potter series and didn't get the good reviews as the HP's,  but I thought that while this was not the fantasy of the HP, it was an extremely well written adult book.  I thoroughly enjoyed it.  Great job Ms Rowling!"

author: b'krissypooh'
title: b'Loved it!'
body: b"This book was excellent.  I loved how it really didn't have a plot but was about just how bad people can be to one another."

author: b'SMonarch'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Had trouble keeping track of the many characters; actually made of list of who's who and who belonged with whom.  They story all came together at the end, but it seemed to take a long time getting there."

author: b'MizShoes'
title: b'Sad little book'
body: b'Ms Rowling can write well. I was involved with her characters by the second page. But what a sad little story she told. When I finished the book, I wanted to read it again and have it end differently, but that would not have been "authentic." What ever she puts out next, I\'ll be in line to read it.'

author: b'Madstrio'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b"I was totally disappointed from beginning to end with this book.  I'm the type of reader that when I commit to a book I have to see it through.  This was one of the hardest.  There is not one character worth cheering for or caring about.  The language is filthy.  The plot was boring and I was hoping that the whole town would disappear in the last chapter."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'so,so'
body: b'I guess I like more of a story.  This was mostly description of the people. --But is was interesting and held my attention.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'Slow and difficult to get through. I am'

author: b'Kasey Curtis'
title: b'Totally unexpected'
body: b"I was not a Harry Potter fan, but having seen a few of Ms Rowling's interviews and speeches I was curious to see what her grown up writing was all about.  What an incredible read!!  I thoroughly enjoyed the story, became fully engaged with the characters to the extent that when I finished the story I felt utterly bereft, not only for the characters (I will not expand on this as I dislike 'spoilers' ...) but for the fact that it had ended ... and I wanted to know how things turned out for them all."

author: b'Jan'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"This book is a far cry from the Harry Potter series.  I understand that she was trying to move away from that phase but this book so far is not anything out of the ordinary.  I'm about 25% through it so maybe something unpredicable will happen but so far...ho hum..."

author: b'Bill Walsh'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Well written book that unfolds and intertwines the lives of each character in a believable manner. Rowling presents a snapshot of the social issues all modern societies face in a humanistic non-judgemental fashion.'

author: b'Ally'
title: b'Slow To Start'
body: b'The first third of the book was rather hard to follow with all the character switches and completely lacked interesting plot. After you get past that point the book becomes rather interesting.'

author: b'Petra'
title: b'Where was The Magic???'
body: b'It was not what I expected from J K Rowling. I wanted mystery and intrigue, at the very least a bit of escapism!!What I got was the life and times of a depressed council  estate resident and the inner workings of the teenage boy!! I could have watched the Omibus of East Enders for that!!'

author: b'Symons39'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Having read the Harry Potter books I found this latest novel of J K Rowlings very disappointing.  Very disjointed and the ending was strange.'

author: b'Ken C.'
title: b'Has Anyone Reviewed This Yet?'
body: b"Thought I'd get my two cents in along with the others. Last week I attended the play Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf. Along the second intermission I asked myself why I was  paying good money to see people be mean to each other. The same thought occurred toward the end of The Casual Vacancy, although the price was a lot lower. It did seem as if there was a lot of nastiness between the book's characters. But, all in all, that excess only caused me to deduct one star, because the writing is excellent and the characters certainly colorful, if not always endearing. I realized that I had been caught up in the life of Pagford, the English village where the action is centered. I can't say that it is a microcosm for our world, but two things have reminded me lately of the need for us to be nicer to others: Virginia Woolf and Krystal Weedon."

author: b'Harry Mitchell'
title: b"Not your daughter's J.K.Rowling"
body: b'If you were expecting something light or fanciful, you will indeed be disappointed.'

author: b'bella'
title: b'disappointed'
body: b'Totally disapointing  . Confusing. Very juvenile in the writing. Loved all the Harry Potter books.  Looked forward to this book and  would not tell anyone that it was enjoyable. Sorry....'

author: b'Lucy'
title: b'Brilliant'
body: b"I thought this book was amazing. I read all the HP books and loved them.  Rowling is an amazing  writer.  She knows how to bring her character's to life  whether you like them or not.  I loved the fact that it was nothing like her previous books. It was extremely intelligent and insightful.  This book was not about the best in people but the worst in people.  It was very honest and sometimes harsh. A lot of people will not like this book because of the very nasty small  minded characters she writes about. But thats what makes this book so good.  Whether we like it or not the people in this book and the things that happen to them exist everyday and every where in our world.  This was a great book!"

author: b'memem'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"A thought provoking,disturbing and often very accurate look into the human condition. The Casual Vacancy explores small town prejudices, presumptions and ego with a view to exposing our own failings. This novel is vastly removed from JK Rowling's previous works and though at times a little tedious is still worth the read."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Did not enjoy'
body: b'Gruesome book, no happiness in this book whatsoever. Would not advise anyone to read this.  Very sad people leading miserable lives.'

author: b'Ron Mace'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"So far the first few chapters are so bad I have had to put it away for now. Very slow and very boring. She is so good but I'm afraid she has missed the mark with this one."

author: b'Kay Marilyn Womick'
title: b'What an eye opener.'
body: b"If I thought about it at all, I always considered myself a liberal with social compassion.  But this book was a real eye-opener.  It has changed me forever.  Can't wait for more of her adult books."

author: b'flowergal'
title: b'Much Better Than Expected!'
body: b'I am a huge Harry Potter fan, and had been looking forward to this book since the day I heard about it.  Then the book came out...I read the first 50 pages online, and thought it was just OK.  So I put my name on a hold list at the library and waited.  I came back to Amazon over and over and read the mixed reviews, and I expected to hate the book.  WOW, was I wrong!  It is superbly written!  Some of the subject matter is not for the faint of heart, and I don\'t know that I can really say that I "liked" the book, but I definitely appreciate the book.  JK Rowling really knows her stuff in terms of people, and how they think and act.  There is hardly a single likable character in the whole book, except for Barry.  I heard JK Rowling say she "needed" to write this book, so I could only imagine that she had a powerful message to convey.  She succeeded.'

author: b'J. Ikuta'
title: b'Good writing, but...'
body: b"Dont' read this book if you are offended by abundant use of curse words and crude sexual references.  That said...the story is intriging and Rowling's writing skill is evident and enjoyable."

author: b'Book worm'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b"I love JK Rowling's New book the casual vacancy. it's not for the faint hearted though, there are some uncomfortable subjects in the book. Pagford's favorite citizen has died suddenly and the reader is then thrown into a voyeuristic type journey into the lives, loves and losses of some of its inhabitants. Some you will love. Some you will hate and of course the ones you love to hate. I think Jk Rowling has delivered a superb piece of writing yet again. Her sentence structure is fabulous. And she has an uncanny knack of knowing how human minds work. Don't read this if you want a fairy tale ending though! It ain't gonna happen."

author: b'JM'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I really expected a much better story from J. K. Rowling than what I got in the Casual Vacancy.  Characters were cliche and not well developed.  Mostly gloomy and dark subject matter, with little redemption.'

author: b'Cheesehead in CA'
title: b'Not funny, not interesting, not finishing'
body: b"I have to agree with the majority of reviewers here that this book is a big disappointment. While the HP books kept me reading far into the night because I just didn't want to put them down, this book is overpriced, incredibly tedious, overly-detailed (particularly with regard to every imaginable bodily function), and just plain boring that even though I've been reading it for several days on my Kindle, I've managed to slog through only 16% of it! So many characters to keep track of, it's almost like reading a Russian novel. I absolutely love good, witty British comedy, but if this book is supposed to be funny, her sense of humor is totally escaping me. I have a real aversion to not finishing books I start reading, but as another reviewer said, so far I just don't care what ultimately happens to all these characters and probably will eventually just give up on this one. JKR, PLEASE go back to writing your undeniably brilliant and clever fantasy fiction, which have been always worth the price of admission ... unfortunately, this book is NOT."

author: b'yeyann'
title: b'not too bad'
body: b'I am a huge JK Rowling fan Harry Potter so when the Casual Vacancy came out, I immediately bought it. First, I would have to say that it was expensive for an ebook. $17.99 on kindle before it was released.'

author: b'lnfitz'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"I couldn't get into the story because of all the bad language and crudeness in just the first chapter.  It's so disappointing when authors feel they need to make books for adults R-rated.  I don't recommend it at all."

author: b'Steven Mitchell'
title: b'...Wonderful. Just wonderful.'
body: b"J.K. Rowling, once again, proves her ability to wield a pen and create a world with characters, that suck you in and hold you hostage until the last page, hasn't been diminished at all these past 5 years. The Casual Vacancy is a wonderful novel about...well, reality and the cruel, hidden nature of humans."

author: b'Bookaholicbee'
title: b'Disappointment'
body: b'I gave this book a shot, plowing through the first chapter, but gave up. Got tired of the soft porn and profanity. Really, you can write a good adult book without that junk.'

author: b'Carol Martin'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b"First I want to say I am a huge J.K. Rowling fan.  I am an avid reader and like a variety of genres.  I was going to buy this book right off the bat for my kindle and at the last moment decided to just download the sample.  Thank goodness I did!  What a waste of money!  I am not a prude but this story so far includes a family that uses extremely foul language, a son who wants to kill his father, and a high school boy who gets an erection on the school bus is just not my kind of reading enjoyment.  This book is far below Rowling's talent.  If you like this kind of sleeze, vulgarity and sexual innuendos then go for it.  I would have given this a half a star if I could have and won't even finish the sample. Waste of my time.  If she comes out with another book I will know to check it out first and not just assume it will be good since she has so much talent."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy is one of the worst books I have ever read.  I feel the purchase of this expensive book was a rip off.  This is a depressing book, full of unlikable characters who fight with each other and swear at each other constantly.  I am surprised they have not all committed suicide.  I could not finish the book, because it was such a downer.  I see no redeeming features in the book, and I am stunned the author would write such a vituperative and degrading story.'

author: b'kindle reader'
title: b'decent book, not a Harry Potter'
body: b"I bought this book because I loved the Harry Potter series and I wanted to see how well J.K. Rowling would transition to a adult focused book.  The writing was still good and the book flowed well but subject-wise it wasn't real exciting.  I am not sure I would buy her next adult focused book."

author: b'good karma'
title: b'YAWN'
body: b"I had great expectations but really struggled with this much anticipated book..I never finished it..I kept trying but gave up after the third chapter.  She's a great writer but this book never grabbed me.  Should stick to books for kids.."

author: b'L. Dakota'
title: b"Because I'm not into fantasy..."
body: b'I\'ve felt guilty for not reading the Harry Potter books. My child was too old to read to, my grandchildren too far away.  Finally a book for me! "The Casual Vacancy" was a delight. I understand her huge fan base, her descriptive writing style immediately hooks you in to the story. The characters in the book were so well flushed out I was able to connect with them all quickly. I can\'t wait for another book from this brilliant author.'

author: b'Rev. HD'
title: b'Not worth the time or money'
body: b'I have not been able to finish this book yet, so I do not know if I am in the percentage that JK Rowling stated on good morning america that she "would not want to know" if they didn\'t cry at the end. I forced my way through 200 pages and could not gag down any more. Perhaps one day I might tourture myself by finishing this read, but I doubt it.'

author: b'pinesusan'
title: b"don't know that I'll finish it - so far haven't found any redeeming qualities"
body: b"so sad to me -  even though I waited for 60 other people to finish (or not finish) reading this library book, I still don't care for this story -"

author: b'Gary Freeman'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'It was a decent book but It was real slow getting me into  it and then keeping my interest. First book I have read by this author and it was slow for me.Purchased from Amazon.'

author: b'Fred Brown'
title: b'Enjoyable'
body: b'I knew nothing about the book prior to reading. Found it to be an enjoyable read. Character development was interesting and believable.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Amazon e-books are a miracle for homebound or disabled people'
body: b"I am disabled and semi-homebound so it's hard to get out to the store and hope that they have a book I want so far this is a great book and I didn't have to leave home to get it and it will always be available on either my wife's computer my computer or Kindle thanks Amazon for creating digital and starting the e-book revolution. Jon"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'It gets better the more you read!'
body: b"Although I  thought that it started a bit slow it did get better so you must be patient.  I got involved with the lives of the characters and cared about what happened to them.  It is definitely a departure from the Harry Potter series.  I like Ms. Rowling's character development.  I would recommend the book but do not think it's her best effort."

author: b'Avshalom Houri'
title: b'Much better then the general reviews'
body: b'The book is about real life and real people.'

author: b'Bevann'
title: b'A casuaL vacancy. kindle edition'
body: b"A rather disappointing first adult book from JK Rowling, author of the Harry Potter books. A story about unlovable residents in an English village, and what happens when a council member dies, and a replacement is needed to fill the 'casual vacancy'. I loved all the Harry Potter books. And I think JK Rowling should stick to children's literature."

author: b'Bonmilly'
title: b'A great read'
body: b'I just finished reading the new JK Rowling The Casual Vacancy.'

author: b'pam'
title: b'Great read.'
body: b"People - if you want a Harry Potter book - read a Harry Potter book!!! Don't expect Hogwarts in this one. This book reminded me of a Maeve Binchy with the way the characters are developed and intertwine, crossed with an episode of Midsommer Murders. It portrays a gritty true to life town with a mixture of shock and humour. I loved it!"

author: b'Crystal Starr Light'
title: b'"But who could bear to know which stars were already dead?"'
body: b'"But who could bear to know which stars were already dead...could anybody stand to know that they all were?"'

author: b'Sherri Koester'
title: b'Gripping Page Turner!'
body: b"This book was very interesting and engaging... I finally had to just sit down and finish it so I could move on with my life!  Each of the characters was artfully written. I was fascinated by the fictional town and how everyone was interrelated. I was transported to Pagford each time I opened the book. Many of the characters were unlikeable but still interesting to watch. I'm really impressed by Rowling, her mixture of dark humor and social commentary makes for a compelling read. I can't wait to see what she does next."

author: b'Salvatore R. Mangano'
title: b'Save your time by reading this review'
body: b"This is a story where the most likable character in the book dies in the very beginning and then the provincial town where he lived proceeds to fall apart like a slow motion train wreck. The End. That's it. Don't bother."

author: b'Ewat1'
title: b'This is no Harry Potter'
body: b'This is definitely no Harry Potter.  I found this book very difficult to get in to.  This book has its moments of fantastic writing, but over all a storyline that could not hold my interest.'

author: b'meowpal'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This book is very slow to get into.  A lot of back and forth with the characters so sometimes it  is hard to figure out who is who and whats going on.  Also instead of using basic names or easy to pronouce and remember names, she made up unusual and different names, which make it harder rather than easy reading.'

author: b'Dmitry Broytman'
title: b'JKR: Disillusion'
body: b"So you have read all of Harry Potter books, you love them, and are already anticipating pleasure from reading JKR's first adult novel."

author: b'Dancinghare'
title: b'Engrossing Book'
body: b'This is a well-written book with well-developed characters. However, if you are looking for a "feel good" book or want to be entertained, you may want to look elsewhere. The book didn\'t captivate me until the middle, at which point I couldn\'t put it down. Even so, there were too many characters and none of them are very likable. The book addresses an overwhelming amount of society\'s ills. In the village of Pagford, everyone is unbelievably messed up. There isn\'t one person who doesn\'t have a significant emotional or relationship problem. It was interesting to watch the characters unfold and to discover their secrets. There is a complex web of cause and effect, often created by the characters\' misunderstandings of certain situations. I was compelled to keep reading, waiting for the inevitable train wreck. The book contains frequent use of the "f" word and some uncomfortably adult situations. It is an irreverent, sad, shocking, and at times, darkly humorous story. There is a glimmer of hope at the end, which adds a tiny bit of light to an otherwise dark story. It\'s worth reading; just don\'t expect Harry Potter.'

author: b'Gale'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I tried over a period of several weeks to read the book.  It did not grab my interest in the least.  Many characters and after reading 20 percent of the book, I still could not figure out the main character.  None of the characters were likable.  I returned it for a refund.'

author: b"j'aimelire"
title: b'jaimelire'
body: b'Simply put, the book did not get my attention, did not keep my interest even after 100 pages into the story and I was unable to finish it. Deleted it from my list.'

author: b'gopsu'
title: b'Great Book'
body: b"I just got finished reading J.K. Rowling's The Casual Vacancy. I loved it. The development of each character throughout the book kept me coming back for more. It might have been a slow start, but once I really got into the core, it shocked me how much I was enjoying it. The last few pages left me sad, raw (because I might have connected with the characters more than I thought) and satisfied."

author: b'June Mackie'
title: b'Rowling not a "One Trick Poney"'
body: b"Ms. Rowling is still my idol.  This book is impossible to put down.  The small English village life is so spot on and her characters are so believeable that I felt like a fly on the wall. Imagine Peton Place in 2012 in an English village but with a much better plot. Lovely, lovely, lovely story.  I would have to tell the whole plot if I started describing the story.  READ IT!  LOVE IT!  Pass it on to all your friends.  It's on my Kindle so that I can read it over and over again."

author: b'eyeski'
title: b'Probably a "Brit" thing'
body: b"Given this author's outstanding success, I assumed this would be a book I would like -- with excitement, intrigue, unusual twists, e.g. I found it anything but. The reader has to keep track of most of the population (so it seemed) of a couple of towns and their complicated relationships to one another. Plus, until near the end of the book, the plot was plodding, boring to the point I wondered if there ever would be any climax. There was, eventually, but not until I'd read 80% of the book. Plus the characters had little so few redeeming graces that I couldn't seem to care much about what happened to them one way or another. I'm just glad I didn't part with the price of the hardcover edition!"

author: b'Sunbunny'
title: b'Not happy'
body: b"It's no Harry Potter.  Characters are not particularly engaging - they're dull.  Sorry I paid good money for it.  I just expected more.  I'm hoping as it goes on it will become more engrossing, right now it's very slow paced.  I realize this book was written for adults but adults like a bit of excitement and characters they can relate too."

author: b'Olene'
title: b'Life, Death and Politics in English Village'
body: b"Conflicts arise between natives and newcomers and between haves and have-nots.  Characters from every social class and age group emerge fully developed in JKR's capable hands.  Set in modern times and cold reality, it is very different from the Harry Potter saga."

author: b'Bronwen Jones'
title: b'A ripping yarn and fabulous read'
body: b"I was hooked, from beginning to end. Also, from a writer's point of view, this is an interesting book, breaking some tiresome rules. It is a bible on how to write a successful multi-POV story, and there is plenty of back story here and there, all in each character's POV, quite long at up to a page and a half, in brackets, and gossipy. I would highly recommend this story. Well done, JK Rowling."

author: b'janet'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Well I've had this book for a couple of weeks now and I still can't get into it. I keep trying to pick up from where I left off but I've skipped so many pages the story has slipped away too.Maybe I'll try it again one day!"

author: b'Mickey'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I was very excited to read this book, as I had read all of the Harry Potter books, after my kids finished them.  I only got to the middle of Chapter 4 before I went on to another book in my kindle.  So maybe, this is a partial review. I found it a bore and difficult to understand, not being British. ( Because their colloquial language  being so different from ours, in the USA, it made for difficult and slow reading . ) Otherwise, it just might be a good book.....  I just couldn't get into it."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Love it!'
body: b'I am not entirely done reading this book, but I am more than half way through it. I think it is fabulous. It is multiple families stories all in one book. Some families lives are more boring than others. But I think the book is amazing. The writing is phenomenal, and the stories seem so real.'

author: b'lauren'
title: b'Disapointed.'
body: b'I had great expectations. I was hoping that an adult novel written by J.K.Rowlings would grab me as much as Harry Potter !  I was bored and kept hoping that the next chapter would ignite my interest. No way...  But I did try to give the book a chance so I read it to the very end.  Sorry but I hope there is no sequel  !!'

author: b'Biker Babe'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I've just finished reading this book and was looking forward to enjoying it as I love all the Harry Potter books. I was disappointed in the story line and found it boring and a bit depressing, not one character was happy and it seemed to drag on and on. I would not recommend this book"

author: b'Enjoy Reading Lynne'
title: b'Casual Vacancy - thumbs down'
body: b"I must say this really missed the mark in my book - didn't like it at all!! Not worth the monies or the time."

author: b'Allyg'
title: b'Enjoyed the detail'
body: b"I enjoyed Miss Rowling's first steps into adulthood. I am a fan of her other books. I felt she hit the mark on this story of English (British ) life having lived in a setting as described it brought back memories. The characters are all to be found in live either here in the USA or in the UK. The haves the have nots and those in between and of course those who want to rule. It has its funny side in a black way and of course tragedy."

author: b'Upstate NY'
title: b'Great story!'
body: b'Started a bit slow but picked up very quickly.  Lots of twists and turns along the way!  I can almost see Pagford in my minds eye.'

author: b'BamaRose'
title: b'Explosive!'
body: b'Rowling certainly knows how to stimulate thought. I remember being *required* to read various books in high school. This is one that will be passed around surreptitiously  and devoured by high schoolers.'

author: b'mrsjmd3'
title: b'For adults!!!'
body: b'I was impressed with J. Rowlings first adult book. It kept the interest. I hope this becomes a series because'

author: b'Gary Hoggatt'
title: b"Rowling's novel is well-written, but just too small, petty, and brutally depressing"
body: b"I'm a big Harry Potter fan.  Okay, so that out of the way, I was obviously looking forward to seeing what J.K. Rowling would do with her first post-Potter book, 2012's The Casual Vacancy.  In her new novel, Rowling displays her usual ability to build deep characters and intricate plots.  Unfortunately, all the characters are so dreary, being pitiful, a jerk, or a pitiful jerk, and and the plot so full of life-at-it's-smallest drama that you feel beaten down by the end.  Maybe that's what she's was going for."

author: b'Elizabeth Moore'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'It was a shift from young adult to really adult reading for Rowling. It was well written and a sad story.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"This is exactly what I felt after waiting days for this book to come out, a casual vacancy. I have waited in line for hours, enjoyed every hour of reading and rereading Ms. Rowling's prior series, but this was disapointing as her first adult selection offering. I so look forward to her characters vividly coming to life but this one didn't do that for me. I will admit I didn't finish the book, and that almost never happens. Wish I had read a sample."

author: b'C. W. Richards'
title: b'Rowling for the rest of us'
body: b'Recognizing that Harry Potter is for younger readers, although many adults enjoy the novels as well.'

author: b'Ktb'
title: b'She has proved herself'
body: b'I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book! JK has proven how diversified she is as an author! Would recommend everyone to pick this up an give it a read!'

author: b'A. Frederick'
title: b'Sad little community.'
body: b'Package arrived promptly and in great shape.  The book was on CDs, could not finish, sad depressing town, people the same have given the CDs away.  Sorry this book was not my "cup of tea" and was really looking forward to the read.'

author: b'Beth'
title: b'Good read'
body: b'This book started slow but built up steam. All in all a good read. Enjoyed the ending. Looking forward to more from her.'

author: b'dogwalker'
title: b'What a surprise!'
body: b'This book was a real surprise after reading the entire Harry Potter series twice.  It was not as graphic as I expected after reading the reviews prior to getting the book. I could not put the book down once I started it, but the ending was depressing.'

author: b'D. J. Miller'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'After all of the hype I was anticipating reading this novel. Found it difficult to follow and sadly went onto other books after about 100 pages.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Characters Careen Into Each Other in Pagford'
body: b'If you enjoy stories that employ the point-of-views of multiple characters, then this novel is the right fit for you. Similar to the 2004 and 2005 films Crash and Syriana, The Casual Vacancy presents the, at-times sordid but most of all imperfect, lives of several characters as they invariably careen into each other in the tiny, gilded community of Pagford.'

author: b'JulieV'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy is unoccupied'
body: b'I enjoyed the HP series from Ms Rowling and was looking forward to reading a grown-up novel from this author.  I have had the book for approx 1 week and normally would have had a book of this size read in just a few days.  I am only half way through "The Casual Vacancy" and not all that impressed.  I found the first several chapters to be confusing, garbled if you will.  It\'s as if a high school student desperate to impress thier English instructor, sat own with a thesaurus and used as many alternate words as possible.  It was rather unpleasant.  I do like the story line and it has gotten a bit better but I still find it just a bit difficult to follow.  Too many characters.  Perhaps it was the garbage I had to sort through in the beginning that just makes it less than joyful to read.  I don\'t know...maybe her niche is in writing for teens/pre-teens.  I will finish the book, eventually.'

author: b'Debbie'
title: b"One of the best books I've read in a very long time."
body: b"The characters are so well developed I felt at times I was in the same room with them.  They were the last thing I thought about as I fell asleep and couldn't wait for morning to continue reading this wonderfully well written book.  The prose and poetry are beautiful."

author: b'C. Elizabeth Barrett'
title: b'Too Much but Not Enough'
body: b"By the end of the first 20 pages, I still didn't really care about any of the characters.  That's an enormous minus for this book.  There was too much information given about too many characters, and not enough reason for me to wonder what happens to them.  I simply didn't LIKE any of them.  Yes, I finished the book but when my Kindle died halfway through and I had to wait a week for a replacement, I didn't miss Casual Vacancy at all!  I think that says a lot.  Yes, the ending is thought-provoking, but it's no much work - work, not pleasure - to get through this book."

author: b'gmamjr'
title: b"Rowling's latest book."
body: b'Sorry, but this book is a disappointment.  Nothing compelling about it.  No really interesting character development or story line. Just a lot of angry teenagers and unrealistic profiling.'

author: b'Jim Cross'
title: b'Vacancy would have been a good title'
body: b'Nothing was happening that was exciting until the end of the book.  Character developement was lacking.  She should go back to Harry Potter type books.'

author: b'Hogwarts Wannabe'
title: b'I Wanted To Like It'
body: b"I wanted to like Casual Vacancy. The two stars are for the excellence of the writing. J.K. Rowling has a wonderful turn of phrase and the ability to draw you into a world completely unlike your own. However, the plot was unrelentingly depressing. If I want to feel hopeless and sad, I'll read the news, not a book."

author: b'Punzoid'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'My daughter, with an English degree, said "It is a good thing J. K. Rowling wrote the Harry Potter series first.".  I completely agree.  This book was populated with uninteresting, mostly dreadful, people doing things which held no interest for me.  After reading the first few chapters, and in order to give it one last chance, I read the last few chapters and found the people were still uninteresting and mostly dreadful.  I have told our friends that it is awful and to not waste their money on it.'

author: b'Mac1'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"A little disappointed in this book. Probably expected too much after Harry Potter. Took a bit too long to get into each character and they didn't feel quite real. She doesn't write as well for adults as she did for kids. All in all okay not a book that makes you feel good, but that is life for many people."

author: b'Lady Pirate'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b"Sorry to say this was one of the worst books I have ever read. I can't wait to get it out of the house. Dank, Depressing and a waste of my time and money. Sometimes people should stick to what they are good at. This book isn't IT....."

author: b'beach reader'
title: b'at  least the spelling was good'
body: b"What a depressing dreary story. Not one likable character in the whole town. I couldn't wait to get it off my kindle."

author: b'Helen'
title: b'Good Read'
body: b'I bought the Kindle version of this book on the first day it was available day while traveling in Australia. Enjoyed it and it kept me turning the page! I was curious about a non HP story, and I believe JK delivered a very good social commentary in The Casual Vacancy. Read it then decide for yourself Be open!'

author: b'C. Green'
title: b'Poorly written downer'
body: b'I did read to the end, but things never got better.  If you like unrelieved death, despair  and disappointment here you go.'

author: b'Patty'
title: b'Disappointing!'
body: b'Rowlings should stick to Harry Potter and fantasy.  The writing was very convoluted and hard to follow.  I was disappointed because she had done such wonderful works with the Potter series and I was looking forward to something totally new and exciting.  Try again J.K. !'

author: b'ConstantReader'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b"This book reminded me of a Chris Bohjalian book.  Troubling issues, but so well written that it is a joy to read.  I'm looking forward to her next book whether it is another HP, another like this one, or something totally different again."

author: b'Steven'
title: b'Impressive'
body: b'Within the first chapters, the reader knows that Rowling spent a great deal of time developing the characters. What makes the book good is that the characters are believable. The book centers around the death of a small town councilman. Anyone acquainted with small town life and idiosyncrasies, will appreciate and relate to the characters of "The Casual Vacancy". If however, you are looking for anything like the Harry Potter series, keep looking. Rowling has demonstrated her gifts as a diversified writer in writing this wonderful and insightful novel.'

author: b'Linda Seim'
title: b"It's not Harry Potter"
body: b'This book was not at all what I expected. That aside it was filled with characters that were fully drawn and multifaceted. I really came to care about these people and therefore was rather disappointed with the ending and that us why I only gave it 4 stars.'

author: b'JWPhelps'
title: b'reader beware'
body: b'Characters do not flow and the language was R  rated. I was going to read it because it was JK Rowlling and I loved Harry Potter.'

author: b'Arthur W. Wallace'
title: b'Literature but not entertainment'
body: b"I read for many purposes. I read a lot of non-fiction in an effort to learn or understand a topic and I read fiction for enjoyment. Fiction presents an escape, an adventure, a fantasy, a comedy. I write extensively. It was very difficult to justify finishing a Casual Vacancy. As an avid Potter fan, I have read all the books and greatly enjoyed them. The descriptions, the characters, the plotting, the suspense was great fun. There was nothing of the sort in a Casual Vacancy. I had assumed that JK Rowling, who I greatly respect would write a murder mystery, or an adventure. It never occurred to me that she would write a novel with almost no plot, no adventure, no action, just as a study of a number of people, none of whom I cared about, all of whom were uniformly awful and involve them in a really boring effort to run for a boring office. A number of the characters died or had a misadenture and I didn't feel the least bit sad as they were all uniformly non sympathetic. When someone can write about sex and make it boring, uninteresting, and superfluous, one has really accomplished something. After reading a Casual Vacancy, cover to cover, I wished I hadn't."

author: b'Kristen'
title: b'Nothing like HP, but good nonetheless'
body: b'If you are looking for a book like Harry Potter, this is not the book for you.'

author: b'MCD'
title: b'Too bored to finish it'
body: b"I never read a Harry Potter book, nor did I ever wish to. For some reason I had thought this would be an English murder mystery. I was clearly mistaken.  I am 170 pages in and there is no movement in the story. I'm bored. This book is a chore. That said, in some senses she is a fantastic writer, better than I had expected. I love her character delevopment, and I cannot overstate that. However, it seems as though that is all there is. If I am wrong, and this story picks up, please someone comment to this review and I will start reading the book again. In the meantime, I am putting it down."

author: b'EJJ'
title: b'Not a bad book but not in the least funny.'
body: b'Having never read a Harry Potter book, I read THE CASUAL VACANCY without preconceived notions. The book is advertised as being full of "black humor," but I didn\'t find anything the least funny in this tale of damaged and poisonous people, all trying to even some score against their neighbors. Rowling apparently took care to make all her characters (including a tragic three-year-old boy and a number of unhappy teenagers) unsympathetic and obnoxious, and in this, she succeeded. Her writing is crisp and realistic, and it\'s impressive that she had the professional courage to turn from enormously popular fantasy to such a grubby story. Altogether, the book is a bit of a potboiler, but Rowling wraps it up successfully, concluding with few happy endings but some sense of faint justice.'

author: b'M. Crain'
title: b'This is not a feel good book.'
body: b"I really disliked this book. Maybe I disliked it because I was accustomed to JK's writing style that conveyed a myriad of emotions within one's self. This book was, well, made me feel yucky...a downer. I wouldn't recommend this book to my friends or family."

author: b'CaroleC'
title: b'JKRowlings adult novel'
body: b"Tthis is JK Rowling's first adult novel and has a full cast of both adults and teeenagers. In fact, there are a large number of characters and they and their lives aand living styles are described in great and overdone detail.  This makes for a very long book that does not always hold the attention."

author: b'Philip Ross Gordon'
title: b'Just Not What I Expected'
body: b'I always expect J.K. Rowling to write imaginative stories filled with unique characters set in a fascinating environment. None of these expectations were met in "The Casual Vacancy." Forget that this is not a Harry Potter book. John Updike wrote about reality (or the effects of intrusions on reality) for decades. Yet, even in his most suburban novels, the characters were unique, the environment was suffused with a kind of underlying tension, and the stories were emotional adventures. This is never the case with this new book. The most touching character is Krystal, the welfare-class teenager who contends with a stupefied mother, a filthy environment, and a little brother who is infected from negligence. The other characters, (including the off-page Barry Fairweather who [spoiler] dies in the introduction) are mostly noticeable for their being annoying and narcissistic. The entire plot revolves around Fairweather\'s apparent charisma which is spoken about but never illustrated. We have to take the word of characters who routinely lie and misrepresent for purposes so petty and insignificant that we wonder what in God\'s name convinced the great Ms. Rowling that this was an interesting tale to tell.'

author: b'Thoms-Mom'
title: b'Did I Just Read That?'
body: b'I waited all year for Casual Vacancy.  I had high expectations after reading the best series of books ever "Harry Potter".  When I ordered it I "knew" I would love it.  As I started to read it I "hoped" I would love it.  Halfway through I knew I was continuing on with the knowledge that this is J.K. Rowling, it has to be great.  Right?  Ahh...Wrong.  I feel utterly let down by this effort.  While I appreciate the layers of writing and the characters - - I just don\'t care about them.  I can\'t say I hated it, but would I read it again knowing what I know now?  I wouldn\'t.  What a bummer...'

author: b'J. Buke'
title: b'WOW'
body: b"All I can say after reading this is HARRY WHO! Wonderful work by an author that I thought was done with. I am so pleased this is not the case and look forward to her next work...for us adults. Very entertaining, couldn't put it down. Well worth the wait. I did have my doubts...but she proved them wrong. Very seldom does this happen for an author who wrote a children's book. I think there have been two: Professor JRR TOLKIEN and his best friend CS LEWIS. This book has earned it's place on the shelf with their ADULT works. Cheers Jo!!"

author: b'JW'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"Others have written enough already for you to know that this book isn't enjoyable.  I'll still throw in my two cents and add that I find the characters to be largely petty, boring, and devoid of worth.  I'm sure this is intentional on J.K.'s part, but just because she does a fantastic job of depicting a town full of a-holes doesn't mean I want to read about them."

author: b'TAC in MN'
title: b'uplifting.....not!'
body: b'In retrospect, I am not sure there was one functional character in the entire book.  No doubt the author posesses writing skills, but if you thought there were dark characters in the Harry Potter series, hang on to your reading seat, you are in for a rough ride.  Redeeming values are few and far between.'

author: b'Mary L Cundiff'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"What a disappointment!  The only reason I finished this book was because I kept thinking it would get better, considering the author - it didn't."

author: b'lovetotread'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I had a hard time getting into this book.  I tried not to compare to the Harry Potter books, keeping in mind that this is a whole new world for J.K. Rowling!  Still a little hard to ready.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Loved it!'
body: b'It was difficult at first to get used to the language and situations used by the Harry Potter author!  Once I let that go, it was a very enjoyable well-written book.  I recommend this book but would caution against letting children read the book.  Teens to young adult ages- it depends.'

author: b'Colorado Retiree'
title: b'Disappointing book'
body: b"Reading this book was the most disappointing experience I've had in a long time.  I was expecting something that showed more imagination in plot and character development, and I would have liked at least one character I could like in some way. Unfortunately, my expectations were not met.  What a depressing book!  I can think of no reason to recommend this book to other readers, unless they are just curious about the author's ability to write an interesting novel for adults.  I'm sure that the author has the ability to do so, but I didn't feel it was demonstrated in this first attempt.  Please try again!"

author: b'lbjafwife'
title: b'Offensive language alert!  Very disappointed!'
body: b'A huge HP fan, I was expecting great things.  Instead, I was vastly disappointed!  First, as she is introducing us to her cast of characters in the first few pages, I found myself thinking that none of these people seemed likeable or even interesting.  Most seemed to lead sad, pathetic lives.  Then, in 2 pages (p.13-14) she dropped the F-bomb 4 times, used s... twice and included other vulgar language.  I was shocked to say the least.  I decided to read on, hoping things would get better.  Instead, by page 21 we are treated to a teenage boy having an erection on the school bus as he watches his "dream girl," which resulted in his needing to go home and masturbate for 30 minutes!  At this point, I stopped reading the book and returned it!  While I understand that this type of language and vulgarity is, unfortunately, prevalent in our society, I find it offensive and do not wish to hear or read it.  I am surprised that Rowling, with her writing skills and excellent command of the English language, could not find other words to describe these people and scenes.  Did she feel she needed to include obscenity and vulgarity in order to entice "adults" to read her book?  If so, what does that say about her perception of her target group?  Does she think that adults can\'t/won\'t read a book without it?  If so, she certainly didn\'t learn anything about the readers of the HP series!  I sincerely hope that she will revert to the writing style used in the HP series for future books and not insult us by thinking that she needs to lower her standards with obscenity and vulgarity.'

author: b'MSMcReynolds'
title: b'Half-way through'
body: b"I am about half-way through this book. I must admit that I bought it purely because I love Harry Potter and was interested to see what else J.K. Rowling had up her sleeve. I am a ravenous reader, if I love a book it's too hard to put down and I end up finishing it in a day or two. I've been reading this for a few weeks. Here are some things it's not: gripping, exciting, intriguing. It is: complicated (there are a lot of characters and they are so similar that they are hard to keep track off), meandering (many vignettes), wandering..."

author: b'Abby3211'
title: b'On the Same Level as HP 1'
body: b"As a member of the Harry Potter Generation, I am the perfect age to read JK Rowling. I was 9 when HP1 came out and now I'm 21 reading the Casual Vacancy. I think people need to remember that this is her 1st adult novel. It's a change and challenge for her. Much like HP1 started slow and finished strong I felt like this book was not easy to get into but I was riveted by the end. I fully expect JK Rowling to pen more adult novels and for her skills to flourish with each new book, just as they did with the HP Series."

author: b'K. Mater'
title: b'The book makes me think'
body: b"I read the book on my Kindle, and was a bit disappointed on the less than perfect editing (I found several instances where a parentheses was missing).  At first I had a hard time keeping all the characters straight, but as I read, it got easier and easier until I just 'knew' them.  I usually do not read books with main characters that I dislike, and this was a book where I did not like many of the characters... sometimes.  At other times I liked them best.  As I read, my allegience to various characters kept switching; and that is the point, right?  People are complicated and 3-D, not paper dolls, so even in my own life there are people I at first glance like or don't like, and later I change my mind."

author: b'Gerri'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Took a little while to get into the story, but I enjoyed the book and the story has stayed in my mind.'

author: b'HLH75'
title: b'Not what I was hoping for'
body: b"From Harry Potter to everyday life and small town scandal??  I expected more excitement or drama.  This is like watching a reality show that never leaves you hanging at the end of the episode.  Wonderfully written, but the content is not what I'd hoped.  I've found I can barely stick with it at times and when I do get back to it, I hope that it's about to get better...but I'm half-way through and it hasn't."

author: b'dlh'
title: b'snore'
