body: b"This book was hard to get through. About 1/3 of the way I thought about not reading further. I loved her Harry Potter books. I didn't expect the book to be anything like them but thought there would be some excitement to it. I hope she changes her style with adult books."

author: b'margaret'
title: b'The Casual Vacamcy-J.K. Rowlings'
body: b'The book started out slow because of the cast of characters but it was well written and keeps'

author: b'Gene'
title: b'Very disappointed'
body: b'I was extremely disappointed in the book. I had not read her previous books but several grandchildren had read them all. The book is marketed as an adult book, but I was not prepared for the sexual content or graphic descriptions of various characters less than perfect body parts.. I had planned to buy another copy as a gift for a friend recovering from surgery but will buy the latest John Grishom book instead. I am probably a quarter of the way through the book and will not bother to read more. I wish Amazon had a return policy like Costco. I would like to be able to return the Kindle book for a refund.'

author: b'Mary'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I thought the book was dark.  I read more than half of it and decided that I was done with it.  I just could not get into it.  It was centered around the death of one man from a brain aneurism and the people that surrounded him.  Boring for me. I was looking for more from J.K. Rowling, author of Harry Potter.'

author: b'Jenna'
title: b"I couldn't stop reading"
body: b"Great character driven story. Huge cast of characters and you'll know them better than your own family and neighbors by the end. Wish Barry didn't have to die. He may have been the only decent kind and selfless person in town."

author: b'Cathy Anne'
title: b'Casual Vacancy Not Casual At All'
body: b'Casual Vacancy is another of J.K. Rowling\'s achievements of fine writing.  The story is typically British and can be depressing as it follows the real life scenarios and secrets of people in small town life, however its depictions of the extents people will go through to get what they want are "spot on".  The ending is not happy, but realistic, predictable, but not a "formula" read.  If you are looking for a read that has a message - this is it.'

author: b'mollie'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'kind of hard to follow - too many characters.'

author: b'janice obrien'
title: b'gripping characters, dark story'
body: b'The characters are very vivid and the story slowly but surely draws you in.  It is a story that sticks with you but an dark tale.'

author: b'pigeon hunter'
title: b'Meh'
body: b'My title pretty much sums it up. I am a grumpy reader, I dont often find books I really very much like. Prior to reading this one, I read some King books that I barely enjoyed and some random library books I had never heard of which were mostly just about better than not reading anything at all. Unfortunatley Casual Vacancy fits right in with these.'

author: b'Michydog'
title: b"She's morphed into Joanna Trollop, shame"
body: b"So disappointed.  What led JK Rowling to think we all needed another Joanna Trollop.  Sadly the last two Harry Potter books became very rambling with long dialogue and little plot.  This follows in that vein.  I couldn't be bothered to wade through the stuff to actually wait for the plot to develop so I've given up reading when less than half way through."

author: b'lucky'
title: b'the casual vacancy'
body: b'Book of the year for me. So insightful and compassionate about the human condition whilst being a page turning unputdownable story at the same time. This is a novel that will stay with you for a long time after reading, and might just make you a better person.'

author: b'AnnabelSA'
title: b'A big disappointment'
body: b'With such a big build-up, perhaps it was inevitable that JK\'s first "adult" book would not live up to expectations, but the whole book reminded me of a "middle class EastEnders"! What an unrelenting story - not a smile or happy face to be seen and no appealing characters at all.  There were times I had to read out loud to understand the colloquial dialogue and you certainly do not want to be squeamish about bad language, a lot of which seemed to me to be gratuitous once characters are established.  I heard JK herself has said she \'doesn\'t care what people think\' which is a pity - she needs to listen to their comments perhaps before setting out on her next book as \'fame and fortune\' are notoriously fickle!'

author: b'CaraM'
title: b'Insightful read'
body: b'I enjoyed this book. It is very different than Harry Potter (as is to be expected), but I thought the characters were deep and interesting. They are often small-minded and petty, but their lives are woven together in a fascinating and compelling way. The end is a little heartbreaking but certainly memorable.'

author: b'Currer Bell'
title: b"We're not in Hogwarts anymore, so if you're looking for fantasy, look elsewhere"
body: b"Though at times overwrought, this is a skillful and moving novel which leaves the black and white morality of Harry Potter's universe far behind."

author: b'A. Savidge'
title: b"Don't waste your money."
body: b"I don't know if I can express how disappointed I am in this book.  I was really looking forward to what JK Rowling could do with an adult novel.  But this is not worth the time it takes to read it.  Her gratuitous use of profanity and crude situations, thoughts, etc.  is horrendous.  Teenage boys couldn't write something this bad.  Less than twenty pages in, she had dropped enough F-bombs (and other extremely crude language) to make a sailor blush.  and add to that, the is just plain boring.  I couldn't keep track of what was going on we'll enough to stay interested in the story.  I'm not finishing this book; I have better things to do with my time--like trimming my toenails or picking cat hairs off the sofa."

author: b'ozzy'
title: b'review'
body: b'It had a lot of people in the story and they all had knick-names and sometimes it was hard to follow.also the accent was hard to read at times.'

author: b'dmac'
title: b'great "Casual" read'
body: b"Had never read JKR work before so didn't have any preconceptions.  Loved her abillity to give succinct visual picture of characters.  Not a book that you 'can't put down' but a worthwhile read particularly for the female reader."

author: b'KatNorris'
title: b"Harry Potter it ain't...but..."
body: b'I didn\'t really know what to expect,  but I was not surprised by the plotting and writing style, for Rowling has proved her talent. This is NOT for kids or even teens, as the language and events were raunchy at times. But the story is a modern day morality tale about how we see the community around us, and how one person can make a huge difference in the lives of those who otherwise would fail, and how their loss can send a community into a tailspin,  ending in great loss, and in this case, great tragedy. We have to ask ourselves "Are we the solution to the problem, or are we the problem?"'

author: b'Beepa'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'HORRIBLE BOOK stick to Harry Potter!  I am trying so hard to get through this book and if it was not for the audio version I would have tossed this one BACK!BORING!'

author: b'Siberia'
title: b'Not worth my time'
body: b"I bought this book for my Kindle.  I tried to like it but it just didn't hold my interest. I finished it because I can't let a book half read. Let me tell you it took a long time and each time I picked it up I had to review who was who and how they related to each other. Needless to say, I will not be reading any future installments of this series."

author: b'L M'
title: b'Very unexpected'
body: b'Great story. The first third is a little slow but then the characters hook you. This story is so different from Harry Potter. It is not a feel good book but a commentary of judgemental people.'

author: b'J. Brooks'
title: b'Casual Expletives!'
body: b"After reading only a few pages, I decided this book was not worth my time, because (disappointingly) the author somehow found it impossible to form sentences that did not contain vulgarities and expletives.  She's such a talented writer that I had though she could form thoughts without crudities.  She must have a low opinion of the sensibilities of her readers to fall into such a trap."

author: b'Bev O'
title: b'Depressing and humorless'
body: b"I did read all of the Potter series and loved the books.  However, I was looking forward to reading a book by Rowling about adult issues and with adult themes.  This was a terrible disappointment.  She has a real skill in bringing characters to life, by why would one want to have these horrible, depressing people brought to life?  There was none of the humor to be found anywhere that saved the Potter books from being unrelentingly dark, especially toward the end of the series.  I was left depressed and unsatisfied.  I heard her say in an interview that it ends on a hopeful note, but even that's hard to find.  All in all, a real downer."

author: b'Mitzi Reinbold w/a Mitzi Flyte'
title: b'I must be a tad different....'
body: b'...than many of the these reviewers.'

author: b'ElizabethK'
title: b'Become enmeshed in village life'
body: b"I have never read any J K Rowling books prior to The Casual Vacancy as the 'Potter' genre does not interest me.  However, knowing how successful a writer she is, I thought I might give The Casual Vacancy a try.  I loved it.  I became totally enmeshed in village life, and could actually see, hear and smell the characters.  The poverty, mental illness, philandering, family violence, bullying and general angst are real facets of the tapestry of our everyday lives, but are often hidden from view.  The way this was woven into the story line was both empathetic and emotionally challenging.  I thoroughly recommend this book with it's raw and gritty characters - it's a bit like peaking behind the white lace curtains of the village neighbourhood - you just never know what really goes on in others' lives."

author: b'Clark'
title: b'Exceeded my expectations'
body: b"I have to admit that I was skeptical about this book.  I wasn't sure that J.K. Rowling could write a story for adults that would be worth reading.  I am glad to say that I was wrong.  It is a powerful story that will stay with you long after you read it.  It is obvious that J.K. Rowling really knew what she was writing about."

author: b'MatthewOaken'
title: b'Wonderful!'
body: b"Excellent peace of work from JK. She hasn't lost her touch at all. The book showed itself very interesting and I'm pretty sure every fan of the author will like it with no doubt."

author: b'Lynholly'
title: b'Disappoining...'
body: b'As a huge fan of the Harry Potter series, I anticipated this novel with great excitement and high hopes.  Regretfully, I have to say that it fell far short of my expectations. Although it\'s more literate than most soap operas, it\'s still a "potboiler" of a novel.  After a very slow, plodding, beginning, it builds into a somewhat engaging story, in which we find out what lies beneath the surface of the lives of the residents of a small English village.  I hope that one day Rowling will give us another novel in the fantasy genre, as I think that is where she truly shines!'

author: b'Ria'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'I saw a TV interview with Miss Rawlings and was interested to see what type of adult book she had written. From the interview I just decided to try the "sample" but ended up purchasing the full book.  It was a terrific read.  I was interested in the chararcters but must admit found it a little hard to keep up with who was who but in the end it all came together well.  I have told my friends and family about it and recommended they read it.'

author: b'jbkap930'
title: b'Starts Slow and Gradually Improves'
body: b'Its a very different J.K. Rowling book.  It starts off slow, then gradually gets more interesting, and then it was hard to put it down, so you could do something else.'

author: b'Meg'
title: b'Awful'
body: b"Dreadful, dreadful, dreadful.  I actually stopped reading in the middle and read another book.  I then came back to it thinking it couldn't continue to be awful straight to the end, because, after all, this is J.K. Rowling.  This is the author who gave us Harry Potter.  This year, she gave us a loser."

author: b'Amelia'
title: b'Amazing'
body: b"It's truly a masterpiece. I've seen a lot of negativity over the book, but when you judge it as a book, it succeeds in the most epic way. I usually hate books that lack some sort of plot. I like the action and the beginning to start as early as possible. And for me, it did in this book. No, there were not explosions and it lacked magic wands, but it had dynamic characters. I could not put the book down, and I would highly recommend the book to anyone who is willing to give it a shot and has a heart. I cried at the end, and I spent the last hundred pages wishing it was longer. Already, I didn't want to leave the deep and thoughtful characters Rowling brilliantly created. I imagine it wasn't easy for her to write a book like this, but there is no doubt in my mind that she pulled it off with elegant prose and such a light touch moving the plot, that it's like it's unfolding without her, and she's typing as quickly as she can to keep up. Wonderful."

author: b'bookworm'
title: b'Characters never came to life'
body: b'I read mixed reviews but approached reading the book with an open mind.'

author: b'Jeri L. Ovalle'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"None of her characters were likable. None of the story lines had anything remotely uplifting to them. The cursing seemed arbitrary and while I normally enjoy a book the expands my vocabulary, this time the choice of words often seemed as though she copied them from a thesaurus. Only Roget would have been familiar with some of the words. If you are hoping for a character to cheer for or a story that renews your faith in humanity, The Casual Vacancy ain't it!"

author: b'Jennifer Steele'
title: b'Lacks Plot'
body: b'Although this book is well written as one would expect, it lacks plot, and does not inspire any personal connection to one character.  While reading I felt as though I did not care about what happened to any of the characters; thus it was hard to get through.'

author: b'jjamieson39'
title: b'A little disappointed'
body: b'Book had a lot of characters so it took a while to learn and get use to the'

author: b'Janet Frischmon'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This book for me was a blunt look at how patriarchal values undermine human relationships. It presented this indictment in inviting you into the lives of people affected by not being truthful and conscious of how their words and actions can destroy people.  It made you care about the people in all their flaws but at the same time wish they would wake up to their responsibility to make their world better.  I would say this is an adult call to be responsible for how you are involved in politics and religion.'

author: b'Twinky'
title: b'Adequate, but not brilliant'
body: b"J.K. Rowlings is a good writer and this first try at an adult novel is entertaining, but not great literature.  It was difficult to follow all the characters and I had to keep paging back to remember who was who.  That said, it's a decent read and worth the time it takes to complete it."

author: b'goombay'
title: b'Very disappointed with JK Rowling'
body: b'Harry Potter fans need to stay away from this foul book! If you use the f- word regularly and look at porn you will have no problem with the book.'

author: b'cyndyloowhoo'
title: b'hard to follow'
body: b'Up until the end, I found it difficult to keep track of the abundant number of characters in this book.  The end seemed as though Rowling just ran out of ink.... Disappointing read.  I expected much better.'

author: b'lkelly9988'
title: b"Doesn't see to go anywhere"
body: b'I am still struggling through Casual Vacancy and am about 40% finish. I hate to say it because I really enjoyed Rowlings other work, but this book just seems to spin and go no where. I keep expecting it to have more of a plot, but so far, it is very 1 dimensional. That is so strange considering the mass of imagination shown in Harry Potter. Its like someone else wrote this book.'

author: b'Beach Addict'
title: b'A very depressig  book.'
body: b"This was one the most depressing books I have ever read, and it had none of the fun or imagination of the Harry Potter series. I will be very unlikely to read any of Ms. Rowling's future books."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I was disappointed, it jumped around from character to character with no real pattern. Perhaps I was expecting too much from her earlier works.'

author: b'Rob'
title: b'Interesting but a bit Lackluster'
body: b'I had hoped that Rowling would Wow me as she did with the Harry Potter series.  Unfotunately, though it was an interesting story, it came across as a bit lackluster.  The ending just stopped as if she was just tired of writing this story.'

author: b'ka'
title: b'Slow and boring'
body: b"Yawn!! I knew the book was going to be very different from the Harry Potter series. JK Rowlings writing  style has flowed in the past. Unfortunately in The Casual Vacancy too many characters, too many nicknames. Plot line drags on!! Don't think I will finish reading the book - which rarely has happened."

author: b'bible student'
title: b'Book in search of a reason'
body: b'I was quite disappointed in JK Rowlings "adult" book.  It seems her only ideas of what makes a book "adult" literature is to frequently use "adult" (crass, needless profanity) words at any opportunity and making sure every character is an unlikable, deeply flawed person. This was a book that didn\'t hold my interest and was hard to finish.  There was no plot to hold the reader\'s interest which is so unlike her prior writing.  Nothing moved this story along and I felt I was was just plowing through it.  It was both simply bad and boring, a sad combination.  Reading should be for pleasure or entertainement and this was neither for me.  Now I don\'t know what to do with the book; it\'s not worth saving and I don\'t want to inflict reading it on others.  This was a very disappointing book from an author with much more talent then she showed here.  Was she just trying to "stretch" herself into something she isn\'t?'

author: b'KateTall'
title: b'I had to force myself to finish this book'
body: b"I'm probably only one of two living human beings who has not read the HP series, so I have no preconceived notions about this author.  Having said that, I must say that I was very disappointed in the character development, style, and substance of this novel. I found myself neither liking nor caring about any of the characters, and my desire to finish this book was really impacted by this. I agree with another reviewer that the author seems to have thrown every imaginable social issue into this book - politics, domestic violence/abuse/neglect, drug usage,alcoholism, socioeconomic issues, teen angst - you name it, it's in there!  I did finish the book because I always do, and palmed it off to my niece with a very clear warning about how much I hated it.  I will be anxious to hear her opinion, since she's a JKR fan."

author: b'Martha Miller'
title: b"Couldn't finish it..."
body: b'Sorry, I tried to enjoy this book.  I started out with interest in how she would do in a different style of book, but I quickly started making comparisons to other authors, and this book came up lacking.  The further I got into the book the less interested I became in the characters, and the less interested I was in reading this book.  When I realized I was intentionally avoiding picking this up to continue reading it, I gave up.'

author: b'NoNameNecessary'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Not only is the book grim and depressing - it's only point seems to be that there is ugliness in life and, oh yeah, that Rowling knows how to curse and be coarse.  Save your money"

author: b'WRBill'
title: b'A very different JKR'
body: b'It goes without saying that this is a very different world from that of Harry Potter.  I would never have known it was by the same author.  But it is still very well written, and very shrewd in observation of adolescent thinking and relations of adolescents and adults.  The world is that of urban poverty, crime, and class politics - "hard boiled" it would have been called in the US 1940\'s.  Harry fans be warned!'

author: b'Joanne'
title: b'Not what one expects from J K Rowling'
body: b'This is difficult. On the one hand I assumed that her adult book would be as fantastically addictive as Harry Potter: on the other, she still writes well. However, the story deals with too many unlikeable characters so it was not easy to root for any of them.  They were all flawed in some way, and I kept hoping that one of them would somehow be redeemed!  Small town rivalries and teenage angst, unrequited love, and all of them undeserving of sympathy.  A tiny bit of Rowling humour crept in, and certainly not bad, but mostly it was a difficult book.  I hope she goes back to what she does best.  I do think that fans need to read this though.'

author: b'MikeB'
title: b'Ponderous and pedantic'
body: b"I bought this anticipating the same intensity and creativity that came from Harry Potter. Silly me, this is boring and heavy. If you aren't British, many things don't make sense. If it hadn't been Rowling, I would stopped after the first 50 pages or so. My advice to JKR?.. Stick to magic."

author: b'Pam Wiedenbeck'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy - a perception'
body: b'I expected more from this novel than I received. This is an attempt at very relevant social commentary on small town and rural England. As such, I think it fails to give the non-British reader a good grounding in the background of rural politics before launching into the social commentary.'

author: b'usuk.bilingual'
title: b'Very engaging'
body: b'I\'m about two-thirds of the way through this book and after a confusing start -- there are so many characters to keep track off -- I\'m having a problem putting it down! I grew up in England and am familiar with many of the very English expressions and words; "people carrier" for example which, in the US is a minivan. The personalities are very lifelike and help you understand how everyone has a story they keep hidden from everyone else. A good read!'

author: b'Diane Pollard'
title: b'Why would we want to know these people?'
body: b"Other reviewers have expressed my feelings more humorously and succinctly than I have the time or interest to do right now. Finally slogged to the end last night and totally missed whatever redemption there was. I'm not looking for frilly and frothy, but don't relish picking up rocks to look at the slimy mess underneath. I just led a book club discussion of Gillian Flynn's Gone Girl and loved the sick intricacies of Nick and Amy's relationship. Yes, we all have ugly thoughts and motivations and it's horrifying to see where they can lead."

author: b'prettywoman17'
title: b'Stick to childrens books!'
body: b"I am having a great deal of trouble reading this book. Maybe my expectations were too high because I loved the Harry Potter books. JK should stick with what she does best and that is childrens books!  I'm not sure I can even get halfway through this dull, boring book but I will try since I was dumb enough to buy it the day it came out."

author: b'Scott'
title: b'Not impressed'
body: b'This is not anywhere near the quality of the HP writing Rowling has done.'

author: b'kcr'
title: b'Characterization.. characterization.. characterization..'
body: b'First, I\'m not all the way through "The Casual Vacancy" but I feel as though I can make a well-informed honest review at this point. Here\'s my advice: Do NOT go into this book expecting 1) A CHILDREN\'S story; 2) Feel good, Dumbledore & Harry Save the Day stories; 3) Harry Potter. This is Rowlings first attempt at writing for ADULTS and she did a phenomenal job. Why did people love HP so much? The original storyline? No. We\'ve all heard/read stories of good vs. evil our entire lives... no originality there.. It was her characterization and the connections she made within those characters. It\'s the familiarity of those characters that made you fall in love. Every single book-nerdy girl felt like Hermione at times or awkward boy felt like Neville... we related to the characters, not the story. And "Vacancy" does not fail in that aspect. Am I loving the storyline? Not entirely, but I knew I wouldn\'t by reading the synopsis... it\'s just not my "style" of story but she\'s sucking me in anyway. She makes me love and hate those characters because I KNOW them.. they exist in my neighborhood, just like they exist in yours. She really brings the story to life IF you can put down your magic wand and use your grown-up brain. And yes, she uses the big four letter "c" word most famously used in "Atonement". Get over it. It\'s an adult novel.. there\'s bound to be some language & I\'m sure your teenage son as thought/said it at least once.'

author: b'Janine Rafferty'
title: b"It's no Harry Potter."
body: b"Having loved the Harry Potter series so much, I was somewhat disappointed in the book. For the first third of my reading, I'd pick up the book after a 2 or 3 day interval and have to figure out who all of the many, many characters were. By the end, the story pretty much came together, with many enjoyable parts, but I would not want to struggle with such a confusing cast of characters again. Also, since I am reading for pleasure I would enjoy more likable people."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Truth or dare'
body: b"It's as if someone dared J.K Rowling to write a book about the most mundane topic and still make it entertaining and engaging.  Unfortunately, as talented as she is, she did not quite pull this off.  The premise of this books was very boring and the characters were dull and egocentric.  She spent far too much time developing the multipe characters in this book.  If this is the first book in a series, this could make sense, but again, I would not want to read it.  Perhaps I expected too much of her considering the magical world she created in Harry Potter.  However, I think she could have done much better with an adult book, even one not set in fantasy."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Rowling'
body: b'Although by the time thatI finished this book I could say that I enjoyed it.  It took a long time to grab my attention.  It was not a book I could not put down.'

author: b'nwcustomer'
title: b'A book about humans and life itself'
body: b'J.K. Rowling\'s The Casual Vacancy to me was about everyday life and what humans go through.  It was very well written and I totally bought into the town and the characters.  There was no fantasy in this book.  You could go into almost any town in the world and come away with these raw human emotions.  I liked how she reminded all of us that people are not always what them seem.  People turn out the way they are due to their youth circumstances and whether or not they are surrounded by loved ones or people who really care what happens to them in this world. It\'s also about how small minded people can be when their egos get in the way. I definitely suggest reading this novel.  I think that we all were "curious" of what Ms. Rowling would come up with after the huge success of Harry Porter, but I find it absolutely ridiculous that this book and the HP series be compared.  That would be like comparing apples and oranges.  Looking forward to her next book!'

author: b'James Harrington'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Rowling is terrific in her debut adult novel.  A little like an English Peyton Place with more sophistication.  Her characters come alive and are real when we consider the dark part of our own hearts.'

author: b'Charles E. Jeffries'
title: b'Disappointing Work'
body: b'Like most who read and were absorbed in the Harry Potter series, I had high hopes for Rowling\'s first "adult" novel. Unfortunately, she did not deliver.  I found "Casual Vacancy" very slow going, the character relationships muddled, the plot mind-numbingly heavy and slow, the language often offensive, and overall, the tone of the book was just plain depressing.  Not recommended.  Wish I had my money back.'

author: b'grandma'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This book took time to get into and felt like a long read.  It seemed hard to connect with and I had to make myself keep reading.  Predicted alot that was going to happen.'

author: b'D. Eko'
title: b'Okay'
body: b'I was so looking forward to this book.  Unfortunately, I found it boring and never finished.  I am sure some readers will love it as there are different tastes in reading material.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Dull & Tedious.'
body: b'Tedious diatribe promoting class warfare.  She should stick to fantasy. This is not up to her usual standards.  Hope she will learn from this and do what she does best.take us into another magical world.'

author: b'blackjack47'
title: b'winner of most boring'
body: b'She should have stayed with Harry Potter. I can put this book down for a week and not miss it.  Boring!!!!!!!!!!!'

author: b'Carole from Saline'
title: b'Not worth reading'
body: b'I had to struggle to get through this book.  Although the social message was clear, the book as fiction was boring and poorly written.'

author: b'Laura N. Venhaus'
title: b"We're not in Hogwarts anymore..."
body: b'If you\'re expecting a Harry Potter for adults and will be satisfied with nothing less, don\'t buy this book.  The Casual Vacancy is a well written novel populated by depressed, angry, trapped, betrayed and disappointed characters and it offers a startling glimpse into life in England that is rarely seen by starry-eyed anglophiles. The language is definitely "adult" as are the situations Rowling describes.  This book covers sexual abuse, petty crime, methadone clinics and all stops in between. It is not a cheerful book, it is not a happy book, but it is an intriguing book and it makes me anxious to see where Rowling will go next.'

author: b'rwm'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I have read all the HP series, several times, seen the movies several times. I looked forward to JK trying something different but I find the book very tedious and boring - I have had it for nearly two weeks and haven't even made it to page 100 and probably won't. If it were a library book, I would return it. I will try to slog through it but I don't think I will change my opinion. If she wants to write mysteries, try in the vain of Nancy Drew or the Hardy Boys, she writes about kids very well."

author: b'2thklnr'
title: b'Big Disappointment'
body: b'The author should have stuck with the style of writing she did with Harry Potter. The book seems to go nowhere for several chapters and even then you want to say what was the point.'

author: b'Nancy'
title: b'Awesome!'
body: b"This story captures your interest from the get go! It starts with an unexpected death and dives right into the lives & people surrounding this death in a little village in England. I can't put it down!!!"

author: b'DebG'
title: b'The casual Vacancy'
body: b"I was extremely disappointed in this book.  The language was very offensive.  I wouldn't recommend itto anyone.  I expected more from her and was looking forward to her new book with great anticipation"

author: b'Robert L Casanova'
title: b'Yawn'
body: b'As much as I wanted to love this book, I just could not find anything to like about it. It was boring.'

author: b'Allium'
title: b'More magic from JKR'
body: b'Despite the grim subject matter, JKR manages to weave her magic yet again, with an engrossing story set in "small-town" UK. Jo has great insight into human nature and uses her astute observations to create disturbingly authentic characters. Despite disliking most of the villagers of Pagford and the Fields,I was still compelled by their stories. I am an incorrigible optimist, so despite the tragic ending of the novel, I felt encouraged that at least some of these fictional interpersonal relationships were redeemed. I look forward to more adult novels from this discerning writer.'

author: b'Emma Parker'
title: b'I tried hard to like it... but I failed'
body: b"I, like any other reviewers here, LOVED the HP series. The writing itself was fine - nothing spectacular, but it was the story, the fabulous story, that drew us all in. I was very excited to read her first novel for adults. Sadly, I feel as if I am still waiting for it... and I've read The Casual Vacancy. It was obvious to me from about page 2 that I wasn't going to be thrilled by it. I quickly began to recognize sentence structures lifted straight out of HP, the language level felt 'dumbed down', and twists in the plot are dealt with in a very similar way as in HP. Admittedly I am an editor, but I wasn't looking for these things. I was actively trying NOT to see them because I loved HP so much... but they just leapt off the page and slapped me in the face. And unfortunately, unlike with HP, the storyline didn't make up for the poor writing techniques."

author: b'Dave Morrin'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'I would recommend others to purchase to read. The picturesque village of Pagford is not what it seems. When a vacancy comes up on the parish council the layers start to unravel.'

author: b'Garry'
title: b'Disappointing work from a truly gifted story teller'
body: b'Let me admit 2 things.  First off, I wanted to read this book because of its author (I love her command of language and imagery, as well as her understanding of and ability to create people/characters).  Secondly, I did not finish the book (or even come close).'

author: b'P. G. Thornell'
title: b'An excellent but challenging book'
body: b"Rowling can certainly write, and I think this is a great though sobering story. The only difficulty is that there really aren't any redeeming characters here. It's quite a cynical world view coming from someone who wrote so exceptionally about good versus evil in the HP series. The second half moves much faster than the first, and though I still think there were a few too many characters overall, she pulled everything together by the end. Now I just have to wait for her next book."

author: b'R PRIUS'
title: b'Strangers In A Familiar Place'
body: b"Forget Harry Potter. J.K. Rowling has already proven herself to be an excellent writer. She is descriptive and thoughtful when parsing her words, but I just didn't love this book. For me, The Casual Vacancy is a lackluster book that is for adults and plays to a very different audience. It deals with a ton of adult issues that are cringe worthy as it traverses life in a small english town and the often perverse characters who live there. It has profanity which is a good sign that this is for oldsters or the over 18 crowd.. This book suffers from a melodramatic and soapy plots that have a predictable endings. The characters are often unlikeable and even despicable. Suffice to say that I didn't really care much for the characters who were as nasty as the subject matter."

author: b'Mockingjay'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Very disappointed!  I knew it was supposed to be somewhat "dark", but  it  is totally depressing.  I guess I really liked her writing style in her original series and this is so different and not anything I would recommend to people in my reading circle.  Sorry Ms. Rowling.'

author: b'Jane Kreuter'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I found this book to be disjointed and hard to follow and the contents depressing.  I kept waiting for the story to come together and become more cohesive but it never happened.  The storylines of the characters were too long as the book switched back and forth to the characters.  I was disappoointed.'

author: b'Constance E. Mollo'
title: b'Casual Vacancy review'
body: b'At first; I did not like the story; however, I found the author engaging and the more I read the more I became hooked on pursuing the story.  I gave it a 4 because the writng was excellent however not necessarily my usual type of novel.'

author: b'Writepaul'
title: b'A Ripping Good Read!'
body: b"Ms. Rowling's previous well known output had no bearing at all on the pleasures to be found in The Casual Vacancy.  I found The Casual Vacancy to be a psychological page turner.  I couldn't wait for each additional detail to be revealed about her score or so of richly drawn, credible and complex characters.  Her portrait of adolescent turmoil and miscalculation is every bit as astute and compelling as her portrait of a decades on marriage.  I preordered the book out of curiosity and was richly rewarded. Knowledge only makes me a fan."

author: b'Penelson'
title: b'Casual Vacacy'
body: b'Struggled through it.  Ms. Rowling built a large cast of disfunctional characters in her little township.  The ending made you wonder why you even cared what happens to them.'

author: b'Avid reader'
title: b'Cannot believe how awful this book is!!'
body: b"Having waited patiently for this wonderful author's next undertaking I am utterly disappointed. I have struggled through about 40% of this book and I am still wondering what the point of the whole thing is. It is the MOST BORING piece of fiction I have ever read. Don't think I can even finish it!"

author: b'Cheryl Keeler'
title: b'It was a good read.'
body: b'Not what i expected. hard to follow at first with all the characters.   better once the story gets going forward'

author: b'Haircuts'
title: b'Dark and dreary!'
body: b"I don't even know where to start..... so I'll make this short and not so sweet. NOT a very good book. JKR spent too much time describing the characters. I kept waiting for something to happen to get me interested but it didn't, until the very end. Don't waste your time unless you have absolutely nothing else to do!!!"

author: b'Sarah'
title: b"No magic of any kind in this book, I wouldn't recommend it."
body: b"This is a grim story about the lives of people that hold little or no interest to anyone.  The book needed magic, not the magic in the Harry Potter series, but the magic that brings a story into the hearts of it's readers.  This books is about the pettiness of people, the useless efforts of others fill the space left by the death of a irreplaceable person, and the shameful way this person is remembered in the lives of the heartless people in his community.  What a waste of time to read, and a waste of talent of the writer."

author: b'J. M. Stewart Lechler'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'J K Rowling is amazing! Her ability to intertwine the lives of a community, the haves and have nots, yet show no judgement on either side was just brilliant.'

author: b'CS in Clifton'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I admit it.  I didn't finish the book. And I generally finish all the books I read. I will try at some point ... probably during the summer ... to wade through this book. Part of the problem is the disappointment that this book does not live up to the storytelling reputation of Rowling. Adults must also be entertained. Page after page introducing various characters. Bits and pieces of information that I assume will be important eventually. Then finally the characters begin to interact. Still, there is no hook. There is no one to pull for.  There is no one to like. They are all depressed and depressing. I was pulling for Rowling. Like I said, I'll check back here someday. But I'm not thrilled with the idea.  I'm being generous with two stars."

author: b'Kaslo'
title: b'Bored'
body: b"Sorry, but I didn't finish the book. It did not hook me in. In fact I found most of it rather boring. What is the story line anyway."

author: b'A Cat'
title: b'I kindly suggest not to read this book.'
body: b"This goes particularly to all Harry Potter fans. You're allowed to love Rowling as much as you want to, but please, if you haven't already: do not read this book."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'boring!'
body: b"I found the book boring and didn't finish it! Not enough character.development or dialogue. Lots of slow descriptions that just didn't keep me interested."

author: b'Juda64'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'To be honest I\'m a little disappointed.  After the huge successes of her childrens books I may have been expecting too much?  I found it very slow to start and even at the halfway mark I was still waiting for it to "takeoff".  There were also a lot of different characters introduced very early on and I found it difficult to keep up with who\'s who\'s.  In saying all that, it hasnt put me off and I would try another of her books if she puts another out in the future.'

author: b'I. M. Sam'
title: b'Come back, Harry Potter!'
body: b"In my opinion, Ms. Rowling should have stuck with children's literature."

author: b'Mingtangyu'
title: b'A waste of money'
body: b'Like all the other Harry Potter fans, I pre-ordered this book and anticipated reading it. Sadly when it arrived and I started reading, I waited page by page to see when any event, character or setting would call out to me to make me read on. There was none. The characters were all flawed but uninspiring. At best, this novel is a documentary of a dysfunctional small town. The author was right when she said that her success with the HP books afforded her to write a novel the critics may not like.  I would say with good reason! such a disappointing book from a talented author.'

author: b'Yug'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'I was disappointed in this book, although as one would expect it is very well written.'

author: b'M. E. Bertolini'
title: b'Casual Vacancy is neither casual nor vacanr'
body: b"J.K. Rowling engages readers in her first novel for adults. One of the most engaging aspects of this novel is Rowling's keen insight into the dark world of the mind of adolescents."

author: b'Karin E. Phaneuf'
title: b'EXCEPTIONAL!'
body: b'JK Rowling has done it again. She\'s so "on it" in her character description and story telling. She has, once again, crawled into the heads and hearts of the characters she writes about, especially the teenagers. Wonderful tale, and an honest portrayal of the lives we live and the complicated situations that make us who we are. BRAVO! Well done.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Rowling continues to deliver a quality product'
body: b"I loved it.  Rowling vests ordinary people with ordinary failings, then creates a story one can't put down.  It will make a good movie."

author: b'JADE'
title: b'THOUGHTS ON CASUAL VACANCY'
body: b'I HAD TO QUIT READING THIS AS IT SEEMED TO BE REPITIOUS  I REALLY LOVED J.K.ROWLINGS OTHER SERIES AND I KNEW IT WAS A DIFFERENT DIRECTION FOR THIS BOOK.  I WISH SHE WOULD GO BACK TO WHERE HER REAL TALENTS LIE.. I WILL WATCH FOR HER NEXT BOOK...'

author: b'Sarah'
title: b'I am not sure this book bridges the ocean'
body: b"I was looking forward to reading JK Rowling's venture into the adult literature area.  As a librarian I know what her books did for young adult/juvenile literature.  There are many social mores I don't understand in Casual Vacancy because the Brits appear to be much more caste conscious although not as conscious as color of skin."

author: b'Sid F Starr'
title: b'Addictive Soap'
body: b"Coronation Street in the West Country? I loved it because it felt like Taunton, Yeovil (Yarvil in the book?) and Bridgewater where I grew up. Intriguing characters that are contrasted with one another, some are transports from the world of HP. For me it ended abruptly and I'm not sure which characters I'd like to follow if JKR revisits Pagford. As pure entertainment, my Kindle copy is value for money."

author: b'Lauren'
title: b'Not Another Potter Novel'
body: b"Like all of the other reviews say, this book contains foul language, is written from the perspective of a dozen or so deeply flawed characters, and in many portions is horribly graphic when it comes to drug use, incest, rape, violence, and neglect. It is, however, masterfully written and tastefully done. There is not a single instance of violence for the sake of violence, and every page propels the story further. The novel is, however, more than five hundred pages long, so don't expect the classic build-up, climax, conclusion. The story ends without any great resolution and there certainly isn't a classic happily-ever-after."

author: b'Jonathan'
title: b'Give it a chance'
body: b"No, it's not as good as Harry Potter. Is it bad? Also no. Give The Casual Vacancy a chance. Just pretend that it wasn't written by J.K. Rowling and evaluate the book on its own merits. I genuinely liked it, because Rowling's strong point will always be character creation."

author: b'blueleprd_74'
title: b"Not Harry Potter and It's not meant to be Harry Potter"
body: b"This book is very good. I've seen a lot of people complain because it isn't like Harry Potter. However, the end of the Harry Potter series became very dark and issues were raised that people generally turn away from. I think The Casual Vacancy has raised similar issues and people need to stop turning away from them."

author: b'oliver'
title: b'depressing'
body: b'Was looking forward to the release, but disappointed in the book. Started reading while on vacation but could not hold my interest. Very sad and dis-functional family sort of thing. Big disappointment.'

author: b'casa'
title: b'Not a fan'
body: b'I started reading the book and got about 6% in (reading on Kindle) but ended up stopping.  I am a huge Harry Potter fan and was so excited when I heard J.K. Rowling was coming out with a new book, but it turned out to be a bit of a disappointment.  I knew this book wasn\'t a "kiddie" novel, but the amount of foul language and vulgar content still took me by surprise.  She\'s such a good writer with out all of that, so I just don\'t see the need.  Maybe the story would have gotten more interesting if I had continued reading, but I had had enough by 6% and didn\'t care to find out.'

author: b'longtimereader'
title: b'disapointed'
body: b'I had no expectations.  I was sure it would be nothing like the Harry Potter series, so in that I was not surprised.  I was suprised however at how hate-full of a story it was.  I hated every minute of reading it, yet I kept reading because I wanted just one good thing to happen.  If JK Rowling writes another book, I will read it, but I am sorry I read this one.'

author: b'Vicki Mock'
title: b'Mildly disappointing.'
body: b"I guess because of all the hype I was expecting a great book.  I found it average, a little slow in spots, but about half way thru it drew me in.  If another author had written this book I would enjoyed more, perhaps because I won't have had such hight expections."

author: b'M from California'
title: b'So disappointed I could cry'
body: b'I love the Harry Potter books. Rowling has managed to create an entire world about wizards and make it believable with a story that gripped you. When I heard that she was finally writing a book for adults, I expected that the same wonderful storytelling would be there without the restraints of writing for children. Unfortunately, I was wrong.'

author: b'Happyreader'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Our bookclub chose this book based on J K Rowling's past successes. It began alright, shaping up to perhaps be funny and ironic, but it slid into just plain dark. Most characters were disturbed, or possessed or evil. There was nothing uplifting about the book, which didn't credit anyone with any spirit of human kindness, and it left me feeling slightly ill. I have recommended to friends that even if they have purchased the book, dump it, don't read it, and just consider it a bad investment."

author: b'Piecemaker'
title: b'I miss you, Harry'
body: b'I have read all Harry Potter books two times, and i thoroughly enjoyed them. I needed to read this book even after reading the reviews. The reviewers seemed concerned about the use of the "f" word. I read all the time, and that didn\'t even show up on my radar. My problem with the book was that I really did not care for any of the characters so I could care less about what was happening to them. I only finished the book because I had started it. I have to say I was disappointed. I hope Rowling will write another book with characters like Harry,Rob, and Hermoine(my personal favorite) in an unknown world. Harry Potter was magical.'

author: b'Franci Hurley Corr'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I did not read The Harry Potter series but of course I knew of their success.  I was very interested to read a novel of hers and loved The Casual Vacancy.  It was descriptive, clear, easy to follow with complex characters and fabulous story line.  I have reccomended it and always will!  One of my faves :)'

author: b'Cora A. Victorine'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'THe book had too many characters. The plot was very diverted into many little areas specific to the characters. All the characters were not likable or important. Sex and violence seemed to be thrown in for the sake of commercialism or to draw interest of the reader but failed. I was very disappoointed in this book.'

author: b'love2read'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Rowling went from genius to garbage. I wish I had read a critique about this book before I wasted my money. Very seldom do I purchase a book and not try to read the whole thing. It was going from bad to worse and then I read a review and realized this was not for me. I hope she does better with her next book but I will never purchase another one of hers without some idea about what it contains. A real stinker. I hate to give it even one star.'

author: b'Bookworm'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'The book was slow, to many characters and not one I truly cared about. I think it may have been a political statement of our times but I am not sure.  Ms Rowling is a really good writer of action,fantasy fiction that transcends age groups.  I am sorry she left that genre and tried something new. I would not recommend it.'

author: b'cstodo'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"For us in the U.S. I found it a bit hard to follow at times.  I also felt there was no real end to the story.  Maybe the more accurate way to tell this is that I felt it was just a bunch of odd stories all different, but tied together, but not in a way that made a whole lot of sense.  It was slow going and I guess I just expected more from J.K.  Yes, it was a story, but I got bored with it very quickly.  No, I didn't expect Harry, but I felt there should be more depth to some of the characters and they were just so predictable.  No suspense or mystery to it."

author: b'M.'
title: b'wonderful story telling'
body: b'Casual Vacancy is a slice of British life,  the good and the bad, with lifelike characterization portrayal.  An example of great story telling; taking the death of one individual and creating a world from the ripple effects of that death.  What imagination. A world that is not always pretty.  The story seamlessly draws you in and before you realize, you are caring about everyone.  The subtle underlying  commentary of how the system works ( it could just as easily be set in America) because the story works.'

author: b'Timothy Allard'
title: b'great book'
body: b'The story was great.  She paints a very believable and poignant story.  I felt like I was there going through it with them. Its definately a book I will pass on and read again.'

author: b'cindy'
title: b'A casual vacancy'
body: b'It was interesting and the characters intermingled, but as a whole, the story was depressing and felt "dark". Maybe that was the intent, but it wasn\'t what I thought it would be like. Disappointed!'

author: b'saphire1043'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'After a few pages I started writing down the names and what they did to help keep track of the story line.  I was very disappointed in the story.  I read approximately 60 pages and gave up.  The story just did not grab me.'

author: b'P. J.'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'I\'m a big fan of J. K. Rowling and looked forward to her first adult book: not sure I\'ll buy another. I wasn\'t engaged at all until well past the first third of the book and even then I had no trouble at all putting it down. Because I didn\'t get caught up in the story I had trouble keeping the characters straight and this was extremely irritating. I finished the book only because it was J. K. Rowling and I thought maybe it would straighten out. It didn\'t.  Originally from the UK I understood the words that were uniquely British so I don\'t know what difference that made to readers who didn\'t know their meaning. I suppose because I read all the Harry Potter books that I expected a page turner with lots of action and vivid characters. This book has a small plot - a man dies leaving an empty seat on the town council that must be filled, and tells a slice of the lives of the people involved. There is no, or very slow, advancement of the "plot" and no action to speak of, although Rowling employs subjects that involve children, a cause near and dear to her heart I understand, including the dark issues of self-mutilation, rape, poverty, addiction, abuse, etc. These are all awful things that need to be addressed but I\'m not sure this is the proper venue, certainly not for me, or perhaps not in the way they were presented. A more intense and suspenseful story might have worked. I struggled hard to read this book in its entirety but perhaps that is because this is not the type of book I usually read. If Rowling\'s future adult books run along the same vein, then she will have lost me as a reader. I don\'t want causes in a novel I read for entertainment. I want entertainment and I\'m sorry to say this book was disappointingly boring.'

author: b'Sub Mom Wife'
title: b'YUCK'
body: b'This book was dark and full of sex drugs and violance.  There seemed to be no point.  I kept forcing myself to read this book hoping against hope that something would happen or I would feel some enlightment.  But in the end it just quit.  I would not recommend this to anyone.'

author: b'Jasmeen Malhotra'
title: b"It's no Harry Potter... but it's definitely J K Rowling"
body: b'(Yes, I read all seven HP books.)'

author: b'J Brown'
title: b'Not real pleased'
body: b'I kept wanting something good to happen and everything in this book kept going downhill. Maybe I just like a happy ending or at least someone to have a happy ending.  Not a big fan of total depression.'

author: b'Jean Hamilton'
title: b'Not Harry Potter but excellent'
body: b"I really enjoyed The Casual Vacancy. Ms. Rowling is a master at defining her characters. One really gets a feeling of living in a small village and how everyone's lives  are intertwined. There are far reaching consequences for everyone's actions."

author: b'Harold Mosher'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I found the book to be somewhat interesting.  The story flowed and I was able to keep tract of the characters.  At times, the vocabulary was a bit too flowery.  It seemed more like a narrative of the social classes rather than a novel.'

author: b'runladyrun'
title: b'Excellent read!'
body: b'If you like Maeve Binchy or authors such as Rosamund Pilcher (which I do) yet hunger for something a little less vapid you will love this book.  Similar to Binchy and Pilcher, Rowling uses a small village as a backdrop and bases her novel on the relationships woven among its inhabitants.  However, Rowling seems to infuse more colour, depth and realism into her characters. Some are crude but so are many in real life.  Harry Potter was a brilliant children/youth series but to try and compare this to that is a most unfair comparison.  This should stand alone and be judged on its own merits.'

author: b'samiread'
title: b'Seriously boorish'
body: b"There is absolutely no intrigue, interest, or creativity in this book.  You could get the same amount of entertainment in picking up the newspaper or turning on the news.  Very disappointing for previous fans - the writing doesn't come close to holding your attention.  Content is distastful without providing any necessity to storyline.  Editors should provide better guidance.  Maybe sticking with fantasy would be better........"

author: b'reader'
title: b'Middling'
body: b"If it weren't by Rowling, I probably wouldn't have purchased it. The characters are unattractive. Her prose is a bit overdone--somehow it worked better in a magical world. Nonetheless, I have to say that it kept me reading."

author: b'Bama Grandma'
title: b'Anxious to read...'
body: b'After reading the Harry Potter series to my grandchildren, I was anxious to read and explore her adult writing.  Sadly, I was disappointed and quit reading after several chapters.  I began at the beginning at least three times, thinking I was missing something, but it never caught my attention and curosity.  To me, it was slow.  I am keeping it in my Kindle to give it another try at some other point in time.'

author: b'archmandrate'
title: b'Fine book, but done before'
body: b"I've read enough British books about class with multiple POVs to feel I can say while Rowling does a good job balancing the characters, ultimately I didn't feel like there was anything really new here.  If you want to read about a similar topic, but Ina more original manner, read Zadie Smith's WHITE TEETH."

author: b'clee'
title: b'Not a Casual read'
body: b"If you were expecting another Harry Potter type book from J.K.Rowling you will be very disappointed after reading the first page of this book. Lucky for me I did not buy the book with those expectations. This is very much a modern story and the language is rough and blunt as are the views of life and people. There were times while reading that I wanted to never read another word of it because of the cursing and raw descriptions of peoples actions. It made me uncomfortable. That said it is a good book and sometimes a reader needs to be made uncomfortable because there are people that think and talk and act like the people in the book. That's why I read, to expand my awareness. So, buy the book and if it sometimes makes you uncomfortable, ask yourself why."

author: b'Meridien'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'This book was an incredible disappointment.  I tried to read it five times because of who the author is and just fially gave up in boredom. I have learned to never preorder again.  She has anounced she is writing no more adult novels because of the poor reception.  Too late to get my  money back from her'

author: b'paula glover'
title: b'Not up to snuff'
body: b"I realize I'm going against the grain on this one, but I'm not thrilled at all with the Casual Vacancy. I think the writing is rough and I'm not particularly interested in the sex lives of young boys. I gave up mid-way through, although I may force myself to finish it."

author: b'Joop'
title: b'unpleasant people'
body: b'This book is well written and the characters are quite believable. Unfortunate, none of the characters are pleasant or likable which makes the book rather dour.'

author: b'Donna M Smith'
title: b'Boring'
body: b"Boring characters and story, just couldn't even get interested. I couldn't wait for this book because I loved Harry Potter books and I sincerely tried to give this a fair chance but the dry characters and uninteresting storyline just completely turned me off."

author: b'Marjie L. Schoonmaker'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'too many charcaters, hard to follow'

author: b'N. Kilts'
title: b'Prophetic Title-The Casual Vacancy-it was both-too casual and too vacant'
body: b'I bought and loved all 7 Harry Potter novels, therefore was very dissapointed in this new endeavor of JK Rowling\'s The Casual Vacancy. With the Harry Potter novels being geared towards children and teens, it was amazing the depth and breadth JK Rowling maintained through each book and all subsequent books tied up wonderfully to the very end. I am an adult in my 60\'s, and anticipated her "adult" novel to have the same depth and even further enhancement of a powerful story line. The plot is boring and the story line drags along endlessly. I haven\'t "invested" any connection to the characters, not even enough to keep the names straight as to who is who. I bought it well over 2 months ago and yet been inspired to finish it. I won\'t give you a plot summary as you can read that on Amazon\'s review. I was amazed to see it listed as No.1 on the New York Times bestseller\'s list. I\'m sure it is selling purely on the strength of her previous works.'

author: b"'Classical' Texan"
title: b'Avid reader'
body: b'I am a J.K. Rowling fan--at least until this book.  From the beginning, I could sense that this book was going to be a "downer", however, I was determined to give it the attention I felt it deserved.  I read the entire book, and there was not a single scene that made me feel good.  The characters were self-centered, selfish, dishonest, and downright mean--teens and adults alike!  The situations, while probably true-to-life, were depressing and dark.  When I finished the book, I was in a royal \'funk\' for a couple of days just thinking about it.  Maybe that is the sign of a good book (having the reader \'think\' about it afterwards) but I didn\'t like feeling that way.  Unless you enjoy reading dark and depressing stories, you better steer clear.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Ok'
body: b'A little complicate in the beginning , a fast but interest ending. The bulling came at any age at any time and the result are ........'

author: b'Janice Mac'
title: b'Seriously mean'
body: b'Does Ms Rowling lilke people? The characters were well developed but thoroughly icky. The kids were worse than the parents and the parents were pretty nasty.'

author: b'windiswish'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Segmented and confusing, lots of uncommon "English phrases" used that muddled the authors descriptions and intent. Slow moving. Did not entice familiarity with characters.'

author: b'Shirl'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b"It was a downer.  My husband finished the book, also thought the same thing.  I didn't finish the book.  Would"

author: b'Ray F'
title: b'Reading JKR'
body: b'She should stick to writing childrens books. I did not like the book at all.Too wordy With a lot of swearing to try and make it an adult book.Bad characters and a weak plot.'

author: b'N. Boer'
title: b"Don't trust the hype; decide for yourself"
body: b'Just thought I would contribute my 2c:'

author: b'R. M. Pauly'
title: b'what a disappointment'
body: b'After the epic adventure of the Harry Potter novels, I am appalled at the lack of interest generated by such negative characters in this novel. They are not even evil enough to be interesting; just repulsive.'

author: b'J. Robinette'
title: b'gossip kills'
body: b"I enjoyed this book, however, I found it to be terribly gloomy and slow in some areas. The characters and the dialogue reminded me of the small town where I grew up. Constant gossiping and lack of respect for one another. I can't say that I would recommend it to another."

author: b'R. Stiltskin'
title: b"Don't expect fantasy"
body: b"One thing JK Rowling does well is characters, and here is a great example. When the Harry Potter series finished it left me wanting more mature fantasy - as the series had become book after book. Just compare the first one to the last! But even though this book doesn't fulfil those desires, it's still a great read and gives us a very absorbing insight into the more remarkable parts of a seemingly normal community, one any one of us could inhabit now! For those of you ready for the next step in Fantasy, and thus left wanting by this, I would suggest China Miville, Walter Moers or the little known J. Alastair Nash."

author: b'Nicole'
title: b'Good reading'
body: b"I don't agree with the  harsh comments I've been reading about this book: JKR has captured the claustrophobic atmosphere of small town England, with the accents and all, depending on the character's age & social rank."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'A one-time read'
body: b'A well-written book, but I will never read it again, and that\'s what separates this novel from those that I love.  I like to be able to identify with, or at least like, a minimum of one character in a book.  The only seemingly likeable character in this novel appears to be the one that dies immediately. I just don\'t enjoy books that shove "reality" and the sad state of human nature in my face.  I get plenty of that in daily life, and I read to escape or to become enlightened in some way. The overall feeling this book leaves me with is despair, and so... it\'s time to read more Terry Pratchett!'

author: b'RG in OK'
title: b'Great book for grown ups!'
body: b'I loved the theme of the book and thought it was skillfully developed through insightful character development.  I recommend this book for adult readers.  It is not for kids.'

author: b'Dorothy Gillen'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'TOO bad I have to rate this book.  I did not want to give it one star.  I did not like it at all, I am sorry I bought it.  I tried to get through  the book, but maybe I am too old.  Loved the Harry Potter series.  This was a big disappointment.  Waste of money.'

author: b'Holly Moon'
title: b'Terrific!'
body: b"I am so into JK's writing style. I would recommend this book to any lovers of the Harry Potter books. Just not for the young ones, but most teens have heard any and all of the adult stuff in this book."

author: b'Crazy Dog Lady'
title: b'HP fan. Not so much CV'
body: b'Quite disappointed in this book. Expected much more from Ms. Rowling. Her imagination from HP was sadly missing as she brought us a barrage of small town drama, predictably starting with a tragedy and ending with more tragedy.'

author: b'Patrick Newton'
title: b"Couldn't even finish it"
body: b"Not at all what I expected.  Can't believe it was written by JK Rowling.  I wasn't looking for Harry Potter, but never expected this either."

author: b'Emily Mowery'
title: b'Yawn'
body: b"I'll be honest, I only read the first 21 pages, but it was boring. Worse than that, the personalities and lives she was creating seemed insincere."

author: b'R. Estes'
title: b'Terribly disappointed'
body: b'I love to read books where the characters are three dimensional people that you would recognize on the street.  Sadly this book is not one of them.  The writing is flat, unimaginative and boring.  If you must read it, borrow it from the library.  I felt it was a waste of the money.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Complex personality interactions'
body: b'This is not so bad as the critics said.  The personalities and interactions centered around the activities of the council and local power struggles are quite interesting.  The children in the story are very interesting, and the various venalities of the adults get appropriate comeuppance.  The tragedies are appropriate commentary on the world as it is.'

author: b'Alice M. Glover'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Pure garbage....even though we were told for adults only....even adults have a limit..Maybe in Other countries this acceptable...but I would'

author: b'me'
title: b'written for uk residents'
body: b'I am sure if I lived in uk I would get it. it reads like a standard english mystery novel so I keep waiting for someone to show up dead under mysterious circumstances but that never happens. could not finish the book and I HATE to leave books unfinished.'

author: b'Maynard M. Mitchell'
title: b'reading off'
body: b'It was not exciting and it ran on and on. He tried to make the book like everyday life and I was boared stiff.'

author: b'tenaj'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'J.K. Rowling needs to stick with her Harry Potter books.  I did not enjoy this one at all.  She does not seem to have a good plot and I lost interest about 1/4 way through the book.'

author: b'E. A. Taylor'
title: b'Tedious'
body: b'A big disappointment . The plot is lost in the never ending discriptions of place and characters.  few memorable characters , and it was hard to keep up with who is who. The plot is weak and silly.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'It is difficult for me to review this book.  I never cease to be amazed at Rowling\'s talent.  Theme and Characters were very complex.  My problem was that I could never really get into it.  I finished the book, but I could have easily quit at any point and put it back on the shelf. There were no characters in the book that I liked or respected.  For me it was just sort of "blah".'

author: b'Ellen R.'
title: b"J.K. Rowling's different type of writing!"
body: b'Disappointed in the story, character flow until 3/4 of the way through the book. After enjoying the exceptional Harry Potter books, perhaps my expectations were too high.'

author: b'Bookworm1976'
title: b'Okay, at best'
body: b'This book was difficult to read. There are many characters and it takes a while to get them all straight in your head. It is fairly slow moving and leaves you feeling terrible at the end.'

author: b'Lesli P. Bernat'
title: b'disappointing'
body: b"I was disappointed with this book.I didn't even finish it. It is such a shame that the great writer who brought us Harry Potter had to stoop to such vulgar language to write an adult novel. I really expected much more from her. Disappointed!!"

author: b'Randy Burnett'
title: b'Eh'
body: b"Well written but a snoozer.  The characters are interesting but there's no twists and turns, I'm about half way through and hoping the plot thickens"

author: b'JoAnn'
title: b'Casual Vacancy  BORING!'
body: b'Very disappointing.  Too many characters, jumps around, just not enjoyable.  I was expecting better from JK Rowling but think she needs to stick to the world of wizardry.  This has been a painful read but I forced myself to finish it!  I do not recommend this book--unless you want to be bored to bits!'

author: b'Nadine'
title: b'"Three or four families in a country village is the very thing to work on" -Jane Austen'
body: b'I enjoyed this book very much. The character development is outstanding. The story focuses on an English country village and the stress caused by country politics, class struggles, love, family, poverty, drugs, and life in general. The writing is delightful and this is the only thing the book has in common with Harry Potter. There is no fantasyland with clear good versus evil. I loved it, but I am a Jane Austen fan and I love stories that contain only three or four country families.'

author: b'Paula S. St Julien'
title: b'A Little Disappointed'
body: b"I was really looking forward to reading J.K. Rowling's new book, but I have to say I was a little disappointed.  I thought the story plot was pretty good, and of course she does a wonderful job of developing her characters, but I was really turned off by all the swearing in the book.  I am by no means a prude, and I don't mind some swearing if it enhances the story.  But I just felt like a lot of it was not necessary and didn't add anything to the story.  I gave the book 3 stars because of the swearing and because I had the ending figured out about halfway through the book."

author: b'Lokie'
title: b'Meh'
body: b'Politics bore me and even with J.K. writing couldnt save the story. It was so boring, what a shame.  I had been excited to get the book.'

author: b'jimlongley'
title: b"That's life."
body: b'Although a little tedious at the start, in switching from character to character and slow development, overall an entertaining read.'

author: b'Jules'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I thought it was just okay.  It seemed to me that we went on a journey and ended up in the same place at the end.  Nothing really changed for anyone.  Hope she goes back to writing for young adults.'

author: b'Myview'
title: b'The big fraud'
body: b'I thought any author who could hold the attention of a middle school reader for 600 pages would write a mesmerizing adult book.  In this case the "adult" designation just meant as in X rated.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'very real characters'
body: b'The characters had such depth. They sucked me into the story and held my interest in such a way that I was surprised how much I cared about their lives.'

author: b'R. Bond'
title: b'Just not for me'
body: b'It was very hard for me to get into. Not that the writing was bad, just not feeling the story line. But, I still feel JKR is brilliant. Maybe she should stick with Children/Young Adult...?'

author: b'my2cents'
title: b'Great Book!'
body: b'J. K. Rowling is such a wonderful writer. The characters in this book, as in her Harry Potter books, have such depth,and the stories Rowling tells are so engaging. This is a good read!'

author: b'DeaZ'
title: b"Didn't like any of the characters"
body: b"Really found the characters in the book unlikable. And I didn't feel the book was resolved in a positive manner. No one seemed to learn and grow from the events unfolding in the book. Finished the novel feeling unsatisfied. I will not be purchasing another one of J.K. Rowling's books."

author: b'Earl W. Godt II'
title: b'Better than Potter'
body: b'This book was better than any of the Harry Potter series in relating the real day-to-day interactions of small town characters.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Difficult to get into but hooks you after 4 or 5 chapters'
body: b"This book was well written but fairly depressing.  Taking place in a small village in England, it delves into the lives, relationships and emotions of a variety of people, building to a climax that one knows can't be good.  Some of the people evolve into more likeable characters than you would expect and some into less likeable characters.  Most of the characters are not very likeable.  The ending worked out well for a few and disastrously for others."

author: b'Lor'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I found this book troubling, I can and do enjoy books without the language that J.K. Rowling decided had to be utilized in this one. I was terribly distressed in what she presumed is enjoyed by all adults...sorry, but that is how I personally feel about her first "Adult Book"'

author: b'Hina'
title: b'Dark and dramatic'
body: b'Although I never read the Harry Potter series, it s easy to see why Rowling has become such an iconic writer. Her writing style is both perceptive and realistic. The characters are very believable. The story does not have too many twists and turns but it is captivating. The novel becomes very dark at times...almost disturbingly so. Yet you cannot help becoming attached to the the characters. All in all, a very good read.'

author: b'L. Kasseris'
title: b'Awful and Quite Surprised'
body: b'OMG! I thought this would be an excellent read given the author-I got through half of it and stopped the "madness". I could not keep up and or did not want to....this is obviously my opinion and I feel I am quite well read and would like to see what other people\'s thoughts are on this book-I am guessing I might be in the minority and others will just say they thought it was a blockbuster just to be in the "know" so to speak-all in all I would leave it at best as a "tedious" and unrewarding read.'

author: b'JoAnn Erfer'
title: b'Stick with Hogworts'
body: b'I tried to like this book, but had no success.  I enjoy a book where the characters grab my interet.  I kept reading but this never happened.  It finally got to the point where, after 100+ pages, I threw in the towel.  Ms. Rowling should stick to what she does best.'

author: b'Lozza'
title: b'Confusing'
body: b"i found the book very confusing. Most characters had nicknames and almost in the same sentence both names were used. This just made reading difficult, as you were constantly trying to remember who the character was and also where they fitted into the story. I admit I haven' t read any of JK Rowlings other books,so I can't comment on the author generally. I would not recommend this novel."

author: b'Mappg'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b"I don't think it holds up to the Potter series but a good read once you delve into it.  Has an interesting twist of characters that keep you engaged."

author: b'bet33'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I guess no one could keep the Harry Potter interest going.  This book did not grab me, and hold my interest.  It was ok, but I guess I expected more from J.K. Rowling.'

author: b'Claus Stahnke'
title: b'No magic, but a lot of suspense'
body: b'Well written, social realistic novel, about the lack of understanding we have for each other, rich vs poor, children vs parents, teachers vs students, and the complications that can come from this.'

author: b'Pattydu'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I was very disappointed in this book and I couldn't even finish reading it.  I thought the characters were awful and didn't care about them at all. Can't believe the same author wrote this and the Harry Potter series."

author: b'Lars'
title: b'Loved it'
body: b'The book was great. Rowling shows that she masters adult fiction at least as well as youth fiction. Buy the book if you feel like doing it.'

author: b'Mfree'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This whole book, "The Casual Vacancy", purchased from Amazon, was boring to me. Too many in\'s and out\'s of situations, very hard to follow without going back pages trying to recapture each situation. I do not recommend this book. Sorry.'

author: b'MelStrella'
title: b'A craftsman at work'
body: b"Rarely do I find a book that I can't put down because it so comprehensively engages all of me, with its quirky but fully believable plot, the unmistakeable wordsmithing of an accomplished author, the shared insight into the broad spectrum of the human condition, and well developed, rounded characters that are very likely to do something unpredictable at any moment. I am fascinated to know how JKR could soooo nail the description of OCD let alone the other character quirks she rolls out for our enjoyment. I hoped JKR would be as good with an adult book as she was with kids fantasy, and she didn't disappoint. Eeep, hanging out for a good night's sleep tonight to make up for this book keeping me reading voraciously into the wee small hours this morning!"

author: b'A. Jonsdottir'
title: b'Very good book - must read'
body: b'I have just finisthed reading Cacual Vacancy - one of the very best books I have read in a long time, and I read a lot.'

author: b'Karen B'
title: b'Awfully brilliant'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy is a searing portrait of a group of  characters in neighbouring towns that explores how even the smallest stakes can create the grandest ambitions. Filled to the brim with toxic personalities, egos, class and fiscal warfare and all kinds of terrible abuses, this is a dark and awful book in so many ways. Deeply disturbing, it is relentless in its scope and in the way it investigates the levels to which humans will stoop. But it is also  intelligently and even beautifully written. I could not put it down.'

author: b'Virginia Baughman'
title: b'Worth the wait'
body: b'I found the Harry Potter books hard to read, but I enjoyed this book very much. A great cast of characters with a great story.'

author: b'slim'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
