body: b'Casual Vacancy was page turning and very insightful of the hopes and follies of humanity. Krystal Weedon was a comical and tragic figure.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Too much profanity'
body: b"I was hoping that J.K. Rowling's first book for adults did not mean profane and obscene language.  Unfortunately, that was not the case. Too bad a gifted writer like Rowling cannot take a hint from the likes of John Grisham that one can write excellent fiction without being offensive."

author: b'Jerryb'
title: b'Disappointing!'
body: b'In an attempt to be"adult" in this new endeavor,the author created a totally unspeaking cast of characters. No redeeming values!'

author: b'Owen Corps'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Excellent. J. K. Rowling has a wealth of knowledge at her disposal. Extremely well written and thought out. Even at the very end, Ms Rowling was still releasing details of the characters that we thought we knew. A sequel would be very welcome!'

author: b'lorat'
title: b'For those who love to read and not because of wrote it'
body: b"Excellent read! Stop thinking about who wrote it and just enjoy it. I'm glad I didn't read it based on the bad reviews I saw before buying it!"

author: b'Mary'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I bought this book at Costco,wasnt going because of all the 1 star reveiws. Took me awhile to get through it. Read about 50 pages and stopped to read a book on my Kindle Fire. Then I started it up again. It is slow going  and took me awhile to remember who is who. But then it got more interesting and I couldnt put it down. I really liked it!'

author: b'M. Keesee'
title: b'Brilliant Character Study'
body: b"I cannot believe that I read the same book that the reviewers with the one-start ratings have been tearing apart page by page. I LOVED THIS BOOK.  I went into it it with trepidation since I loved the HP books and expected to be disappointed.  I was thrilled by the multitude of characters populating this tiny English town.  If anyone lives in a small town like I do you will agree that while we think we know everybody's business, none of us are aware of the nasty dark secrets behind our neighbor's closed doors.  All these characters are well drawn, have depth and will walk around in my brain for a long time to come.  I hope people give this book a chance because it is well worth the read. I look forward to Rowling's next endeavor."

author: b'Barry Weiss'
title: b'Politically Uncomfortable For Some!'
body: b"This was an excellent character study and political narrative from a progressive point of view.  I can't help but feel there are a lot of Howard's and Shirley's (you will know what I mean when you read the book) whose right wing sensibilities (if there are such things) were wounded by the political positions taken and thus many of the negative comments about the book."

author: b'Barbara Lucas'
title: b'Boring'
body: b'Very slow moving.  The characters are dull and uninteresting. Found it hard to care about them  She should stick to fantasy.'

author: b'Alphacat'
title: b'The worst ever'
body: b"The worst book I have ever read, in fact couldn't finish it. The characters are awful - didn't like any of them; no redeeming qualities at all. What is the point of writing such an awful book? No empathy for any of them. Time wasted for sure."

author: b'SFWINO'
title: b"Can't Get Through It"
body: b"OK, I read a novel per week; I loved Harry Potter; I looked forward to and expected a different story that showed JK's writing skills.  BUT..... I have started this book 4 times and can't get pass 20%. Confusing, rambling, too many people,,,ugh.  I am going to walk away from it for now and pick it up for a 5th try in a few weeks. Maybe it's me..... but I don't think so."

author: b'Derek'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'the seamier life styles of the candidates for the "Casual Vacancy" & their families is revealed in this (Hog)warts and all (pun intended) tale. The language is at times coarse , but I found the story intriging.'

author: b'avidreader'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"In a word, boring.  I don't dislike serious books and had high hopes but one-third of the way in, The Casual Vacacny is not even remotely compelling.  I care nothing about the characters all whom so far are unappealing.  I don't think I can bring myself to finish it."

author: b'Johan Adkins'
title: b'Die hard fan'
body: b"I  understand that Jo Rowling is an advocate for distressed teens and their families and is actively trying to help.  I know these types of lives and characters exist and the hopelessness of their situations and the inadequacy of any social and community systems to help is discouraging and dire.  I was just disappointed in the down and dirty...we expect magic and uplifted spirits when we read her books.  We care about all of her characters and unfortunately I didn't care about any of them in Casual Vacancy.  I wanted to love this book as I did her Harry Potter series."

author: b'tsetsefly1'
title: b'Village Politics Meets Something Wicked This Way Comes'
body: b"I am reading this with bated breath: it's hard to put down. Just when you think you know enough about particular characters, something new happens to them, or they make something happen to someone else. As Miss Marple of St. Mary Mead village might have put it, there is much wickedness in village life, under the surface. A very adult novel. I didn't expect Harry Potter, and J.K. Rowling is simply stretching and limbering up her literary muscles. More power to her! It can be a disturbing read, but the exaggerated evils are there to make a point about hypocrisy. Real life can be just as unsettling. I alternate between really enjoying this and biting my fingernails down to the nub. You decide!"

author: b'Regina'
title: b'Beautifully Written Work of Art.'
body: b'Casual Vacancy is a beautifully written work of art. Nothing has been missed in the story. No storyline was neglected. Every character and every scene is perfectly orchestrated to completion. Reading Casual Vacancy is like eating that perfect meal. It starts off with an explosion of flavor, akin to a beautifully prepared appetizer and from there Rowling guides the reader through a perfectly told story that is nicely sustained. A good story is one that the reader does not want to put down, but is not forced to rush through. It is a story that once over, its characters will be missed. And once completed, the storyline line and messages are still being contemplated in the minds of its readers. This is the brilliance of Casual Vacancy.'

author: b'Kali the Cat'
title: b'Boring and tedious at best.'
body: b"This is a very disappointing outing by J.K. Rowling.  I found the story boring and a tedious read at best.  I had read some of the other reviews of 'The Casual Vacancy' after starting the book but still felt promise for a good read, after all this is J.K. Rowling.  Other reviewers stated you needed to read at least half of the book before the storyline would pick up.  I didn't find this to be so.  Even at the end I wondered why I had bothered with the effort to plod on when I could have been reading something much better."

author: b'Ann'
title: b'A lot of realistic issues crammed into a volatile political landscape'
body: b"I know why you've either read, or are going to read this book. It's because you're curious. Curious as to what has Rowling come up with for adults post Potter, and if it can live up to the legend of Potter or not. I went into this with my mind still set in the idyllic childish world of Harry Potter (you really shouldn't, clear your mind and just read this book as it is) and I can tell you the exact moment that Rowling effectively shattered any childhood fantasies that I had left (it was when she dropped about 7 f-bombs in the span of two consecutive pages really early on)."

author: b'rdr'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'Knew book was for adults and not at all like HP series but I only got to the third or fourth chapter and was totally bored, confused,and the really foul language was a turnoff.  She is a better writer that what is found in this book. Maybe you should take a look at it in a library and read a few chapters before buying just to see if you will like it.'

author: b'Julie'
title: b'Too many characters... and nothing happens in this book besides people dying'
body: b'Too many characters to follow, gets very confusing. There is not one normal family in this town everyone is screwed up to the point where it is very unbelievable. the end is horrible, nothing is resolved! Had a hard time finishing this book. This is one I will not reread!'

author: b'Jan'
title: b'Worst Book Read'
body: b'Our Book Club selected this book with the high hopes our families have had with the Harry Potter series. Never have I been so disappointed and dismayed. This book, to my surprise, was just one step from being labled porno. With that said, the writing was more of a rambling farce about a small town. The language was more than the usual hard core and the characters were almost impossible to separate or remember from one page to the next. I realize the ratings jumped to the top when her book came out, but what a quick tumble they took with me.'

author: b'booklover343'
title: b'So disappointing'
body: b'I was really looking forward to this book but it was so disappointing.'

author: b'Aaron'
title: b'Tough Transition'
body: b"I read this book without the notion that it would be anything like the world of HP. I was very excited to hear Rowling's voice in a new arena. I have just finished the book and I feel just so-so about it."

author: b'Lynda B'
title: b'Good read'
body: b"No, it isn't Harry Potter but then I didn't expect it to be.  This novel was reminiscent of P. D. James without the murders.  Well written with well drawn characters (lots of them too).  I won't say this was her best effort because I loved all the Harry Potter books but it was very good and I only expect her non-magical writing to improve as time goes on."

author: b'Renate Scheelar'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This book is an excellent read.  All the elements of the plot work together and there are no events which, when one has finished reading the book, one wonders what roles these events played in the overall unity of the story.  The characters and the situations created for them are very real.  The plot, at times, is quite gut wrenching, but true to life.'

author: b'PG5000'
title: b'Complex, Dark, Engaging - but takes some time to get there'
body: b'Hello,'

author: b'M. Worch -. Telaak'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'The most Boring book I have ever tried to read..  I was very disappointed. Barely made it through chapter 4.  Maybe too British? Very descriptive but going no where..'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Vacant'
body: b'I rarely start a book I do not finish but this is it.  I tried to stick with it, thinking it might get better, but I cannot force myself to read the rest of it.  Too many characters introduced to be able to follow, very heavy subject material, I am disappointed.  I dumped it from my Kindle.'

author: b'Pen Name'
title: b'Great book'
body: b"This was a great read, could hardly put it down. Can't wait for a sequel! Or more from her like this!"

author: b'Gayle Hughes'
title: b'Fan of J.K. Rowling in Tallahassee, Florida'
body: b'It was well written and the characters are expertly drawn.  It is not a "happy" book and some readers will be sorry that it is not.  Overall, though, she gets is right in the struggles of the lower classes and the political fights that rule their lives.'

author: b'Pen Name'
title: b'Not Quite Harry'
body: b'Plot was engaging throughout, but the shifting perspectives were hard to follow. Some of the story lines were a but lackluster as well.'

author: b'chelsea'
title: b'A good read but ...'
body: b'I suppose I was expecting something absolutely extraordinary from the author having been utterly enthralled with her Harry Potter books- and I am over 60!  It is written very well, she really does have a superb turn of phrase, and  she has tried to touch upon many big problems facing society today.  But the end was so dark and so depressing.  I thought it petered out somewhat and was expecting something a little more triumphant: reinforcing the social services, establishing child care facilities, dealing with the horrific housing problem.  And the pettiness of local councils!!!  I am glad I read it and i have recommended it to others but I would not read it again.'

author: b'K. Dickson'
title: b'Barry Fairbrother and the Chamber of Secrets?'
body: b'J.K.Rowling is a great story teller, but her real skill is character portrayal. She didn\'t disappoint with the Harry Potter novels and she doesn\'t disappoint with THE CASUAL VACANCY. Although the most likeable character dies in the first few pages, Rowling fleshes out the others realistically and skillfully over the course of this long but very readable novel. They are all flawed, vulnerable and very identifiable. Some are almost caricatures, but their stories all complement each other. As with Harry Potter, I couldn\'t put it down and I cried at the end. Can\'t get that Rihanna song out of my head: "You can stand under my umbrella..."'

author: b'Jay P. Chawla'
title: b'rented'
body: b'Why do authors study people, and why do they experiment on them?  What gives them the inspiration that keeps them going as they study people and break them into parts and figure out their mistakes and see what causes behavior?'

author: b'Eric M Small'
title: b'Magic of a different kind.'
body: b"When Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone was published, I was nine years old, and I devoured every page. I have continued to delight in Ms. Rowling's work for well over half my life, and now (at 24) I have just finished The Casual Vacancy. Once again, I have not been disappointed."

author: b'Robyne Melia'
title: b'I Liked It'
body: b"for the first chapter or two, i struggled to put the characters together... i was also quite ill so that's something to consider, but when i got in i really got in. i have a lot of respect for the author, but really forgot about her altogether."

author: b'Sue Fitzmaurice'
title: b'Superb portrayal of parochialism and small-mindedness'
body: b'There is barely a single likeable character throughout, but each is superbly depicted.  Rowling has "set to" with her obvious dislike of the parochial, small-minded English middle class, and its lack of any decent sentiment for those less fortunate than themselves - and that\'s no small number of the population today.'

author: b'Nicola'
title: b'I kind of expected more....'
body: b"I really looked forward to reading this book. I had high hopes for a book targeted at adults but in that same un-put-downable style that Rowling is so very capable of. Alas...it wasn't to be. It seems to me that Rowling's idea of good writing for adults is picking a fairly grim (but very factual) topic and then using really obscure words to describe it. Thank goodness for Kindle's definition function. The story didn't grip me and I didn't find any of the characters lovable enough to retain my interest. It's a real shame because she can write....I think maybe she just tried too hard to be different from her previous works this time round and it didn't quite work."

author: b'Anoif'
title: b'Hard going'
body: b"Expected more than just a long saga. It was like reading an episode of East Enders. Everyone knows each other and it's all doom and gloom. So many characters, week story line and hard going. Disappointing. Best to stick to fantasy JK."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Bravo, Ms. Rowling!  Bravo!'
body: b"I was so immersed in Casual Vacancy and realized only when I finished the book today, that I'd been as deeply involved as ever I had been in the Harry Potter series.  But this time there was the deeper, darker, adult current that is behind the lives the children lived through in the earlier series.  JK has proven once more her immense capacity for character development and the complex inner workings of the desperately narcissistic psyches thriving in any community.  Having worked as both a community therapist and a school counselor in my own career, her descriptions of families and children at risk and those dealing with addictions were written so precisely as to feel like  real families on every street in every town.  The ego conflicts and complex weaving among the adults of her community also accurately reflect the human tendency to scapegoat the less fortunate and hide their sufferings from our own eyes because they too closely reflect our own hidden and feared pain.  I would not have sacrificed one page or one word of this gifted artist's book.  I was in awe till the very end.  Thank you and I can't wait to read the next one!  So, Bravo, Ms. Rowling!  Bravo!!"

author: b'reader'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'I was disappointed in the book. It was long and boring and the story line was way out there and difficult to follow.It was not up to her standard of holding ones interest.'

author: b'M. Marble'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'After plowing through the first 300 pages of this disappointing novel, I would say that J K Rowling should stick with young peoples\' literature.  Adult literature to her is a lot of profanity in both American words and British words, teenage libidos running wild, and all the other evil deeds as listed by other reviewers.  There appears only to be hate, self-centered egos, and highly dysfunctional people.  There is no mystery, romance or even steamy sex scenes, the drama is even lacking...just raw emotions of getting even with those you have a distaste for whether it be parent, spouse, child or friend.  So many characters it is often hard to keep track of who is who.  The plot line is just who will fill a vacated councilman\'s seat and the "fight" to fill it.  This book makes our American political muckraking look tame.  Don\'t waste your money.'

author: b'cori casas de gonzalez'
title: b'Lost in the writing!'
body: b"I just love to read all kinds of books. I purchased this book not expecting any concrete results. I thought an  adult  novel from a very entertaining and well read author would be enjoyable or at least interesting, it's none of those things."

author: b'connie'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I couldn't get interested enough to read very much at a time, I read on it for over 2 weeks and only got through a small portion of the book.  It seemed to skip all over the place, it was hard to keep up with the characters, I couldn't figure out what was going on. It just couldn't hold my interest it was boring."

author: b'MC'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Very, very slow.....having a really hard time getting thru it.  I think she probably does better with children books.Better luck next time.'

author: b'Music Lover'
title: b'Terrible!'
body: b"I really wanted to like this book as I am a big Harry Potter fan, but I just couldn't. The  characters, especially the adults, were awful people. Very few had any redeeming qualities, and many of the story lines were left unresolved and left all of the children in the same unhappy households they were in throughout the book. There were a few too many characters to follow, and the main plot was just boring. Not a good outing for Miss Rowling."

author: b'QLO'
title: b'SLOW GOING'
body: b"Well, I'm about 100 pages in and find it kind of hard to get going. But will keep at it"

author: b'montanajen'
title: b'Waste of time'
body: b"Nothing to cry about. No joy, no comedy, no suspense, no love. I wouldn't buy another book by this author without reading glowing reviews first. I don't expect many of those for this novel. Yes, I read and enjoyed all of the H.P. books. Is this really the same author?"

author: b'Adam Faughnan'
title: b'1 star Reviews are idiotic'
body: b'This is well written, expertly plotted and stays with you long after it ends. The 1 star reviews here focus on the fact that it is not like Harry Potter. I thought it was made pretty clear this is an adult novel and is not suitable for kids.'

author: b'Robert Rose'
title: b'Nothing casual about it'
body: b"JK Rowling's transition from wizard world into the realm of a small town abutting a larger one, set against the backdrop of local government, with the hopes, dreams and dark desires of people who could be our neighbours, is at times akin to an uncomfortable train ride. The scenery slips by giving us a glimpse of rural beauty, counterpointed with images of despair, poverty, addiction, and petty politics portrayed by the sort of characters not created from dark magic, but the grittiness of contemporary life in rural England. There is little that is mystical in Casual Vacancy apart from the inner workings of teenage minds heavy with hormones on the voyage of discovery to adulthood. And with the solidity of rolling stock on steel track, there are lurches and resonances along the way."

author: b'M. S. Baldivieso'
title: b'Worst book I ever read.'
body: b'This book was terrible. I guess I was expecting too much because I actually read the Harry Potter series along with my son as he was growing up. I was not looking for an adult version of that series. I was under the mistaken belief that the author would write something for adults that would draw one in to an interesting story.'

author: b'Michele Hamele'
title: b"Duh, It's Not Harry Potter"
body: b"I am a huge Harry Potter fan, so of course I will read anything put out by J.K. Rowling.  When I read the description of this book months ago, I was disappointed, as the plot didn't seem like one that would appeal to me.  However, I decided to give it a chance.  I generally finish every book I start, unless I am REALLY not enjoying a book.  For about the first half of this book, I was ready to quit.  The only thing that kept me reading was that I wanted to be able to assess the book fairly, since it is from a favorite author of mine.  There were two main things that made this book difficult for me to stick with. First, the characters are not very likeable at all.  They ranged from annoying to pathetic to downright repellent.  Second, I just couldn't get myself to care about the whole plot with the election and the Fields issue."

author: b'Iris'
title: b'the Casual Vacancy'
body: b"This was the most boring, uninteresting, no-point book I have ever attempted to read.  If this had been J.K . Rowling's first book, she would never have been published.  After 3 attempts to find something redeemable in the story or the characters, I deleted it from my Kindle.  Don't waste your time on this one."

author: b'Sanam'
title: b'Absolutely Loved It'
body: b'This is definitely an adult book, and discusses many adult themes. Also, it might be beneficial to have a laptop next to you so you can look up some of the British slang that is used by the younger characters.'

author: b'Kelly Brianna'
title: b'I wanted more.....'
body: b'The writing is solid, JK Rowling is a very good writer. And there were interesting bits peppered throughout the book, but for a 500 page novel, I needed more to be happening & for those parts to be more frequent. There is a lot of slow parts.'

author: b'Kristi Mickelson'
title: b'Just genius...'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy and JK Rowling are pure genius. Rowling takes you to picturesque Pagford, a small English town, and introduces you to a cast of characters that will make you laugh, cry and pound your fists in anger.  I was engrossed in every word and when I wasn't reading, I was thinking of the characters and longing to get back to Pagford and to the lives of those who live there.  I had no trouble keeping up with who was who, and enjoyed how their lives intertwined with one another.  This book makes you think about class distinctions, prejudices and social issues.  It brings to light the petty thoughts and personality flaws that many of us have.  The characters in the book are people we all know. And to get into their thoughts... well, it was down right hilarious at times."

author: b'TravelStudent'
title: b'One Word:  Depressing'
body: b"This was a hard read.  The book is well written in a very British sort of way, but the story line is brutal on just about every level.  I came close to giving up several times but in the end I muscled through mostly because of few moments of a television interview with J.K. I happened to see, I believe on the Today show.  The interviewer said he cried at the end.  I wanted to read that ending.  I did mist up there but I'm not sure it was the story that did it.  I simply may have been relieved it was over.  Depressing hardly describes the entire work.  I'd really love to know what J.K. was thinking as she wrote this book.  I read all the Harry Potter books and loved them.  There are plenty of dark moments in HP but The Casual Vacancy left me exhausted and completely cold.  If it was the only book I'd read by J.K. I would never read another.  It's that demoralizing of a story.  If you're looking to be sad and depressed this book will fulfill that wish.  Otherwise read something else."

author: b'C. Christopher'
title: b'No Vacancy Here'
body: b"I'm not a Harry Potter fan, not having any interest in reading them. Yet with her grand success with the series, and now writing an 'adult' story, I jumped to buy the book the day it came out."

author: b'DeeP'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'The characters are diverse but shallow. They are, for the most part , pretty unsympathetic. Perhaps I just expected too much.'

author: b'Jennifer L. Johnston'
title: b'It was okay.'
body: b"There are good and bad things about this book.  I'm not going to compare it to HP at all.  It's entirely different!"

author: b'SunnyLorraine'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Enjoyed the read.  The language was brutal but not as much as her descriptions of the abject poverty the poor live with in council housing in England.  Drug addiction, abuse of children, rape, no hope ... she covered it all.  Having grown up in a small country town in Manitoba, I saw many of the characters in this book in my home town.'

author: b'CHUCKC'
title: b"Not what I expected, didn't care for it at all."
body: b'I never caught on to what J.K. Rowling was trying to say, other than that small villages can harbour resentments that go back for decades and that resentments and prejudices can fester until a boiling point is reached.'

author: b'scotty'
title: b'Stick to Harry Potter'
body: b'I did read the book.  But to be honest, it was so pathetic that toward the end, I was skimming just to be done with it.  It deserved one star, but I gave it two for creativity.  Much of the atmosphere is crude and lowlife.  Many of the love scenes are brutish and animalistic.  If you like that kind of stuff, go for it.  But get real, J.K., this is not your genre.  Stick with Harry Potter fantasy. You deserve those 5 star accolades.'

author: b'Chihuahua Zero'
title: b'An Underrated Foray into Adult Fiction'
body: b'Slowness? What slowness?'

author: b'Anne'
title: b'Very disappointing'
body: b'The novel is hugely disappointing.  JK Rowling was not served well by her editors. The work is over-full of static, rather stock, characters. The descriptive passages are bloated.  It is overly-emotive yet strangely flat. At the same time, the plot hardly moves forward.  I read about half of it with a kind of horrified fascination, as one looks at a train-wreck, but finally had to put it down.  I hope that her next novel will show more of the tight plotting and drama of the Harry Potter series.'

author: b'Candice Hayden'
title: b'I love this woman for her talent and all she has given us...but, hate this book.'
body: b"As one who spent countless nights perched at the bedside with my children reading the HP series...it was a nighttime ritual at our house...I couldn't wait to order the book on my Kindle and rabidly opened it immediately. It was extremely difficult to follow the characters who seemed quite two dimensional, difficult to maneuver much of the UK vernacular. I finally just put it down and shook my head. JK Rowling is such a gifted writer. But I am wondering if her editors and publishers were frank with her about this book...or just looking at the $$$."

author: b'julie'
title: b'i loved it, i really really did!'
body: b"i don't think i've ever written a review, but the reviews for this book are so bad and i loved it so much that i had to write.  here are some thoughts that might help you decide to buy this book or not:"

author: b'TXJG'
title: b'Well written, but so depressing'
body: b"The writing is beautiful and insightful.  Unfortunately, we don't care about any of the characters in this seedy story and without a protagonist it is hard to find a reason to pick the book back up and finish it.  Harry Potter readers, don't bother buying it.  If you like well written books about how pathetic people are, you'll definitely want to pick this up."

author: b'Linda Martz'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"J.K. Rowling's style is great.  Her character development is excellent.  It's really too bad that I can't say the same for the story.  Even though everything was tied up in a neat little package at the end, I was still left with a feeling of disappointment.  About all I got from the book is that everyone has secrets and nobody is really happy.  I read books that move me or entertain me more than once.  Once was enough for Casual Vacancy."

author: b'Sophiafrancesca'
title: b'Human inheritances'
body: b'I for one enjoyed this book.  I thought it depicted the common sins of our humanity.  Rowling  shows what jealousy, greed, and loveless families without true guidance springs forth in this world.  It shows how our lives seriously effect our children  in the most important years of their  lives.  Although the language is a bit raw, you skim over these words in the anticipation of reading onward.'

author: b'P. Smith'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"The story began as a page turner. I looked forward to what would happen to the characters and the coming events. I did not realize that was the prolouge. Trying to get through Chapter one is wrenching. I eventually gave up and started reading from one of my other favorite authors. One day I will go back to try and finish the book, especially since paying the price for the new release. I recommend borrowing from the library when it's available."

author: b'WBH'
title: b'Not a Casual Vacancy'
body: b'At first there were so many characters so quickly that I became somewhat confused trying to follow the setups, but if you stick with it, about a third of the way through, the story takes off and it is the vintage J.K. Rowling that you were hoping to meet once again. I thoroughly enjoyed this effort, and it became a real page turner in very short order. This is a very adult J.K. Rowling in both the use of language and in the tough issues that she investigates.'

author: b'BamaLover'
title: b'It makes you think'
body: b'This would be a great book for teens & adults...especially with focus these days on bullying. Book starts slow & there are a lot of characters for the reader to become familiar with (I would suggest simple notes) but I was quickly drawn in to the dynamics at play.'

author: b'Liz Williams'
title: b'None'
body: b'This was one of the most emotional reading experiences I can recall in a very long time. These characters became so real; flaws and all.  Each of their scenarios really reasonated and I found myself unable to put it down even though it was uncomfortable and almost unbearably sad at times.  I think this book is a contemporary masterpiece in the vein of the Harry Potter series but an entirely different subject matter.  sometimes it is possible to write a story that reflects real life and offers hope and light depite the darkness and Rowling achieved this in spades.  Read this book, reflect on it...you wont be disppointed.'

author: b'Kimberly Denz'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy is painful, beautiful, uncomfortable, dark, funny; but mostly it's honest. Rowling's gorgeous prose is familiar to Harry Potter readers, and her storytelling is as masterful as ever in The Casual Vacancy."

author: b'Johann'
title: b'not great, but I liked it'
body: b'Book was good, not great'

author: b'essbeepee'
title: b'Disappointment'
body: b"I bought Ms. Rowling's book out of curiosity. If my opinion can save any of you from reading this very disappointing trite piece of airport trash, I will have done you a favour. The characters are one dimensional and stereotyped, the situation contrived. Ms Rowling must be a very dark person, none of the characters have ANY redeeming social value. The children hate their parents and do teen age rebellious stuff (who would imagine such a thing?) The grownups are either drunk, having sex with the wrong people, violent, or terrified. Everything gets worse, in a totally predictable way. Its like reading a trashy People type magazine about people you would never want to meet in a place you would never want to go. Give it a miss!"

author: b'Janette'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I was wanting to read this to see if I would love JK's adult fiction as much as her children's  fiction, unfortunately I didn't."

author: b'Gramz'
title: b'R rated'
body: b"I was soooo disappointed in this book.  I would never have expected the author of the amazing Harry Potter series to write a book like this.  I am a 57 year old grandmother, but am selective about my reading.  This book is definitely R rated and NOT suitable for kids.  I repeat . . . NOT suitable for kids.  I read some and then skimmed the rest. It was vulgar and crass.  There was an abundance of sex and profanity. If this is the type of book the public wants, it's a sad commentary of what we find entertaining."

author: b'Mark W'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b"Slow moving. Bounces around. Rather boring. I read the Harry Potter series and truly enjoyed it. Based on the literary value of that series my wife and I purchased Casual Vacancy expecting the same level of fast paced intrigue. We are both reading the book and have both set it aside for now as it doesn't hold our interest."

author: b'Susan D'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b"I enjoyed reading The Casual Vacancy very much.I thought it was very well written and the descriptions of the characters were very believable.I did,however,think one character may have been based on Uncle Vernon from the Harry Potter series.The plot kept me interested throughout the book and although the ending wasn't totally unexpected I did find it extremely sad.I hope Ms Rowling continues to write books for adults as she seems to be totally in touch with the real world, which is quite unbelievable considering the fantasy world we have come to know through her previous books."

author: b'Taylor'
title: b'I liked it'
body: b'I liked it.'

author: b'sps4'
title: b'Miserable, unreadable'
body: b'Doesn\'t matter who wrote it. It\'s not a good book. The plot and storyline are my cup of tea, so Iif anything I was biased toward liking it but by page 20 I was sad and disappointed that The Casual Vacancy was not to be the cozy "someone died in a small English town lets have a look at everyone\'s lives" story I\'d anticipated. Not sure who would enjoy this book. Someone already miserable and cynical and dull, who\'s also not looking for an escape from all that.'

author: b'Allison'
title: b'I actually returned this book'
body: b'This author goes so far out of her way to differentiate herself from Harry Potter that she goes completely and miserably overboard. The words got in the way of the story so much so that I could not even get past page 40. This book was offensive and totally lacking any reason to hang on and persevere.  I returned the book.'

author: b'artistchick46'
title: b'Absolute Trash'
body: b"This book is the biggest disappointment! JK Rowling has prooven that she can write characters that we love and that we love to hate in the HP series, but you don't see any of that in The Casual Vacancy. Either the characters are not worth mentioning or just disguising because of their behavior and disregard for others. What a waste of time, money and energy. JK Rowling should stick to what she knows."

author: b'Grammybaz'
title: b'A book that no intelligent reader should waste his time on'
body: b'There is no reason to describe every scene, every person, every home or relationship in such base and disgusting terms. PIMPLES AND SWEAT, BELLY BUTTON HAIR AND WIGGLING CONTROSEPTIVES, FILTHY BATHROOMS AND SOILED DIAPERS, OBESE MEN AND SWEARING TEENAGERS ALL MAKE THE BOOK A DISGUSTING READ.I CAN ENJOY A WELL WRITTEN SEX SCENE AS WELL AS THE NEXT BUT THIS BOOK MADE ME CRINGE AS FAR AS A COULD READ IT.'

author: b'Margaret R. Tomczak'
title: b'Enjoyed it. A little rough in spots,'
body: b'It took me a substantial amount of time due to visual impairment and no dedicated long uninterrupted periods for reading.Good character development. Clear setting descriptions.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Not a Keeper'
body: b"I am an avid reader and my home is small, so I've learned to categorize my books as 'one-time reads' and 'must own for life'.  One time reads are borrowed or loaded on the Kindle.  Must own books are hard copies to be kept forever."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Magical in its own right'
body: b'Characters and plot were very excellent!  If Rowling wants to write more adult books, this is off to a great start for her.  I love Rowling and I always will!'

author: b'Norm 43'
title: b'ENJOYED THE WRITING AND CHARACTERS'
body: b"FIRST-TIME READER OF THIS AUTHOR.  I DIDN'T READ ANY OF THE HARRY POTTER BOOKS. ENJOYED HER WRITING STYLE, AND THE CHARACTERS.  THE PLOT WAS OK, PROPOSING A GENERAL THEME OF MAN'S INADEQUACIES, ALONG WITH HIS BLINDNESS TO HIS OWN SELFISH JUDGEMENTS. CERTAINLY HIGHLIGHTED MAN'S PREJUDICE AND JUDGMENTAL ATTITUDES TOWARDS THE POOR AND MARGINALIZED.  IT WAS AN ENJOYABLE READ."

author: b'Beverly Debenedictis'
title: b"Bev's Opinion"
body: b"I thought this book was okay and, no, I was not comparing it to Rowling's previous books.  I liked the characters but didn't think the story was interesting."

author: b'Dusty'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I was looking forward to a captivating read. Very disappointing - boring! It reminded me of a soap opera.  It went on and on and on with no pizzazz.'

author: b'Rose Strickman'
title: b"Rowling's Trying Way Too Hard"
body: b'I knew this book wasn\'t going to be another Harry Potter.  I knew it was going to be a "literary" novel exploring humanity\'s darker side.  But I didn\'t expect this.'

author: b'David Carney'
title: b'What a Great Read!'
body: b'Most of the negative reviews complain of a lack of story line / plot.  I agree: there really is no "plot."  However, that said, this is an excellent read-it is absorbing, entertaining and contains fantastic dialogue and character development.  Congratulations to J.K. Rowling on a work well done!'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Just Harry please'
body: b"I find the book boring. It's like reading a soap opera. The plot is lame. After reading 70 percent I jumped to the ending because I couldn't take it anymore and of course the ending is a let down. Overall the entire book us one big let down."

author: b'Diane K. Bird'
title: b'Heartbreaking'
body: b"I found The Casual Vacancy to be absorbing, engaging, often darkly humorous, and ultimately heartbreaking. The many characters were well drawn . It didn't take long to learn who was who even though the relationships were complex. Highly Recommened."

author: b'FoothillCouponer'
title: b"It's just NO good! Vulgar language swearing on Cd"
body: b"I pre ordered this on cd....Gosh...I'm on the 2nd disc......still slow and boring, and the swaring is too much! With all the swearing and vulgar nasty language I cannot listen to it at work in my spare time."

author: b'Bookworm'
title: b'Behind closed doors'
body: b'Hard to put down. Believable plus entertaining, start to finish.  These people are as real as your own friends and neighbors.'

author: b'vickie'
title: b'Get from the Library if you feel you MUST read it!'
body: b"I'm upset that this book was such a disappointment. I read all genre of books, so I didnt start reading this expecting another Harry Potter. I did expect to be drawn into the book and unable to put it down. and it was so bad I found reasons not to read it."

author: b'Jack C.'
title: b"Jack don't like it"
body: b'I have tried three times to "get into" this book. Each time I have been unable to get any meaning out of the story line and just put it down in frustration.'

author: b'MamaW'
title: b'Good, but a departure from the Potter vein'
body: b"I am enjoying The Casual Vacancy, but not as much as the Harry Potter books.  Guess I was hoping for the page turning can't-put-it-down experience of the other books and this is an entirely different animal.  It is good, just has different pacing and so many struggles for each of the characters.  To be honest it is a bit depressing, but picks up very nicely in the end."

author: b'Rex Katz'
title: b'Excellent story - Compelling and Gripping - Classic'
body: b"I thoroughly enjoyed the book. The darker side of human nature is often disturbing and not easy to write about. These characters are real - they mirror many a family and acquaintances. Don't make the mistake of comparing this book to children's book. Compare it to Dostoevsky, or Dickens or any of today's popular authors like Deaver, Kellerman, Childs, Sandford, Grafton, Crais, etc. - Then you see how JK towers above them."

author: b'nadia'
title: b'Good read'
body: b'The storyline was OK and it was enjoyable, not earth shattering, but good solid enjoyment. This is definitely not a Harry Potter type story, and I would recommend it.'

author: b'yvonneadrienne'
title: b'A big disappointment'
body: b'I purchased the book on its release day and have not been able to get into it.  I go back to it when I am trying to sleep and it helps me to nod off.  Usually, after a short period of time, I can get into a book, but it is not happening.'

author: b'K. Coonce'
title: b'Great Book'
body: b'This is a great Book.  I really love the way the author writes.  My only issue with the book is that if you are not British you might have a hard time understanding some of the words she uses.  Other than that the writing and vocabulary is awesome!'

author: b'Dagny'
title: b'What is the point?'
body: b'I loved all the Harry Potter books.  So I was eager to see how JK Rowling would do with an adult novel.  I have not finished the book.  Not sure I will.  There are endless characters--too many to want to keep track of--especially with no real dramatic point as far as I can see.  Perhaps there is a surprise ending.  But right now close to 50% of th book read, I am still wondering what it is.  Small town English politics may be of interest to some--but I have not been hooked half way through the book. Usually, books I choose grab me in the first chapter--this book has gone way beyong my grab factor.'

author: b'My Little Pony Girl'
title: b'A Different J.K. Rowling! For adults only'
body: b'First, let me state that this is NOT a book for children!!!'

author: b'Steve'
title: b'Compelling, powerful, adult, gritty and ultimately optimistic'
body: b'JK Rowling has mastered another literary genre in "The Casual Vacancy."  She provides the reader with a powerful and compelling look at poverty, class structure and small town life in modern day Britain.  Her story combines drama, social commentary, dark humour and ultimately a message of optimism about the human condition presented through a cast of fascinating, flawed, complex characters whose lives are entwined in the web of English village life.'

author: b'jan'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'The characters were VERY well developed but it just took too long getting to the'

author: b'emilie00'
title: b'A casual vacancy'
body: b"Very clever premise, very complex interwoven plot. Enjoyable seeing teen characters as major players in an adult novel The most interesting character- `Fats'- lovely. The story saved by being balanced. It didn't condemn the middle classes while it poked derisive fun?  Didn't condemn anyone specifically- all of us- antiheroes.  I thought it less about class distinctions and more about human condition. Soul has to express itself someway - rare heroes like Barry Fairbrother make the most of what life has to offer while the majority  of us squabble & squander it tragically. The internet shown as a damaging force- Fat's facebook bullying- but also as a positive force for the silent sufferers - Andy & Suhkvinder  who found a voice  there & got their messages across."

author: b'Indy'
title: b'Big let down'
body: b'Not only is the book CRUDE, it falls way short of the level if writing that J.K. Rowling is capable of. The story took a long time to get into and when it did get moving just wasnt that good. I skimmed 20% of the book just so I could finish it. I will be deleting it off my kindle. Pass this book by!!!'

author: b'asibe'
title: b'CASUAL VACANCY'
body: b'This was a very well written book but overall I found the storyline depressing hence only gave it 2 stars :('

author: b'Robert Griffiths'
title: b'I loved it'
body: b'I enjoyed the story, and the way this book was written; simple as that.'

author: b'Anonymous'
title: b'ZERO stars'
body: b"I would give this book ZERO stars (or negative stars) if that was an option. I am returning it for a refund at Costco. It's just depressing, disgusting, and crude."

author: b'Deborah s'
title: b'Some uncomfortable truths'
body: b'Glad she had the talent and courage to write this. A different genre but equal skill, a great read. Do hope we see more from Ms.JK.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Good character novel'
body: b"This book delves into the minds and motivations of the residents of a small town. JK Rowling's talent for creating full, three-dimensional characters truly shines. The people are in turns generous, flawed, tortured, selfish, damaged, intelligent, and loving. Getting into the story is a bit slow until you get the hang of who's who, but soon you feel yourself being pulled into their lives. You'll find yourself chewing on the resolution for days. It's not a happy-go-lucky story by any means, but more a story of humanity and what we choose to do with our fragile human lives."

author: b'Rebecca'
title: b'A bit of a downer'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy is filled with, and told from the point of view, of many different characters from the small town of Pagford. Somehow with the number and variety of characters we are introduced to I can honestly say (aside from a few moments here and there) there was not one single character I liked. The citizens of this town from young to old were for the most part unlikable, petty and obnoxious to name a flaws. It is is a testament to the writer that despite this I continued to read this novel and see it through. The novel goes on and on cycling through the character chronicling the events in the town following the death of Barry Fairbrother and up to and after the election to fill his vacant council spot. The entire book I was expecting it to build to a big finish, which it did for the most part. This was full of social and political commentary told through the events in a seemingly normal small town. Worth the read and shows Rowling's talent in that despite being known for and spending so much time living in and building a world that is now so well know she is able to go in a completely different direction and write something so different."

author: b'N. Bery'
title: b'An Excellent Story of Characters'
body: b'I must admit I bought this book because I am a huge J.K. Rowling fan.'

author: b'Annalaura Brown'
title: b'Not that great'
body: b"I'm having a hard time finishing this book. It's got quite a few swear words as well which really bothers me and it's kind of boring. Being a big Harry Potter fan, I find it hard to believe that the same author even wrote this book."

author: b'kayhart'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I am an avid reader (I read every single night before bed no matter what) and was very excited about the potential of this book. Had been looking for a month for a good one.  My kids grew up on Harry Potter and all the hype about this "adult" content novel was overwhelming. Now I realize that it was just that, marketing/hype,  and I was sucked in.  I have been trying to read this book for several weeks.  It does not hold my attention and has so many characters that I have to re-read 3-4 pgs. back. each night.  I am now into it for the price of the book w/Amazon so I will continue to struggle through.  A  racket and a disappointment.  Waste of money.'

author: b'Pamela Hines'
title: b'the casual vacancy'
body: b'A very enjoyable read. I enjoyed how each character was woven into the plot as they interacted and influenced each other. Very reminicent of Maeve Binchy.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'The Spell Has Been Broken...'
body: b"First, I would like to preface this review by stating that I am an avid Harry Potter fan (I'm in Ravenclaw, if you must know), and maybe that was my problem -- my expectations were too high.  In HP, I genuinely cared about the characters.  I felt for them -- I felt connected or impacted in some way by each of them.  Even as an almost irrelevant character, I felt compassion and sadness for the father of Cedric Diggory when he was murdered.  Unfortunately, I cannot say the same about A Casual Vacancy."

author: b'Mary Ellen'
title: b'Such a disappointment.'
body: b"Such a disappointment. Knowing what a skilled writer JKR is and her amazing creativity I purchased this book with high expectations. What a let down. I found the characters to be dull and no one was likable so I didn't really care about them or their situations which were not very interesting anyway. The first fifty or so pages were just introducing the characters. I tried to read it to the end thinking it would improve as we went along but it didn't seem to be heading in that direction so I gave up. There are plenty of good books to read; why waste my time."

author: b'Sam Falkner'
title: b'Better than I Hoped'
body: b"I've always like J K Rowling's work, and wasn't sure what to expect here. I knew she was breaking genre. Would it be awkward? Would it work? I'm happy to find that it worked very well."

author: b'SPT2011'
title: b'Incredible descriptive writing - but just not for me'
body: b'This book is very well written. JK does not disappoint with her incredible descriptive writing. The imagery created while reading this book was the best I have ever experienced, along with the Harry Potter books.'

author: b'orcadeb'
title: b'A grim tale brilliantly written and narrated (audio version)'
body: b"I had been looking forward The Casual Vacancy and particularly the audio version read by the brilliant Tom Hollander ever since I first learned that he was doing it.  I may be a bit biased being a huge fan of anything Mr Hollander performs. He has the uncanny ability to paint a visual image of each character in whatever story he is reading. I am also a fan of JK Rowling and the two together are pure magic though not the Harry Potter type by any means. The story is grim and there are a lot of characters but somehow you become a part of their lives and by the end I found myself with tears in my eyes, wondering what they were doing after the story ended. In my opinion Ms Rowling has proven that she can write anything! I can't wait to see what is next!"

author: b'Higgie'
title: b'Human Nature'
body: b'J.K.Rowling\'s novel, "Casual Vacancy", should be on the book list of every psychology class in human nature.  She went right to the depth of who we are.  I am amazed at her insight and the way she wove a tapestry of human nature, in a pleasant read.'

author: b'Katie'
title: b'Boring!'
body: b"Had mediocre expectations for this book, despite loving the Harry Potter series, and I am still disappointed.  In my opinion, it has a very slow start, uses too much British slang (makes it difficult for an American audience to follow at times), is short on plot and a little on the dark side.  About 3/4 through and haven't finished it yet because I don't find it to be an enjoyable read.  I do not recommend it."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b"Pagford ain't no Hogwart's!"
body: b'Some reviewers have given this book one star based on the price, and while I will say it is much too expensive for a digital book, my review is based on the book itself.  Let me add that I was given this as a gift - I never would have paid so much for a digital copy.'

author: b'D. Williams'
title: b'Rowling can do SO much better than this'
body: b"THE CASUAL VACANCY, Rowling's first novel for an adult audience, takes place in an English village called Pagford.  A member of the parish council, Barry Fairbrother, has died suddenly of a brain aneurism, leaving the casual vacancy - the British term for the need to fill a vacated seat on the parish council."

author: b'Cathy'
title: b'Better than Harry Potter'
body: b"I read Harry Potter books and enjoyed them however Casual Vacancy is by far better written, and more interesting.  It definately attracts a different audience and maybe that is why some people are disappointed in the book.  Harry Potter fans will be disappointed in the down to earth plot (no wizardry) and more indepth character development. I think it was one of the best books I read this year. I couldn't put it down."

author: b'Patty L.'
title: b'Not as expected'
body: b"This book isn't exactly for adults. Teens could read it & learn from it. I wouldn't recommend anyone pay what I paid for it on kindle, that's for sure!!"

author: b'katielmr'
title: b'Only ok'
body: b"I bought this book asap because i am a huge fan of J.K.Rowling, however this book was nowhere near as captivating as any of the Harry Potters, I know they are in no way comparable but to be honest i haven't even brought myself to finish it, its a struggle to read."

author: b'navymomma26'
title: b'Confusing'
body: b'This time JK introduced too many characters at one time. The book is hard for me to follow and I would rather go back and read 50 Shades of Grey all over again. She should stick to young adult fantasy books.'

author: b'Lady D'
title: b'Fantastic book!!'
body: b'What I loved about this book is that each and every character is \'disgustingly human\'.  They are our friends and family, our neighbors and co-workers, and even ourselves.  Ms. Rowling reminds us that "the line between good and evil cuts through every human heart".'

author: b'Dr. Trish L.'
title: b'Disappointed.'
body: b'I was very excited waiting for JK Rowling\'s first adult book to be released---even pre-ordered it. The disappointment came from the fact that she is still writing about children, or should I say, adolescents in this case.  She did a wonderful job with character descriptions(and there were many), however, I was hoping that the plot would be over-the-top excitement. Next time I\'ll think twice about getting another one of her "adult-themed" books, if there is one.'

author: b'ECV'
title: b'Slightly dull'
body: b"A surprisingly dull offering which focuses on character descriptions for the first 100 pages. The latter half of this bleak book becomes slightly more engrossing. I am an avid fan of Rowling's writing but I was disappointed with this book.  I also think the sympathy with the teenage characters places this book more in the young adult genre -- it would seem that there are very few adults with any redeeming qualities I this tale."

author: b'Hounds of God'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'After 25 pages I was done. Not a prude, just tired of all the foul language. $$ down the drain.'

author: b'Lady on Corbin'
title: b'Engaging Read!'
body: b'Was very interested to see how JK Rowling would handle an adult book and was not disappointed. The characters were intricately drawn and captured your interest.  The twists and turns kept you wanting more.'

author: b'iphone4-toronto'
title: b'Glimpse of British village life'
body: b"I had heard a friend complain that this book was long, boring and depressing but I totally disagreed, I loved it!  It is not a fast-paced read, and it is not action-packed, but that's not what it's supposed to be.  It is a glimpse of a village in Britain which is small enough so that just about everyone knows just about everyone, or is connected in some way, and everyone gossips about everyone else, and everyone has an opinion (and feels superior to the opinions of others).  I also loved the separate worlds of the parents and the children, sort of like an upstairs-downstairs juxtaposition - the worlds are inextricable, but totally different."

author: b'KsanaO'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b'Reading the reviews here, I think that many of the readers are doing J.K. Rowling the supreme disservice of secretly hoping for an adult version of Harry Potter while reading this book.'

author: b'Karen'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'Reading this book was like watching an endless episode of Survivor in which you see the degradation of humanity.  It was the British commoners at their worse or "white trash" hypocrites.  I wanted to scream at those self-absorbed characters that if they hate their friends and family, leave the situation or change your own attitude!  The class distinctions, racism, and sordid swearing at family and friends in front of them and behind their backs was disgusting. I am no prude.  I swear occasionally but this was over the top!  I found the whole read boring and full of blue language with "f_ _ _ in\'" this and "f_ _ _ in\'" that.  The audiobook gave me a whole new insight to the uppercrust sound of British English.  They can cleaverly put you down or in your place with the most debonair of accents and witticisms.'

author: b'Donna Hartpence'
title: b'DWS Kindle Books'
body: b"This was a very interesting, even though sad, story from our favorite wizard Author, J K Rowling.  Though the plot was simple there are interesting character developments and interactions/links that made for a theme about people and their personalities and how what they did or didn't do had consequences that affected all of them.  There was a bit much obscene language but not so much that it made the reading a bad one. It was enjoyable and would recommend it to fans of Rowling and modern mystery, or social readers."

author: b'john kelso'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b'A Casual Vacancy is a good read. J.K.Rowling writes well for adults, too.  One criticism:  at times I had trouble keeping up with the characters. There were plenty of them, and they moved quickly from plot twist to plot twist. But the book was entertaining, and it struck at some serious points -- such as the ongoing  fight over how  the fortunate should deal with the downtrodden. The book spoke to the battle between those who want to help the poor, and those  who want to keep all their stuff and everybody else be damned. As a side note, American readers will pick up a lot of British speak from reading this book. Who knew that "shagging" means, well, never mind.'

author: b'SD'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy review'
body: b"No one can deny that J K Rowling is a talented, imaginative writer with great vision and the ability to create fascinating plots, realistic characters, inspiring settings and important themes; however, in her debut adult novel, some elements are less than stellar.  The basic premise, exploring the characters in two adjacent towns as they fight to fill a vacant council seat, has some merit, probably, but I had trouble distinguishing the characters and caring about them.  Eventually I did end up caring about a couple of them and Rowling succeeds in making them believable, but the theme is disheartening and the outcome depressing. Buy it to see how she writes for adults, but don't expect the quality or enchantment of the Harry Potter novels."

author: b'annie'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I could not get past page 30, I felt like I was reading Shades of Gray. If I could return this book I would in a heartbeat.'

author: b'ADDICUS'
title: b'Casual Vacancy, no wizardry here!'
body: b"J.K. wanted to get away from Hogwarts with Casual Vacancy, but where she went needs Harry's cloak.  I read 5 chapters and J.K. must have won a Quidditch Race and been awarded the universes's largest thesaurus.  J.K.'s chacters are many and without soul (who cares).  Five years in the making, Casual Vacancy reminds me of an open book essay question in high school where you don't want to leave any thing out and a one page assignment becomes a ludicrous"

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'not Harry'
body: b'A true English novel.This author never disapoints in settings, characters or plot.Was sad when it ended.Looking forward to the next book by this author.'

author: b'Chandler Foster'
title: b'WHAT???'
body: b'Ok... I have to admit, I bought the book because of the author.  In reality, I don\'t usually read books based in England.  However, I have to say it captured my attention and kept it throughout the book.  The characters were typical "little burg" mentality... and they were charming to say the least.  But the end... the end... came so abruptly, I felt like I had just walked off a cliff... no warning.. no logical end to the book.  (Hopefully, this is the author\'s way of telling us there will be a sequel.  So in short, it was a good read until the abrupt ending...'

author: b'ELS'
title: b'A moving work about politics and responsibility'
body: b"This book stands alone, bearing the mark of Rowling's talent without hearkening HP too directly. Yes, the end-of-chapter cliffhangers are still there, and so is the dark psychology of the characters; but this is no children's novel. The power of this book comes from its multi-voiced storytelling, through which the reader accesses the inner worlds of a web of community members, all of whom are inexorably self-absorbed, fearful, and suffering. You will recognize yourself in all of these characters-- the adults and their teenaged children. This book makes your heart race, your stomach churn, and your mind question. You will be caring about its characters long after you've read the final page. Flanked by funerals, this story is a distinct kind of 21st century tragedy that you won't soon forget."

author: b'Librarian'
title: b'Audience?'
body: b"If this was supposed to be a book for young adults, it may grab a few of them, but if it was supposed to be for adults, the author failed miserably.  It is boring, discombobulated and hard to stick with...it may be the first book I don't finish."

author: b'Jane Easterly'
title: b'A brilliant and powerful novel that is incredibly difficult to read'
body: b"Harry Potter author J.K. Rowling's new adult book The Casual Vacancy is a brilliant and powerful novel that is incredibly difficult to read. Rowling proves in this book what a skillful writer she is. She is able to create characters so complex, so multi-faceted, that it's hard to remember they aren't real."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Truly great read!'
body: b"I bought this book after reading several lukewarm reviews- mostly comparing this book to Rowlings previous works.  I decided to go into reading this as if I had never heard or, or read anything previously creating by the author. I loved this book!  The storyline is fantastic, and draws you in to all the families in the story.  You can't help but identify with the characters.  She shared with the reader a special talent in this book- showing depth for every character, and how you never really know someone or what has brought them to this place in life.  She took each character and gave you the good and bad that exists in all of us.  She also knows how to tell a story without giving away the plots too early."

author: b'Conitis'
title: b'After a slow start, a compelling read'
body: b"This was the first JK Rowling book I've read, but I had heard good things about from everyone who's read the Harry Potter books.  I found getting to know the characters in about the first quarter of book a rather slow affair. However, once I knew all the players the story really picked up and the book was hard to put down.  I really enjoyed developing strong feelings about the characters and really caring who would prevail in all the conflicts going on in Pagford.  I look forward to Ms. Rowling's next venture into adult novels."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Underwhelmed'
body: b'Not my favorite...I find her writing style difficult and her characters not well developed, or rather disjointed.  I am disappointed and would have returned the book had I purchased it traditionally.  Sorry...I had been anticipating its arrival....'

author: b'Ann Ominous'
title: b'Gritty'
body: b"I have never read a Potter book... That said, I found this to be a great read.  It was a bit difficult to grasp all the characters, went back a few times to reorient on who was who. Worth the effort. Not for kids, but that was made clear prior to it going on the shelves. It wasn't a happy story but you routed for the foul mouthed heroine all the same."

author: b'Dina @ All The Stacks'
title: b'Enjoyable Social Commentary'
body: b'I have so many thoughts about this book and must preface with a little bit about my own personal beliefs. I am a very political person (I am very active in county and state-wide politics). I would identify as a liberal. All that being said, I found The Casual Vacancy to be a well-written social commentary.'

author: b'Mariann Grace'
title: b'Disappointing... J.K. Rowling, please try again!'
body: b'Having read and re-read the richly allegorical Potter series, I was hoping for a novel as thought-provoking and endearing but at an adult level.  After reading 130 pages, "The Casual Vacancy" just doesn\'t deliver.  The characters aren\'t likable, or even interesting;  the drama and story seem pointless.  I really don\'t care what happens next, there is nothing compelling in the first 25% of the book that makes me want to keep reading.  Rowling describes her characters dispassionately, much like Stephen King... many times I actually felt like I was reading the beginning of a Stephen King novel, just waiting for the first sinister or other worldly event to occur!  The problem is:  nothing like that happens, and the only real horror lies in wasting one\'s time reading about these characters\' dreary, colorless lives and musings.'

author: b'E. Ollie'
title: b'An Emotional Ride'
body: b'JK Rowling knows how to create a world. I came to really care about the characters and their lives. This is not a "happily ever after" kind of tale, youll want to look elsewhere if youre looking for hufflepuffs and rainbows.'

author: b'zoshi'
title: b'Loved it!'
body: b'Chatty and immediately comfortable to read. It has well-observed characters, nowhere near as much profanity as some reviewers would have you believe, and a really decent, plausible story line. A really good holiday read - not highbrow "literature".'

author: b"Arya&Xander'sMom"
title: b'Whip Lash'
body: b'I, like so many others, was extremely intrigued about what JK Rowling wrote about in her newest novel.'

author: b'jocflier'
title: b'What a disappointment!'
body: b'Same detailed character development as the Potter series, but very poor plot development.  And I became seriously tired of reading about highly dysfunctional families.  Not an enjoyable book.'

author: b'Dr Agana'
title: b'The casual Rowling Reader: Not half bad'
body: b'Just because everything has been said about a book doesn\'t mean more can\'t be said, right? The first I\'d say (though certainly not the first to say it), looking at the number of reviews it has prompted in record time, is that if it weren\'t for this author, there wouldn\'t be that many. But neither would there be this well-rounded, engaging, fine story. So the standard for me was: Would there have been just "fine" shrugs, or more, with another, less-famous writer? Was J.K. Rowling under a particular obligation to write a better-than-fine book? If you\'ve read even one of her--here goes, I can\'t not mention it--Harry Potter books, you\'ve already pre-formed an opinion. I\'ve only read the first, and I thought this was better.'

author: b'Cathy Ann'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I WAS NOT looking for a Harry Potter repeat but what was described as a "dark comedy". The whole book would be better as a TV show like "Eastenders". I read & read waiting for something to happen, but read in vain. While well written it was very dull. It did make a point about poverty & Rowling\'s charitable cause of helping poor children & promoting literacy, but offered little else. The characters were well presented but the book as a whole can be missed. If you want to read it borrow it from your local library, J.K. Rowling & her publishers have enough money, save yours. For "dark comedy" I would encourage everyone to read Terry Pratchett\'s Discworld books. Best written satire on the planet!'

author: b'openmind'
title: b'no place to hide'
body: b'This first adult novel of J. K. Rowling has a Jane Austen-ish tone to it, in how it lays out the land, but that\'s where the similarity ends. Ms. Rowling sliced open all the souls to the core, revealing all of their weak and ugly sides to the degree that there\'s "no place to hide". She painted the pictures so clearly, not to mention deftly, sneaking up on you, that when outrage finally pours out it can afford to do so without any doubt or apology.'

author: b'nannie801'
title: b'What a bore!'
body: b'This book is so awful I quit reading after the first 20 pages...it seems that in order to be ADULT you have to be as crude and vulgar as possible with no story line in between the nastiness. Where did the writer go that wrote such engaging books that adults loved and read them right along with the tweens in the household? She certainly lost her muse with this thing...don\'t waste your time or money...I\'m taking it back tomorrow and having learned my lesson, will NEVER read anything she "writes" again.'

author: b'A. Wolcott'
title: b'Poor language choice'
body: b"So sorry to see that she has fallen for the F___ word.  I detest that word and it's use, multiple times, in the first chapter has encouraged me to throw the book in the garbage.  I will never buy another foul language book by Rowling as I am extremely sorry I wasted money on this trash."

author: b'Nikki'
title: b'A sad but good read'
body: b"This book is different than others because it follows about 15 different characters rather than just a few.  That made it hard to get into at first: remembering all of their names and backgrounds and connections was very confusing in the beginning.  But once I understood what was going on I found myself very drawn into what was happening.  I'll be honest- this isn't a very happy story.  There was a little bit of dark humor but also blatantly depressing points throughout the story, and it was all set against a slight political background which was interesting.  I think Rowling did a good job of showing how desperate people can be to achieve some sort of happiness, but I would have preferred a slightly happier tone."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Wonderful book!'
body: b'I don\'t understand the negative reviews that I read.  Yes, in the first part of the book there are a lot of characters to read about and digest but if the information wasn\'t there the rest of the book would not make sense.  Once I was past the first part, I absolutely devoured this book.  The story was in some ways dark but so is life.  I got "involved" in the plot to the point that I felt I was in the middle of the story myself.  It grabbed me in a way that few books have recently.  It wasn\'t a happily after after kind of story but that\'s part of what made it real and personal.  Real life doesn\'t have many "happily ever afters" either.  I hope Ms. Rowling writes another book for adults - I will be first in line.  Three cheers and five stars for THE CASUAL VACANCY!!'

author: b'Helen BB'
title: b'An engaging look at real life'
body: b"Casual Vacancy was a page turner from the beginning. The characters are well rounded and engaging. I feel sure I have met many of them in my time. For the people who are critical, I suspect you need to move on from Harry Potter.  Yes - they were fantastic books, but so is this. I'd say this is neither better nor worse than Harry Potter - just different. JK truly is talented to be able to write such diverse works - no one trick pony."

author: b'VBH'
title: b'I sooo wanted to like this book'
body: b"It was just a struggle to read. I kept hoping that there would be a point to the story but there didn't seem to be. JK Rowling writes well, no doubt about that but the characters in this book just seemed flat and uninteresting."

author: b'Alice'
title: b'I loved it!'
body: b"I loved this book.  It is very internal which I adored - lots of what people are thinking versus how they are acting, their motives, how they view those around them and why (I would love to be - and a little scared of being! - JK Rowling's friend.  She is so perceptive!  I would constantly be wondering how she was assesing me, ha!).  Very well written.  I devoured this."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b"very difficult to read,didn't have any sort of flow,too many characters waffling on about nothing."

author: b'Potter Fan'
title: b'Boring, had to force myself to finish it.'
body: b"A dark story about life in a small town. The emphasis seemed to be on the struggles of teenagers, perhaps that was the target audience, not adults? I'm sorry I bought the book."

author: b'Craig Waldon'
title: b'A good read'
body: b'I like her writing style. Very descriptive and I really enjoyed the book as the characters slowly revealed themselves. The story had to end somewhere but I found the ending a little disappointing. It seemed to wrap everything up too quickly. Perhaps I wanted more, did not want the book to end!'

author: b'walnut'
title: b'Getting motivated to move on is a struggle'
body: b"It's been a real struggle to read this book.  I really have to push myself to pickup where I left off......I can't believe that I am only 10% thru the book.  Very slow..."

author: b'H. Thomas'
title: b'The threads of hope are thinly woven'
body: b'As a huge fan of the HP series, it was a surprise to read Casual Vacancy.  The plot was sound, but the only character with any redeeming features such as compassion or kindness died in the first few pages.  I found it impossible to care what happened to a cast of such mean-spirited people.  Only the teenagers had any depth, and I kept waiting for something good to happen, for some to have a change of heart and grow. Disaster heaps upon disaster and what little hope arises is too little, too late. The book ends as it begins, with death.'

author: b'Stacye P. Murphy'
title: b'Welcome to the real world'
body: b'First two things, this is not Harry Potter and its not a comedy.  It is one of the best written books I have read in a while and I applaud Rowling for going to this little perfect town and exposing  the closed doors and minds of its inhabitants. These people do walk among us and if we look inside ourselves deeply we might even be them.  Excellent read!'

author: b'Mark Twain'
title: b'Great read'
body: b'I don\'t know why everyone is comparing this to Harry Potter. It is not Harry Potter. It\'s a new book. I believe it would have received better reviews if it was an unknown author. I thought it was a "great read."'

author: b'SuzieDoozie'
title: b'Brilliantly Unexpected Tale of Humanity and the Lack Thereof'
body: b'I am a huge fan of "Harry Potter"... I\'m talking HUGE--As in, I\'ve read all the books several times and I listen to the audio books often.  Most people have the radio, I listen to Grammy Award Winning Jim Dale read J.K. Rowling\'s seven-book masterpiece.  That being said, I was excited and at the same time very wary when news broke that Rowling was writing a new book unrelated to Harry Potter.  How could she measure up to a standard she had already set so high, and in a genre so different from what she\'s always written?'

author: b'KSDisque'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy or a Colossal Waste of Time ?'
body: b"Horrible, depressing, pointless book.  The characters were despicable in general, and never fully developed.  The story drags along.  For American readers, lots of British slang which didn't always make sense."

author: b'Dooley'
title: b'You requested a star so I gave it one. I would not normally give it anything!'
body: b'I regret purchasing this book.  It is dreadful.  The language and smarmy descriptions were not what I expected from J K Rowling.'

author: b'Usha Rajendran'
title: b'A disappointment!!!'
body: b"Rowling is disappointing in this book. Though it is interesting in parts and has an easy flow, I wouldn't recommend this book. I do hope her next book will be interesting as she IS a good writer."

author: b'gardengirl'
title: b'Dull, depressing, unengaging'
body: b"I started this book with great anticipation and kept reading hoping I would eventually begin to find it interesting, enjoyable, etc. This never happened. I could have cared less for the characters. The plot was a snore. Perhaps not living in England makes it more difficult for me to embrace the story. I still look forward to Ms. Rowling's next writing project."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'An insightful glimpse into the lives of others (and maybe ourselves)'
body: b'As with most others, I had to calm my inner craving for more Harry Potter and try to move on.  After I was able to do that, I was impressed and was able to enjoy A Casual Vacancy.'

author: b'Stacey R. Willman'
title: b'Casual Vacancy left me feeling vacant.'
body: b'I read books to escape my world for a little bit.  When you read a book, you do not want to go to a world that is worse than your own and without adventure.'

author: b'D. Holmer'
title: b'I think it wanted to be "Confederacy of the Dunces"'
body: b'Who doesn\'t love JK Rowling?  I have no joy in criticizing her work here, but I think this is a book that tried too hard to reflect something the author wasn\'t.  I think Rowlings had in mind to craft a comedy like "Confederacy of Dunces" but didn\'t digest it enough for the end result to go in as "in-your-face disgusting human behavior" and come out as art.  It was all just too raw.  Why so raw?  She is skilled enough to write a "Confederacy of Dunces" type book.  But this one makes me think of the ingenue actress who spends years on the big screen becoming the world\'s sweetheart and then decides she wants to be known for deeper work, but rather than doing deeper work she bares her breasts on screen.  I always feel a little embarrassed for her when she does that.'

author: b'A. G. Mattocks-lewis'
title: b'Great read'
body: b'I have to admit, I was a little apprehensive about reading this book as even as an adult i just loved the Harry Potter books. However from the first opening lines i had put aside my reservations and immersed myself into this book. I thought it was a fast paced and complex read.
