I loved the book start to finish and even though I could see what was going to happen it still had my heart in my mouth and a little tear in my eye by the end. There have been mixed reviews about this book, but I would suggest you read it for yourself and give it a try. I loved it'

author: b'Pam Quattrone'
title: b'Boring and long!'
body: b"I was so disappointed in this novel. I was expecting much more. It was very long, and I had to force myself to keep reading it ( because once I start a book I have to finish it). Toward the end it got a little exciting but that didn't make up for the rest of it."

author: b'Michael Burke'
title: b'Yay!'
body: b'I loved the writing in Harry Potter and I am not disappointed here. The plot:  a dead council members job needs filling. More than politics, Fraught with internecine and family and friends conflict.  She has painted the feelings and personalities every bit as engaging as the Potter books. And there is adult language.'

author: b'Bruno P. Baumberger'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'After having been thrilled by 6 large Harry Potter volumes, I bought the book the first day expecting a similar experience. I fought through the first 80 pages of the new book. I found it boring and I gave up. I will give it another try at some later time.'

author: b'Peter Garganese'
title: b'the Casual Bore'
body: b'I was finally going to read a J.K. Rowling book, but was somewhat disappointed. This book is kind of boring!'

author: b'Dixie Grace'
title: b'A British Peyton Place?'
body: b'What a great read!  While the premise of the book (the multi-faceted relationships between folks in a small town) has been done before, this one is set in a small village in England, which lends it an entirely different feel.  J. K. Rowlings continues to write beautifully, with some lines so finely sculpted you want to go back and read them a second and third time. You get the impression that Ms. Rowlings knows life in a small town intimately, with all the ugliness and pettyness that that entails.  The many characters are very well developed, but you find yourself wanting to read on to learn even more about them.  Looking forward to what she comes up with next!'

author: b'boliveras'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'Stop reading cause it not what they said it was. Fifty shades was a better book. This one is not good at all'

author: b'Pink'
title: b'Interesting characters and story'
body: b"I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews on the profanity and subject matter, this is no different that a lot of other adult fiction books I have read.  That being said, this book has very interesting, if not very likeable characters.  I had a hard time deciding which one I disliked the most!  Some are pretty despicable. The story is interesting too.  I like the way each chapter is from a different person's point of view."

author: b'Floo Powder'
title: b'What was she thinking?'
body: b'I waited on pins and needles for this book to come out and bought it on the first day it went on sale.  I sat down with it and got about half way through and decided to see what other people thought about the book.  OK, so I\'m not the only one who thinks this book belongs no where else but the trash bin!  But I read on thinking there has to be a point to all the swearing and "shagging".  Nope!  I finished the book and its in the trash where it belongs.  I\'ve never read a more pointless book in my life.  Again, what was she thinking???'

author: b'Larissa'
title: b'A much-needed story of truth'
body: b"As a teacher of English literature, I'm thrilled by The Casual Vacancy. The characters are rich and captivating. The story is intricate and honest. I can't wait to invite my students and colleagues to explore their own reality mirrored in this monumental literary triumph. Do yourself a favor, and allow the truth of Rowling's masterpiece to pierce the thick wall of your existence."

author: b'fifie'
title: b'The casual vacancy'
body: b'This was a fabulous read - while I havent read the Potter series I now understand why she is considered one of this century`s great writers.  The development of the characters combined with the ability to make you like them one moment, feel sorry for them the next moment and then hate them a second later is a rare gift in writing. Her ability to weave so many stories yet keep the plot tight is also very good. From memory I think I was told it was light hearted comedy - dont be fooled by this description - yes there are some laughs but Rowling isnt afraid to go to some very dark places yet manages to leave you feeling uplifted and retain your faith in the human race.'

author: b'Anne G. Henry'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"One of the best books I have read in years.  Adult language and situations but reflects life as some people must live it.  One of those you can't put down."

author: b'Gabrielle McCann'
title: b'Loved it'
body: b'AS soon as I finished this book I immediately started it again! I loved how Jo drew you in as a reader - I wanted to find out more about the characters. Great book!'

author: b'Berecca'
title: b'I know these people.'
body: b"This book was not as novelly as I had expected because it was impossible for me to really care about any of the characters.  The story had too many weak entanglements and I thought it ended quite abruptly.  There wasn't one main character, really, but a variety of background characters of greater or lesser importance."

author: b'Jessica B.'
title: b'Quite frankly the characters are boring'
body: b"Before I start my review, I want to make it clear that I only read 25 pages of this book (and it took me 5 days to even get that far because it wasn't keeping my interest). I also want to make it clear that in my life I have not finished about 6 books and this is one of them."

author: b'E. Smiley'
title: b'Brilliant in unexpected ways'
body: b'This is not my usual genre. For me books about modern life generally fall into at least one of the following categories: pretentious, boring, saccharine or trashy. So I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed this book, which I read out of curiosity; in fact I was completely sucked in, living in the book rather than merely reading it.'

author: b'anthony scandiffio'
title: b'dribble'
body: b'This book is very slow and so tedious to get involved with.'

author: b'Lori'
title: b"It's a mediocre read"
body: b"I am a big fan of the Harry Potter series and as such, I was not expecting anything like that from Rowling's first adult book but I WAS expecting a riveting tale and The Casual Vacancy just isn't.  I read a couple of books a week and get into the characters pretty fast, but I kept forgetting who everyone was and that's not normal in a book of about 500 pages.  It's not a bad story, but it's not a great story either.  The characters in her other books (HP) make them great books but the characters in TCV were nothing special.  I wanted so much to love this book.  I didn't.  :("

author: b'Sean Hallissey'
title: b'Disappointing...'
body: b'While I understand that, unlike the Harry Potter series, "The Casual Vacancy" is to be an adult novel.  Unfortunately "The Casual Vacancy" just hasn\'t captured my attention like Harry Potter.  I will most likely finish it because I paid for it, but this makes me sad.  I wonder why I am wasting my time. J.K. Rowling is a goof zuthor, but I think her niche is Children\'s Liturarure.'

author: b'Rebecca W.'
title: b'Loved it!!!'
body: b"I absolutely loved this book!!! It is nothing at all like the HP books and it stands very well on it's own. I had to double check the author a few times because it is so different."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Not worth the 3 days I wasted on it'
body: b"I was looking forward to reading this book, but as I kept reading, I kept thinking, it's got to get better...it never did.  J.K. Rowlings' Harry Potter series was so well written, clever and insightful.  This book is just diappointing--there is more dysfunction than a Real Housewives show---I kept reading just to be able to say that I'd read it all the way through--and secretly hoped there would be a better storyline as I read.  J.K. Rowling should stick to what she does best---this isn't her finest hour."

author: b'kenusee'
title: b'Muggles in Dystopia: a disturbing read, but it will stay with you'
body: b'When I read the Harry Potter books, I thought they were beautifully crafted. I bought this book because I wanted to see what J. K. Rowling would give us next.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Beautifully Tragic'
body: b'Barry Fairbrother\'s death is the catalyst that changes the lives of numerous people in the small village of Pagford.  JK Rowling has intricately woven together seemingly unrelated characters in her first "adult" novel.  She tells with heartbreaking honesty about the lives of both adults and teenagers in a small English town (that could just as easily be in America).  At the heart of the tangle of lives is Krystal and Robbie Weedon and Barry Fairbrother\'s death was the beginning of the end for them too.  Husbands and wives, fathers and sons, all of their secrets are revealed and you just might recognize yourself in one of these oh-so-human characters.  There is no magic to make their lives more bearable (but magic never did that at Hogwarts either) and people learn that they must live with the consequences of their actions, or lack of action in some cases.'

author: b'Katie M'
title: b'Kept Reading Expecting It To Get Better'
body: b'I pre-ordered this book on the assumption that any work from her would be very good, and quite possibly great.  I was wrong.  It is not that good, and certainly not a great read.  It is one of those books, that the reader sticks with, expecting it to get better, or expecting at the end to realize it made a point or an impact.  Again, to me - it did not.  To me it was a mediocre soap opera.  A story that might play better on screen, in a series like Desperate Housewives, than written as a novel by an author as noted as J.K. Rowling.'

author: b'Forget Housework, Read!'
title: b'Making a great story out of "normal dysfunctional" families!'
body: b'Alot of characters introduced quickly, but once you get into it a great and fast read.  Suggest you write down the couples names as they are introduced in the book with a key word to remember them, or you will find yourself going back chapters to remember them and their "dysfunction" (which is harder to do reading via the Kindle.)  This is especially a help if you don\'t read alot in one sitting.'

author: b'Deb'
title: b'Disappointing'
body: b'In spite of high hopes, this foray into the adult genre lacked a story line that would have been expected of Rowling.  While the characters had the depth she so exquisitely bestows in her writing, I found the storyline uninspiring and the mood of the entire novel to be bitter and depressing.'

author: b'Lady Judith'
title: b"Rowling's new venture"
body: b"I don't know what I expected, but was rather sad after reading this book. I expected so much more.  The writing was fine, and the intertwining of the characters was good, but just too English for me, I guess. My personal opinion would ask that the author should stick to fantasy. I am glad I read it but will not be on my re-read list."

author: b'Ames'
title: b'Loved it.'
body: b"I've read a lot of books this year. Some have been multiple narrators, most have not. I'm a big fan of the multiple perspective genre that seems to be becoming more popular these days, and absolutely loved this book. As for everyone saying that the characters did not hold their attention, I can not disagree more. The characters were so realistic and detailed, and the writing was fantastic. The characters were exaggerated for entertainment, rather, they were very much like you and I, but perhaps some a bit more gritty. It was a wonderful story that I would definitely read again."

author: b'H. R. Allen'
title: b'Just realize this is by no means a childrens book!'
body: b'I will attempt to leave no spoilers. I hate reading reviews with spoilers.'

author: b'Francis'
title: b'Gritty plot a long way from Harry'
body: b'JK Rowlings new book has achieved her objective of being a long step away from the Harry Potter series.  It is a gritty novel which is unyielding to sentiment.'

author: b'Carolyn Zalon'
title: b'Much Awaited Book'
body: b"In J. K. Rowling's book Casual Vacancy, we experience the author's release from the restrictions of writing for children. As many authors and actors eagerly admit when they get to go to HBO, it is a relief to swear brazenly and discuss all sorts of questionable topics and not worry about censor.  Rowling's teenage characters exercise great hostility and disillusionment towards the adults closest to them as adult failings are literally advertised one by one. Rowling also takes on the tension ever present between the haves and the have nots and brings up the topic of entitlement so much part of the current presidential debate in the U.S. The novel is a serious look at reality."

author: b'Viv'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This book holds your attention all the way through, although with so many characters i did sometimes get confused as to who was whom sometimes, but very good reading'

author: b'Etexan'
title: b'Casual author'
body: b'I have read all of the Harry Potter series and loved them . This book is boring at the beginning and gets worse.'

author: b'Parispony'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'Full of caricature rather than character with many reminiscences of Harry Potter characters it is an easy read but not a compelling one.'

author: b"Rascal's mom"
title: b'Horrid Book'
body: b"This is one of the worst books I have ever read.  There is not one sympathetic/likeable character; the book has no redeeming quality.  The profanity just seems to be gratuitous.  I really hate that I pre-ordered the book because I enjoyed the Harry Potter series so much.  Now I've paid more for this Kindle edition than for any other I've purchased.  If I had a hard copy I would just throw it away; donating it would just make it available for someone else to waste their time on."

author: b'the casual reader'
title: b'Dont Waste Your Time'
body: b'I was drawn to this book because of my love of the Harry Potter series. I of course knew that it wouldnt be anything like the Harry Potter series, but my respect for JK Rowling and her ability to transport me to another world through her writing was what I expected. I must admit, I hated this book.  I knew that this was written for adults, but come on.  The language, the graphic sexual content, and frankly the boring topic made it impossible for me to complete the book.  The question I have is if JK Rowling did not have the previous successes that she already had, would this book even have been published?  My opinion is no.'

author: b'Millie'
title: b'A Good Yarn'
body: b'I enjoyed this story but found the number of characters confusing especially in the first half of the book. Still worth the read  !!'

author: b'Margaret'
title: b'pl'
body: b'This was a decent book, not nearly as entertaining as her Harry Potter books.  The problem is that her characters were too cartoonish and none had any redeeming charachteristics so that you wanted them to do well.  It was a bit disappointing.'

author: b'CatieOlovestoRead'
title: b'Big Shoes to Fill'
body: b'I tried not to think of this book as a JK Rowling book-- because there was really just no way it could compare with Harry Potter.'

author: b'Big Griff'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Having returned reciently from England I find this look into West Country English life very interesting.  The Characters play very well and the insights into young minds facinating. Unfortuniately, the portrail of adolicent morals is all too close to the mark.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Somewhat disappointed'
body: b"I have long been a fan of JK Rowling and was delighted to see a new book from her. I couldn't wait to get started and the first few pages with her typical way with lush descriptions of characters didn't disappoint."

author: b'Translucent'
title: b'hmm'
body: b"You know, J. K. Rowling has a huge amount of talent, and if you use Tolstoy's definition of art as something that makes you feel as if you were right there, then Ms. Rowling is definitely an artist.  Yet I hate every character in her book.  They could use some magic all right, but there isn't any to be had.  It was an extremely depressing experience, reading this book, and that is because of the author's extreme gifts.  I noticed, incidentally, that she still most values the Gryffindor mentality.  Courage and loyalty still seem to be her most admired qualities.  But other than that, such human misery!  Well-drawn, well-observed, yes.  Enjoyable to read, well, I'm not so sure."

author: b'Wendy Buckley'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I was very disappointed in this book. The foul language was unnecessary, and I felt took away from the story. I have not read the Harry Potter series, but I expected more, given that her books were so popular.'

author: b'Joan M. Williams'
title: b'None'
body: b'I found this book to be a great disappointment.  The writing was excellent but the story was very unimportant except to the characters themselves.  Rowling killed off the only truly likeable characters at the end.  It was difficult to remember all of the characters and keep their relationships straight.'

author: b'Book Mother'
title: b'Too depressing'
body: b'I read this book because I loved the Harry Potter books.  This book is not nearly as well-written or easy to follow, nor is is nice to read.  There is really not a redeeming person in the book; there is no joy; there is no real redemption.  It is sad and depressing to think that everyone in the world has such serious problems as those that JK writes about here.  I finished it, but had to force myself.'

author: b'Di'
title: b'Poor'
body: b'Was really disappointed in the boook.  It has not grabbed my attention.  Wish I would of downloaded the free part of the book before purchasing'

author: b'kim m fowler'
title: b'a very SLOW read!'
body: b"First book in some time that i haven't finished.  I read at least a book a week and after 6 chapters, i had to move on.  Hard to follow; and just not all that interesting!"

author: b'Mark Twain'
title: b'JK Rowling'
body: b'Very good read; Rowling is obviously capable of stringing a lot of detail behind the plot.  I was not aware of this kind of ability to craft a novel.'

author: b'AshleyP'
title: b'JK Book Review'
body: b'This is an excellent book from JK Rowling as a first novel for adults. As a huge adult fan of the Harry Potter series, this lives up to every one of my expectations! Worth every penny!'

author: b'M. H. Bayliss'
title: b'A bit of a chore to get through'
body: b'I tried to read this book with no preconceived ideas about what JK Rowling might write. Judged on its own merit independent of the HP series, this book is DARK. Rape, drug addition, seriously disturbed characters,viscous family relations, compulsion disorders around pedophilia, self inflicted cutting... this is not a light read. There are more messed up teens and parents in this small town than seems humanly possible. If that\'s the point that everyone is a hypocrite and has a hidden agenda, then she made that point well. That being said, the writing was sharp, the intertwined lives of the characters well conceived, the depiction of the town was vivid, but I found that I had to will myself to finish the book, mostly because there are really no sympathetic characters in the whole lot of them. You end up alternating between feelings of intense dislike mixed with pity for most of the characters and that fact kept me from really enjoying the book. I feel like I survived a 3 day ordeal just by finishing. My conclusion is that JK Rowling is a very perceptive writer with a sharp grasp of people\'s character flaws, but deep down I wished she\'d touched upon some redeeming features of humanity. I felt like I needed a shower after finishing this book. Sure, she brings up many important social issues but you have to prepare yourself for a bleak few hundred pages. Whatever comedy there is more along the lines of "funny/sad" not funny/funny.'

author: b'booklover'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I have just read Casual Vacancy and while I enjoyed it some of the english words were confusing. I am waiting for the next book by her.'

author: b'Laura0417'
title: b'Great characters!'
body: b"First of all, let me just say, not about Harry Potter = Boo!! But once I got over the hope that Harry would make an apperance in this book...:) I really enjoyed this book. The subject matter is definitely gritty at times, but very real. Too real. Definitely an adult book. But the way J.K. Rowling writes the characters is amazing. Even the characters you hate, are perfect. The story sucked me in right away, and the way it all is pulled together in the end is amazing. I especially loved how each character is tied to the others, through someone who knows someone, or someone's kid works for another character, or their kids are friends, and their stories cris cross back and forth at different paths, each character touching another's lives in different ways, whether for good or bad. Highly recommend this book as a great story, written by the best, but be ready for lots of swearing, descriptive drug use, and sexual situations."

author: b'JCW'
title: b'give or take'
body: b"This book is so-so. It wasn't something that I would read again. Maybe all the pre-release hype made it anti-climatic for me but it didn't hold my interest."

author: b'Judi B'
title: b'Save your money.'
body: b'First, let me preface this with I loved the Harry Potter series.  It is hard to believe that this was written by the same author.  This book was a major disappointment to me. I have only stopped reading a couple of novels in my 64 years and this was one of them.  I made it about as far as I could.  Enough said.'

author: b'Janice L Smith'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Too many characters,  plot is confusing and doesn't seem to flow together with all the different scenarios going on.  Lost interest"

author: b'Lyndac'
title: b'Very good, but could be better than very good'
body: b"There's a large number of characters and that you get to know as each chapter or section moves on, this is enjoyable, you become involved in people you can believe in. The build up of the story is slow and precise, soon you're living in the fictional world and are less and less surprised as the characters unfold. My only disappointment is that the end came - well, too close to the end. I'd have liked to approach the end of the story more slowly, to have had more time to revel in it."

author: b'Eileen Engle'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Well written. Rowlings captures the diverse personalities of the town's characters and their foibles.  Poignant in the descriptions of the intertwined relationships of the characters."

author: b'T. Anderson'
title: b"Dark but couldn't put it down"
body: b"Loved this book.  While many of the characters were pretty unlikeable, I still couldn't wait to see what happened to them.  Ms. Rowling is a consummate storyteller and this book is no different from HP in that regard.  It's dark, yes.  It's certainly not for kids but really, can't we all recognize a bit of each of these creeps in some of the people we run into in our daily lives?  Their innermost thoughts are just what I imagine certain acquaintances and co-workers have in their heads too! :-)  I look forward to more books in the adult genre from Ms. Rowling."

author: b'Mary'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Disappointed!  I loved the Harry Potter series, but this book never reached that level.  Far from it.  Sorry I wasted my time.'

author: b'Rod Petree'
title: b'Lost Time'
body: b'I did not see any plot or purpose to the book. It probably would interest a female (I\'m male) reader more because it is oriented toward people and familys. It is well written but I do not think it is JK\'s style. I would like to see her do a continuation of "The Girl with the Dragon Tatoo" series.'

author: b'Mickey'
title: b'1st book of J.K. Rowling I have read'
body: b'I saw all of the Harry Potters movies and enjoyed them. The first few more than the last ones. I know people who have read her books and was told how wonderful they were, so I was excited to read a book of hers. She is a good writer but the theme of this book was not my cup of tea.'

author: b'Barbara A'
title: b'Addictive'
body: b"I am still reading this first book for adults by J. K. Rowling but totally absorbed in the characters she has painted with glorious color, humor, flaws, jealousy and survival.  It's a story about years of the rich dominating the poor,  as well as about detached parents and angry kids. I have not arrived at the resolution of all the issues brewing, but strongly feel that I will be delighted at the end of the book."

author: b'Bookreporter'
title: b'Readers expecting the charm and magic of Harry Potter are in for a surprise'
body: b'Imagine for a moment that you are J.K. Rowling. Your internationally bestselling novels about an orphan boy who attends an imaginary school for wizards and witches, over which you labored for 10 years, have sold hundreds of millions of copies. They have been translated into 73 languages and turned into eight blockbuster movies. Harry Potter is now and probably will remain a household name for decades. You are reportedly the richest woman in England (even richer than your queen), quite possibly the world. You are A-listed for every conceivable event on the planet. Would you rest on your laurels, perhaps buy a private jet and a yacht or two, and tour the world?'

author: b'Safira925'
title: b'A Haunting Psychological Perspective of a Small Town'
body: b'So everyone knows JK Rowling wrote Harry Potter, and that this is her first adult-only novel, and that it is nothing like Harry Potter, right? I have to wonder if the shift in style, as well as the anticipated release ( and subsequent reality of the preceding facts) has prompted all these one-star reviews. Honestly people, we were warned!'

author: b'PatE'
title: b'Better then expected'
body: b'Although it took me a few chapters to become engaged with this book, I am now looking forward to every opportunity to read it.  The characters are well developed.  Although one can sense where the story is leading it stills hold my interest.  No doubt this will end up on a best-seller list.'

author: b'BrandyWinn'
title: b'Wonderfully Gritty'
body: b'Definitely not Harry Potter, but just as engaging for adults.  And it is for adults only.'

author: b'SteinbeckFan2010'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"Not the Rowling I know and grew to love. Such a complete letdown. 15% through the book and none of the characters were interesting enough to make me want to read more. I don't usually leave books unfinished, but unfortunately this is one of the very few that belongs to that pile."

author: b'nancy of new york'
title: b'Terrible'
body: b'This is a really sick view of humanity. There is not one decent intelligent character. Very disappointed. Rowling could have so much more imaginative in character development'

author: b'Wendy Napier'
title: b'Not what I was expecting'
body: b"Interesting story, but not at all what I was expecting, very slow in the beginning, with an abrupt ending. Don't know that I'll even read it again."

author: b'Joan'
title: b'Casual Vancency Disappointing'
body: b'I was very disappointed with this book. To me it was very depressing and I had to force myself to finish the book. I am a great fan of Rowling, but this is one book that I would not recommend...'

author: b'Shelly Horton'
title: b'Surprising'
body: b'I warmed slowly to the book at first but by the end I thought it was genius. I was amazed at the raw emotions, abject poverty, and despair she talked about and yet it is supposed to be a dark comedy.  I work with kids (and their parents) who are socially comparable to her characters from "the Fields" and I felt it too realistic to get much humor from it. It is also a story on race and political issues and that part was funny but at the same time, I felt, a window into the sad reality of how social climbing and power can be so very corruptive. Overall I was captured by the characters.'

author: b'lily'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I am finding it difficult to finish this book chiefly because I consider it to be young adult/teenage material. It is slow moving and does not for me have adult appeal.'

author: b'Ksenia Anske'
title: b"Bitter, sarcastic, delicious, nasty. This is J.K. Rowling you don't know."
body: b"Bitter, sarcastic, delicious, nasty. This is J.K. Rowling you don't know. Ghastly, loving, disgusting, bleak, sensual, murderous, lusty. This is J.K. Rowling you never read. Real, human, mundane yet complex and heartbreaking, The Casual Vacancy is a story of one man who did more by dying then he did by living, a story penned over an idyllic English town that is all sparkle on the surface but rotten guts inside. Or is it? What J.K. Rowling did here is take the grit of ordinary life and elevate to the heights of beauty, with all of its daily drama, dirty politics, gossip, abuse, neglect, rape, violence, drug addiction, bullying. The list goes on. Rest assured, every aspect of our imperfection is touched upon, and masterfully at that."

author: b'Judijudi65'
title: b'What were you thinking?'
body: b'J.K., what were you thinking?  A mundane book with unforgettable boring characters in a trite story.  That her characters are unforgettable is usually a good thing however, this book was so trite and depressing I wish I could forget the characters...unfortunately they stay with you long after the story is over and not in a good way.'

author: b'BookCity2012'
title: b'Very Well WRITTEN but NOT for the faint at heart'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy is a very well written book. The breaks in the chapters are all lead into by the character mentioned in the previous section. Its a rather clever way to wright. It goes round in circles and makes the story very easy to read. The characters are complex and there are sublites to the story that you have to think on. The Casual Vacancy it may be but the book is anything but casual.'

author: b'reader'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Very slow, language not good, characters not interesting or appealing.  Difficult to finish, she should have stuck with Harry Potter.'

author: b'sweet girl'
title: b'DISSAPPOINTED TO SAY THE LEAST'
body: b"After watching Rowlings on TV interview, was very anxious to get book from local library. Put name on the waiting list and hurried to library once called.  There is NO WAY I can make myself finish reading the dull, dreary, depressing book.  Only half way through I have taken notes and there are 47 characters thus far! I have really, really tried hard to get into this book.  I stopped to come read reviews here to see if it was just me.  Thank goodness I'm not going crazy and others feel as I do."

author: b'Jenni Bellin'
title: b'Because she can'
body: b'With great interest and excitement I began this first non-Potter from Jo Rowling, and it did not disappoint. Both sad and entertaining, it is a social commentary on small town culture and the danger of taking oneself too seriously. Jo has that knack of familiarising you so well with a character in such a short span, that even if you cannot like them, you empathise. One cannot help but become involved, rather then just merely objectively viewing the story as a whole. I hope she keeps writing. I for one, am sold.'

author: b'C. Fazio'
title: b'Overblown and overrated'
body: b'Expectations were high that JKR could transition from Harry to adults.  Disappointed with the results. An easy read but not of the quality we have grown to expect from this author.'

author: b'OhioPat'
title: b'Great new read from Rowling'
body: b'J. K. Rowling has brought her considerable talents to adult fiction.  There is much to laugh, cry, and think about in The Casual Vacancy.  This is a book I would read again.'

author: b'hearthside'
title: b'Wow! Wow! Wow!'
body: b'Amazing book!  Rowling captures the "real" world - the world of liberals & conservatives, bullies & victims, rich & poor, old & young - in her first adult novel "The Casual Vacancy".  Her characters are fully realized, flawed members of the human race with all their capacity for love & kindness as well as mean-spirited stupidity.  Rowling has successfully created the same kind of magic here that she brought to "Harry Potter": she has invented fictional people who become real to the reader.  These are characters to love, to hate, and to mourn.  This is a place to live in and know - the way we know our own home town - and the way we know Hogwarts.  A fantastic achievement!  I can\'t wait to share this book with my adult friends who\'ve grown up with Harry Potter!'

author: b'B. Holley'
title: b'PHENOMENAL'
body: b"What a great book. I am a huge JK Rowling fan and was wondering how her next offering would fare. It is totally different than her beloved Potter series and it is just wonderful. What a great voice she gives to the community and how wonderfully she weaves her spell of the impact that a death has on everyone involved. She ends it all wrapped up in a huge bow of satisfaction for this reader. Next?? I can't wait."

author: b'M. Blades'
title: b'Back in Little Whinging...'
body: b'It was well written and I did enjoy it. That said, I did prefer the HP series to this offering by J.K. (which is probably my preference in books over any flaw in the writing). All in all, a good read, but if fantasy/upbeat comedy is your thing you just might be sorely disappointed.'

author: b'Krissy'
title: b'Disapointing, waste of time and money.'
body: b'I reserved this book the moment I heard about it and anxiously awaited the release date.  It was a huge disapointment.  There are way too many characters and to make it even more difficult they are all dull and have nothing really remarkable about them.  Their names seem similar (or perhaps I was just that confused) and then adding in the various nick names for the various characters who have nothing exciting about them, I spent most of the book thinking "now who the hell is this?"  I wanted to tough it out and get through the book in case something got exciting, but it never happened.  It was a long, painful read.'

author: b'kennglen'
title: b'Compelling'
body: b"This was not a children's story, but it was a great read, and I found I could not put it down until it was finished."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Bad Parents Beware.  Retributions can be severe'
body: b'The things these English parents did do their children without even thinking about them finally caused the downfall of careers, and worse, a death of a young teen who was on the brink of being saved by the one person who cared about her and died an untimely death.  I think Rowling harbors a great deal of anger in her soul towards adults who are unkind, uncaring, and unfeeling towards their children.  This was evident in the Harry Potter series, but the young had recourse to magic.  In this book, the young have no recourse other than revenge by anonymous internet sabotage of the adults who have been monstrous or just plain stupid in their dealings with children and teens.  Personally, as I grew up, adults around me were so engrossed and occupied with their own problems, hang-ups and leftover hurts from their own childhoods, they were not able to see their own children objectively'

author: b'Some Chick'
title: b'A Big Novel'
body: b'Just finished J.K.Rowling\'s "The Casual Vacancy".  I\'d say it is the antithesis of Harry Potter.  Hard read (compared to HP), cast of dozens and all omniscient up in there (though I luv watching skilled writers break rules, as a writer myself I kept mentally whispering "No Sir!" followed by "You go Girl!").  Wow.  Brilliant. All I can say is it is worth the effort it takes to read.  Though I sincerely hope the next book will take us inside a few more pleasant minds.  If it\'s not a classic, we\'ve allowed our short attention spans to ruin us.'

author: b'Grace'
title: b'The magic is gone'
body: b"This book really makes me upset. One thing that J.K. Rowling was excellent at was making even the characters you didn't like, likeable in a way that kept you interested. There was not one character in this entire book that I liked or thought was the least bit drawn out. It's as if she wrote a book every crappy person she's ever met and tried to write a story around it."

author: b'David A. Appling'
title: b'Bleak, sad, tragic, but never banal.'
body: b"Rowling's venture into the adult (very adult) novel is good, but no Harry Potter in any way."

author: b'Missusan'
title: b'satisfied my curiosity'
body: b"As a reader of the entier Harry Potter series (twice) I already knew J.K Rowling was a writer who could grab you & keep you interested, but I was curious how she would handle a different kind of story.  In my opinion, it was harder to get into the story (Harry Potter books were engrossing from page 1), but once I got into it I wanted to keep reading, and the expansion of the story was surprising and went in directions I didn't expect. So I would definitely recommend this book and look forward to anything new from this author."

author: b'R. Martin'
title: b'A detailed study of human nature'
body: b'Human behavior fascinates me, and this detailed exposition absorbed my attention to the extent that for much of the book I forgot to look at the Kindle indicator at the bottom of the screen. Rowling clearly is a keen and perceptive observer and listener, and her facile use of dialect and vocabulary of each character is accurate and consistent.'

author: b'rynbaskets'
title: b'Slow start, sudden ending'
body: b'This book depicts typical conservative small town in England. As in the Harry Potter series, Rowling is masterful in building up characters, but the storyline moves so slowly and once the expected tragidy happens, bamg, the book is over. I was left perplexed.'

author: b'Reviewer'
title: b'Wonderful'
body: b'Could not put this book down, not just because of the intriguing plot but also because of the great writing. It is amazing that after so many years, Rowling is still able to keep me up and night turning the pages.'

author: b'Heather168'
title: b'A good read,  unsatisfying end.'
body: b'I was very keen to read this book, and did read late into 2 nights to finish it. I love a good mystery story, and the plot was well-developed. Just found the end unsatifying... makes me wonder if Rowling intends to write a sequel.'

author: b'Patricia'
title: b'A very engrossing plot from a masterful writer'
body: b'Wow - I thought this was a powerful book.  Since I\'ve never read any of the Harry Potter stories, I was curious to read something by J.K Rowling.  It is not easy to get into - there are so many characters to keep track of.  I finally had to resort to writing down a list of characters - something I haven\'t done since "War and Peace and all those Russian names - but the list really helped.  The other reviewers have covered the plot - a small English town full of politics and dysfunctional families.  But what a plot Rowling can weave.  Some of it is so realistic as to be hard to take - particularly the bullying of teenagers (my least favorite part) but I quickly became engrossed in the characters and stayed up very late last night to find out what happened to them all.  I plan to read parts of it again.  If you like a good story with many characters and excellent writing, I can definitely recommend this book.'

author: b'CAW'
title: b'So disappointing'
body: b'I was so looking forward to reading this book as I am a huge Harry Potter fan and think JK Rowling is a genius. However I just cannot get in to her new book. I have read almost 50% and am struggling to get in to the story at all. It is as if the author is trying too hard. I sure hope the story picks up or I may not bother finishing it. Harsh words from someone who has read each of the Harry Potter books  at leats three times.'

author: b'cakelady'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Still reading but find it well written and very enjoyable and I'm more than halfway through,"

author: b'Jane Freeman Wilson'
title: b'Will there be a sequel?'
body: b'Firstly, those people getting upset that this is not a kid\'s book/not Harry Potter really need to read more about a book before they buy it. It was categorically stated that it was an adult book, and not more HP. Secondly, I thought this book was excellent. I just finished it this morning, and I really would like to read more about the people of Pagford, as soon as possible. I was completely drawn into this very real and well written world, and if I have any disappointment, it\'s that the book was not longer, and that there isn\'t (yet) a sequel in the works. The characters were three dimensional, and interesting, and I have absolutely met many similar "types". Yes, there were a lot of characters, but this is a story about the inhabitants of a town - and to fill that larger picture, you need a big cast. I could see this novel translating easily to the small screen, perhaps over 5-6 episodes - I would love to see that in fact. Perhaps at some point, J K Rowling can shake off the mantle of Harry Potter and write more novels like this. I would absolutely invest in another one, and hopefully I will get the chance to do so.'

author: b'KARIN'
title: b'THE CASUAL VACANCY'
body: b"I HAVEN'T FINISHED THE BOOK YET,BUT AM ENJOYING IT.  THE SOCIETAL JUDGEMENT AND THINGS WE COVET IN SOCIETY ARE DETAILED PERFECTLY IN THE STORY!"

author: b'krissi'
title: b'plot?'
body: b"Wow! I knew going in that my expectations of Rowling were too high so I put that aside and prepared to read. Currently on page 70 and I'm pretty sure I'm throwing in the towel soon. There's no plot.... No one seems to be able to say this is a book about____. So in the midst of a sea of dark random moments, characters I can't stand, and cursing I think I'm done"

author: b'Judith A. Zaleski'
title: b'Vacancy in Thought'
body: b'This is one of the worst books i have ever read.  It is about a small town filled with residents who are  dark and depressing.'

author: b'James W. Havens'
title: b'A Casual WHAT ??!!'
body: b'After writing seven books without a swear and nothing more sexual than a little "snogging" JK let herself go wild.  I am concerned because some of the Harry Potter material was taken from her childhood so if some of her childhood is included in this book she needs counseling. The book details child abuse on every other page, which inclused neglect, emotional, and sexual abuse.'

author: b'Minnie'
title: b'Yuck!'
body: b"I pre-ordered Rowling's new novel, thinking that a writer with her imagination and story-telling ability would write something else that was at least half as good as her previous works. No dice! This book was so crappy, I didn't fully finish it. I got through four chapters and couldn't stand it any more, so I just skimmed and speed-read the rest of the book."

author: b'Lorelei'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling'
body: b'I really enjoyed this book. It reminds me of a Maeve Binchy type novel. All about the little town Pagford and the towns people. Definitely a good read!'

author: b'mary'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'It was very overated. I did not enjoy enjoy reading it. I only finished it because I spent money to buy it.'

author: b'Jen'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"I really like the Harry Potter books, so I jumped at a new book by J.K. Rowling. So far I am pretty disappointed. There just isn't a plot to this book - I feel like very little has happened and the entire book is just snippets of the characters relatively depressing lives. To be honest, I'm only about 35% of the way through - and if my assessment changes, I will come back here and change my review. I WILL FINISH THIS BOOK! Even if it kills me - mostly because I paid $17.99 for the kindle edition. Totally not worth it. Maybe the author should stick to writing young adult."

author: b'Ktb'
title: b'A change and very different'
body: b"You can't expect to know what this book is going to be like  Jk Rowling writes an intriguing novel that whilst slow and really not much happens till the very end she keeps it ticking over enough that you struggle to put it down. I thoroughly enjoyed it however I do get a little lost in stories that every chapter is  told by 'a difference perspective'."

author: b'Carla Lilie'
title: b"We're not at Hogwarts anymore"
body: b'Poverty.  Addiction.  Racism.  Abuse.  Alienation between spouses, and between children and parents.  These are some of the issues J. K. Rowling writes about in "The Casual Vacancy", her first novel intended for an adult audience. And these are real-world issues even harder to overcome than Voldemort.'

author: b'Kathleen Alexander'
title: b'Vacancy review'
body: b'Vacancy was very slow moving.. hard to get into the characters.. too much time spent on characters ruminations and not enough substantial action'

author: b'Artguy149'
title: b'Not very entertaining'
body: b'I went into this book with an open mind, fully understanding Rowling wanted to do something totally new from her Harry Potter series. That said, I was left thinking, why should I care? While the characters are excellently fleshed out, like people you might really meet, the entire story has a rather parochial feel, like a gossip column in a small town. After several chapters I wondered when anything relevant to me would happen. If you like a story about bigger themes, the wider world, this is not the book for you. If you like a small, regional story about petty people you might enjoy it.'

author: b'jogo'
title: b'a casual reading'
body: b'not all bad. she should return to the style who suits her better. I have faith in the future of this writer'

author: b'Ronald E. Parsons'
title: b'A First-Rate Book by a First-Rate Authoress'
body: b"Whatever else Casual Vacancy is it is a marvelously drawn account of true, largely-unrecognized virtue hidden behind the gritty exterior of the teen-aged girl Krystal Weedon from the wrong side of the tracks in small-town England.  Among the few who saw value within her was the man around whose death the book's story is centered."

author: b'Karla Hatfield'
title: b'Loved Harry Potter and loved this book!'
body: b'This book showed a completely new side of JK Rowling and I really enjoyed it. The book was very honest about people and their feelings and thoughts. It reminded me that people are fragile and can be severely misunderstood. At times I would confuse the characters because there were so many of them, but after the first fourth of the book I had them all straightened out.'

author: b"'laine"
title: b"First Adult Book-teenagers' viewpoint"
body: b'This book was advertised as Ms. Rowling\'s "first adult book".  While the subject matters were adult, I found the book was mostly centered around the teenagers\' point of view and not from the adults...I was disappointed.  I was expecting an adult book about adult matters and centering around the adult characters.  I would not recommend this book to friends without explaining this point...If I had known what the book was really about, I would not have bought it.'

author: b'starrie'
title: b'speedy~'
body: b"i got this book really quickly .. i am a super fan of JK ROWING in harry potter of course. but this one is also what i'm looking for~"

author: b'padarn princess'
title: b'Slow start ...'
body: b"I have never read a JK Rowling book in my life (Harry Potter just didn't appeal to me) and I was curious to read a book by the author. The book is a slow burn.  The first half of the book introduces the reader to the characters, most of whom are hard to like. I continued to read the book as it was quite an easy read and suddenly found myself gripped and couldn't put it down. The issues highlighted in the book are a sad reflection on society and all our petty prejudices, however, a few of the characters manage to transcend the hopelessness portrayed in a few of the characters narratives.  I enjoyed the book - but it's not life changing.  The best part is that I can now say that I have read a JK Rowling book!!"

author: b'analies'
title: b'A "modern tale" of human relationships.'
body: b'Sad story, not really a mood enhancer, but well written.  Some of the terms are specific for UK.  Felt that the storyline was all too real.  Did a good job of developing characters, and motives for their behavior.'

author: b'md'
title: b'Nothing Casual about The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy is a very interesting story about the interactions between people.  J. K. Rowling gets into the minds of her characters, and does an excellent job of showing the characters point of view.  The story is about what actually happens to real life people and the games they play between themselves.  This book is a wonderful read, and it can teach you so much about the interaction between different social statuses of people, the goodness and the evil mischievousness.'

author: b'Catherine'
title: b'Succumbing to Mainstream'
body: b'J K Rowlings in her book Casual Vacancy has succumbed to a genre that is based on reality, but delves into the world of sensationalism. Her fantasy is much faster paced and exciting...rather than boring. This reader found some pages were worth skipping.'

author: b'Wilma'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I was so looking forward to JK Rowling's new book.  I love her story telling ability, however I was very disappointed in this story.  It really left me flat.  To me, the characters were not very interesting and the story did not keep my interest.  Sorry, but I cannot recommend this book."

author: b'M. A. Vanhuizen-husselson'
title: b'disappointment'
body: b'First time I am reading anything from this writer.So far it does not live up to its expectations. Very all over the place and not a very good storyline (I think).I would not buy a second book of hers.  (sorry!!)'

author: b'lupinelady'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b"Expected more from this book.  Difficult to follow the many story lines.  If I had been able to read it in one day I probably would have found it easier.  Wouldn't really recommend this book for purchase."

author: b'HP lover'
title: b'Amazingly thought provoking'
body: b'This book was fabulous, heart wrenching and depicted flawed people at their worst. Characters were well developed and beautiful. Looking forward to her next one!'

author: b'James M. Arrington'
title: b'Definitely not Harry Potter'
body: b"A novelist who switches genres (i.e., from children's fiction to adult fiction) risks disappointing her fans.  The reviews I've read so far speak to the dissonance Harry Potter fans feel when they encounter a novel that echoes (in my estimation) those of P. D. James.  James's characters are seldom likeable, but James strives for truth-telling:  most people, in life as in her novels, are not pleasant people.  The same is true of Rowling's new novel:  telling the truth about one's characters is what Rowling's novel is about.  It's not sweet reading.  But it has the punch of truth:  the truth, as Rowling sees it, is not pretty.  If you want pretty and nice, stick to her novels for children;  if you want to understand human nature, read The Casual Vacancy.  The only problem I had with The Casual Vacancy was keeping track of who was who and how the characters related to one another.  But I'm willing to think that this problem is MINE, not the author's."

author: b'Sketchy'
title: b'Great read'
body: b'I think the key to enjoying this book is to not expect Harry Potter with adult content. There was always going to be huge pressure on JK Rowling to deliver the goods with her book after Harry Potter and I believe she has.'

author: b'M'
title: b'Sheer Genius of Character Exploration'
body: b'After reading so many negative reviews, I approached this book with a bit of trepidation, wanting simply to put a toe in the water by reading the first few pages. What I found was one of the most engrossing pieces of literary composure of our time.'

author: b'Dennis S Gardner'
title: b'Not a good book.'
body: b'Surely the English people have not become as sickening, hateful and archaic as J K Rowling describes?  The personalities in this book are full of decadent thoughts and actions, with very few redeeming characteristics.  I found each character hard to believe, which spoilt this story for me.'

author: b'A casual observer'
title: b'A new favourite'
body: b"Every review of this book seems to start with 'This is not Harry Potter..' and that's correct, it's not. And as long as you're not expecting Harry Potter you'll be fine. Otherwise you might want to go read, well, Harry Potter."

author: b'Bobbie'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I expected a different type of story. Too much about teenagers and their sexual habits and not enough about the adults.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'No one to root for'
body: b'Throughout the book you continued to hope it would improve, that something would occur to spark your interest.  This never occured.  The were no likeable characters, no one to cheer on, and in actuality just remained a very depressing book.'

author: b'puzzlemaze'
title: b'Huge disappointment'
body: b"I couldn't imagine that JK Rowling could write an awful book after Harry Potter, but, sadly, she has.  This book is unreadable-- it's world is miserable, sadistic, hateful, bleak and totally uninspired.  And couldn't her editor have clued her in to the fact that in print, a little of the F word goes a long way and a lot of it is just lame. I soldiered through 46 pages before I began skimming for about ten minutes, and then skipped to the end. In HP, the Muggle Dursleys were deliciously horrid, and was the family I loved to hate.  I CV, Muggles are just horrid and mercifully, completely forgettable. The ending was not remotely sad, it was just the rotten cherry on top."

author: b'Jude'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'An absolute and complete waste of time.  Nasty, abusive, disgusting.  I would never purchase another book by this author and I have deleted it from my kindle.'

author: b'SLC'
title: b'The Empress Has No Clothes...'
body: b"I'm sorry I wasted my weekend on this Tawdry Tale.  What a waste of J.K. Rowling's considerable talents!  This dark, gritty book features a host of unlikeable characters on a collision course for disaster."

author: b'Krystal Veverka'
title: b'This book leaves you feeling awful.'
body: b"It's kind of trashy- like Jeanette Walls, The Glass Castle, but much better written. I feel kind of sick after reading it (and through most of the chapters). I would not recommend it unless you've got a strong stomach, a zest for unhappy marriages, and teenage suicide. It is expertly written, the characters well developed, and a good flow through the book, just terribly depressing. No thanks. I hope she tries again in her area of specialty- HP!"

author: b'Anne, 47'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I enjoyed this book. It followed a few families who were real, with their own ambitions, histories, and personal faults.'

author: b'lioness_torres'
title: b'Ive Read The Entire Book'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy was a great read. The first few chapters give you the background on the town and the characters and it was important for JK to do so. I laughed, cried, was shocked and mad all in one book. It is a roller coaster ride. JK did a wonderful job of showing a glimpse of the minds of very different people while connecting them all. It left me wanting more and I cant wait to read another adult novel by JK... so I hope she writes one soon! Dont listen to the complaints about this book, read it and love it!'

author: b'Sweet Pea'
title: b'Pretty entertaining'
body: b'Liked this turn for JK Rowling.  Very unlike Harry Potter but characters are very well written and I was engaged and interested in how it would all turn out.'

author: b'Benjamin Vaterlaus'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'I was hoping for a "clean" adult book with intrigue, challenge, and fun. What I found was a dirty soap opera. Unfortunately, this was one of those times when I couldn\'t even finish the book. I read somewhere that Rowling was willing to take criticism for this because she wanted to write something totally different from Harry Potter. Well, she did and she will. I will read another juvenile fiction that she writes, but if she does a sequel to this book (or even in a similar vein), I won\'t waste my money.'

author: b'princess'
title: b'princess michelle'
body: b"good book, I didn't read Harry Potter, but liked her writing form for this book. look forward to JK writing more books for adults"

author: b'Jacqueline A. Emuryan'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'This book was very hard to follow as far as the characters were concerned.  Definitely not a book that kep my interest.  I had to force myself to finish it.'

author: b'windy'
title: b'Great expectations'
body: b'I found the story a little predictable and rambling. My expectation of the book was very high because of previous childrens books so I was a little dissapointed, but that will not stop me reading the next book.'

author: b'Maryanne T. Heller'
title: b'Reminiscent of Jane Austin'
body: b"Unlike other reviews that I have read, I found Ms Rowling's Casual Vacancy to be quite an interesting glimpse of life in modern,non-urban England.  The character development was elegant and the social commentary brilliant.  I loved it."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Moving and engaging, masterful storytelling'
body: b"I don't usually write reviews for books because I find the experience of reading a book to be so personal and so subjective it's hard to translate that into what I think someone else's experience of the book might be."

author: b'Gentle reader'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b'I was so enamored with the creativity and magic in the Harry Potter series.  This book just seemed gritty.  I guess she was capturing human nature, but I hope for better from mankind.'

author: b'Michael Conley'
title: b'wish I could "un-buy"'
body: b'It took an effort to finish this book.  Ala Miss Marple, Rowling has decided to expose English village life as the a true cesspool of humanity.  There is not one sympathetic character.  They range from nasty and unpleasant to warped and vile.  Nothing good happens in this book.  It is a total downer with many tragic events and noone even learning from them.  If you want to be depressed, read this book.  I guess the author wanted to prove she is a serious writer.  If this is how she sees the world, she needs some serious help.'

author: b'Lila Maine'
title: b'not my style'
body: b'The writing was wonderful. The story was not. I found it to be dull and could not care about the characters. I had to force myself to finish it.'

author: b'Blueladybug2'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I'm half way through the book and I'm having a hard time following all the characters.  There is a lot of charaters in this book and it gets quite confusing.  All the reviews I've read says to read it to the end.  They say the ending is worth finishing the book.  I guess I'll find out.  JCM"

author: b'Sandi'
title: b'Tragedy'
body: b'This book was a waste of my money & such a disappointment.  I was so excited to get it because I loved Harry Potter, but unless she changes a lot I will not buy another one without reading some first. The book was nothing but sadness, gossip, tragedy, & more sadness. Color it black. To me, there was no mystery, no suspense, no real direction.  The characters had no redeaming values.'

author: b'trjmom'
title: b'very good'
body: b"Really enjoyed Rowling's new book.  Unexpected ending but the book was realistic.  Only criticism is the introduction of so many characters in the beginning.  Difficult to keep everyone straight until further on in the book."

author: b'Blue Mist Reader'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Always interested in books by authors that are a "first" or an "only". This is indeed a first for J K Rowling (in adult fiction) and I enjoyed it enough to hope it is not the only one she writes.'

author: b'Kisa'
title: b'Wait, who are all these people again?'
body: b"Too many characters, many of whom don't develop enough for me to have a sense of their identity until halfway through the book.  Writing felt a little uneven to me, in some places her descriptions and dialog are brilliant, but others felt a bit forced and over the top."

author: b'Willow'
title: b'No characters to root for'
body: b"I haven't finished the book. It's taking me a while to slog through it.  Actually, I got tired of being mired in so many disreputable characters, I am taking a break from the book and reading another one before I go back to it. It's been mildly interesting, though I'm waiting for something to happen."

author: b'M. Cotton'
title: b'Well written but..'
body: b"This book was well written, but just not my cup of tea. It was a well woven tale of a middle class town.  However, if it hadn't been a JK Rowling book, I wouldn't have given it a second look on the shelf.  JK once again proved herself to be an excellent author, but fans of the Harry Potter series might have trouble jumping over to the new genre with her."

author: b'LRock10288'
title: b'Enough to keep my interest, not enough to blow me away.'
body: b'I just finished The Casual Vacancy last night, after receiving it as a birthday gift. I\'ll admit, as a massive Potter fan, I was beyond eager to get my hands on Rowling\'s new work. The Casual Vacancy was good, I finished it and did not feel "dragged" to do so, but I was not left wanting more, wishing that I would have milked the brilliance and wanted to continue on with this story. Ironically, one of the biggest upsides in this book, to me, was also hand in hand with one of the biggest annoyances. This book is very much riding on observations of common human behaviors, which I thought at times to be brilliantly executed, and in the same breath, sometimes painfully cliche and stereotypical. In such a character-based story, I felt that the character layers and developments were to be crucial in telling it.'

author: b'Kurt Stefan'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'After reading a number of the early reviews on this, I approached it with trepidation.'

author: b'James Heron'
title: b'Not Harry Potter, but a great read.'
body: b'Like many, I  purchased this book to see how it would compare to the Harry Potter books, all of which I made a point to read and thoroughly enjoyed. This is a very worthwhile read. The author has made the move to writing for adults very well, with the shortcomings as well as the gifts each of has to balance in our lived. While the characters are very well developed; I had to turn back several times to remember who was was connected to who ... and how. I finally resolved this by a simple "family tree" for each family. A good read ... actually I enjoyed this every bit as much as the Potter books.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'The first boring thing J.K. Rowling has ever written'
body: b'Like 99.97% of everyone who has read this book so far, I am a huge "Harry Potter" fan. However, I love to read books from many genres, and I was very well aware that "The Casual Vacancy" was J.K. Rowling\'s foray into a whole new world. I wasn\'t expecting wizards or magic or broomsticks or even humor. What I was expecting was a novel that wasn\'t super dull to read, and unfortunately  for me, that\'s exactly what "The Casual Vacancy" is, from start to finish: boring, boring, boring. And my goodness, how it DRAGS! Rowling\'s extremely vivid descriptions and characterizations were apparent in this book, but the problem is that all of the characters are basically selfish and one-dimensional, not to mention completely uninteresting. This book paints a dark picture of the lives of the residents who inhabit a small English town and come to blows over its politics, but there\'s nothing for the reader to really grab onto or care about, and the pacing of the story is unbelievably slow, especially for the first half of the book.'

author: b'Brian and Nancy'
title: b'Library Now Has a Vacancy'
body: b'I could not force myself to finish this book.  The book starts out with a myriad of characters, but few of them are likeable or interesting enough to care about what happens to them.  The plot drones on ad infinitum with the first hundred pages flitting among the host of characters recounting where they were when another one of the unliekable characters died.  Who cares?  No me.'

author: b'NCGal'
title: b"Doesn't grab me."
body: b"I'll admit that I was curious as to what J.K. Rowling would do to try and follow up after Harry Potter. And I find myself not really making time to read it. I believe that I am just now starting chapter 5 and I purchased it the day after it was released. It certainly isn't the same caliber of Harry Potter (and, truthfully, was hoping for the encyclopedia she said she would write) and so far isn't as interesting as the last book that I purchased. I'll eventually finish it, considering I paid $18 for the Kindle version."

author: b'woman on the move'
title: b'Ture to life book, not for children'
body: b'This book is a portrail of real life in society. It is a very graffic account of what goes on in peoples lives, and how lives all intertwine, in one way or another.I would say that it is not a book that should be read by anyone under the age of 16 at least.'

author: b'wasateacher'
title: b'A memory filled turn of phrase'
body: b'A former 5th grade teacher, I always enjoyed sharing the newest Potter books informally with my students and loved watching them use what they\'d read about in the Potter repertoire; as one student (who\'d been reluctant to read the books just because everyone else was reading them) said when she dropped her pencil on the floor,"Levioso!"'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'its not supposed to be pretty, its supposed to be real and it is'
body: b"If you are looking for a light , sunny read this is not the book for you.  If you can't handle seeing what really goes on in the lives of many sad souls this is not the book for you.  It is a look at the seamier side of life.  Rowling paints an accurate picture of what life is for many teens and adults in a small, rural town.  She captures their emotions brilliantly.  Is it depressing?  Yes.  Is it hard to read at times? Yes.  Is it a well constructed, deep piece of literature? Yes.  It is human emotion and raw need at its worst.  And it is very much like her Harry Potter books. They are dark and disturbing not light, sunny books either.  J K Rowling makes you feel strong emotions with her writing. She makes you think.  You need to look behind the story to see the real story she is telling. I had to come back and add to this review after continuing to read so many negative reviews. First- if you have not bothered to read the entire book please don't write a review - its not fair to the author. Second, if you bought this expecting Harry Potter that was your mistake not the author's. This book is clearly advertised as an adult fiction book. And finally, she did not write  a book about all of the inhabitants of a small town. She choose to write about a group that was bound together by a common  event /cause. That these people all had serious life issues they were dealing with was the setting of the book. Life is not always pretty. In fact I recognized many of the same issues I see  people I know dealing with- people you would never expect to have these kinds of issues/ problems. Someone commented that there was no clear character to root for.I disagree. I was rooting for all of them."

author: b'Jeanette T. Smetana'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'A large amount of characters were inroduced close to the onset of the book, with more coming forward as the book progressed.  It was difficult to keep these people straight and I had to keep going back to earlier parts to be able to place them.  It was also hard to like anyone in the book except for the Social Worker and the teen-agers, Krystal and Andrew, so the ending, while very realistic, was very disappointing.'

author: b'Happy Scherer'
title: b'A bitlLike Elizabeth George but without the "mystery"'
body: b"This is a difficult book to rate.  It reminded me a lot of books by Elizabeth George and/or PD James, with alternating chapters about different characters who all intersect at the end.  It's that type of texture and character development, but without the mystery/detective piece or the characters we love like Lynley and Havers or Dalgliesh.  But it does share that same sense of small town British life, and certainly the characters are interesting and well-developed."

author: b'Scifigirl20'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Interesting comparison and conflict between an ideal Britain and modern Britain as it truly is. The characters and the plot were rather depressing however. It was a solid effort but lacked the magic of Harry Potter'

author: b'Hugh A. Whitesell'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I am extremely disappointed in this book. It does not in my opinion hold a candle to Ms. Rolwing's Harry Potter Series. To me it seems confused, poorly organized, full of extreme and unecessary bad language... and a not very interesting plot. Ms. Rowling, whose creation of the Harry Potter Books was brilliant, can surely do much better than this first attempt at an adult novel."

author: b'Niseymaria'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I was curious to see if it would compare favourably with the Harry Potter books. Sadly it did not. I was totally bored and did not finish reading it. Very , very disappointed.'

author: b'Lil Sue'
title: b'An average book'
body: b"I am an avid reader and was looking forward to reading JK's new book as I have so much respect for her, but was disappointed with the read. There were too many characters and the story line was lacking excitement with an obvious ending."

author: b'Dottie Logerot'
title: b'Slow as molasses'
body: b"What a disappointment.  Who would have thought the same mind that made up the world of Harry Potter could create this mess.  I just didn't get it from the very beginning."

author: b'Nan'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I couldn't make it past 100 pages. Completely depressing storyline, a ridiculous amount of swearing and just plain vulgar. I didn't even want to give the book to anyone so I threw it away."

author: b'Cynthia Hicks'
title: b'Slightly disappointing'
body: b"I wanted to like this book a lot more, but the characters only became compelling toward the end.  The plot was adequately complex, but I grew frustrated with Rowling's  inability to pull everything together in a smooth, concise way.  The ending felt appropriate, though a bit frustrating.  I hope that the author will focus now on another gripping series for youth - her Harry Potter fans will probably have mixed emotions about this venture."

author: b'Michael J. Smith'
title: b'Incredibly Disappointing'
body: b'I was really looking forward to this book.  Yes I read all of the Harry Potter books and loved them.  I also read Dickens, Russo, Irving, Wodehouse and lots of other authors this new book would supposedly be compared to.  I hate to say it, but good lord, I was amazingly disappointed.  Disappointed doesn\'t begin to cover it.  I was barely able to keep reading.  I finished this book only because it was by J.K. Rowling.  I am too old to spend time reading books that, after more than 100 pages of reading, I just don\'t like.  I decided to make an exception of this novel.  I expected a story about class struggle and death, but I also expected some humor.  The book is devoid of any real humor, it is simply depressing.  There is also no desire to feel any kind of sympathy for any of the characters, because you never really get a chance to like any of them from the beginning.  There are so many characters to keep up with in this book that you would think some of them would be likable.  they aren\'t.  I"m sorry.  I won\'t recap the book, everyone reading this probably has an idea.  I cannot recommend this book.  I hate to say it, but there it is.'

author: b'LadyBeth'
title: b'Disturbing & Icky'
body: b'I pre-ordered this book in anticipation of another amazing, well crafted story from the Queen Authoress herself.  The intro was okay but dull; however, I was quite certain J.K would weave her writing magic in a splendid fashion as the story progressed.  Each character she presented was despicable and JK\'s "adult" descriptions of them were foul, pornographic, sadistic and disturbingly dark.  The F-bomb was used so many times, I wondered if this was the first time she allowed herself to cuss because it was like she just couldn\'t get over herself about using excessively, ugly language.  I only read 17% of the book (on my kindle) and then quit reading it altogether because I couldn\'t stand another deplorable word.  I concur with those who said they wouldn\'t even put the book into the GoodWill or other thrift store bins.  Wouldn\'t want it to get circulated into the hands of another unsuspecting reader.  I am hoping inspiration returns to this very gifted writer but I won\'t pre-order her next book.  I will wait patiently to read the reviews first before I part with my money.'

author: b'Voracious Reader'
title: b'JKRowling is a genius.'
body: b'This book is a masterpiece. She has to be one of the best writers of our time. For any adults that felt she was only capable of writing children stories, you are terribly wrong.'

author: b'Diane Bellomo'
title: b"Not Potter.  Didn't Have To Be."
body: b"I've read (some) of the other 600 reviews of this book, and I really can't find a whole lot to add, pro or con.  I'll leave it at this:  I liked it, found it satisfying in ways that are impossible to put into words.  Rowling's writing style here is different than it was for Potter, certainly more *grown up,* but the narrative (and those metaphors!) bring depth, and the characters are as multi-faceted as they need to be for the story.  The ending is less predictable than inevitable, which is, to me, a much better word.  It's not likely I'm going to re-read this - like I do with the Potter books - but I'm not sorry I read it once."

author: b'momreads'
title: b'Night and day'
body: b'Anybody holding back from reading this book based on the "Harry Potter" books should rest easy. They are NOTHING alike!'

author: b'JKM'
title: b'Disappointing!'
body: b'I was curious to see how Rowling would make the jump to writing adult literature.'

author: b'Dr. Carole'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I bought the book with great expectancy, but I was very disappointed and could not finish reading it. None of the characters were likable and the plot uninteresting.'

author: b'Katie'
title: b'Upsetting and Confusing'
body: b"I am a Harry Potter fan, and while I knew this would be a big departure, I wasn't expecting this. I kept getting characters confused because of their similar names and lack of connection developed between reader and character. Every time I read the book, I just felt sick, but I had to get through it. It was very upsetting because I could easily see it all happening in the real world. Overall, I just wasn't happy reading this. It took me to uncomfortable places I didn't want to go, and now I'd be concerned about reading anything else she puts out. I'll stick with Hogwarts."

author: b'Kerry Sullivan'
title: b'Smaller than life and dull'
body: b"I'm sure it's a mixed blessing being J.K. Rowling.  Your books are all expected to be magical and are held to impossibly high standards.  On the other hand, you're richer than the queen and get to live in a castle, or could if you wanted to.  But this book is a long, dull slog by any standard.  With one exception, the characters are smaller than life, boring, and unlikeable.  And the one exception, well--SPOILER ALERT--she goes the way of Dumbledore.  A completely unsatisfying waste of time, money, and shelf space."

author: b'sonshine'
title: b'soap opera'
body: b'I purchased this book based on her great suspenseful writing with Harry Potter.  This is nothing more than a vulgar soap opera.  I stopped reading after about 10% of the book.  Sad.  Wish it could be returned.'

author: b'Sahara'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"To tell the truth I was a little disappointed. The characters don't seem real to me and the story just rambles on without really generating any interest in how it will finish. I like my stories to make me want to read as quickly as poosible."

author: b'mgab4045'
title: b'causal vacancy'
body: b'I have just started the book and their are many details about the town.  So I have not got real excited about staying with the book until midnight.'

author: b'Jennifer Gross'
title: b'ADHD'
body: b"I couldn't even finish this book. When I picked it up. I assumed it was fantasy. I love to read, But since I have ADHD. After the first chapter. My attention started to wonder. Tell I finely gave up. I personally thought it was boring and slightly crude. Thou I would have looked past the crudeness for a good fantasy."

author: b'deeptissue808'
title: b'Missing the magic'
body: b'I am not able to "lose myself" in this book as I did in Harry Potter.  Plot, characters, writing just ok. Took a long time for the plot to get my interest. If it wasn\'t written by JK Rowling I would not be putting the effort into finishing it.'

author: b'Mary Jo R.'
title: b'21st century "It\'s a Wonderful Life"'
body: b'I can\'t quite understand all critics\' and Amazon readers\' bad reviews. This is the best novel I\'ve read in a long time. I\'m not sure if it\'s deliberate, but it has echoes of "It\'s a Wonderful Life." One man\'s death causes the unraveling of a community. Yes, it\'s a pretty grim story, but Rowling\'s biting social commentary is entertaining. Each character is deeply flawed but in a very human and recognizable way.'

author: b'Dawn Romine'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"I found myself just wanting to quickly finish the book so that I could start a different one.  When I read the Harry Potter series, I didn't want the books to end."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Too many F bombs!'
body: b"I purchased this book because I loved the Harry Potter series.  I have to admit I only read the first 6 pages of the book.  Lords name in vain 3 times, 1 bloody hell and I lost track of the F bombs.  I was crossing them out and I looked down the page and saw 3 more.  This book is currently in my trash can.  I wouldn't even donate to the library."

author: b'Melissa C. Dare'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"If this had been J.K. Rowling's first book, it probably would be the last to find a publisher.  The overall impression of the story is one of dismal hope, diminished opportunity, and downright mean people.  It doesn't help that the most likable person in the story is killed over in chapter one."

author: b'Page Turner'
title: b'I Need Mental Floss'
