body: b'I was repelled, disgusted, depressed, but mostly bored. But I kept forcing myself to read because it just had to get better, right? Wrong. It was Awful.  Dismal.  Depressing. Sad. Dirty. Tragic. The mind who created Voldemort and the Dementers created this book.'

author: b'Gaby Cesman'
title: b'Impossible to stop reading'
body: b'As I never read Harry Potter I cannot compare this book to the best selling series.'

author: b'Stype'
title: b'Good, but not what I expected'
body: b"If it didn't have JK Rowlings on the front cover, I think I would have been blown away. Unfortunately, my expectations were that I was reading the author of Harry Potter, and it turned out to be surprisingly Ibsenesq. Not a bad thing, just unexpected. The story was exceptionally executed, and overall a good read. I will likely pre-order her next one too."

author: b'Dayle'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'I am trying to read "Casual Vacancy. There are so very many people to remember in this book.'

author: b'Beverly'
title: b'Disappointing !'
body: b"JKRowling is a fantastic author. However she tries to hard in this book to prove that she can write an adult novel. I couldn't get past the pre story. Just lost interest in so many unsavory characters. Hope to see something more refreshing in the future."

author: b'coppella'
title: b'slow to start'
body: b'I am 3/4 way through this book, and it is finally getting interesting.  Tedious reading at best.  The character development was laborious.  The "English" verbiage took a while to comprehend.  I would not purchase another novel of hers.  Did not read "Harry Potter" and now I won\'t.'

author: b'teeny'
title: b'disappointed'
body: b'I was a big fan of her other books but casual vacancy did not come close to being a good and entertaining story.  Personally, I found it boring and too drawn out to be entertaining.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Well drawn characters and well crafted story'
body: b'I became really invested in the characters and story.  This book gets one of my highest accolades - it seems plausible.  The characters are interesting and complex but are completely human.'

author: b'Samira Manners'
title: b"Couldn't finish it"
body: b'Depressing .... Not what I wanted or expected. Very detailed yet too much detail of a sad little town. I wanted an escape not a kick into sad reality for some parts of the world.'

author: b'Robin Duxfield'
title: b'Great book'
body: b'An enjoyable book. JK Rowling confirms that she is an entertaining story teller, this time telling a tale about a council in a small town.'

author: b'Taylor'
title: b'JKR moves on'
body: b'This book has very little relation the Harry Potter ones.  It is very good on its own.  Clearly this was a story she felt she had to tell and I am glad that I read it.'

author: b'tibker'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'It gave me a headache trying to keep all the characters straight. A couple if interesting strands of story, put it down half way through. Will try again later'

author: b'aztrainer'
title: b'Just okay'
body: b"5 chapters in and still waiting for the pizzazz. Too much dirty language for my taste. I wish it was a book I just couldn't put down but it's not. A little boring."

author: b'claudia swisher'
title: b"Not Potter but That's OK"
body: b"Because my mother was a huge Anglophile and I have seen a ton of British comedy films, I understood this genre and fell right into the world of this tiny town with its tiny-minded inhabitants. Pagford is the center (centre) of their existence, and everyone knows everyone else's business. But, once the doors are closed, families are hiding secrets that are crippling. Children are abused, mental illness rules, dissatisfaction and sadness. Small meanness keeps some hearts forever closed."

author: b'elite5091'
title: b'Not my cup of tea'
body: b"Bleh. I couldn't finish the book. There was no central hero. I don't know about you but I need a hero to cheer for and a villain to despise (and secretly admire). This book contained neither. It is a snapshot of a town and its residents. This book will probably be turned into a TV show or mini-series. It would be better served as a script than a novel.  So, in summary: Bleh."

author: b'Chris'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I may not be fair to the author by rating this book so soon.  I am 45 pages into the book and am quickly losing interest.  If it doesn't pick up soon I will be extremely disappointed in the authors writings on this book.  I shall continue on and hopefully it will get more interesting."

author: b'Sheila'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"Having not read any of the Harry Potter books, I was very excited about reading an adult book by this author. I am having a really hard time getting through this book! Because of the popularity of the Harry Potter books, maybe I expected too much or maybe it's just me. I love to read and usually can't wait to get back into whatever book I am reading, but I may have to pass on this one."

author: b'Jackson'
title: b'casual vacancy'
body: b'J.K. Rowling is a excellent writer, however this book was disappointing.  I never got involved in the story because most to the story was not interesting.'

author: b'Cheryl A. Youree'
title: b'Casual Vacancy lackluster'
body: b'After the delightfully developed characters and the vividly descriptive settings of the Harry Potter epic, I found Casual Vacancy to be flat and lackluster. I did not connect with the characters, nor did I find the story itself to be imaginative.'

author: b'longdaydogs'
title: b'snorefest'
body: b'Not my cup of tea. Filled with bad language. Story was just too predictable. There was no one in the story that I felt connected to. Nothing to get excited about. I would not recommend this book.'

author: b'M. Weedon'
title: b'too bleak'
body: b"Most Harry Potter fans will not like this book, not that anyone should compare Rowling's new book to the Potter series. But I didn't expect this book to be so bleak. The Casual Vacancy is set in a small British town that's populated by small minded, selfish people with dysfunctional families and failing relationships.  Yes, Rowling created a world with strong characterizations, but I have a hard time with books if I don't like any of the characters, and that was the case with her first adult novel. The most likeable character died in the first chapter.  The characters who have some humanity are enablers with flawed relationships. Only at the end of the book do the other characters start showing each other some compassion, finally making an effort to patch up their families.  It's a sad book.  But I will probably read Rowling's next book in hopes that it's more uplifting."

author: b'Hi there!'
title: b'Casual Vancancy'
body: b'[[ASIN:B007THA4FI The Casual Vacancy] I loved the Harry Potter Books and could hardly wait to read an adult story by J.K. Rowling--I am not sure what I expected--this is a serious story full of social problems--as you read you are drawn into the lives of the characters--you cry with them--you laugh with them--you wish for them a better way of life--we the readers--begin to understand this is our world--we are the ones who can make this world better--the book is thoughtful and strangely compelling--Thank You--J.K. Rowling--I love the way you put the words together!'

author: b'Ann H. Karegeannes'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"I find the cast of characters a bit confusing. There is not enough background on each to easily delineate them from each other. The conflict over the newly empty Council seat does bring out the underlying conflicts and mean spirited relationships that often exist in very small towns.I do find her use of the children's lives as almost separate from the parents but who are controlled almost unmercifully by these parents."

author: b'Connie'
title: b'Stunk'
body: b'This book was terrible.  Poorly written, pointless plot, and an Extremly unessisary dirty storie line.  I am shocked this is the same person that wrote Harry Potter.  Thank you so much Amazon for giving me a refund, I would hate to own this book!'

author: b'Kimberly D. Parthemore'
title: b'Love J.K.Rowling'
body: b'I love J.K. Rowling and her new book "Casual Vacancy" is very good. It is NOTHING like Harry Potter but it is a very easy read. The reader will imagine themselves tangled in the lives of the townspeople. I read it in 2 days....ENJOY.'

author: b'Anne c kelly'
title: b'casual Vacancy'
body: b"I thought the book was well written but I still wouldn't recommend it to everyone because it is so gritty. It's like reading an episode of East Enders."

author: b'Margaret'
title: b'Deep, dark and dysfunctional'
body: b'She is a master of words however her subject matter is very dreary. When did fatal flaws such as hubris or egotism disappear, to be replaced with victimization? Each character seems afflicted with any of the current societal woes such as ADHD, child abuse, drug dependency or incest, and on and on. Hardly an uplifting story.'

author: b'Teresa T'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"J.K. Rowling's skill with creating characters that are real and jump out of the page carries over into her writing for adults."

author: b'Elphaba5110'
title: b'Not Harry Potter'
body: b'I was really excited to read this book. I love the Harry potter series and JK Rowling is by far my favorite author. I downloaded it and at midnight I checked to see if I had received it. Had to wait til morning. Part of me likes the book. The plot of the book was hard to grasp, I know her writing style is to describe everything and in certain genres it works. I plan to reread this book at a later date so I can hopefully understand it.'

author: b'D. D. E Middleton'
title: b'Little Disappointed'
body: b'Pre-ordered the book with great expectation. It is a good novel but not the quality of storytelling I expected from J.K. Rowling.'

author: b'Natasha Harder'
title: b'Great Book'
body: b'I am currently half way through this book and it is wonderful so far.  The writing is on par with her Harry Potter books.  I am enjoying this new topic and village she is taking me to.  I am certainly going to finish this novel and hopefully see many more from her.'

author: b'Bob'
title: b'It was OKay!!'
body: b'It was an interesting read.  I did not like the ending of the book.  It kind of left you hanging.  Harry Potter was much better.  She should sit at home and collect her royalties.'

author: b'David B (Louisiana)'
title: b'Wonderful book'
body: b"I read the reviews before I bought the book (they almost persuaded me not to buy it).  I'm glad I trusted my instincts.  I found this to be a truly good story.  I think Ms. Rowling took an ordinary setting and premise and brought them to life extraordinarily well.  She certainly understands human nature and shares that understanding with great wit.  I don't know if she intended it, but I think she also manages to teach a life lesson on the mess we can all make of things when we let our lives become self-centered.  I'd recommend this book to any adult and, certainly, any parent."

author: b'Helly'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'When I read the town name Pagford I expected a wizard to come round the corner immediately.'

author: b'emoc'
title: b'Better than expected.'
body: b'Though I purchased this book with some trepedation I fully enjoyed it. The writing was wonderful with fully developed characters and a story line that kept me guessing until the end.'

author: b'gigi'
title: b'disappointed'
body: b'This book and author did not live up to expectations.  The characters were bland and the subject uninteresting.  I forced myself to finish reading this book - hoping that I would find redeeming feature.  Sadly, I did not.'

author: b'BobbyGee'
title: b'Rough language put-off.'
body: b'The story is rather slow in getting started.  When it finally revs up, the foul language is offensive -- something not expected from J.K. Rowling.'

author: b'G. Hall'
title: b'Unexpected'
body: b"I wasn't sure how to feel about this book at the beginning.  It is SO different from the Harry Potter books.  I thought it got off to a slow start, with the introduction of lots of characters and the mingling of all these characters in a small town, but the pace picks up & the ending is unexpected.  Once the reader gets a feel for each character, the book becomes an enjoyable read. I recommend it."

author: b'Barbara L. Moeller'
title: b'A Casual VACANCY'
body: b'Very confusing and difficult to get through. I am still plugging through, hope it gets better. Halfway through and still do not get the point of this book.'

author: b'Peggy S. Moore'
title: b'Very disappointed'
body: b'Needless to say, I loved the Harry Potter series that J K Rowling wrote.  I guess I was expecting this book to be written in the same great style but I would have never guessed that it was an adult rated xx book....I was so disappointed....there are lots and lots of great books that are written without the filth and profanity....but if you like the filth and profanity, then this book is for you.'

author: b'Daniel F Peavey'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b"Very disappointing read. I understand expectations were high, however this story didn't even come close. I felt like I was reading a dictionary, too much discriptive writing, not enough dialogue. My 12 year old could have thought up a better story and written a better plot. I blame the publisher, it looks like someone wanted to make a quick buck on a big name. Suggestion for book - use as fire starter."

author: b'MJoPow'
title: b'Lacks "Magic"'
body: b'All good novels have "magic"--something that makes you care about the characters. For me, The Casual Vacancy lacks that quality. I\'m not all the way through, but it\'s a struggle to read it because I don\'t particularly like any of the characters. I\'m keeping at it in hopes that it will eventually be worth the read, but I have my doubts.'

author: b'Diane Cramer'
title: b"Couldn't finish it"
body: b'Characters I could not even begin getting interested in.  Located in a town that is flat and lackluster.  Rambling plot.  The only characters with depth are the teenagers.  It seems to me the author is best sticking to her comfort zone of adolescents.  Wish I had not bought the book nor wasted my time reading half of it.'

author: b'gpfnyc'
title: b'not good'
body: b'this book was a total bore . I wish I were Harry Potter so I could get back the time I wasted on this book'

author: b'T. C. Brayshaw'
title: b'Where is the story?'
body: b'I am presently almost half way through this book, and still asking myself why I keep reading it.  The opening chapter sets up a multitude of plot lines that that could have been followed but none were.  After her excellent series of young adult books I have been disappointed by the lack of structure.  It is an easy read.'

author: b'peewee'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b"... an array of characters with a multitude of conflicts... it boils down to the story of Krystal Weeden. It is plain to see Rowling's keen interest in needy children. The ending of this novel ... the funeral ... is perhaps the best I have ever read. What a tribute to a courageous girl!!!"

author: b'Ken Hall'
title: b'Character matters'
body: b"A writer who can create compelling characters and set them in motion in a story that raises universal questions is one who deserves to be read. That's what J.K. Rowling has done in The Casual Vacancy. I can't imagine anyone who has been a teen or a parent or who lives in a community -- in other words anybody -- being put off by this book the way some of the critics were. I'm astonished that any book review editor would have accepted a submission that started with and sometimes continued on the premise that this was no Harry Potter. That's not what you would call news or insightful. What was interesting and worthy of mentioning was her ability to create similar characters in vastly dissimilar situations. Harry and friends always felt like real teens with real teen troubles and desires even if their world was unreal. These teens and adults are real in the real world. It was not a perfect book. The prose and focus bogged down occasionally but only briefly. I wish she could have published this under a pen name. It deserved an honest and unbiased reception, one it did not get. But it deserves to be read and enjoyed on its own terms."

author: b'anonymous'
title: b'Casual Vacancy, a bit too real for me!'
body: b'I have been looking forward to the release of this book for a few weeks now and I feel a bit disappointed. The story is well written with some very clever phrasing, however I enjoy reading in order to imagine an alternate world for the duration of a story, not a more bleak glimpse of other\'s existences. I have not yet finished the book as I am finding that I only read it in small increments. Given J.K. Rowling\'s talent as a writer when she set out to create a more "real" town with characters you could meet on the street, she succeeded!'

author: b'Dale Wilson'
title: b'Casual vacancy'
body: b'Very disappointing...after enjoying all the Harry Potter series and the wonderful imagination that went into her writing, Casual Vacancy was hard to get into, had characters that were so uninteresting and all worried by SO many issues, there was hardly a likable one in the book.  The English "slang" made reading very stilted.  I read the whole book, but at the end wished I hadn\'t read it at all.'

author: b'M. Sanchez'
title: b'Casual Vacancy Review'
body: b'I have not finished this book because it is a book that is easy to put down.  Not a page turner for me.  The death of a council member allows you to go inside the lives of many of the small town"s citizens.  I expected more from the writer that brought us Harry Potter, books that I have read many times.'

author: b'Conrad F. Sterling'
title: b'DISAPOINTED'
body: b'So many cuss words and not a sin left uncovered in the book.  Reaaly a slow read and too many characters to try and keep track of. I was really disappointed in this whole book.'

author: b'Stephanie'
title: b'Complicated read'
body: b'I gave up 1/3 through the book. All the political talk and constantly switching back and forth between characters was killing me.'

author: b'Frances Lee Carlson'
title: b'my review'
body: b"it's not up to the level of her harry potter books but it is very entertaining.  i'm hoping that it will be made into a movie."

author: b'Elizabeth M. Ortiz'
title: b'Casual Vacancy'
body: b'In her first attempt at "adult" fiction Ms. Rowling holds nothing back, using language and very graphic images that only very wel grounded adults should read.  All of her characters are seriously flawed, as are most of us; but they have made some very fateful decisions that affect those around them in very negative ways.  It is a very dark story, and the ending brings no relief from the sadness, only relief that the book has finally ended.'

author: b'George B. Lane'
title: b'A Little Boring'
body: b'I believe Ms. Rowling should stick with Harry Potter. Her plot line in the new book seems contrived and rather provincial. I had trouble maintaining interest and could only read a few pages at a sitting, whereas with a book that interests me I can read about 100 pages at a sitting. I also had trouble empathizing with her characters.'

author: b'Peggy S. Bell'
title: b"She  should have stuck to writing kid's novels!!!"
body: b'Wow!! this book is just awful!!!1 Boring,boring, jumbled and confusing @ times. I think she should have stuck to Harry Potter. Will never read her again!!'

author: b'Ari Dale'
title: b'Missing magic.'
body: b"In her iconic Harry Potter series, Rowling had even hard core, no-nonsense, no- fantasy readers in awe of her wit and wizardry with the written word; many who didn't  believe in magic  became fully enchanted.  By contrast, The Casual Vacancy is a regular novel, with a reasonably interesting but not extraordinary plot.  Some of the sex scenes are really quite superfluous- even amateurish, as if a highschool student were trying to shock his Creative Writing teacher.  There were too many forgettable characters doing unremarkable things.  Try again, JK, but maybe don't try so hard."

author: b'bames'
title: b'Interesting read'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy is definitely something different from JK Rowling's Harry Potter series. The reader is best to leave any preconceived ideas that the book will be somewhat similar. The Casual Vacancy is an interesting story about the residents of the fictional town of Pagford."

author: b'ckodin'
title: b'Loved it!'
body: b"I hope that Rowling contines to write adult fiction. I couldn't put this book down. The characters are so intense and weave an excellent story."

author: b'Ant'
title: b'Bleak, bitchy and brilliant'
body: b'After Harry Potter, we all know that JKR is a good storyteller, but who knew she could write as well!'

author: b'Coffee Addicted Writer (Billy)'
title: b'Beautifully Written, but Flawed'
body: b'J. K. Rowling is one of the most successful writers of all time due to her Harry Potter franchise becoming a worldwide phenomenon. I was a bit surprised when she announced that she was writing an adult book instead of another children fantasy series. The moment she made the announcement the pressure for success was on her.'

author: b'Goodreading7778'
title: b'Loved it!'
body: b"I bought this book, before it was released, with no expectations of what it would be like. I was very excited to find that it was a really enjoyable book and I was thoroughly entertained whilst reading it. I loved J.K. Rowling's writing style, the characters were interesting and her view of small town interactions was really funny and even twisted at times. I hope she continues to write adult fiction as I loved reading this book."

author: b'Timothy S. Reader'
title: b"A great read (if you're smart enough to take it on its own merits)"
body: b"I'll give the naysayers one thing - it is kind of a slow burn and you probably won't be racing through the first few chapters with your heart pounding.  I can even understand why someone without a lot of time to read could put it down and forget to put it back up, but when it gets going this is a cracking domestic melodrama that will have you grabbing a few pages whenever you can.  I was also pleasantly surprised that it's much less preachy than I've been led to believe, I suspect J. K. Rowling and I don't see eye to eye on matters of social security and public housing, but not once does this book veer into progaganda, and if it didn't change my opinion about anything, it also didn't make me feel angry or even particularly challenged.  Yes, it's a tad expensive and I'm the first to admit that I bought it so I wasn't left behind when people were discussing it, but if it's not worth paying for right this minute, it's still one you want to bookmark and not forget about."

author: b'Joshua Gross'
title: b"It Doesn't Have to be About Wizards To Be Good"
body: b"This was an interesting book. JK Rowling created some in-depth characters and situations, and it was interesting to read how they interacted with and misunderstood each other. The plot and characters were well crafted and came together well at the end. I think JK Rowling has written a perfectly fine book for adults and has proven she knows what she's doing, despite all the readers out there wondering why there's no wizards and why it's not more fun. The Casual Vacancy explores the lives of realistic characters in a confusing and often tragic realistic world. It also raises many questions about what's important and what's not, and how things appear as opposed to how they really are. I read this book because I appreciate JK Rowling and I knew reading something she had written would be worthwhile."

author: b'Avidreader'
title: b'disappointed'
body: b'I managed to wade through almost half of the book before I gave from boredom.  This may be a great "work of literature" but it failed to hold my attention. Too bad it cost so much.'

author: b'PollyC'
title: b'Character pictures'
body: b"JK Rowling writes in nice clear prose, and you don't catch her trying to be clever - she just is clever. The Casual Vacancy is true to form. I have never understood the HP bashing, and I don't understand the criticism leveled at this new novel. If it isn't to one's taste, then that's not the same thing as it being a 'bad' book. Bad writing is always obvious, but good writing can be both obvious and innocuous. JK Rowling is certainly a successful writer, but I also believe her to be a good writer."

author: b'vegantrav'
title: b"No, it's not Harry Potter.  Yes, it is fantastic!!"
body: b'Full disclosure: I adore J. K. Rowling. I worship her as a literary goddess, as a muse nonpareil. I think she is one of the greatest storytellers in human history and a superb writer to boot (not the greatest writer, though: in my estimation, that honor belongs to both William Shakespeare and Fyodor Dostoevsky). Thus, my review of The Casual Vacancy may not be completely unbiased.'

author: b'Mae10286'
title: b'very good novel'
body: b'I actually really loved this book.  It took me a bit of time to get into it, but the second half flew by.  There is enough intrigue and little questions answered along the way to keep you going.  Funny and Sad, very well written.'

author: b'lildog'
title: b'It takes a village...or one good man'
body: b"The Casual Vacancy generated a ton of speculation and excitement as people looked forward to JK Rowling's next literary effort. I was very excited when I downloaded my copy to my Kindle and sat down to enjoy her work. The book is a sort of parable, as JK is fond of developing stories that operate on several levels.  At its most simplistic level, its about the death of a town council member and the ripple effects that death has on the members of his small community.  On another level it is a study of the politics and infighting of small town governance.  On yet another level, its a closer look at the inner workings of relationships rife with physical and emotional abuse, and the co-dependency that fuels these dysfunctional families.  And ultimately, it is a concrete demonstration of the evil that occurs when the village has no interest in helping to raise its neglected children.  Is it a happy story?  Not really.  Is it an interesting character study?  Absolutely.  You come to understand and sympathize with the members of JK's community, some of them against your better judgement.  JK Rowling has an amazing talent for writing and bringing these odd ensemble characters to life."

author: b'James Horlan'
title: b'Hogwarts Nowhere to Be Found'
body: b"This is probably the best Maeve Binchy novel since Circle of Friends......wait, what?  It's Jo Rowling?  Oh right.  You sure?"

author: b'SusanB45LK'
title: b'Train Wreck'
body: b'I will never get the several hours of my life back.  Sorry.  Stick to Harry Potter.  And, I had such high hopes.......'

author: b'Ruth Glennon'
title: b'There must have been Dementors hovering nearby as she wrote.'
body: b'I feel like all the happiness had been sucked out if me. As if I will never be cheerful again. Need some chocolate.'

author: b'Cassidy Fontana'
title: b'Given public opinion, I almost feel like I should apologize for more or less liking this book...'
body: b"This an incredibly difficult book to review, because I had such mixed feelings about it over the course of reading. In the beginning, I found it surprisingly vulgar (not just because it's JKR, but more so than many other adult books I've read), and I also thought it was somewhat slow. To an extent the vulgarity comes from the kinds of characters Rowling portrays, but in my opinion she takes it further than she has to."

author: b'Linda'
title: b'Horrible!'
body: b"Do you want to get depressed? Then read this book. It has it all: child abuse, child molestation, rape, prostitution, heroin, self-mutilation, cyber-bullying, domestic violence, ample swearing, etc. etc. etc. I guess Rowling was attempting to showcase her versatility by veering as far from the Harry Potter books as possible. This book is depressing from beginning to end. Don't waste your money."

author: b'IrishLass'
title: b"I wanted to like this book, but it just wasn't likable"
body: b'I\'ve read and re-read the Potter series, so I couldn\'t wait for Ms. Rowling\'s first "grown-up" book.  Maybe if I\'d had lower expectations, I wouldn\'t have been so disappointed. The book had no redeeming characters, the pace was plodding, and I found it hard to finish. If it had been written by anyone else, I would have abandoned it, but I kept thinking there might be a hopeful twist.  I\'m not suggesting a Pollyanna all\'s-well-that-ends-well finish, but a nice mixture of positive and negative personalities would have been nice. I hope Ms. Rowling returns to the fantasy genre...there\'s no doubt she is gifted, so hopefully this is just a hiccup in her successful career.'

author: b'S. Spilka'
title: b'A Rousseaistic Quandary'
body: b'I must confess that when I was reading the book, I wanted to write a review that would bury it. Like many others, I felt that the adult characters in the book were intolerably mean, cruel, and selfish. However, now that I have finished the book, I am propelled to praise it. Simply put, I miss it. Unbelievably, I want to be in Pagford again, with its unsavory characters and heart-breaking victims. Why? Because the book is vivid and powerful, and its ending packs a punch.'

author: b'Margaret Sebastian'
title: b'Love it!'
body: b'I have to write 20 words and "I loved the book" isn\'t enough.  I have the CD version and feel as if I knew the characters by the end.  Beautifully written JKR - more please.'

author: b'Leanna'
title: b'Another Great Effort from Rowling'
body: b"I am absolutely a J. K. Rowling fan, having grown up along with the Harry Potter series. I pre-ordered The Casual Vacancy with the highest expectations, and while it certainly doesn't measure up to the Potter series, it's still a great read on its own. The characters were all expertly crafted, and while the plot got a little lost during some parts of the story I still couldn't put the book down. It's a quick, easy read that I'd definitely recommend."

author: b'Traveling Wilbery'
title: b"This novel makes you think about your values, although it's not original and is very depressing"
body: b'Before I started reading the novel, I scanned reviews and was amazed at the number of one star reviews. After finishing the novel, I think, I know why  there are so many. I think, people expected JKR to come up with something as original as Harry Potter series.  Alas, Harry Potter happens only once, and we all are thankful that it did happen :-))'

author: b'Nancy Anne Kirby'
title: b'It really gets better after the first 100 pages or so...'
body: b"I've noticed a majority of the one and two star reviews put the book down around the 100 page mark, and that is why I wanted to review this book.  First of all, I am a big Harry Potter fan- I absolutely loved the book series.  Second of all...try to forget that the same author wrote this book- it is nothing like Harry Potter."

author: b'Upstater'
title: b'I loved it!'
body: b'This is exactly how I imagined JK Rowling\'s comeback. It is a TRUE book that should be judged on its own merit ( I love HP books, if that matters). Once you clear your mind of any expectations about what this book should and shouldn\'t be, you will find a rare and profoundly moving literary work of an amazing writer. English( American) is my second language and yes, I understood and enjoyed every bit of the book( I\'m mentioning it because a lot of people commented on the "trouble" they had with reading the book because of British English). Not only that, I swear I "saw" the future movie in my head while I was reading it, including I now have my own "cast" for it, because as much as JK Rowling denies that this is a "filmable" book, I sincerely doubt she believes it. The book is excellent, her writing is even better.'

author: b'KateJones'
title: b'Grim and depressing'
body: b'I knew this was going to be a different book from the Harry Potter series, but I had not at all expected something so dark and grim and depressing.'

author: b'Antoinette Klein'
title: b"J.K. Rowling Isn't Just For Kids Anymore"
body: b"I've never read a Harry Potter book but, of course, knew of this author's extraordinary fame.  Therefore, I was anxious to read her first book written specifically for adults.  Also, I am a great fan of those who write of life in small English villages.  But be forewarned:  this is not the quaint and cozy village as found in works by Rosamunde Pilcher or Maeve Binchy.  This is a dark and seamy tale that explores the worst of rural life, the not-so-neighborly residents who wouldn't lend a hand if their life depended on it."

author: b'Gentle Reader'
title: b'Waste of a good writer'
body: b"Couldn't bring myself to continue reading after the first seven pages.  Somehow I expected a charming, well-written story with interesting characters and intriguing background.  What I got was the British version of a Danielle Steele novel.  For those who are looking for a charming, gentle read, this is NOT it.  Lesson to self: never assume that a great writer will continue to be a great writer when changing genres."

author: b'Michele'
title: b'Tragic, but everyone ought to read it!'
body: b"This is one of the most tragic books I've ever read. I ended up speeding through the second half in one day to get it over with because I didn't want to linger over it. One reason it's so particularly sad is that it's about modern life for many people, both well-to-do and poor. I hope a lot of people read this book. I think it could be an eye-opener for many."

author: b'seagreen'
title: b'a literary disaster'
body: b"It's not just that this book is unlike the Harry Potter books, it's that it lacks the range, beauty, clarity, height, breadth, imagination and compassion of those books. I didn't just feel disappointed-- because this is an author I truly love-- what I felt was more like grief. No, I did not read the whole thing. I couldn't. I'm going to return it and hope for the very best next time around."

author: b'Elizabeth Bennett'
title: b"Say it ain't so, Jo!"
body: b"I found Casual Vacancy an overwhelming disappointment.  Too many characters, such sad teens..two of whom remind me of the Columbine shooters, although they did not mount a mass attack...Each of the characters is well-sketched, but I hit compassion fatigue pretty early.  It's a sort of Lord of the Flies meets HArper Valley PTA in an English village.  Rowling is still a wordsmith, manages complex plotting deftly, and can capture nuance perfectly.  But worth reading?  Oh no."

author: b'Marva'
title: b"Don't spend your money on this one"
body: b"Don't spend your money on this book.  I wish I hadn't spent mine!! I couldn't even get past the first chapter.  It is filled with sex and foul language.  It is dark, dismal and depressing."

author: b'sydney reader'
title: b'no surprises...'
body: b'HP was a derivative pastiche, spawning Twilight and company, and if you think about it, HP was filled with a good deal of quasi-sadistic violence, directed at children. Little wonder then that her first adult effort was adult in every sense of the word but one: there is no depth. Overall, the vacancy in this ponderous and pretentious book is anything but casual and confirms the suspicions of many, if many other reviews are an indication of public opinion: a lackluster book from a less than mediocre "author"- there are better books in the world, and I hope that readers will continue to appreciate substance over tripe and hype.'

author: b'heather'
title: b'a promising start but......'
body: b"Unlike most people, I went in to this book knowing that it would be different and VERY different it was......it took me days to finish this book, not because I didn't like it but because it was longer then it need to be and characters/events were usually a couple pages to long."

author: b'Hally Hazelmann'
title: b"Really wish I hadn't bothered"
body: b'The book was well-written as far as the style, characters, descriptions, etc, but so depressing and just tawdry and pointless.  It\'s as if JKR can only allow "magic" people to be good.  The parent-child relationships make me wonder if she has huge issues with her parents.  It\'s hard to believe a town this small would have quite that many horrible people, horrible parents and horrible kids.  I enjoyed the HP books, have read lots of contemporary British adult fiction and was curious about what Rowling would produce. I struggled through to the end of the book, but was very glad to be finished with it.'

author: b'lgl'
title: b'A great read - no one said it would be HP!!!'
body: b"I am very surprised by all the reviewers who compare this book to HP, and despair.  It's like comparing toothpaste and a candy bar because they both might be made by the same company.  This is adult realistic fiction - it's not young adult fantasy.  Very well written, very literate, very rich and even though it's 500 pages, it's good to the last drop.  I read this book over a weekend and enjoyed it all - wasn't even tempted to skim.  Entertaining yet not superficial.  Yes, the book actually touches on real life, even some of the aspects of real life that are not pretty.  Nothing tawdry, just real things that happen to real people.  It's not sensationalized nor is it sugarcoated.  I am glad that I did not believe all the negative reviews and got to enjoy this book."

author: b'Brian J. Buehler'
title: b'Took weeks to get through the first third'
body: b"Being a huge fan of the Potter books and movies, I signed up for the pre-order of The Casual Vacancy as soon as possible.  When it arrived, I tried to start reading the Kindle version.  It literally took me weeks to get through the first third of the book.  Had the author been anyone I did not have a strong pre-existing admiration of, I would have quit and given the book a single star.  It really feels like a two-star book but according to Amazon's scale and my feeling that it is basically OK, it gets 3 stars."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'One star is way too generous'
body: b"This is the worst book I have ever TRIED to read. Mostly narrative, little actual dialog among characters. I could stand no more after about 100 pages, and that was torture. It was my book club's choice, and that is the only reason I threw $14.99 in the toilet. Great sleeping pill."

author: b'annelan'
title: b'disappointed'
body: b'I have not read Harry Potter - So was looking forward to a book by the Author that appeared to be something I could get into and I loved the concept of the story- I have it on Audio book 13 hrs over three parts  - the first few chapters where great I had great hopes - JK can really write but I had to give up reading it 3 parts thru and I have never done that before  - It got so unendingly squalid and hatefull mean and dirty that the thought of another few hrs of that would likely do me in - It\'s like all the nasty stuff of a hundred peoples life has been set loose - I am not a "Pollyanna" reader but this was just too much- Maybe if it wasn\'t sooo long 13hrs of desperation is 7 hours too long.'

author: b'Blondie'
title: b'NOT worth the price'
body: b'The worst book I have ever read.  Boring story about people I could not have cared less about. I only finished it because of the price I paid.  AND the fact Amazon made me wait over 10 days to get the this book which I pre-ordered.'

author: b'S. C. Burnside'
title: b"So boring, I didn't even finish reading the Kindle sample!"
body: b"I got the sample sent to my kindle, and was so bored, I didn't even finish that. I didn't expect this from JK Rowling; I am very disappointed. I saw an interview in which she said it took her 4 years to write this book...maybe she bored herself!"

author: b'dizzerina'
title: b'Some Familiar Themes (if you love Harry Potter) in a Very Different World'
body: b'There are parts of this book that are fascinating and parts that don\'t really pay off. Krystal Weedon and her family are a pretty strong plot line, and I think it would have been a much better book if JKR had tightened it up to just her story and reduced the story arc of other characters to more of a supporting role, and how they relate to the Weedon family. Or maybe more of Sukhvinder too, her plot and ending felt very much like that of a character like Neville Longbottom, just most entrenched in the Muggle world, obviously. But there were so many storylines that just felt like, "well, this stuff happens in the real world." Yes, it does, and the descriptions are probably quite accurate. But that doesn\'t make them particularly rewarding to read, outside the occasional recognitions of some emotional truths. The arcs aren\'t that satisfying, and they don\'t particularly reward the effort of keeping up with them.'

author: b'Kharol S. Means'
title: b"Stick to children's books."
body: b'I expected more from the woman who wrote Harry Potter.  I did not want to read about pre-pubescent boys scratching their balls or their hard-ons....give me a break, that stuff is every where. Does she consider it necessary to sell a book ?  Went downhill for me after page 20 or so.'

author: b'Julie Jennings'
title: b'Stark portrayal of human nature'
body: b'The people in this book are wretched and sad, the only good one dies within the first few pages of the book. He had the same limitations yet he managed to survive and thrive. He made a point of trying to help bring those less fortunate along with him. She seems to have picked out the vices she most dislikes in people and assigned them a character in her book. Each has a pronounced problem and you are shown why, they are so well written that I found that I wanted to slap some of them and put my arms around others. The book will hold you and make you think long after about the characters. In a way it seems to be a mirror, you must have the fortitude for self examination and the willingness to see the truth. She lays bare the most base attitudes and behaviors, it is subtle in some and extreme in others and you are made aware of just how much damage can come of it. There are chain reactions through out the book and there is a very tangible sense of how fragile life really is. This book is not a cozy as one reviewer mentioned and while there is humor, it is dark. This book is meant to make you think about yourself, your actions and your attitude towards others.'

author: b'VintageFan'
title: b'Dark and Morose'
body: b"I am another in the minority who did not read the Harry Potter book series, however, I did see the movie series with my Granddaughter.  I purchased this book because I was curious about what type of story Ms. Rowling would write for an adult audience and was intrigued by the descriptions I read. I was hoping for a sharp, funny and insightful look at small town politics with its' real-life consequences. Instead, it was immediately evident that this story was another dark and morose tale of children being victimized by  cruel and dangerous adults, and in turn, victimizing each other. Ms. Rowling is adept at painting an exacting picture of the effects of cyclic poverty, substance abuse and child abuse that is apparrently as dire in the UK as it is in the US. She is also dead on at illustrating the chiasmic flaws in an ineffective and impotent child welfare system that is also apparrently as dysfunctional there as it is here. The last two chapters of the book were  the best, in my opinion. It left me crying, as a tragic ending will often do. While I feel Ms. Rowling is a very good writer and has a talent for weaving together many plot lines at once, this book wasn't what I expected or what I had hoped to read on my fall vacation."

author: b'elizabeth andropolis'
title: b'Too Close for Comfort?'
body: b"Instead of presenting the struggle between good and evil in a realm somewhere between reality and fantasy, Rowling confronts us with the world or our own making wherein our choices determine the fabric of our present society. This makes for uncomfortable reading, as upon honest reflection we see a glimmer of ourselves and neighbors in her characters. The story is firmly set in England, yet the plight of each person surely has a worldwide counterpart. The citizens of Pagford and Yarvil seem incapable of honest self-reflection. It is only when faced with tragic interconnected situations, that may have been averted if they hadn't been so self-centered, do they pause to think beyond themselves...yet some still fail to perceive."

author: b'Samuel B. Pierson'
title: b'Dull as Ditchwater'
body: b'Snooze inducing and terminally boring. A pointless excursion into English suburban life. Too much exposition, and I am not engaged with the characters. The Only thing interesting was the barrage of un-potterlike profanity.'

author: b'RachelVol'
title: b'Not as bad as everyone  makes it sound.'
body: b'I was excited to read JK Rowling\'s new novel, but then after reading many of the reviews I was worried I would be disappointed.  Thankfully, I was not!  The plot, setting, and characters are nothing like Harry Potter, but especially when I first started reading, I kept noticing similarities between her writing style in this "adult" novel and in Harry Potter. However, I made a point to disassociate this novel from her previous ones.  I think you do this novel a disservice by associating it with Harry Potter.'

author: b'Bonnie Jane'
title: b'Ugh'
body: b"What a disapointment. While JK certainly doesn't need the proceeds from this book, somehow I think she owes her readers at least a shot at an entertaining read.  Enough has been said about plot etc. The effect of this book is depression and boredom.  Can she successfully put one word behind another to make a sentence? Sure. Is the outcome pleasant to read?  Not in this case.  JK has said that she doesn't much care what people have to say about her book, she wanted to write it. So there.  If this book did not have J.K. Rowling on  the cover I would not have bought it.  Adult fare  she says.  I will stay a kid, thank you."

author: b'Wendy'
title: b'Great Read'
body: b'This was a great book. 5 stars.'

author: b'jlh'
title: b"Sorry JK, but I'm disappointed!"
body: b'I had hoped to love this book, but am afraid that I found it to be filled with characters who are mired in lives that are sad and pathetic.  The adults are bitter and dissatisfied; and the children are on the same path.  I tried to feel some sympathy for all of them, but am afraid that I was glad when I came to the last page.'

author: b'Michael'
title: b'Thoughtful story'
body: b"I enjoyed this book more than I thought I would. I was immediately drawn to these very human characters. It defies the idea of good and bad characters. Regardless of how I felt about each character, they all faced their own dangerous and sometimes deadly and destructive demons. The lessons j.k. Rowling imparts are beyond the stories in her literary works. I'm inspired to stops and consider the personal struggle of others and be a helpful force in their lives wether foe or friend, vs. a destructive force."

author: b'Awaken'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"What a let down in reading this book. Not worth purchase nor worth the time to check it out in the library. The cost didn't bother me at all but the lack of .... Everything it is not!  It is so true about being inspired in life creates magic. This book was void of any! Very disappointed."

author: b'V. Lord'
title: b'Into the minds of the petty Pagfordians'
body: b"Ever the astute purveyor of internal dialogue, The Casual Vacancy takes us on a dark journey into the petty minds of citizens of Pagford, a small town in the west of the U.K.  Whereas Harry Potter's story highlighted every brave, kind, loyal impulse of man and took us on a journey of self-sacrifice and victory over evil, The Constant Vacancy does the opposite.  I found it depressing, and the heavy voiced narration of  Tom Hollander in the Audio CD version didn't help.  Everything was tinged with a dark undertone; there seemed to be no hope in sight for any of the characters.  I found I did not like any of the characters enough to care what ultimately happened to them, and I am even seriously reconsidering my desire to retire to just such a small place as Pagford, some idyllic place in the countryside of the U.K. now seeming to be a horrible grouping of nasty minded, petty individuals I'd do well to avoid."

author: b'Jamie K. Schumann'
title: b"Worst Book I've Ever Read"
body: b"I'm so glad I did not purchase this book, but I carry tremendous guilt that I am the person who asked that our public library pay money to order it!  Not one likeable character, no real plot, horrible all the way through, then an even worse ending.  I would not have even finished it, other than my optimism that JK Rowling would at some point in the book, make it all worthwhile.  Did not happen!  Had this been her first book, it would have been her last."

author: b'T. D. Myers'
title: b'Really?'
body: b"Okay, I know this is her 'adult' book, but really? Cursing in what seems every second sentence? You're better than that Ms. Rowling. The characters are just boring. I could not finish it, but may try to again. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, I won't be buying her next book. I'll wait for a copy at the library."

author: b'E. Robinson'
title: b'Great Book!'
body: b"This review doesn't have spoilers."

author: b'Favorite Grandma'
title: b'Very disappointed'
body: b'I was very disappointed with JK Rowlings new book.  I was excited to buy it but after just a few pages, I realized that I could not read this book.  It is full of very vulgar and offensive language.  I actually returned it to Amazon for a refund.'

author: b'Dark_morph84'
title: b'Great Deal!'
body: b"I was very excited to get this book, it came exactly on the date it was suppose too, and it was in perfect condition! Couldn't wait to get my hands on one! Also much cheaper than the book store. It was listed for $35 and was sold on Amazon for $20.90!"

author: b'D'
title: b'Pretty awful'
body: b'Wow.  I loved her writing with HP and was really looking forward to her new effort.  Unfortunately, she seems to equate "adult fiction" with the idea that it must contain disgusting language, images and people.  It\'s an insult to the reader.  I wouldn\'t recommend this to anyone.  Save your money.'

author: b'Kalba'
title: b"Don't Expect Magic"
body: b"While I wasn't expecting a return to Hogwarts or anything about Quidditch, I was expecting an interesting and perhaps readable book."

author: b'Claire'
title: b'Casual Vacancy Big Disappointment'
body: b'I was excited to see where J.K. would take her story writing but sadly disappointed that her Adult book needed to tell a story so filled with explicit and vile language and scenes.  I feel her story could have been told with out every other word out of many characters mouths being the F word.  I understand the some of the characters have a horrid life, I get that.  I have read quite a bit of this book hoping to get to the good stuff.  Not finding it.  Not at all what I expected from the book cover.'

author: b'Nanci'
title: b'Giving up - for now'
body: b"I've only read 93 pages, but am giving up - or maybe taking a break? - from the book. I ADORE the Harry Potter series, and knew going into this that it would be very, very different. I didn't expect to love it, but I did expect to enjoy it. Instead, I've met a cast of characters, none of whom I like, and it feels like, after 92 pages, we're still in the intro."

author: b'Joshua Glowzinski'
title: b'What?'
body: b"Ok, maybe it is because I have been really tired when I am trying to read this.  Maybe it is because a lot of the stuff in this book is in reference to what I assume is and are English places and things.  But, I can not comprehend this book at all.  I mean, I read a chapter and instantly forget everything I've read.  No, I do remember key parts.  But the rest just leaps from my mind.  I got to page 30 or so and decided to start over.  She spends a lot of time telling things about characters right away.  Just little things.  I just have not gotten into it yet.  I guess I need a dictionary.  My eyes kind of pop out.  I will try again though.  I mean, it's on my iPad, so I own it for good.  I get the feeling that it is written well, just a lot of stuff that is above me, words, phrases, places and things."

author: b'DownUnder'
title: b'Cold and clinical'
body: b"I've never read JK Rowling before and was keen to read this novel based on the majority of reviews which referred to humour - even if black humor - and brilliant depictions of people and life.  The brilliant depictions are true - undeniably Rowling is a gifted writer.  I didn't find any humour, black or otherwise, in this unrelenting picture of self-involvement, class warfare and pettiness.  I can only hope it isn't a real reflection of life in British villages.  Like watching a car crash repeatedly on film, I had to keep going (a testament to the author's skill) to see if there was some kind of redemption or hope available for this sorry and infinitely sad cast of characters.  Nope!  Buy it:  the writing is excellent, but the story line left me feeling rather like the character Sukhvinder."

author: b'C. Gibbon'
title: b'Not a Great Effort'
body: b'This book really dragged at the beginning. The introduction of so many characters made them very hard to keep straight. I think I finally got most of them into my head about halfway through the book. It was just a story about a typical small town and its problems with a sad ending. Definitely not worth the price. I sincerely hope that Ms Rowling does not continue this story (because I could see an opportunity for a sequel) in her next attempt at an adult novel.'

author: b'Wade McGinnis'
title: b"Maybe in magazines, but you'll still be my star."
body: b"J.K. Rowling has written here one of my favorite type of stories: loads of characters seemingly disconnected, yet their stories come together in intricate ways.  Some reviewers aren't comfortable with the many characters whose moral codes are in the grey area at best, but I think that's what makes this a great novel.  Rowling has weaved together delicious drama and interpersonal conflict in her first adult novel, and I will continue to read anything she publishes!"

author: b'C. M. Poole'
title: b'I enjoyed it after all'
body: b"This is by no means a children's book, which I think we have established.  This is also a very British book.  Most may not understand some of the slang used (especially by the more 'lower-class' characters) unless you understand British slang and culture very well.  If you have seen the TV series Skins, then I imagined it to be similar, only there is a lot more adult character attention and politics."

author: b'Patricia A. Murphy'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy Is Formally Vacant Of Likeability'
body: b"Perhaps the reason for J.K. Rowling writing this dark, joyless novel, with truly unlikable characters, was to prove to the world that she could create something that doesn't appeal to children. If so, she succeeded. Trouble is, it doesn't appeal to adults, either. Certainly not to this one. The Harry Potter books started out fun and they grew progressively darker and less amusing. Even so, they were good reads.  Maybe that dark side managed to completely take over this author to the point where all entertainment was, unfortunately, blotted out. I had high hopes for something  immensely  readable here.  I'm fairly certain I won't be anticipating anything of value should there be another book from Rowling.  For sure, didn't get one this time around. Not a book I'd recommend. With all the books on my list that I want to read, I'm rather sorry I wasted any time on this one."

author: b'J. Reid'
title: b'The Not So Casual Battle of the Classes Drama!'
body: b"J.K. Rowling has once again engulfed her readers in another world.  This time its not full of witches, wizards and magical creatures, but the real life demons addiction, prejudice, abuse and poverty....to name a few.  The characters are richly developed and well crafted, allowing the reader insight into why and how they've become the people they are.  While all manner of unpleasant dramas unfold in the seemingly ideal town of Pagford, the heart of the book is the battle between the classes and the potential repercussions to society of turning a blind eye towards the poor and disadvantaged."

author: b'James Duckett'
title: b'I Wanted To Love This'
body: b"I picked up The Casual Vacancy because of my love for J.K. Rowling's previous books. This is not my normal genre of reading choice, but I thought good writing would make it enjoyable. I know this is not a MG or YA Fantasy, and I'm not going to knock it stars because it isn't."

author: b'allana'
title: b'i did not like it and just skimmed through'
body: b'it would be unfair to review this book  as i did not read it fully actually not much at all but amazon keeps on making it pop up and asking me for a review so i had to find a way to stop this,generally i did not buy it the school i work in had a copy lying around i skimmed and scanned and lost my interest quite quickly this of course does not mean others might not enjoy it i didnt at least those bits i rushed by ,now i hope amazon will leave me alone kisses to all and to all a good night'

author: b'Beverly Hopkins'
title: b'BORING!!!'
body: b'I was disappointed in this book.  I was so bored, I did not even finish it, and I honestly tried to (three times).  Too many characters and confusing to follow them.'

author: b'H. KITE'
title: b'Incredibly Dull'
body: b'I kept waiting for something to happen in this book.  However, it never did.  I find my local village meetings more interesting than reading about the problems in this small town.  Very disappointing.'

author: b'L. Peterson'
title: b'Rowlings Move to Adult Story'
body: b"This book was a major disappointment.  I loved the Harry Potter books.  Thus, my expectations were high for the author's move to adult characters.  I purchased the book at the Philadelphia Airport before flying to a rural destination for four days knowing I would have much time with little or nothing to do.  My first criticism is that she introduces way too many characters in the first few pages and we are supposed to keep these people--parents and their children--separated one from the other.  To complicate this process, she alternates from using their given names and their nicknames.  Unlike War and Peace, there is no list to help the reader remember who the characters are.  I had nothing else to read otherwise I probably would have given up after 50+ pages.  All of the characters keep returning over and over so one does not feel that some are important and some not.  My second criticism is that all of the characters are dysfunctional.  There is no one to like or cheer onward.  One does not care about anyone in this tale.  I do not recommend the book."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'First Off- Quit Comparing this to Harry Potter. Totally Different Genre..'
body: b"No. It's not a fantasy book. It never claimed to be a fantasy book, and obviously if you read it, you must be able to read, so take some time to read the sleeve and notice that this was never meant to be a fantasy book. If more people had done this, this quite enjoyable piece of literature would not be rated a mere 3 stars. Honestly, it's ridiculous. Most of the poor reviews are from people who were disappointed it wasn't Harry Potter.. If you rated it poorly due to this reason, you should be ashamed of yourself. If you rated it poorly because you have legit problems with it, then good for you. But I highly doubt most people truly absorbed the story, because not everyone would rate it as highly as I chose to, but it sure as heck wasn't a 1 star read. Come on now... 1 star is like... Dan Brown. Even that Twilight garbage is more like a 2.. hat. Rowling writes better that that, even if you didn't like the story at all."

author: b'PB Backenson'
title: b'Enjoyed The Casual Vacancy very much.'
body: b"I loved how J.K. Rowling fleshed out each character. Two-thirds into the book I was thinking about how their lives were unfolding as I went through my day as if I too were a resident of Pagford and they were real people. I look forward to more from Rowling. She's a great writer."

author: b'Dharma'
title: b'Terrific Book. Hard for American readers to understand'
body: b"This is a terrific book. Great characters, excellent pacing, fearless, and full of insight. It won't win any Booker prizes because it has way too much plot, and not an ounce of gloss or superficiality. The complex web of characters emerge from the accumulation of details as real people, not admirable, but convincing."

author: b'Ian R. Bruce'
title: b'Uneven'
body: b"It's hard - maybe impossible - to put aside the Potter legacy and read this adult novel on its own merits."

author: b'Beatrice31'
title: b'Really Not Good'
body: b"I loved the Harry Potter series the way I love ice cream.  A LOT.  I had really high hopes for THE CASUAL VACANCY.  I love adult literary fiction. When I read the teaser I pictured something like the quirky movie, WAKING NED DIVINE. I thought, WOW that's really awesome that she'd write something totally different. I was hoping for the magical feeling without the magic."

author: b'T. C. Pile'
title: b'Rowling Conjures a Tale for Adults'
body: b'No one can say that J.K. Rowling cannot conjure up a good story, and the Casual Vacancy is most certainly a good story. The plot is every bit as intricate and twisted as any of the Harry Potter books, the characters are fully drawn and believable, and the action keeps you in suspense, waiting for the multiple threads of narrative that Rowling lays out to align and spontaneously combust. You can feel that explosion coming early in the book, as layer after layer of the peaceful veneer of small-town life in the English countryside is peeled away to reveal the simmering cauldron of anxieties, neuroses, overblown egos, class and racial tensions, and suppressed rage that lies beneath.'

author: b'Brittany D'
title: b'Great Character Study'
body: b"I think plot details have been reviewed pretty well by this time, so I'd like to comment on the characters."

author: b'James Montgomery'
title: b"It's not supposed to be like Harry Potter"
body: b"Rowling wanted to write something completely different from Harry Potter. She has made it clear that this is aimed squarely at adults. I thoroughly enjoyed this gritty novel even with the large amount of verbal obscenities. However, be warned it's morbid & the ending doesn't tie everything up nicely. (i.e. who stays in Pagford & who ends up romantically involved with whom)"

author: b'Alex Knight-Hernandez'
title: b'Eh'
body: b"Good book, with a lot going on and a boat load of characters. The e-book version costs way too much and on top that you can't lend it out! What's up with that??"

author: b'Wozzie29'
title: b'Ho hum'
body: b"I did not read the HP books so came to this novel with few expectations. There is no doubt in my mind that JKR is a very talented wordsmith.  However, I found the book hard going and I'm reading others in between, that is, while I plough through.  Too many characters and I don't give a hoot about any of them, not much happenning... I'm sure it's very subjective but I'm having a lot of trouble getting through the novel."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Loved this Book'
body: b"I've read the HP series and I couldn't wait to see what new direction JK Rowling would take us,  I was not disappointed, the same masterful storytelling is evident.  I was so wrapped up in the characters and their lives that I find myself wondering what's going on with them now and I miss reading about them."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'An excellent read'
body: b'The start of this book is very slow and I was suprised Rowlings had chosen such a dull topic. After all local politics is tedious is any country. However, she draws you in with the development of her characters who despite being flawed and generally unpleasant lodged themselves in my mind leaving me thinking about them long after I finished the book. This is not a light hearted or humerous book, but is a easy read which I highly recommend.'

author: b'Nathan Webster'
title: b'Very dark, very British - and very good. Rowling is legit.'
body: b'Obviously, after seven Harry Potter books, JK Rowling was basically all set as far as her checkbook was concerned...but while I certainly enjoyed those books even as an adult, there\'s always the question of "is this all there is?" As though those stories weren\'t enough, since they were "fantasy."'

author: b'Tess'
title: b'So Disappointed'
body: b'So disappointed in this book.  Very boring.  I kept waiting for the story to take off but it never did.  A very depressing cast of characters and such a sad commentary on small town life.  I so loved the Harry Potter books and was expecting much more from this author.'

author: b'S. Klein'
title: b'A bit surprised'
body: b'Let me preface by saying I did not go into this thinking about HP. I knew that this was an adult book and not in the fantasy genre. I got it (from the library, thankfully) out of curiosity because I wanted to see how well she could write an adult book.'

author: b'Sam'
title: b'SNOOZEFEST'
body: b"As a fan of J.K. Rowling I was excited for her first adult novel. Was I expecting Harry Potter......no, but I was expecting a good read. Boy was I wrong. Rowling herself describes this book as a Black Comedy but there is one thing missing, there is not one thing funny in this book or even slightly amusing. With great anticipation the book finally arrived in the mail and I opened it ready for an evening of good reading. It has been a week now and I have only managed to get to page 56 and am calling it quits. In all fairness I did pick out random pages throughout the book and read them only to find out that it felt like what I had read in the first 56 pages. The characters, like the book itself, are flat and uninteresting, the cussing and the sex seems like she is trying to say See I can write for adults, except you don't have to be vulgar and crass to make a book good. Maybe if Barry Fairbrother had lived the book would have been better. Rowling also said that she didn't write the book for her fans but more for herself....maybe she should have had bound just one and kept it on her bookshelf and saved us all from wasting our money. If she writes another book will I buy it? Maybe after I have read more reviews and not just because she wrote it expecting it to be great. If I could ask her one question it would be will you please refund me my money so that I can buy a good book. My recommendation: Borrow from the library if you really want to give it a go, but don't waste your money."

author: b'Psin Khan'
title: b'OHH, No!!!!!!! It is a jamble and has no energy.'
body: b'Was unable to finish reading The Casual Vacancy. Just not the type of story I like to read. In looking back at the HP books I can see a hint of the style for this book in the Order of the Phoenix.'

author: b'Teresa Pietersen'
title: b'Everyday Life Under A Microscope'
body: b'This is not fantasy and is in no way a Harry Potter book.'

author: b'Kelly Brouillard'
title: b'horribly boring'
body: b"I had no delusions that The Casual Vacancy was going to be anything like Harry Potter. I was interested because I'm such a fan of JK Rowling. But man, what a huge disappointment. This novel was horribly boring. I got as far as page 132 and then couldn't motivate myself enough to pick it up again. I wanted to keep going because I'm such a fan of Rowling, and I was determined to finish, but alas I just couldn't do it. I would pass if I were you."

author: b'Barbara Griffea'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'Not Harry Potter, completely different genre, but just like I did with the Potter series, I will eventually reread this book.  It is that good!'

author: b'Andre C. Brummer'
title: b'Extremely Disappointing - Beware Language'
body: b'I had enjoyed HP and was looking forward to reading "The Casual Vacancy". After 15 minutes I tossed it in the trash can, where it belongs. The constant swearing and blasphemy was too much for me.'

author: b'Debbie Johnston'
title: b'sleeping pill , and yes I did read Harry Potter !!'
body: b"I love her writings and NO i was NOT expecting a new Harry Potter....  the book starts off great and then moves into a boring offensive language that doesn't help... I just took too long to read it.... after the funeral it got even worse..... where was the  desire to get to the end ?? I still haven't found it. All the swearing just lost me...."

author: b'R.Reader'
title: b'Overall, a pretty depressing book, but the characters are very memorable ..'
body: b'I never touched Rowling before, so I cannot and will not be comparing her potter work to this. I will not be holding her in any godlike regard. I have read The Casueal Vacancy with clear eyes. I understand the risk an author takes to offer something new to their public, and so I commend Rowling for that.'

author: b'Kathleen J. Menard'
title: b'DISAPPOINTING'
body: b"Disappointing doesn't begin to describe.  Characters are pathetic.  It's a good thing that this is not her first writing attempt"

author: b'Christopher E. Reid'
title: b'disappointing and disgusting'
body: b'I pre-ordered this book because I (used to) admire the author and was eager to read her new story. I stopped reading about 1/3 of the way through. I feel soiled. This book is devoid of all the things I love about her previous books. It\'s like she set out to prove she can write "adult" fiction. One third of the way in, I have no idea who the protagonist is or what the main plot is. No love, no hope, no positive virtue of any kind. No striving against evil. Just evil and depravity.'

author: b'Phyllis Guster'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy'
body: b'YES, this book was written by the author of the immensely popular Harry Potter series. NO, this book is NOT Harry Potter.'

author: b'S. Mari'
title: b'Like Huck Finn or The Wire'
body: b"I had not read any previews saying the book would be funny - and I actually feel awful for the readers who did. There is are funny moments, but these moments are like in life, painful, awful moments that are only funny years later. This book was not flat as many reviews claim, there simply was no dual at the end between good and evil. JK Rowling's readers will sort themselves out sooner or later and this book will get more readers who can review it without the word 'disappointing'."

author: b'fREADom'
title: b'A Huge Disappointment'
body: b'As with all of Ms. Rowling\'s books, I pre-ordered and waited in anticipation for "delivery" day.  While her HP books were intended for a younger audience, I was enthralled by her writing style, character development and creative plots.  I couldn\'t wait to read her "adult" book and share it with my 81-year-old mother.'

author: b'kate'
title: b'The only book I ever deleated without finishing'
body: b"never having read Harry Potter I had no preconceived expectations. All Ican say is I am so glad I did'nt pay 50 NZ dollars for the print edition. Awful"

author: b'Jeanie'
title: b'Imagine Harry Potter as a Real Boy'
body: b"It seems this book is one that people love, or they hate. The one star reviews for price isn't fair to the book or its author, nor are the reviews from people who didn't read it, or just a read bit of it."

author: b'Silicon Valley Girl'
title: b'Just substitute sex & drugs for wizardry...'
body: b"... and Bob's your uncle in J.K. Rowling's new universe."

author: b'vad'
title: b'Disappointed'
body: b"I just started reading Casual Vacancy, and I must say that so far I am disappointed.  I really don't know about the kind of person J.K. Rowling is, but I am appalled at her use of profane language and sexual situations.  It always frustrates me when a female author feels she has to resort to the kind of profanity many male authors use.  I was expecting a grown-up book, not an adult book.  I am certainly not a prude, but I am so tired of foul language.  There is a plethora of words in the English language to be used without constantly using profanity.  I guess I'll have to stick to elementary and middle school fiction!"

author: b'Erica Driscoll'
title: b'disgusting disappointment!'
body: b'I was so excited to read this new book by JK Roeling!  BUT, it was a complete waste of time and money.  UGH!  What a disappointment!  I feel like she tricked me into purchasing a pornographic book.  Much of the language in books today is unnecessary, and I can often overlook that.  However, her pornographic and explicit language was totally offensive--I would NEVER have purchased the book had I known she was going in this direction.  I will never buy another book of hers--ever.  BIG MISTAKE, Ms. Rowlling!  Disgusting!  BTW, I did not even finish the book because it is THAT offensive!'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Bleak, Boring and Disgustingly Profane'
body: b"I wasn't expecting this book to be anything like the Harry Potter series.  However, I had high expectations based on the fact that J.K. Rowling is an exceptional writer.  I heard that the book was very dark.  However, that was OK because the HP books had gotten darker and darker without losing that dry wit and sarcasm which made them so enjoyable. But I was very disappointed..."

author: b'blacklily'
title: b'Casual Vacancy Review'
body: b"Many people dislike this book but i don't think its because they are judging the book against the Harry Potter phenomena and not this book alone."

author: b'eeoyrefan'
title: b'If this book were an Every Flavor Bean, it would be TRIPE.'
body: b"I downloaded a sample of The CV to my Kindle over the weekend.  After reading it and encountering (just in the sample chapters) not only Ron Weasley's favorite expletive (BH!!), but the s-word, f-word and...perhaps most appalling of all from a female author...the c-word, I can tell you I WON'T be ordering the book."

author: b'Karen L. Stephens'
title: b'Searing Social Commentary'
body: b"I loved this book - yes it took a while to get going - with a huge cast of characters, each painstakingly introduced. However, the lengthy beginning certainly paid off as you become immersed in the daily, tortured struggles of people trying to find a sense of importance, 'authenticity' and meaning in the small community of Pagford."

author: b'Noella'
title: b"It Isn't Harry Potter: But It Is J.K. Rowling"
body: b'Like the myriad of reviewers before me have said, The Casual Vacancy is certainly not Harry Potter, but it is still J.K. Rowling. The book is written in her word using the same flourishing writing styles of the beloved pages of Harry Potter, and for this reason, it is impossible to separate the two. If you have never read a word penned by Rowling prior, than this book might take on an entirely different role for you. If, however, like so many others, you have read her works, it is downright impossible to forget them.'

author: b'skc'
title: b'Sudden death'
body: b'I know I cannot be alone in my thinking, as soon as sudden death occurred I was expecting a guest appearance by Harry attempting to capture the evil creature inflecting death an suffering on the muggles, but 60 pages in and still no Harry.  Very upsetting.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Junk'
body: b'A better title for this book would be The Jerks.  If you want to read 500 pages of selfish, boring characters without one redeeming quality then this is the book for you. I had to will myself to finish it, should not have bothered.'

author: b'David L. Snow'
title: b'Just OK'
body: b"I was expecting more of this book but I feel it didn't deliver.  With more than 80 characters it became confusing and I really didn't care what happened to any of them.  It seemed to drag on for me and I kept expecting something big to happen.  I was disappointed in the book and felt I could have spent my money better elsewhere."

author: b'Susan Dobmann'
title: b"If you like the Fword than you'll love this book !"
body: b'I am a huge Harry Potter fan.  When I bought this book I did it with the understanding that it would be nothing like Harry Potter.  If I had known about the overabundance of swearing I never would have picked it up. For example, Chapter 2 is less than 4 pages long and contains the F word five times.  A little swearing is acceptable for effect, but it was obvious that it would only get worse.  Needless to say I put the book down. If I could I would return it for a refund. Too bad that she alienated her audience with unneccessary language this way.'

author: b'Margot C.'
title: b"It's not Harry Potter, but no one said it would be. And it's good in its own right."
body: b"I'm a die-hard Harry Potter fan, and the greatest parts of that series include the quality of language, that it's entertaining and readable without being silly or simple, and the way Rowling creates complex, compelling characters--they have secrets, and I need to know what they are. Those same qualities come across all the way through The Casual Vacancy, which feels real and true, and it made me think about the characters and their relationships, why I did or didn't like them, and what their motivations are for their actions. While I was reading it, I kept thinking that I felt like I shouldn't enjoy it--it was upsetting and unnerving at times, and none of the characters was entirely likeable--but I totally did; in fact, I found it hard to put down. The plot isn't a sweeping, action-packed epic, but the subtlety with which Rowling crafts this small English town held my attention and kept me thinking after it was over."

author: b'chandria1026'
title: b'This book is awful...could not finish it.'
body: b'I will be honest with you, if I could have given this a negative star...I would have. I would like to state that I am an avid reader and I do go through at least a book a week, sometimes two. This is the first book in about ten years that I could literally not finish. Everything about it is awful. The only thing I am grateful for; that I have waited to get the book from the library and did not have to pay for it. Do yourself a favor and save your money and time!'

author: b'Catherine Dawsn'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy'
body: b"Over the past few weeks Ms. Rowling has been doing the talk and promotion circuit. The reviews on her newest novel - and only 'adult' release thus far - have been less than generous. And, some have been downright nasty - reflecting (I dare say) some of the human characteristics her story explores."

author: b'L. Erickson'
title: b'Heartbreaking and Tough But Masterful - Stick With It'
body: b'There is a lot of misery in this book, and no magic. The problems the characters face - poverty, addiction, abuse, mental illness, sudden death, infidelity, and many others - are relentless and cannot be fixed by the wave of a wand.
