Well, looks like it doesn't. Unless you can identify with the low-lifes of the world, and only them. I wish there could have been a better mix of characters. I can't believe that J K Rowling's audience is made up of mostly low-lifes on drugs with totally hopeless lives. How's about us regular people? I hope she tries again and learns something from all the bad reviews she's getting on this one."

author: b'Connie J. Jasperson'
title: b'An Adult book for adult readers'
body: b"J. K. Rowling is an extremely strong writer, and is brilliant at crafting and peopling her tales. First off, you need to set aside Harry Potter and read this book as if it were the only work of hers you've ever read.  If you go into this expecting Hogwarts and all the gang reinvented, you will be disappointed. You'll love or hate this book on the strength of her work, not because it is part of a mega-phenomenon. It is a story of ordinary people, living rather mundane lives. Their politics are mundane and too important to them; their motives are the usual trifling things which motivate petty people. These are not always nice people.  That said, I would recommend this book to those who read literary fiction. This is an adult book, for adult readers."

author: b'Shelly A. Uner'
title: b'"Adult" in every meaning of the word'
body: b'Let me say first, I am a HUGE fan of the Harry Potter series, and I\'m an adult with a literature degree currently teaching high school English.  I\'ve read the Potter series four times all the way through and have gotten more out of it every time.  I was so excited to have a new J.K. book and pre-ordered a hard copy and a Kindle version.  I only made it through five and half chapters and am thoroughly disgusted and disappointed.  As a friend said after I told her about my experience, "It\'s like the child actor who grows up and goes into porn just to prove they are no longer a child."  Why, J.K., why?'

author: b'Y. Scott'
title: b'Gutsy effort, but not delivered well'
body: b"First of all, I admire J. K. Rowling's courage to write a totally different novel after having written the most popular fantasy novels in the world. I also appreciate her effort to talk about difficult social issues we face today."

author: b'Zorra'
title: b'"It\'s a Wonderful Life" on Privet Drive'
body: b'FIVE STARS (Though Amazon is only allowing me to give it 4 for some reason).  I finished reading this book about eight hours ago, and I find myself still haunted by it.  A gritty version of "It\'s a Wonderful Life" set on a street much like Privet Drive, it is a challenging book.  Yes, it is a tragedy, foreshadowed from the beginning, but elaborate plot twists are not the point.  The point is the characters.  You won\'t like them at first, and you are not meant to.  Rowling unveils the way in which we are all cabined off from compassion by our own self-centered dramas.  She takes you on a journey of your own failings, and it\'s a cruel and unfortunately accurate journey.  But then she surprises you with compassion, even for some of her most unlikeable characters, even for you.  For example, this sentence:  "How awful it was ... the way tiny ghosts of your living children haunted your heart; they could never know, and would hate it if they did, how their growing was a constant bereavement."  All she asks is that you have the compassion for others that she has shown for you.  You finish the book with a series of "if onlys," because so many of the characters have the chance to avert tragedy, and fail.  If only, you can\'t help think, Hagrid was there, with his pink umbrella -ella -ella.  But this is the real world, and somebody like us has to rescue the boy under the stairs.  Rowling doesn\'t leave us without hope, however.  As in the original "It\'s a Wonderful Life," you also finish the book with an indelible sense of what one imperfect person CAN do.'

author: b'Avid Reader'
title: b'Absolutely Abysmal!'
body: b"Absolutely pathetic attempt at adult fiction from J K Rowling. I purchased the book, read about 50 pages and trashed it (returned the book). Rowling has gone overboard with foul language to set herself apart from the kid's book style of the excellent Harry Potter series. The setting is horrible, characters boring and storyline will put you to sleep. The dialogues go on and on talking drivel about the same topic for 30 pages. Useless trash. I vow never to read another Rowling book just because of the way she has deviated from her strengths in this misguided attempt. Waste of time."

author: b'H. M. Knof'
title: b'Too bored to finish'
body: b"I, like so many others, looked forward to J.K. Rowling's first book after the Harry Potter series.  I ground through the first 25%, thinking that it had to get better, that there had to be a developed character somewhere.  It didn't; there wasn't.  'Nuff said."

author: b'Cotton Mather'
title: b"I can't get through it"
body: b'Oy vey--this book is a mess. It is dreadfully dull.  I will slog through it somehow this year, so all is not lost but--I will never believe that Ms. Rowling wrote it.  No way.'

author: b'knotfixx'
title: b"There's nothing wrong..."
body: b"in writing a fabulous and entertaining series aimed at children, yet enjoyed by millions and millions of adults!!  And there's nothing wrong in selling 450 million copies of your wonderful series!"

author: b'marina'
title: b'21$ ?????'
body: b'21$ the price of kindle edition????? Why??????'

author: b'SDL'
title: b'Enjoyed very much'
body: b'Good for JK to branch out and do something different. While I still wish she would return to the Potter series at some point it is still great to have new stuff from her. The book had a real eerie feel to it. Small town secrets always make for a good story.'

author: b'Kate'
title: b'A Casual Vacancy Is now on my Bookshelf'
body: b'I pre-ordered this with some trepidation.  When she first mentioned years ago that she was writing a "political fairy story for adults" I didn\'t think I would be fully on board without more details.  When word came earlier this year that the book would drop during the eight-week "sweet spot" before the Presidential Election in the United States I grew leery.  There are a lot of political issues about which Rowling and I seem to generally agree but I felt that the danger of this being a bleak polemic was high.'

author: b'Tysha'
title: b'A boring book'
body: b'This book is boring. The plot is slow. I pushed  myslf to read it; but I could  only read it until page 17. Too boring. I am very dissapointed with Ms. Rowling.'

author: b'Annette'
title: b'Incredibly Disappointed'
body: b'Would give a zero rating if poosible...downloaded book so I could not return it...deleted it from my library...not worth anyones time...crude'

author: b'Anne Jordan'
title: b'Ughhhhh!!!! What a WASTE!!!!'
body: b'If I could give this 0 stars, I would.  I am so disgusted that an author, who possesses  such an enormous vocabulary and imagination would resort to f-bombs to convey her point.  Thank goodness I got a free sample for my kindle!!  I deleted it as soon as it was obvious that this book is garbage and that was way before I was even half way through the sample.  Try again, J.K. and next time make it a point to write without leaning on obscenities, as if that makes a book "adult".'

author: b'Nick Brocketah'
title: b'Much Too Expensive'
body: b'Why are they charging so much for the Kindle version? Shame on them. Should definitely be more around ten dollars.'

author: b'Love at First Book'
title: b'Liked but not loved'
body: b"When I heard that J.K. Rowling was going to be writing an adult fiction novel, my first thoughts were apprehensive.  As the deadline for the novel's release crept closer, I finally buckled down and decided I would read it (although I'm super annoyed at the ridiculously expensive Kindle price for the book)."

author: b'Andrew Daubigny'
title: b'Foul Ball'
body: b'"... sliced through his brain like a demolition ball." If that\'s your idea of good prose, this book is for you.'

author: b'Judy Shepherd'
title: b"Today's world"
body: b'Recommend late teen to adult.  great character development. small town life.   Examines bully,cyber crime, family structures an faith in human goodness.'

author: b'Runa'
title: b'Vacancy, Indeed'
body: b'Reading this book felt so much more like an obligation than something done out of enjoyment. It was not a joy but a relief to finish it. I realize this wasn\'t supposed to be Harry Potter and comparisons are moot, but I didn\'t expect it to be the diametric opposite of HP. It is written for a totally different audience, an audience that does not consist of me. This thing can go sit on bookshelves with the likes of John Grisham and other rich people cranking out meaningless dramas. Where Harry Potter created a beautiful, rich, diverse cast of characters, The Casual Vacancy creates the same caricatured people I read to avoid. I found myself liking the characterizations of the teenaged characters (with the exception of social worker, Kay), and would be interested in seeing Jo create a realistic young adult novel, or even a more political novel, rather than the upper class gossipfest this was. There was some compelling themes that could have been explored further (the clinic, "the light of God shone from every soul") but ultimately went unresolved. It also would have worked better, in my opinion, as a linear novel, rather than one told from too many points of view, leading to a crowded, overwhelming read.'

author: b'Christie'
title: b'Adult maybe, grown-up not!'
body: b'I was anticipating the release of The Casual Vacancy because it promised to be an interwoven tale of the residents of an English village.  Yesterday I eagerly went to my local bookstore where there they sat--big, thick copies of this wonderful sounding story.  I picked up my copy, bought it, and returned home to began to read.  What a disappointment it turned out to be!  Sure there were lots of characters but I didn\'t feel any sympathy toward them.  And the language!  No thanks, I don\'t need to read all that profanity and tasteless talk. Why couldn\'t this adult book be written for grown-ups?  Why is something considered "adult" because it is filled with tasteless profanity* just for the sake of it i.e. the F bomb ad nauseum?  We expect our children not to talk that way and read that stuff but as adults we accept it?  I guess I had hoped that Ms Rowling\'s story would be along the lines of other British writers such as Rosamunde Pilcher or Maeve Binchy.  Oh well, I\'ll have to just reread The Shell Seekers or Circle of Friends.'

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Rowling?  Really?'
body: b'I am not only a big fan of Harry Potter but also a bibliophile in general.  Imagine my joy at having another offering to become obsessed with.  Unfortunately, the obsession for "The Casual Vacancy" borders on complete loathing.  I have to admit I did not and *could not* finish this literary abortion.  At about the quarter mark, I was compelled to delete it.  The run-on sentences, unfulfilled parenthesis and foul language do nothing at all to detract from the one-dimensional characters and rampant stereotypical behavior within a bleak setting.  If there\'s a storyline, I never found it.'

author: b'Wild Swan'
title: b'Alt Harry Potter'
body: b'This book is about what would have happened to Harry Potter had there been no Hogwarts.  It\'s an "alt" version - what happens to a neglected child in the welfare state, what happens when there is no magic, what happens in a world composed of Durselys.  That makes it an adult book and a very unpleasant read. I could not bring myself to care what happened to any of the Durselys. I see that almost everyone gained self knowledge (and most did not put it to any use); I see that hacked Facebook pages as a means of knowledge is very clever (JKR lives); I see that a girl who was being destroyed is more confident because she is imitating someone (Kristen) whom she does not really see as she is - but I didn\'t care.  I was glad I\'d reached the end alive myself, that was all.  However I did read the entire book so Rowling is still a page turner. I will also buy her next book but I hope someday she can integrate what is at present a double vision - magic childhood and adult rottenness.'

author: b'SHELLEYBOND'
title: b'It cost HOW MUCH for the Kindle edition?!!'
body: b'Never having read the HP series, I was pleased when JK Rowling wrote this, a non-fantasy book.  I went to order it this morning and saw that the cost of the *Kindle Edition" is a whopping $17.99!!!!  I don\'t care WHO set the price -- that\'s outrageous for an ebook!  I\'ve taken Rowling\'s book off my reading list and will be telling my book clubs why!'

author: b'Beth'
title: b'Grim, Crass, and Exceptionally Dull'
body: b"You know that wholesome pop star who desperately wants to outgrow her good girl image? She leaks a sex tape, goes to rehab, and generally tries too hard to prove how bad she can be. That's what this book is. J.K. Rowling is proving that she's not just a writer for kids; she can write a grown-up book with sex, drugs, and a whole lot of foul language!"

author: b'Evelyn'
title: b'Why?  Why would anyone finish this book?'
body: b"I wanted so much to like it, but page after page brought out new characters whom I would not like in real life, treating everyone around them badly, spewing venom,...every page full of bad feeling....who reads books populated with unlikeable people being despicacble? Worse,,  reviewers saying 'we all know people just like them?' I don't know people like them, thank God! And for all the times I have used language that would make my mother blanch (followed here by a comment which Amazom would not approve for publication,  though the book is riddled with far worse than what I said) after the first three chapters of this book, I had had enough of being splattered with a verbal buffet of offensiveness. If this were a hardcover edition, it would be thrown out the window with great force: being an eBook, however, I intend to smoosh my finger on that 'delete this piece of refuse' X with great satisfaction and move on to something with redeeming value."

author: b'Anna P.'
title: b"Not HP... and that's ok!"
body: b'This review has no spoilers!'

author: b'fubar330'
title: b'Fallen Hero'
body: b"I have only read the sample, but that all it took for me to be disgusted.  Being a fan of Harry Potter I was happy to see that J.K. Rowling was publishing another book.  However, I didn't see this coming.  Yes, I looked past that boy wizard to read this book.  The language is valugar, I didn't care about the character at all when he died, and I felt embarrassed reading it. If this is what the future of books is becoming count me out."

author: b'B. Roberts'
title: b'Good'
body: b'Note: This review contains no spoilers about the plot.'

author: b'Charles'
title: b'Utter junk'
body: b'First off, to avoid problems from the JKR is god crowd: I did read the book.'

author: b'Her Dotness'
title: b'R.B. Sheridan on downers'
body: b"As a retired English teacher, I'm truly apologetic that I cannot finish this book. I know I should  read it and appreciate its merit since I'm certain based on the third of it that I did read that it will provide numerous thesis and dissertation writers with new grain for their scholastic mills."

author: b'M. Stark'
title: b'A bleak view of humanity'
body: b"I had to stop reading at around page 130. To say that this book is dysfunctional would be an understatement. It portrays humans in the worst light possible, and I saw absolutely no redeeming qualities in the characters (and there are many-- which is another thing, I couldn't even keep everyone straight!) I see this book as JK Rowling's experimentation with extremely upsetting subjects and multiple point of views. But I have to say, I don't think this experiment is a successful one and I hope she never writes something so depressing again."

author: b'Mudita'
title: b'Erotic fiction for 16 year olds?!'
body: b'Would you ask your grandmother to explain teenage sexuality? Would you read 500 pages of your grandmother explaining teenage sexuality? Well, it might read better than Rowling trying to do so...'

author: b'Rory Marinich'
title: b"The magic? Still there! But there's darkness, too, and plenty of sorrow..."
body: b'At the start of Harry Potter and the Sorcerer\'s Stone, we meet the Dursleys, stodgy and small-minded and "proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much." J. K. Rowling loves poking fun of the self-absorbed from within their own heads, then zooming out and showing us their victims, for whom the cruelty of idiots is considerably less fun.'

author: b'Ballin'
title: b'Call it the next "Fifty Shades of Gray"'
body: b'Through the special argot Rowling utilizes, the reader can almost feel like sexual fluids are splashing all round them in this sexual thriller.  The passion is bifurcated into the categories of, hot and super hot.  The first 100/150 pages will be just "hot."  However, after that, you are in for a ride.'

author: b'The Man on the Grassy Knoll'
title: b'overpriced'
body: b"You'd have to be out of your mind to pay $18 for an e-book! I think I'll wait for the discount."

author: b'S. Morton'
title: b'$17.99..really????'
body: b'The reason I chose to go to Kindle was to save money and space. (Stacks of books laying around get in the way) but come on publishers ...what makes you think the average workingman can or will pay that for a digital file?  Not Me. I work hard for my money. If I was going to pay that I would buy the hardback. I will just wait on the list at my local library. Seems strange to me that I can find some really good books for less than $5.00 by those who self publish but a large publisher wants a fortune because of a name. The book might be good but I somehow doubt it is $17.99 good.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Very Dissapointed'
body: b'Purchased this book for my Nexas 7.  It\'s not anything I would normally choose to read.  Thought it being JK Rowling, it might be a just a good "Who Done It" Mystery.  WRONG!  No I didn\'t expect it to be Harry Potter.  A waste of money.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Updated after finishing: THIS BOOK COULD BE TRIGGERING FOR PEOPLE RECOVERING FROM BEING CUTTERS OR ABUSE'
body: b"Update: finished the book.  Not really my kind of fiction, I read fiction to STOP thinking about the depressing inequalities and unhappy endings in real life. (Slight spolier) I knew there was going to be a suicide in the book from reading reviews. I found myself wondering which character it would be (there are over 20 characters whom we get point of view from, maybe over 30) but not particularly caring too much. It was one of the top 5 I suspected, tho the triggering event was a bit of a surprise it was predictable many pages before the triggering event happened. Folks DO need to go in prepared, one thing I didn't see mentioned in reviews was that one of the characters is a cutter. This, plus the POV portrayals of spousal and child physical abuse and rape could be very triggering for some folks. Being inside the mind of a character while they are slicing up their arm with a razor blade if you are a recovering cutter (or other self-mutilation behavior) could be a very bad thing is my concern. I finished the book feeling like I had just sat through a really rough time with a friend who was just really awakening to the horrible disparities in society and hadn't really found their footing & hope for the future yet. It is not an optimistic book, and there weren't any characters I really connected with - none of them felt at any point like people I would really want to sit & have a cuppa with if I knew even as much about them as the other characters did. Might be a really good book for folks thinking of going into social work or community activism to read though. Depressingly accurate portrayl of that from my experience. I suspect a lot of this was JKR trying to process & come to terms with her own kids being teens/young adults in the socioeconomic situations she's been in, etc, and her trying to understand why some of these horrible things happen in the world where she doesn't see any humans as pure saints or pure evil."

author: b'Instrument of the Blessed Virgin Mary'
title: b'All about Obama and Romney'
body: b'This book is basically about Obama v. Romney.  The facade of a city after its leader is gone.  So basically, our political system.'

author: b'Patrick'
title: b'More "Girl with the Dragon Tattoo" than "Harry Potter"'
body: b"I'm only 1/4 of the way through the book but I just wanted to put forward a two thoughts that might influence your decision to get this book:"

author: b'Nome de Plume'
title: b'My 8 year old read this, I am disgusted by all the sex and drug use.'
body: b'It was my 8 year old daughters birthday and I happened to be in my local book store.  I saw this in a display and thought "...Wow, she wrote the Harry Potter series, my daughter Ophelia would love this".'

author: b'Ionia Froment'
title: b'No Vacancy'
body: b'The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling is perhaps somewhat of enigma. I, just like countless thousands of other readers was so curious about what this author would come up with after so many hugely popular Harry Potter books. This book was in a way, refreshing, and in a way disappointing. Let me explain.'

author: b'mary'
title: b'lucked out and got it cheap'
body: b"i actually only paid $10 for this book, because i got 15 dollars today for doing a survey at the mall, therefore i don't feel like i lost too much money. This book is weird, i would have rather seen Rowling do a book about Draco Malfoy and his family, that would have been much better"

author: b'John Williamson'
title: b"We're no longer in Hogwarts..."
body: b"Don't let anyone kid you: there's magic in J.K. Rowling new novel"

author: b'just another bookworm'
title: b"Peyton Place meets PG Wodehouse. (Yes, I read it. No, I haven't read HP.)"
body: b"Throwing in my two cents as one of the few people on the planet who hasn't read the HP series. (My kids were the perfect age as the books came out: young enough to love them, old enough to read for themselves.) I pre-ordered THE CASUAL VACANCY and inhaled it the minute it hit my Kindle mainly (I will admit) because it's a remarkable moment of publishing history, but I was quickly drawn into the story. The characters are people I already know, because they are the people we all already know. In the end, I liked this book on its own merits. And I liked it a lot."

author: b'potterfan19'
title: b'Disappointed in this book:('
body: b'As a big Harry Potter fanatic I really looked forward to this book. I only tried the sample and what I read was not what I expected. I will not buy the full edition because this book does not interest me. Jo you have let me down. I hope that your next book will be another fantasy book then maybe I will be able to read it.'

author: b'J. Nelson'
title: b'Great book!'
body: b"I received this book as a gift and I loved it.  Great writing.  Highly recommend. It is extremely ignorant for people to rate a book as a negative just because you are unhappy with the price.  Dumbest thing ever! It you don't like the price, keep it moving."

author: b'Henrik Ellegaard'
title: b'A glimpse of the future?'
body: b'With no competition from other book stores on the Kindle this is what happens: The Kindle book costs more than the hardback.'

author: b'NBS'
title: b'Combating stupidity...'
body: b'I was interested in reading some reviews of this new book and was shocked to see it got only 3 stars.  As I read the negative reviews, I realized that the vast majority of the reviews are from people who haven\'t even read the book and who are basing their "review" solely on the price.'

author: b'opinionated'
title: b'Response'
body: b'OK I didnt read this book.  I confess that along with others I find 18 too much for my reading budget.  I also have often found that a bit of patience can reward one with a substantially lowered price.  However, I am shocked by the moral judgements reflected in some of these reviews.  How much money an author already possesses has little to do with the value of her work.  Writing something people really want to read does require hard work.  This work does deserve monetary compensation.  So the kindle edition is not a simple download worth nothing because there is no paper.  Wake up you are paying for the WORDS.'

author: b'legallyblonde'
title: b'Greedy B---- Greedy Amazon'
body: b'Well the book was so-so.  Ms. Rowling should stick to her original audience. I actually borrowed the book since I would never pay $17.99 for'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'READ THE SAMPLE BEFORE YOU SHELL OUT THE BIG BUCKS'
body: b"Okay, so I haven't read the whole book.  Just like if I step in dog doodoo I don't need to get down and roll around in it, the first sample chapters of Rowlings' new book told me that it isn't something I'm eager to read.  You can decide for yourself whether it is an astounding step forward in her writing career or simply an astounding step.  For the price you will pay for this book, be sure you are going to enjoy it and there is doubt on that topic."

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Boycotting because of price!!'
body: b'Absolutely silly to pay $18 for a file download.  Greedy! Greedy! Greedy!  Shame on you... There is just one file, already produced (and not well based on other reviews).  Cost pennies to send.... I refuse to buy and so should others.  Send a message!'

author: b'J. Friedman'
title: b'I READ THIS BOOK!  Purchased at the bookstore. SPOILERS!'
body: b'J.K. Rowling is best known for her Harry Potter Series. This book is an attempted shift at an adult novella. The book itself comes in an orange and red hardcover binding. The cover is a bit visually disappointing - a simple black "x" in a checkbox with vintage lettering indicating the title.'

author: b'Martin Olvera'
title: b'Way too expensive !!'
body: b'I was very excited to buy this book for my Kindle Reader but...$17.99...are you kidding ? In this economy ??'

author: b'Computer Geek'
title: b'Was excited to buy until I saw the price for ebook.  Boycotting'
body: b"After reading the news that this was released, I immediately went to Amazon to buy it.  At $17.99 for an e-book though, it simply isn't worth it, especially for a new, unproven series that isn't Harry Potter.  I will be waiting until the price falls or I can get it from the library as an ebook.  (Removed unhelpful comments about how much money JK needs)"

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'gave it a chance and actually READ it'
body: b'I purchased "The Casual Vacancy" last night on my Kindle Fire.  As a student, I don\'t have a lot of spare money for books and the price was slightly deterring, but I grew up with Harry Potter and absolutely love JK Rowling\'s writing, so I decided to go ahead and buy it. I have experienced no problems at all with the format of the book; the Kindle Fire offers 8 different font sizes, and I have been reading this book at the second smallest option.  So, price and Kindle format both were essentially non-issues for me.'

author: b'Booksrfun'
title: b'You are truly inspiring!  Keep it up, J.K.!'
body: b'The portrayal of the characters on this book is very deep and real and as original as if someone really lived through the situations, totally different from her previous published Harry Potter fantasy series.'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'Have not read and will not read'
body: b'Maybe I am not being fair but, based on the reviews that I have already read, the use of the "f" word and other profanity is not entertaining to me and I will not read a book that is laced with it.  If I start a book that "sucked me in" with it\'s description and find that the profanity is there, I dump it and go to another.  That\'s why I mostly get the free ones or ones for a few bucks.  I won\'t wast money on such things.  This author was so successful with the Harry Potter series without the bad language.  It saddens me that she would resort to using it just because she is writing for adults.  Doesn\'t say much for us older folks does it!!  Sooooooo, I am rating without reading this time.  Sorry if I offended anyone.  Not my intention.'

author: b'Holly Day'
title: b"From Someone Who's Actually Read It!"
body: b"Just to set the record straight on Casual Vacancy, I was given a copy as a gift. When you read the book, you need to forget this is the same author who gave us Mr.Potter's world of magic. This is set in a tiny English town and deals with politics,class struggle,poverty,drug use,child abuse,rape,self-mutilation, suicide, pedophilia,mental illness and other ugly realities. Much to her credit the author does this with sharp comic wit, however it does all go on a bit too long with the ending being somewhat predictable and heavy-handed. It goes from being a lively comedy of manners to over-wrought slog by the end. I will say that I did enjoy her attempt to combine cutting comedy with social commentary. This is definitely not a book for the children in your house with the salty, profane language and delicate subject matters."

author: b'Saguaro View 124'
title: b'So far so good!'
body: b"I've only gotten about halfway through the book, but I can honestly say that I've been enjoying it. The characters are beautifully realistic. I think that as someone who grew up reading Harry Potter it is very nice to see J.K Rowling writing again. So far I have loved this new different novel, but it makes me honestly upset to be critiquing it for its format and it's price. And I at least read a story for the story itself and not for its looks."

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Everyone can see the price, Idiots!'
body: b"I can see the price for myself when looking at purchasing the kindle edition so I don't need 20+ people telling me that it's too expensive! There was only one review of this book out of MANY that was actually about the content of the novel. I love JK Rowling and grew up with Harry Potter so I will buy this book and pay the $17.99 without a complaint. As Americans, we pay for convenience... that's what makes the economy go round people! If you don't like the price DON'T BUY IT! If you want to read it I'm sure you can wait until the price drops or it's available at the public library. The world has enough REAL victims without all of us thinking we are because of the price of a book... get a life!"

author: b'Kindle Customer'
title: b'Thanks for nothing'
body: b"Thanks a lot, folks. I looked at the reviews to see how other people had rated this book and why so I could decide whether or not to purchase it. What I found here were complaints about the e-book price and responses to those complaints. A book is a book, no matter the format. I own a Kindle but do not necessarily expect the books to be less expensive. My decision on what format to purchase is sometimes determined by the weight of the book but mostly by whether I have friends who would also like to read it. Get over yourselves and your complaints about price. Buy the book or don't buy the book. The rest of us don't really care and you are wasting our time."

author: b'DearMYRTLE'
title: b'Initial thoughts'
body: b'Just started reading... using Kindle App on my iPad, strictly for the larger screen. So far too much unnecessary use of the "f" word. Hope this isn\'t an indication of things to come. Copious use of foul language doesn\'t make this an adult book. Hope this isn\'t an indication of things to come. Copious use of foul language doesn\'t make this an adult book. J K Rowling may be trying too hard to break out of her Harry Potter mold. But I am willing to get past the first chapter. Usually by now in a book, I know if I\'ll like it. Just saying...'

author: b'Amazon Customer'
title: b'The Casual Vacancy of Harry Potter'
body: b'LOL! It was funny to see J.K. Rowling try to write a book that was not Harry Potter.  The title is misleading but there is more than a vacancy that\'s casual.  Some may call the title artistic and witty, but I think it\'s quite the opposite being that Harry Potter is not in the book which makes the vacancy more than casual.  I think the book should be titled "The Enormous Vacancy."'

author: b'discerningreader1'
title: b'keep it up jk'
body: b'excellent character portrayal,insightful,and as an agatha christie fan, i was quite pleased to find a novel reminiscent of her style.  thrilled to become lost in the fantasy of an english village setting with a cast of amusing and brutally real characters'

author: b'Anne Gowlett'
title: b'stop complaining'
body: b'I wish some readers of this kindle edition would stop complaining.'

author: b'Ann V.'
title: b'Buy the Hardcover Copy'
body: b'If you do not like the Kindle price, buy the hardcover copy.  Only a few dollars more for something concrete which may make you feel its worth despite its worth in literary sweat, creativity, & execution.'

author: b'Wooddell'
title: b'As a product - too expensive'
body: b'I thought I would like to read, but the preview chapters are not very exciting and the price is way too high! This is a review of the worth of the product as a whole and in my opinion the value is not there in writing or price.'

author: b'Carm'
title: b'Format!'
body: b'I have no official review for this book as I have yet to read it. However, I just downloaded it to my kindle and the font is tiny. I must set my kindle font to the biggest it allows and it is still too small to read comfortably (plus the margins are now huge). Considering it killed me to purchase an ebook for over the usual 10-12 bucks I really feel that one costing $17.99 the font should be formatted properly.'

author: b'William Hegedus'
title: b'Great book'
body: b"This book shows a realistic, slightly cynical, portrayal of people. It is in no way, shape, or form a sugarcoated version of a novel. I am ashamed that so many people are giving it low star reviews because they either a) don't like the price or b) don't like its Kindle formatting."

author: b'Letting Light In'
title: b'What One Needs to Know About Kindle Price'
body: b"I'm confused by people who complain about kindle prices not being lower. For starters they do not understand the difficult economics of book publishing [printing costs are only a small part of cost--thus only a small difference in cost]. Buying a kindle or ebook reader for cost savings isn't a wise idea--unless you plan to just read public domain books. Used or secondary market physical copies usually cost less or if they aren't it will generally be for a popular book you can buy and easily resell. So while I understand there are good reasons to own a Kindle or Nook, just getting it for saving money seems to be missing the point."

author: b'rocka-chic'
title: b"Don't buy it if you cant afford it"
body: b'There is such a place called a library. You can check the book out and read it if you feel the price of the book is too high. People complain about the most absurd things. In the time it takes to type up a nasty review...most people would come to the conclusion to 1. go to the library or 2. wait a couple months for the price to go down. Work smarter not harder people! It would be really nice to read a review on the content of the actual book =)'

author: b'Mary E. Rumbaugh'
title: b'Not any amount, I have now read the sample.'
body: b'When I pay more the $10.00 for a book it had better be a Hardcopy GREAT WORLD CHANGING book, School Text book, or the Bible. Never an electronic book.'

author: b'Tricia K.'
title: b'Seriously?  $17 bucks for a computer file???  Do you think I can wave a wand and make money?'
body: b"Premise sounds dull as dirt.  For $17 for a computer/Kindle file??? No thanks; I'll wait until I can gete a used one for a buck ninety-five.  Rowling is NOT God, even though the kiddies seem to think so."

author: b'Pretzel'
title: b'A must read'
body: b"The depth of character development and storyline echoes why JK is one of the greatest storytellers of our time.  This is not your kid's fantasy book - but is a thoroughly enjoyable escape which is exactly what I want in a good book."

author: b'Prodigy'
title: b'I love it'
body: b"The book was great and I will love to re-read it again and again. I really hope Jo goes for more books- Adult or Fantasy and that I will continue reading them. This story is great. The price may be high but it is worth it. You see, it's all about different points. Like Shirley Mollison who HATES Barry Fairbrother or Mary Fairbrother the wife of Barry. Please buy the book and see whats going on in Pagford."

author: b'David Katz'
title: b'Kendle price too expensive'
body: b"I started to order the kindle edition and than looked at the price. It was only a couple of dollars cheaper than the paper one. Having been in publishing I know the cost of paper and manufacturing and the Kindle edition is over priced.  I hope this is not the new wave of the future.  There should definitely be a larger gap between kindle and hardcover.  I am a big supporter of Amazon I hope this doesn't change my mind"

author: b'M. A. Barnett'
title: b'too expensive'
body: b'I would love to buy this book but it is too expensive! I find it hard to comprehend why I will be able to but this book cheaper in a soft cover version.'
